A notable part of development was a large-scale proof of concept (PoC) project wherein Hoshizaki tested 1,700 pieces of equipment to produce a highly scalable system on Microsoft Azure.

title: International Center for Journalists promotes independent journalism with Microsoft Defender
executive_summary: The International Center for Journalists (ICFJ) supports reporters, editors, and newsrooms across the world, especially in places where it is dangerous to pursue independent journalism. To better protect members of the press and their own staff, ICFJ works with FSi Strategies to deploy Microsoft Defender. The industry-leading security solution gives staff and journalists the confidence to engage candidly, building a stronger network of journalism worldwide.
products: Microsoft Secure Score, Outlook, Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Entra ID

title: New York City Public Schools: Ensuring access for all with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: New York City Public Schools (NYC PS) rallied to deploy learning devices with cellular LTE access to over 750,000 students in 1,800 schools. The massive deployment faced substantial challenges, including supply chain availability during the pandemic, technical issues, and logistical hurdles. Previously, NYC PS sought device management solutions that could scale to meet the needs of educators and students while providing a seamless user experience. Their existing solution could not effectively manage the variety of platforms needed by schools and students. The NYC PS considered various platforms and ultimately—in early 2020—chose Microsoft Intune, due to its capabilities, cross platform compatibility, and cost since it was already included with Microsoft 365 A3 and A5 licenses, making it a cost-effective choice.

title: C&A implements Power BI and enhances data experience with BI self-service model
executive_summary: C&A, one of the largest retail networks in the world and with a strong presence in Brazil, relied on the support of partner company Iteris to build a BI system with three levels of execution and, thus, give autonomy for different areas to build their own reports—from the board to the store floor, with a modern and robust platform.

title: INDEP and Microsoft Azure: An unprecedented success story in Mexico’s public sector
executive_summary: Following the Agreement by which policies and provisions are issued to promote the use and exploitation of information and communication technologies within the Mexican Federal Public Administration, INDEP was able to efficiently adapt its IPv4 protocol telecommunications to IPv6, through a strategic alliance with Microsoft and its cloud solutions.

title: Westminster School improves security and gets peace of mind with Microsoft Defender Experts for XDR
executive_summary: Established in 1961, Westminster School in South Australia has around 2,000 students and staff. Facing cybersecurity challenges with a small IT team, the school adopted Microsoft Defender Experts for XDR. With improved security insights, reduced noise, and accelerated incident response, the school has access to proactive collaboration and experts on demand.

title: C&A implements Power BI and enhances data experience with BI self-service model
executive_summary: C&A, one of the largest retail networks in the world and with a strong presence in Brazil, relied on the support of partner company Iteris to build a BI system with three levels of execution and, thus, give autonomy for different areas to build their own reports—from the board to the store floor, with a modern and robust platform.

title: INDEP and Microsoft Azure: An unprecedented success story in Mexico’s public sector
executive_summary: Following the Agreement by which policies and provisions are issued to promote the use and exploitation of information and communication technologies within the Mexican Federal Public Administration, INDEP was able to efficiently adapt its IPv4 protocol telecommunications to IPv6, through a strategic alliance with Microsoft and its cloud solutions.

title: Westminster School improves security and gets peace of mind with Microsoft Defender Experts for XDR
executive_summary: Established in 1961, Westminster School in South Australia has around 2,000 students and staff. Facing cybersecurity challenges with a small IT team, the school adopted Microsoft Defender Experts for XDR. With improved security insights, reduced noise, and accelerated incident response, the school has access to proactive collaboration and experts on demand.

title: More affordable, accelerated, simplified: Microsoft Teams Phone now makes it possible to reach Hannover Re employees worldwide
executive_summary: Communicate across borders in a consistent, efficient, and digital way while automating the costs of on- and offboarding and the set-up of new workstations: Hannover Re shows how to do all of that—and at the same time, get rid of more than 4,000 hardware telephones to reduce the associated operating and acquisition costs with digital solutions. The reinsurance company relies on Microsoft Teams, Teams Phone, and Operator Connect to modernize collaboration and communication between its employees at all locations worldwide and with its customers.

title: NBA players are improving performance with AI on Azure AI infrastructure
executive_summary: The NBA Stats Team wanted to explore how AI could help them process data on all on-court players’ specific live body movements, analyzing things like speed, dunk height, number of passes and dribbles, and even injury risk, simultaneously. The team built a Microsoft Azure solution based on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) that can manage and process up to 16 gigabytes of raw data per game, not including RGB video signals—sometimes more if the game goes into overtime. The new solution is deployed and operational, and the data being collected is already helping the NBA better understand players’ strengths and weaknesses and improve their performance. The NBA aims to use Azure AI infrastructure to continue to build new learning models and support statistic overlays on viewer screens as they happen on-court.

title: Rockler streamlines operations, cuts support tickets by 68% with Visionet and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce
executive_summary: Rockler distributes high-quality hardware and tools for woodworking enthusiasts. The company handled many essential retail tasks manually, leading to operational delays, increased labor expenses, and customer dissatisfaction. Rockler’s outdated ERP system also contributed to fragmented experiences across different channels. Visionet deployed its PartnerLinQ unified digital connectivity solution for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce to help Rockler accelerate EDI integration, improve omnichannel commerce, and automate processes.

title: Cassidy and Azure OpenAI Service: Making AI simple for all
executive_summary: N/A

title: Share.Market redefines the investment experience with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Mantrac halves IT costs and enhances agility with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Mantrac faced rising costs, limited scalability, and inflexibility with its on-premises IT infrastructure. Their outdated disaster recovery setup further complicated operations, causing delays and increasing errors when transferring services between global data centers.

title: Kaya elevates customer experience and operational efficiency with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power BI
executive_summary: Established in 2003, Kaya Limited is a leading provider of dermatologically approved and scientifically advanced solutions for skincare, haircare and body.

title: WIKA recalibrates global business operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: WIKA had 50 separate, highly customized instances of on-prem Dynamics; updating all 50 instances took three months to complete, which kept their IT team constantly rolling out changes.

title: Cosmo Energy Holdings gains ESG insights with Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability
executive_summary: With environmental, social, and governance reporting requirements changing all the time, Cosmo Energy Holdings needed a way to take its ESG reporting from siloed and inefficient to something more systemized, automated, and flexible.

title: Mitsubishi Chemical Group approaches from top and bottom to innovate with Power Apps.
executive_summary: Operating globally, the company faces a complex cost structure due to different business systems for each affiliation. The company is focusing on reducing costs and optimizing operations.

title: Capitec Bank employees save more than 1 hour per week with Microsoft 365 Copilot and Azure Open AI
executive_summary: Capitec Bank, South Africa’s largest retail bank centered on customers, strives to keep things simple, affordable, and accessible. The bank's Head of Data Transformation wanted to make things even simpler for employees.

title: Outokumpu uses Rimo3 to reduce time to migrate 1,742 apps to Microsoft Intune and Azure Virtual Desktop by more than 90%
executive_summary: Facing challenges in modernizing its legacy IT infrastructure, global leader in sustainable stainless-steel production Outokumpu turned to Rimo3 for automated testing and cloud migration solutions.

title: PizzaExpress feeds digital transformation with Office 365 and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: For PizzaExpress, being open for business means more than a hot oven and fresh ingredients. It’s about delivering exceptional experiences through a customer-centric, data-driven approach backed by world-class cloud technology from Microsoft.

title: Edsby uses embedded analytics to deliver full-spectrum learning and unlock new opportunities
executive_summary: To help educators meet the full range of learning needs for K–12 students, Edsby wanted to add an advanced analytics service to its cloud-based Learning Management System. It used Microsoft Power BI Embedded to build advanced data visualization capabilities directly into the Edsby web portal. Now, Edsby is delivering more value at a cost its education customers can afford, opening new revenue streams and more business opportunities, and helping educators improve student outcomes.

title: Forever 21 moves to Microsoft Azure, registers record-breaking holiday revenues
executive_summary: Keeping up with fast fashion is never easy. But at Forever 21, organizing 200 new items a day and conducting online and in-store sales in more than 50 countries bring some unique challenges. To modernize its infrastructure and deal more easily with peaks in demand, the retailer turned to Microsoft Azure. Before long, Forever 21 was using new levels of scalability to break revenue records over the 2018 holiday season.

title: With Azure AD B2C, top UK healthcare provider now offers a secure web portal as user-friendly as its facilities
executive_summary: Nuffield Health is one of the United Kingdom’s leading not-for-profit healthcare organisations, with 31 hospitals, 111 fitness and wellbeing clubs, plus medical clinics and other facilities across the country. It is also the UK’s largest provider of corporate fitness and wellbeing services to businesses, including about half of the public companies in the FTSE 250.

title: Collaboration and knowledge-sharing in the cloud bring Swisscom's field technicians closer together
executive_summary: When Swisscom, Switzerland’s leading telecoms and TV service provider, was faced with communication challenges, siloed ways of working, and disconnected tools, the company worked with Microsoft to create a solution―“Work Smart NOW.” The initiative to connect its workforce on a unified platform has resulted in the deployment of Microsoft Office 365 across groups within the business. Microsoft Teams, in particular, has enabled a communication culture shift within the field services division. Now, “Field Service” engineers can easily collaborate, share knowledge, and work remotely across devices―in keeping with Swisscom’s open-book philosophy.

title: Kennametal backs its smart factories with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: In the past, modernizing a factory meant only buying new equipment. Today, it’s also about data, as Kennametal knows well. For more than 80 years, Kennametal has advanced materials science, tooling, and wear-resistant solutions for global industries. Accustomed to innovation in design and manufacturing, the company decided to rethink the modern factory. After months of planning, Kennametal took a huge step forward when it completed a migration of its 3-terabyte (TB) SAP enterprise resource planning (ERP) system to Microsoft Azure—over a single weekend. The new architecture improves security, boosts application performance, and surfaces previously hidden data that Kennametal is now using to fuel a digital transformation and create the factory of the future.
products: Azure, Azure Load Balancer, Azure SQL Database, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Network, SAP on Azure, Dynamics CRM, Power BI, SQL Server

title: Outpost VFX goes all Azure with Avere vFXT for a lion’s windblown mane, artist positivity, and global impact
executive_summary: Outpost VFX’s new film project promised to be a great business and creative opportunity—except for the extreme complexity of the visual effects (VFX), a crazy-tight deadline for delivering hundreds of shots, and the need for about 10 times more infrastructure than the studio had on-premises.

title: Icertis automates scaling, reduces costs by 70%, meets customer demand around the clock
executive_summary: Icertis solves the hardest contract management problems for some of the world’s biggest organizations. But difficult-to-predict daily spikes in customer workload demand made it complex, expensive, and time-consuming to scale its database estate using a custom-built solution. By moving to the Microsoft Azure SQL Database serverless compute tier, Icertis can now rely on automatic, near-instant rescaling of database compute resources to immediately accommodate its customers’ changing and often unpredictable workload patterns. In making the move, the company cut its database costs by nearly 70 percent.

title: Rockwell Automation brings visibility, new capabilities to sellers with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Fortune 500 company Rockwell Automation, Inc., (NYSE: ROK) provides industrial automation and digital transformation solutions to global customers across industries. As business grew and customer needs became more complex, Rockwell Automation needed a more comprehensive solution to manage sales and build strong customer relationships. The company adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps, and Power BI to simplify and standardize tools for its global salesforce. Now sellers are empowered to connect with subject matter experts, streamline processes, and quickly provide the right information to customers to build relationships.

title: The Salvation Army Switzerland deepens relationships with supporters through a CRM-based loyalty program
executive_summary: N/A

title: Better forecasting, safer driving with Bosch
executive_summary: By combining road and weather expertise with rich vehicle data, Bosch attained real-time, granular insights by using Azure Data Explorer—improving driving safety, forecast accuracy, and increasing the availability of automated driving functions, in a way that was globally scalable.

title: Cosentino bases its technology strategy on Microsoft 365 and PowerBI for a sustainable growth
executive_summary: Cosentino Group, a Spanish multinational leader in the production and distribution of innovative surfaces for architecture and design, launched more than a year ago a transformation plan that bets firmly on Microsoft 365 to help its human capital to be better connected, thus favoring flexibility and management agility. In its transformation process, Cosentino was also seeking optimizing its operations, both internal and with suppliers and customers, giving access to professionals to innovative solutions that will directly impact on the creation of an ecosystem that would bring value to the market.

title: Suite Hub streamlines bookings and increases conversions with Dynamics 365 Sales and Power Apps
executive_summary: Suite Hub makes it easy to source, compare, and book serviced accommodations for business travelers anywhere in the world. To best present corporate bookers with accommodation options that perfectly match their needs, Suite Hub uses Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Power Pages. Suite Hub continues to make enhancements to its platform to centralize data, increase data security, and help bookers and providers interact seamlessly. By unifying its interface and adding Power Automate flows with low-code development, Suite Hub increased the efficiency of its booking process, leading to a 30 percent boost in booking conversions.

title: How do you keep the trains running through a global pandemic?
executive_summary: In the busy London commuter belt served by Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR), around a million passengers depend on rail journeys to get to and from work every day. In early March 2020, when the extent of the COVID-19 crisis started to become evident, GTR urgently began planning how to keep its essential services running for key workers and colleagues.

title: Major media company’s migration succeeds, despite pandemic, with help from Microsoft
executive_summary: Media24 thought it had a complex and challenging IT issue: conducting a tenant-to-tenant Big Bang migration of 4,000 Office 365 accounts with just four months to plan and one chance to get it right. Then the pandemic struck. Microsoft Consulting Services helped the company to move training and migration guidance to a virtual environment, implement best practices for adoption and change management, create Power BI dashboards to keep executives informed, and more. A strong partnership between the two companies and a “One Microsoft” approach that brought together all relevant resources, helped make it possible. The migration succeeded.

title: El BCI invierte en Microsoft Azure Stack Hub para acceder a beneficios de nube híbrida
executive_summary: El Banco de Crédito e Inversiones (BCI) tiene como objetivo brindar experiencias tecnológicas sofisticadas a sus clientes. Como parte de una travesía de transformación digital, el BCI ha iniciado un cambio en toda la empresa a Microsoft Azure y utilizó la extensión Azure Stack Hub para desarrollar una arquitectura híbrida que abarca nubes públicas y privadas. Con Azure Stack Hub, el BCI puede mantener las aplicaciones y los recursos en las instalaciones según sea necesario por motivos de rendimiento o normativos. Desde su migración a Azure y Azure Stack Hub, el BCI ha mejorado el rendimiento y la confiabilidad de sus sistemas y ha adquirido la agilidad para presentar nuevos productos a los clientes más rápidamente.
products: Azure, Azure Stack, Azure Stack Hub

title: Swun Math pivots to distance learning with Pegasus One and a Microsoft .NET solution
executive_summary: Swun Math, a mathematics program in Cypress, California, needed to rapidly move its learning material online because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Swun Math connected with Pegasus One, a Microsoft partner based in nearby Fullerton. To give Swun Math an easy path to online learning delivery, Pegasus One implemented a solution built with Microsoft .NET tools. Using its future-ready online learning platform, Swun Math has built a thriving distance education community that can seamlessly grow as the company evolves.

title: Lockheed Martin builds for the next stage in human space exploration with Microsoft HoloLens 2
executive_summary: Lockheed realized it needed mixed reality to address the needs of the building process, and to help streamline instruction delivery and to empower accurate, efficient building processes. Lockheed Martin decided to use Microsoft HoloLens 2 to address these needs. With augmented reality, and the help of HoloLens, the company can focus less on the minutia of construction and error management and more on designing and empowering the next generation of deep space travel.

title: WTW raises certainty in an uncertain world with AI-driven Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Customers from around the world rely on professional services organization WTW for its innovative risk strategies, insurance placement, HR consulting, and compensation and benefits planning. All of these services depend on enormous volumes of data that engender the clarity and perspective organizations need to make the best possible decisions in a world that guarantees only uncertainty. So, protecting client data and intellectual property are a WTW hallmark. Over the years, the company had built up a raft of unrelated, legacy security solutions that were increasingly difficult to maintain. Its vision for a more streamlined, productivity-first security posture called for a tightly coordinated tool set. WTW found what it needed with the full suite of Microsoft Security solutions, including Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Purview, and Azure. It’s excited to use the latest security innovation, AI-driven Microsoft Security Copilot.

title: Finance association streamlines communications and events for stronger member engagement with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Banks and finance companies may operate independently, but they are united by best practices, regulations, and shared professional standards through organizations like the Australian Finance Industry Association (AFIA). The organization supports more than 100 financiers and has 50 associate members. It wanted to understand each of them more fully to offer communications, services, and events that best meet their needs. After deploying Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing, including event management capabilities, AFIA quickly expanded its class offerings, automated its emails, saved employee time, and increased member satisfaction.

title: Regional health insurer improves security and experience, simplifies monitoring with Microsoft security solutions
executive_summary: MVP Health Care is a nationally recognized regional health plan with strong values of quality and integrity. The company’s emphasis on member confidentiality and cybersecurity makes it easy to see why it has won numerous awards for quality, service, and customer satisfaction. When the company divested from numerous overlapping, redundant security licenses, it turned to Microsoft integrated security solutions for a simpler, more proactive and easily managed security posture.

title: University to enable students to securely manage their own transcripts with Verifiable Credentials
executive_summary: Based in Tokyo, Japan, Keio University used manual processes to manage students’ transcripts and graduation certificates. In 2020, it joined a research project to deploy a solution based on Microsoft Azure Active Directory—Verifiable Credentials with decentralized identifiers. The solution will provide 33,000 students and 386,000 alumni a highly secure, interoperable, and private way to manage and share their transcripts and certificates. Keio expects to improve security and lower the overhead of engaging alumni over the years.

title: Sri Lanka’s largest listed company harnesses data for simplicity, agility, and resilience
executive_summary: John Keells Holdings (JKH) operates across various sectors, from consumer goods to financial services, information technology to leisure, property development to transportation. The company’s diverse portfolio was unified into a single platform through Microsoft Azure. By consolidating the data from all its business units into one solution, JKH improved its service quality group-wide. The organization gained a deeper and more holistic understanding of its customers across different sectors and business units.

title: Closing the digital divide for people with disabilities
executive_summary: Founded in 1799, SeeAbility is a charity that provides ambitious support for people with sight loss, learning disabilities and autism.

title: Cloud-based visualization of data serves science in the global fight against resistant pathogens based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Where science meets digitalization: the Global Antimicrobial Resistance Research and Development Hub, or Global AMR R&D Hub, works with huge amounts of research data from all around the world. In its mission to combat resistance to antimicrobial medication, the Hub needed a way of transparently documenting how research funding is used and make this information available to the public. The solution came in the form of a dynamic dashboard based on Microsoft Azure and Power BI. It will help highlight the scientific fields that need further research funding.

title: DGS Law raises the security bar and levels the playing field with Microsoft Defender Experts
executive_summary: DGS Law proves that dispensing stellar legal services isn’t tied to having a large employee count, even though its medium-sized law firm is held to the same cybersecurity standards as goliath law firms. Happily, DGS Law found Microsoft Defender Experts for XDR, a managed detection and response service incorporating Microsoft’s security expertise and tools to help a four-person security team punch above its weight. DGS Law can now operate as effectively as its large competitors while focusing its resources on what matters most—its clients.

title: Florida university gives students hands-on skills, job-hunting success with Microsoft courseware
executive_summary: Students need to know about changing technology more than ever, while professors have less time than ever to enrich their classes to meet that need. Florida’s St. Leo University is among the 500 universities worldwide that are addressing that gap with Microsoft Learn for Educators. The Microsoft Learn for Educators program enables faculty members to infuse Microsoft curriculum, hands-on labs, and tools into the courses they already teach, better preparing their students for Microsoft certification and successful job hunts.

title: Forza Horizon 5 crosses the finish line fueled by Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: BeeKeeperAI speeds healthcare AI development with Azure confidential computing and Intel SGX
executive_summary: Access to healthcare data is critical for clinical AI development, but availability is hampered by lengthy contracting and medical ethics reviews to ensure data security, typically through data anonymization tools. BeeKeeperAI uses Microsoft Azure confidential computing to create secure data enclaves built on Intel Software Guard Extensions. Within these, encrypted AI computes against an encrypted dataset in the data steward’s HIPAA-compliant cloud environment. BeeKeeperAI’s Zero Trust platform now dramatically accelerates the healthcare AI development process by enabling sightless computing on secure, quality healthcare data compared to traditional methods.

title: Plus Malaysia Berhad streamlines internal processes with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: PLUS Malaysia Berhad (PMB) is the country’s largest highway service provider and one of the largest in Southeast Asia. To ensure a safe and efficient highway network for citizens, its stakeholders always seize opportunities to improve internal processes. PMB adopted a low code Microsoft Power Platform to automate time-consuming manual tasks and empower non-technical teams to build business apps quickly. Shorter cycle time, simplified work process, and faster report generation have increased internal efficiency, enabling the workforce to focus more on value-added activity to improve customer experience.
products: Microsoft 365, Power Apps

title: Partnership between California Child Support Services and Microsoft on Cloud Adoption leading to a more efficient system protecting Californian children and families
executive_summary: Businesses and organizations have rapidly transitioned to intensify digital integration following COVID-19. And with the transition to digital adoption also came a rise of cyber threats. As a state organization, the existing cyber infrastructure at the California Child Support Services (DCSS) had impeded timely remediation of business continuity and was vulnerable to security threats. To meet changing business needs, DCSS engaged Microsoft Consulting Services to help tackle several challenges associated with their on-premises Child Support Enforcement (CSE) business system. Through Microsoft services, DCSS is now better able to meet their mission to enhance the well-being of children by providing payment services to Californian families faster than ever before.

title: Marks and Spencer is boosting sustainability and inclusivity initiatives with Surface Go 2 and Surface Hub 2S
executive_summary: Looking to modernize the shopping experience and promote hybrid work, British multinational retailer Marks and Spencer (M&S) adopted a digital-first mindset that brings innovation both to its offices and the retail floors of its 600 stores. As some employees have returned to the office, M&S knew it needed to create a hybrid work approach where remote and in-office workers can easily collaborate. So, it turned to Microsoft Surface devices to help bridge that gap. The company equipped its offices with Surface Hub 2S interactive whiteboards to facilitate collaboration and create ideation spaces where all workers can communicate effectively and feel like their voices are being heard. Employees can also easily review new clothing designs without needing to see them in person. M&S also carried its future-focused approach to retail floors, where all store managers now use Surface Go to provide faster, more efficient services and coach their teams to better serve customers. With Surface Go devices, retail teams always have the information they need at their fingertips, and the company has reduced its in-store printing by one-third.

title: Security Bank streamlines the sales process to empower sales frontliners with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: As a leading universal bank in the Philippines, Security Bank Corporation offers a full range of financial services. To achieve greater customer-centric banking, Security Bank streamlined its sales proposal and approval process for even greater efficiency. The bank developed the Sales Proposal Builder application using Microsoft Teams technology. Proposal and approval times were cut from two hours to 30 minutes, and from two weeks to a day, respectively. This helped salespeople focus more time and energy on the bank’s clients.

title: Sanofi gains speed and agility with an Azure hybrid cloud strategy
executive_summary: Since its founding in 1973, Sanofi has relentlessly pushed the boundaries of medicine. With a mission to deliver life-saving medical treatments and vaccines to people everywhere, Sanofi relies on its cutting-edge science and manufacturing to make the impossible possible for millions of people around the world. When faced with the limitations of its on-premises infrastructure, Sanofi adopted a hybrid cloud strategy and chose Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform, gaining the speed, agility, and reliability necessary for innovation.

title: Valencia CF creates meaningful, hyper-personalized fan experiences with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Valencia Club de Fútbol (CF), a 103-year-old football club in eastern Spain, has a dedicated and loyal fan base that spans generations. As an innovative and forward-thinking organization, the club is continuously improving the global fan experience and building new connections with the Valencia community. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365, the club gained new and actionable insights and a deeper understanding of its fans. From deploying an app to speed food orders in the stadium to checking-in with 1,500 season ticket holders who missed in-person games during the COVID-19 lockdowns, Valencia has used the insights from its customer data to create delightful, rewarding, and engaging fan experiences.

title: Alfa Beta introduces a fresh way to communicate with stores using the Microsoft Teams platform
executive_summary: In the past, store managers received information through emails that they accessed via PC’s in a store office. Accessing the information took managers away from the shop floor, and there was no simple way to confirm with support offices once a task had been completed. Because many Alfa Beta employees were already familiar with the Microsoft 365 platform, the move to Teams for collaboration was simple and intuitive. The new process is helping save time for managers and support office workers alike: Alfa Beta has tracked a 10% reduction in the time store managers spend looking for information.

title: Atrium Underwriters ensures its future data estate with SQL Server 2022
executive_summary: While the financial services industry traditionally takes a conservative approach to new technology, London-based Atrium Underwriters considers it to be a key driver of its current success. “Whether it’s getting data, storing data, or analyzing data, technology helps us balance risk and create a profitable book of business,” explained Emma Walter, IT Delivery Manager at Atrium.

title: NHS Supply Chain boosts productivity with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: “Knowing what I know now, if we hadn’t made the choice we did, I would have been gutted,” says Chris Gundel, IT Operations Manager at NHS Supply Chain. “The Microsoft Surface devices are a phenomenal product.”
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Surface Laptop, Surface Pro, Surface Studio, Windows 11

title: A Greek MSP leads the way by empowering employees with Azure skills
executive_summary: Office Line is one of the leading cloud Managed Services Provider in Greece, Cyprus, and Malta, and a star Microsoft partner for 20 years. It empowers companies by helping them migrate to the cloud. In an effort to accelerate the Azure migration process, Office Line turned to Microsoft’s training and skilling initiatives to raise operational capacity and equip its employees with the necessary skills and knowledge. Today, Office Line is one of few organizations in the world to receive seven Advanced Specializations on Microsoft Cloud. These specialized skills are helping the company grow by 40 percent every year.

title: Romanian courier company implements Azure to offer efficient and reliable delivery services
executive_summary: Sameday is the fastest growing Romanian courier company, using technology to create delivery solutions that drive growth for its customers and partners. The Romanian company offers an extensive range of services: home delivery, the same day delivery and delivery to over 3,200 easybox lockers nationwide.  To provide its services effectively, Sameday relies on technology and digitization, and Microsoft Azure is the chosen solution for managing its logistics infrastructure and for managing the locker network and reporting.  As a result, the company has seen an increase in its on-time delivery rate and revenue.

title: UniCredit: empowering employees with cloud technology and collaboration tools
executive_summary: European bank UniCredit is committed to empowering its employees with the use of technology. But for an organization employing 87,000 people across 13 countries, this is no easy task. For years, UniCredit had to handle a wide range of IT environments across the group, which made it challenging to engage with its workforce and unlock its full potential. This all changed in 2021, when the organization launched a company-wide digital transformation program aimed at migrating to the cloud and implementing shared collaboration tools with Microsoft’s help.

title: City of Saint John triumphs over ransomware attack with Bulletproof and Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Even as the City of Saint John was working harder than ever to deliver service to its citizens during an unprecedented pandemic, it was targeted by a crippling ransomware attack. Thanks to its steely resolve and its strong relationship with Microsoft Partner Network member and security expert Bulletproof, the City rebuilt and came back stronger than ever before with a host of Microsoft Security solutions.

title: LA County Public Defender uses Microsoft solutions to keep serving more than 100,000 clients per year, even in a pandemic
executive_summary: The Los Angeles County Public Defender’s Office (LA County Public Defender), which provides legal defense to more than 100,000 clients yearly, used Microsoft products to pivot in a single weekend. When the Covid-19 pandemic forced offices to shut down in March 2020, LA County Public Defender worked remotely to develop cases. Clients still had to show up for court dates, and deputy public defenders had to provide legal services. To accomplish this quickly, LA County Public Defender used Microsoft 365 solutions it already owned, introducing digital collaboration and health-screening protocols. In doing so, LA County Public Defender became a model for other government entities looking to innovate and embrace technological solutions.

title: Municipality of Alkmaar migrates to Azure, improving IT operations and citizen experiences
executive_summary: As one of the largest municipalities in the Netherlands, the Municipality of Alkmaar supports its 115,000 citizens with impactful innovations. It has steadily introduced digital applications to connect and engage citizens but recently faced difficulty scaling and meeting timelines while relying on outdated hardware. In only three months, the municipality completed an expansive migration to Microsoft Azure to drive business continuity and overall agility. It also improved system performance, scalability, and security, making its digital offerings faster and more available to citizens than ever before.

title: Ernst & Young LLP (EY) improves their employee experience with Microsoft Search
executive_summary: Employees at Ernst & Young LLP (EY), one of the largest professional services networks in the world, introduced Microsoft Search to help employees easily search for people, files, sites, and more. In parallel with a campaign to strengthen and update permissions on the company’s two million Microsoft SharePoint sites, the global firm rolled out user education campaigns to its employees to create the best search experience possible. Now, EY teams use work search to facilitate better collaboration among teams and higher productivity companywide.

title: Enexis adopts Microsoft Mixed Reality technology and the industrial metaverse to take a leading role in the energy transition
executive_summary: Dutch state-owned utility provider Enexis is on a mission to drive the energy transition at a national level. This, however, requires significant changes. From infrastructure upgrades to grid expansions, Enexis is largely transforming its operations – and is doing it using new technology and greater amounts of skilled personnel. To make sure that its current and future workforce is equipped for the needs of the future, Enexis has rolled out a training program centered around using Mixed Reality with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Guides and HoloLens 2. An instant success across the company – allowing trainees to master materials 40% faster than in traditional ways – the initiative has persuaded Enexis to go even further, and venture into the possibilities offered by the industrial metaverse.

title: Kantar Adopts Windows 11 Enterprise to Build the Foundation for Copilot and AI
executive_summary: To achieve its vision of delivering an employee experience that rivals the simplicity and ease of use of the best consumer experience, Kantar moved from on-premises to cloud-based Intune endpoint management. In preparation for its deployment of Windows 11 Enterprise, the company spun up Windows 365 Cloud PCs—and is harnessing the power of generative AI with Copilot. In addition to reducing costly, time-consuming IT processes, these benefits enabled Kantar to boost productivity for employees—translating an improved employee experience into impactful outcomes for its clients.

title: Körber uplevels pharma factories with cloud-based PAS-X MES SaaS using Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing
executive_summary: Körber is helping customers become future-ready with easy-to-deploy, scalable, and secure pharmaceutical production by transforming its PAS-X Manufacturing Execution System (MES) offering into an SaaS solution. This strategic enhancement is designed to meet the rising global demand for pharmaceuticals by facilitating scalable MES deployments and maintenance while reducing capital and resource expenditure. The move capitalizes on the robust stability of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing, including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), to offer a service stack to customers that enables greater flexibility and scalability. Körber customers are already reporting significant IT responsibility and initial investment reductions while being able to scale and update easily.

title: Dentsu drives creativity and growth for brands, supported by Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: With a storied 120-year history and 72,000 employees, dentsu is revered as one of the top creative media companies in the world, with a reputation for being innovation specialists as much as they are marketing and transformation experts. Dentsu’s agency teams are powered by data, tech, and generative AI. One of the big challenges dentsu clients face is demand for content on a growing number of channels, which means dentsu must keep its creativity ahead of this rapid pace of change to build experiences that resonate with its clients and drive brand engagement. Microsoft Copilot is revolutionizing creative workflows, supporting dentsu’s talent, and helping to rethink services. By reducing and removing tactical tasks, dentsu employees can focus on the strategic part of their work – collaborating creatively to build brands and engage consumers.

title: OSTP moves toward CO2 emissions neutrality with Microsoft Sustainability Manager
executive_summary: Nordic-based OSTP Group specializes in manufacturing welded stainless steel tubular products and custom equipment for pressure corrosion applications. In pursuit of ambitious sustainability goals, OSTP built a digital platform featuring Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability, Sustainability Manager, Azure Data Platform, and other Microsoft technologies to gather and report on available CO2 emissions information. The platform utilizes Sustainability Manager to unify OSTP’s data intelligence, and aims to give employees and customers an increasingly automated and comprehensive view of the emissions impact of the company’s operations and value chain.

title: Building bridges across divisions: First National Bank South Africa enhances customer experience with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: With a 185-year legacy, First National Bank (FNB) is South Africa's oldest financial institution. A disjointed customer relationship management (CRM) system and departmental silos spurred FNB to elevate its approach. Turning to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Customer Service, the bank not only unified its data for a holistic customer view but also refined its sales and service strategies. With automated workflows, proactive customer insights, and enhanced engagement metrics, FNB began a new chapter in customer-centric relationship banking.

title: Legal & General increases safety, security, and business agility with Azure SQL DB
executive_summary: Founded in 1836, Legal & General is a leading financial services group and major global investor, with sustainable finance and a zero-carbon future at their core. The company promotes what they call “inclusive capitalism,” an aim to build a better society for the long term by investing customers’ money in things that make life better for everyone.

title: Visma: shaping the future of the software sector by innovating with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Visma is a leading European software provider based in Norway. The owner of more than 170 companies across the continent, Visma sees cloud technology as key to its success and that of its entire ecosystem. Over the past few years, it has been pushing for cloud adoption both at an internal level and across its wider network – encouraging all companies in its group to embrace the cloud they prefer, at their own terms. Microsoft Azure has been a pivotal part of this process. At Visma, it has formed part of a multi-cloud platform and beyond, and it’s getting selected by hundreds of other companies in the Visma group as primary cloud provider.

title: Chester Zoo streamlines operations with Valto and Microsoft SharePoint
executive_summary: The renowned Chester Zoo in the United Kingdom spans 51 hectares and sees 2 million visitors per year. Facing challenges in document management and modernizing business applications, the zoo consulted with Microsoft partner Valto. Valto used SharePoint, Power Apps, and other Microsoft products to design and implement solutions for the zoo. These solutions streamlined document reviews, facilitated uniform orders, and provided news access, improving operational efficiency and upholding a seamless visitor experience.

title: Körber uplevels pharma factories with cloud-based PAS-X MES SaaS using Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing
executive_summary: Körber is helping customers become future-ready with easy-to-deploy, scalable, and secure pharmaceutical production by transforming its PAS-X Manufacturing Execution System (MES) offering into an SaaS solution. This strategic enhancement is designed to meet the rising global demand for pharmaceuticals by facilitating scalable MES deployments and maintenance while reducing capital and resource expenditure. The move capitalizes on the robust stability of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing, including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), to offer a service stack to customers that enables greater flexibility and scalability. Körber customers are already reporting significant IT responsibility and initial investment reductions while being able to scale and update easily.

title: Chester Zoo streamlines operations with Valto and Microsoft SharePoint
executive_summary: The renowned Chester Zoo in the United Kingdom spans 51 hectares and sees 2 million visitors per year. Facing challenges in document management and modernizing business applications, the zoo consulted with Microsoft partner Valto. Valto used SharePoint, Power Apps, and other Microsoft products to design and implement solutions for the zoo. These solutions streamlined document reviews, facilitated uniform orders, and provided news access, improving operational efficiency and upholding a seamless visitor experience.

title: Elcome delivers fast, reliable broadband at sea with Microsoft Fabric and Copilot
executive_summary: Marine electronics expert Elcome understands the importance of reliable broadband connectivity to keep its customers safe at sea and keep their businesses operating smoothly. Working with Microsoft AI Cloud Partner Program member Onyx Data, Elcome deployed Microsoft Fabric—including the Real-Time Intelligence, real-time hub, and data activator features—along with Copilot to build Welcome, an industry-first, ISP-grade monitoring and management platform that is scalable, flexible, and future-proof. With its Microsoft-powered solution, Elcome has reduced data latency from minutes to seconds, giving customers high-speed connectivity that keeps vessels and crews safe and well-informed in the ever-changing marine environment.

title: Posten Bring: Setting the logistics sector up for the future using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Posten Bring is a Norwegian mail and logistics group operating across the Nordics. An institution that is more than 370 years old, Posten Bring has, at the same time, a decisively modern vision for itself and its future. A testament to this is its recent decision to move all its operations onto a cloud-based system—phasing out a long-outdated, on-premises system in favor of a scalable, reliable, and flexible solution fit for the modern delivery provider. A solution designed to better support the rise of e-commerce, as well as peak periods like Christmas and Black Friday. And ultimately lead Posten Bring to the era of data and AI.

title: Gamle Oslo boosts its ability to serve residents using Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: The district of Gamle Oslo in the Norwegian capital of Oslo is always looking to provide better services to residents by directing its resources intelligently and efficiently. However, the district lacked a unified window into its multiple sets of collected data, impeding its ability to deliver assistance and funding efficiently. Gamle Oslo adopted Microsoft Fabric as a tool for collecting and analyzing all its data, giving workers greater insight and improving service for residents.

title: Bader Sultan uses Microsoft Copilot to boost productivity and serve clients faster
executive_summary: Bader Sultan and Brothers Company (BSBC) is leading regional supplier of high-quality healthcare and hospital equipment. Based in Kuwait, the company employs a workforce of 300 people and operates throughout the GCC. It invests heavily in its people and in technology and chose to implement Microsoft Copilot early to support their work, productivity, and innovation. The company is delighted by the additional support the team has reported thanks to their use of Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 which is helping to drive productivity improvements as well as better, faster, and more timely responses to customer requests.

title: Teladoc Health: Transforming telehealth operations with Copilot
executive_summary: Teladoc Health uses Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 to revolutionize its telehealth operations, automating routine tasks, boosting efficiency, and increasing productivity. This has resulted in considerable time savings, faster client service response times, and streamlined onboarding processes. The interoperability of Copilot has not only strengthened Teladoc’s operational capabilities but also resulted in better leadership engagement and employee satisfaction, setting a new standard in the telehealth industry.

title: Torfaen County Borough Council streamlines organisational support for Social Care using Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Digi Rogaland prioritizes student safety with Bouvet and Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Digi Rogaland realized that they lacked competence in digitalization, the Internet of Things (IoT), and a secure data platform to combine data used by several of the municipalities.

title: Melbourne Airport democratizes data-driven decision making with Microsoft Fabric.
executive_summary: Melbourne Airport, the second busiest in Australia, is a key connector for the country’s travel and transportation. The operational team needed to upgrade its data analytics capabilities to improve operational efficiency and passenger experience.

title: British Heart Foundation accelerates innovation with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: The British Heart Foundation (BHF) is Europe’s largest funder of research into heart and circulatory disease, and the organization finances projects using AI to accelerate scientific breakthroughs. It wanted to test how AI could help its business operations, too.

title: University of Manchester drives value from Microsoft 365 Copilot with emphasis on creative thinking and continuous learning
executive_summary: The University of Manchester is a technology and innovation leader. It is currently exploring how generative AI can power its own operations.

title: Hong Kong Maxim’s Group serves streamlined sales and production with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Maxim’s Group needed a scalable solution able to satisfy complex business needs that would simplify user experience and improve its customers’ ordering experience.

title: SEB takes Zero Trust to the bank with Entra ID and Microsoft Defender solutions
executive_summary: Leading Nordic banking and financial services provider SEB insists on the tightest security possible for its customer data. Clearly, end-to-end Zero Trust was the way forward. But what security solutions would best meet the need?

title: ABN AMRO Bank migrates to Microsoft Copilot Studio to support over 3.5 million customer conversations
executive_summary: ABN AMRO Bank had been operating several chatbots but wanted to explore a new platform that would allow them to better implement AI capabilities.

title: NBA boosts AI innovation by migrating to Azure for security, scalability, and speed
executive_summary: Celebrating the game of basketball through many channels, including events and broadcasts, the NBA needed a better way to access data, moving onto a unified platform to scale on demand and use AI-driven capabilities, such as high performance.

title: Eaton helps power its finance processes, data access, and efficiency with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Eaton needed to manage thousands of standard operating procedures (SOPs) and improve data access across teams, prompting the company to find a solution to streamline operations, automate documentation, and support knowledge transfer.

title: Envirotainer protects pharmaceuticals more sustainably with Cloud for Sustainability
executive_summary: Envirotainer, a leader in transporting temperature-controlled pharmaceuticals, needed sophisticated technology to track emissions data across 100 airlines and 600 pharmaceutical companies as part of its ambitious sustainability goals.

title: Coca-Cola Bottling Company United dispenses streamlined order management with RPA in Microsoft Power Automate
executive_summary: Coca-Cola Bottling Company United (Coca-Cola United) has a long history of supplying Coca-Cola products directly to retailers and restaurants. But when Coca-Cola introduced its new Freestyle vending machine, Coca-Cola United, a privately owned company that isn’t owned by Coca-Cola, was challenged to streamline its order and invoicing procedures. It rose to the occasion quickly, using Microsoft Power Automate robotic process automation (RPA). Coca-Cola United is advancing the strategic Freestyle initiative with process automation that matches the individuality and innovation that the product represents.

title: Carhartt gains business agility, supports rapid business growth with SAP solutions on Azure and Teams
executive_summary: For more than 130 years, Carhartt apparel has been famed for its quality, durability, and innovation. The family-owned company, headquartered in Dearborn, Michigan, is now transforming its business model to increase retail revenue alongside its traditional wholesale business. But to do that, it needed SAP S/4HANA systems that could provide the scalability and availability to support rapid growth. By working with Microsoft Partner Network member KochaSoft to implement SAP on Microsoft Azure, Carhartt has gained the elastic but stable environment it needs to be more agile and responsive as it grows.
products: Azure, Azure Load Balancer, Azure NetApp Files, SAP on Azure, Microsoft Teams

title: Columbia Sportswear gains business flexibility and a sales boost with Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Columbia Sportswear is passionate about getting active people into the great outdoors with the company’s global brands of clothing, footwear, and accessories. To digitally transform its business and streamline operations from IT datacenters to warehouse inventory and point-of-sale checkout, Columbia moved to Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365 Commerce, Dynamics 365 Finance, and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. From record-setting holiday sales in 2019 to corporate resilience in the face of COVID-19, the company’s cloud investment is making a positive impact on business performance through greater staffing efficiency, faster and more flexible customer service, and increased inventory awareness. Columbia plans to gain greater insight into consumer activities and preferences through Dynamics 365 Connected Store and deliver even more value to loyal customers with Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.

title: Tencent updates web and mobile payment infrastructure for better scalability and agility
executive_summary: Tencent FiT, a division of Tencent and a global leader in online and mobile payment services, planned to modernize its IT infrastructure to accommodate rapid business expansion. The company migrated to a new back-end architecture based on .NET Core and ASP.NET Core. It now has an efficient API gateway for communication with payment settlement services, making them more scalable and maintainable and its development teams more agile.

title: The Allscripts prescription for agility: lift and shift to the cloud
executive_summary: Allscripts is a leading healthcare software manufacturer, serving physician practices, hospitals, health plans, and Big Pharma. To transform its applications frequently and host them securely and reliably, Allscripts has started to use Microsoft Azure. In just three weeks, the company lifted and shifted dozens of acquired applications running on 1,000 virtual machines to Azure. Allscripts also develops software in Azure and realizes dramatic time-to-market gains and savings by using the Azure platform as a service offering.

title: Heathrow Airport inspires employee engagement with Microsoft Power Apps
executive_summary: Heathrow Airport is always open to technological advancements that increase productivity, but when the airport granted its entire workforce access to Microsoft Office 365, few could have expected the incredible impact a handful of first-line employees would realize through Microsoft Power Apps. Through the low-code development of 30 apps, Heathrow employees have eliminated 75,000 pages of paperwork and reduced data entry by nearly 1,000 hours, helping the airport reduce its costs.

title: Kennametal pushes manufacturing into the future with IoT and Microsoft cloud solutions
executive_summary: Kennametal delivers industrial parts and services to global customers in industries from aerospace to energy. As part of its multiple-year modernization strategy, the company migrated IT resources to Microsoft Azure and invested heavily in factory upgrades. Recognizing the importance of data in modern business, Kennametal uses performance insights uncovered with Microsoft Power BI to optimize its sophisticated machinery. Kennametal’s initial efforts to drive a data culture have resulted in significant impacts. In certain areas of production, the first upgraded factory has improved machine setup times by almost 50 percent, increased press availability by 50 percent, and seen the most productive month ever in terms of pieces per day through certain departments.

title: Medical equipment manufacturer improves first-line worker efficiency with LTE-enabled Surface Pro
executive_summary: Workers for medical equipment manufacturer Beckman Coulter carried laptops, digital cameras, signature pads, and 4G network cards to customer sites. To consolidate devices, the company upgraded to Microsoft Surface Pro with LTE Advanced. Customer service is more efficient with this new, always-connected modern workplace solution. Workers collect customer signatures with Surface Pen, and take photos and access reference documents via Microsoft OneDrive from their devices—without relying on Wi-Fi hotspots.

title: BCI invests in Microsoft Azure Stack Hub for hybrid cloud benefits
executive_summary: Banco de Crédito e Inversiones (BCI) aims to give its customers sophisticated technology experiences. As part of a digital transformation journey, BCI has initiated a companywide move to Microsoft Azure and used Azure Stack Hub to develop a hybrid architecture that spans both public and private clouds. With Azure Stack Hub, BCI can keep applications and resources on-premises as necessary for performance or regulatory reasons. Since moving to Azure and Azure Stack Hub, BCI has improved the performance and reliability of its systems and gained the agility to roll out new products for customers faster.

title: Fortinet transforms customer experience through Microsoft commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Fortinet is a leading cybersecurity company that develops and markets solutions that cover devices, endpoint, network, cloud, and security operations. With a broad portfolio of solutions available, Fortinet is transforming its customer experience and journey across the cloud through the commercial marketplace.

title: Concentrix leadership boosts pilot adoption of Breakthru on Microsoft Teams by 48x
executive_summary: Concentrix is a global Fortune 500 company with over 450,000 employees helping the world’s leading organizations modernize technology and transform experiences. Leadership at Concentrix believes well-being is a part of their success.

title: Pearson empowers language students to learn faster in a natural way with Azure AI capabilities
executive_summary: Pearson helps people around the globe learn foreign languages so that they can advance in academics and careers. When primary school students learn English, they often need more practice and feedback from teachers and parents than they can get. Pearson worked closely with Microsoft to help address this need, providing input on Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services capabilities in development such as pronunciation assessment. Pearson then added multiple AI-based services to its Longman Welcome to English program, offering interactive instruction for students, support for teachers, affordability for parents, and a digital learning option during COVID-19.

title: ELSAN reinvents the patient journey with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: ELSAN needed a solution to simplify patient journeys, reduce administrative burden, and support more personalized, efficient care at scale.

title: Nuance’s Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) helps doctors document care faster so they can spend more time with patients delivering high-quality care with AI on Azure
executive_summary: Nuance develops technology solutions that help its healthcare customers increase efficiency and provide the best patient care possible. Using Microsoft Azure and PyTorch, the company created Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX), an AI-based clinical solution that automatically turns doctor-patient conversations into accurate medical notes, which benefits both parties. Patients experience a more engaging, personal visit because doctors can focus on the patient rather than entering notes into a computer. And doctors who use DAX report significant time savings and less stress, which helps minimize burnout.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Container Registry, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Machine Learning

title: Schindler: elevating the cities of the future
executive_summary: Every day, all over the world, more than 1.5 billion people use Schindler’s elevators, escalators and moving walkways. Now, the Swiss company has ambitions to play a key role in creating the seamless, smart and sustainable cities of the future. From office buildings, to airports, to shopping centers, Schindler is unleashing new data-driven innovations that will transform its services and offer more connected experiences for its customers.

title: Bern KAIO enters digital meeting spaces with the expert help of SPIE ICS
executive_summary: Kantonales Amt für Informatik und Organisation (KAIO, or Canton Office for IT and Organization) is the central official entity supplying innovative IT solutions to the entire Canton of Bern government. KAIO needed an effective hybrid meetings solution to respond to COVID-19 workplace challenges. In an innovation workshop, SPIE ICS presented solution scenarios, demonstrating a candidate based on Microsoft Teams Rooms. KAIO chose to run a proof of value (PoV) based on Skype for Business on premises and, after successful completion of the PoV, the solution is now used operationally.

title: Energy company improves power grid operation with Azure-based web platform
executive_summary: As the largest producer of renewable energy in Switzerland, Axpo manages and maintains a 2,400-kilometer, high-voltage power grid. The organization is committed to energy efficiency, sustainability, and minimizing climate impact while delivering the highest-quality power at a reasonable cost. As part of its digital transformation, the utility created a single access point that links users to all relevant information on grid assets within a geographical view. With the help of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Search, Azure Maps, and Power BI, Axpo grid engineers and maintenance teams can easily find comprehensive, up-to-date data about the condition of each grid asset. This cuts search time up to 99 percent, makes it easier to identify problem areas in near real time, and paves the way to automate several grid-asset management tasks, thus reducing time significantly for many operational activities.

title: DVAG embraces omnichannel intranet solution from workai
executive_summary: Deutsche Vermögensberatung AG (DVAG) is Germany’s largest financial consultancy. For many years, its employees had been forced to rely on custom-built and fragmented systems for collecting knowledge and communicating. The company recognized that it needed a better system for employee collaboration and customer service. workai provided DVAG with a new intranet that now plays a crucial role in integrating its staff and ensuring flawless customer service. The modern and engaging workai omnichannel platform enables instant access to personalized information and sales knowledge for DVAG’s 18,000-plus financial consultants across Germany.
products: Azure, Azure AI Search, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Washington Township Public Schools in New Jersey connects more than 7,000 students and staff with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Many schools had to scramble and shift to a remote learning paradigm when the COVID-19 health crisis struck. But for some school districts like Washington Township Public Schools in Sewell, New Jersey, the transition was faster and more effective because it already had the technology in place to facilitate distance learning. Students and teachers were able to stay connected through the seamless integration of Microsoft Surface devices and productivity applications like Office 365 and Teams. The school increased productivity, communication, and accessibility—and future-proofed student learning in the process.

title: CEMEX moving SAP to Microsoft Azure and SUSE Linux for better availability, performance, and lower costs
executive_summary: To keep the world supplied with high-quality building materials, industry giant CEMEX relies on SAP applications to power day-to-day operations. The company’s datacenter is in Mexico, which sometimes caused application latency issues for international employees, while procuring on-premises hardware was time-consuming. By migrating its SAP landscape to Microsoft Azure and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications, CEMEX has saved money, improved performance by 40 to 70 percent for migrated SAP applications, and increased IT flexibility with on-demand cloud services.

title: SL2™️ from CellTrust drives mobile productivity and compliance for PCM
executive_summary: Young, dynamic, financial technology-savvy, and mobile, members of the client advisory team at Payne Capital Management (PCM) found it challenging to tell their clients that they couldn’t send them text messages because of compliance restrictions. An advisor’s only alternative was managing two cell phones: their personal phone and a protected one that belonged to the company. In response to this need, PCM selected the CellTrust SL2™️ Enterprise Mobile app with a built-in mobile business number (MBN) feature to provide advisors with privacy and their clients with a direct line, while capturing and archiving any work-related conversations conducted on advisors' personal phones to achieve regulatory compliance.

title: Azure Defender for IoT helps global geological materials company secure production and bridge the IT/OT gap
executive_summary: Global lime and minerals producer Lhoist’s IT security and industrial automation organizations haven’t always worked closely together, but a renewed focus on industrial cybersecurity united the two in a global initiative built around Microsoft Azure Defender for IoT. The new agentless OT security monitoring platform offers powerful asset discovery, vulnerability management, and threat monitoring capabilities, and contributes to a safer, more resilient, and more efficient operation that furthers the mission shared by all Lhoist workers: ensure production availability and deliver value to their customers.

title: Metroscope permet aux producteurs d’électricité d’améliorer leur efficacité et réduire leurs émissions grâce au jumeau numérique
executive_summary: Metroscope, an EDF startup founded in Paris in 2018, develops digital twin solutions for energy production plants, which improve efficiency and reduce emissions by monitoring and analyzing industrial assets. Today, Metroscope’s software is deployed on 67 industrial assets. To achieve a scalable, reliable, and highly secure solution, Metroscope chose to run its platform on Microsoft Azure technology. Metroscope is taking advantage of Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) to deploy applications along with Azure Database for PostgreSQL and Azure Cosmos DB to manage data. For end-to-end security, Metroscope implemented Microsoft Sentinel for threat analysis, Azure Key Vault for safeguarding customer-managed encryption keys, Azure Log Analytics to analyze data and service logs, and Microsoft Defender for Cloud for continuous monitoring and security insights, recommendations, and scores. Metroscope and its customers benefit from enhanced reliability, load balancing, autoscaling, single point of entry, and robust security. And everyone benefits from lower-carbon production facilities.

title: Wolverine Worldwide activates a digital shift to spark innovation with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Wolverine Worldwide has been activating a digital shift, transitioning from reliance on legacy on-premises applications and data to a more versatile deployment in multicloud and multitenant environments. By adopting Azure Arc to manage its data and operations, Wolverine Worldwide has made quick innovation easy for its different brands. They can rapidly test, react to research, and develop potential solutions for their unique challenges by spinning up and winding down varied resources as needed.

title: WestJet takes flight with advanced AI for personalized guest offerings using Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: WestJet goes far beyond simply shuttling guests between destinations. The second-largest Canadian airline focuses on people, providing an outstanding experience for guests and employees alike. To better understand how the COVID-19 pandemic has impacted guest needs and their preferences, the company worked closely with Microsoft to develop an AI-based Guest Experience Solution that allows WestJet to gain better insights into guest preferences. Now, the airline adjusts its offerings based on what guests want for a memorable trip while maintaining stability for guests and the company during a disrupted time.

title: Sonical helps Move To Happiness with a future-proof online platform
executive_summary: Move To Happiness wants to help people find exciting workouts, relaxing yoga classes, lifestyle programs and motivational health tips, so that everyone can work on their well-being in a fast and fun way. The company had already been toying with the idea of reinforcing this vision and their brand with an online platform for some time. Covid-19 was the last push they needed to go all in. In order to achieve this they called on the expertise of Sonical. Thanks to the online platform that Sonical built, Move To Happiness in Nijlen can help people work on their well-being in a fast and fun way, regardless of their location or the global situation.
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Journeys, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Dynamics 365 Business Central goes on a field trip!
executive_summary: Care4Cows is a company founded by Gijs Hampsink, a passionate entrepreneur who knows his business. The company offers products and advice related to milk production and how to improve it. Care4Cows is special because it not only supplies high-quality products, but also provides customers with sound and technically-substantiated advice, helping them make the right choices when purchasing liners and other milk shed parts. Everything is aimed at ensuring good udder health, which benefits the animals and their farmers.

title: Goliath Games & Blisss Software
executive_summary: Goliath Games is a major player in the field of board games. Rummikub, Triominos, Sequence and Super Sand are belong to the stable of this family company. The games manufacturer has 1.5 billion consumers worldwide. Their head office is in the Netherlands, in the historic Hanseatic trading city of Hattem, with branches and offices in thirteen other countries. Goliath's motto is "Clever Together!" They develop and market games based on this theme of combining fun and thinking.

title: Trusted fishing company embraces Dynamics 365 for better claim management
executive_summary: Pescatlantic Group—founded in Miami in 1987 with a single fishing boat—now produces, supplies, and commercializes yellowfin and bluefin tuna, as well as other premium species, for customers across North America. Pescatlantic Group has grown into one of the most respected fishing enterprises in the industry. To employ a solution that could best fulfill its workflow requirements, the business recognized that it needed to upgrade from its on-premises Microsoft Dynamics NAV 2009 instance to cloud-based Dynamics 365 Business Central. Korcomptenz worked with Pescatlantic Group to migrate the company to the new environment.

title: Yamaguchi Prefecture Board of Education accelerates digital education with Microsoft
executive_summary: N/A

title: Clearsight augments electrical infrastructure inspection with AutoML for Images from Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Constellation (Nasdaq: CEG) is the nation’s largest producer of carbon-free energy and a leading competitive retail supplier of power and energy products and services for homes and businesses across the United States. In March 2022 Constellation announced a sustainability arrangement with Microsoft in which Microsoft will develop software to allow Constellation’s customers to match their energy use with local carbon-free energy sources, 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

title: Aga Khan University optimizes operations to improve services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The Aga Khan University (AKU) is a private, not-for-profit institution of the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN), whose mission is to improve quality of life in the developing world and beyond through world-class teaching, research, and health care delivery. Given the wide geographic scope of its operations and its enduring commitment to quality, the university has consistently prioritized technological advancement and innovation in order to better and more efficiently serve its constituents: the patients, students, faculty, and staff. AKU’s journey towards Microsoft Azure cloud is part of its digital transformation. The tools, functionality and agility provided by Azure cloud is helping AKU in areas of research, business intelligence, data analytics and security.

title: Teaching with Microsoft Teams: How Onslow County Schools Maintains Social Emotional Learning Despite Disruptions
executive_summary: Onslow County Schools sits on the east coast of North Carolina, serving both the broader community and the children of Marines stationed at Camp Lejeune. The district is home to over 27,000 students across 40 different educational facilities, and like so many districts it has worked tirelessly to provide an education that will prepare students to succeed, despite all the disruptions of the last few years. To do so the district has relied upon Microsoft technologies and Windows devices, to create conditions that enhance teaching, enrich learning, and engage students across a spectrum of broader social and emotional challenges.

title: ICRON delivers up to 30% reduction in procurement costs, and you can take advantage of ICRON solutions on Microsoft Azure, today.
executive_summary: ICRON is a leading supply chain planning and optimization solutions company. ICRON enables the beauty and simplicity of optimized decision making to unleash the full potential of enterprises. ICRON’s solutions are successfully in use in FMCG, food and beverages, pharmaceuticals, chemicals, glass, high technology, and aerospace industries around the world.

title: Swift innovates with Azure confidential computing to help secure global financial transactions
executive_summary: With the rapid increase of cross border transactions, and growth in instant payment networks, the financial services industry is focusing on fighting fraud that can cost hundreds of billions annually. As the leading infrastructure provider for financial messaging services, Swift has long worked with its community of over 11,500 institutions to drive new ways to detect and catch fraudulent transactions. And now it is working with Microsoft to innovate further in the fight against financial crime. Using federated learning techniques along with Azure Machine Learning and Azure confidential computing, Swift and Microsoft are building an anomaly detection model for transactional data—all without copying or moving data from secure locations. The shared vision is that the model will become the new standard for reducing financial crime while achieving the highest level of security, privacy, and cost efficiency.
products: Microsoft Purview, Azure Machine Learning

title: The City of Kelowna increases and speeds access to its services with Azure AI
executive_summary: The forward-thinking City of Kelowna always looks for ways to deliver greater benefits to its citizens without increasing costs for them. Now that cognitive search technology and conversational AI are available, the city aims to use them in support of its 311 non-emergency municipal services help line. Sourcing real-time data and existing documentation, the solution can efficiently answer a wide range of questions. The City of Kelowna expects the solution to soon help translate complex legal documents, walk people through permitting processes, and reduce the need for repetitive work for citizens and governmental employees alike.

title: AI4Bharat achieves more data processing with less costs in a critical research project on sign language with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: “AI4Bharat is an initiative focused on building open-source AI for Indian languages, including datasets, models, and applications. Incubated in IIT Madras as a non-profit, it is supported by a few organizations & entities including Microsoft Research, and Azure Global, and is a Microsoft’s AI for Accessibility Grantee.”

title: Locobuzz delivers the future of Customer Experience with Microsoft Azure OpenAI
executive_summary:
