Arineo, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network, is providing support on the journey toward an integrated ERP, CRM, and HR system landscape based on Microsoft Dynamics 365—an example of efficient remote working during the COVID-19 health crisis.

title: Entain bets on SQL Server 2022 to boost growing gaming business
executive_summary: Entain is a leader in sports betting, gaming, and interactive entertainment. Through a cutting-edge technology platform, they provide exciting and safe gaming experiences to millions of customers across five continents. Customers expect to place wagers and receive payouts quickly and securely 24/7/365 across 33 languages and 42 currencies, no matter how many events are happening simultaneously.

title: Pension Protection Fund chooses Microsoft Azure to drive efficiency and innovation
executive_summary: “Doing the right thing is very important to the PPF. That’s something we’re very passionate about,” states Simon Liste, Chief Information Technology Officer at the Pension Protection Fund (PPF). “And, I’m very passionate about using technology and digital services for the greater good.”

title: Ernie Green raises security scores in identity management, Azure, and Office 365 by 30% with a new data foundation implemented by Core BTS
executive_summary: Ernie Green Industries (Ernie Green) broke down data silos by migrating to Microsoft Azure. The Tier 1 automotive supplier, which has a 40-year history of collaboration with prominent auto manufacturers, wanted to remain competitive in the new data-driven market. The company’s siloed and aging data infrastructure made it difficult for decision makers to get a high-level view of company operations and work efficiently. So Ernie Green launched a digital transformation on Azure with support from Microsoft partner Core BTS and migrated datacenter infrastructure across nine locations to a single cloud solution. Now company data is accessible and secure, and employees have cut monthly financial closing processes from a few weeks to a few hours.

title: Thanks to Microsoft Azure, Alstom can provide its customers with high-performance, secure and scalable digital services
executive_summary: In a world where the decarbonization of industries is at the heart of public policy, the development of ever more sustainable means of transportation appears to be one of the key responses to this major challenge. Provided we make it attractive and we continually reduce the energy consumption associated with its activity, which is inherently more sustainable.

title: Employee register tool on Azure for lively inter-employee communication — Mitsui Fudosan’s approach shows best solution to PaaS utilization
executive_summary: As a comprehensive urban developer, Mitsui Fudosan engages in a wide range of real estate businesses such as offices, shopping malls, homes, logistics facilities, hotels, and resorts. It is also active in implementing digital transformation, with the Digital Transformation Division playing a key role not only in facilitating modernization of internal systems, but also in promoting business innovation in the areas of office buildings and commercial facilities, etc. by setting missions such as cloud promotion, system advancement, and BPR promotion. When the relocation of its Head Office in FY2019 happened, the company launched its efforts for the activation of inter-employee communications. The company adopted “FACEWALL,” an online employee register tool provided by RANA UNITED, and built a system using Azure PaaS services.

title: Peel Region enhances productivity, collaboration, and security using Microsoft 365 and Security solutions
executive_summary: Peel Region went through a digital transformation that increased productivity while facilitating collaboration using Microsoft solutions. Peel Region depends on its employees to provide services to more than 1.5 million residents. Therefore, it wanted to improve experiences for both employees and residents by modernizing its technology. Employees were already using Microsoft 365 for various tasks, and the region realized that Microsoft 365, in addition to other Microsoft solutions, can make it easier for employees to collaborate remotely. Peel Region’s IT team also enhanced security, preventing 10,000 emails with viruses or malicious URLs over the course of 12 months.

title: Microsoft modernizes its datacenter leasing cycle with Power Platform
executive_summary: The Lease Acquisition team at Microsoft manages a complex multi-billion-dollar leased datacenter portfolio. Initially, the team heavily relied on manual processes and tools, to interact with the Lease providers and maintained critical data across various Microsoft Office documents and SharePoint. As the business grew, the Lease team realized a pressing need to streamline and centralize its data for stakeholder visibility, transparency, and better accountability and reporting of the datacenter leasing process as well as enablement to manage assets effectively. The team required digitization of several processes to automate routine tasks and provide a secure user interface for Lease providers.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Functions, Azure SQL Database, Azure Static Web Apps, Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Exchange Online, Dataverse

title: Varsity College scales up student lab capacity and saves IT costs with Azure Lab Services
executive_summary: Varsity College is a brand of the Independent Institute of Education (IIE), South Africa's largest registered and accredited private higher education provider. Until recently, all computer labs on the Varsity College campuses used fully on-premises equipment, requiring ongoing IT and administrative overhead to maintain. Since 2020, Varsity College has gained IT efficiencies by using Azure Lab Services, with cloud-based virtual machines (VMs) replacing the on-premises labs.

title: Revolutionizing healthcare: SAT Health streamlines patient support programs with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: SAT Health empowers healthcare providers with innovative and data-driven solutions. With its previous system for managing Patient Support Programs (PSP), the company faced challenges in data storage, security measures, and process scalability. Partnering with MY Synergy, SAT Health enhanced its PSP system by building it on Microsoft Power Platform and providing access through Azure Active Directory. The new MY Care solution has improved patient service delivery by healthcare professionals while maintaining high security standards and boosting staff efficiency.

title: USF fosters a culture of data-driven decision-making, empowering employees to derive insights in minutes using Power BI
executive_summary: The University of South Florida (USF) has accelerated data-driven decision-making by empowering its teams to access information and enriched business insights through a self-service approach. Financial reporting is essential to the university’s operations, but it used to be a time-consuming task, with teams compiling data from multiple sources into spreadsheets using homegrown tools. USF freed its teams from these repetitive manual tasks by connecting its information sources using Azure Synapse Analytics and Microsoft Power BI. The university has facilitated the adoption of these tools through data literacy training, helping its teams to become self-sufficient client technologists.

title: Payoneer saves months in setting up call centers to offer speedy financial services using Cloud PC solution
executive_summary: For nearly 20 years, Payoneer has been a trailblazer in the global digital economy. The financial technology company empowers businesses with a platform to manage their financial transactions and funds, and to pay and get paid internationally in different currencies. Guy Winberg, the Global IT-Corp Group Manager, was looking for a more cost-effective and time-saving solution for deploying new and maintaining the company’s network of call centers. For this, Winberg and his team transitioned service agents to Windows 365 Cloud PCs, which enabled Payoneer to combine the power and security of the cloud with the versatility and simplicity of a PC.

title: CitiusTech leverages Microsoft Teams for a more engaged and productive workforce
executive_summary: CitiusTech Healthcare Technology Private Limited (CitiusTech) provides a range of technology solutions and services to healthcare and life sciences companies, to help them navigate an increasingly digitally driven industry. It provides offerings across consulting, engineering, healthcare solutions, products, analytics, and AI, to enable organizations in the healthcare sector to reinvent themselves, deliver better outcomes, and have a positive impact on patients. The company partners with healthcare and life sciences organizations across the world, accelerating digital innovation and driving business transformation. Boasting an impressive track record of over 130 satisfied clients and more than 5,000 successful deployments, CitiusTech is at the forefront of powering the future of healthcare by facilitating the industry's digital transformation journey.

title: Duke Energy develops pioneering methane-emissions monitoring platform on Microsoft Azure with Accenture and Avanade
executive_summary: Duke Energy, one of the largest US energy-holding companies, set an ambitious goal for its natural gas utility business, planning to achieve net-zero methane emissions by 2030 for its own operations. Reaching that goal requires going beyond current industry practices, which utilize calculations to estimate methane emissions and periodic physical inspections to detect and monitor potential leaks. Seeking more accurate detection methods, Duke Energy worked with Accenture, Avanade—a joint venture between Accenture and Microsoft—and Microsoft to tap the deep technological expertise needed to achieve its goal. Together, they developed a first-of-its-kind methane emissions monitoring and remediation solution on Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Dynamics 365 that significantly improves leak surveys, emission calculations, and leak remediation.

title: AFM elevates Romania's sustainability with Microsoft Azure-powered solar grant allocation
executive_summary: Romania’s Environment Fund Administration (AFM) is championing initiatives to reduce the nation's carbon footprint and encourage sustainability. One of these initiatives is its annual Green House Solar Panels Program, offering citizens funds to help set up solar panels in their homes. AFM teamed up with Romania’s Rural Investments Financing Agency (AFIR) to build an online platform based on Microsoft Azure, enabling the agency to meet the strong demand and surge of concurrent traffic when funding applications open. By the end of the last submission phase, close to 90,000 beneficiaries were able to successfully apply for a funding of 20,000 RON (4,000 EUR) each.

title: Royal Automobile Club of Western Australia modernizes to drive auto club member service with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Royal Automobile Club of Western Australia (RAC) is a membership organization based in Western Australia, with 2,000 employees serving more than 1.2 million members. As a purpose-led organization without shareholders, RAC is focused on influencing positive change to improve life for all Western Australians. RAC also offers a number of services including Roadside Assistance, Insurance, Travel, Tourism, Finance, Auto Services, Batteries, Tyres, and Security.

title: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited implements modern customer-centric store operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: India’s first billion-dollar fashion powerhouse, Mumbai-based Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited (ABFRL), keeps trend-seekers throughout India and around the world looking their best. The company’s loyal customers can find everything from high-end luxury apparel to budget-conscious clothes for the whole family at ABFRL’s 3,900+ brand stores and the 33,500+ fashion retail outlets where its brands can be found.

title: Investec maps leadership vision to organizational initiatives around the globe with Microsoft Viva Goals
executive_summary: With more than 8,500 employees serving high net worth individuals and institutions worldwide, Investec needed clearer visibility into its priorities. By implementing Microsoft Viva Goals, the international specialist banking and wealth management group gained transparency into interdependent goals and measurable key results at all levels.

title: Standard Bank of South Africa expands use of Power Platform to enterprise applications
executive_summary: Standard Bank, the largest bank in Africa, has developed over 1,500 Power Platform solutions for a variety of business needs, including enterprise applications for finance, operations, and HR. A Center of Excellence supports over 1,500 citizen developers across the bank’s global network. The bank is also looking to leverage the generative AI capabilities in Microsoft Copilot Studio and other Power Platform products.

title: Al Babtain Group enhances security, analytics, and productivity with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Al Babtain Group, a leading Kuwaiti conglomerate, ventured into a digital transformation. Their aim? To supercharge efficiency and spark innovation across their expansive array of sectors. With Microsoft 365 E5 and Azure, it elevated its security from rudimentary to robust, scoring an impressive 80 Microsoft Secure Score. With an integrated, scalable environment that includes Dynamics 365 and Power Platform, AI Babtain Group has streamlined workflows, empowered employees while enabling quick and informed decision-making.

title: Quiddity engineers a better system with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Quiddity’s mission is simple: to enhance lives in communities across Texas through engineering and innovation. Founded in 1976, the Houston-based civil engineering firm has become a strong competitor in engineering, surveying, and land development projects in every major city in Texas. The firm’s engineering services and more than 650 employees at 10 locations support nearly 20 public and private market sectors. Quiddity’s customers range from cities looking to optimize their water and transportation infrastructure to developers designing master-planned communities from the ground up. Whether through highway design and street improvement, retail space and residential development, flood mitigation and stream restoration, or water supply and wastewater management, Quiddity strives to improve the communities where its employees live, work, and play.

title: Australia Pacific Airports Corporation elevates operations with Dynamics 365 to keep the pace of modern travel
executive_summary: Australia Pacific Airports Corporation (APAC) owns and operates Melbourne Airport and Launceston Airport. Named best airport in Australia/Pacific by Skytrax in 2024, 2023, 2021, and 2020, Melbourne Airport is Australia’s busiest 24/7 airport, welcoming more than 30 million passengers per year on 41 airlines traveling to 24 countries. Launceston Airport in Tasmania, just one hour by air from Melbourne, welcomes over one million visitors per year, and is the second busiest airport in the state.

title: Standard Chartered sets new standard in innovation with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Standard Chartered is a leading international banking group headquartered in London, England. It has a presence in 53 of the world’s most dynamic markets and serves clients in an additional 64, employing nearly 85,000 people. With operations in consumer, corporate and institutional banking, and treasury services, it is a client-centric financial institution committed to offering innovative services to its clients.

title: Cielo speeds threat detection and response with Microsoft Defender XDR and Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Cielo employs more than 6,000 professionals and brought in more than BRL10.6 billion in revenue in 2023 (USD2.19 billion). Like many other large companies, Cielo has, in years past, contracted a wide variety of companies to provide portions of its cybersecurity environment. The resulting solution was costly and overly complex. Adopting Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Sentinel, Intune, and more, the company has since consolidated its security landscape in a way that reduces not just costs and complexity but threat response times as well.

title: ABN AMRO boosts Employee Net Promoter Scores by 46% and lowers costs by 40% with Dynamics 365.
executive_summary: ABN AMRO, one of the largest banks in the Netherlands, had to contend with a fragmented Customer Relationship Management (CRM) landscape. Previous CRM tools had a high cost of ownership, kept data siloed, and were not aligned for the use of cloud-based architecture. The bank embraced Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Sales and has lowered total cost of ownership for its customer engagement platform by up to 40 percent, improved its eNPS (employee net promoter score) from 4.8 to 7.0, improved productivity, and helped make the most of its data with a highly interoperable, cloud-based solution.

title: Gardens Alive grows with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Gardens Alive is a major multi-channel retail supplier of gardening products in the United States and Canada, producing and delivering millions of plants, seeds, trees, and bulbs every year. Headquartered in Lawrenceburg, Indiana, the company runs distribution centers, greenhouses, warehouses, production, and drop ship locations in Ohio, Michigan, and California. It sells directly to customers on marketplaces such as Home Depot, Amazon, Lowes, and Walmart and offers product lines with puzzles, games, and home decor.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Arma Group boosts efficiency and profitability with Microsoft 365 and Azure
executive_summary: Arma Group, a leader in Egypt's fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) sector, transitioned to Microsoft Azure, addressing security and performance challenges and reducing capital expenditures. With a more scalable, flexible cloud-based datacenter, the company has improved profitability and productivity. With Microsoft Sentinel, Arma Group has also enhanced its security posture. Finally, implementing Microsoft 365 enabled Arma Group to bring its departments closer together, boost efficiency, and support data-driven decisions with Power BI.

title: United Way for Southeastern Michigan advances its mission with a more secure and collaborative workforce using Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The nonprofit United Way for Southeastern Michigan sought a secure communication solution for its hybrid workplace. The organization implemented Microsoft 365, including Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Defender for Business, to enhance internal communication, collaboration, and customer service.

title: Info-Tech offers speedy, cost-friendly HR system on Microsoft Azure, leading to 10x growth in customer base
executive_summary: Info-Tech Systems helps businesses transform their human resources (HR) operations. Finding it hard to maintain an on-premises HR management system (HRMS), the company migrated its application to the cloud using Microsoft Azure for efficiency and scalability. This strategic move helps Info-Tech deploy software 97% faster and save 50% on maintenance costs. Customers now enjoy reduced downtime, enhanced security, and instant access to HR services. As a result, Info-Tech saw a 10x increase in its customer base and a 90% rise in customer retention.
products: Azure, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Backup, Azure Firewall, Azure Load Balancer, Azure Monitor, Azure Virtual Machines

title: A dedicated coach for all BASF employees: Working more productively with Viva Personal Insights
executive_summary: There are a host of advantages to working in international teams. To ensure that employees can optimize the coordination of their largely digital collaboration across multiple continents, Microsoft developed Viva Personal Insights. BASF is among the many companies offering its employees this app as a virtual coach: Viva Personal Insights analyzes work behavior and suggests measures to enhance well-being, teamwork, and productivity. These data-driven reflections on how people work are proving very popular indeed.

title: Easy to maintain, quick to scale: ZEISS migrates SAP applications to the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: SAP applications, such as Treasury and Risk Management, SAP ERP, SAP BW, or SAP HCM, are the very core of a company. For its SAP applications, ZEISS had opted for an on-premises setup—an outdated and thus less flexible solution that was difficult to operate and modernize. This led to lengthy and slow processes in IT, and the automation of recurring processes seemed virtually impossible. Then, in 2017, the company made a decision: it would migrate business-critical SAP applications to the Microsoft Cloud with the help of Azure. ZEISS now benefits from unlimited scalability, flexibility, automation, and high speed in application development and use.

title: With Microsoft Azure, Terragon helps businesses leverage insights and target customers with the right messages at the right time
executive_summary: Terragon, a pioneer in Africa's MarTech sector, is redefining how businesses engage their customers. Using artificial intelligence and mountains of data, companies can send consumers the right messages at the right time with AI-powered insights. Picture this: a Bank customer engaging with their favorite app (game, news, entertainment, sports etc.) attempts to make an in-app payment; Registering the customer’s action the Bank (through Terragon’s software) is able to engage that customer and help them instantly facilitate a seamless payment process with the least amount of friction (by identifying that customer, using their phone number as their ID across platforms in the cloud) thereby adding value to the consumer’s experience. Terragon’s move to Microsoft Azure improved its security posture and turbocharged Terragon’s operations, slashing deployment times from about six weeks to just a week. After the move, the company could deliver notifications to end-users in half the time.

title: Alabama Appellate Courts System transforms and modernizes judicial operations with Azure
executive_summary: On a mission to become one of the most modern courts in the nation, the Alabama Appellate Courts System (AACS) needed to digitize justice systems to accelerate secure and transparent proceedings. AACS is in the process of migrating many of its on-premises operations to a more secure cloud environment on Microsoft Azure. With this unified solution, justices, employees, and 6,000 outside attorneys benefit from remote access, more efficient operations, and improved security.

title: Swiss Paraplegic Centre – Working with Microsoft to usher in the digital workplace, with Microsoft Teams and SharePoint Online
executive_summary: Like so many other clinics, the Swiss Paraplegic Centre had become bogged down in protracted and bureaucratic internal work processes. These processes devoured a lot of time that was then no longer available for patient care. In 2020, the Centre therefore resolved to press ahead in digitalizing the clinic’s workplaces. The result? A year later, the SPC’s IT department collaborated with Microsoft to launch the Modern Workplace project with the aim of accelerating work processes and making them more efficient. To begin with, Microsoft Teams was introduced, Microsoft Exchange mailboxes across the entire Swiss Paraplegic Group were migrated and a new intranet was set up in the cloud based on Microsoft SharePoint Online. Microsoft Power Platform was deployed to optimize, standardize and digitalize a large number of administrative processes. Effective support for day-to-day workflows and the removal of bureaucratic obstacles significantly improved satisfaction levels throughout the workforce.

title: Jashanmal National Company brings scale, security, and speed to retail with Dynamics 365 Commerce
executive_summary: For more than a century, Jashanmal National Company has been a retail giant across the Gulf Cooperation Council countries. But with more than 150 stores and a sprawling distribution network, its on-premises retail management system could not keep up with the pace of expansion. With a strategic shift to Dynamics 365 Commerce, supported by Intwo, JNC not only streamlined its vast operations but also enhanced security and operational efficiency.

title: For Lander & Rogers, seamless integration and 78% faster deployments with Surface complement hybrid work
executive_summary: Lander & Rogers, an influential Australian law firm with a practice spanning a broad spectrum of sectors and industries, needed to upgrade its fleet of devices to meet the demands of both remote and in-office work. The Surface Laptop empowered the firm to follow modern deployment and management strategies—and with Microsoft Intune and Autopilot, it reduced deployment time from 3 hours to 40 minutes.

title: From Azure to Microsoft Teams: Gol Creates Intelligent and Integrated Data Solution for Revenue-Generating Areas
executive_summary: The airline’s Data & Analytics team has built an environment that orchestrates the collection of data from multiple sources into a single, Azure-based data lake. This data is made available for viewing through Power BI, Microsoft Excel, and through an intelligent bot integrated with Microsoft Teams.

title: Khansaheb Civil Engineering enhances fieldwork efficiency and digital security with Microsoft 365 E3
executive_summary: Khansaheb Civil Engineering has played a pivotal role in the development of the United Arab Emirates for the past 89 years. As the company grew, it accrued inefficiencies, such as data spread across 300 on-premises servers, conflicting domain policies, and outdated systems that complicated remote access and collaboration. To streamline its technology infrastructure, Khansaheb Civil Engineering adopted Microsoft 365 E3. The shift improved online security through advanced threat protection and identity management, used SharePoint to store data, and Teams to enhance remote collaboration. The result—streamlined operations, reduced costs, and improved cybersecurity. Employees can now work seamlessly on-site with fewer safety risks and operational costs, and higher overall productivity.

title: Dynamics 365 modernizes B3 Social's donation management, now directing efforts to volunteering
executive_summary: B3 Social, responsible for private social investment and volunteerism at B3, the Brazilian stock exchange, was able to customize a sales solution for social impact work, with a fully remote implementation and support from Nexer, a Microsoft partner company. The solution allowed for process automation, increasing the productivity of the operation, in addition to bringing a single database with simplified access, improving processes to fulfill the objective of contributing to the reduction of social inequalities in Brazil.

title: Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia enhances fundraising efforts with Moore, a Microsoft partner, and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Children's Hospital of Philadelphia (CHOP) partners with Moore, a Microsoft partner, to enhance fundraising efforts through a novel constituent identity solution developed using Microsoft Azure. This collaboration has led to an 85% increase in response rate and a 25% boost in gift size, significantly accelerating the major giving process. The secure and scalable Azure platform ensures data privacy while enabling CHOP to forge deeper, data-driven constituent relationships, ultimately leading to safer children everywhere.

title: Milpark Education transforms student support with Dynamics 365 and Microsoft’s Digital Contact Center
executive_summary: Milpark Education, a South African higher education provider, faced operational challenges in student support. Its legacy systems created data silos, slowing down student interactions. In collaboration with Enterprisecloud, Milpark Education implemented Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and the Digital Contact Centre within a short 3-month timeframe. This change, along with additional Dynamics 365 and Azure technologies, helped Milpark Education transform its Student Support via a new integrated digital platform. Equipped with greater visibility, Milpark Education has reduced resolution times by 50% and escalation times by over 30%. This frees its support staff to bring more value by focusing on conversations required for more complex cases.

title: LifeLabs® brings care closer to home with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
executive_summary: As Canada's largest provider of laboratory testing and management services, LifeLabs has been serving the healthcare needs of Canadians for more than 50 years. LifeLabs performs 112 million diagnostic, naturopathic, and genetic tests for more than 20 million customers annually. More than 6,500 LifeLabs employees at more than 380 Patient Service Centers (PSCs) put customers first in everything they do, earning a 90% satisfaction score. With LifeLabs MyVisit™ personalized mobile lab services powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service and Power Platform, customers can get their tests done at a time and location that fits their schedules, and then get their results online for the ultimate in convenience.

title: Zenith & Company's active support capabilities that proactively identify customer needs help NCSOFT operate its global network efficiently
executive_summary: With a global network in North America, Europe, Japan, and Taiwan, starting in the US in 2000, NCSOFT has been working tirelessly based on the motto "a new world connected through joy.” NCSOFT expects to reduce costs and improve business efficiency simultaneously through license management with Zen-Portal based on Microsoft Teams.

title: Microsoft Security implements Microsoft Entra ID Governance and saves over $1.5 million per year
executive_summary: The Digital Security and Resilience team at Microsoft handles identities and access management for the majority of all Microsoft-owned tenants. Previously, the team managed identities and access with SailPoint IIQ, a legacy solution that was becoming difficult to maintain and expensive, costing over $1.5 million per year. The team switched to Microsoft Entra ID Governance, gaining a cloud-native approach and automated tooling, cutting costs, and scaling to over 200,000 entities in just six months.

title: ZF Group builds manufacturing efficiency with over 25,000 apps on Power Platform
executive_summary: ZF established a unique, enterprise-wide functional and governance model for citizen developers. This includes a development portal with over 100,000 site visits and 17,000 unique users since its launch last year.

title: Södertälje kommun upgrades school device security with Microsoft Intune and Microsoft Entra
executive_summary: N/A

title: The Rijksmuseum saves hours in identity management with Microsoft Entra ID Governance.
executive_summary: The Rijksmuseum’s identity management and access rights needed an upgrade to handle the increasing complexity of identity management and the need to comply with strict security standards and regulations.

title: Insight boosts efficiency and security while driving future growth with Surface, Windows 11, and Copilot
executive_summary: Insight wanted to improve productivity by streamlining processes and onboarding. Stronger security and privacy measures were needed to avoid potential vulnerabilities. Scalable solutions were needed to improve delivery quality, accuracy, and speed.

title: CPFL implements robust Microsoft security solution and gains visibility and intelligence
executive_summary: For 109 years in the electrical industry, CPFL Energia was looking for a new SIEM tool to improve the level of monitoring, anticipate possible attacks on its online environment, which grew with remote working, and found response to its demands by combining the tools from Microsoft Sentinel and Azure Monitor Logs.

title: Sanabil Investments boosts productivity by adopting AI at work, through Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Sanabil Investments, a financial services company in Saudi Arabia, needed to enhance productivity by reducing the time employees spent on manual everyday tasks, diverting focus from more strategic and valuable work.

title: The Rijksmuseum saves hours in identity management with Microsoft Entra ID Governance.
executive_summary: The Rijksmuseum’s identity management and access rights needed an upgrade to handle the increasing complexity of identity management and the need to comply with strict security standards and regulations.

title: Insight boosts efficiency and security while driving future growth with Surface, Windows 11, and Copilot
executive_summary: Insight wanted to improve productivity by streamlining processes and onboarding. Stronger security and privacy measures were needed to avoid potential vulnerabilities. Scalable solutions were needed to improve delivery quality, accuracy, and speed.

title: Leading university in North Macedonia drives seamless transition to remote learning with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With fifteen faculties and more than 9,000 students, Goce Delcev University of Stip is a top-ranked public university located in North Macedonia. It began experimenting with remote learning solutions in December 2019. By March 2020, more than 4,400 students and 360 lecturers were actively using Microsoft 365 tools to access, learn, and share content, making Goce Delcev the first university in North Macedonia to seamlessly shift to a remote educational environment, aligning students with the demands of increasingly digitized world.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Cutting edge technologies provide game changer for automotive icon Mercedes-Benz
executive_summary: A global icon in the automotive industry, Mercedes-Benz is committed to delivering the ultimate customer experience―not only in the design and production of superior vehicles, but in industry-leading service. To help achieve this goal, the company choose Microsoft HoloLens 2 and Dynamics 365 Remote Assist technologies to improve service technician efficiency, reduce time to problem resolution, and reduce the cost and environmental impact of service-related travel.
products: HoloLens

title: 3M manufacturing plant uses data analytics to increase efficiency and cost savings with Azure SQL Edge
executive_summary: 3M produces more than 60,000 products in its Safety and Industrial, Transportation and Electronics, Healthcare, and Consumer Business Groups. At one of its US manufacturing plants, the 3M Corporate Research Lab partnered with the local 3M Manufacturing team and identified an opportunity to predict anomalies and then use those insights to reduce manufacturing downtime. They proposed integrating data streams from two production lines, correlating them, and then running analytics and machine learning locally. Because the data came from two systems that arrive at different times, and because the plant’s network connectivity was limited, the team determined that building a custom module with Microsoft Azure SQL Edge deployed through Microsoft Azure IoT Edge would give the performance, management, and security needed. With this new edge capability deployed, the resulting faster and more streamlined processes will allow 3M to identify a manufacturing line’s problems in advance, thus providing both operational efficiency and cost savings benefits.

title: AABB uses SharePoint site help recovered COVID-19 patients donate plasma—and save lives
executive_summary: At the onset of the coronavirus pandemic, researchers found that COVID-19 convalescent plasma (CCP)—plasma donated by recovered COVID-19 patients—could help those who were critically ill from COVID-19. Yet there was no easy way for those who had recovered from COVID-19 to figure out how to donate that plasma. That’s when the nonprofit AABB (formerly known as the American Association of Blood Banks) adjusted its public-facing SharePoint website to help visitors locate a CCP donation site near them with just a click of a button.

title: Protecting the delivery of mental health services in Greater Manchester
executive_summary: On March 23rd 2020, the UK Government announced a lockdown in response to the growing coronavirus crisis. The need to limit face-to-face contact for infection prevention and control was uppermost in the minds of senior leaders at Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust (GMMH). Yet the needs of service users had to be met.

title: UK’s most trusted financial brand trusts Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: “Every customer wants their bank to be proactive. The more proactive we are, the more enjoyable experience it is for them,” says Anthony Pooley, Customer Relationship Manager in the business savings team at Nationwide Building Society. “Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 helps us to be much more proactive.”
products: Dynamics 365 Sales, LinkedIn Sales Navigator

title: The key to business agility at Swiss Re is greater efficiency—and a Cloud Center of Excellence
executive_summary: Swiss Re’s strategic alliance with Microsoft has dual goals: creating entirely new digital markets as well as a new cloud-based operating platform to host them. The global reinsurer sees Microsoft providing far more than great technology: helping to drive innovation, creating new business models, and fostering a new mindset and cultural shift away from centralized command-and-control and toward central standards with business-side autonomy.

title: Digital for all: Onesait Platform uses Red Hat on Azure to streamline and democratize digital transformation
executive_summary: To help customers keep pace with digital transformation, Madrid-based Minsait, an Indra company and leading digital transformation consultancy and information technologies firm, uses Red Hat OpenShift container technology on Microsoft Azure to support its Onesait Platform, a powerful and scalable development platform for IoT, AI, and other digital solutions. With the agility of container technology, the high functionality and global scalability in Azure, and enterprise-grade support from Microsoft and Red Hat, Minsait has built a multiservice platform that it can use to create new business models and help any organization establish a roadmap to digital success.

title: Dentsu Aegis Network gains new business agility with a rapid cloud migration
executive_summary: With four global datacenters supporting its media and digital marketing business, Dentsu Aegis Network faced significant cost, scalability, and governance challenges. By migrating its entire infrastructure to Microsoft Azure, the company can now provision and scale services quickly and cost-effectively. And by using the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure, the company has accelerated the agility, governance, and cost benefits of its Azure investment.

title: Wipro modernizes the world’s oldest cosmetic brand—protects it from online fraud with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Wipro Consumer Care & Lighting makes less than 5 percent of its sales from e-commerce. After acquiring the world’s oldest cosmetic brand—Yardley of London—it sought a way to change that. But before it could launch a new e-commerce platform with confidence, it needed to have a fraud protection solution ready to scale with the brand’s anticipated growth. After testing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Fraud Protection on its live Yardley of London e-commerce site, Wipro now expects to reduce instances of online fraud by at least 80 percent.

title: Protecting the delivery of mental health services in Greater Manchester
executive_summary: On March 23rd 2020, the UK Government announced a lockdown in response to the growing coronavirus crisis. The need to limit face-to-face contact for infection prevention and control was uppermost in the minds of senior leaders at Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust (GMMH). Yet the needs of service users had to be met.

title: UK’s most trusted financial brand trusts Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: “Every customer wants their bank to be proactive. The more proactive we are, the more enjoyable experience it is for them,” says Anthony Pooley, Customer Relationship Manager in the business savings team at Nationwide Building Society. “Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 helps us to be much more proactive.”

title: The key to business agility at Swiss Re is greater efficiency—and a Cloud Center of Excellence
executive_summary: Swiss Re’s strategic alliance with Microsoft has dual goals: creating entirely new digital markets as well as a new cloud-based operating platform to host them. The global reinsurer sees Microsoft providing far more than great technology: helping to drive innovation, creating new business models, and fostering a new mindset and cultural shift away from centralized command-and-control and toward central standards with business-side autonomy.

title: Absa experiments with Microsoft Copilot, boosting efficiency and customer engagement
executive_summary: The Absa Group, one of Africa's largest financial institutions, has made great headway in embracing generative AI initiatives by adopting Microsoft Copilot to enhance operational efficiency and customer engagement across multiple business areas. Using this AI-driven tool, Absa’s employees have streamlined various business processes, saving several hours on administrative tasks each day and being better prepared to engage with fellow colleagues and clients.
products: Microsoft 365, GitHub Copilot, Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365, Microsoft Copilot for Sales

title: Hellenic Bank drives new mobile banking experience with Azure
executive_summary: One of Cyprus’ largest banking groups, Hellenic Bank, is committed to offering customers reliable service and a leading customer experience. When the Bank decided to move away from its old mobile app to a cloud-first approach, it chose Azure as the foundation. Now, with improved agility, faster incremental releases and a more user-friendly experience, the Cypriot bank is reaping rewards in terms of customer and staff satisfaction.

title: Citroën Chile enhances its management system with Dynamics 365 and Annata 365, specifically designed for the automotive industry
executive_summary: To fine-tune industry-specific administrative processes, the French brand subsidiary in Chile deployed Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations, integrated with Annata 365, to manage finance, sales and marketing.

title: Dominican Republic’ Judiciary becomes a benchmark of digital transformation for the Latin American justice sector with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: In just three weeks, the Dominican Judicial branch deployed Microsoft Teams to execute virtual hearings and legal processes across more than 600 offices in the country.  To date, more than 104,000 virtual hearings have been held, ensuring the continuation of the judicial work. In addition, the entity has transformed the service to citizens, increasing its efficiency and speed through the use of solutions built on Azure and Power Platform.
products: Azure Backup, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft Teams, Azure Key Vault, Power BI, SQL Server

title: Grupo Bimbo accelerates its sustainability journey with Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability
executive_summary: Sustainability has always been an essential part of everyday business at Grupo Bimbo, the Mexico-based international producer of baked goods and snack foods. To help the company achieve its ambitious sustainability goals, Grupo Bimbo is deploying Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability, which helps businesses collect, track, and analyze all the strategic metrics of their sustainability strategy. Grupo Bimbo has a comprehensive strategy encompassing nutrition, social impact, waste, and water, and the company is beginning with tracking emissions in Canada, Mexico, and the United States. Grupo Bimbo is rolling out Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability to all its global operations, and the company has appreciated its ease of use and its ability to connect to multiple data sources, including external repositories and Internet of Things sensors, to automate data collection.

title: Brighthouse Financial® leverages the power of Microsoft to amplify innovation and collaboration
executive_summary: Annuity and life insurance provider Brighthouse Financial, Inc. became an independent, publicly traded company in 2017, following its spin-off from MetLife, Inc. Since then, Brighthouse has focused on ways to boost innovation and rethink its entire technology platform. As part of that ongoing focus, Brighthouse has tapped into the potential of its investment in Microsoft 365 — streamlining communications across work groups, further enhancing its collaborative culture, and enabling employees to more efficiently deliver on the company’s mission of helping people achieve financial security. Additionally, Brighthouse’s cloud-first, SaaS-focused environment — supported by tools such as Microsoft Surface and Teams — has helped drive new ways of collaborating across the company as it continues to operate remotely during the COVID-19 health crisis and readies for an eventual transition to a hybrid work environment.

title: Polish special needs school nurtures every child’s strengths with Office 365 Education tools
executive_summary: To ensure all students are given equal opportunities to succeed, Zespół Szkół Specjalnych (ZSS), a special needs school complex in Kowanówko, Poland, crafts inclusive, learner-oriented classes. In keeping with its mission, the school aims to enhance each student’s unique strengths, providing them with learning conditions under which they develop the confidence to thrive. To accommodate the different needs of its primary and secondary-level students—who experience varying degrees of emotional, intellectual, and physical disabilities—the school introduced a set of accessibility tools built into Office 365. From digital whiteboards to Stickers add-ons, each tool provides the best learning experience for each student.

title: How a decentralized identity and verifiable credentials can streamline both public and private processes
executive_summary: Digital identity forms the cornerstone of everything that individuals do in the digital world. There is a genuine need for a sustainable technology and processes that give users control over their data and allow trusted interactions. In a decentralized identity ecosystem, citizens can easily prove their identity and share authoritative data with third parties. Furthermore, they can keep track of what information is shared with whom and at any time can deny third parties’ access to personal information. Microsoft applied this concept to a high-impact public sector use case in the region of Flanders in Belgium. The pilot ‘starting a business in Flanders’ showed that the use of decentralized identity technology lowered the burden for citizens and raised their trust in the government.

title: ZF employees create low-code solutions to accelerate the business using Microsoft Power Platform and Dataverse for Teams
executive_summary: Something new is happening at ZF’s workplace. The global company has a 100-year history in the automotive business and is renowned for creating systems for passenger cars and commercial vehicles. As the auto parts supplier accelerates its transition from a manufacturer to a technology company creating mobility solutions, it has deployed Microsoft Teams, the digital collaboration tool in Microsoft 365, to boost productivity and collaboration. But that’s just part of the story. Employees began to take ownership of how they used the new Microsoft tools to solve problems and get their work done faster—creating a valuable synergy between new workplace behavior and the company’s drive to lead in the mobility industry.

title: noon payments drives seamless, instantly scalable online transactions with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Middle East-based noon payments offers a complete payments solution: quick onboarding, feature-filled checkout, and speedy integrations across the world’s major e-commerce platforms and shopping carts. Looking for a rapidly scalable solution that could minimize costs and streamline the DevOps process, the company chose Microsoft Azure. Thanks to millisecond response times and single-click cloud deployment, noon payments is making online transactions more responsive for online shoppers in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and beyond.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Stack, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Cerner delivers measurable performance and resource gains to healthcare clients with Microsoft Edge
executive_summary: Cerner delivers healthcare technology solutions to more than 2,400 hospitals and 12,500 ambulatory medical offices globally with more than 3 million daily users accessing patient data. By taking advantage of Microsoft Edge within its products during a pilot, Cerner saw measurable performance improvements related to memory usage, page loading, and CPU utilization. By newly using Microsoft Edge to process and present health information to caregivers, Cerner saw increased client satisfaction, improved performance, and internal system resource savings. Cerner will expand the rollout of Microsoft Edge to the rest of its clients in 2022 so that they can access new capabilities supported by a modern browser and retrieve patient data faster.

title: Expedia Group takes off with OneDrive
executive_summary: Expedia Group opens the world to those with a wanderlust. The Seattle-based company gathers more than 20 travel-related online businesses under its brand, employing people all over the world. When Expedia Group sought to simplify costs and reduce license costs, yet improve collaboration, productivity, and security, it turned to Microsoft OneDrive, adding SharePoint sites for teams. With nearly half of its 25,000 employees seamlessly migrated to date, Expedia Group offers its employees a deluxe fare to a streamlined environment.

title: Global automotive distributor Inchcape achieves data-driven digitalization with Azure
executive_summary: Inchcape, an independent automotive distributor, markets and supplies vehicles from leading auto brands to consumers across the globe. To adapt to market disruptions, Inchcape realized it needed to embrace data-driven digitalization to make better business decisions. Working with Microsoft Partner Tiger Analytics Inc, the company put its ‘Accelerate’ digital transformation strategy into action. The result was a modern analytical architecture built on Azure that enables Inchcape to get real-time business intelligence. It helps Inchcape leverage data for predictive analytics in customer engagement, pricing optimization, and demand forecasting.

title: Employees at National Australia Bank celebrate productivity gains and simplified user experience with Microsoft Edge
executive_summary: National Australia Bank (NAB) identified an opportunity to drive productivity improvements for its people by simplifying the web browsing experience across its applications. Shifting to one browser—Microsoft Edge—improved employee flexibility, saved workers thousands of hours, and offered a better user experience.

title: AlphaBOLD streamlines customer service for Calpine Energy Solutions
executive_summary: Calpine Energy Solutions faced significant challenges in maintaining visibility into its financial information and customer support activities. Calpine’s legacy system wasn’t fully integrated, so the company had limited access to its data as well as disparate data stores, ultimately reducing the quality of its customer service. AlphaBOLD solved Calpine's challenges with a solution built on Microsoft Power Platform and driven by Dataverse and Power Apps that improves visibility, streamlines program management, and integrates with the company’s legacy systems to improve its billing processes.

title: Azure helps Eshgro to grow their business faster and quickly scale to other countries
executive_summary: As the fastest growing Microsoft Azure partner in the Netherlands, Eshgro makes IT simpler, faster, and more secure for their customers by integrating Microsoft Azure technologies with the Smarter 365 platform—which translates solutions into the best functionality for the customers. The Azure platform and its APIs enable Eshgro to quickly deploy services in an automated fashion—helping them to grow their business faster.

title: University of Surrey adopts a data-driven approach to improving student satisfaction, powered by Microsoft 365 and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Established by Royal Charter in the 1960s, the University of Surrey has worked for more than fifty years to harness the talents, creativity, and skills of its student body, in service to the broader community. It is a legacy that has earned the University recognition and awards, and one that attracts a student population of more than 16,000.
products: Power BI

title: Samhall sparks a digital awakening with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: For 40 years, Samhall AB has been positively impacting Swedish society by helping people with disabilities find gainful employment, transforming nearly 250,000 lives in the process. Recently, the company has undergone a transformation of its own. Using Microsoft Power Platform, Samhall automated its manual credit check process, saving employees time and effort and setting an example that has sent ripples across the company. It has created a culture of innovation, boosting Samhall’s pursuit to help the most disadvantaged in society to improve their lives.

title: Leading funds manager in the Philippines ATRAM achieves faster data processing with Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Managing and analyzing sensitive and scattered data can be complex. ATR Asset Management Group (ATRAM), the sixth largest player in the industry today, needed to harness the capabilities of its siloed data. The firm built a more unified platform with Azure Synapse Analytics—allowing it to leverage data efficiently, safely, and cost-effectively. It also adopted Azure API Management to organize APIs, forge partnerships, and expand its customer base. This focus on digital transformation resulted in ATRAM’s enhanced productivity.

title: Delhaize Serbia digitizes its customers’ in-store shopping experience with an app based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Operating through more than 480 stores across the country, Delhaize Serbia is the largest retail chain in Serbia and a member of the international retail chain Ahold Delhaize. As a market leader, the company is strategically committed to being an innovator that always brings customers a modern shopping experience. With an omnichannel approach to business and a desire to provide customers with innovative benefits that match their personal shopping habits, Delhaize Serbia decided to develop a loyalty application called "My Maxi", based on Microsoft Azure.

title: Microsoft empowers support engineers to shine brighter with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Microsoft operates one of the largest customer support teams in the world with tens of thousands of customer support engineers and more than 145 million contacts per year. Prior to 2020, the team was using 16 different case management systems and over 500 individual tools. This slowed down service, hindered collaboration between engineers, led to more redundant engagements, and produced inefficient workflow. To provide better resolution of customer issues, leverage the full expertise of the engineers on staff, and use its own tools to show how Microsoft can power one of the most complex customer support organizations in the world, the support team migrated to Dynamics 365 Customer Service. This resulted in a 31 percent increase in first call resolution and a 20 percent reduction in missed routes.

title: An education and training tool that utilizes MR and digital twin technologies to improve engineer skills to ensure expressway safety
executive_summary: The expressway network of Japan has been constantly expanded since the 1960s and its total road length is currently over 10,000km. On the other hand, more than half of the expressway network has been used for over 30 years and aging of structures such as road surfaces, bridges, and tunnels has emerged as a social issue. The dwindling number of expressway maintenance and management engineers in line with the decline in the productive population is also one of the significant challenges.

title: Ovintiv cracks the code of efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Ovintiv (NYSE: OVV) is one of the largest and oldest energy production companies in North America. With origins dating back to the 1880s, the company is known for developing innovative techniques to extract unconventional resources locked deep in tight sands and shales. Its vision is to be at the forefront of driving technology, both in the field and the back office, to profitably and sustainably produce safe, affordable, reliable energy for consumers and shareholders. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, it is a US domiciled company with operations in Canada.

title: Rockwell Automation goes cloud-native on Azure to bring modern software development paradigms to the factory floor
executive_summary: Rockwell Automation, the largest industrial automation company in the world, is turning to the cloud to help its customers be more productive. FactoryTalk® Design Studio™, the company’s first cloud-native application, was developed with Visual Studio Code, is deployed via GitHub, and harnesses the power of Microsoft Azure. Delivered via the cloud, it eliminates all the drawbacks of on-premises applications that have traditionally existed in the manufacturing space. FactoryTalk Design Studio also supports new ways of working, bringing robust collaboration features and modern software development paradigms to the factory floor. Moving forward, the combination of Visual Studio Code, GitHub, and Azure is making developers at Rockwell Automation more efficient and agile, enabling them to get more done and deliver more quickly via an integrated platform and a smaller toolset.

title: GEMS Education optimizes financial and procurement operations across 120 entities with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: GEMS Education was established in 1959 in the United Arab Emirates to put a quality education within the reach of every learner. Today, GEMS Education is one of the world’s largest K-12 private education providers, striving to empower students in more than 60 schools in the MENA region alone via innovative curricula and learning strategies. As part of its objectives to enhance its capabilities, GEMS Education partnered with Microsoft Technology partner, InTWO, to move from Dynamics AX2012 to Dynamics 365 and enhance productivity. As a result, users have faster and easier access from anywhere and a secure environment for financial operations, procurement processes and collaboration with vendors.

title: Wellstar builds stronger ties to patients through Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Cloud for Healthcare
executive_summary: To deliver more personalized and effective care, Wellstar—a not for profit health system—wanted to unify data from multiple disparate sources to provide business and clinical users with a more comprehensive view of each patient. It achieved that by creating the Omnichannel platform on Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare. This solution collects patient data from all touch points—clinical, administrative, and customer service—and uses Microsoft Dynamics 365 to clean it and apply analytics to personalize communications and care experiences. This more individualized approach is expected to increase preventive care, improve patient satisfaction and outcomes, decrease the administrative burden, and save costs, which will expand its ability to provide charity care.

title: Government Savings Bank digitalizes operations to serve customers better with Power Apps
executive_summary: Government Savings Bank aims to build a sustainable economy by eliminating poverty and reducing inequality in Thailand. To reach this goal, the bank looked into digital transformation to improve its financial services and serve Thai people’s needs. It sought Microsoft Power Apps and Power Platform’s capabilities to establish a digital branch for customers as well as optimize internal hiring, reporting, and data collection processing. As a result, operations have become agile, increasing customer and employee satisfaction.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Power Apps

title: South African Board of Jewish Education’s digital transformation journey in partnership with Buzzbotics, and Microsoft
executive_summary: King David Schools, under the auspices of the South African Board of Jewish Education (SABJE) are a network of Jewish schools in Johannesburg offering PrePrimary through to High School education across five campuses in Johannesburg. King David Schools currently has 3300 students and 300 educators in our family of schools.

title: ​​Centro Hospitalar builds up resistance to threats, analyzes 48 million logs a day with Microsoft Security solutions​
executive_summary: When Centro Hospitalar de Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro needed a way to protect sensitive, highly confidential patient data and applications in its hybrid environment, it chose Microsoft Security solutions. The hospital system’s future-forward strategy calls for a dynamic, cloud-based security approach that will stay on top of threats and position the organization for cloud migration. It now has a centralized view of security events with Microsoft Sentinel, increasing frontline defense with Azure Automation and Microsoft Defender for Cloud. With Azure Arc to extend Centro Hospitalar’s Azure platform protections to its on-premises assets, the hospital system considers its IT security vaccinations up to date.

title: Enhancing security and lowering costs in one go: arab national bank and Microsoft Security
executive_summary: As one of the largest banks in Saudi Arabia, The arab national bank (anb) strives to provide faster, simpler banking for commercial clients as well as consumers. The bank wanted to empower its employees to serve customers remotely through digitization, which required top-notch security. “We relied on a variety of third-party security solutions which required a lot of effort,” recounts Ala Asali, Chief Security Officer at anb. Now, with Microsoft Security as its overarching, tightly integrated security solution, anb has enhanced security operations, lowered costs, increased employee productivity with remote work and improved customer experience—with just one strategic move.

title: Raiffeisen Bank Serbia revolutionizes risk management with low-code technology and data
executive_summary: Raiffeisen Bank International (RBI) is one of Europe’s leading financial organizations, committed to providing outstanding services across the CEE region using technology. As part of these efforts, the group’s Serbian entity is currently pioneering a journey of digital transformation aimed at optimizing everything from internal communications to data analytics and risk management processes. Driven by a long-standing partnership with Microsoft, the initiative is already transforming the way Raiffeisen Bank Serbia – as well as the rest of the group – operates, uses data, and empowers employees.

title: Banner Health uses Microsoft Surface tablets to improve the telehealth experience for patients and providers
executive_summary: Banner Health, one of the largest nonprofit health systems in the United States, deployed Microsoft Surface Pro tablets to significantly expand telehealth services in hospitals and clinics. With the healthcare industry facing challenges, from staffing and resource management to evolving patient needs, the organization wanted to create a flexible, mobile telehealth system to improve efficiency. Banner Health used Surface Pro tablets to help its staff treat more patients and elevate the patient experience. Using Microsoft technology, Banner Health improved both the convenience and efficiency of healthcare while using its staff and resources more productively.

title: Ovintiv cracks the code of efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Ovintiv (NYSE: OVV) is one of the largest and oldest energy production companies in North America. With origins dating back to the 1880s, the company is known for developing innovative techniques to extract unconventional resources locked deep in tight sands and shales. Its vision is to be at the forefront of driving technology, both in the field and the back office, to profitably and sustainably produce safe, affordable, reliable energy for consumers and shareholders. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, it is a US domiciled company with operations in Canada.
