executive_summary: GEMS Education was established in 1959 in the United Arab Emirates to put a quality education within the reach of every learner. Today, GEMS Education is one of the world’s largest K-12 private education providers, striving to empower students in more than 60 schools in the MENA region alone via innovative curricula and learning strategies. As part of its objectives to enhance its capabilities, GEMS Education partnered with Microsoft Technology partner, InTWO, to move from Dynamics AX2012 to Dynamics 365 and enhance productivity. As a result, users have faster and easier access from anywhere and a secure environment for financial operations, procurement processes and collaboration with vendors.

title: Wellstar builds stronger ties to patients through Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Cloud for Healthcare
executive_summary: To deliver more personalized and effective care, Wellstar—a not for profit health system—wanted to unify data from multiple disparate sources to provide business and clinical users with a more comprehensive view of each patient. It achieved that by creating the Omnichannel platform on Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare. This solution collects patient data from all touch points—clinical, administrative, and customer service—and uses Microsoft Dynamics 365 to clean it and apply analytics to personalize communications and care experiences. This more individualized approach is expected to increase preventive care, improve patient satisfaction and outcomes, decrease the administrative burden, and save costs, which will expand its ability to provide charity care.

title: Northern Trust invests in client services with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Northern Trust is a preeminent global financial firm that provides asset servicing, investment management, and wealth management services for the world’s most successful institutions, families, and individuals. Founded in 1889 and headquartered in Chicago, today the company has more than 23,000 employees in more than 20 locations around the world. One of the largest and oldest banking firms in the US, Northern Trust manages more than $1.4 trillion in assets. Its success is anchored in one purpose: to serve as its clients’ most trusted financial partner, guarding and growing their assets as though they were its own.

title: mBank strengthens cloud capability through upskilling with Microsoft Learn
executive_summary: mBank, one of Poland’s most innovative banks, is preparing to move its applications to the cloud. To make the most of the migration, the bank has also begun upskilling employees in this area and implementing a comprehensive learning program with Microsoft. With over 40 percent of IT personnel having benefited from the courses, the employees can strengthen their cloud capabilities. “Now that our team knows cloud technologies inside out, we can make sure that everything goes according to the plan,” says Adam Ksit, IT Deputy Director at mBank.

title: Kubota Environmental Engineering and a partner teamed to develop technology for optimized inspections of infrastructure with HoloLens 2
executive_summary: Since its establishment in 1890, Kubota Group has been involved in the development of modern waterworks through the use of iron water pipes, increasing food production and saving labor through agricultural machinery, harmonizing humankind and the environment through environmental facilities, and has been providing a wide range of products and solutions. The group's vision is to be a "platform that sustains life," and seeks to solve social issues in the sectors that are essential for the survival of humankind - food, water, and the environment - in order to realize a sustainable society.

title: Pixar Animation Studios empowers creators with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The original idea for the RenderMan® Challenge was to provide a platform for the creative community to engage with Pixar Animation Studios and create their own vision and narratives using tools and assets provided by Pixar. Rendering is the compute-intensive process of generating a high-fidelity digital image or 3D model from computer graphics. Many creators lacked the needed technical resources to participate. As of 2022, all entrants get free access to Azure Virtual Machines with AMD processors, meaning anyone anywhere can participate.

title: CP AXTRA becomes first retailer in Thailand to amplify efficiency and optimize customer service with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Amgen empowers its global workforce with Microsoft Copilot, shaping the future of healthcare
executive_summary: Amgen, one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, is known for pioneering biologics for serious diseases. It’s leveraging tech like advanced data analytics and AI paired with de-identified human data to transform drug discovery and development. Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 is an important part of this approach, boosting productivity and fostering a more inclusive global workforce. This strategic use of AI not only has the potential to speed up drug development but also supports advancements in Amgen’s business processes.

title: G&J Pepsi discovers untapped potential with Dynamics 365, boosts profit by $30 million
executive_summary: Nearing its centennial, G&J Pepsi-Cola Bottlers has distinguished itself with a legacy of innovation and employee commitment. Using Microsoft technology, the company has streamlined operations, enhanced customer service, and increased market share. Its digital transformation journey, fueled by Dynamics 365 and other Microsoft technologies, has improved efficiency, employee morale, and market adaptability, positioning G&J Pepsi for future growth and continued success in a competitive landscape.

title: VusionGroup revolutionizes retail, transforming physical stores into data-driven assets together with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Telecom expenses for Florida Crystals dropped 78% with Teams Phone and Teams Meeting Rooms
executive_summary: Focused on innovation and product development, Florida Crystals Corporation is a joint owner of ASR Group International, the world’s largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar with operations in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Belize, the United Kingdom, Portugal, and Italy. The company produces a full line of grocery, industrial, food service, and specialty sweetener products. Florida Crystals wanted to modernize collaboration and voice platforms, improve videoconferencing capabilities, and integrate analog devices to address the needs of its growing, international workforce. Working with its partners UnifiedCommunications.com, Logitech, NTT Data Group, HP | Poly, Yealink, and AudioCodes, the company adopted a value-added solution across Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Teams Phone, Operator Connect, and Teams Rooms. After consolidating its private branch exchange (PBX) installation and eliminating leased lines, Florida Crystals found that its telecom expenses dropped 78%.

title: SWISS targets 30% cost savings, increased passenger satisfaction with Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Hitachi Solutions transforms internal operations with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Hitachi Solutions faced difficulties in managing resource allocation and project planning, creating inefficiencies in tracking employee hours and utilization. The company recognized the need for a more streamlined, unified data management approach.

title: Coquitlam School District partners with Microsoft to build secure infrastructure and enhance data insights with PowerApps and Copilot
executive_summary: The district faced challenges with data compliance and privacy, especially with unstructured data from teachers.

title: Kubota Environmental Engineering and a partner teamed to develop technology for optimized inspections of infrastructure with HoloLens 2
executive_summary: Since its establishment in 1890, Kubota Group has been involved in the development of modern waterworks through the use of iron water pipes, increasing food production and saving labor through agricultural machinery, harmonizing humankind and the environment through environmental facilities, and has been providing a wide range of products and solutions. The group's vision is to be a "platform that sustains life," and seeks to solve social issues in the sectors that are essential for the survival of humankind - food, water, and the environment - in order to realize a sustainable society.

title: Pixar Animation Studios empowers creators with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The original idea for the RenderMan® Challenge was to provide a platform for the creative community to engage with Pixar Animation Studios and create their own vision and narratives using tools and assets provided by Pixar. Rendering is the compute-intensive process of generating a high-fidelity digital image or 3D model from computer graphics. Many creators lacked the needed technical resources to participate. As of 2022, all entrants get free access to Azure Virtual Machines with AMD processors, meaning anyone anywhere can participate.

title: CP AXTRA becomes first retailer in Thailand to amplify efficiency and optimize customer service with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Amgen empowers its global workforce with Microsoft Copilot, shaping the future of healthcare
executive_summary: Amgen, one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, is known for pioneering biologics for serious diseases. It’s leveraging tech like advanced data analytics and AI paired with de-identified human data to transform drug discovery and development. Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 is an important part of this approach, boosting productivity and fostering a more inclusive global workforce. This strategic use of AI not only has the potential to speed up drug development but also supports advancements in Amgen’s business processes.

title: G&J Pepsi discovers untapped potential with Dynamics 365, boosts profit by $30 million
executive_summary: Nearing its centennial, G&J Pepsi-Cola Bottlers has distinguished itself with a legacy of innovation and employee commitment. Using Microsoft technology, the company has streamlined operations, enhanced customer service, and increased market share. Its digital transformation journey, fueled by Dynamics 365 and other Microsoft technologies, has improved efficiency, employee morale, and market adaptability, positioning G&J Pepsi for future growth and continued success in a competitive landscape.

title: VusionGroup revolutionizes retail, transforming physical stores into data-driven assets together with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Simplified routing, uniform communication: SMA Solar Technology AG relies on Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Custom solutions for home installation or massive solar parks—SMA always offers its solar technology customers comprehensive solution packages. The number one goal: to create a climate-friendly and sustainable future. And that applies not just to SMA products and services but also to the way the company communicates. SMA is now laying the foundation for this through a cloud strategy, Microsoft Teams, and Teams Phone. In the process, it is choosing global standards and consolidated collaboration over complex stand-alone solutions.

title: CISSS de l'Outaouais' DSMD enhances care collaboration and services with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Centre intégré de santé et de services sociaux (CISSS) de l'Outaouais wanted to overcome the constraints of geographic distance and resources to facilitate professional collaboration and simplify the coordination of care.

title: DLA Piper’s journey with Microsoft 365 Copilot is a blueprint for legal innovation
executive_summary: DLA Piper understood the need to manage complex documents, ensure consistency across global teams, and streamline workflows. To streamline this process, it sought a program that would improve productivity and reduce time spent on low-value tasks.

title: The Rider Firm gets new efficiencies with Copilot, helping better serve their riders
executive_summary: The Rider Firm is a direct-to-consumer company making bike wheels and bikes for a fast-growing customer base. Maintaining a competitive web presence and an organised inventory system is crucial for delivering superior customer service.

title: Uber Technologies migrates over 80 business processes encompassing 40,000 flows to Power Automate
executive_summary: Uber Technologies moved out of its on-premises datacenters and on to a cloud service. This prompted the company to assess whether they should also move their automated processes to the cloud or consider another automation platform.
products: Power Automate for the desktop, Power Automate

title: London Stock Exchange Group increases productivity with Windows 365.
executive_summary: London Stock Exchange Group’s developers had previously navigated between multiple desktops. Using Windows 365 has streamlined this process.
products: GitHub Copilot, Windows 365

title: Quant transforms silos into synergy with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Quant’s Dynamics AX solution was at the end of its supported life, making way for an upgrade and an opportunity to unify its global platform.

title: Schaeffler unlocks factory insights with Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing
executive_summary: Schaeffler needed to modernize data management and unlock intelligence across diverse IT/OT systems, using generative AI. This enables advanced factory reporting and troubleshooting to boost uptime, quality, productivity, and yields.

title: Visual Comfort & Co. gains critical supply chain visibility with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: A series of mergers and acquisitions left Visual Comfort & Co. with fragmented product and customer data. A complex supply chain featuring overseas manufacturing and shipping made it hard for sales staff to know when products would be available.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Microsoft Fabric

title: Mixed grill: Smithfield Foods runs its $15 billion pork business using a hybrid cloud
executive_summary: To trim the fat from its datacenter infrastructure, Smithfield Foods runs its $15 billion business in Microsoft Azure using a hybrid cloud model. In Azure, servers and other resources are available instantly using a pay-as-you-go model, and Azure analytics highlight inefficiencies and security vulnerabilities. With these insights and efficiencies, Smithfield has slashed datacenter costs by 60 percent, reduced new-application delivery from two months to one day, and bolstered network security.

title: NFL Players Association scores a win with smart data plays
executive_summary: The National Football League Players Association (NFLPA) constantly looks for ways to better serve its members—current and former NFL players—during and after their football careers. With a new player management system built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Azure, the NFLPA can quickly mine player data to find licensing and marketing opportunities for more players. By using these cloud platforms, the NFLPA can quickly scale its systems and reduce capital and maintenance costs, freeing staff to develop new member services.

title: XTO Energy taps into IoT and the cloud to optimize operations and drive growth with Azure and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: XTO Energy is a subsidiary of ExxonMobil and has major holdings in the Permian Basin, one of the world’s most important oil-producing regions. To overcome the challenges of monitoring and optimizing a vast number of widely dispersed field assets, XTO Energy has been digitalizing its Permian operations. By using Microsoft Azure IoT technologies to electronically collect data and then using Azure solutions and Microsoft Dynamics 365 to analyze it, XTO Energy gains new insights into well operations and future drilling possibilities.

title: Public safety technology provider uses Azure and HashiCorp Terraform to transform evidence management
executive_summary: To minimize the need for deadly force in policing, Arizona-based Axon provides agencies with less-than-lethal weapons, body cameras, and the cloud-based digital evidence management system, Evidence.com. When Axon wanted to better manage high data volumes, strict data-integrity standards, and a global customer base, it used HashiCorp Terraform on Microsoft Azure to migrate Evidence.com from Amazon Web Services to Azure. Now Axon can meet its customers’ data requirements, accelerate innovation, generate more business value, and promote more transparent law enforcement.

title: H&R Block delivers scalable, multichannel tax preparation services with Microsoft SQL Server 2017
executive_summary: The tax industry has changed a lot recently, and H&R Block made plans to stay ahead of the changes, providing seamless multichannel experiences and unifying its disparate data sources to better serve its customers. By moving its various workloads to Microsoft SQL Server 2017 and Microsoft Azure and using Azure data services, the tax provider has been able to enhance service delivery, scale to meet its peaks in demand, and accelerate innovation.

title: A future-proof platform so retailers can deliver delight
executive_summary: ao.com is an electrical retailer operating in the UK and Germany. For the last 20 years, it has operated predominantly online. Delivering on AO’s ambition to exceed customer expectations and create delight requires constant effort and innovation.

title: Walgreens Boots Alliance delivers superior customer service with SAP solutions on Azure
executive_summary: Global pharmacy retail giant Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) is on a digital transformation journey that involves moving on-premises applications and IT resources in a heterogeneous Linux and Windows environment to the cloud. This includes the company’s massive 100-terabyte SAP landscape. WBA chose Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform, and after thorough planning with Microsoft and WBA’s implementation partners, the SAP migration to Azure went smoothly in less than a day. WBA now enjoys improved performance and data centralization that also helps the company provide better customer service.

title: Naudodamiesi „Microsoft 365“ „Lietuvos geležinkeliai“ persikėlė į modernią bendradarbiavimo erdvę
executive_summary:
Lithuanian railways company Lietuvos Geležinkeliai (LTG) runs most of the railway networks in the country. To enable remote collaboration and streamlined workflows, it implemented a cloud-first strategy, starting with Microsoft 365. As a result, all office and frontline employees could start collaborating virtually with the new system in less than 12 months.
The company has successfully created a ‘#ModernTeam,’ where each member has a strong sense of accountability and contributes to company's mission.

title: A Magyar Közút új utakat épít a hatékonyság felé az SAP HANA és az Azure révén
executive_summary: Magyar Közút exists to ensure safe traffic flow across Hungary. By conducting crucial maintenance work—repairing damaged roads, pruning trees, replacing damaged signs, and painting pavement markings—the company’s activities have a direct impact on Hungary’s commuters. It therefore wanted to enable quick upgrades of its reporting system and boost efficiency across the control hub and maintenance crews. Working with local Microsoft partner S&T Consulting Hungary, Magyar Közút moved to SAP HANA on Microsoft Azure, implementing a highly secure, scalable, and cost-efficient cloud platform.

title: Sustainable digital transformation at Rolls-Royce
executive_summary: As the world transitions to a net zero carbon future, the industries in which iconic British brand Rolls-Royce operates are some of the most critical – but they are also some of the hardest to abate.

title: How Microsoft and Anthology empowered Coppin State University’s student engagement through digital transformation
executive_summary: In a bid to better connect with existing students on a more personal level, while also expanding its appeal to potential future students, Coppin State University has leveraged software partner Anthology’s suite of Microsoft products to great effect. In addition, the program has enabled Coppin to further its mission of providing educational opportunities while promoting lifelong learning in a more accessible way.

title: University of Pittsburgh innovates in biomedical research by securing data in the cloud
executive_summary: Researchers in the University of Pittsburgh’s Department of Biomedical Informatics needed to grant multiple outside researchers access to sensitive biomedical data that would speed treatment to patients in need. They collaborated with Microsoft cloud solution architects through Pitt Information Technology, the university’s central IT department, to deploy a secure research enclave in record time using Microsoft Azure. Now, the university has a blueprint for replicating this secure environment, creating broad, secure access to sensitive data from multiple sources. University officials expect this will accelerate clinical trial approvals and access to funding for Pitt’s vast research community.

title: Lindsay Corporation drives sustainability and innovation initiatives with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: To help Lindsay Corporation fulfill its mission of bringing efficient, robust, and sustainable technology to the global agriculture and infrastructure sectors, the company decided to shift the IT infrastructure for its product platform to a cloud solution. With the flexibility, scalability, and security that cloud services can provide, the company saw an opportunity not only to get more value from its data, but also to expand and improve its products. Lindsay prioritized finding a solution with strong IoT capabilities from a technology innovator, and found both in the Microsoft Azure platform.

title: Serving Syrian IDPs and refugees with the help of cloud technology
executive_summary: Aided by a technology grant from Microsoft, Türkiye-based NGO Assistance Coordination Unit (ACU) is empowering humanitarian organizations across Syria to better serve those in crisis – by providing timely, mission-critical data. Using the power of Azure, Power BI and Office 365 Enterprise ACU’s “Early Warning Alert and Response Network” (EWARN) and “Information Management Unit” (IMU) are moving ever closer to real-time crisis monitoring and information management, helping better serve Syria’s most vulnerable.

title: Using AI to get vaccines to market faster
executive_summary: Phlexglobal is a leading technology and services organisation in the life sciences sector. It offers a suite of products to help life science and pharmaceutical companies manage their clinical and regulatory operations.

title: SitePro accelerates green expansion using Azure Cache for Redis
executive_summary: SitePro disrupted the oil and gas industry when it launched a fresh take on digital oilfield automation based on IoT tech. The company’s innovative end-to-end approach automates everything from real-time data capture at the source to final payments and analysis. Adoption has been so high that at some points, the SitePro solution has controlled up to half of the fluid moving in the Permian Basin—the richest oil-producing area in the United States.

title: Iguazio boosts Azure Machine Learning with MLOps automation, enabling companies to rapidly deploy AI
executive_summary: Interoperating with Azure Machine Learning (AML), MLOps solution provider Iguazio helps companies transform their artificial intelligence (AI) projects into real-world business results. Working across Financial Services, Healthcare, Retail, Media, Entertainment and other verticals, Iguazio automates machine learning pipelines end-to-end, cutting down the time and resources needed to get data science to production. Global leader in water, hygiene, and infection prevention solutions, Ecolab, turned to Iguazio, when it sought to add predictive risk modelling to its solutions offering. Using Iguazio’s MLOps platform, Ecolab was able to accelerate production time five-fold, break down silos between data scientists, engineers and DevOps practitioners, and discover a better way to collaborate and deliver results.

title: Yapı Kredi enhances its data assisted management culture by capitalizing on business intelligence across all units via Power BI
executive_summary: Yapı Kredi, the leading name of Turkish finance sector, enhances its data assisted management culture by capitalizing on business intelligence across all units via Power BI.

title: Element innovates with Microsoft Azure to drive process improvements in service
executive_summary: Headquartered in London, UK, Element is a global business that provides specialist testing, inspection and certification services to a diverse range of businesses. With over 6,500 engaged experts working in more than 200 facilities in the Americas, Europe, Middle East, Africa, Asia and Australia, Element is one of the fastest growing companies in the global testing, inspection and certification sector. When the finance team in its shared services centre for the Americas was forced to work from home during the COVID-19 pandemic, it needed to digitalise its paper processes fast. The creativity of the team and its use of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services delivered more than business as usual – it delivered significant efficiencies.

title: Bank of Khyber leverages Microsoft SQL Enterprise in core banking
executive_summary: With more than 190 branches in the country, Pakistan’s Bank of Khyber (BOK) has embodied professionalism and a commitment to quality service since its founding in 1991. The organization’s recent shift to SQL-based core banking was a first among Pakistani banks. It also saw BOK become a top Microsoft customer, harnessing SQL technology with Microsoft Azure and maximizing its use of Microsoft 365 productivity tools, Power BI, and Power Apps. Today, BOK is building a robust, cost-effective, and seamlessly integrated digital foundation for future growth.

title: Two City of Houston departments use Teams to reach out to minority-owned and women-owned businesses
executive_summary: The City of Houston's Legal Department and its Office of Business Opportunity (OBO) wanted to host a virtual forum designed to increase awareness about opportunities to work with the Legal Department and provide guidance about how to become an approved vendor, particularly for minority-owned and women-owned businesses. They desired a technology solution that would allow the event experience to mimic an in-person job fair, where attendees network and make connections. Working with Microsoft Customer Success, the City’s IT team and the Legal Department's IT team worked together to create a solution that met the event requirements. Ultimately, more than 100 businesses attended and understand more about how to work with these two offices.

title: ODE Yalıtım enters a new era with its Dynamics 365 upgrade across all business units
executive_summary: A major name in insulation materials industry with large scale investments and innovative R&D and exports of more than 4,000 products to 6 continents, ODE Yalıtım enjoys the benefits of the Dynamics 365 upgrade undertaken in a very short time during the pandemics. Dynamics 365 offers the company the chance to ensure operations are efficient, up to speed and streamlined.

title: Numbers add up as Voya Financial uses Microsoft Azure’s data science capabilities for Investment Management
executive_summary: When the Fortune 500 financial services firm Voya wanted more powerful and flexible computing power, it began moving its enterprise data science program to Microsoft Azure. The organization is now using AI and machine-learning technology to refine and scale its investment management quantitative strategy and improve customer service and product performance for its customers.

title: Association of Kenya lnsurers (AKI) goes digital with DIAS and Azure
executive_summary: The insurance industry Kenya was facing many challenges. The high cost of manual, paper-based operations had eroded profitability; reporting and documenting an automobile claim often took 10 to 12 days (Source: IRA TCF survey); and around 25% of the claims were fraudulent (Source: Deloitte Insurance Outlook report–East Africa). The Association of Kenya Insurers (AKI) partnered with SwiftAnt to digitalize insurance certificates and claims processes. To address these issues, SwiftAnt implemented its InsureTech solution Digital Insurance Apps powered by SwiftAnt (DIAS). DIAS is driven by a Microsoft suite of Azure Machine Learning, Azure Cognitive Services, AI, and blockchain. Claims can now be filed in just six minutes.

title: Atos selects Microsoft Azure cloud platform and RISE with SAP for greater flexibility
executive_summary: Atos recently decided to migrate all its internal information management resources to Microsoft Azure to harness the benefits of a more secure, robust, and agile solution. Moving from its on-premises infrastructure to a private cloud, Atos will have greater adaptability, scalability, and ease of integration in Azure.

title: AlphaBOLD revamps JWC Environmental's contact center solution
executive_summary: JWC Environmental was founded in Southern California in 1973 and is primarily known for manufacturing waste shredders and screening systems. JWC needed to enhance its customer service process flow to overcome challenges such as outdated customer service functionalities, disconnected and delayed processes, and manual case management reliance. AlphaBOLD helped JWC overcome these obstacles by implementing Unified Service Desk for Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (USD). JWC now enjoys more time- and cost-efficient management of incoming client requests and can focus on growth, innovation, and quality.

title: Nokia améliore son niveau de sécurité en gérant rigoureusement les données sensibles dans un service IA avec Azure Arc
executive_summary: Based in Finland, Nokia is a leading telecommunications company with operations around the world. One of the many valuable services it offers is a telco AI ecosystem called AI & Analytics, Virtualization, Automation (AVA) for its carriers to help optimize their networks and service delivery. Nokia created a successful proof of concept (POC) to validate an updated architecture using Microsoft Azure Arc. Now, Nokia is able to deploy, operate, and monitor the AVA applications running in the customer’s preferred cloud, while meeting the data regulatory needs for different countries.

title: Tristel builds a global business using SAP Business One on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Tristel is a manufacturer of infection-prevention and contamination-control products.

title: The KBO-Champion NC Dinos chose Microsoft Azure AI solutions to take another leap forward
executive_summary: Founded in 2011 and celebrating its 10th anniversary this year, the NC Dinos won the Korean Series championship in the 2020 season, nine years after its foundation, due to innovation through data and AI, and a result, has established itself as a top-tier club with much love and support from baseball fans at home and abroad.

title: Air passengers on cloud nine: Lufthansa Group relies on Microsoft Azure for personalized customer journey
executive_summary: Air traffic is precision work. Every second counts. This comes as no surprise to anyone who’s ever watched planes take off and land at a major airport—it’s as if they’re being pulled along by an invisible thread. Every second of the day, airlines such as Lufthansa fly passengers all around the world. In the future, precision work will also be a hallmark of customer service at Germany’s largest airline. Lufthansa Group has already got the ball rolling by setting up a one data platform (ODP) based on Microsoft Azure, which will enable it to assist passengers with personalized services before, during, and after their flight.

title: The human researches, the machine calculates (bills) – RWTH Aachen automates invoicing workflow with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: How can jeans production be made more sustainable? How can a machine component be optimized, manufacturing processes be made more efficient, and untapped energy-saving potential be unlocked? RWTH Aachen University conducts research into a broad range of topics. As part of their research activities, several of the university’s institutions use the Azure cloud platform to carry out analyses and calculations, which is then charged based on use. And that’s where things were getting complicated: the invoice total was divided manually between the individual research units, which would then cover their own costs. Today, the university has an automated invoicing workflow in place, which has enabled the cloud to be rolled out for research projects all across campus.

title: Powering Speech-to-Text AI that iterates at the speed of business
executive_summary: Helping quality content reach the linguistically diverse global market is a challenge that Vitra.ai decided to solve using AI. Co-founder Satvik Jagannath saw that businesses often had great content—videos, images, podcasts, and text—but what they needed was more reach, a way to break into global markets, expand their presence and increase their revenue using content they already had, instead of reinventing the wheel.

title: Yapı Kredi opts for "M365 E5 Information Protection" to safeguard its information
executive_summary: Yapı Kredi is one of Türkiye's major financial institutions, drawing strength from the 2006 merger of Yapı Kredi and Koçbank, two long-established Turkish  institutions in finance. Utilizing innovative technologies to lead the industry with distinctive services and applications, Yapı Kredi has now opted for the M365 E5 Information Protection solution in Data Security Management.

title: From data silos to holistic, analytical sales management and data-driven customer service: Power equipment manufacturer STIHL relies on Dynamics 365 in sales, marketing and service
executive_summary: "Every chainsaw is only as good as its service"—this quote by the company's founder Andreas Stihl inspired the philosophy on which the complete service structure of ANDREAS STIHL AG & Co. KG is based on. Over the last few years, the long-established company from the Swabian town of Waiblingen has expanded its portfolio to include digital products: Among others, the product portfolio includes digital products and solutions such as robotic mowers and the "STIHL connected" platform. To adapt established, decentralized sales- and service processes to the demands of the constantly evolving market, STIHL relies on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service.

title: O2 Czech Republic saves 30 percent TCO per workload by moving to Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Pobuca expands and helps business globally with Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365-based solutions
executive_summary: Pobuca used to be an infrastructure system integrator. In 2016, it decided to build its our own product and become a software-first company to help companies improve customer experience and loyalty. The secret sauce—Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology that helps make sense of the all the data—is based on Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365. With Microsoft’s solutions, Pobuca has seen a 77-percent increase in revenue in the past year. As for Pobuca’s clients, they’ve seen average increases in customer loyalty by 23 percent, satisfaction by 18 percent and revenue by 5 percent.

title: Government of South Australia enhances security, drives resiliency with Microsoft Unified Support
executive_summary: The Government of South Australia wanted to optimize its overall technology investment and offer better employee and citizen experiences, but its IT environment meant that some agencies lacked support. The state government developed a new centralization approach, and after entering into a two-year agreement for Microsoft Unified Support, it was able to unite its agencies under a single Microsoft 365 tenancy. It now receives expert guidance and tailored support, whenever needed, as it modernizes its capabilities and services. The Government of South Australia utilizes Unified Support to enhance its security posture, upskill staff, and rapidly deploy key Microsoft technologies to boost collaboration and efficiency to meet the needs of its agencies and serve its citizens.

title: Datenbooster für Individualgastronomie: Das Dashboard von ECHT Gastro Partner auf Basis von Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: ECHT Gastro Partner GmbH has the restaurant trade in its blood: for over 100 years, its parent, the Nordmann Group of Companies, has combined the roles of producer, manufacturer, supplier, and restaurant owner. That is why ECHT Gastro Partner has set itself the goal of making the restaurant trade fit for the future. The medium-sized enterprise’s ECHT Dashboard, which is based on Azure Synapse Analytics, is designed to provide independent restaurant owners with a full business overview that is transparent, fast, and up to date. This allows owners to react to changes earlier and target any adjustments more precisely.

title: Golden State Foods modernizes manufacturing and operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: A core line of business for food industry leader Golden State Foods (GSF) is the production of liquid products like sauces, dressings, and condiments. GSF needed to modernize a 25-year-old legacy ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system that ran the Liquid Products division at two existing plants and set it up for a new plant to manage the business across the division locations seamlessly. To create a common modern platform with shared data, centralized reporting, and standardized processes GSF turned to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

title: Belgian brand Kambukka dials up productivity with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Kambukka is a premium Belgian brand creating trendy and eco-friendly drinking and eating vessels. Between its website and various online marketplaces, Kambukka handles between 80 to 150 orders per day. Prior to using Dynamics 365 Business Central, for every sale that the company made, one person had to manually adjust the amount of stock in the system and create an invoice. This process was time-consuming, subject to human inaccuracies, and took employee focus away from selling. To solve this, Kambukka turned to the connector application between Shopify and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. With the front- and back-end processes connected, the Kambukka team saves an entire day per month in working hours and is free to build relationships, focus on sales, and generally work faster, smarter, and better.

title: Set up IT infrastructure for future sites in just two weeks—for Greenreb, Dynamics 365 makes it possible
executive_summary: As an exclusive licensee of Topgolf, Greenreb AG aims to firmly establish golf as a leisure experience in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, and Italy. The medium-sized company is starting out with ambitious goals. It just opened its first innovative golf experience venue, complete with a dining area open to the public, and it plans to establish many more sites across continental Europe over the next few years. Such an expansion needs a stable and scalable IT system that ensures smooth back-office processes. To build its infrastructure, Greenreb has opted for Dynamics 365 Business Central, Sales, and Marketing.

title: Government of Nunavut promotes Indigenous languages with groundbreaking Microsoft machine translation
executive_summary: Canada’s northernmost and largest territory is also its most sparsely populated area. As one of the four Inuit homelands in Canada, Nunavut is home to those who speak the Inuktut family of languages. Concerned by the dwindling use of Inuktut in the territory compared to English and French, the Government of Nunavut collaborated with Microsoft, using Microsoft Translator, part of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services, to help strengthen connections between Inuktut speakers with those speaking the official languages in the rest of Canada, English, and French.

title: Egyptian engineering firm empowers people with information culture through Microsoft cloud
executive_summary: Engineering firm PGESCO sought to migrate from an on-premises setup to the cloud to capitalize on an information-centered corporate culture. Through digital transformation leveraging Microsoft 365 and Power Platform, PGESCO boosts productivity and efficiency, shortening cycle times by nearly 50 percent and reducing its carbon footprint significantly.

title: KPMG helps banking customers identify financial risks by unifying data with Azure AI
executive_summary: In the late 2000s, financial crime committed at banks by traders garnered a lot of media attention. Those behaviors also eroded customer trust in financial institutions and led to massive fines. To help banks detect undesirable activity, KPMG created Magna, a risk analytics solution. The company recently added more AI capabilities to Magna using Microsoft Azure Cognitive Search, Azure Cognitive Service for Speech, and Azure Translator. The sophisticated AI detects subtle clues about misbehavior and alerts KPMG customers in a fraction of the time, boosting trust and decreasing risk.

title: Inventec improves manufacturing efficiencies with Azure Private 5G Core
executive_summary: Manufacturers focused on the future have begun to embrace advanced technology to improve quality control and empower their employees to make faster, more data-driven decisions. Inventec decided to position itself at the forefront of this next wave of manufacturing and “smart factories” to drive efficiency and lower costs.

title: VavaCars created a 360-degree customer journey management system using Dynamics 365
executive_summary: VavaCars provides car owners with the opportunity to sell vehicles through its platform. They created a 360-degree customers’ journey management system using Dynamics 365 and adopted Azure to store their data.

title: Microsoft simplifies global employee expense management with Dynamics 365 Finance
executive_summary: When the complexities and costs of maintaining an on-premises infrastructure and a global web of both customized networks and third-party expense management systems became too much to handle, the Microsoft Finance Management team decided to centralize and standardize its core expense management operations. The team worked with the Microsoft Digital Employee Experience (MDEE) team, choosing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and integrations with Microsoft Azure and Power Platform to help centralize and standardize Microsoft employee expense data and processes. The new system, called MyExpense, has streamlined and brought consistency to employee user experiences, helped reduce costs, and is ensuring Microsoft compliance standards with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX), while improving security and privacy, as well as accessibility and dependability of services

title: Nagarro increases efficiency by integrating worldwide employees, systems, and data with Microsoft Cloud solutions
executive_summary: Nagarro is a global leader in digital product engineering. With its forward-thinking, agile, and caring mindset, it drives technology-led business breakthroughs and helps its clients transform, adapt, and build new ways into the future. The company delivers exceptional customer outcomes by leveraging its expertise across multiple industries and cutting-edge technology. Listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, Nagarro is growing exponentially, with a team of over 18,000 employees across 33 countries.

title: More finding, less seeking: Moveworks revolutionizes how employees search for information with innovative conversational AI platform
executive_summary: Enterprise leaders are increasingly looking to better support their employees with automated processes and the benefits of conversational AI. Moveworks is bridging that gap with a conversational AI platform that understands exactly what employees need, no matter how they ask—and provides rapid, personalized responses that minimize disruptions to workflow.

title: Teknosa detects attacks 18 times faster with Microsoft Security Solutions
executive_summary: Customers are at the heart of Sabancı Holding’s Teknosa. Based in Türkiye, the retailer offers high quality technology products and services to delight customers all over the country. Teknosa envisions to maintain its leadership in the geographies where it operates with its innovative and differential quality products and services. For this cause, Ulaş Kaya, Information Security Manager at Teknosa, ensures operations continue safely. By replacing multiple solutions with Microsoft Defender, Kaya fast checks security with one dashboard and ensures business continuity for the company.

title: Natuzzi crafts amazing customer experiences with Microsoft mixed reality technologies
executive_summary: Italian furniture maker Natuzzi is known around the world for its innovative designs, attention to detail, and stellar customer service. To transform its white-glove customer service, increase sales conversions, and accelerate the purchase journey, Natuzzi has introduced mixed reality technology from Microsoft into its augmented store—a digital experience where customers can be inspired to design how they live and entertain, and where they can see potential purchases in the context of their own homes, positioning Natuzzi as the first store they want to visit. We invited Creative Director and Stylist, Pasquale Junior Natuzzi, to share his creative vision for how the company is disrupting the furniture industry with innovative thinking and products.

title: Westpac embraces and encourages a culture of innovation with Power Platform
executive_summary: Westpac, Australia’s first bank and one of the largest banks in New Zealand, has a long history of innovating with technology to provide great customer service. Continuing in this tradition, Westpac was seeking an adaptable low-code platform that could support a broad range of user needs that was simple to configure. Since 2019, Westpac has been using Microsoft Power Platform to help streamline business operations, solve IT issues, and formally support its “citizen developers”—employees who build their own solutions to simplify processes. In under two years, citizen developers have built about 1,000 apps, which are used by 15,000 people, and IT is building in-house solutions faster with low-code tools than with traditional software development.

title: Engagely.ai delivers more natural conversations, multi-lingual support and intuitive workflows with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Engagely.ai offers modern, AI-based, full-stack Customer Experience (CX) automation solutions. It empowers clients and their customers across industries to deliver exceptional customer experiences.

title: Engagely.ai delivers more natural conversations, multi-lingual support and intuitive workflows with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Engagely.ai offers modern, AI-based, full-stack Customer Experience (CX) automation solutions. It empowers clients and their customers across industries to deliver exceptional customer experiences.

title: TatvaCare leverages Microsoft Azure OpenAI to transform healthcare
executive_summary: TatvaCare, a promising start-up in the Indian health tech landscape, was founded in 2020 with a mission to transform care practices. It aims to promote efficient, patient-centric care and optimize outcomes across the healthcare spectrum. Its product portfolio includes TatvaPractice, an advanced electronic medical record (EMR) and knowledge platform aimed at healthcare practitioners; and MyTatva, a digital therapeutics (DTx) application to help patients manage chronic health conditions. TatvaCare is committed to achieving a long-term health continuum by improving the quality of care at one end and enhancing the quality of life on the other.

title: Belimo embraces Dynamics 365 to cement a future-focused strategy, save time, and improve experiences
executive_summary: Belimo, a leader in field devices for building automation, has a global footprint and an evolving workforce, one that increasingly favors leading-edge tools for customer relationship management. The business chose Dynamics 365 to consolidate on a trusted platform, improve collaboration between business functions, gain new insights, and future-proof its CRM solution. Today, Belimo is aligned with the evolving expectations of employees and customers.

title: MultiChoice boosts user satisfaction with Azure Machine Learning and Azure Databricks
executive_summary: Have you ever wished for a viewing experience that knows your taste better than you do? MultiChoice, Africa's premier entertainment destination, has made that a reality with Azure Machine Learning. Users enjoy highly personalized recommendations that cater to their tastes, making every view count. As MultiChoice is making the viewing experience better, smarter, and more enjoyable, it has seen a remarkable uptake in user engagement and satisfaction.

title: PageGroup invests in Microsoft Azure to build a platform for innovation using responsible AI
executive_summary: PageGroup finds talent for its clients so they can grow their businesses. Much of a consultant’s work is admin intensive, so opportunities for efficiency can make a big impact. They built a global enterprise data platform on Microsoft Azure, creating a platform for further innovation and the use of cloud-based technologies, such as generative AI. Innovations with Azure and OpenAI are already having real business impact.

title: The Environment Agency transforms regulatory services within Government powered by Azure Data and Power Platform
executive_summary: The Environment Agency’s priority is to create a better place for people and wildlife. Part of their work involves the administration of permits and regulatory permissions for citizens and businesses. To work more effectively, the Environment Agency embarked upon a strategy of transformation to modernise and consolidate its technical estate. Although the programme is ongoing, it has already brought wide-ranging benefits.

title: Ally Financial empowers customer service associates to focus on human engagement by using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Digital financial services firm Ally Financial (Ally) is using Microsoft Azure and Azure OpenAI Service to reduce manual tasks for its customer service associates, freeing up time for them to engage with customers. Ally is committed to delivering a seamless customer experience, and its associates are its human face. Previously, they had to take notes and write summaries after calls, which competed with the amount of time and attention they could give customers. By using generative AI to automate manual tasks, Ally empowered its associates to deliver a better, more personal experience while protecting vital customer data. Now they are more productive and engaged than ever.
products: Azure, Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: Astronomer delivers business-critical data with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Data engineers, data scientists, and analysts rely on accessible data to power critical applications and processes. Astronomer partnered with Microsoft Azure to offer a solution that delivers data on time, with the speed and scale business-critical applications demand.

title: Qatar Post processes thousands of documents daily and runs smoother postal services with Power Automate
executive_summary: Qatar Post has redefined postal services for the digital age, using Power Automate and Azure Cognitive Services to automate its processes. Partnering with SquareOne, an expert in robotic process automation, Qatar Post has automated the processing of more than 1,000 dispatch documents daily. It extended automation to retail services and even parcel sorting using autonomous mobile robots (AMR). Real-time service quality dashboards and automated reports help management keep track of operations. The impact is massive: heightened efficiency, increased accuracy, and saved valuable time for all employees.

title: Nanoleaf boosts productivity by 33% with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: As LED lighting pioneer Nanoleaf expanded to more than 200 global retailers, the company needed to consolidate multiple software programs into a single solution. Nanoleaf implemented Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central to optimize its financials and supply chain control, resulting in a 33% productivity improvement in its supply chain operations.

title: Revolutionizing contract life cycle management with generative AI and Azure
executive_summary: Contracts are the foundation of commerce. They govern every dollar in and out of the enterprise while serving as the definitive source of truth for business relationships. Yet, within many organizations, contract life cycle management remains fragmented across various departments such as legal, procurement, finance, and sales. Ineffective contract management can lead to revenue loss, unnecessary expenses, unwanted renewals, and in the worst cases, noncompliance or breach of contract situations that might result in fines or litigation.

title: IFAD enhances food systems and agriculture opportunities in fragile rural communities with help from Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: With a global mission to eradicate poverty and hunger in some of the world’s most fragile rural communities in developing countries, IFAD (International Fund for Agricultural Development) works hand in hand with governments to fund projects and innovative practices that enable small-scale producers to develop sustainable agricultural practices, transform food systems, and build resilience in the face of some of the biggest global challenges. IFAD needed a better way for its global teams and partners to access and share critical information from and to the remote locations they work in. It wanted a solution that could support seamless configuration and security management, along with the equitable adoption of new tools. Using Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Search, and Power BI, the organization built Omnidata, a centralized analytics platform that connects data, dashboards, visualizations, and analytics powered by machine learning and AI. The solution gives all personnel fast, direct access to critical data in every region IFAD serves, plus training in analytics and machine learning so they can actively create new tools to address specific day-to-day challenges.

title: Space and Time helps customers decode blockchain data with Microsoft Azure Open AI
executive_summary: Space and Time is a Microsoft-backed verifiable data warehouse that provides customers with easy access to data from the blockchain. FTI Technology, a global consulting firm and Microsoft Partner that provides Digital Insights & Risk Management solutions, is evaluating how Space and Time’s AI models through Microsoft Azure OpenAI can support its expert-led services for blockchain data.

title: Paytronix migrates 250 million unique customer profiles to Microsoft Azure within two hours
executive_summary: Paytronix, a provider of customized digital experiences for restaurant and convenience store guests, used Microsoft Azure to expand its business and improve its security profile. Supporting more than 1,800 customer brands, 700 clients, and over 250 million unique customer profiles, the company wanted to plan ahead for scale, performance, and reliability. With the opportunity to expand its services into global markets, the company needed to position itself for growth. Paytronix turned to Microsoft and, after a six-month planning process, completed the migration to Azure in under two hours. With Azure, Paytronix is growing its business and operating at record speeds while saving on costs and benefiting from improved security.

title: Paytronix migrates 250 million unique customer profiles to Microsoft Azure within two hours
executive_summary: Paytronix, a provider of customized digital experiences for restaurant and convenience store guests, used Microsoft Azure to expand its business and improve its security profile. Supporting more than 1,800 customer brands, 700 clients, and over 250 million unique customer profiles, the company wanted to plan ahead for scale, performance, and reliability. With the opportunity to expand its services into global markets, the company needed to position itself for growth. Paytronix turned to Microsoft and, after a six-month planning process, completed the migration to Azure in under two hours. With Azure, Paytronix is growing its business and operating at record speeds while saving on costs and benefiting from improved security.

title: Bank of Cyprus increases collaboration while reducing costs with Microsoft 365 and Teams Phone
executive_summary: Enabling a complex network of departments and associates, Bank of Cyprus needed a better way to communicate. The Bank decided to make Microsoft Teams its go-to platform where employees seamlessly transition between collaboration tools and telephony services, leveraging on Microsoft 365 and Teams Phone. This pivot not only streamlined operations but also enhanced employee efficiency and provided opportunities for further cost reduction. With the anticipated cost reduction in network infrastructure, reduction in electricity consumption, and a significant decrease in annual CO2 emissions, the bank sets a new standard in banking efficiency and environmental responsibility.

title: A secure and compliant version of ChatGPT: Otto Group builds its own in-house AI solution using Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Efficient knowledge management is crucial for the success of any company—no matter whether the goal is to develop new products or provide the information necessary to ensure good customer service. In the past, Otto Group relied on a number of different tools such as FAQ documents or wikis to get the job done. But now, this global retail company and service provider is putting AI into overdrive: ogGPT (Otto Group GPT)—an in-house solution based on Azure OpenAI Service—currently has 26,000 employee users, who are exploring where the tool can accelerate and simplify day-to-day operations and internal processes.

title: Northvolt powers the energy revolution with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Lionbridge disrupts localization industry using Azure OpenAI Service and reduces turnaround times by up to 30%
executive_summary: Lionbridge Technologies, LLC (Lionbridge), a global translation and localization services provider, is using Microsoft Azure and Azure OpenAI Service to accelerate its delivery times and improve quality. Lionbridge seized the chance to work with open-AI technology rather than against it, improving agility and offering hyper-personalization with LLMs. Since launching its AI-enabled solutions, which use GPT-4 on Azure OpenAI Service, Lionbridge has reduced project turnaround times by up to 30%. In the process, the company is disrupting the localization industry and creating a host of new business opportunities.

title: Redi, set, go: Virgin Money delivers exceptional customer experiences with Microsoft Copilot Studio
executive_summary: With 6.6 million retail and business banking customers, Virgin Money is on a mission to make you “happier about money”. One way in which the brand innovates to deliver exceptional customer experiences is through its award-winning virtual assistant, built using end-to-end Microsoft technologies, including Copilot Studio, paired with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service for managing the omnichannel customer experience.

title: Network Rail embraces a more efficient and safer data-driven future with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Network Rail needed to modernize its data analytics solution for asset management and maintenance. The company’s Intelligent Infrastructure program chose Microsoft Azure to help build several new solutions, bringing together multiple data streams for asset management. One of the tools gives maintenance engineers better insight into the 20,000 miles of railway track and countless other assets that make up the network. Today, employees use the solution, called insight, to understand data 50% faster than before and improve efficiency, passenger experiences, and safety—all while saving costs.

title: Hotelier becomes a citizen developer, building a smart work culture based on Power Platform and hyper-automated work environment
executive_summary: Lotte Hotels & Resorts, including Signiel, is the largest hotel and resort company in Korea that leads the country’s hotel and resort culture. As more and more domestic and international tourists are visiting, it welcomes guests with quality services and facilities as a global chain hotel. This is all thanks to countless employees' hard work. Lotte Hotels & Resorts has been creating a new work culture that allows them to work more efficiently and focus on the nature of the work by adopting Microsoft Power Platform for automation.

title: CARE leverages data and Azure AI to prepare for global emergencies
executive_summary: The development nonprofit CARE works around the world to fight poverty and promote equality, including by responding to crises. It is using AI to better understand emergency preparedness in its country offices so it can act without delay when lives are on the line. A solution built in Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service enables CARE to analyze open-ended survey responses to gauge emergency readiness, identify areas of improvement, and prepare for crises.

title: Cielo deploys agile, integrated, and secure environment with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: In search of a new infrastructure to elevate the potential of its environment for vendors, Cielo found a response to its demands in Microsoft tools, streamlining the entire process with security. As a next step, the company works on continuous technology improvement to scale to more users.

title: KPMG streamlines tax compliance services with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: KPMG in the US needed a modernized customer engagement system to align its business processes to file taxes and serve clients faster. Its homegrown legacy solution didn’t provide standardization or automation and left tax preparers working in different tools.

title: Michelin embraces AI with Azure OpenAI Service and Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: From the factory to the office, Michelin is seizing the potential of generative AI to continue to master its industrial challenges and boost the performance of its teams.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Microsoft Copilot, Microsoft 365 Copilot

title: Dynamic Health Systems uses Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare to reduce clinical workloads and deliver better patient outcomes
executive_summary: ISV Dynamic Health Systems created its VitruCare365® platform on Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare technologies to enable motivational care planning.

title: Alameda County ITD saves 100 hours per patching cycle with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Alameda County Information Technology Department (Alameda County ITD) confronted scalability constraints with its on-premises architecture, spent too much time on maintaining and expanding infrastructure, and faced increasing storage demands.

title: Krones AG redefines factory floor collaboration with Windows 365 Link
executive_summary: Krones needed to help its frontline workers seamlessly access their cloud-based resources as they moved from station to station. Sharing devices and user accounts was inefficient and inconvenient.

title: legal-i is revolutionizing medical insurance claims management with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: legal-i was looking for a solution that would make the complex processing of unstructured data sets in the healthcare and insurance sector significantly faster and easier.

title: DWF boosts productivity and client experience with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: DWF understands generative AI will transform knowledge work. It wants to lead in AI in law and professional services.

title: Super Hosokawa lowers food waste and boosts sales by sharing demand forecasts across the entire supply chain with Azure Databricks
executive_summary: "We aim to reduce food waste while also increasing sales." This seemingly contradictory goal was pursued through a demonstration experiment conducted in Oita and Fukuoka prefectures, focusing on reducing food waste through data collaboration across the supply chain.

title: WeTransact unlocks the Microsoft marketplace with Azure and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: The Microsoft commercial marketplace offers millions of customers worldwide a convenient place to find, try, and buy software and services. But getting a solution listed and transacting can be time-consuming and complicated.

title: Ontada transforms 150 million unstructured oncology documents with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Knowing each data point can make a life-changing difference for cancer patients. It is time-consuming, error-prone, and cost-prohibitive for Ontada to generate key insights using manual processes to analyze 150 million unstructured oncology documents.

title: Howdens enables customers to increase efficiency with innovative tool in Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Howdens is developing digital tools to support their customers to conveniently access the information they need to increase efficiency.

title: Kuwait Finance House cuts risk processing time by 96% with Microsoft AI solutions
executive_summary: Kuwait Finance House (KFH), a pioneer in Islamic banking, decided to undertake a major digital transformation of processes and centralize data by employing AI capabilities to support risk professionals in decision-making and efficiency.

title: Brunswick is cruising to success with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Brunswick's growth led to a fragmented ERP landscape, with multiple legacy systems causing inefficiencies. The lack of standardization made it difficult to manage operations and maintain consistent data across its global divisions.

title: Intermountain Health saves thousands of hours, improves patient care with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: To continue delivering high-quality healthcare, Intermountain Health wanted to connect AI, language models, and advanced algorithms to the cloud to make patient care and clinical caregiver support scalable, reliable, and transformative.

title: Hero AI innovates with Azure AI reducing patient waiting times by 55%
executive_summary: Hero AI, a healthcare technology company, is addressing industry challenges by improving patient care and operational efficiency. The company aims to reduce patient wait times, shorten patient stays, and increase hospital capacity.

title: Paramount Bed adopts Microsoft Dynamics 365 as its ERP solution for the next decade
executive_summary: A legacy ERP from 1998 couldn’t handle growth in the corporate group and expanding fields of business. Adding new functions as separate systems resulted in a core system made up of individually optimized subsystems.

title: Newman’s Own cuts costs, helps more children with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: In the highly competitive food industry, Newman’s Own continues Paul Newman’s commitment to “give it all away,” with 100% of the company profits going to Newman’s Own Foundation. It needed to improve employee productivity and maximize savings.

title: DTEK’s YASNO boosts customer service with Microsoft Azure OpenAI, reducing inquiry handling time by 22%
executive_summary: Due to increased customer support requests, DTEK's YASNO company needed to streamline contact center data processing to improve inquiry handling efficiency.

title: Games Global saves over 22,000 hours per year with Microsoft Power Platform and Copilot Studio
executive_summary: Games Global wanted to streamline everyday operations by replacing manual processes with automation. Approvals, audits, and reporting relied on email chains and spreadsheets, slowing teams down and limiting efficiency.

title: Amgen builds agent in 6 weeks with Copilot Studio to help accelerate R&D
executive_summary: Finding and sorting through thousands of pieces of digital resources, reports, and presentations has the potential to slow knowledge transfer for drug developers at Amgen.

title: McGees Property secures its future after ransomware attack with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: McGees Property, one of Australia’s largest privately owned commercial real estate agencies were hit by a ransomware attack on their 40th anniversary in 2022. Staff were locked out of their files for more than 4 weeks, working from personal emails and still trying to keep as many deals going as possible.

title: Dar facilitates access to critical data via PARA Copilot utilizing Azure AI on PARA OS
executive_summary: Dar’s intelligent building portfolio management solution, PARA OS, is designed to use advanced data analytics to improve operational performance. While powerful, it requires guided onboarding for the less technically inclined or new users.

title: Unifonic boosts productivity and accelerates customer engagement using Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Unifonic faced challenges using fragmented tools that hindered internal collaboration. This disjointed approach also led to inefficiencies in auditing and reporting, impacting overall operational effectiveness.

title: LTIMindtree merges 85K endpoints seamlessly with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: The merger of Mindtree and Larsen & Toubro Infotech, a technology manufacturing and services company, created the need for a flexible solution that would manage endpoints, patches, and vulnerabilities while seamlessly integrating effortlessly with the company's IT environment.

title: Chill Passion boosts employee attendance and confidence with Healthper’s Return to Work program on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Chill Passion, a manufacturer and distributor of high-quality beverage-dispensing products in Chicago, needed to install an affordable temperature-monitoring and testing solution for its employees during the COVID-19 pandemic. Healthper provided the company with two temperature terminals, installed at entry doors, and enrolled Chill Passion employees in Healthper's Return to Work program. Facial recognition and identification was powered by the Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services Face API, which trained Healthper's AI model, and the system was deployed on secure Azure infrastructure. Return to Work slashed screening time per employee from 45 seconds to two seconds and increased employee attendance by 100 percent in four weeks.

title: Fermax: Opening new doors for customers through IoT technology
executive_summary: One of the world’s leading door entry systems manufacturers, Fermax has always had a strong history in innovation. The company has developed a new Wi-Fi–enabled product through Microsoft Azure IoT technology, and for the first time it is able to see valuable insights around how customers are using its products. This helps Fermax not only improve their user experience, but also offer a range of value-added services directly to the customer.

title: Spanish Point Technologies helps musicians get paid fairly with its Azure-driven Matching Engine
executive_summary: Spanish Point Technologies wanted to help musicians earn fairer incomes for their properties by creating a solution that helps collective management organizations accurately invoice for music royalties when their works are used in a public space. The company worked with Microsoft and Databricks to build a big data and AI platform, based on Azure resources, which matches music performances to copyright holders at scale, processing hundreds of millions of transactions every month.

title: Empowering the employee experience at Mall of America® with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: For nearly 30 years, Mall of America (MOA) has served as a staple for tourism in Minnesota and across the Midwest. With over 520 stores and 11,000 employees year-round, MOA strives to embrace its visitors with the warmth and hospitality so readily associated with the North Star State. With guidance from Microsoft and Boyer & Associates, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network, MOA has been able to further enhance that experience by simplifying employee workflows with the adoption of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.

executive_summary: Finding and sorting through thousands of pieces of digital resources, reports, and presentations has the potential to slow knowledge transfer for drug developers at Amgen.

executive_summary: McGees Property, one of Australia’s largest privately owned commercial real estate agencies were hit by a ransomware attack on their 40th anniversary in 2022. executive_summary: Dar’s intelligent building portfolio management solution, PARA OS, is designed to use advanced data analytics to improve operational performance. While powerful, it requires guided onboarding for the less technically inclined or new users.
