executive_summary: Unifonic faced challenges using fragmented tools that hindered internal collaboration. This disjointed approach also led to inefficiencies in auditing and reporting, impacting overall operational effectiveness.

title: LTIMindtree merges 85K endpoints seamlessly with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: The merger of Mindtree and Larsen & Toubro Infotech, a technology manufacturing and services company, created the need for a flexible solution that would manage endpoints, patches, and vulnerabilities while seamlessly integrating effortlessly with the company's IT environment.

title: Lumen unifies data, gains near real-time insights, saves 10,000 hours with Fabric
executive_summary: Lumen’s aging systems created data silos, duplication, and inconsistent metrics. Marketing and sales teams struggled with slow ingestion, manual processes, and limited visibility, hindering their ability to act quickly and make informed decisions.

title: Educational software company brings joy of reading to children worldwide with .NET Core technology
executive_summary: If LightSail has its way, children (and even adults who have never had the chance to learn to read) all over the world will be learning to read with cutting-edge technology, regardless of geography, culture, or economic background—and they’ll have fun doing it. Based in New York City, the company built its Literacy-in-a-box solution on the .NET Core open-source platform, downloading content to any device running a browser to convert it to an e-reader that can be used anywhere—with or without internet.

title: BBC innovates how it delivers trusted news and entertainment with Azure AI
executive_summary: As one of the world’s oldest and largest global news and entertainment broadcasters, the BBC has built its reputation by delivering high-quality journalism with integrity to global audiences. It was looking for a strong partner that could help it build its own custom-branded voice assistant—but it needed full control over the experience, the customer relationship, and its customers’ data. With Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services and Azure Bot Service, the BBC created an end-to-end, customized digital voice assistant that captures its brand identity and helps establish a new conversational relationship with its many audiences.

title: Ullman Dynamics breaks through growth barriers to protect seafarers on a global scale
executive_summary: Ullman Dynamics boat seats aren’t just accessories for police, military, and coast guard around the world―they are crucial tools that empower these professionals to do their jobs safely. Quality is Ullman’s highest priority, but as the company grew, outdated technology was keeping it from reaching its full potential. By implementing a cloud-based business solution from Microsoft, Ullman Dynamics has unlocked the flexibility, efficiency, and insight to deliver an even more bespoke service to its growing client base.

title: LV= provides world-class claims handling with Microsoft Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
executive_summary: From its Head Office in Bournemouth on the South Coast, LV= provides investment and insurance services to more than 5 million members and customers thoughout the UK. One of the UKs largest insurers, LV= paid individual protection claims totalling £97.9 million during 2018.

title: Weeks Roses delivers inventory data at scale with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: San Joaquin Valley–based wholesale rose grower, Weeks Roses, faced data visibility challenges caused by multiple locations, disparate systems, and on-premises servers. Thanks to the new lead systems analyst, Tina Brown, and Microsoft Partner, ACE Microtechnology, the company migrated its systems to Dynamics 365 Business Central. One-month post-migration, the company is already seeing the benefits: streamlined processes, greater security, and more transparent operations.

title: Retail solution provider gets to the finish line fast with Azure IoT solutions for reimagined in-store experiences
executive_summary: Closing the retail gap between brick-and-mortar and the online space takes imagination, ingenuity, and innovative technology. Ombori and its part owner, ITAB, a leading European consumer experience solution provider for retailers, help stores bring the in-person shopping experience in line with the convenience of online purchasing. They’re overcoming the traditional barriers of low connectivity in stores with Microsoft Azure IoT Edge. Now they’re responding to a global pandemic by creating solutions that help retailers with social distancing. Ombori and ITAB rely on Microsoft solutions to respond quickly to market demand, swiftly creating digital products at scale.

title: Using technology to free up time for special children
executive_summary: Kinderhaus AtemReich is home to 18 children who can’t breathe without technical assistance. The non-profit institution in Munich’s Nymphenburg district provides round-the-clock medical care for boys and girls ranging in age from infants to teenagers. In times of tight budgets and staffing shortages, modern technologies such as Microsoft Teams or Azure take pressure off the staff and ensure that the children will continue to get high-quality care in the future—an example of meaningful use of digital technologies and cooperation among partners who have their hearts in the right place.

title: Working as one medical team during a crisis with Surface Hub 2S and Teams
executive_summary: To lead your team through a crisis, there are three things to take into account—you need to be visible, help your colleagues do what needs to be done, and most importantly, communicate.”

title: UBS and Microsoft unite: Co-creating the future of banking with Azure AI
executive_summary: UBS faced challenges in delivering personalized insights to clients due to complex workflows and content systems, hindering efficiency in providing comprehensive financial services solutions and timely, tailored advice to its clientele.

title: Operation Smile bridges the gap in access to care with Azure OpenAI and Fabric
executive_summary: To serve its global patients, Operation Smile needed better support for translation and localized data input, faster ways to identify and classify cleft conditions, and a replacement for manual data analysis in spreadsheets.

title: Indiana Pacers use Azure AI Foundry to create first live arena captioning service
executive_summary: The Pacers Sports & Entertainment (PS&E) technical team needed a custom, live-game captioning system that could deliver instantaneous captions to its deaf, hard-of-hearing, and non-English-speaking fans on arena screens and in its mobile app.

title: EY accelerates secure AI development using Microsoft Purview SDK
executive_summary: EY wanted to help clients adopt GenAI while mitigating data oversharing and loss. That required a way to embed data security, compliance, and governance directly into the custom applications the EY teams were building.

title: One of the biggest heat treatment provider—SECO/WARWICK Group, joins up customer journey with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: With customers in more than 70 countries,  SECO/WARWICK Group manufactures furnaces and heat treatment solutions for the automotive, aerospace, recycling and tooling industries. Seeking to improve efficiency of business processes, the company migrated to Dynamics 365. Leveraging Sales, Customer Service and Field Service modules, it not only connected its staff but the entire customer journey, gaining both customer and product insights while driving faster time to value.

title: Microsoft Teams helps CSG thrive during COVID-19
executive_summary: For more than 35 years, and across over 130 countries, CSG has acted as a trusted partner to some of the world’s most well-known brands, and strives to make ordinary customer and employee experiences extraordinary through digital innovation. When COVID-19 caused an almost immediate wholesale shift to remote working, CSG needed a solution that would aid that transition quickly and with minimal disruption to workflows. By capitalizing on a longstanding relationship with Microsoft, CSG was able to seamlessly implement and accelerate the rollout of Microsoft Teams, ensuring it was better equipped to cope with whatever challenges COVID-19 presented.
products: Microsoft 365, Planner, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI, Surface Pro

title: Duquesne University transforms its enrollment decision-making with Microsoft Power BI
executive_summary: Duquesne University, based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is a medium-sized Catholic University with approximately 9,000 students. In recent years, colleges in the Northeast and Midwest have seen a decline in enrollment. To counter this, Duquesne has explored ways to enhance its enrollment process. In 2020, the university partnered with TRIVIUM BI to use Power BI and the Microsoft platform to make more data-driven enrollment decisions. This has allowed the university to democratize data across virtually every level of management, from frontline counselors to the President and Provost. Joel Bauman, hired to head this effort as the Senior Vice President for Enrollment, is a recognized practitioner of strategic enrollment management.

title: Costain enables agile collaboration and innovation on major infrastructure programs
executive_summary: Smart infrastructure company Costain replaced its legacy datacenter wide area network (WAN) hardware with cloud-based Microsoft Azure Virtual WAN and Azure Firewall Manager, for instant agility when connecting with 70 project sites across the UK. Costain now updates networks remotely, saving many hours per month waiting for new connections and traveling to sites. Running its WAN infrastructure solely on Virtual WAN with Silver Peak devices, Costain shares data more securely and updates security policies centrally and with greater ease.

title: ChemTreat digitally transforms its manufacturing and service operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: ChemTreat, Inc. (ChemTreat) provides water and process treatment services to a wide range of industries. To keep pace with its own growth and increasing technological maturity in the markets it serves, ChemTreat adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and Dynamics 365 Finance, using them to improve its processes, transform its operations, and modernize its supply chain management. With expert implementation support from partner Alithya and the FastTrack for Dynamics 365 team, ChemTreat realized enhanced data visibility and insights, improved inventory, manufacturing, and distribution processes, and now provides better, more intentional, and proactive customer service.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Azure Virtual Desktop helps Grant Thornton UK LLP solve business challenge
executive_summary: As a member firm of one of the world’s leading organizations providing accounting, auditing, and tax and financial advisory services, Grant Thornton delivers value to its customers every day. With a cloud-first strategy combined with Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop, the United Kingdom–based firm went beyond borders and expectations—tapping into its global network of 58,000 workers and solving a business resourcing challenge.
products: Azure Virtual Desktop, Exchange Server, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, SharePoint

title: Amedisys clinicians provide better home care with mobile devices managed by Microsoft Endpoint Manager
executive_summary: Every year, 415,000 patients across the United States benefit from home health visits from an Amedisys caregiver. Richard Kaufmann, Vice President and Chief Information Security Officer at Amedisys, supported the move to Microsoft, in part because it streamlined compliance and helped accomplish one of his teams’ key goals: to make the user experience as seamless as possible without sacrificing security. With Endpoint Manager, Amedisys now has an integrated solution for managing endpoints that includes Microsoft Intune and System Center Configuration Manager.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot

title: Cerner associates shape the future of healthcare in hybrid workplaces with Microsoft collaboration tools
executive_summary: After extensive conversations with leaders across Cerner, the organization came up with three hybrid work categories that would likely play out across the company. All of these are augmented by Teams functioning as a collaborative hub for work. Using Teams, Higginbotham includes globally dispersed team members in these meetings, creating a sense of camaraderie despite the distance.

title: Scandinavian Airlines speeds app development, lowers costs with Azure Database for PostgreSQL
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Charity enhances security and compliance, saves costs with Microsoft 365 security
executive_summary: As the charitable arm of Derby County Football Club, Derby County Community Trust (DCCT) aims to improve people’s lives using the power of sports. Creating meaningful experiences for people of all ages and abilities is more than just fun and games, though. DCCT is serious about protecting sensitive information about its members and the organizations it works with every day. With Microsoft Azure Active Directory, Microsoft Defender for Office 365, and Microsoft Endpoint Manager, DCCT can now secure its data and devices while reducing costs and inefficiencies to maintain that pact.

title: monday.com accesses rich data, connects workflows, and generates valuable insights in its Work OS platform using Microsoft Graph
executive_summary: For many of monday.com’s customers that use Microsoft 365, Microsoft Graph is a key technology. Microsoft Graph provides an API into the organization’s cloud-based productivity data. Through this single, highly secure endpoint into the Microsoft 365 platform and features, monday.com can access rich, actionable organizational data from a wide variety of sources.The Microsoft 365 environment is designed from the ground up with security in mind, and Microsoft Graph offers a security API to hook into that environment, along with multiple security providers, through a single programmatic interface.

title: American Cancer Society remains resilient, battles cancer through a digital-first strategy
executive_summary: American Cancer Society funds and conducts research, supports patients, and educates the public to help people live free from cancer. Its recent digital transformation helps the nonprofit drastically reduce overhead, raise more money in a changing fundraising climate, and make each dollar raised stretch further. By adopting a cloud-first posture, American Cancer Society embraces efficiency and innovation in its battle against cancer.

title: Romanian pneumatics company Bartrom bolsters resilience by moving its ERP system to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As a pneumatics and compressed air specialist, Bartrom provides services and mechanical devices to businesses across Romania. After a series of unpredictable power outages would stop its on-premises enterprise resource planning (ERP) system from running for days, the mid-size company decided to move it to the cloud. Looking for an affordable solution with built-in security and a strong backup and recovery plan, it chose to implement SAP Business One on Microsoft Azure. Not only has the solution proven to be highly secure and scalable, it also helped Bartrom cut down its overall costs.

title: Ukraine’s Raiffeisen Bank Aval reshapes 2.5 million customers’ experience with Microsoft cloud solutions
executive_summary: Recognized as “Best Bank in Central and Eastern Europe” by The Banker for the fifth time in a row, Raiffeisen Bank Aval (RBA) always strives to exceed customer expectations and improve customer service and personal engagement. To empower its 6,500 employees spread across the country, RBA used Microsoft 365 to streamline communication and processes. Then, to deliver a connected multichannel experience for all its clients, the bank used Azure and Dynamics 365 Marketing for its campaign and loyalty management platform. As a result, the bank is seeing a 10 percent month-to-month growth in loyalty program involvement, and 15 percent more people have agreed to hear about the bank via their preferred channels.

title: Ukraine’s Raiffeisen Bank Aval reshapes 2.5 million customers’ experience with Microsoft cloud solutions
executive_summary: Recognized as “Best Bank in Central and Eastern Europe” by The Banker for the fifth time in a row, Raiffeisen Bank Aval (RBA) always strives to exceed customer expectations and improve customer service and personal engagement. To empower its 6,500 employees spread across the country, RBA used Microsoft 365 to streamline communication and processes. Then, to deliver a connected multichannel experience for all its clients, the bank used Azure and Dynamics 365 Marketing for its campaign and loyalty management platform. As a result, the bank is seeing a 10 percent month-to-month growth in loyalty program involvement, and 15 percent more people have agreed to hear about the bank via their preferred channels.

title: Humanitarian organization transforms technology to continue transforming lives
executive_summary: For 30 years, Human Appeal, an international relief and development agency, has helped transform and save lives. Founded in 1991 by two students in a flat in Manchester, Human Appeal was built from the ground up with the goal for a just, caring, and sustainable world. Today, it boasts more than 170 employees in the United Kingdom, 100+ staff members internationally, and 850+ volunteers. Working in 24 countries, Human Appeal provides services like emergency relief, food security, water, sanitation, and healthcare via mobile clinics to millions of the most vulnerable people each year. Faced with rising costs, increased threat of security breaches, and the need to reach staff and volunteers in remote areas, Human Appeal decided to transform its technology.

title: Leader in Polish real estate market, Dom Development, streamlines operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: With operations in Warsaw, Wroclaw, and Tricity, Dom Development is one of the leaders in the Polish real estate market. In 2018, to make sure each project met the highest standards, the company established its own general contractor, Dom Construction. This set up the perfect opportunity to build new systems based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain Management. Consolidating all business operations within the group, it allows Dom Development to redesign processes, streamline workflows, and enable the new line of business to be ready in no time.

title: Arla Foods transcends distance to feed a hungry world with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist on HoloLens 2
executive_summary: When one of the world’s largest dairy companies finds a large proportion of its skilled machine operators grounded by COVID-19 restrictions, it needs to pivot to maintain critical business continuity—and fast. With thousands of liters of perishable dairy products at stake, Arla Foods didn’t have time to waste. Already underway on its mixed reality journey, the company put its ingenuity to work, along with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist on mobile devices and, in some factories, enabled employees to go hands-free with Dynamics 365 Remote Assist on Microsoft HoloLens 2. This was a vital boost to the program Arla Foods developed to keep its employees safe by adhering to social distancing measures, help preserve essential food supply during a pandemic, and even create a blueprint for remote assistance that supports its high-priority sustainability goals. Not bad for a mere two weeks’ work—the amount of time it took Arla to make mixed reality technology available to its production facilities around the world.

title: Nonprofit ECRI provides life-saving medical information with Microsoft technology
executive_summary: During COVID-19, nonprofit ECRI’s mission to provide impartial, authoritative guidance and assurance for healthcare workers and organizations became more important than ever. ECRI relies on Microsoft technology to collaborate, create solutions to answer new healthcare questions, and keep sensitive data secure. The nonprofit takes advantage of technology to continue sharing insights that enable life-saving decisions—during the pandemic and beyond.

title: Microsoft improves marketing operations efficiency with Microsoft Power Automate
executive_summary: The Global Demand Center (GDC) at Microsoft plays a critical role in driving Microsoft’s commercial businesses. It’s the connected sales and marketing engine that runs all the commercial marketing campaigns for the company. It’s designed to engage customers throughout their lifecycle, from awareness to retention, helping them succeed at each step of their journey. The GDC uses artificial intelligence to determine the right experience for each customer at the right time and provide insights and actions to marketers and sellers, driving increased demand for Microsoft products.

title: AIMS increases collaboration and efficiency with iGlobe's Office2SharePoint for Outlook add-in
executive_summary: With a network of about 200 accountants supporting over 25,000 SMEs and their clients across the country with tax and accounting help, AIMS Accountants for Business is the largest network of independent qualified accountants in the United Kingdom. AIMS was looking for a way to provide its employees and franchise holders with centralized, structured access to important documents and files.

title: Uniper ties a complex data estate together with Azure Arc
executive_summary: As an energy company, Uniper operates in a constantly changing environment. Its international presence requires navigating a sea of regulatory and compliance requirements that call for a plethora of IT environments. When the company implemented Microsoft Azure Arc, it gained the tool it needed to control the uncontrollable—a unified management solution it uses to manage all its resources from a single interface. That visibility doesn’t just deliver efficiency and ease of use. It heightens security, too.

title: Bahia Principe Hotels & Resorts deploys analytical system with AI models
executive_summary: Bahia Principe Hotels & Resorts collaborated with Luce Innovative Technologies to implement artificial intelligence (AI) models for classifying potential customers via site navigation data and predicting the probability of turning those users into buyers. Based on Microsoft Azure and Power BI, the implementation enabled the creation of an infrastructure capable of supporting the training of the AI models through analysis of large volumes of data. The obtained data is made available within optimal response times to maximize user experience while also increasing efficiency in marketing campaigns.

title: EY-Microsoft joint innovation reduces tax data processing from months to hours with Microsoft Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: Professional services organization EY works with more than 200,000 clients in 150 countries, from startups to multinationals across many sectors, helping them meet their most pressing obligations—one of them being tax. EY’s Intelligent Tax Function Framework combines Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and Microsoft 365 technologies to help enable some of the fastest data-processing speeds in the tax industry. By creating a single source of truth, what previously took tax professionals months to achieve now takes just hours.

title: AccountabilIT reduces authentication friction for employees, increases market value with Azure Lighthouse
executive_summary: Managed IT and cybersecurity services firm AccountabilIT provides best-in-class technology solutions that its clients can rely on. But the company kept running into issues with its previous security information and event management provider, which lacked a sophisticated and integrated security federation feature. By implementing Microsoft Azure Lighthouse, AccountabilIT eliminated identity provisioning, reduced operations costs, and opened new market opportunities.

title: Advantech chooses Microsoft to modernize network security and anchor its global Zero Trust strategy
executive_summary: Technology manufacturer Advantech realized it needed to match its modern workplace initiative with a more proactive IT security stance for its corporate networks and manufacturing facilities around the globe. With the help of partner Freedom Systems, Advantech identified Microsoft Security as the best option, building on existing Microsoft 365 investments and offering a broad range of connected features that are easy to deploy and operate. Advantech staff now enjoy a more secure and compliant environment that enables them to focus on their core business goals.

title: GetGo Redefines the Consumer Experience in Convenience with Cooler Screens
executive_summary: GetGo, a food-first convenience store chain, has been bringing innovation to its stores for years, with an emphasis on technology to optimize the consumer experience. GetGo partnered with Cooler Screens to replace traditional cooler aisle doors with digital smart screens which seamlessly integrated into GetGo’s existing high-traffic beverage area. Cooler Screens technology and contextually relevant retail media and merchandising resulted in an improved consumer experience, same store sales lift and operational improvements for GetGo.

title: udaan accelerates its unicorn journey with Azure SQL Database, saves on infrastructure costs
executive_summary: The difficulties faced by micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in India as they struggled to replenish their inventories inspired a wildly successful startup. When three former Flipkart engineers saw a win-win opportunity to make life easier and more profitable for both sellers and suppliers, they formed udaan. The company offers MSMEs a new path to success. But without a scalable technology to handle millions of transactions reliably, udaan couldn’t exist. It chose Microsoft Azure SQL Database and built a highly scalable and resilient platform that lifts the MSMEs of India every day.

title: The University of Miami drives reliability with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The University of Miami is a leading-edge teaching and research institution located on Florida’s southern tip, part of a region known as Hurricane Alley. With a steady threat of extreme weather–related outages, the University looked to Microsoft Azure to improve its disaster recovery capabilities and shift key on-premises assets to the cloud. Pursuing a well-architected strategy, the University set up redundant versions of key data warehouses in Azure and now takes advantage of Azure availability zones to safeguard against outages, stay operational during maintenance and improvements, and help ensure resilience and reliability. Additionally, the University is realizing greater agility, faster response time to business needs, and reduced costs by continuing to pursue Azure-backed solutions.

title: Microsoft Sentinel strengthens Salford Councils cyber security and reduces corporate risk
executive_summary: For many public sector organisations, cyber security tops the corporate risk register. Salford City Council is one of the ten metropolitan borough councils in Greater Manchester. It serves 220,000 residents. The diverse city region includes some of the most deprived wards in the country as well as being a high-tech hub that includes MediaCityUK, home to 250+ creative and digital businesses. As part of a wider programme to develop digital skills across the city region, Salford City Council has created a commercial security operations centre built on a public-sector-operated platform and Microsoft Sentinel. As well as protecting the council and its residents, the SOC services will be offered across the North West – and, eventually, beyond – to make public sector and enterprise more secure.

title: Bolloré Transport & Logistics unlocks localized, customized solutions with Power Platform
executive_summary: Simply put, Bolloré Logistics (one of Bolloré Transport & Logistics’ four business units: Bolloré Logistics, Bolloré Ports, Bolloré Energy, and Bolloré Railways) is a “travel agency for goods.”

title: Turning gas into cash: N-ERGIE’s virtual power plant based on Azure helps market electricity made from biogas
executive_summary: When cattle eat grass, they produce organic material: manure. And when this ferments, you get biogas. Burning biogas in a combined heat and power (CHP) plant is a way to generate clean electricity. For a long time, Germany’s farmers could turn a profit by producing electricity this way because for over 20 years the country’s Renewable Energy Sources Act (EEG) guaranteed them stable sales prices for it. But with the phasing out of this remuneration, the job of marketing electricity is once again falling to the plant operations. A complex undertaking. To ensure incentives to operate such plants remain, N-ERGIE Aktiengesellschaft developed a virtual power plant based on the Azure cloud platform. This allows decentralized management of CHP plants to keep them running at maximum efficiency. It also means operators get the best possible market price.

title: Cloud security helps Pathfinder protect women’s reproductive health worldwide
executive_summary: Pathfinder International is a nonprofit that supports reproductive health and the rights of women and girls across the globe. The organization runs programs to improve access to family planning and contraception, maternal health services, HIV and AIDS support, and more. By transitioning much of its technology infrastructure to Microsoft services, it can work in ways that are more secure, efficient, and strategic. Azure Active Directory and other Microsoft solutions have minimized risk of cyberattacks and security breaches, while Microsoft InTune enables staff in remote locations to manage devices without dangerous travel or unnecessary risk. Through Microsoft Power Apps, the organization has created streamlined, paperless digital workflows for many processes. These technology solutions free up staff to focus on the health mission of the organization, with the knowledge that the technology backing their work is secure, efficient, and reliable.

title: Innovasjonsparken Stavanger: Setting the Standard for Property Management
executive_summary: As property owners and managers, the Innovation Park Stavanger team needed a platform that could centralize their tenant systems and streamline how customers engaged with their services. That’s where Veni came in. Together, these two organizations are building a universal asset management platform that includes a ticketing system, resource booking capabilities, and so much more. At the core of it all? Azure. Read our case study to see why these teams chose Azure and how they’re setting the standard for the office property management space.

title: Lessons learned from using Microsoft Viva during the pandemic to improve employee work-life balance
executive_summary: After a two-year period of remote work, many Microsoft employees are returning to their offices—but not to the old ways of working. During that disruptive time, Microsoft leadership, reinforcing a culture that emphasizes employee wellbeing, listened to employees and learned many lessons about work-life balance and wellbeing. Teams then worked together to implement change by enforcing positive habits with Microsoft Viva. These best practices, which flourished during the pandemic, will help Microsoft maintain its business success moving forward in a hybrid work environment.

title: Kitchen Brains makes smart kitchens even smarter with Azure IoT Central
executive_summary: For the past 53 years, Kitchen Brains has been developing process control systems to ensure food quality and consistency, improve employee safety, increase guest satisfaction scores, and reduce food, labor, and training costs. Kitchen Brains recently introduced KBconnect, a platform based on Microsoft Azure IoT Central that seamlessly connects a range of IoT devices for quick service restaurant (QSR) chains and food service original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) to provide real-time data used to optimize operations. By providing a robust IoT backbone and ultimate scalability, Azure IoT Central reduced Kitchen Brains development time by an estimated 80 percent—from 12 to 2 months—and provides the ingredients for continuous enhancement to meet the specific needs of each QSR and OEM customer.

title: Romanian bank upgrades employee experience with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Libra Internet Bank offers its customers one of Romania's most modern internet and mobile banking services. Even before the COVID-19 pandemic, the bank’s clients could already manage accounts without leaving their homes. However, at the beginning of the pandemic, Libra had yet to adjust effective remote working, aiming to expand communication between employees and to reach the next level of internal collaboration. To do this, the bank made online teamwork fully possible, by using Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365. Within a month, nearly 1,000 employees had transitioned to the cloud. Now, they can all collaborate on the go, work on their mobiles, and have reduced email load.

title: Microsoft helps Adif deploy its collaboration platform to more than 11,000 employees in less than a week
executive_summary: With the arrival of COVID-19, Adif accelerated its digitization process to enable its more than 11,000 employees, spread across the country, to continue working and guarantee the continuity of operations during the worst months of COVID. To meet the significant challenges of such a large transformation project, the company relied on four Microsoft Gold Partners: NTT Data (formerly everis), for initial consultancy and development of the “Espacio365” project; SEIDOR, which proposed the solutions deployed; Tokiota, to implement Azure Virtual Desktop and launch the Company Communicator app in Teams; and Capgemini, which developed the app for Conventional Network Project Management through Microsoft Power Apps. By launching this project, Adif has managed to unify different solutions that previously produced unwanted silos.

title: AccountabilIT reduces authentication friction for employees, increases market value with Azure Lighthouse
executive_summary: Managed IT and cybersecurity services firm AccountabilIT provides best-in-class technology solutions that its clients can rely on. But the company kept running into issues with its previous security information and event management provider, which lacked a sophisticated and integrated security federation feature. By implementing Microsoft Azure Lighthouse, AccountabilIT eliminated identity provisioning, reduced operations costs, and opened new market opportunities.

executive_summary: The University of Miami is a leading-edge teaching and research institution located on Florida’s southern tip, part of a region known as Hurricane Alley. With a steady threat of extreme weather–related outages, the University looked to Microsoft Azure to improve its disaster recovery capabilities and shift key on-premises assets to the cloud. Pursuing a well-architected strategy, the University set up redundant versions of key data warehouses in Azure and now takes advantage of Azure availability zones to safeguard against outages, stay operational during maintenance and improvements, and help ensure resilience and reliability. Additionally, the University is realizing greater agility, faster response time to business needs, and reduced costs by continuing to pursue Azure-backed solutions.

title: Team Rubicon optimizes logistics and mobilizes more volunteers with Dynamics 365 Field Service
executive_summary: By uniting the skills of military veterans, first responders, and skilled civilians to rapidly deploy emergency response teams, Team Rubicon helps communities through natural disasters and humanitarian crises around the world. As crisis situations become even more complex and urgent, the organization relies on technology to solve complex logistical challenges. By implementing Dynamics 365 Field Service for volunteer management, project operations, work orders, and more, the nonprofit can do more with less and help more people recover from the impact of a disaster faster.

title: Qanawat ensures readiness, no downtimes, scalability, and security to its payment procedures.
executive_summary: Qanawat is the leading digital mobile solutions provider in the Middle East and North Africa. Qanawat was expanding its market share in the DCB payment and wanted a reliable infrastructure partner that provides Scalability - Security – Availability. The requirement was challenging as the payment transaction should occur on time without delay and volumes may increase suddenly. To sustain its growth, Qanawat decided to migrate its on-prem infrastructure and direct carrier payment platform on Azure thus ensuring readiness, no downtimes, scalability, and security to their payment procedures Qanawat Digital FZC Qanawat (meaning ‘Channels’ in Arabic) is the leading digital mobile solutions provider in the Middle East and North Africa. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Dubai, UAE, they are strategically partnering with 40+ Mobile Network Operators, 10+ Digital Platforms, 700+ Merchants, content providers and Technology companies. Qanawat is the biggest Digital Music and Online Content aggregator in Pan Arabic Region being a reference company for Mobile Network Operators, Digital Content Merchants, and their customers. The aim at Qanawat Digital is to support people and organizations and leverage the full potential of innovative mobile solutions by being the platform that allows Digital Content Merchants to reach their public target and allow the consumers to get the desired content and pay for it using their phone credit.

title: Land O’Lakes, Inc. shares the recipe for multicloud protection: Microsoft Defender for Containers, related solutions
executive_summary: When a respected company with a century of history behind it upgrades its digital security posture, there are bound to be challenges. But for Land O’Lakes, Inc., the flexibility and breadth of Microsoft Security solutions answers the need to blend old solutions with new ones and realize the greatest possible advantages of a multicloud, hybrid workspace. The company achieved more granular visibility with Microsoft Defender for Containers and Microsoft Sentinel. And happily, Microsoft Security solutions work seamlessly with non-Microsoft solutions and point the way to continued ease and productivity.

title: Apex Group optimizes costs, safeguards data, and unlocks value with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Dedicated to helping its clients make sound decisions and build financial security, Apex Group strives to support the communities it serves. To achieve this, Apex Group needs an advanced, reliable, high-performance IT structure that includes comprehensive network and data security. Apex Group now scales with Azure Virtual Machines, running as many as 500 virtual machines to meet peak loads or as few as 20 when demand declines.

title: Goodbye desk phone, hello Unified Communications: SAP turns to Microsoft Teams for mobile working worldwide
executive_summary: With 15,000 accounts migrated in a single day, the smooth transition to Teams Phone at SAP’s Bangalore campus in India is one of the fruits of a long-term digital transformation strategy. It is now more than 10 years since SAP first began phasing out landline phones in company offices and rolling out Unified Communications solutions in their place. Over this period, more and more employees have swapped the telephone receiver for a PC and headset. Microsoft systems were providing flexible communications long before COVID-19 and way before anyone began talking about having to work from home. Today, 150,000 SAP® users and devices around the world communicate over Microsoft Teams. This early shift to hybrid working has had a clear impact on corporate culture at SAP.

title: Less planning, more travel: HYMER is driving motorhomes into the digital future with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: A motorhome is a house on wheels; it promises the ultimate freedom of travel. But like a home, it’s packed full of devices. And like a car, the technology needs to be understood, maintained, and operated correctly. Only then can the travel planning begin. To make things a little easier, motorhome manufacturer HYMER has combined automotive digitization with smart-home solutions and travel-related services: the HYMER Connect app makes sure the joy of travel isn’t overshadowed by time spent dealing with logbooks, user manuals, and to-do lists. The pioneering app, the motorhome, and its components all communicate over the Azure cloud platform.

title: Kitchen Brains makes smart kitchens even smarter with Azure IoT Central
executive_summary: For the past 53 years, Kitchen Brains has been developing process control systems to ensure food quality and consistency, improve employee safety, increase guest satisfaction scores, and reduce food, labor, and training costs. Kitchen Brains recently introduced KBconnect, a platform based on Microsoft Azure IoT Central that seamlessly connects a range of IoT devices for quick service restaurant (QSR) chains and food service original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) to provide real-time data used to optimize operations. By providing a robust IoT backbone and ultimate scalability, Azure IoT Central reduced Kitchen Brains development time by an estimated 80 percent—from 12 to 2 months—and provides the ingredients for continuous enhancement to meet the specific needs of each QSR and OEM customer.

title: Maire Tecnimont streamlines contract processes with Microsoft Syntex
executive_summary: Headquartered in Milan, Italy, Maire Tecnimont is a leading industrial group in the natural resources transformation sector: technology, engineering and construction in the oil and gas downstream and in energy transition. The company operates in 45 countries through approximately 50 companies, involving more than 40,000 people including vendors, contractors, and partners from 70 nationalities worldwide.

executive_summary: By uniting the skills of military veterans, first responders, and skilled civilians to rapidly deploy emergency response teams, Team Rubicon helps communities through natural disasters and humanitarian crises around the world. As crisis situations become even more complex and urgent, the organization relies on technology to solve complex logistical challenges. By implementing Dynamics 365 Field Service for volunteer management, project operations, work orders, and more, the nonprofit can do more with less and help more people recover from the impact of a disaster faster.

title: Hultafors Group Implements A Scalable CRM Solution To Support Sustainable Growth
executive_summary: Both organically and through acquisitions, Hultafors Group had entered a period of sustained growth and reached a point where they wanted to take their existing CRM solution to the next level to meet the demands of their expanding business. So they did what any forward-thinking company would do, they sought out a partnership to join them on their journey going forward. It seemed natural and logical to invest in a strong and collaborative partnership that could help the business further embed Dynamics 365, bringing all their sales teams into one unified system. That’s when they brought CRM-Konsulterna (CRMK) onboard.

title: Global professional services firm RealFoundations activates new level of knowledge-sharing for global workforce with Microsoft Viva Topics
executive_summary: RealFoundations is a professional services firm dedicated to helping organizations that develop, own, operate, service, occupy, and invest in real estate work smarter. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, it serves 15 of the top 25 largest global property managers and nearly all the top 25 largest global office, retail, industrial, and multi-family owners, with more than 300 client-serving professionals across eight global offices.

title: Denso’s development of “human-like” robots using Azure OpenAI Service as the brain to help robots and humans work together through dialogue
executive_summary: N/A

title: Transferring the out-of-date virtual environment to Azure a multi-cloud option. What is LIXIL’s flexible and effective multi-cloud strategy?
executive_summary: LIXIL makes pioneering water and housing products that make better homes a reality for everyone, everywhere. LIXIL also proactively promotes DX (digital transformation). They consider this to be the key of the LIXIL transformation, through which we aim to reform the existing businesses, create new businesses, and even improve productivity and employee engagement. LIXIL’s Digital Function promotes modernization of the existing IT infrastructures while aiming to strengthen their system toward DX promotion. As part of the initiatives, they started transferring the out-of-date virtual infrastructures, which are in their on-premise environment, to the cloud. They decided to employ Microsoft’s full-managed service “Azure VMware Solution (AVS)” as one of the transfer destination options, since they would be using multiple cloud services under the multi-cloud strategy.

title: Liebherr ensures seamless document security across Dynamics 365 and SharePoint with permissions synchronization from Connecting Software
executive_summary: Liebherr is an innovator in mobile tower crane building, construction, and automation technology, not only in Germany, but around the world. The company integrated Microsoft Dynamics 365 and SharePoint and wanted to ensure permissions were also synchronized between the systems without the need for human intervention. Connecting Software’s CB Dynamics 365 to SharePoint Permissions Replicator synchronizes permissions between Dynamics 365 and SharePoint automatically and has been working smoothly behind the scenes for Liebherr for over five years.

title: Cognizant embraces remote work with Microsoft Intune and Windows Autopilot
executive_summary: When the pandemic hit, Cognizant had the tools it needed to deal with the worst-case scenario. With a process that does not require on-premises infrastructure, Autopilot can securely provision devices over an internet connection. Cognizant’s IT teams were quickly able to transition to remote provisioning and ensure that the company’s associates could productively work from home.
products: Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot

title: Dell Technologies unlocks new connections and streamlines work with Microsoft Viva Topics
executive_summary: When Sandra Murtagh, Vice President of Global Sales Learning and Development at Dell Technologies, and Karen Butcher, Head of the Global Sales Learning and Development Transformation Office at Dell Technologies, launched a transformation office within the Dell learning and development organization, the goal was to orient the sales function toward the future. They focused on delivering great experiences and integrating their learning platform with Microsoft Teams, where sellers will be able to access training content at the moment of need. Viva Topics emerged as the next logical step. Turning to Viva Topics to uncover knowledge from within the apps they use every day leads Dell sales employees to forge new connections with colleagues.

title: Picanol Group finds flexibility and faster time to market with Azure Stack
executive_summary: The art of weaving tends to conjure up images of a slower, simpler time—of dedicated craftspeople using traditional techniques to make and trade textiles locally. But today, weaving is a thoroughly fast-paced and global business, with companies navigating shifting markets, using leading-edge technology, and scaling to meet worldwide demand. Picanol has been at the forefront of this business for the past 85 years. The Belgium-based weaving machine manufacturer delivers weaving technology to the textile industry and beyond. Additionally, Picanol Group offers engineered casting solutions within the company Proferro and the development and production of electronics at Psicontrol. To continue its tradition of transformation, the group launched its Factory 4.0 strategy and adopted the Azure Arc enabled infrastructure of Microsoft Azure Stack HCI to gain centralized management, flexibility, and faster time to market.

title: Expanding MSC's capabilities with SQL Server 2022
executive_summary: MSC Mediterranean Shipping Company SA is the largest global container ship operator in the world. To manage 730 vessels across 260+ routes calling at 520 ports they rely on solid IT services including SQL Server. With SQL Server 2022, they are expanding their capabilities around availability, performance and security to better support a truly worldwide operation.

title: Kodak Alaris enhances ERP resilience with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As part of a brand that’s more than 130 years old and synonymous with imaging, Kodak Alaris combines the latest innovations in imaging science, artificial intelligence, and advanced process automation to help deliver digital transformation and smart business solutions to customers around the world. Their advanced, patented intellectual property combines breakthrough technologies and human know-how to unlock the power of images and information. They enable businesses to run faster and governments to run smarter by turning data into powerful, actionable insights, and they provide consumers with innovative solutions to preserve and enjoy their most cherished memories.

title: BPW Aftermarket Group drives enterprise standardization with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The BPW Aftermarket Group (BPW AMG) is the commercial vehicle (CV) spare parts network of the BPW Group. More than 1,500 employees at 170 branches throughout Europe ensure the reliable and fast supply of spare parts for trucks and trailers across the continent. BPW AMG supports CV shops and vehicle operators to repair and maintain vehicles quickly, safely, and efficiently, and at the same time in keeping with their values. In other words, BPW ensures that shops have the right number of the right spare parts for the right vehicles at the right time.

title: New York City Department of Education rises to the challenge with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: New York City was an early epicenter of the pandemic, which had a profound impact on its 1.2 million-plus school students. Schools were closed for in-person learning in the spring of 2020, re-opened, then closed again in November 2020. When the New York City Department of Education needed to quickly ramp up their remote-learning capabilities, they built a cloud-based platform on Azure Synapse Analytics and achieved high performance, easier management, and enterprise-grade security.

title: ISV Success program helps Akouo bring to market a simultaneous interpretation solution for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Founded in 2021 and based in the United Kingdom, Akouo’s solution provides universal and simultaneous multilingual interpretation for meetings directly within Microsoft Teams. Users simply add Akouo to their Teams meeting and participants select their preferred language. By tapping into the resources of the ISV Success program, Akouo has moved from development in October of 2021 to a transaction-ready solution that will soon be published on the commercial marketplace.

title: ABN AMRO meets customers anywhere for financial advice with Microsoft Teams and Azure Communication Services
executive_summary: When ABN AMRO set out to create one of the best video banking experiences in the industry, the goal was always to put customers first. “We have a strategy to be a personal bank in the digital age,” says Joeri Hartmans, Senior Product Owner of Video Banking and Interactive Voice Response at ABN AMRO. A key part of that vision is making video banking as simple, seamless, and secure as possible. “We want to make sure that customers can have digital advice wherever and whenever they want,” he says.

title: Steward Health Care protects patient data in an evolving cyber pandemic through Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Steward Health Care approaches the challenges of protecting its dispersed IT landscape with the same dedication that its clinicians apply to patient well-being. Noting the evolving threat landscape, the company evaluated security solution providers and cybersecurity partners. It allied with BlueVoyant and chose a comprehensive Microsoft security environment to cover its full range of security needs. The “better together” ecosystem of BlueVoyant and Microsoft enhanced its ability to adapt to the cyber pandemic—the surge in malicious attacks during the COVID-19 pandemic. The partnership succeeded, elevating security and bringing peace of mind to its security teams.

title: Sigma Loyalty Group transforms business through future-proof infrastructure
executive_summary: Sigma Loyalty Group provides enhancement services and solutions across industries. As a provider of identity and information protection services, Sigma’s business has been in high demand and on a growth trajectory, but its inability to seamlessly scale and cost-effectively maintain its infrastructure and ecosystem slowed them down. Sigma needed to modernize its services, from on-premises servers to the cloud and from traditional applications to web apps. Azure-fueled digital transformation helped Sigma Group increase availability, improve infrastructure security and improve overall business performance.

title: CHPK builds its dream hybrid cloud solution with Azure Stack HCI and Windows Server
executive_summary: If you own, build, or occupy property, CHPK Property and Construction Consultants is ready and equipped to help. The UK-based property and construction consultancy offers an innovative approach to multidisciplinary services such as building surveying, fire engineering, project management, and contract administration with the goal of improving the industry and protecting those within it. Using Microsoft Azure and hybrid cloud solutions like Azure Stack HCI and Azure Arc, CHPK is realizing its vision for the future and transforming into a confident, resilient, and cost-effective business, enabling employees to continue putting clients first.

title: AHW implements multiple Microsoft products while experiencing substantial net savings
executive_summary: AHW wanted to enhance its quality service to the farming, lawn, and garden industries with a company-wide digital transformation. The company aimed to better serve its customers by improving its internal procedures and securing its network. However, with a small IT team, updating its communication, security, and automation technology seemed like a daunting task. Thankfully, the company’s familiarity with its existing Microsoft 365 license facilitated an easy transition to Microsoft 365 E5, an inclusive license consisting of Microsoft Teams Phone and advanced security and compliance capabilities. It also implemented Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft Power Platform, helping the company to earn substantial net savings while improving customer-employee relations.

title: Natuzzi uses Dynamics 365 to redefine the luxury furniture experience with a data-first approach
executive_summary: For more than 60 years, the Natuzzi name has been known for not just quality furniture, but beauty, craftsmanship, and comfort capable of enveloping the senses. The Natuzzi Group has grown from a manufacturer of sofas and armchairs to a globally hailed creator of exceptional luxury furniture that delivers a harmonious combination of design, function, aesthetics, and ethics.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power BI

title: University of Bath researchers test theories and release findings faster than before with Azure HPC
executive_summary: The University of Bath wanted to upgrade its infrastructure to be able to provide access to the latest technology, including the newest types of virtual machines as they’re released. It now uses Microsoft Azure high-performance computing to empower its academic community to produce cutting-edge research and enhance course curricula at a faster pace than previously possible. It addresses its storage, monitoring, and management needs with a suite of Azure services, helping its researchers, teachers, and students benefit from new efficiencies, reduced response time for faster research results, and more opportunities to collaborate with the greater academic community.

title: Xcel Energy adopts Microsoft Power Platform and empowers citizen developers to deliver $600,000 of value through app and workflow creation
executive_summary: Xcel Energy, an electric and natural gas delivery company serving millions of customers, has empowered its community of developers to design real-world solutions for daily tasks with Microsoft Power Platform. Xcel Energy has advanced clean power for more than 15 years, and it needed a software solution that would automate routine tasks. By making Power Apps readily accessible to employees through Microsoft 365, the company invited its teams to develop their own apps to meet business needs. Its employees have expanded their skills in monthly work groups and semiannual hackathons, and they’re now developing innovative solutions that have established the company as a technology leader in the energy sector.

title: SGS rides the headwinds of green energy with Azure IoT solution that optimizes wind turbine capacity
executive_summary: SGS, a leading global testing, inspection, and certification (TIC) company, has created a competitive advantage for itself in the burgeoning green energy market in China. Combining its expertise in TIC with Microsoft Azure cloud services, SGS developed an intelligent device for wind turbines that uses Azure IoT Edge and IoT Hub to deliver continual, real-time oil condition data for wind farm operators. With OCM-Online®, SGS customers gain predictive analysis of their expensive assets’ condition, reducing the risk of unplanned downtime and costly interruptions to wind energy generation. And SGS has a new, extensible service offered on a subscription basis to boost cash flow that’s applicable to other industries with similar application scenarios. With OCM-Online®, green energy development is part of the winds of change at SGS.

title: ABN AMRO meets customers anywhere for financial advice with Microsoft Teams and Azure Communication Services
executive_summary: When ABN AMRO set out to create one of the best video banking experiences in the industry, the goal was always to put customers first. “We have a strategy to be a personal bank in the digital age,” says Joeri Hartmans, Senior Product Owner of Video Banking and Interactive Voice Response at ABN AMRO. A key part of that vision is making video banking as simple, seamless, and secure as possible. “We want to make sure that customers can have digital advice wherever and whenever they want,” he says.

title: Lallemand ferments its digital evolution with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The act of fermentation is fundamentally about change. Microorganisms break down carbohydrates, producing a wide range of metabolites, such as enzymes or ethanol, that are crucial in the production of bread, wine, yogurt, pharmaceuticals, and biofuels. Family-owned since its founding, Montreal-based Lallemand has used this imperceptible process to become a global leader in yeast and bacteria production with 11 business units spanning 5 continents.

title: NewDay reinvents its business model with new platform based on Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: NewDay revolutionized the credit industry in the UK by being an inclusive and responsible lender. NewDay realized that the financial marketplace had an appetite for technology that could power brands to directly engage with customers to provide credit. Enabled by Azure Cosmos DB and other Azure services, NewDay is providing tools and technology to support other companies’ building payment services and credit solutions.

title: Insight Enterprises champions BCDR, cuts management time in half with Azure Business Continuity Center
executive_summary: Insight Enterprises helps businesses manage and protect their increasingly complex IT ecosystems. To continue unlocking new customer and work experiences, the company was eager to try innovations related to business continuity and disaster recovery.

title: Eurowag achieves instant access to actionable data with Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: With a vision to streamline the road transportation industry, Eurowag, a leading force in the sector for more than 25 years across Europe, found its challenge in data centralization. The company’s existing on-premises solution was no longer adequate to meet its needs for more growth and business acquisitions. It looked for an agile, scalable product, which the company found in Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics. The solution delivered in real-time analytics, giving Eurowag faster, more reliable access to crucial data, enabling proactive decision-making and a shift in perspectives.

title: Hilti empowers its diverse workforce with Workday for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Hilti is a world leader in the design and manufacture of cutting-edge technologies, hardware, software, and services for the professional construction industry. With 32,000 employees in more than 120 countries, Hilti serves roughly 280,000 customer contacts each day developing products and solutions that drive productivity, safety, and sustainability in construction. With a diverse workforce spanning office-based, field-based, and operation environments, Hilti needed a solution to provide employees with a more simplified, flexible way to complete key tasks—no matter their location. Through the successful adoption of Workday for Microsoft Teams, employees can now quickly and easily request time off, share feedback, and check in and out without ever having to leave Teams. Not only does this save employees time, increase engagement, and improve productivity, but it also enables them to focus on their purpose of making construction better while delivering a better customer experience.
