executive_summary: NewDay revolutionized the credit industry in the UK by being an inclusive and responsible lender. NewDay realized that the financial marketplace had an appetite for technology that could power brands to directly engage with customers to provide credit. Enabled by Azure Cosmos DB and other Azure services, NewDay is providing tools and technology to support other companies’ building payment services and credit solutions.

title: Insight Enterprises champions BCDR, cuts management time in half with Azure Business Continuity Center
executive_summary: Insight Enterprises helps businesses manage and protect their increasingly complex IT ecosystems. To continue unlocking new customer and work experiences, the company was eager to try innovations related to business continuity and disaster recovery.

title: Genus PLC builds a best-of-breed business solution with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Genus PLC (LON:GNS) is a world-leading animal genetics company. It uses leading-edge research techniques, innovative technology, and world-class support services to help farmers around the world produce meat and milk more efficiently and sustainably. This work enables customers to enhance their commercial success while increasing the world’s supply of safe, affordable, and high-quality animal protein. Genus serves more than 50,000 customers in more than 75 countries, primarily through Genus ABS (focusing on dairy and beef cattle) and Genus PIC (focusing on pigs). The company employs more than 3,500 people around the world.

title: Centrica creates data platform with Azure HDInsight and Power BI
executive_summary: Centrica, an international energy services and solutions company, serves millions of UK and Ireland consumers and businesses with the supply of electricity and gas, services, and solutions through leading energy brands, including British Gas and Bord Gáis. Headquartered in Windsor, Berkshire, Centrica transitioned from an on-premises Hadoop data platform to Azure PaaS as part of their data modernization strategy. During this transformation, they established a new data platform with the aims of consolidating data, fostering scalability, and driving cost-efficiency. This platform not only promotes collaboration and streamlined data access for the development of data products, but also significantly contributes to lowering operational costs, reducing the overall TCO and improving performance and scalability. As a result, data processing and analysis accelerated, transforming time-intensive tasks into immediately available assets.

title: Kyndryl transforms hundreds of legacy solutions by deploying SAP S/4HANA on Azure
executive_summary: After its 2021 spin-off from IBM, Kyndryl inherited technology, infrastructure, and employee work environments that weren’t fit for purpose. To reduce complexity during the removal of its legacy technologies, the company implemented a greenfield SAP S/4HANA-based platform on Microsoft Azure. The solution simplified processes across the company and consolidated 375 legacy tools into one SAP ecosystem. Kyndryl completed the migration in 18 months and now plans to help customers complete similar digital transformation initiatives.

title: BBK moves from past to future, reshaping its home décor retail business with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Polish company BBK S.A. helps to create elegant, functional interiors through its selection of home décor and textile products under the home&you and Essex brands. Due to new strategic directions and digital disruptions, BBK prioritized investments in modern technologies, focusing on cloud-based solutions. One of the first choices made was Microsoft Dynamics 365. The move streamlined operations across 130+ stores and ensured business continuity for BBK. The result: a company set towards a culture where innovation thrives and every member contributes to BBK’s success.

title: Cancer Council NSW fights cancer securely with Intune and Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
executive_summary: To better meet the needs of Australians fighting cancer and to prevent disease in the future, Cancer Council NSW upgraded its technology. The organization worked with Microsoft partner cubesys to strengthen its security posture and better manage employee devices. Now, Cancer Council NSW has the confidence its teams can better support people in the field securely.

title: RSM UK ignites innovation with Power Platform to support its people and clients
executive_summary: The professional services industry is transforming and RSM wants to lead this transformation, positioning itself as a “digital first” organisation. They chose Microsoft Power Platform to drive business-led innovation through the use of low-code tools including Power Apps, Power BI, and Power Automate. They are enjoying internal process efficiencies, developing digital skills, attracting the best talent, meeting and exceeding changing client expectations and winning new business.

title: DMK reduces IT administrative effort by 50% and optimizes operations with ITProCloud Hydra for Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: With an annual turnover of 5.5 billion Euros, DMK Deutsches Milchkontor GmbH (DMK) is a leading player in the dairy industry and one of the largest suppliers to German food retailers. DMK wanted a comprehensive solution for managing Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop to allow the company to focus on its core business of processing milk products of the highest quality. DMK chose ITProCloud GmbH, a Microsoft partner with expertise in building and deploying solutions on Microsoft Azure such as ITProCloud’s Hydra management software for Azure Virtual Desktop. By deploying Hydra, DMK significantly reduced administrative efforts by 50 percent and Azure costs by 20 percent.

title: NewDay reinvents its business model with new platform based on Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: NewDay revolutionized the credit industry in the UK by being an inclusive and responsible lender. NewDay realized that the financial marketplace had an appetite for technology that could power brands to directly engage with customers to provide credit. Enabled by Azure Cosmos DB and other Azure services, NewDay is providing tools and technology to support other companies’ building payment services and credit solutions.

title: Grupo Olarena project with Dynamics 365 stands out among the top 100 in Mexico in 2022
executive_summary: With the implementation of Microsoft's ERP, the Mexican hospitality company Grupo Olarena was able to automate task flows, integrate with suppliers, and improve its financial, accounting, and treasury operations. In addition, its ongoing commitment to innovation and optimization enabled it to simplify back-office management processes, increase accuracy, agility, and speed of information gathering. It also improved the results of various operations.

title: Setagaya City’s agile DX promotion: Restructuring administrative services with Support for Mission Critical
executive_summary: Tokyo's Setagaya City is the most populous of Tokyo's 23 wards (approximately 918,000*) and the second largest (approximately 58㎢*). The city is blessed with a good access to the city center via multiple train lines, and while there are bustling commercial areas such as Shimokitazawa and Futakotamagawa, there are also many quiet residential areas, green spaces, and parks. (*As of January 2024)

title: SHI elevates the employee and customer experience with a fast, smooth Windows 11 Pro deployment
executive_summary: SHI, the global technology solutions provider, deployed Windows 11 Pro for its entire workforce of 6,100 within three months, thereby readying its technology environment for more productive and rewarding user experiences. The company hopes to help its customers achieve the same success and is in the process of completing other, extremely efficient Windows 11 Pro migrations. AI will be key in SHI’s technology portfolio as it assists customers transform for the future on a Windows foundation.

title: Godrej Consumer Products harnesses digital transformation with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Godrej Consumer Products Limited is a leading Indian multinational operating in personal and home care segments. It is part of over 125-year-old Godrej Group and has a legacy built on the values of trust, integrity, and respect. Godrej Consumer Products is a fast-growing, ambitious enterprise that is expanding its presence in emerging markets of Asia, Africa, and Latin America and bringing the goodness of health and beauty to consumers in these markets.

title: Xome increases productivity by 20% with migration to the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Online real estate marketplace Xome modernized its operations by consolidating multiple datacenters and cloud providers into one streamlined cloud solution with Microsoft Azure. Maintaining various physical datacenters was limiting the company’s potential to grow, so Xome decided to modernize by migrating to the cloud. After considering several cloud providers, the company chose Azure for its scalability and AI capabilities. By combining all its datacenters onto a single cloud platform, Xome cut costs, enhanced security, and saved the IT team’s time.

title: BNY Mellon transforms data storage, resiliency, and scalability with Azure Database for PostgreSQL
executive_summary: Global financial services company BNY Mellon houses and manages critical data for its clients and wanted to incorporate flexibility and resiliency into one of its self-managed databases. The company sought a solution built around tailored microservices to support its cloud-native data management offering. BNY Mellon turned to Microsoft Azure, and within nine months, it migrated to Azure Database for PostgreSQL and created a cohesive, customized solution. The company’s simplified data storage and analytics capability enhances how it helps clients turn data into meaningful insights. The transition has also given BNY Mellon employees more time to focus on innovation as the company seeks new ways to serve clients with technology.

title: Nationwide Building Society achieves 27% savings in total cost of ownership with Windows 365
executive_summary: Nationwide Building Society’s 18 million United Kingdom members share ownership and profit in the world’s largest building society. The organization has long invested in personalized service to its member community, providing home ownership and savings opportunities. To address growing business operations and continue to effectively serve its membership, Nationwide faced a critical need to replace its aging on-premises virtual desktop infrastructure platform. Because scaling out its datacenter was a large capital expense, it turned to Windows 365 as a better alternative. By using Windows 365 Cloud PCs to support offshore teams, the organization delivered innovation faster and more securely. With the rapid deployment capabilities, operational efficiencies, and simplified support of Windows 365, Nationwide achieved a 27% savings in total cost of ownership.

title: Rotterdam transport agency modernizes passenger payments with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The Netherlands’ national government set a target for the country’s transport companies to hit by 2025: the full implementation of a common solution for customers throughout the country to travel paying with their bankcard, credit card, or mobile phone. RET, Rotterdam’s public transport agency, joined forces with GVB, Amsterdam’s public transport company, to build cloud-based applications running on OVpay, its Microsoft Azure application. The OVpay application enables customers to use their own bankcard to pay fares directly.

title: Repower accelerates innovation at its e-mobility brand, PLUG’N ROLL, with Dynamics 365, saving time and costs.
executive_summary: N/A

title: Almere's modern workplace delivers employee satisfaction, projects savings of $73,000 with Microsoft Surface Pro
executive_summary: The Municipality of Almere in the Netherlands is the country’s newest city, built on land reclaimed from the North Sea. It sought to create a modern workplace for its employees. Employees were dissatisfied with their laptops and outdated workstation configurations—and had expressed a measure of low satisfaction in their employer.

title: Bahrain’s Information & eGovernment Authority sets example of future-facing business continuity with Microsoft 365 and Azure
executive_summary: The Kingdom of Bahrain’s Information & eGovernment Authority (iGA) is on a mission to redefine public service. From struggling with on-premises infrastructure to achieving nearly 100% information availability with Azure Backup, the authority has been leading transformation in the Gulf region. iGA’s Cloud First policy and adoption of cloud solutions—the first in the Middle East—streamlined operations and saved thousands of work hours, setting a new standard in digital transformation.

title: Qatar Social Work enhances social services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Qatar Social Work (QSW) has changed the way it serves the Qatari community by embracing digital transformation. Through Azure, Microsoft 365, and Dynamics 365, QSW has brought its eight specialized centers together, streamlining operations and cutting down on costs. Using advanced cloud services and productivity tools, QSW also fortified its security posture, ensuring the protection of critical personal data. This digital leap, crucial during the COVID-19 pandemic, has enabled seamless remote work and collaborative innovation, marking a new era in delivering social services.

title: Head Start Homes expands affordable homeownership with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Head Start Homes addresses Australia’s housing crisis by helping families with a limited income save for, find, and buy a home. The number of people eligible for its services exceeds their capacity, so Head Start Homes utilizes AI to grow.

title: Accenture boosts SAP HANA agility and performance by migrating to Azure
executive_summary: Accenture is in the midst of an ambitious digital transformation journey that culminated in the migration of its 7-terabyte SAP Business Warehouse (BW) on HANA estate to Microsoft Azure. By running one of its most business-critical applications in Azure, Accenture can deliver HANA environments five weeks faster, improve SAP BW performance by up to 70 percent, and reduce costs. After its rapid migration, Accenture now has a cloud migration playbook to use to help clients do the same and gain similar benefits.

title: Portuguese bank accelerates cloud adoption and digital transformation
executive_summary: Caixa Económica Montepio Geral (CEMG) has provided banking and other financial services throughout Portugal since 1844. To collaborate more easily across 323 branch locations and more than a dozen central offices, the bank decided to move its business process to Microsoft Office 365. To speed this change, the bank teamed with Microsoft Adoption Services and crafted an implementation strategy that turned employees from reluctant users into advocates for digital transformation. In addition to accelerating the adoption of new technologies and business processes, the bank expects to become more competitive by providing better and more seamless service across all locations.

title: BCP reveals its best version with Microsoft Teams Rooms
executive_summary: BCP was looking to adapt its operations to a hybrid work environment.

title: Outcome-based healthcare: AiR Healthcare uses cloud-based health management solution to expand new care model
executive_summary: AiR Healthcare Solutions (AiR Healthcare) wanted to shift the treatment of people with acute behavioral disorders in times of crisis to a value-based model that promotes ongoing communication and accountability for results. To that end, the organization launched the AiRCare disease management service, based on Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Dynamics 365. AiR Healthcare now offers personalized care and clinical insights on a scale that can significantly impact behavioral health, as well as help patients and healthcare providers avoid crises and improve outcomes.

title: From coding to data analysis, Access Holdings Plc. brings speed to its operations with Copilot
executive_summary: Access Holdings Plc. is a leading multinational financial services group serving over 56 million customers with services like commercial banking, lending, payments, insurance, and asset management. To address challenges in data management, meeting productivity, and app or software development, the company adopted Copilot for Microsoft 365. With generative AI capabilities integrated into daily tools, staff are more engaged in meetings and can analyze data faster. Writing code now takes two hours instead of eight, chatbots can be launched in 10 days instead of three months, and presentations can be prepared in 45 minutes instead of six hours.

title: From imagination to reality: Oodles Smart redefines home experience with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Grove City College increases student engagement and advances digital unity with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: Grove City College, a private liberal arts college that provides laptops to each student, sought to replace its aging hardware with powerful, flexible devices that would meet the needs of its diverse student body.

title: elunic democratizes AI for industry with shopfloorGPT, an autonomous problem solver based on Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: elunic supports its customers in digitizing for Industry 4.0. The shopfloor.io platform is used for data collection and evaluation as well as for networking.

title: Carlsberg Group increases cloud efficiency with FinOps and Azure solutions
executive_summary: Carlsberg migrated its IT infrastructure to the Azure cloud in 2018 very quickly, to minimize any system downtime that would affect production. It began its FinOps journey to gain visibility into costs and to right size resources.

title: Thai social foundation transforms by helping people with disabilities find employment
executive_summary: Founded in Bangkok in 2012, Thailand-based Social Innovation Foundation (SIF) provides job matching for people with disabilities (PWD). By implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Office 365, SIF overcame the challenges of voluminous paperwork, geographic distances, and time-consuming analog communication to carry out its 2020 mission―finding jobs for 10,000 PWDs accumulatively―transforming itself into a modern organization. SIF seeks to enhance the quality of life of PWDs by establishing a one-stop job matching center for PWD social workers and employers; the organization’s goal is to empower PWDs and help them find gainful employment. “We provide the necessary assistance, coordination, and infrastructure so PWDs can access job opportunities,” explains Apichart Karoonkornsakul, President of SIF. “Matching the right competencies with organizations’ requirements can be difficult.”

title: Blazing a new trail in financial services
executive_summary: A comprehensive ‘all in’ approach to cloud migration has paid dividends for innovative financial services business, Mattioli Woods.

title: Microsoft and Delta launch cloud solution sales program with Azure and IoT
executive_summary: Following the launch of a global strategy alliance with Microsoft, Delta Electronics is one of the first companies in the industry to quickly achieve four gold-level expertise certifications for Microsoft's Global Partner Ecosystem in six months—Application Development, Cloud Platform, Data Analytics, and DevOps—and become a Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider.

title: CBRE delivers better workplace experiences through Host, a comprehensive, scalable product suite, using Azure Digital Twins
executive_summary: As a global leader in commercial real estate services and investment, CBRE is focused on providing advantage to its customers. CBRE Host combines concierge services with a connected workplace experience platform that offers smart room scheduling, wayfinding, and other tools to remove friction from employees’ workdays. Meanwhile, facility managers deliver more timely maintenance, and investors gain insight into property utilization. And by using Microsoft Azure Digital Twins and Internet of Things (IoT) resources, CBRE accelerates the digitization of physical spaces and delivers relevant insights while securely managing IoT devices.

title: Leading Ukrainian real estate development firm delights customers through technology
executive_summary: While many companies in the real estate development sector struggle to digitally transform themselves, RIEL is thriving. This successful Ukrainian real estate development company boosts team productivity and customer satisfaction by embracing modern project management and collaboration tools, including Microsoft Office 365 and Microsoft Project Online.

title: C.H. Robinson improves visibility into customer needs with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: C.H. Robinson solves logistics problems for companies across the globe and across industries, from the simple to the most complex. To best serve its customers, C.H. Robinson requires a 360-degree view of each one, with deep visibility into their needs, so that it can offer optimal solutions. C.H. Robinson adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Microsoft Power Platform to deliver personalized customer engagement and gain the contextual insights necessary to meet a broader range of customer requirements. Deployed to 2,700 employees in 180 days, the company’s solution paid for itself in just 11 months.

title: Walgreens Boots Alliance moves a mountain of SAP assets to Azure in a key modernization move
executive_summary: With stores in every state and around the world, Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) is a giant in retail. It’s also the friendly neighborhood pharmacy on the frontlines of the pandemic response, dispensing lifesaving aid to 8 million people each day in stores and online. Even before its designation as an essential services provider, the company knew that it needed more flexibility across its global supply chain to serve its customers better and faster. A key step in the company’s digital transformation occurred when its massive SAP landscape—an estimated 100 terabytes (TB)—was migrated to Azure. It was the biggest SAP S/4HANA scale-out deployment on Azure to date.

title: UNICEF and Microsoft scale Azure-based platform Primero to empower social workers and help more children
executive_summary: UNICEF works in more than 190 countries and territories to save children’s lives, defend their rights, and help them fulfill their potential. Faced with an ever-evolving global child protection landscape and ever-increasing child protection needs, the organization wanted to expand the adoption of Primero—its case management tool. The new Primero X is now a digital, open-source case management tool that delivers a streamlined Azure-based platform as a progressive web application and software as a service (SaaS). Built with leading edge security features, Primero X helps improve data collection, allows case workers to be truly mobile and advances best practices for child protection services.

title: Coca-Cola UNITED manages rapid growth with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Coca-Cola UNITED is one of the largest bottlers and distributors of Coca-Cola products in the United States. It has also been one of the fastest growing. While the company has been around for almost 120 years, most of its growth has occurred within the span of just four years. Microsoft Power Platform has turned out to be a key tool in helping Coca-Cola UNITED navigate this amazing growth. Here’s its story.

title: Coca-Cola Beverages Africa streamlines its operations with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: With more than 40 bottling plants and serving over 650,000 retail outlets on the continent, Coca-Cola Beverages Africa (CCBA) is the number one Coca-Cola bottler in Africa and the eighth largest globally by revenue. In the wake of major consolidation, which established its operations in 2016, the bottling giant needed seamless digital systems that enabled the business to operate as one. With Microsoft, namely Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365, and Azure, CCBA achieved that goal, reducing its IT costs from 2.85 percent of net sales revenue to just below 1.4 percent of net sales revenue, while enhancing its customer and staff experience in the process.

title: LA Unified rallies partners to build COVID-19 tracking app and accelerate getting kids back to school
executive_summary: In March 2020, Los Angeles Unified School District (LAUSD) closed all of its schools in response to the spread of COVID-19. Along with its partners, LAUSD developed a plan called “Safe Steps to Safe Schools.” The plan uses a Daily Pass app, developed by Microsoft with significant input from LAUSD, to help coordinate and monitor testing for staff, students, and their families. Access to real-time data and analytics helps LAUSD make intelligent, informed decisions not only about keeping individual students home if they’re sick but also about handling more complex scenarios.

title: Finnish Tax Administration builds citizens’ trust with a more secure cloud platform
executive_summary: The Finnish Tax Administration is a global leader in digital taxation, annually processing confidential data from 5.5 million citizens and 300,000 businesses. Security plays a fundamental role for the organization, so it is using Microsoft 365 E5 and Microsoft Cloud App Security to strengthen its cyber resilience, speed-up triage time, and better manage its risks.

title: Poland’s Jagiellonian University Medical College brings the Microsoft HoloLens 2 into the classroom
executive_summary: The Jagiellonian University Medical College in Kraków is part of the Jagiellonian University, one of Europe’s oldest academic institutions. Preserving a centuries-old legacy of research excellence, the university harnesses cutting-edge technology to enhance the education of future doctors. Recently, it acquired Microsoft HoloLens 2 mixed reality headsets to use in the classroom. Combining mixed reality capabilities with apoQlar’s holomedicine technology, the university is poised to teach students modern medical imagery and 3D object processing—bringing aspiring doctors up to speed with the tools and solutions they will be using in their day-to-day work.

title: Dynamics solutions bring resilience for an international law firm
executive_summary: Fieldfisher is an international law firm headquartered in London. With 22 offices in eleven countries, it focuses on four key sectors: energy and natural resources, financial markets, technology and life sciences.

title: Towards a fair, healthy, inclusive and sustainable city
executive_summary: Bristol City Council serves the population of the eighth-largest city in England, totalling more than 400,000 people. Social care plays a huge role in Bristol City Council’s plans and ability to fulfil its objective to ensure Bristol is a fair, healthy, inclusive and sustainable city in which to live.

title: Maersk Drilling uses Microsoft Project to streamline complex technical project management
executive_summary: Operating drilling rigs around the world, Maersk Drilling focuses on running them in the safest and most sustainable way possible. The company’s engineering department supports efficient operations by relying on project management software to track and evaluate project progress and deliverables. Maersk Drilling is moving from multiple solutions to Microsoft Project to boost efficiency, establish more modern ways of working, and deliver a common baseline for individual projects. It’s using Project together with Microsoft Teams and Power BI to extend information transparency and promote collaboration.

title: Advancing women in tech with Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
executive_summary: The University of Bath is a leading British research university in the south-west of England, established by Royal Charter in 1966. Ranked by Times Higher Education as one of the top 250 research-intensive global universities, students come from every corner of the globe to study at Bath.

title: Nestlé innove dans ses stratégies de croissance grâce à Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Founded in Lausanne, Switzerland, in 1866, as the Anglo-Swiss Condensed Milk Company, today Nestlé is the world’s largest consumer packaged goods and retail multinational, employing more than 275,000 people. From originally providing milk and infant food products, the company now has more than 2,000 brands in 188 countries. Nestlé products include frozen and prepared foods, beverages, sweets, supplements, and pet foods.

title: Siemens readies for the future, takes a Zero Trust strategy supported by Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: When one of the world’s largest companies maps out a future-ready security plan, it needs a scalable, flexible solution to fit its complex environment. Multinational conglomerate Siemens is a perfect example. Even as it contended with the complexity of multiple non-standard systems typical of a company that continually acquires other entities, it aspired to an elevated security posture built on Zero Trust principles. It found what it needed with Microsoft Security solutions.

title: Prosegur boosts security, eases management of servers at scale with Azure Arc
executive_summary: As a security company, Prosegur needs to ensure that its own infrastructure is highly secure so it can keep delivering reliable, leading-edge services to its customers. As the Spanish company grew rapidly and expanded globally, it turned to Microsoft Azure Arc and other security solutions to easily manage its hybrid, multicloud environment. Prosegur has already added 700 servers and plans to move a total of 5,000 servers. The company now has a single place to monitor and manage its infrastructure, which minimizes disparate tools, saves employees time, and decreases costs.
products: Azure, Forms, Planner, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Teams Phone, Outlook

title: Windows Pro-powered Acer laptops enable Kent RO Systems to drive productivity and business continuity amidst hybrid normal
executive_summary: KENT RO Systems is India’s largest and most trusted water purifier brand.  As India’s leader in water purification technologies, KENT has over 50 million customers.  Our ability to transform lab research into innovative products makes KENT the most trusted water purifier brand in India.

title: Avianca’s cloud journey takes wing with Microsoft Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Well-known South American airline Avianca enjoys a reputation built on more than a century of superb service, safety, and punctuality in the travel industry. Much of the company’s success rests on its capacity not only for meeting the regulatory demands and unpredictability of the air travel market, but for continual innovation. As it pursues its cloud migration, Avianca gracefully aligns older systems with newer technology that it depends on to continue to deliver excellence as a carrier. It simplifies that lift with Microsoft Azure VMware Solution.

title: InMobi optimizes operations and expands opportunities with Azure Kubernetes Service
executive_summary: InMobi is a leading provider of marketing and monetization technologies. With deep expertise and unique reach in mobile, it is a trusted and transparent technology partner for marketers, content creators and businesses of all kinds. InMobi’s mission is to power its customers’ growth by helping them engage their audiences and build meaningful connections. Its affiliated businesses – Glance, an unconsolidated subsidiary that offers a lock screen-based content discovery platform and video platform Roposo – help InMobi create new content and commerce experiences in a world of connected devices. InMobi is headquartered in Singapore, maintains a large presence in San Francisco and Bangalore and has operations in New York, Chicago, Kansas City, Los Angeles, Delhi, Mumbai, Beijing, Shanghai, Jakarta, Manila, Kuala Lumpur, Sydney, Melbourne, Seoul, Tokyo, London and Dubai.
products: Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Cosmos DB, SQL Server

title: Personalized experiences drive admissions at the University of Salford
executive_summary: With a history stretching back to the industrial revolution, the University of Salford is built on a foundation of technology and research. Originally created to help educate and train a rapidly modernizing workforce, Salford maintains a student-centered focus in the digital age, staying at the forefront of innovation with an emphasis on advanced technologies and robotics. While the university prides itself as a global institution with over 23,000 students from all around the world, reliance on a patchwork of legacy solutions hindered its ability to attract top global talent. To streamline the applicant journey, the University of Salford modernized their admissions and operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the Power Platform to support better, faster student engagement.

title: Cautious CIO turns evangelist after a successful migration to end to end Microsoft Security Solution
executive_summary: E-commerce presents a valuable target for cybercriminals, and global e-commerce company QNET recognized the need to adopt a more efficient and secure IT infrastructure. The company migrated on-premises infrastructure to Azure, and replaced its patchwork of security products and services with an end-to-end strategy built on Microsoft Security products and services. The team now has greater confidence from more complete and in-depth visibility into a previously opaque environment. A once-skeptical CIO recognizes increased productivity and transparency from a safer, more productive IT infrastructure and a boosted return on IT investments.

title: Motionlab creates personalized videos on Azure to engage shoppers and increase brand loyalty
executive_summary: Motionlab is a tech company based in the Czech Republic that also has a presence in the Western Europe, Middle East and East Asia. With a platform developed on the Azure cloud, the company enables brands and agencies to create personalized marketing videos. The platform offered Motionlab the scalability and data security it needed to service its clients well. The video creation platform is easily integrated with tools for emailing, messaging, as well as CRMs, allowing clients to craft videos based on real customer information and seamlessly deliver these to emails, mobiles, apps, etc. The results have led to high conversion rates and increased brand loyalty for its clients.

title: Consumer Direct Care Network transforms medical claims with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Consumer Direct Care Network (CDCN) engaged Microsoft Consulting Services to rewrite CDCN’s existing Claim Processing System and move the system to the cloud. This was urgently necessary for CDCN to keep up with its exponentially increasing user base and support the increasing volume of transactions and people it serves. Turning to Microsoft Azure capabilities of scalability and flexibility, CDCN transformed its claims platform, which allowed it to expand annual claims processing capacity from 3 million items to over 20 million items—with optimized cost and performance.

title: Jotun modernizes key business apps to run on Azure
executive_summary: The Jotun Group is a global supplier of decorative paints and marine, protective, and powder coatings. As part of its strategy to migrate on-premises applications to the cloud, the company recently modernized nine key business apps to run in a platform as a service environment on Microsoft Azure. Jotun completed the project in less than a year with help from the Azure Migration and Modernization Program and development partner Infosys—from project kickoff and landing zone build-out through modernization and deployment of all nine apps. Today, those apps perform better, experience less downtime, and cost less to operate. Software releases have accelerated from two to three per year to every two to three weeks, and a single team now owns each application end to end—with deeper insights and new tools for optimizing application performance, security, and costs.

title: Vietnamese financial giant SSI improves user experience with a modern workplace for employees
executive_summary: SSI Securities Corporation is one of Vietnam’s largest consumer brokerage firms, seeing themselves as working in “the business of success”. The company is committed to unlocking opportunities in the financial market for its wide client pool. When the COVID-19 pandemic disrupted day-to-day work, SSI embarked on a company-wide digital transformation. Using a combination of tools including Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365, and Azure, the firm turned the challenge into an opportunity, increasing sales and enhancing the customer experience. Its large employee network spread across multiple cities successfully transitioned to remote work.

title: Visionary Wealth Advisors helps safeguard mobile communications with Microsoft Purview Data Lifecycle Management and CellTrust SL2
executive_summary: Security and compliance are top priorities for financial services companies handling billions of dollars in customer assets. When the financial planning firm Visionary Wealth Advisors needed to balance compliance supervision with innovative ways to meet customer needs through mobile text messaging and other digital communication, it adopted the CellTrust SL2 communication platform on Microsoft Azure with Microsoft 365 E5 and Microsoft Purview Data Lifecycle Management for maximum security and compliance. Now, the firm can respond to clients at a moment’s notice.

title: Equinor targets data efficiency and a low-carbon future with Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Energy
executive_summary: Global energy firm Equinor is committed to a sustainable, low-carbon future, and the company realizes that effective use of data is essential to achieving its goals. To break down corporate data siloes and provide employees with all the information they need to make effective decisions, Equinor chose to implement Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Energy aligned with the energy industry’s OSDU™ Technical Standard. Equinor is already realizing efficiencies in data collection and storage that can help streamline operations to extract hydrocarbons more efficiently and pave the way for increased investment in renewable energy.

title: Digitalization of heat exchangers reduces the world's carbon emissions
executive_summary: The world’s energy demand will double by the year 2050. That is why we must make the most of the energy we already produce. The partnership with Microsoft enables Alfa Laval to optimize the energy efficiency in their customers' processes.

title: Reviving the Country’s Tourism Sector Through Digital Workplace Transformation with Tourism Malaysia
executive_summary: Famously known for their campaign taglines ‘Malaysia Truly Asia’ and ‘Cuti-Cuti Malaysia’, Tourism Malaysia is committed to and focused on promoting the country to domestic and international markets. The agency actively began the modernization of its IT infrastructures and networks in 2013. The undertaking eventually lost some momentum through the years over various difficulties and drawbacks, but COVID-19 had proven to be the impetus needed to help Tourism Malaysia consolidate operations and reinvigorate its digital transformation.

title: Piraeus Bank builds on collective strengths, unites hybrid teams with Viva Connections
executive_summary: Piraeus Bank makes thousands of employees connected and empowered from the first 'hello.' The bank builds on the collective strengths of every team member by expanding Microsoft Teams with Viva Connections. The employee experience hub helps strengthen company culture and foster connections among employees, where everyone can feel included. Employees can now make the most of their workday, no matter where they are.

title: Responsive teaching that reflects the reality of the student experience using Microsoft Reflect
executive_summary: Every act of learning happens in a context. When an educator steps in front of a room to begin the first lesson of the day, with the first period bell’s ring still echoing in the hall, that educator must deal with myriad challenges and backgrounds students have brought to the classroom. Events at home, frustration with the course material, a first romance gone bad, and more can alter the mood of the students and their ability to connect with the material and each other. This social and emotional landscape has always been a part of the reality of learning, but its importance elevated in the wake of the disruptions of the last few years, and the anxieties it left behind in students. For All Hallows’ School in Brisbane, Australia, the solution came in the form of Microsoft 365 A5, Windows devices, and Microsoft Reflect.

title: The power of innovation: How Kent School District accelerates student success with Microsoft 365 and Surface
executive_summary: Kent School District is the fifth largest school district in the state of Washington. The district spans 72 square miles and is responsible for educating nearly 25,000 students across 42 schools. For Kent School District stakeholders the return to in-person learning presented an opportunity to embrace the benefits of continued adaptation and collaboration. A key component of that success was the deployment of Surface devices, Microsoft 365, and the educational tools therein. They serve to supplement the mission of Kent School District to successfully prepare all students for their futures. By providing modern education tools that enable accessibility and digital citizenship, the district gives students the necessary tools and skills to thrive in their lives beyond high school.

title: GF Piping Systems tackles social and environmental challenges using Microsoft Azure services
executive_summary: Sustainability is at the heart of everything GF Piping Systems does. As the leading flow solutions provider, the organization has been giving leak-free piping to a range of end-market segments for many years. Recently, the organization realized it needed to reinvent its offering to expand its reach and better serve existing customers – so, it partnered with Microsoft to digitally transform its operations. Using cloud technology, it built a flexible, modular platform environment to help develop customized solutions that meet customers’ needs and help them to solve social and environmental challenges - ultimately enabling positive change for a better tomorrow.

title: Vietnamese bank builds the country’s first cloud-native mobile banking app on Azure
executive_summary: Vietnam International Joint Stock Commercial Bank (VIB) has a decades-long track record of providing innovative, customer-centric service in Vietnam. The bank was one of the first one in the region to move to digital banking, and in 2021, worked with Microsoft to deploy a multi-cloud ecosystem (the first in Vietnam’s banking sector). An Azure cloud now hosts many VIB applications, including MyVIB 2.0, Vietnam’s first cloud-native mobile banking application.

title: MTN South Africa harnesses Microsoft Power Platform to slash fraud risk
executive_summary: Launched in 1994, MTN South Africa is a subsidiary of MTN Group, a leading emerging market operator with a clear vision to lead the delivery of a bold new digital world to our customers. We are inspired by our belief that everyone deserves the benefits of a modern connected life. The MTN Group is listed on the JSE Securities Exchange in South Africa under the share code ‘MTN’. Our strategy, Ambition 2025, is anchored on building the largest and most valuable platform business, with a clear focus on Africa. Visit www.mtn.com or www.mtn.co.za for more information.

title: Vodafone uses Azure DevOps to power agile transformation
executive_summary: “Your ability to respond, react, to stay relevant, to innovate and to compete comes down to your ability to release value to your customers as frequently as possible. That’s why Azure DevOps is such an important underpinning for business success and for cultural change,” says Ben Connolly, Global Head of Cloud Engineering & Head of Digital Engineering UK at Vodafone. “It really has revolutionised how we work.”

title: Jefferson Health modernizes as it migrates on-premises Epic environment to Azure
executive_summary: With a mission of improving lives by reimagining health, education, and research, Jefferson Health is modernizing its technology infrastructure to scale and support faster innovation. The multi-state nonprofit network of hospitals and research facilities is migrating its on-premises Epic® electronic health record (EHR) system to Microsoft Azure.

title: Emrill increases employee productivity by 30 percent with Dynamics 365 Finance
executive_summary: Emrill Services provides award-winning integrated facilities management services in the UAE. The company set out to modernize its processes to achieve greater data visibility and deliver even better services. “We sought out an ERP system that would streamline our work and boost efficiency,” says Hussain Saifuddin, Head of ICT at Emrill. After deploying Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance, Emrill brought company data and operations together, empowering its staff to increase productivity, save time, analyze data independently, and make informed decisions.

title: Doukas School unlocks the creative potential of students with the use of Surface devices and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Doukas School provides advanced educational and sports programs for learners aged 3 to 18, in Athens, Greece. It is the first school in the country to have used one-to-one technology in the classroom and stays in the forefront of educational innovation by constantly investing in technology. In 2022, the school switched to Surface devices and implemented Microsoft 365 on all levels. This move enabled both students and staff to improve learning outcomes within a secure, sustainable and accessible environment.

title: CooperSurgical accelerates sales productivity during rapid global growth with unified CRM on Dynamics 365
executive_summary: CooperSurgical, a leading fertility company, adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 as a unified CRM solution to deliver transparency during a time of rapid global growth. The company nearly doubled in size in two years, making it difficult to get an accurate overview of operations and opportunities. Many recent acquisitions were using their own CRM and ERP systems, and knowledge sharing was a time-consuming process. CooperSurgical decided to adopt Microsoft solutions globally to enhance forecasting, relationship management, and productivity. Now, the company is poised to bring healthcare products and services to patients more quickly than ever.

title: ELTRAK Group secures business continuity with Microsoft Security
executive_summary: ELTRAK Greece is the exclusive distributor for Caterpillar in Greece. To serve its customers better, the company transitioned to cloud solutions to improve productivity and management. ELTRAK Greece collaborated with Microsoft partner Office Line to use Microsoft Security, reducing its endpoint security maintenance effort by 75 percent and ensuring business continuity in its new environment. The move also helped the company achieve the ISO 27001 certification, an essential standard for information security management systems (ISMS) and their requirements.

title: Piraeus Bank builds on collective strengths, unites hybrid teams with Viva Connections
executive_summary: Piraeus Bank makes thousands of employees connected and empowered from the first 'hello.' The bank builds on the collective strengths of every team member by expanding Microsoft Teams with Viva Connections. The employee experience hub helps strengthen company culture and foster connections among employees, where everyone can feel included. Employees can now make the most of their workday, no matter where they are.

executive_summary: Every act of learning happens in a context. When an educator steps in front of a room to begin the first lesson of the day, with the first period bell’s ring still echoing in the hall, that educator must deal with myriad challenges and backgrounds students have brought to the classroom. Recently, the organization realized it needed to reinvent its offering to expand its reach and better serve existing customers – so, it partnered with Microsoft to digitally transform its operations. Using cloud technology, it built a flexible, modular platform environment to help develop customized solutions that meet customers’ needs and help them to solve social and environmental challenges - ultimately enabling positive change for a better tomorrow.

executive_summary: Vietnam International Joint Stock Commercial Bank (VIB) has a decades-long track record of providing innovative, customer-centric service in Vietnam. The bank was one of the first one in the region to move to digital banking, and in 2021, worked with Microsoft to deploy a multi-cloud ecosystem (the first in Vietnam’s banking sector). An Azure cloud now hosts many VIB applications, including MyVIB 2.0, Vietnam’s first cloud-native mobile banking application.

title: MTN South Africa harnesses Microsoft Power Platform to slash fraud risk
executive_summary: Launched in 1994, MTN South Africa is a subsidiary of MTN Group, a leading emerging market operator with a clear vision to lead the delivery of a bold new digital world to our customers. We are inspired by our belief that everyone deserves the benefits of a modern connected life. The MTN Group is listed on the JSE Securities Exchange in South Africa under the share code ‘MTN’. Our strategy, Ambition 2025, is anchored on building the largest and most valuable platform business, with a clear focus on Africa. Visit www.mtn.com or www.mtn.co.za for more information.

title: Grupo Bimbo bakes in end-to-end data security and compliance with Microsoft Purview true to its “deeply human” values
executive_summary: With operations around the globe, more than 100 well-loved brands, and 145,000 employees (associates, in Grupo Bimbo parlance), Grupo Bimbo is a major player in the consumer goods industry. Its leadership strategy includes rigorously protecting its trove of recipes and R&D assets. Most importantly, the company must care for one of its most precious assets: its sterling reputation. Not only is the international bakery lauded for its commercial success, its “deeply human” ethos makes Grupo Bimbo a sought-after employer. Its vast store of sensitive data calls for visibility and highly effective safeguards to ensure compliance with regulations in the many countries where Grupo Bimbo operates. The company answered these requirements with the Microsoft Purview family of data security, governance, risk, and compliance solutions. This visibility sparks an array of benefits: improved data security, compliance, greater efficiency for cybersecurity teams, and—critically—increased protection against data loss and business conduct violations while safeguarding the privacy of every Grupo Bimbo associate.

title: O2 Czech Republic boosts productivity and streamlines meetings with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: O2 Czech Republic is leading the way in workplace productivity and communication dynamics. With its early adoption of Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365, O2 has seen a significant decrease in time spent on administrative tasks. Instead of manually drafting meeting summaries and action points, employees now use Copilot to automatically generate the information they need. The move has revolutionized how information is shared and has made automation a part of daily work at the telco giant.

title: AI assistant for more personal wealth management: Van Lanschot Kempen uses Copilot for Microsoft 365 to foster personal engagement
executive_summary: When preserving and creating wealth for our clients, it’s essential to establish a personal connection. That is the only way the client will trust the advisor, and the advisor can understand the client’s needs. This is particularly true when it comes to financials. Van Lanschot Kempen is one of the world’s oldest financial institutions still existing. This Netherlands-based firm has the experience to know just how important the personal touch is in its business, which is why it always strives to give its employees time to build personal connections with colleagues and clients. Thanks to Copilot for Microsoft 365, Van Lanschot Kempen is reducing the time needed for daily tasks, freeing up time to invest in that crucial personal connection.

The company transitioned to a cloud-native ecosystem with Microsoft Azure four years ago, as part of its digital transformation. It has since built Senkron ROC, a Remote Operation Center that oversees 20 hydropower, wind, and solar plants 24/7. Through advanced AI analytics, Enerjisa Üretim can now monitor real-time performance, forecast production levels, and predict maintenance requirements. It also fortified operations with a specialized Security Operation Center, processing 3.3 million security events daily. All this translates to increased operational efficiency with well-timed preventive maintenance, and a safer, more secure future for sustainable energy management.
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Analytics, Azure Digital Twins, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Operator Call Protection, HoloLens, Microsoft 365 E5, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: How Cornerstone Academy Trust and Cloud Design Box deliver innovative, game-changing education using Microsoft 365
executive_summary: England’s Cornerstone Academy Trust is using Microsoft Education’s Learning Accelerators like Reading Progress to create a richer learning environment for 1,500 primary students. Digital, cloud-based tools enable innovative classroom experiences, and teachers gain the time and real-time insights for effective, personalized support. By creating a richer learning environment, the Trust equips students with the skills and confidence for a bright future. Working with Cloud Design Box, the Trust has rapidly improved the reading outcomes for students.

title: Team Rubicon’s tech-infused humanitarianism and the impact of Copilot in Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Team Rubicon, a veteran-led humanitarian organization, is focused on assisting communities before, during, and after disasters and crises. In its quest to foster a more positive and tailored volunteer experience, the organization looked to Copilot in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights to personalize outreach faster and more effectively than ever before. Using the smart suggestions of Copilot, Team Rubicon is reaching the right people, organizing, and reporting efficiently, and providing a more fulfilling and personalized volunteer experience.

title: RepsMate empowers businesses to create super agents by leveraging Azure's AI superpowers
executive_summary: Fresh on the Romanian startup scene, RepsMate is already making waves and attracting big names. Its goal is simple: to help customer service and sales agents better understand and serve their clients. How? With an Azure-powered AI assistant that provides answers to challenging questions that agents face. The technology has enabled customers to halve the size of the supervisory teams, enhance agent efficiency, and elevate customer satisfaction. A member of the Microsoft for Startups program, RepsMate has taken advantage of Microsoft’s networks, support, and guidance, as well as published its app on the Azure Marketplace, gaining unparalleled traction in Eastern Europe.
products: Azure, Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Operator Call Protection, Power BI

title: Paige.AI, Inc. stores petabytes of data on Microsoft Azure to help pathologists and thousands of patients with quicker cancer diagnoses
executive_summary: Paige.AI, Inc. (Paige), a leading provider of digital pathology tools, collaborated with Microsoft to migrate a massive amount of image data from cancer screenings to Microsoft Azure and create AI-driven tools to enhance cancer detection. Paige uses the latest technological advances to improve the speed and accuracy of cancer diagnoses. However, the company found it challenging to store its data in an easily accessible and cost-effective space. By migrating its data and solutions to Azure, Paige increased ease of access for pathologists around the world seeking digital pathology solutions in a cost-effective way. In the future, Paige hopes to provide even more data and AI support to help pathologists diagnose cancers more efficiently.

title: Siemens Teamcenter and Microsoft Azure solve the tough challenges with a modern PLM
executive_summary: With Siemens Teamcenter, customers can have full visibility up and down the product lifecycle, from planning, to manufacturing, to purchasing. Deployed on Azure, Siemens offers an adaptable Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system that connects people and processes that previously were isolated. With the scale, security, and reliability of Azure, Siemens is giving its customers an edge over the competition.

title: Efficient processes for a sustainable energy, heating, and mobility transition: SWM relies on Azure IoT, artificial intelligence, and big data analyses
executive_summary: Stadtwerke München (SWM), the municipal utilities company serving Munich, has made it its mission to drive every aspect of the city’s energy, heating, and mobility transition forward. Making this happen hinges on establishing smart connectivity for all areas of infrastructure. This is the only way to collect the relevant data in real time, make processes transparent, and harness real added value and optimization potential in a sustainable way. To this end, SWM relies on INSIGHT—a data-driven digital transformation solution it developed in-house and based on Microsoft Azure IoT, big data analyses in the Azure cloud, and artificial intelligence (AI).

title: Bond Brand Loyalty securely improves performance, accelerates client onboarding by 20 percent using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Bond Brand Loyalty (Bond), a customer experience, loyalty, and growth firm, used Microsoft Azure to scale to more than 2 petabytes of transactions while maintaining security and privacy. The company, which operates programs with more than 100 million members, manages rewards programs by keeping track of points, rewards, and customer communications. To deliver seamless customer journeys, Bond processes billions of rows of data every day. The company recognized the need to strategically shift to the cloud and enhance its technology with Azure. Bond built a modern offering with Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Synapse Analytics. Now the company is scaling its business globally to serve thousands more customers.

title: How Fractal Analytics Achieved Data Resiliency using Parablu & Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Fractal Analytics' success stems from its dedication to leveraging AI-driven innovation to deliver cutting-edge solutions to diverse industries. With its unparalleled expertise in financial intelligence, data science, and supply chain management, the company continues to be a leader in the industry, providing clients with top-tier products and services that drive growth and success.

title: Futuristic smart airports are now a reality, with Microsoft AI-enhanced security and private 5G networks by NTT
executive_summary: Microsoft has partnered with NTT to develop a smart airport solution featuring a connected 5G network and AI-enhanced security.

title: Quintain brings properties to life with help from Simply Dynamics and Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Quintain is a property development and asset management company that was established in London in 1992 and is now recognized as a significant industry expert in developing major urban regeneration programs. Its Irish operation was founded in 2019, becoming the third-largest residential mixed-use developer in the country. To meet the challenges associated with such rapid expansion, Quintain turned to Simply Dynamics for help implementing a new financial management system based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.

title: Dialog Information Technology builds a better backup strategy with Azure and Metallic
executive_summary: When Dialog Information Technology, one of Australia’s leading technology services companies, wanted to decommission its physical offices and lay the foundation for moving its on-premises datacenters to the cloud, it chose to build an enhanced business continuity and disaster recovery strategy around Microsoft Azure. It’s now managing backups of its expansive Microsoft 365 environment using Metallic, a Commvault data protection solution built on Azure. Not needing to build and manage its own dedicated backup infrastructure has led to cost and time savings like 95 percent faster Microsoft 365 backups, an AUD20,000 reduction in annual licensing costs, and AUD50,000 less in upfront costs with Metallic. It’s also given Dialog an opportunity to grow its business and envision a seamless and highly securely future in the cloud.

title: Ezra VeBitzaron redefines construction management with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Ezra VeBitzaron is a cornerstone of Tel Aviv-Jaffa's urban development since 1937. The company wanted to shift to the cloud to overcome integration and data flow issues faced with on-premises management systems, as well as facilitate smoother collaboration with its many contractors. After implementing Dynamics 365 Business Central, Ezra VeBitzaron saw more efficiency in its daily processes and an 11% cut in operational costs. Thanks to automation, it has also saved 75% of time spent on manual processes and made it more effective to collaborate with contractors and manage projects.

title: Treasury Curve makes life easier for treasury professionals with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Treasury Curve, a fintech provider of treasury management solutions, is powering its growth with a cloud-based platform built with Microsoft solutions. A longtime Microsoft customer, Treasury Curve realized its legacy cloud platform would not support the company’s anticipated growth and that migrating to Microsoft Azure presented both cost and client benefits. Since migrating to Azure with support from FastTrack, the company has improved customer service and reduced server costs by 33%. Today, the company’s treasury management platform can pull data from more than 11,000 global financial institutions in near real time. Treasury Curve also has an enhanced security posture and is better positioned for growth.

title: dentsu optimizes collaborative workflows with Microsoft Teams Premium
executive_summary: Global creative media company dentsu reduces time spent on repetitive tasks and ensures its global employees get the most out of every meeting with Microsoft Teams Premium and Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365.

title: Demirören accelerates security operations of diverse sectors with Microsoft XDR and data security
executive_summary: Demirören is a leading conglomerate in Türkiye that covers industries like heavy metals, media, real estate, education, technology, and gaming. To secure its large breadth of data operations, the company deployed Microsoft extended detection and response (XDR) and data security solutions. In recent years, it rapidly upgraded its technological infrastructure, enhancing collaboration and adding detection and response capabilities to better enable remote work. By deploying Microsoft security solutions, Demirören reduced complexity in its security stack, significantly boosting productivity. Demirören’s partnership with CloudCan enabled it to further optimize cloud environments, leading to substantial cost savings and better decision-making.

title: Air India harnesses AI for operational excellence with Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With a remarkable 90-year history, Air India is not only the flag carrier of India, but a symbol of the country’s aviation excellence and technological prowess. At the heart of the airline’s vision is a transformative technological journey, most recently marked by the incorporation of Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 into multiple departments. Notable is how Air India is weaving AI and Copilot into its operations with a custom-built plugin for Copilot in Microsoft Teams. This innovative step, a testament to Air India’s commitment to digital evolution, unlocks a new realm of operational insights. With the ability to converse with AI in Microsoft Teams, the Copilot plugin not only provides critical data on flight punctuality and operational hurdles, but also empowers proactive, collaborative decision making.

title: Call2Recycle expands battery recycling programs using Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
executive_summary: Call2Recycle operates the largest battery recycling program in the United States and Canada. To better serve a rapidly changing battery market and streamline operations, the organization turned to Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform. An integrated system saves approximately $25,000 in annual fees. A Power Pages site helps manage an e-bike battery recycle program with over 2,000 retailers. Together, these solutions are helping to drive even larger and more complex programs, including battery recycling for the electric vehicle (EV) market.

With an Azure-powered AI assistant that provides answers to challenging questions that agents face. title: GovTech sparks AI innovation among public agencies using a platform built with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: With generative AI, making government services more efficient is easier than ever, and no one knows this better than GovTech, the technology arm of the Singapore government. Using services such as Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, the agency created LaunchPad, a platform where government agencies can explore and harness the potential of AI, browse through prototypes and central products, and learn from each other. With more than 3,000 monthly active users across all government agencies, LaunchPad has already sparked more than 400 ideas and 20 prototypes, laying the foundation for the government to harness the power of Generative AI.

title: Transact Campus boosts data security with Azure Web Application Firewall
executive_summary: Transact Campus offers a mobile-centric technology ecosystem for educational institutions in the US. It was using a third-party web application firewall to protect its products. However, high costs, a variety of bugs, lackluster performance, and limited scalability led the company to explore other options. The company selected Azure Web Application Firewall on Azure Application Gateway, boosting customer data security, reliability, and scalability while reducing costs.

executive_summary: N/A

title: Axon enhances public safety and cuts report-writing time in half using Draft One, an AI-powered solution built on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Axon Enterprise, Inc. (Axon) provides technology solutions and tools that help protect and empower police officers, and it wanted to reduce the hours police officers spent writing reports each shift.

title: Nonprofit Age UK uses Azure AI Services to support human connection and battle loneliness
executive_summary: Nearly a million people in the UK say they often feel lonely, and Age UK works to serve a greater number of these folks in need of connection. The nonprofit built and implemented an AI-powered tool, built with the Azure AI Services text-to-speech capability, to scale up its human-to-human Telephone Friendship Service. The tool transcribes phone calls between a volunteer and an older person matched via the friendship service, enabling Age UK to quickly review more calls for safety. That frees up employees to make more matches and monitor more pairings, creating capacity to expand the Telephone Friendship Service.

title: WSIPC simplifies storage and saves thousands in costs with Azure Elastic SAN
executive_summary: Technology services cooperative WSIPC faced challenges with its traditional approach to storage, including costly upgrades. Supporting more than 300 school districts and 10 terabytes’ worth of databases, it wanted to allocate storage more easily and cost effectively.

title: Clinical staff at ULSTMAD have more time, less stress with Azure API Management
executive_summary: Clinical staff at Unidade Local de Saúde de Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro (ULSTMAD) had frequent technical problems while accessing hospital records, and many suffered burnout from spending so much time using unwieldy software.

executive_summary: The EST organization's reliance on a singular, outdated forum hindered their ability to efficiently manage student records and attract funding.

title: PKO Leasing saves 550 hours each month with Dynamics 365 Contact Center, an AI tool for customer support
executive_summary: PKO Leasing, serving 150,000 businesses daily with car, equipment, or capital investment leasing, had an outdated call center platform. Manual processes and difficulty in retrieving insights kept IT busy and slowed agents, impacting efficiency.

title: CancerCenter.AI transforms cancer diagnostics, cutting diagnosis times with the help of Azure-powered platform
executive_summary: Having seen his nephew’s drawn-out cancer journey firsthand, Piotr Krajewski set out to reduce long diagnostic waiting times for patients. Krajewski discovered the field had a global shortage of specialists, and time-consuming collaboration methods.

title: Aon improves customer data security by leveraging Azure SQL Managed Instance with Microsoft Entra
executive_summary: Aon saw an opportunity to modernize secure access for its most important Microsoft SQL Server database. By moving to Microsoft Azure, Aon streamlined and automated how services accounts are authenticated and allowed access to its data.

title: Toastmasters improves the member experience and enables growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Toastmasters International runs a global network of public speaking clubs where members hone their skills and create community. The nonprofit needed a more efficient way to help people join, answer questions, and enable more member self-service.

executive_summary: Sayvant is using generative AI to improve clinical charting, save time, and produce higher-quality documentation.

executive_summary: OneDigital needed a faster, smarter way to gather personalized insights for client meetings, as manual research was time-consuming and risked underprepared, less impactful engagements.
