Since 2017, the company has developed and operated their “service navigation system (Ser-navi)”, a caretaking record system within the company, to record the daily condition of each resident. In addition, the company has established a personnel system for masters of caretaking with high expertness and practices as “MAJI-kami” (MAJI-kami system) and driven forward their effort to apply it to develop human resources. Recently, the company started a development of ”MAJI-Kami AI” solution, in which they combine enormous data stored in Ser-navi and various sensor data which were just started to introduce into nursing homes, as well as MAJI-kami system. We interviewed the persons in charge to learn how do they try to turn the “findings” of MAJI-kami into knowledge and how do they try to materialize them at sites.

title: With CI/CD improvements and shorter release times, J. J. Keller & Associates focuses on creating impactful features using Split Software’s Azure DevOps integration
executive_summary: J. J. Keller & Associates provides regulatory, safety, and compliance solutions to more than 500,000 customers, including 90% of Fortune 1000 companies. It turned to Split Software to aid its development team in providing continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) of features that provide the most value to customers and positive impact to its business.  Split’s integration with Microsoft Azure DevOps services brings robust feature flagging, experimentation, and targeting for increased visibility across teams, agile deployment and development, and granular control of the release process. Thanks to Split’s integration, J. J. Keller’s development team releases updates bi-weekly instead of quarterly, and in minutes instead of hours.

title: Maidenhead Bridge uses marketplace to magnify and scale worldwide
executive_summary: Maidenhead Bridge is a leader in the emerging category of multicloud network software providers. Its unique solution lets customers connect from any virtual platform and cloud with Cloud Security Connectors for Secure Service Edge (SSE) vendors. With help from the ISV Success program, it has successfully adopted the commercial marketplace as core to its go-to-market strategy—propelling Maidenhead Bridge to scale and reach global customers.

title: Skills, Speaker Coach, and the student experience: How Springfield Public Schools uses Microsoft Education to deliver content effectively
executive_summary: When it comes to education in the classroom, someone is almost always presenting something. Educators present lecture material, discuss an upcoming lab experiment, or conduct a real time writing revision. Students prepare and deliver reports about a wide variety of topics, from history to computer science.

title: Giving students ownership with Reading Progress in the Milton Area School District
executive_summary: Few skills are as fundamental to a child’s success as reading. For decades, educators have assessed the reading progress of their students by having them read texts of varying difficulties aloud, in person, and then using those assessments to guide subsequent instruction. When schools shut their doors, those practices, and the learning that resulted from them, were disrupted in new and novel ways. For educators in the Milton Area School District, located in Central Pennsylvania, these challenges opened opportunities to explore and use technologies that improve literacy and fluency in their students. They turned to Microsoft Reading Progress, a program that uses artificial intelligence driven assessments to empower students to read, improve, and grow their skills—both on their own and with targeted aid from their teacher.

title: Supply chain insights with just one click: ALTANA pools knowledge in graph database built on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Knowledge transfer is essential for the success of a company—not only when experienced employees are retiring and it’s necessary to preserve and pass on their many years of expertise. Chemical company ALTANA started early on to consolidate the knowledge of its purchasing department in a central location. To do this, the company is relying on a graph database, Microsoft Azure, and PRODYNA, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network. The EMPOWER platform solution not only minimizes time and effort, increases performance, and enables price predictions with a deviation of only 5 percent, it also brings more transparency to sustainability data in the supply chains.

title: Blockchain innovator Fireblocks successfully processes more than $4 trillion in digital assets with Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Blockchain infrastructure provider Fireblocks wanted to create a proprietary ecosystem to remove the complexity of working with digital assets and cryptocurrencies and provide a higher level of security than ever achieved. Using Microsoft Azure confidential computing and Intel® Software Guard Extensions, the company collaborated with Microsoft to develop its innovative technology launched in 2018. Fireblocks has since helped redefine the digital assets industry, processing more than $4 trillion in assets while achieving the highest international security certifications and creating new opportunities on the blockchain for organizations of all types.

title: With Azure AI, TIM is a pioneer in the implementation of a synthesized voice service to increase customer satisfaction and retention
executive_summary: TAIS, the company's virtual assistant, is supported by Azure and is able to meet the needs of TIM’s customers with the ability to change the speed and intonation of its voice, as well as speak in 140 different languages. Through its pioneering actions, TIM modernized its telephone answering service, reduced costs, and was able to get closer to its mission of becoming the mobile carrier most beloved by customers.

title: Radish Cooperative reduces food waste, improves service for customers and business for restaurants with Azure
executive_summary: Montreal-based Radish Cooperative’s founders saw a food delivery market dominated by large digital platforms and formed a startup that offered affordable prices without sacrificing quality. They took a cooperative approach to ensure that Radish put its restaurants, couriers, and customers first. Joining the Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub, they developed a cloud-native, vertically integrated digital platform built on Microsoft Azure services. By hiring, training, and paying couriers appropriately, incentivizing restaurants as shareholders and decision-makers, and using data analytics and cloud-native tools, the cooperative and its members are thriving. Radish also offers integrated marketing, HR, and ordering services to its members to spur business and reduce food waste.

title: Cognizant personalizes the learning experience for more than 350,000 users with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Cognizant, one of the world’s leading professional services companies, helps its clients modernize technology, reimagine processes, and transform experiences to stay ahead in the fast-changing world. Headquartered in the United States, the company has a rapidly expanding footprint that extends from India and China to Europe, North America, South America, and the Middle East. A powerhouse of digital innovation, Cognizant combines its cutting-edge digital capabilities with industry expertise to offer solutions, business consulting, and services in order to accelerate its clients’ journeys toward digital transformation.

title: MediView transforms medical imaging with mixed reality using Microsoft HoloLens 2, bringing advanced procedures to more patients
executive_summary: MediView, a US medical technology start-up, is transforming healthcare with mixed-reality technology where digital and physical worlds interact. The company is improving patient outcomes by helping clinicians move beyond 2D medical imaging. Augmented reality is the cornerstone of this effort, and MediView has partnered with Microsoft to deploy the Microsoft HoloLens 2 headset in healthcare settings. Using MediView technology, clinicians report increased confidence during procedures and less physical strain, and remote collaboration services could make minimally invasive procedures more widely accessible. MediView’s innovative mixed-reality imaging solutions are a testament to how its partnership with Microsoft is changing healthcare.

title: Gluwa uses blockchain to help investors fund loans to the unbanked

title: Marlo Farma makes pet care and veterinary pharmaceuticals distribution a walk in the park with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: For three decades, Marlo Farma, Serbia's top distributor of pet food and veterinary pharmaceuticals, has been innovating and growing. But its previous ERP system struggled to keep pace, causing purchase inaccuracies and decreasing customer satisfaction. Working with Microsoft partner GoPro, Marlo Farma migrated to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. The result: a 30 percent rise in logistics and warehouse efficiency, real-time insights supporting decision-making, and most importantly, happier customers and healthier pets.

title: Designers Resource connects sales, finance, and operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Designers Resource Textile Pvt Ltd, an Indian home textile leader, addressed challenges in order fulfillment and remote work during the pandemic by adopting Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. Results include a 15 percent operational cost reduction and a 20 percent sales increase.

executive_summary: STERNET, a Polish distributor and factory service of electric drives and industrial automation, decided to modernize its customer relationship management (CRM) and take advantage of the cloud. executive_summary: A national provider of telephonic crisis services and digital tools for behavioral health, Protocall Services (Protocall) is on a multistage cloud migration to improve the reliability, security, and scalability of its infrastructure. On-premises and colocated systems no longer provided the performance or agility Protocall needed. Protocall’s migration has made it more agile and secure, with virtually 100% application infrastructure uptime. Many of Protocall’s business processes are simpler, and Atmosera’s continuous management of the Azure environment allows Protocall to focus on its mission: helping people in need.

executive_summary: Sasfin Bank Limited's Group Legal team, headed by Howard Brown, embarked on a transformation journey to enhance the bank’s legal operations. Built on Microsoft Azure, the platform doesn't just centralize 20,000 documents; it also uses artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze contract clauses, making post-signature management a breeze. Questions like 'What does this confidentiality clause mean?' are instantly answered, while Power BI dashboards provide real-time snapshots, moving from guesswork into data-driven decision-making.

executive_summary: PTT Global Chemical (GC) is making strides in transforming its internal processes and empowering its employees to deliver value to customers fast. products: Azure, Azure Operator Call Protection, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID

executive_summary: Promo.com has revolutionized its video creation services with Microsoft Azure and Azure OpenAI Service. By generating videos in just two minutes, Promo.com has increased its user engagement and grew its PromoAI product, adding over 1 million USD in new annual recurring revenue just 5 months after launch, while enhancing customer retention by 40%.

executive_summary: Alstom, a worldwide leader in the railway sector, operates in more than sixty countries, providing rolling stock, signaling systems, and services for rail. executive_summary: To empower the micro-entrepreneurs of Poland with robust banking services, Nest Bank decided to focus on both efficiency and innovation. It adopted Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365, freeing up the minds of its employees from administrative burdens and gaining a new level of efficiency in daily workflows. With Copilot, employees revolutionized how they prepare for, run, and follow up on meetings, as well as how quickly they develop new ideas.

title: Gasunie: driving sustainability and efficiency in the Dutch energy sector with Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: Dutch energy network operator Gasunie is a key energy player in the Netherlands and beyond. Traditionally a gas provider, the company is on a mission to drive more sustainable resources, such as hydrogen, and facilitate the European energy transition. To do that, Gasunie has built an intelligent data platform and put it at the heart of its data-driven activities – making it the single source of truth for insights to support daily operations. Powered by Microsoft, the platform has already proven a game-changer at the company. It’s helping the market to get better insights into the import and export of gas flows and filling degree of connected gas storages, but also to improve heat efficiency for the LNG Terminal (EemsEnergyTerminal) that the company recently built in the north of The Netherlands. All with a view to making the data platform play a central role in supporting the energy transition.

executive_summary: Austrian pipe manufacturer Poloplast was among the first Microsoft customers to participate in the preview of the new demand planning feature for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Built on the Power Platform, Demand planning empowers everyone to take a low-code approach to demand modeling and provides an intuitive user experience for reporting and analysis. Today, the business has made the forecasting process more user-friendly and collaborative, extended its outlook from three months to one and a half years, and reduced storage costs significantly due to more precise purchasing.

executive_summary: Veradigm is a top provider of healthcare data and tech solutions for payers, providers, and life sciences—including billing services via its Practice Fusion EHR platform. It was fielding high volumes of basic medical billing questions. To help customers get faster answers, Veradigm used Azure AI Search, Azure OpenAI Service, and more in a Zammo.ai software solution to develop Billerbot. The generative AI–powered self-help chatbot is programmed to field basic queries about medical terms, processes, and billing.

This swift development highlights AXA's commitment to innovation and its potential to empower employees in the insurance industry.

As a prominent ETF issuer in the industry, CSOP Asset Management has served as a pioneer in bridging the gap between Chinese markets and international investors through financial offerings that run the gamut from ETFs to financial derivatives.

The trusted tax preparation company envisioned using generative AI to create an easy, seamless process that answers filers’ tax questions, maintains safeguards to ensure accuracy, and minimizes the time to file. Valuing Microsoft’s leadership in security and AI and the longstanding collaboration between the two companies, H&R Block selected Azure AI Foundry and Azure OpenAI Service to build a new solution on the H&R Block platform to provide real-time, reliable tax filing assistance. AI Tax Assist combines nearly 70 years of trusted tax expertise with the latest advancements in AI technology from Microsoft Azure OpenAI to streamline and simplify the tax preparation process for millions of H&R Block clients.

title: ClearBank processes 20 million payments a month—up from 8,000—with platform built on Azure
executive_summary: ClearBank has grown significantly since launching in 2017. To continue scaling up, it needed to rapidly grow within the cloud and develop a resilient competitive platform to process payments. Overcoming regulatory concerns about cloud security, ClearBank moved its services to Microsoft Azure Service Fabric and App Service Environment. It added other Azure products and Microsoft Security solutions to help protect and enhance the platform. With its move to Azure, ClearBank gained both scalability and efficiency. It now pushes out 183% more monthly system releases and has a robust, reliable platform to support the latest banking products and services for financial institutions.

title: Georgia Tech is accelerating the future of electric vehicles using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Dr. Omar Asensio, an Associate Professor at Georgia Tech and Visiting Fellow at Harvard Business School, leverages Microsoft's Azure OpenAI Service to enhance the electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure. By analyzing global EV charging behavior data in 72 languages, Asensio's team uncovers insights crucial for policy development and infrastructure improvement. Their work addresses the key challenge of consumer confidence in public charging stations, a significant barrier to EV adoption. Utilizing AI, the team achieves rapid data classification and predictive modeling, highlighting the reliability of networked chargers over non-networked ones. This approach promises scalable, cost-effective solutions for improving EV infrastructure, contributing to environmental sustainability and equitable access to EV technology.

Since 2021, CTI has partnered with Microsoft Research Asia and Microsoft Azure AI Speech, establishing 1,330 test centers in 162 countries, serving over 50 million learners. They aim to integrate AI with Chinese language education, developing advanced tools like facial recognition and intelligent assessment. Using Azure AI Speech Services, CTI created the Learn Pronunciation to HSK application, providing instant pronunciation feedback to learners. This collaboration has resulted in a mobile Chinese pronunciation learning classroom, enhancing educational experiences with consistent and accurate evaluations.

executive_summary: MediaKind knows that media workloads are compute and egress intensive and often rely on on-premises equipment. It wanted to move to the cloud for current and future innovation and to extract value from existing content and ways of consuming media.

executive_summary: Dutch company Achmea made its first steps toward its goal of being an all-digital insurance provider by migrating three of its key workloads to Linux instances on SAP HANA Certified Virtual Machines on Microsoft Azure. It now has a powerful, scalable infrastructure that can serve as the foundation for future transformation while providing more reliable performance and lower operational costs.

title: Clearent scales its modern microservices architecture to handle 500 million payment transactions a year using the Azure SQL Database hyperscale service tier
executive_summary: Clearent provides credit card processing services for merchants of all sizes, all over the world. Already at 500 million transactions a year, Clearent wanted a data solution that could meet its ever-increasing demand—and unite all its information in one place. The company now uses the Microsoft Azure SQL Database hyperscale service tier to scale automatically and almost infinitely. This supports developers and architects in their day-to-day work, provides the data consistency that guarantees concurrent access for tens of thousands of users, and generates faster insights for its own decision-makers—and its customers.

title: Teijin ‘cloudifies’ its RFID-based management inventory system, streamlining hospital operations and optimizing medical costs with Azure
executive_summary: Recopick is an IC tag–based RFID management system from the Smart Sensing Business Development Project of Teijin. This solution is used in many areas, including book management at libraries, work-in-process management at factories, inventory management at retailers, and supplies management at hospitals. In April 2019, Teijin released a cloud version of Recopick, using Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform. The first user was Kitano Hospital, a large medical research institute with 699 beds and 1,500 employees. Deploying Recopick together with the SPD service (hospital logistics management service) of Konishi Medical Instruments optimized internal logistics and visualized the use and inventory status of supplies. The hospital also expects the solution to facilitate management accounting in the future.
products: Azure App Service, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Stream Analytics

title: This bank is mastering what it sees as the next market disrupter in global financial services
executive_summary: Internet and mobile apps, move over. The new industry disrupter is bot technology. Nedbank, one of the major banks in South Africa, is using a virtual call center solution, based on the Microsoft Bot Framework, that can understand the context of clients’ questions. It answers questions for which it is programmed at 10 percent of the cost of live agents. The bank envisions many other uses for the technology as part of a digital transformation intended to expand its competitive advantage.

title: Alpha Travel: How one ambitious business digitally transformed its opportunity to go global
executive_summary: There are only four sets of traffic lights on the 18 Faroe Islands. Tórshavn, the small capital on Streymoy Island, is home to all of them. Sandwiched between the Norwegian Sea and Atlantic Ocean—about 320 kilometers north-northwest of  Scotland—this globally ambitious company, Alpha Travel, is quietly adopting the latest cloud-based technology.

title: Chatbot answers the call for efficient customer service in Aberdeen
executive_summary: Aberdeen is a thriving, cosmopolitan city in the northeast of Scotland offering a wide range of information and services to residents and businesses.

title: Adaptive Biotechnologies transforms data stream into new immune medicine platform with Azure
executive_summary: Founded in 2009, Adaptive Biotechnologies is a commercial-stage biotechnology company focused on harnessing the inherent biology of the adaptive immune system to transform the diagnosis and treatment of disease. Adaptive was built on the premise that the adaptive immune system can detect and treat most diseases in the exact same way, but the inability to understand precisely how that system works has prevented the medical community from fully leveraging its capabilities.

title: Clean Energy Fuels runs greener, boosts efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Commercial heavy- and medium-duty trucks, waste collection vehicles, and public transportation all run on renewable natural gas from Clean Energy—a sustainable, carbon-neutral fuel. Clean Energy innovates constantly, using cutting-edge solutions for every facet of its operations. It trusts Microsoft Dynamics 365 to support its growth and its mission. Clean Energy added Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist and HoloLens to close the loop on information, from back office to the pump, accelerating productivity and cutting down on company travel.

title: Insurance broker streamlines customer engagement, manages rapid growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, OneDigital provides health and benefits, retirement and wealth, and workforce and HR advisory services for employers of all sizes. After years of rapid growth, the company needed to modernize its IT environment and improve visibility into the business and the customer journey. OneDigital adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 for cloud-based customer engagement capabilities, along with Azure, Power BI, and Microsoft Teams. By unifying its environment with Microsoft technologies, OneDigital reduced costs and gained a centralized view of customers to respond to their needs at the speed expected by today’s modern consumer.

title: Air India elevates customer support while saving money with Azure AI, data, and apps
executive_summary: As part of a transformation intended to restore its status as a world-class airline with a strong Indian identity, Air India needed to upgrade the customer experience without increasing costs.

title: BMW Group innovates with Azure for 10 times more efficient data delivery
executive_summary: Before 2018, BMW Group’s development fleet relied on manual data transfer and on-premises data processing, significantly slowing vehicle development and prototype cycles.

title: NTT DATA Transforms Its Enterprise with Agentic AI in Microsoft Fabric, Azure AI Foundry
executive_summary: NTT DATA, a global business and technology services provider, adopted Microsoft Fabric to eclipse previous state-of-the-art solutions and achieve greater insights, faster decision making and scalable data-driven operations.

title: Auquan helps financial institutions save 50,000+ hours with Microsoft Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Finance industry professionals spend most of their time manually processing unstructured data and writing reports, greatly limiting the scale and speed of what they can accomplish.

title: PIMCO boosts client service with an AI-powered search platform built on Azure AI
executive_summary: The client-facing teams at PIMCO serve hundreds of thousands of clients around the world, all of whom need accurate, up-to-date information on the products they hold. To boost the client experience, PIMCO wanted to help its associates spend less time aggregating data and more time engaging with clients.

title: University of Venda attains 99% service uptime and enables a smarter campus with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: University of Venda needed to replace its on-premises servers that often led to system downtime and slowed access to essential services. It also needed to shorten its six-month long procurement cycle for new hardware to better support future growth.

title: Kent County Council can focus more resources on frontline service delivery after deploying Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Kent County Council faces numerous challenges in delivering services, including resource and budget constraints, a growing population, complex resident demands and administrative burdens that reduce efficiency.

title: Real estate investment trust Host Hotels transforms data into actionable business insights using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Host Hotels & Resorts’ IT team faced the efficiency and cost-benefit challenges of an outdated datacenter running legacy software. The infrastructure needed constant maintenance to stay current with the latest security and compliance specifications for a publicly traded Fortune 500 company. The decision to switch to Microsoft Azure cloud services has been a gamechanger. The organization has achieved major gains in resiliency, security and compliance, in addition to remote work capability. And Host’s IT team has been freed up to contribute to the company’s bottom line by providing critical, real-time data that informs business decisions and keeps the organization ahead of its competition.

title: Microsoft Azure gives Capital on Tap the agility needed for global expansion
executive_summary: Capital on Tap began from the starting point that small business owners are the foundation for growth in our economy, and yet today’s banking system has left them behind. By the end of 2020, Capital on Tap was again expanding out its Microsoft Azure services to support its launch into the US market. Capital on Tap is now focused on optimisation: upgrading VMs to increase performance without adding cost and gradually moving away from VMs altogether. This move to a serverless architecture wasn’t an option before.

title: Enabling Remote Learning During the Pandemic
executive_summary: Classera main challenge is the need for fully remote work of Classera employees due to Covid-19 pandemic and beyond. Microsoft applications and solutions are catalysts to connect our teams across five branches to work together with high level of efficiency and teamwork spirit.

title: San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency boosts citizen services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: San Francisco’s 874,000 residents and 26 million visitors rely on the San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency (SFMTA) to get where they’re going safely. The agency, established by voter mandate in 1999, works to connect San Francisco through a safe, equitable, and sustainable transportation system. Driven by a need to centralize its data and reduce administrative bottlenecks, the SFMTA partnered with Microsoft to build a serverless data solution—centered on Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics—that it has used to unify disparate data, streamline processes, and gain insights and efficiencies.

title: Washington State’s King County uses Azure to help secure resident health data—and make lives better
executive_summary: King County is Washington State’s most populous county, with more than 2.2 million residents. For the Department of Community and Human Services, ensuring that these residents have access to critical social and health services is top of mind. Hampered by siloed systems, tools, and modes of data collection, the county turned to Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics to create a unified data platform that delivers a more holistic view of data, faster access to data, and a clearer picture of public health metrics.

title: Pakistani footwear and tyre tube manufacturer unlocks holistic view of retail business with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Established more than 50 years ago, Servis Industries Limited (SIL) is a leading manufacturer and exporter in Pakistan. To achieve its goal of becoming a global, world-class, and diversified company, SIL moved its on-premises infrastructure to cloud. By adopting Dynamics 365 Finance, Supply Chain Management, and Commerce, the company now has a holistic overview of its retail stores and an infrastructure management system that can support rapid national and international growth.

title: The food tech company reducing global food waste with cloud technology
executive_summary: LMK Group is a Nordic food tech company that delivers a large variety of meals directly to its customers’ doors. As part of its work, the company is on a pioneering mission to reduce global food waste and drive sustainability across the grocery retail sector. To do this, LMK has been using cloud technology to optimize its processes, provide customized options for its clients and ultimately become a fully data-driven company.

title: Reinsure globally, analyze locally: Munich Re relies on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As a leading global provider of reinsurance, Munich Re needs to maintain a clear view of the risk situation and trends worldwide. As such, big data analyses on a grand scale are nothing new for the company. However, restrictive laws on data storage around the world were presenting challenges. At the same time, Munich Re was seeking to further increase its rate of innovation and operate in even closer proximity to its global customers by spreading its in-house analytics know-how more widely. This is why Munich Re moved its data analyses to the Microsoft Azure Cloud.

title: How Liberty University is fighting COVID-19 using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: At Liberty University in Lynchburg, Virginia, a mechanical engineering team received a Microsoft AI for Health COVID-19 grant that provided access to Microsoft Azure Cloud, Microsoft High-Performance Computing (HPC) capabilities, and Microsoft AI for Health data science experts. The grant helped them study how a new respiratory therapy device can help COVID-19 patients and their caregivers.

title: Walgreens empowers pharmacists with an intelligent prescription data platform on Azure
executive_summary: Walgreens processes hundreds of millions of prescription dispenses a year across nearly 9,000 stores, and each transaction has hundreds of associated data points. Using Microsoft Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and other Azure resources, the company created an intelligent data platform that can quickly process data from prescription dispenses and create valuable insights within minutes, not only for pharmacists who are serving customers but also for operations and analytics teams across the company. This immediate access to rich transactional data and insights, whether generated 10 seconds ago or 10 years ago, changes the way that pharmacists and other decision makers use data and conduct business.

title: Maccabi Healthcare Services streamlines and secures daily workflows with Microsoft Power Apps
executive_summary: With over 70 years’ history, Maccabi Healthcare Services is Israel’s second-largest healthcare maintenance organization (HMO). It provides both insurance and primary healthcare services to its over 2.4 million members. Needing a more secure and efficient way to manage critical healthcare-related communication and workflows, Maccabi turned to Microsoft Teams and Power Apps. Today, healthcare workers and their patients are benefitting from a more streamlined and efficient approach to patient onboarding, case handovers, and homecare visits, dramatically improving the healthcare experience.

title: REI connects with customers for virtual outfitting to create a personalized experience using Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: With their highly identifiable green vest and expert knowledge of outdoor apparel and gear, retail employees at REI Co-op are hard to miss. The largest consumer co-op in the United States has more than 170 locations across 41 states and 12,000 green vests, as its sales floor employees are called, all connected by a love of the outdoors. Green vests are on hand to help the co-op’s 20 million members find just the right gear to make their outdoor pursuits a success, but everyone, not just members, can benefit from shopping with the specialty retailer.

title: Mitsubishi Electric boosts connection among employees, speeds digital business transformation with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Mitsubishi Electric celebrated its 100-year anniversary by stepping up the transformation of its business model and business style, and is taking action on many fronts to achieve next-level growth. As part of those efforts, the company adopted Microsoft 365 to start building the Mitsubishi Electric Global IT Platform Service for its employees around the world. By April 2020, the global IT platform had evolved to facilitate easy communication and collaboration within the company, and Mitsubishi Electric employees now transcend organizational boundaries and physical distances by using Microsoft Teams and Surface devices.

title: Everseen and NVIDIA create seamless shopping experience that benefits the bottom line
executive_summary: Shrinkage, or inventory loss, is a major problem that large retailers and grocers deal with every day. According to the National Retail Federation (NRF), the retail industry is losing more than $61 billion a year in North America alone. And it’s only getting worse—more than 23 percent of retailers have seen their shrink rate increase from 1.8 to 2 percent. So, if you have a $20 billion grocery retailer, with the industry shrink rate average, the company’s US business would have lost more than $4 billion a year to theft and other related losses.

title: Sustainable jeans and sneakers manufacturer chooses Microsoft 365 to stay one step ahead
executive_summary: When you wear a pair of 1083 jeans or sneakers, you know exactly where the fabric was dyed, where the seams were sewn, and where the shoelaces were made. The goal of 1083 is to create clothing that looks great and contributes to a circular economy, an approach that prioritizes recycling and reusing materials to combat waste, all while creating new jobs by supporting the textile industry close to home. “1083 is the distance between the two most distant cities in France,” explains Thomas Huriez, President of 1083. “Our mission is to manufacture jeans and sneakers at a distance of less than 1,083 kilometers from our customers.”

title: CCBPI accelerates business and drives performance with Sales Capability tool
executive_summary: Coca-Cola Beverages Philippines (CCBPI) manufactures and distributes soft drinks and other consumer beverages in the Philippines. The bottler recognized that it needed to make better use of its data to lower costs and increase efficiency. Lingaro delivered a data and analytics solution that helped CCBPI overcome its data challenges via a Microsoft Power BI report solution powered by Azure. The Sales Capability tool from Lingaro provides easily accessed actionable insights that enable CCBPI to accelerate its business. The bottler has also realized substantial savings through automating data injection processes and eliminating manual work.

title: Kuwait’s National Aviation Services (NAS) powers a safe return to air travel with Azure
executive_summary: Present in numerous airports from Morocco to India, Kuwaiti National Aviation Services (NAS) is committed to enabling air travel that is both safe and stress-free. To help power the resumption of key flights amid the pandemic, NAS pioneered a forward-thinking mobile platform on Azure through its airport technology arm ICT.aero that specializes in the sourcing and development of solutions. Not only does the platform ensure strict COVID-19 testing compliance and identity verification, it also keeps travelers informed of all government requirements. So far, more than eight hundred thousand travelers have taken advantage of the mobile solution for a safe and seamless journey.

title: Galadari Food and Beverage modernizes cash collection with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Galadari Food and Beverage (GFAB), a part of the Galadari Brothers Group, operates the largest network of food & beverage (F&B) stores in the Gulf region. With activities soaring, its manual cash collection system was strained. The company then created the Cash in Motion app on Microsoft Power Platform to enhance collection and transparency. With this, GFAB can now monitor and track cash movement via real-time notifications. The company plans to expand operational fluidity across other Galadari businesses with more automation using Power Platform.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Power Apps, Power BI

title: All from a single source: all4cloud relies on the Microsoft Teams platform and partner Telekom
executive_summary: Do not simply introduce software, but live and think in processes: this is the goal pursued by all4cloud. The IT service provider has already helped around 200 customers migrate to the cloud, the majority of them Small and Medium Enterprises from every sector imaginable—from circular connector suppliers right over to frozen pizza producers. They all have one thing in common: a desire to reorganize their processes. This is where all4cloud comes in. The SAP partner now relies on Microsoft Teams and partner Telekom for communicating externally with customers and collaborating internally among employees.

title: Step by step into a digitalized future: Liebherr-Hausgeräte turns to Dynamics 365
executive_summary: What do caterers and laboratories have in common? They both work with products that have to be stored at very specific temperatures. In order to demonstrate compliance, caterers and lab technicians have to maintain temperature logs. Smart refrigerators from Liebherr‑Hausgeräte maintain these logs practically unaided and sound an alarm if the temperature rises above or falls below the recommended level. This is just one of the many ways in which Liebherr‑Hausgeräte harnesses digitalization. When it comes to comprehensive customer support, Dynamics 365 provides the basis for a strong, consistent CRM.

title: "Trailblazing: a new digital & integrated approach to the student record system at TEDI-London".
executive_summary:
TEDI-London is a new higher education provider for future engineers, founded by Arizona State University, King's College London and UNSW Sydney. It will accept its first student cohort in September 2021, welcoming them to a newly built campus in London’s Canada Water.

In October 2019, TEDI-London’s CIO, David Minahan, was in the unusual position of being able to define and implement a best practice digital strategy and a new student record system without being having to deal with any legacy constraints.

title: Everseen and NVIDIA create seamless shopping experience that benefits the bottom line
executive_summary: Shrinkage, or inventory loss, is a major problem that large retailers and grocers deal with every day. According to the National Retail Federation (NRF), the retail industry is losing more than $61 billion a year in North America alone. And it’s only getting worse—more than 23 percent of retailers have seen their shrink rate increase from 1.8 to 2 percent. So, if you have a $20 billion grocery retailer, with the industry shrink rate average, the company’s US business would have lost more than $4 billion a year to theft and other related losses.

title: Sustainable jeans and sneakers manufacturer chooses Microsoft 365 to stay one step ahead
executive_summary: When you wear a pair of 1083 jeans or sneakers, you know exactly where the fabric was dyed, where the seams were sewn, and where the shoelaces were made. The goal of 1083 is to create clothing that looks great and contributes to a circular economy, an approach that prioritizes recycling and reusing materials to combat waste, all while creating new jobs by supporting the textile industry close to home. “1083 is the distance between the two most distant cities in France,” explains Thomas Huriez, President of 1083. “Our mission is to manufacture jeans and sneakers at a distance of less than 1,083 kilometers from our customers.”

title: Professional services firm, Wipfli, uses Microsoft Azure to stay ahead of the competition
executive_summary: The accounting and consulting industry is incredibly competitive. Acquisitions are common, and the pressure to rapidly deliver innovative services drives competition. After a series of acquisitions, and with the impact of COVID-19 on remote work, Wipfli needed a cloud solution to consolidate its existing platforms and provide much-needed speed and agility to its client service and development teams. The large professional services provider chose Microsoft Azure.

title: Kruger boosts employee productivity in factories using HoloLens 2 and Dynamics 365 Guides
executive_summary: North American paper products and energy specialist Kruger is nearly 120 years old, but the company takes a modern approach to technology, giving employees innovative tools to make them more confident and effective in their work. With Microsoft HoloLens 2 and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Guides, Kruger is bringing its factory handbook to life using sophisticated features like spatial triggers and branching to guide the employee where the work happens.

title: Children’s hospital makes every moment count with help from Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Annae Barney Gorman, a philanthropist and community activist, lived her life in “the relentless pursuit of optimal health for every child.” What she started back in 1919 as a small health services center for residents of North Dayton, Ohio, has evolved into one of only 31 freestanding children’s hospitals in the United States today. More than 400 physicians, 1,000 nurses, and 2,000 staff are at the heart of Dayton Children’s Hospital’s vision of reinventing the path to children's health for families throughout the region and beyond. The hospital’s employees believe that each moment counts in how they interact with their patients, families, and each other. There were more than 384,000 visits in 2019, and all of them were key moments in unique patient journeys that are now better understood with the help of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.

title: Microsoft Power Platform transforms engagement center process to deliver faster impact for animal health
executive_summary: Patterson Companion Animal Health Division provides everything a veterinarian needs to run their business and help their furry and non-furry patients. This includes sourcing specially requested items, which was a manual and inconsistent process. The process ultimately led to SKU proliferation, dead stock, and inflated inventory levels. Microsoft Power Automate generates emails throughout the process, proactively providing status, helpful details, and final decision. Mapping the process highlighted opportunities for improvement that were addressed and automated. This has reduced the number of items being set up unnecessarily—saving time and ongoing maintenance.

title: The tower in the cloud: Lufthansa Systems secures applications in the new cloud infrastructure with Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Aviation is about so much more than the colossal metal tubes that somehow manage to take to the sky. In the cockpit, in the cabin and on the ground, digital processes and solutions play a vital role in the industry. And wherever digital solutions are used to define processes, a maximum level of data security and system stability has to be ensured. Lufthansa Systems is setting new standards here with the Global Aviation Cloud, the cloud delivery platform developed specifically to meet the needs and security standards of airlines. Cloud-based hosting guarantees the global availability of its applications, while Microsoft Sentinel keeps watch over the many solutions deployed by its customers. This allows any security gaps to be quickly identified and closed.

title: Inail simplifies Italian citizens' access to online services with Microsoft Power Apps, Dynamics 365 and other Microsoft technologies
executive_summary: The Italian National Institute for Insurance against Accidents at Work (Inail) is a government entity that serves Italy’s workers, providing them with protections and advocacy at work. Inail wanted to simplify access to its services and support citizens remotely, so it worked with Microsoft and Microsoft Partner Network members Accenture and Avanade to build Sportello Digitale. Sportello Digitale is an intuitive online app built on Microsoft Power Apps, Dynamics 365, Teams, and Viva that helps citizens quickly and easily connect with Inail employees. Since the app’s launch, no citizen who has made an appointment online through Sportello Digitale has needed a second appointment to provide additional details on their case, and Inail has benefitted as well with reduced the costs, labor, and time spent resolving cases.

title: Confluent delivers enhanced data privacy, opens new opportunities with Azure Private Link
executive_summary: For many organizations, operationalizing data at this level would require significant infrastructure expansion, but Confluent does that work for them by delivering a fully managed, cloud data-in-motion software as a service (SaaS) platform, built on Apache Kafka and more securely and optimally accessed with Microsoft Azure Private Link. To provide the value of cloud-backed, real-time data for risk-averse customers, particularly those in highly regulated industries or with other increased security requirements, Confluent uses Azure Private Link to help maintain the privacy and integrity of any customer’s digital network. It chose Private Link to help minimize the complexity of connecting virtual networks in the public cloud and simplify highly secure connectivity for all types of customers.

title: Global food retailer promotes collaboration across its enterprise with Teams and Teams Rooms systems
executive_summary: With 54 million customers making virtual and in-person visits to the 7,137 grocery stores that its brands operate in Europe, the United States, and Indonesia every week, Ahold Delhaize is a truly global operation. “We’re very committed to serving the customers who visit our brands and their supermarkets,” says Robin Albregt, Director of Global IT Solution Delivery at Ahold Delhaize. However, the global nature of the business means that serving those customers requires a connected workforce who can seamlessly collaborate no matter where they are. “With a highly diverse geographic footprint like we have, bringing people together to collaborate is really important to Ahold Delhaize,” says Mike Laurenti, Chief Information Officer at the Global Support Office of Ahold Delhaize. “One of the things that makes Ahold Delhaize special is our ability to understand best practices from one part of the company and share them broadly across the organization. Microsoft Teams is an important tool for how we do that.” Supporting that collaboration is even more pressing as Ahold Delhaize and its brands continue to embrace hybrid work. “I’m focused on making sure we’re maximizing the productivity of this hybrid way of working,” says Albregt. “To do that, we’re deploying Teams and Teams Rooms systems across our global enterprise.”

title: Atkins leverages Microsoft Azure to help them to build more sustainably
executive_summary: “Sustainability is everything to Atkins and we rely on these tools in order for us to do this in the most efficient manner,” says John Weir, Associate Director at Atkins. Atkins delivers design, project management and engineering consultancy services. Because our lived environment is facing rapid change, Atkins is radically transforming the way infrastructure is designed, delivered and operated. Lesley Waud, Global, Design Transformation at Atkins, has been in the industry for 40 years. She says, “there’s never been a better time in terms of the difference that we can make for society.”

title: Everseen and NVIDIA create seamless shopping experience that benefits the bottom line
executive_summary: Shrinkage, or inventory loss, is a major problem that large retailers and grocers deal with every day. According to the National Retail Federation (NRF), the retail industry is losing more than $61 billion a year in North America alone. And it’s only getting worse—more than 23 percent of retailers have seen their shrink rate increase from 1.8 to 2 percent. So, if you have a $20 billion grocery retailer, with the industry shrink rate average, the company’s US business would have lost more than $4 billion a year to theft and other related losses.

title: Microsoft Dynamics provided by inspirit365 connects Corvus Energy’s operations worldwide
executive_summary:
Corvus Energy is the world’s leading supplier of specially designed energy storage systems (ESS) for the maritime sector. Its vision is to be the leading provider of offshore zero-emission solutions and to drive the trend toward more sustainable shipping.
Corvus Energy has multiple manufacturing facilities and sales offices around the world. It needed an ERP system capable of linking up and streamlining administration and production.
The solution to this was provided by inspirit365 in the form of Microsoft Dynamics 365. Thanks to this, Corvus Energy has a system that automates production and processes, supports further growth, and connects the company’s data and information in a common, state-of-the-art ERP system.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Quicker access to information, consistent data storage, and increased efficiency at Spairliners thanks to Dynamics 365 Human Resources
executive_summary: More employees, new areas of activity, a different way of organizing work—the business momentum at Spairliners GmbH called for the company to restructure its HR work and manage tasks more efficiently. While to begin with, Excel and SharePoint had largely fit the bill when it came to processes and documentation, Spairliners wanted to increase efficiency and reliability by bringing in a new solution. Microsoft’s Dynamics 365 Human Resources proved to be the perfect product.

title: Global IT services consultant Atos chooses Microsoft Security to protect internal endpoints
executive_summary: Atos is an experienced and accomplished IT security consultancy and is a trusted worldwide IT partner for major international organizations. When it came to security and compliance for its own internal network, Atos turned to Microsoft Security as part of its migration to a more consolidated, cloud-forward Microsoft 365 platform. Microsoft Security features are now replacing individual point solutions, helping ensure that more than 100,000 Atos employees and administrators meet global business compliance mandates in a highly secure and productive environment.

title: A Revolutionary Ecommerce Platform with Azure at the Foundation
executive_summary: At IRP Commerce, the goal isn’t to find new ways to generate revenue for the company — it’s to keep uncovering innovative ways to solve solutions for its customers. It’s why, according to Chief Commercial Officer, Philip Macartney, IRP Commerce has built an ecommerce platform that goes beyond just giving merchants a place to sell their products. Instead, the IRP Commerce platform is a data rich solution that equips merchants with the insights and support they need to optimize revenue generation every step of the way. At IRP Commerce, the goal isn’t to find new ways to generate revenue for the company — it’s to keep uncovering innovative ways to solve solutions for its customers. It’s why, according to Chief Commercial Officer, Philip Macartney, IRP Commerce has built an ecommerce platform that goes beyond just giving merchants a place to sell their products. Instead, the IRP Commerce platform is a data rich solution that equips merchants with the insights and support they need to optimize revenue generation every step of the way.

title: FastTrack prepares Hive Streaming for global co-sell accessibility
executive_summary: People use videos to communicate in many parts of life. Thankfully, companies like Hive Streaming help customers—like Bayer and Chevron—drive employee engagement through powerful video experiences that are both stable and highly secure. This technology became paramount during COVID-19 when many enterprises shifted to remote work.

title: Energy management firm Amber uses performance management solution in Microsoft Teams to engage employees, improve culture
executive_summary: Based in the United Kingdom, Amber is a B Corporation–certified energy company, which means that it meets social sustainability, environmental performance, and accountability standards, and it’s transparent to the public. It takes an innovative, planet-first approach to helping its clients cut energy costs, reduce their carbon output, and work toward achieving Net Zero status. Amber has been growing steadily since it was founded in 2009, and as it approached the 100-employee milestone, it was looking for a better HR Performance Management Solution. “We needed something that seamlessly integrated into the day-to-day lives of our employees,” says Ryan Cullen, People Director at Amber.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Peet’s Coffee meets market changes with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Peet’s Coffee, founded in California in 1966, prides itself on providing customers with the highest quality craft coffee and tea. You can stop by a Peet’s Coffee shop for a cup, or purchase Peet’s products in the supermarket and online—from whole beans to K-cups to capsules and more—to brew at home.

title: Green Kite uses Power BI dashboard created by Bespoke for deeper insights
executive_summary: Green Kite is a professional inventory company that works with agents and landlords in the United Kingdom to carry out more than 10,000 detailed inventories per year. Their highly skilled team carry out numerous inventories, check-ins, midterm inspections, and checkouts on a daily basis, all for multiple agencies. Green Kite had been spending days manually consolidating data to create detailed reports on property inspections. By adopting Power BI, Bespoke.xyz were able to create custom dashboards to clearly display crucial, current data to employees in the field, saving hours per week that now can be spent on key improvement areas.

title: x15ventures powers, updates, and optimizes desktop environment with Microsoft Managed Desktop
executive_summary: As the venture-scaling arm of one of Australia’s big four banks, x15ventures is dedicated to building, acquiring, and investing in early-stage ventures. From very early on, x15 realized it would require a technology environment that supported the agility and innovation potential of startups, but that also enabled them to be built with scalability and safety in mind. While evaluating management solutions for its new desktop environment, x15 sought to bring together industry-leading capabilities in security, collaboration, remote work, agility, and flexibility for an efficient, high-performing device experience. To meet its mission of delivering a highly secure, performant, and fully equipped environment, x15 has deployed Microsoft Managed Desktop and a full suite of Microsoft modern management solutions to improve the onboarding process, optimize its security strategy, and rapidly scale up to support more ventures and offer more and better development resources.

title: Juvare scales critical emergency management applications on Azure, boosts disaster response, resiliency
executive_summary: In the event of an emergency, every second counts. Mirroring that ethos, Juvare, one of the largest emergency management and response software providers globally, aims to maintain the same flexible and responsive posture as its core clients—government agencies, hospitals, universities, healthcare organizations, and emergency response operations across the world.

title: Maire Tecnimont: becoming a data-driven business through Viva Insights
executive_summary: Maire Tecnimont, a global leader in the natural resources processing sector, is all about using technology to elevate the employee experience. Under the leadership of its visionary CIO, the company has implemented Microsoft’s range of workplace analytics solutions in a bid to empower its people and promote flexible working. One of the first businesses in Europe to do so, Maire Tecnimont is now combining these technologies with data-driven insights and cloud-based solutions to inspire even more innovation across its offices.
products: .NET, Azure, Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva Insights, Power Automate, SharePoint

title: Campari Group improves security, access for its 1,000+ third-party contractors worldwide through Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Campari Group, the world’s sixth-largest spirits player with a portfolio of more than 50 brands, including Aperol, Appleton Estate, Campari, SKYY, Wild Turkey, and Grand Marnier, always strives to strike an operational balance between access and security. Headquartered in Italy, with 22 plants and in-market companies in 23 countries, Campari Group maintains an environment open enough to provide necessary access for valued third-party contractors, yet secure enough to minimize risks and stave off threats. Campari Group manages to do exactly that with Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop and the Microsoft Cloud.

title: Exxaro unites on-premises and cloud infrastructure into a single monitoring solution with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Since 2017, Exxaro Resources has been on an ambitious transformation journey. In addition to upgrading its IT infrastructure, the South African company has built a sustainable growth impact strategy that lays out the company’s aim to “transition from a coal base to a minerals and renewable energy solutions business that will thrive in a low-carbon future.” It credits its successes in part to a strategic, well-managed, and digital-first approach to innovation and operations, which most recently included refreshing its Wi-Fi, LTE, and internet-based networks and moving an initial set of datacenters to Microsoft Azure to unlock the power of the cloud.

title: LUKS: simplifying hospital processes with low-code technology
executive_summary: Luzerner Kantonsspital (LUKS) is one of the largest hospitals in Switzerland, as well as a leading digital innovator. A forerunner of virtual consultations and digital patient management systems, LUKS believes in using technology to simplify processes and empower its staff. As part of this mission, the hospital has been exploring low-code apps and how they can help optimize operations and drive efficiencies. Their benefits were particularly clear during the pandemic, when LUKS used Microsoft PowerApps to create a solution that helped staff triage patients eligible for a COVID-19 antibody therapy. Built in just a few days, the app has helped clinicians save time and treat hundreds of patients at a crucial time of need.

title: Elastic provides enhanced security with Azure Private Link
executive_summary: As a leading platform for data analytics solutions, Elastic powers the search box for some of the largest brands in the world, provides observability across multiple services, and helps secure tens of thousands of devices. Customers ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies are using Elastic’s Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security solutions. Elastic Cloud, its hosted and managed offering available via Microsoft Azure Marketplace, allows customers to securely search, analyze, and visualize their data, to keep mission-critical applications running smoothly, and to protect against cyber threats.

title: Solocal uses Azure Virtual Desktop to virtualize its sales teams’ working environment
executive_summary: Solocal is a premier digital partner for local companies in France, from small or medium-sized businesses to large companies with extensive networks. It aims to vitalize local life, striving every day to unveil the full potential of all companies by connecting them to their customers through its innovative digital services. With a turnover of 428 million euros in 2021, Solocal advises more than 304,000 companies across France and supports them in boosting their activity through digital services. Whether it be digital advertising, marketing, or website creation, the sales teams run the show in terms of offering advice and expertise to the group's various clients. At the end of 2019, Solocal made the decision to move these vital teams to a virtual workspace so they could enjoy an increasingly modern and agile working environment. The group's Infrastructure and Operations Department and Technical Department set about testing this setup, unaware that just a few weeks later COVID-19 would force them to ramp up their efforts.

title: MoE and Microsoft Collaborate to Ensure Education Continuity in Saudi Arabia
executive_summary: Maintaining continuity in the education domain is not easy when the infrastructure needed for teaching and learning is inaccessible to teachers and students. The COVID-19 pandemic has only hampered this continuity, in addition to obstructing activity in every walk of life across the world. People experienced prolonged lockdowns in the first half of 2020 and restricted movements in the second half of the year, and, aside from a handful of organizations, most businesses in every sector worldwide temporarily halted their activities as a result of the pandemic. The Saudi Ministry of Education (MoE) was an exception — the virus did not deter the MoE's determination to impart K-12 education to students across Saudi Arabia.

title: Uniting support for people with disabilities using Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Serving more than 70,000 disabled people every year across the UK, Africa, and Asia, the UK-based charity Leonard Cheshire wanted to better understand its broad spectrum of supporters, improve supporter communications, and create a stronger supporter base. Knowing that as with the for-profit sector, it’s more efficient to retain existing “customers” vs. recruit new ones, Leonard Cheshire chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights to help them create more cohesive supporter experiences. Now, the organization has a 360-degree view of supporters, providing a new perspective that has helped Leonard Cheshire transform communications from organization-centric to supporter-centric, and better unify and align their supporter base with their mission.

title: Exxaro unites on-premises and cloud infrastructure into a single monitoring solution with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Since 2017, Exxaro Resources has been on an ambitious transformation journey. In addition to upgrading its IT infrastructure, the South African company has built a sustainable growth impact strategy that lays out the company’s aim to “transition from a coal base to a minerals and renewable energy solutions business that will thrive in a low-carbon future.” It credits its successes in part to a strategic, well-managed, and digital-first approach to innovation and operations, which most recently included refreshing its Wi-Fi, LTE, and internet-based networks and moving an initial set of datacenters to Microsoft Azure to unlock the power of the cloud.
