title: QHR empowers doctors and their patients with a platform to connect with Azure Communication Services
executive_summary: QHR Technologies is changing the way we interact with healthcare. Approximately one in every four Canadian healthcare providers rely on QHR’s electronic medical software solution to keep patient records secure and organized. To help patients connect with clinics and their doctors, QHR created Medeo, an app that enables virtual visits, messaging, check-ins, appointment scheduling, file sharing, and other communication needs. Medeo uses Microsoft Azure Cloud and Azure Communication Services to provide modern, advanced capabilities that support a best-in-class patient experience. With Azure Communication Services, Medeo is proving a more accessible, streamlined, and proactive healthcare system for patients and healthcare providers across Canada.

title: NCOC overhauls ITM project management processes with Project for the web and Power Platform
executive_summary: The North Caspian Operating Company (NCOC), a leading oil and gas company from Kazakhstan, is revamping its Information Technology Management (ITM) project management processes. To increase visibility, make collaboration easier, create efficient KPI management and reporting, the team relied on Microsoft’s Project for the web and the Power Platform. According to Maxat Shaumenov, the Head of IT Project Delivery, “All key pieces of information are structured in one place now, making it possible to control costs, manage risks and issues, and plan our resources. We are now resolving issues three times faster than before.”

title: Swiss ITP helps e-mobility provider create a smart, uniform IT environment
executive_summary: Swiss E-Mobility Group (Schweiz) AG (SEMG) sells its products in Switzerland and throughout the DACH region. New brands are constantly being added to its portfolio. The acquisition of e-bike retailer m-way presented SEMG with a huge challenge. A complex branch operation with its own data center needed to be integrated as intelligently as possible. The objective was to establish a uniform, smart IT environment for the entire Group. With the support of Microsoft partner Swiss IT Professional AG, all systems and servers were migrated to the Azure cloud. The new environment is fully scalable, cost-effective to operate, and provides the ideal conditions for flexible growth. With Azure Kubernetes Services, it was also possible to create an omnichannel platform covering all channels. This offers customers a comprehensive overview and an optimized shopping experience.

title: Good cooperation: How Borealis enables new sites to work safely
executive_summary:
The Austrian chemical company Borealis, headquartered in Vienna, is the world's eighth largest producer of polyethylene and polypropylene.
After acquiring new sites worldwide, a lot of time had to be invested in the past to adapt the local infrastructures to Borealis' compliance standards. New corporate partners had to be brought on board as easily as possible and a secure working environment had to be created quickly. For this, remote work was relied on with the help of Microsoft's Azure Virtual Desktop, thus saving not only hardware but also time. Instead of waiting for a Borealis device to be delivered, partners now only need a laptop - and gain access to the Borealis network.

title: Relias enhances data-driven training and reporting for health organizations with Power BI and Azure Synapse
executive_summary: Serving more than 11,000 healthcare organizations across the United States, Relias helps its clients measurably improve patient outcomes and advance healthcare talent. Customers use Relias solutions to retain staff, elevate care quality, and reduce risk. As a data-driven organization, Relias relies on analytics to help clients reach their goals. But with data spanning across multiple sources and hundreds of tables, and acquired technology platforms that required consolidation, Relias needed a centralized solution. Using Microsoft Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics, the organization built a platform that generates actionable insights for its clients, helping to deliver life-saving healthcare education with greater speed, efficiency, and effectiveness.

title: Business Development Bank of Canada filters Microsoft Exchange content with Connecting Software´s custom solution built in just two months
executive_summary: Business Development Bank of Canada (BDC) is a leading bank for Canadian entrepreneurs and provides small and medium-sized businesses with financing and advisory services. BDC’s investment arm, BDC Capital, engaged Connecting Software to provide a custom solution to protect information on Microsoft Exchange from exposure when integrated with third-party CRM and relationship intelligence platforms. Connecting Software customized its CB Exchange Server Sync to enable robust, unidirectional filtering for Exchange mailboxes and content. The customization was built and deployed in two months, providing an encrypted integration featuring rules-based filtering that powers BDC to better serve its customers.

title: Make-A-Wish® continues its mission of hope and embraces innovation with help from Surface devices
executive_summary: Renowned around the world for creating life-changing wishes for children with critical illnesses, Make-A-Wish had a bold new vision to digitally transform its operations. It needed to standardize its IT services and devices across geographically dispersed staff and volunteer teams, and portability and ease-of-use were paramount to maximizing productivity and streamlining operations. Make-A-Wish selected Microsoft Surface Laptop 4 to help transform how it restores hope and joy for wish kids and their families when they need it most.

title: The robot whisperers: KUKA develops automation solutions in the cloud
executive_summary: Manufacturing companies are relying more and more on automation to make their own production safer and more efficient. Ultramodern robots, such as those made by the automation specialist KUKA, autonomously perform dangerous process steps on the production line and thus relieve employees of the risk. As one of the world’s leading suppliers of intelligent automation solutions, KUKA is continuously enhancing its own automation technology with the in-house IT department providing and programming the complex applications that employees use on a daily basis. In North and South America, KUKA has now migrated much of its IT operations to the Azure cloud platform. This guarantees low latencies and rapid availability.

title: Wolters Kluwer Legal & Regulatory improves efficiency and drives better outcomes for legal professionals with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Wolters Kluwer Legal & Regulatory partnered with Microsoft’s Modern Work Customer Co-Innovation team to develop a game-changing legal workflow enhancement solution by incorporating its winning content with Microsoft 365. The solution is a Word add-in that sources and offers relevant, valuable legal content that professionals can immediately draw upon as they review documents. Using the solution vastly improves legal professionals’ workflow and focus because they don’t need to jump between screens and applications while reviewing a document.

title: More persuasive than any presentation: SAP test environment in the cloud at the click of a button thanks to SAP on Azure
executive_summary: It takes a lot of time and money to plan an SAP system, build the necessary infrastructure, install software, and define databases. A crucial consideration for 2S – Security Solutions GmbH and its Extended Access Management solution for SAP. The software has to be installed on different SAP releases and tested accordingly in advance. Thanks to the Project Phoenix tool based on Microsoft Azure, this now happens quickly and easily in a complete SAP system at the click of a button, and is even invoiced transparently according to use.

title: RapidDeploy drives innovation in public safety with cloud-native mapping and analytics using Azure for US Government and Power BI
executive_summary: When RapidDeploy brought its cloud-native emergency response platform to the United States, it met initial resistance from public safety officials who doubted its ability to meet their standards for security, reliability, and uptime. Responding to the demands of the market, RapidDeploy partnered with Microsoft to build its platform with high availability and cybersecurity in mind.

title: Arizona Department of Education boosts backup capability, compliance, and data privacy on a tight budget with Azure BCDR
executive_summary: Working in IT for a government organization can sometimes be more challenging than a private enterprise because of intense budgetary pressures. These IT challenges at the Arizona Department of Education (ADE) fall squarely on the shoulders of Head of Production Services Edward Block and Infrastructure Manager Chris Henry, both of whom are wizards of scrappy, innovative thinking and doing more with less. ADE manages the state’s K-12 public education system, which with more than 1 million students and 51,000 teachers in 2,380 public schools is the fourteenth largest in the United States.

title: Colas Group uses Power Platform to fuel innovation—and responsible, sustainable solutions
executive_summary: The Colas Group, a subsidiary of the Bouygues Group, has one mission: to imagine, build, and maintain sustainable transport infrastructure. Backed by a network of 800 construction business units and 3,000 material production units in more than 50 countries on five continents, the Group’s 57,000 employees act locally to connect communities and foster connection for today and tomorrow. Colas’ ambition is to be the world leader in innovative, sustainable mobility solutions.

title: How Microsoft improves leadership communications with Viva
executive_summary: This article is part of a series that describes how Microsoft Viva was developed and deployed at Microsoft. In this sixth installment, we build on chapter five to describe how Microsoft leadership is using Viva Engage to improve company communications.

title: SSP Group serves up transformational change with Microsoft SharePoint
executive_summary: When I arrived, I inherited a very fragmented architecture. We had 35 different systems in 35 different countries and a lot of those systems were reaching end of life,” explains Mark Smith, Chief Digital & Technology Officer at SSP Group. “We had to face into that technology obsolescence. We could continue with the old way of doing things or we could do something transformative.”

title: Banking on speed and performance: Why Banqsoft is upgrading to SQL Server 2022
executive_summary: Banqsoft is a Nordic-based market leader offering software solutions for asset finance, digital banking, and credit management. Combining cutting-edge technology with industry expertise, the company helps its customers stay competitive in an increasingly digital financial landscape.

title: Malaysian aviation ground handler helps airlines elevate customer service standards
executive_summary: Malaysia’s independent licensed ground handler, Pos Aviation, has positioned itself at the edge of innovation, offering a suite of aviation services to commercial airlines across the country. The company provides cargo, handling, in-flight catering, and e-commerce in addition to aircraft maintenance and engineering services. Faced with rapid growth, Pos Aviation has refreshed its legacy systems and boosted IT efficiency while empowering its customers. In addition, the company has enhanced internal and external automation and reporting capabilities with Microsoft Power Platform, including Power Apps and Power BI, and streamlined teamwork via Microsoft Teams.

title: FirstGroup accelerates business, reduces emissions with the centralized visibility and management of Azure Arc and Azure Monitor
executive_summary: As one of the United Kingdom’s leading public transportation providers, FirstGroup knows how to make the trains, and busses, run on time. Its bus and rail operators speedily and reliably connect people, places, and communities across the United Kingdom because they never lose sight of the value of smart and efficient management. And that’s no small feat considering that the company moved more than 1.4 million passengers over the past year with a fleet of almost 9,000 vehicles.

title: Wichita Public Schools empowers 60,000 students and staff by creating virtual classrooms and hybrid work capabilities on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Wichita Public Schools, serving nearly 50,000 students and almost 10,000 teachers and staff, initiated an online communications platform using Microsoft Teams, making virtual classrooms, remote work capabilities, and in-network communications possible. Its IT staff had to move quickly after COVID-19 made in-person school and work unavailable at its 94 public schools and special program sites. Coordination with its existing UC infrastructure was also required. Wichita Public Schools’ relationship with Microsoft partner NEC, the school district’s PSTN provider, expedited seamless connection to Microsoft Teams without interruption, preparing the district for the future of remote work communication and online education.

title: Government of Albania recovers from cyberattack in three days, builds resilience with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: When the Government of Albania faced a sophisticated nation-state attack, the Albanian National Agency for Information Society (AKSHI) responded quickly and decisively. In the face of a double-pronged assault - a decoy ransomware attack coupled with a "wiper" attack designed to destroy systems and data - AKSHI took swift action by isolating its infrastructure and shutting down critical systems to prevent damage.

title: Bulutistan extends Azure services to local cloud with Azure Arc–enabled SQL Managed Instance
executive_summary: As one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Türkiye, Bulutistan is helping to enable its customers’ digital transformation while keeping data within the country’s borders. Bulutistan is turning to Azure Arc to provide its customers with Azure services while keeping data on-premises in accordance with the country’s data sovereignty laws. A recent proof of concept and pilot test of Azure Arc–enabled SQL Managed Instance in September 2022 convinced Bulutistan that it could extend the Azure services and security that its customers need to accelerate the pace of innovation and do more with less.

title: Enabling safe, healthy & sustainable spaces with data-led innovative IoT platform
executive_summary: Morgan Sindall Property Services is a property maintenance provider with over 30 years of experience within the housing sector. The company provides planned and reactive maintenance to over 200,000 domestic properties.

title: Carnival Corporation sets sail to the edge and achieves enhanced agility with Azure Arc–enabled infrastructure
executive_summary: As the world’s leading cruise operator, Carnival Corporation is focused on delivering unforgettable happiness to millions of guests annually by providing extraordinary cruise vacations. Faced with the challenge of deploying the latest technology in remote areas with limited connection, the cruise industry has historically faced barriers with digital transformation. Despite its size and scale as a globally distributed business with nine world-class brands and 92 passenger ships, however, Carnival Corporation has managed to put innovation at the forefront to support its employees in reimagining guest experiences.

title: Understanding how forces act: Azure IoT helps fischer carry out continuous structural monitoring and thus enhance safety
executive_summary: From scaffold struts and concrete formworks to the jib and boom of a crane, many engineering structures are held together by bolts. Buildings and structures are subject to extreme forces that need to be monitored and documented to ensure that their functionality and load-bearing capacity is maintained. To this end, German start-up Connected Products—which forms part of fischerwerke GmbH & Co. KG—chose to base its Construction Monitoring solution on Azure IoT. Based in Baden-Württemberg, fischerwerke is a family-run SME that specializes in fixing and fastening technologies. The company prides itself on its ingenuity, offering products such as SensorAnchor and SensorDisc that improve the safety and service life of civil engineering structures by making construction monitoring more transparent and facilitating predictive maintenance.

title: More intelligent banking and innovative customer engagement for Goals101 with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Goals101 is on a mission to make banking personalized, automated, and delightful. It is a Transaction Behavioral Intelligence (TBI) company that accelerates business growth for banks using Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML).

title: Swiss ITP helps e-mobility provider create a smart, uniform IT environment
executive_summary: Swiss E-Mobility Group (Schweiz) AG (SEMG) sells its products in Switzerland and throughout the DACH region. New brands are constantly being added to its portfolio. The acquisition of e-bike retailer m-way presented SEMG with a huge challenge. A complex branch operation with its own data center needed to be integrated as intelligently as possible. The objective was to establish a uniform, smart IT environment for the entire Group. With the support of Microsoft partner Swiss IT Professional AG, all systems and servers were migrated to the Azure cloud. The new environment is fully scalable, cost-effective to operate, and provides the ideal conditions for flexible growth. With Azure Kubernetes Services, it was also possible to create an omnichannel platform covering all channels. This offers customers a comprehensive overview and an optimized shopping experience.

title: Good cooperation: How Borealis enables new sites to work safely
executive_summary:
The Austrian chemical company Borealis, headquartered in Vienna, is the world's eighth largest producer of polyethylene and polypropylene.
After acquiring new sites worldwide, a lot of time had to be invested in the past to adapt the local infrastructures to Borealis' compliance standards. New corporate partners had to be brought on board as easily as possible and a secure working environment had to be created quickly. For this, remote work was relied on with the help of Microsoft's Azure Virtual Desktop, thus saving not only hardware but also time. Instead of waiting for a Borealis device to be delivered, partners now only need a laptop - and gain access to the Borealis network.

title: Relias enhances data-driven training and reporting for health organizations with Power BI and Azure Synapse
executive_summary: Serving more than 11,000 healthcare organizations across the United States, Relias helps its clients measurably improve patient outcomes and advance healthcare talent. Customers use Relias solutions to retain staff, elevate care quality, and reduce risk. As a data-driven organization, Relias relies on analytics to help clients reach their goals. But with data spanning across multiple sources and hundreds of tables, and acquired technology platforms that required consolidation, Relias needed a centralized solution. Using Microsoft Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics, the organization built a platform that generates actionable insights for its clients, helping to deliver life-saving healthcare education with greater speed, efficiency, and effectiveness.

title: Dell Technologies supports innovation and boosts knowledge sharing in a hybrid world with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: When Bruce Sánchez, Global Lead for Sales Learning and Development Technology at Dell Technologies, thinks about  team members learning new information or skills—like cloud solutions or negotiating—he knows it’s often in response to a tactical obstacle. “In the modern world, we seek and learn in the moment of need,” he says, referring to the range of options available to curious minds, from search engines to instructional videos. “We recognize that our sales team members are no different. They want to find the information they need, when they need it, no matter where they are.”

title: Recycling innovator uses computational simulations to build real-world sustainability solutions using Azure HPC
executive_summary: A lot of us believe in doing what we can to help fight climate change, and for many, that includes recycling. Of particular urgency is the recycling and management of plastics, one of the most impactful and pressing challenges in the sustainability sphere. Encina is an innovator at the highest level in this realm, breaking new ground with partner CPFD Software. With the help of Microsoft Azure high-performance computing (HPC), the company is designing the most powerful and promising plastic recycling solution on the horizon: circular products for a circular economy. To advance the urgent and vital work of designing next-generation recycling facilities, Encina and CPFD ran groundbreaking simulations using CPFD’s Barracuda Virtual Reactor software. In one of the largest real-world Virtual Reactor simulations ever run on any public cloud platform, they took full advantage of an advanced system from Azure and full stack accelerated computing from NVIDIA. Azure is enabling Encina and an expanding and varied pool of companies to provide innovative sustainability products and services to customers, generating potential solutions for critical global problems.

title: Koppert seeds transformation with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: For more than 50 years, the mission of Koppert has been to make agriculture and horticulture healthier, safer, more productive, and more sustainable, working in partnership with nature. Founded in 1967 by grower and visionary Jan Koppert, the company has helped farmers and growers around the world maximize yields while reducing their environmental impact. Koppert advocates using natural enemies to combat pests, bumblebees for pollination, and microbials and biostimulants that naturally strengthen and protect crops. Because Koppert products are alive, it is paramount that customers receive their products in peak condition.

title: 100-Year-Old Retailer Canadian Tire Modernizes Data Platform with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Canadian Tire Corporation (CTC) is a group of companies that includes more than 1,700 retail and gasoline outlets across Canada. Its retail business is led by Canadian Tire, which was founded in 1922 and provides Canadians with products for life in Canada across its Living, Playing, Fixing, Automotive and Seasonal & Gardening divisions. With an increased focus on leveraging technology to improve retail experiences and better serve customers, CTC is looking to leverage near-real-time insights and prioritize data-driven decision-making. As a result, the organization decided to shift their data to the cloud. With Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI, CTC has started to bring near real-time insights across their organization.

title: KUKA manages its robot fleets in real time with a software platform based on Azure IoT
executive_summary: Industrial robots work quickly, precisely, and almost around the clock in many fields, not just the automotive industry or electronics manufacturing. For their robot systems, automation specialist KUKA and its subsidiary Device Insight have developed the iiQoT software platform based on Microsoft Azure IoT. The platform provides important condition data in real time and enables remote monitoring of entire robot fleets. This allows efficient control of facility management, including fault monitoring and maintenance. An internal KUKA lighthouse project in the German city of Augsburg has shown that in one year of production, the platform saved 25 hours of machine downtime and administrative work.

title: Global aquaculture feed producer uses Microsoft Project to gain efficiencies, improve collaboration
executive_summary: Global aquaculture company BioMar wanted a change. Three departments were using an aging application to manage its product development cycle. The system was inefficient and not flexible enough to fit BioMar’s growth and product development needs. The organization sought a robust project management solution that would support its scientists and product managers to better collaborate and communicate, work more efficiently, and minimize manual processes. Today, BioMar is implementing a Microsoft-based project management solution that incorporates Microsoft Project, Power Platform, and Microsoft Teams that the company anticipates to roll out in Q1 2023.

title: Greek gaming leader optimizes its financial operations with S/4HANA on Azure
executive_summary: OPAP is the leading gaming company in Greece and one of the most renowned in its industry internationally. It is a sector leader in embedding global Responsible Gaming principles in its operations and supports Greek society in practice through an extensive corporate responsibility program focusing on health, sports and employment.

title: Ace Hardware International expands to global markets, onboarding franchises faster with Azure
executive_summary: To conduct leading-edge and highly accurate forecasting, it’s also essential that Climavision quickly and efficiently extracts maximum value from its data. The Azure HPC + AI platform provides the infrastructure and orchestration that Climavision’s resource-intensive workloads need. With the help of its Azure infrastructure, Climavision can now move as quickly as the weather changes.

title: Austrade improves CRM, supports Australian economic strategies with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Australian Trade and Investment Commission (Austrade) promotes economic prosperity by connecting Australian businesses to the world. Its previous CRM (customer relationship management) system was outdated and slow, leading the company to search for a solution that could manage new business processes, more effectively unify data, and provide more accurate and complete views of customers. Austrade was impressed by the capabilities of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales as a CRM tool, as well as with its connectivity to Dynamics 365 Customer Insights and Marketing. This, along with price, speed, and interoperability with the Microsoft stack and Azure, made Dynamics 365 Sales the clear choice for Austrade.

title: Egyptian building pioneer revamps project budget management with Oracle on Azure IaaS
executive_summary: Alexandria Construction Company (ACC) is a pioneer in large-scale infrastructure and construction projects and a leading contributor to Egypt’s economy. The company began its digital transformation by deploying the region’s first Oracle on Azure IaaS project. The solution is currently in its pilot phase at Noor—a smart city project that will set the benchmark in Egypt’s developmental landscape. Despite being in the testing stage, ACC has already saved on capital costs and human resources since deployment.

title: Kantar Group’s Media business accelerates insights, goes cloud-native with Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: MultiCare leads the way in healthcare data interoperability via a fully managed solution built with Microsoft and Microsoft partner 3Cloud
executive_summary: Growing healthcare organization MultiCare Health System teamed up with Microsoft and Microsoft partner 3Cloud to meet changing demands in health data access prompted by the use of fitness trackers and phones. MultiCare wanted a scalable, interoperable data exchange framework to connect providers, patients, and payers—key for success in population health and value-based care. It also required an adaptable solution. Working with Microsoft FHIR experts and partnering with 3Cloud, MultiCare built a unique, fully managed solution using Microsoft Azure. The results have surpassed expectations: in three months, MultiCare has seen a significant reduction in administrative burden with a $50 per-chart cost savings and a 65 percent reduction in labor.

title: OriGen accelerates reservoir simulations by 1,000 times with Azure AI infrastructure
executive_summary: New York City–based software developer OriGen is revolutionizing the energy industry with proprietary AI models supported by Microsoft Azure AI infrastructure. OriGen’s AI solutions focus on three key areas—energy reservoir simulations, geological modeling, and operational optimization—to deliver extremely high speed and accuracy and empower better decision-making for energy industry customers. Using Azure AI infrastructure, OriGen has fast, easy access to the compute resources required to drive its NVIDIA GPU-based solutions and the means to deploy its powerful offering as a software as a service platform.

title: Unbanked no more: CWallet empowers migrant workers to access financial services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: For migrant workers in Qatar, accessing financial services can be hugely challenging. That’s where CWallet comes in—”We want to foster inclusivity and bring full financial services to an underserved community and to microbusinesses,” shares Co-founder and CEO of CWallet Michael Javier. With Microsoft Azure, the company has built a secure fintech platform that is trusted among its customers and set up for strong business continuity.

title: ABN AMRO Bank optimizes financial crime detection with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: "Banking for better, for generations to come"—this mission drives ABN AMRO Bank, a Netherlands-based financial institution committed to vigilance against financial crime. With financial crime on the rise, the bank realized that it needed a new approach to handle its vast transactional data. Embracing technology, it employed Microsoft's Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics to increase efficiency. The major improvement, however, came with the bank’s use of Azure Data Explorer (ADX). With ADX, ABN AMRO revamped its due diligence process by increasing its speed in and capacity for handling billions of transactions.

title: British Columbia’s Provincial Health Services Authority improves healthcare through better data access, insights with Azure
executive_summary: When Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) began seeing the need to deliver faster, more comprehensive health insights to healthcare workers across British Columbia, it took action. Old, unstandardized requests were slowing data analysis and the sharing of insights. To standardize and speed data access, PHSA moved its healthcare analytics platform to Microsoft Azure, creating a readily accessible data analysis platform that is scalable and secure. Data requests that once took many months now take only days. Because of the sensitive nature of health data, PHSA has worked closely with Microsoft to make sure health data never leaves Canada and is kept highly secure.

title: AI-enhanced operations management for growing enterprises with CoreStack and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Founded in 2016 and headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, with offices in Chennai, India; Dubai, and London, CoreStack is a multi-cloud governance platform that empowers customers to confidently leverage cloud services. CoreStack governs more than $2 billion worth of cloud assets for over 750 customers and partners across major hyperscalers like Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and VMware. CoreStack’s AI-powered platform abstracts complexity in rapidly changing multi-cloud environments, accelerating time to value and enabling enterprises to realize their digital ambitions.

title: AXA chooses Azure to offer next-generation digital services and transform its customers' healthcare journey
executive_summary: To meet the ever-evolving customer expectations, AXA, one of the world's leading insurers, has leveraged the power of Azure technology and the expertise of Microsoft and Healthanea to develop value-added services that integrate digital and physical healthcare journeys, while offering patients proactive support, from the detection of their first symptoms through to their medical treatment. The result is a platform, which connects hospitals, pharmaceuticals, heath tech solutions, insurers and more to provide patients with improved and frictionless access to healthcare.

title: Ontario aids marginalized populations with cloud-based collaborative solution on Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: To help communities participating in multi-sectoral risk intervention models better engage with at-risk individuals and reduce reliance on police for a variety of nonviolent incidents, the Ontario Government developed its Risk-driven Tracking Database on Microsoft Dynamics 365. Under agreement with the Ministry of the Solicitor General, governmental and not-for-profit organizations across the province have access, free of charge, to the solution. They use it to help standardize the collection and analysis of de-identified risk-based information at the local and provincial level. The government is reducing reliance on police to address the root causes of diverse societal issues such as homelessness, drug overdose, and violence.

title: Intralox boosts customer service effectiveness with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Intralox, a subsidiary of Laitram Corporation, provides highly specialized and innovative conveyance technologies and services that enhance food safety, power e-commerce, and solve material handling challenges for food processing, industrial manufacturing, and logistics industries worldwide. The industry leader in complex conveyance systems, Intralox focuses on continual improvement to meet the evolving needs of its customers.

title: Murdoch’s unifies retail operations and POS with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Murdoch’s Ranch & Home Supply has met the needs of farmers and ranchers, do-it-yourselfers, and outdoor enthusiasts since opening its first store in Bozeman, Montana, in 1994. Today, more than 2000 Murdoch’s employees sell over 300,000 products in 40 stores via two distribution centers throughout the west and on its e-commerce site. Murdoch’s friendly, knowledgeable service staff help customers discover its breadth of products to find everything from fence posts and animal feed to toys, tools, and tack.

title: Citizen developers find creative ways to help Shell run safer, smarter and more efficiently with Power Platform
executive_summary: Shell launched its citizen-development initiative four years ago in a program called DIY (Do IT Yourself) with Power Platform. Two years ago, the company established a dedicated center of excellence within the digital engineering function to “empower every employee to digitize work processes to improve productivity, increase agility and create more value for customers.” Today, DIY is driving previously unimagined efficiencies, empowering workers to accelerate the company’s digital transformation.

title: Atrium improves efficiency and cuts 80 percent of costs with Microsoft Power Apps and SAP on Azure
executive_summary: From 40 to just six days for crucial approvals and 80 percent cost-savings after a shift to the cloud: Atrium Quality Contractors isn't just building Egypt's landmarks; it's redefining construction management. As the prominent arm of Talaat Moustafa Group, Egypt's largest publicly listed real estate developer, Atrium focuses on innovating every facet of its business. From using Power Apps to digitize business workflows to migrating SAP on Azure to streamline construction-related processes, the contractor turned a manual workflow nightmare into a breeze, saving 60 percent of day-to-day team efforts. On top of it, it brought business continuity, scalability, and high cybersecurity.

title: Fujitsu Japan rebuilt their solution by fully utilizing Azure PaaS! What’s the advantage of “Java on Azure” and what’s appealing about it?
executive_summary: Fujitsu Japan is accelerating conversion of their solutions to cloud. The “TradeFront” series, the company’s EDI solution offered to retailing, wholesale, and manufacturing industries, is also one of them. By 2020, the company had built a shared infrastructure on Microsoft Azure where their SaaS services can be built, and in 2022, they built a new master data management (MDM) function by fully utilizing Azure PaaS. Amidst the rapid changes in business environments, master data management is one of the keys in promoting digital transformation (DX). We interviewed people in charge to hear what advantages have been created by full-scale introduction of PaaS, what roles Azure have played and keys in promoting “Java on Azure”.

title: How Microsoft Dynamics 365 is helping Securitas to transform operations and make the world a safer place
executive_summary: Swedish security services provider Securitas is committed to keeping millions of people and organizations around the world safe by combining people with technology. As part of this mission, Securitas has rolled out a CRM platform that relies on Dynamics 365 to better support its sales teams, get greater insights via sales and customer data and foster greater transparency and collaboration across its client teams.

title: 10x efficiency: Atera enables better IT management with its AI-powered IT Platform
executive_summary: "Empowering IT professionals to reach 10x IT efficiency" is the vision of Atera, a software company based in Tel Aviv, Israel. Its AI-powered IT Platform with Azure OpenAI Service integration provides an all-encompassing view of IT activities, proactively identifying issues and offering immediate solutions. The AI engine also allows end users to troubleshoot and auto-resolve tickets without IT intervention. With this, IT professionals can focus on critical tasks, reducing the first response time to zero and enhancing IT teams' capacity exponentially. Atera's AI-powered IT Platform isn’t just a product, it is a gamechanger for IT management worldwide.

title: Atrium improves efficiency and cuts 80 percent of costs with Microsoft Power Apps and SAP on Azure
executive_summary: From 40 to just six days for crucial approvals and 80 percent cost-savings after a shift to the cloud: Atrium Quality Contractors isn't just building Egypt's landmarks; it's redefining construction management. As the prominent arm of Talaat Moustafa Group, Egypt's largest publicly listed real estate developer, Atrium focuses on innovating every facet of its business. From using Power Apps to digitize business workflows to migrating SAP on Azure to streamline construction-related processes, the contractor turned a manual workflow nightmare into a breeze, saving 60 percent of day-to-day team efforts. On top of it, it brought business continuity, scalability, and high cybersecurity.

title: Fujitsu Japan rebuilt their solution by fully utilizing Azure PaaS! What’s the advantage of “Java on Azure” and what’s appealing about it?
executive_summary: Fujitsu Japan is accelerating conversion of their solutions to cloud. The “TradeFront” series, the company’s EDI solution offered to retailing, wholesale, and manufacturing industries, is also one of them. By 2020, the company had built a shared infrastructure on Microsoft Azure where their SaaS services can be built, and in 2022, they built a new master data management (MDM) function by fully utilizing Azure PaaS. Amidst the rapid changes in business environments, master data management is one of the keys in promoting digital transformation (DX). We interviewed people in charge to hear what advantages have been created by full-scale introduction of PaaS, what roles Azure have played and keys in promoting “Java on Azure”.

title: How Microsoft Dynamics 365 is helping Securitas to transform operations and make the world a safer place
executive_summary: Swedish security services provider Securitas is committed to keeping millions of people and organizations around the world safe by combining people with technology. As part of this mission, Securitas has rolled out a CRM platform that relies on Dynamics 365 to better support its sales teams, get greater insights via sales and customer data and foster greater transparency and collaboration across its client teams.
