executive_summary: "Empowering IT professionals to reach 10x IT efficiency" is the vision of Atera, a software company based in Tel Aviv, Israel. Its AI-powered IT Platform with Azure OpenAI Service integration provides an all-encompassing view of IT activities, proactively identifying issues and offering immediate solutions. The AI engine also allows end users to troubleshoot and auto-resolve tickets without IT intervention. With this, IT professionals can focus on critical tasks, reducing the first response time to zero and enhancing IT teams' capacity exponentially. Atera's AI-powered IT Platform isn’t just a product, it is a gamechanger for IT management worldwide.

title: Bank Credit Dnipro secures banking services for customers with Microsoft Azure amidst instability
executive_summary: Founded in 1993, Bank Credit Dnipro (BCD) is a leading Ukrainian financial institution committed to anticipating and answering the needs of tomorrow. When Ukraine faced external conflict in 2022, BCD rushed to preserve its infrastructure and banking services for customers. With the support of Microsoft and partner Kyivstar, the bank embarked on a rapid digital transformation powered by Microsoft Azure. The solution has enabled secure card processing for 65,000 cardholders and stable remote working possibilities. BCD now operates with a robust failover mechanism, bolstering financial security and ensuring business continuity.

title: Samaritan Health Services empowers caregivers and patients with Epic on Azure
executive_summary: To better serve its community of employees and patients, Samaritan Health Services decided to shift to cloud-based management of its electronic health records (EHR) and data systems. After successfully implementing an IT disaster recovery solution, the organization moved its Epic production environment to Microsoft Azure, helping to modernize EHR management, gain agility and flexibility in managing patient data, and cut back the cost of running on-premises datacenters.

title: EY embraces Azure SQL Managed Instance and unlocks scalability and cost efficiency
executive_summary: Ernst & Young LLP (EY), a globally recognized professional services firm, stands at the forefront of delivering excellence in assurance, advisory, tax, and transaction advisory services. With a commitment to building a better working world, they help clients navigate today's complex business landscape with clarity and confidence.
products: Azure Blob Storage, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Managed Instance, SQL Server

title: Beiersdorf has a clear view of its sustainability progress—thanks to Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and a central data corpus
executive_summary: To set the company on a path that clearly benefits the environment and society, Beiersdorf launched its CARE BEYOND SKIN Sustainability Agenda, which features specific sustainability targets: achieve an absolute reduction of 30 percent in greenhouse gas emissions by 2025 along the entire value chain versus 2018 and make all packaging refillable, reusable, or recyclable by 2025. In order to make progress along this path transparent and measurable, precise KPIs are needed to obtain accurate data that reveals levers with maximum impact on these targets. Beiersdorf has therefore initiated a dedicated Sustainability Digitalization Program that uses a data analysis platform based on Microsoft Azure and Power Platform.

title: Dyno-Rod reduces friction in the field and improves outcomes with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Dyno-Rod has been expertly clearing drains, fixing burst pipes, and providing a range of plumbing solutions, including leak detection and radiator repair/replacement, for households and businesses across the United Kingdom since 1963. Known for personalized service and its familiar orange vans, the privately held business was acquired by the Centrica group in 2004 and is now part of British Gas and Scottish Gas. Dyno-Rod has one of the UK’s largest plumbing and drains forces. Its network of over 1,100 certified engineers, 54 franchisee businesses, and local support teams serves over 1 million customers per year—consistently scoring 4.7 stars out of 5 in satisfaction surveys.

title: Centrica develops over 800 business solutions with Power Platform
executive_summary: Centrica is a leading energy services and solutions provider and the UK’s biggest retailer of zero carbon electricity. The company’s use of Power Platform has grown from 300 apps in 2019 to over 800 business solutions today - from simple productivity solutions to advanced, enterprise-wide solutions. A Center of Excellence helps maintain governance and supports almost 330 makers and 15,000 users across the company. Total savings from Power Platform development is estimated at $4.4 million over four years compared to other development options.

title: House of HR enhances security across its diverse organization with the Microsoft 365 E5 bundle
executive_summary: House of HR is a pan-European company specializing in Human Resources services including staffing, consultancy and recruitment. Headquartered in Belgium, it has around 5,000 employees located in over 800 branches. The company has an aggressive growth policy that includes the widespread acquisition of small to mid-sized organizations, which however retain a high degree of autonomy. Ensuring an excellent standard of security for all parts of the organization – and the data of the millions of candidates they process each year – is a challenge that the team has addressed with several Microsoft solutions such as the Microsoft 365 E5 bundle. Including security solutions Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Purview and Microsoft Sentinel, the new stack has successfully raised security KPIs and maturity levels across the entire company.

title: Fujitsu's ERP, GLOVIA, Now Migratable to Azure or Newly Introduced on Azure. Connects to Cloud Services, Aims to Resolve 2025 Digital Cliff
executive_summary: Having supported the accounting operations of Japanese companies for nearly 50 years, ”GLOVIA” has strengthened its collaboration with Azure, completed verification, and is already being adopted with Azure by multiple companies. “GLOVIA SUMMIT, Fujitsu Group’s Accounting Solution” for major companies has been providing it as SaaS or IaaS using the company’s platform since 2019. They say that the background for strengthening the collaboration with Azure is that the need for Azure usage is increasing among customer companies, and that it enables them to provide customers with value-added services even more by using Azure’s various technologies and services. We interviewed Fujitsu’s developers who promotes GLOVIA SUMMIT business.

title: Usina Santa Adélia gains flexibility, robustness, and security with data center migration to Azure
executive_summary: The company found in the cloud the possibility of modernizing its technology infrastructure, drove application development, and, with the potential for integrations, also installed a platform that provided peace of mind for remote work during the pandemic, with simple usability. What was driven by security was gradually becoming a digital transformation by the possibilities generated by Azure.

title: McCormick brings employees and information together with Viva Connections
executive_summary: McCormick is known as a global leader in flavor. The company’s range of brands and products are enjoyed by millions of consumers around the world every day. Integral to the organization’s ongoing success is the 13,500-strong team behind these household and restaurant favorites, and finding ways to connect, inform, and engage with them is a key component of the company’s growth strategy. However, one of the tools to help with this—the company’s intranet—lacked modern functionality. In response, McCormick built a new employee portal with Microsoft Viva Connections. MKC Connect offers vibrant multimedia assets that are accessible to all employees through mobile-first technology, and its content management system enables updates to be made quickly and efficiently. Feedback has been excellent so far, and the real-time analytics in Viva Connections demonstrate the site’s growing popularity. McCormick has exciting plans to add new personalized functionality and content, giving the company a solid foundation for future growth in this key area of employee engagement.

title: Employees at Principal Financial Group use Microsoft Viva Goals to drive strategic alignment and enable business growth
executive_summary: Principal was successfully tracking ongoing corporate strategy within its multiple lines of business, but mapping goals across the entire company created challenges. Aligning to an enterprise-wide strategic vision was necessary for future company growth. Viva Goals integration with Microsoft 365 apps allowed the company to incorporate the product into daily workflows. Using a Microsoft 365 E3 license, the company deployed Viva Goals in a phased rollout to align priorities. The company's check-in Pulse Survey reported employee sentiment as a positive 4% increase from five months earlier.

title: OpenEdges Technology gains confidence in Microsoft 365 security and cost-effectiveness through Microsoft Solution Assessments
executive_summary: OpenEdges Technology is a semiconductor IP specialist company that develops and supplies modules required by various semiconductor companies based on semiconductor design technology. It easily supplies various design technologies, including memory controllers, interconnects, and NPUs, which embed the potential of artificial intelligence, to semiconductor products. OpenEdges Technology is contributing to the significant semiconductor growth in South Korea.

title: BanCoppel increases productivity with Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations
executive_summary: The Mexican company BanCoppel chose Microsoft solutions to automate manual processes and was able to increase the efficiency and productivity of its operations.

title: American Engineering Testing (AET) builds a foundation on Dynamics 365
executive_summary: American Engineering Testing (AET) is a premier provider of geotechnical engineering, construction materials testing and engineering, environmental consulting, building performance, petrography and chemistry, and specialized laboratory services. Since 1974, the employee-owned firm has provided critical investigation, analysis, and engineering consulting services that deliver certainty in a field that leaves no room for error, helping structure owners, contractors, and materials suppliers perform at their best from planning and design to successful project completion.

title: Taking the innovation leap: Tervisekassa boosts security and innovation with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Tervisekassa, the Estonian Health Insurance Fund, wanted to modernize its infrastructure to enhance health services while keeping sensitive healthcare data safe. As the first step in its journey to innovation and digital transformation, it partnered with Microsoft and Fujitsu Estonia to migrate its infrastructure, including SAP, to Azure. With a scalable infrastructure, Tervisekassa tripled its innovation rate, adding 21 new customer-oriented services without increasing resources. It safeguarded its data and systems, and lowered infrastructure and maintenance costs while continuing to provide reliable healthcare to Estonians.

title: Auteco Mobility migrates 95% of its server infrastructure to Azure and decentralizes its operation
executive_summary: The company achieved improvements between 30% and 100% of critical processes and achieved stability within 2 weeks of starting implementation. The migration allowed it to filter operational loads and reduce its server count from 52 to 36, providing benefits in performance, availability, and agility.

title: Warwickshire County Council simplifies IT management and enhances employee experience with Microsoft Surface
executive_summary: Following an earlier 2019 decision to standardise on Microsoft Surface devices via a leasing agreement, the council recently undertook an estate-wide device refresh programme. They confirmed that Surface continued to deliver the best overall value while enabling the council to build on the benefits achieved as a result of its earlier decision. The council has achieved its targeted cost efficiencies in ICT while also enabling a new way of working—more mobile and agile.

title: Kantar optimizes internal customer app experience with Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: Kantar is a global leader in marketing data, analytics, and insights, helping shape top brands in more than 100 markets. Previously, Kantar’s internal apps were siloed by location. Data was shared by securely emailing spreadsheets. The company used Azure Integration Services to create the KantarHub. Now, employees can access internal apps and share data in one place, simplifying daily processes for HR, Legal, and Compliance activities while modernizing data security. There are about 150 integrations, with more planned.

title: McKnight Foundation accelerates its mission and supports community partners with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Minnesota-based McKnight Foundation supports projects that promote justice, racial equity, the arts, and economic abundance locally and around the world. In line with its culture of innovation, it wanted to experiment with AI to improve internal operations.

title: Landscape Structures reimagines productivity with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Landscape Structures sought a fully integrated solution that could keep pace with its growth while streamlining and automating processes between sales, manufacturing, and finance.

title: MISO undergoes a digital transformation with Microsoft Industry Solutions Delivery
executive_summary: MISO is a regional transmission operator thatneeded a new data platform to manage, hedge against, and respond to market risks and opportunities as well as meet future energy demand to manage uncertainty and long-term planning.

title: Lexmark makes lasting impressions with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Lexmark’s places a premium on customer engagement but its legacy solutions were disparate, making tracking customer journeys complex and inefficient.

title: Burns & McDonnell leveraged Microsoft Azure to manage, store, and secure data
executive_summary: Accumulation of data from each construction project was housed in multiple locations, leading to delays in getting timely feedback to governance teams, leadership, and project teams.

title: Evergrowth accelerates sales growth with Microsoft Clipchamp
executive_summary: Evergrowth specializes in a Customer Intelligence platform that enables B2B sales team to operate AI-driven agents across the sales funnel. As a young company, it was focused on acquiring new customers and differentiating itself from competitors.

title: How Hellmann Worldwide Logistics transformed its global operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Hellmann Worldwide Logistics (Hellmann) sought to replace its legacy ERP with a scalable solution that increases transparency, productivity, and efficiency.

title: Bank of Queensland evolves operations, delivers business value with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Bank of Queensland wanted to launch a digital modernization strategy to ensure agility and resilience, build and scale for the future, and support its customer-first approach to business.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Copilot, Microsoft 365 Copilot

title: Waterair on its way to unrivaled customer experience with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The company has been in business for over half a century. It has brought its expertise to more than 120,000 customers and has won several awards for its innovation

title: Data encryption provider squashes compatibility challenges with latest Microsoft service
executive_summary: In the data security business, app compatibility issues can pose major risks to the customer relationship—especially for highly regulated enterprises. That’s why Canadian company WinMagic knew it needed Microsoft to quickly resolve two bugs causing its encryption app SecureDoc to stop working during Windows 10 updates. It worked closely with the Microsoft App Assure service to find a permanent fix. Now, WinMagic enjoys pain-free Windows 10 updates and a competitive advantage in its market while it boosts customer confidence in modern desktop technology.

title: Grupo Martí begins its digital transformation, supported by Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Multi X powers community engagement with Power Apps and other Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: N/A

title: Fundación Duoc UC Professional Institute works to bridge the gender gap in technology with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The Chilean institution provided, with the support of Microsoft, a series of training sessions for the Student Ambassador program and certification in Microsoft Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900) to more than 60 students to encourage their participation in the field of STEM careers.

title: Cochez and CIA power their digital transformation by basing their infrastructure on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Through Aludra Cloud, Hypernova Labs' solution based on Microsoft Azure, Cochez y CIA deployed e-invoicing to streamline their sales processes.

title: Confidently moving to the Cloud with Microsoft Unified Support
executive_summary: With the mission to help every person achieve their potential through access to world-class education, training, apprenticeships and care, the Department for Education (DfE) oversees 20,000 schools in England.

title: Manulife migrates and modernizes essential valuation application using Azure services
executive_summary: The financial services industry does not often embrace major change, but to Manulife, a progressive approach to IT is essential to modern business success. Manulife’s digital transformation includes moving IT resources and applications to the Microsoft Azure cloud platform, including its valuation system. For the innovative valuation system transformation project, the company’s developers used Azure services to modernize the valuation application and streamline development processes with workflows and automation that speed up time to market and reduce costs.
products: Azure, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Database, Power BI, Visual Studio

title: Global chemical manufacturer streamlines sales processes with Microsoft Power Platform and AI Builder
executive_summary: Global chemical company Hexion has been manufacturing specialty chemicals and performance materials for more than a century. The company is committed to safe manufacturing, community involvement, and making the world better, safer, and cleaner through “responsible chemistry.” Hexion uses Microsoft Power Platform to streamline and automate core business processes while also helping solve today’s most pressing issues to create a better future.

title: Bank of Queensland evolves operations, delivers business value with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Bank of Queensland wanted to launch a digital modernization strategy to ensure agility and resilience, build and scale for the future, and support its customer-first approach to business.

title: Waterair on its way to unrivaled customer experience with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The company has been in business for over half a century. It has brought its expertise to more than 120,000 customers and has won several awards for its innovation

title: Data encryption provider squashes compatibility challenges with latest Microsoft service
executive_summary: In the data security business, app compatibility issues can pose major risks to the customer relationship—especially for highly regulated enterprises. That’s why Canadian company WinMagic knew it needed Microsoft to quickly resolve two bugs causing its encryption app SecureDoc to stop working during Windows 10 updates. It worked closely with the Microsoft App Assure service to find a permanent fix. Now, WinMagic enjoys pain-free Windows 10 updates and a competitive advantage in its market while it boosts customer confidence in modern desktop technology.

title: Global software company Episerver uses Azure Data Explorer to gain enhanced consumer insight
executive_summary: Episerver is a global software company offering personalization services, web content management, digital commerce, and marketing. Seeking a better tool to optimize data storage and management that could also solve critical use cases—such as visitor segmenting based on historical activity—the company opted for Azure Data Explorer (ADX). Backed by ADX functionality, Episerver can nimbly meet customer requests and release an expanded feature set. As such, the company expects a reduction in cost and operational management and is now poised to explore additional system functionality.

title: Learn how Embassy, a leading real estate developer, made the leap to the cloud with Parablu and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Parablu, a Microsoft ISV partner headquartered in Santa Clara, California, provides secure data management solutions. The Parablu solution - BluVault for endpoints - addressed Embassy’s specific requirements for moving to the cloud infrastructure. BluVault allowed Embassy to work through its strategy for ensuring safe backup of data residing on employees’ laptops by leveraging Microsoft Azure enterprise cloud compute instances. Parablu also helped Embassy achieve its goal of using Microsoft OneDrive storage as a backup repository, rather than invest in additional storage.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, OneDrive for Business, SQL Server, Windows Server

title: Filing taxes in Poland is easy with a service developed by the Ministry of Finance and Microsoft Consulting Services
executive_summary: For most people, doing taxes is not something that’s at the top of the list of things they enjoy. Many find the process time-consuming, cumbersome, and stressful, and they wait until the last minute to complete it. Many rely on accountants or tax preparers.

title: Surface, Microsoft 365 and Teams transform the way healthcare teams work
executive_summary: Cumbria, Northumberland, Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust is one of the largest mental health and disability Trusts in England. It employs more than 7,000 staff, who provide services across an area totalling 4,800 square miles and a population of approximately 1.7 million.

title: Malta Information Technology Agency improves proactive threat detection with Microsoft security solutions
executive_summary: MITA is a Maltese government agency acting as the central driver of governmental information and communication technology (ICT) policy, programs, and initiatives. The agency recently adopted Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform for its hybrid environment and is committed to enhancing the end-user experience of its clients through the implementation of a modern workplace initiative that includes Microsoft Teams and the entire Microsoft Office family of products. Over the years, MITA has significantly invested in enhancing its detection and protection capabilities, strengthening a proactive information security stance through AI-reinforced prediction and real-time cyberthreat prevention mechanisms.

title: Schneider Electric powers up a sustainable energy future with Azure
executive_summary: Schneider Electric is a leading energy solutions provider that focuses on positively affecting the climate and economies around the world. The company wanted to simplify its application infrastructure and help customers like power providers and manufacturers optimize energy performance using the Schneider Electric EcoStruxure™ Power Advisor application. To achieve its goal, Schneider Electric migrated Power Advisor to Microsoft Azure and reconfigured it for multitenancy. The results? Simplified scaling, enhanced velocity, lower costs, and happier customers.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Database

title: MCS improves business-critical applications for faster patient care with replication and reporting in Azure
executive_summary: MCS, through its subsidiaries, manages a lot of data through business applications that healthcare patients and providers use to access crucial information about coverage and clinical decisions. The company adopted Microsoft Azure Data Factory to replicate data from its legacy AS/400 platform in near real time and adopted Azure SQL Managed Instance for reporting and analytics. As a result, the company gained operational efficiency, flexibility, and improved analytics to continue optimizing its environment to best serve customers.

title: Azerbaijani Ministry of Education unlocks the power of data-driven education
executive_summary: For the Azerbaijani Ministry of Education, connected, data-driven education is the future of learning. With the aid of its recently launched online education platform, the Ministry is helping more than 1.3 million K–12 students advance their knowledge from wherever they study. Using Microsoft Teams for Education and Microsoft Power BI, the Ministry and teachers are equipped with key educational content, insights, and statistics. This helps improve teaching methodologies over time, ensuring students stay engaged with lessons. Teams enables students to connect to personalized learning content seamlessly, making exceptional education possible in any location.

title: alldata boosts platform capabilities with secureguard and Azure
executive_summary:
Headquartered in Vienna, Austria, alldata IT-Systeme offers its customers a comprehensive package of infrastructure outsourcing solutions and ongoing support services that enable them to reduce their IT operating costs while obtaining high-performance, stable, and reliable hosting.
To avoid their platforms from reaching obsolescence and peaking their capacity limits due to high customer demand, alldata needed to act fast, and so it decided to expand and upgrade its existing infrastructure with secureguard's blazics 3100 hardware, a hyper-convergent solution based on Microsoft Azure Stack HCI.

title: DC Water implements Microsoft Azure and PowerApps to cut costs, streamline processes, and better support customers
executive_summary: Spurred by the pandemic, DC Water continued to migrate most of its applications and workforce systems to the cloud as the agency adjusted to working remotely while fulfilling utility customer requests. The agency now runs nearly 100% of its apps and IT systems in the cloud, minimizing the need for paper tracking, in-person interaction, and multiple inflexible technology systems. Customers are able to interact with staff remotely, and employees are performing job duties by relying on technology. With proper support and collaboration, DC Water is projecting budget savings as a result of the digital transformation.

title: Gautrain Management Agency powers productivity and trust with Microsoft technology
executive_summary: The Gautrain Management Agency (GMA) works to ensure that the Gautrain, South Africa’s only rapid rail network, operates reliably. The agency aimed to operate more efficiently and upgrade its customer-facing services, but internal technological mistrust curbed its progress. In 2016, the agency switched to Microsoft 365. It recently added Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Power Apps, Microsoft Teams, and more to the mix to further boost the GMA’s ability to deliver, while enhancing the trust of its customers and the capabilities of its staff.

title: Transforming healthcare delivery with virtual consultations on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Like many healthcare organizations worldwide, the Rotherham NHS Foundation Trust—a part of the National Health Service (NHS) in the United Kingdom—is rapidly progressing on its digital transformation journey. One of the most forward-thinking trusts in the United Kingdom, the Rotherham NHS Foundation Trust is at the leading edge of health service reform, and it is achieving exceptional results. The Trust provides a wide range of health services to a local population of more than 264,700 residents.
products: Bookings, Dataverse for Teams, Forms, Microsoft Graph, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Montessori school delivers hybrid education to classrooms and homes with Microsoft Teams and Surface
executive_summary: Aurora Montessori School delivers hands-on experiential education to students throughout their early learning and elementary school years, introducing complex concepts very early through the use of developmentally appropriate Montessori learning materials. Transferring this educational model to a remote learning scenario during the onset of COVID-19 was monumental, and school administrators quickly realized they needed technology to succeed. Using modern Microsoft Surface devices, students and teachers were able to stay connected in online classrooms through Microsoft Teams.

title: Bringing the efficiency of AI to FinTech: Paysafe streamlines internal processes with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Facing complex documentation, an intricate web of information, and multiple languages and geographies, leading payments platform Paysafe decided to address these challenges with Copilot for Microsoft 365. With the enthusiastic endorsement of its CEO, Paysafe’s employees quickly used Copilot to streamline meetings, information management, and document creation, addressing language barriers, eliminating time-consuming tasks, and boosting creativity along the way.

title: Finance House offers much needed support to small & medium sized businesses with cloud-based app
executive_summary: Many communities across the UAE lack access to affordable financial products and services. Finance House (FH) acts as an economic engine for these unserved or underserved communities, facilitating an environment for them to thrive. While smaller financial service companies often find it challenging to compete against mega financial corporations with large reach, Finance House is an exception. Driven by a goal to provide exceptional service to its customers, FH is on its way to provide services as advanced as those offered by larger financial institutions—competing in the same market space through quality service and affordable pricing. Its soon-to-launch fully digital financial services will provide apps for corporate and consumer banking clients on Microsoft Azure.

title: Heineken partners with Microsoft to become the best-connected brewer
executive_summary: “Heineken wants to become the best-connected brewer and actually that's based on our history. We have strong connections with our consumers and have known them for 157 years,” says Ronald den Elzen, CEO, Heineken.

title: Beilinson Hospital uses augmented reality to treat COVID-19 patients and train residents
executive_summary: Beilinson Hospital was established in 1936 and has since been a leader in novel surgical procedures and in the establishment of specialty medical departments and units. Beilinson established the first blood bank in Israel in 1964, performed the first living-related donor kidney transplant in Israel, and the first heart transplant in 1968, just one year after the first world heart transplant.

title: Taking genetic analysis to new heights with cloud technology
executive_summary: Geninus, a spin-off company from Samsung Genome Institute, specializes in medical genomic analysis. It is the first to commercialize next generation sequencing-based cancer panel in Korea. Besides its strong performance in the domestic market, Geninus now exports its technology to Japan, Vietnam, and Australia. The company leverages data analytics with the Microsoft Azure Cloud to develop new solutions. With the power of big data and artificial intelligence, Geninus looks to continue creating genomic technology that benefits all of humanity.

title: Heineken partners with Microsoft to become the best-connected brewer
executive_summary: “Heineken wants to become the best-connected brewer and actually that's based on our history. We have strong connections with our consumers and have known them for 157 years,” says Ronald den Elzen, CEO, Heineken.

title: Beilinson Hospital uses augmented reality to treat COVID-19 patients and train residents
executive_summary: Beilinson Hospital was established in 1936 and has since been a leader in novel surgical procedures and in the establishment of specialty medical departments and units. Beilinson established the first blood bank in Israel in 1964, performed the first living-related donor kidney transplant in Israel, and the first heart transplant in 1968, just one year after the first world heart transplant.

title: Taking genetic analysis to new heights with cloud technology
executive_summary: Geninus, a spin-off company from Samsung Genome Institute, specializes in medical genomic analysis. It is the first to commercialize next generation sequencing-based cancer panel in Korea. Besides its strong performance in the domestic market, Geninus now exports its technology to Japan, Vietnam, and Australia. The company leverages data analytics with the Microsoft Azure Cloud to develop new solutions. With the power of big data and artificial intelligence, Geninus looks to continue creating genomic technology that benefits all of humanity.

title: Mosaic Life Care scales portal, maximizes vaccine accessibility with Azure SQL Managed Instance
executive_summary: Many living in the United States were incredibly relieved when the COVID-19 vaccine became available—but finding an available dose could be tricky initially. Mosaic Life Care, a healthcare organization based in Missouri, didn’t want its on-premises environment to limit how many patients could register for shots. So, the organization moved its vaccine portal to Microsoft Azure SQL Managed Instance so that it could scale without worry. The IT team saved time and administrative hassle by no longer managing its infrastructure, and Mosaic quickly administered more than 60,000 doses.

title: Real estate specialist Wedgewood lists Microsoft Sentinel among its best investments
executive_summary: When Chief Information Officer Rick Gehringer reviewed IT security at investment specialist Wedgewood, his first issue was lack of visibility into a diverse, partly siloed, hybrid infrastructure. He and Cybersecurity and Compliance Manager Aladdin Alsati partnered with KMicro with the mission to build protective security measures that will stop discovered threats before they disrupt business operations, and allow for the immediate detection and response to new threats.

title: Eagle Mountain-Saginaw ISD’s roadmap to improving equity in education
executive_summary: Educators prepare students to succeed in this 21st Century economy by empowering them to think critically, engage collaboratively, and learn to tap into and assess the surplus of information available at the tap of a finger. The great news is that educational technologies have evolved and innovated to enable educators to embrace new ways of teaching. As is the case with most technological breakthroughs, the key question is, “Who has access to the benefits that come with innovation?”
products: Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, OneNote

title: Armacell: Speeding Up Incident Response and Recovery with Azure Sentinel
executive_summary: Armacell is a global manufacturing company, providing flexible insulation foams for the equipment insulation market. As a growing company relying increasingly on the cloud, they need fortifying their defence against security threats. As part of that initiative, they needed a partner that could manage threat identification and incident response with them — and that’s where Excellium came in. Building their solution on Azure Sentinel, Excellium will help Armacell with a cost-effective approach to event collection and collation, threat detection, incident investigation, and rapid response. Read on for the details.

title: Organica Water optimizes wastewater treatment processes while driving sustainability with Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: Organica facilities appear far more like beautiful botanical gardens than wastewater treatment plants. By enabling customers around the world to build and operate space- and energy-efficient biological water treatment facilities, Organica Water is helping address the challenge of urban water scarcity. With more than 120 treatment plants, it’s important to have an efficient way to remotely monitor and actively manage water quality, Organica turned to Microsoft Azure and Power BI for a solution. Today, the bio-centric company is better equipped to ensure only the purest water is made available for re-use, while advancing in their sustainability goals by reducing travel, manual work and energy use.

title: Dubai Airports enables hybrid work and remotely carries out major facility maintenance and improvements despite pandemic
executive_summary: Dubai Airports, operator of Dubai International (DXB), the busiest international airport in the world is a key contributor to Dubai’s GDP. When COVID-19 hit, it had to shut down all passenger operations and enable employees to work from home. Within 48 hours the airport rolled out Microsoft Teams for more than 2,000 staff members to continue working remotely. Dubai Airports also used this time new technology for a major overhaul of its train systems and to perform maintenance work on the airfield and buildings, minimizing disruption for passengers.

title: Varde Municipality has significantly increased its security and compliance by implementing microsoft 365 E5.
executive_summary:
The threat from cybercriminals has never been greater. And the new challenges require that security and compliance are thought through from the start. Therefore, the Microsoft 365 E5 license has given Varde Municipality a range of security tools. In Varde Municipality, the cloud-based digital solution with Microsoft 365 E5 provides employees and users with a secure framework to work under while ensuring that public security and infrastructure requirements are pre-thought in and continuously updated. Varde has thus got a solution that brings everything together on a platform, ensures compliance with GDPR and strengthens IT security.

In this video, you can hear more about Varde Municipality view and experiences using Microsoft 365 E5.

title: Solar panel manufacturer REC Group builds a solid foundation for future growth on Azure
executive_summary: REC Group offers high-efficient solar panels with a reliable long-term performance to provide people with clean and affordable solar power. To support its future growth and tremendous expansion plans, REC wanted to upgrade from SAP ERP Central Component (ECC) to S/4HANA and run it in Microsoft Azure with a solid Security and Disaster Recovery (DR) strategy. The company now generates reports and performs analytics much faster, leading to higher efficiency while minimizing operating costs. As ‘Solar’s Most Trusted’, it is now better equipped to make more informed business decisions and accelerate its customer centric service.

title: Malaysian flag carrier flies ahead by enabling workforce to become future-ready
executive_summary: Having navigated through many storms, Malaysia Aviation Group (MAG), the parent company that manages Malaysia Airlines, saw the global pandemic as another challenge to overcome. This time, MAG looked to apply Digital Culture to its greatest asset—its workforce. A people-centered program trained existing workers for new roles, equipping them with the right mindsets and technology skills that accelerated the company’s digitalisation. Amidst an industry turmoil, the airline retained all of its staff and increased employee engagement in the process.

title: Engage Squared helps clients use Microsoft Viva to improve their employee experience
executive_summary: Watch to learn how Engage Squared Microsoft 2022 Employee Experience Partner of the Year is helping organizations like Cricket Australia deploy the Microsoft Viva suite to improve their digital employee experience. “Microsoft Viva is a great way to help connect the dots between different parts of a business, from people and culture to internal communications and everything in between,” explains Claudia Piscitelli, Chief Marketing Officer at Engage Squared. Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, Engage Squared provides professional and managed services to organizations in Australia, New Zealand, and across Asia.

title: Czech e-grocer meets expansion goals with Azure’s cloud technology
executive_summary: Košík is an e-grocery company currently serving the Czech and Bulgarian markets. Its mission is to feed people in a digital way. With a strategy focused on growth, Košík needed the right flexibility and readiness to scale up its operations, access new markets, and deal with a rapidly changing environment. Košík turned to Microsoft Azure, implementing a cloud-based strategy that allowed the company to save time and operational costs, all while meeting unexpected demand and further expanding its business.

title: Driving internal digital transformation with self-built apps—based on smapOne and Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: “Isn’t there an app for that?” This rhetorical question has become almost cliché. There’s an app for pretty much everything these days, a digital assistant for all kinds of tasks—in the consumer segment at least. It’s a similar story in the business world: employees can simply create apps themselves that support their workflows using a no-code platform, for example with the pre-defined app modules from smapOne. For more complex processes, Microsoft offers Power Apps. Together, the two tools provide a 360° portfolio for building bespoke applications.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Excel, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Malaysian flag carrier flies ahead by enabling workforce to become future-ready
executive_summary: Having navigated through many storms, Malaysia Aviation Group (MAG), the parent company that manages Malaysia Airlines, saw the global pandemic as another challenge to overcome. This time, MAG looked to apply Digital Culture to its greatest asset—its workforce. A people-centered program trained existing workers for new roles, equipping them with the right mindsets and technology skills that accelerated the company’s digitalisation. Amidst an industry turmoil, the airline retained all of its staff and increased employee engagement in the process.

title: ICTC drives digital equity to build a shared digital future for Canadians with Microsoft
executive_summary: The Information and Communications Technology Council (ICTC) is a Canadian nonprofit that conducts digital industry and market research, elaborates policy advice, delivers program-based digital guidance for Canadian businesses and industries, and provides training and development opportunities for Canadian talent. Recognizing the need to serve groups underrepresented in the digital space, including women, newcomers, Indigenous Peoples, and youth, ICTC launched its Digital Equity and Employment Pathways (DEEP) program to provide upskilling and development opportunities with Microsoft Learn resources. ICTC’s DEEP program has a 93 percent employment rate, with 70 percent of participants being women. Along with other key ICTC initiatives, it continues to equitably develop Canadian talent and drive Canadian innovation for years to come.

title: HoloLens 2 Empowers BMW China Training Academy to Create a “Futuristic” Training and Shopping Experience
executive_summary: With cutting-edge training concept, leading digital platform, and state-of-the-art equipment, BMW China Training Academy is committed to providing engaging, inspiring, and innovative learning experiences for the dealers and their employees by adopting the latest technologies. BMW China Training Academy is now adopting HoloLens 2 widely by 3D rendering the car models 1:1 to provide a disruptive and immersive training and car shopping experience, and thus driving business growth for BMW in China.

title: Unilever migrates its SAP estate to Azure in 18 months, fueling unconstrained capacity for business growth
executive_summary: As one of the world’s largest consumer goods companies, Unilever and its brands are household names. To support its business needs and those of more than 3.4 billion daily consumers across 190 countries, Unilever set strategic transformational goals to modernize its infrastructure and drive growth across the company. Part of that ambitious strategy was a migration of its SAP and non-SAP environments, including its four core enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, to Microsoft Azure. Unilever’s move to Azure has brought greater efficiency, scalability, and availability, including highly secure storage—all designed to position the company for a more sustainable and cloud-native future.

title: Howard University doubles security score and saves $1 million annually with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Howard University (Howard), a leading historically Black institution based in Washington, DC, doubled its security score in less than a year after expanding its use of Microsoft Azure. Like many universities, Howard sought to strengthen its security through cloud migration but was limited by a lean IT budget. A ransomware attack in 2021 created an opportunity for the university to reexamine its infrastructure and led to a security code optimization partnership with Cloudforce. In just three weeks, Howard restored all core IT services by using Microsoft solutions and other tools. The university bolstered security, increased efficiency, and saved money, demonstrating what higher education institutions can achieve with the help of modern IT partners.

title: Nexi uses Azure App Service to modernize its FinTech apps to provide a personalized payment solution to customers
executive_summary: Nexi is a European PayTech company that helps its customers pay and accept digital payments through a complete and personalized range of simple, intuitive, and secure solutions. To simplify transactions and empower people and businesses to enjoy closer relationships and prosper together, Nexi needed a unified solution with more flexibility to allow its developers to spend much less time on infrastructure activities and provide more value on delivering products. Working with Microsoft and cVation, Nexi moved forward to implement app modernization and transformation.

title: STOPWATCH leverages Azure, Visual Studio, and .NET Core to Deliver an Omni-Commerce Solution
executive_summary: Upon its founding, STOPWATCH needed a platform and toolset that would enable it to go cloud-native from day one—so that it could quickly and efficiently deliver a solution to help consumer packaged goods companies understand how their products are being sold across every channel, from every perspective, in real time. The company chose Microsoft Azure, .NET, and Visual Studio, giving it everything it needed: fully managed services that let developers stay focused on meeting customer needs instead of managing infrastructure; a programming framework optimized for harnessing the power of both Azure services and open source; and a toolkit for pulling all of the different pieces of its solution together as a highly collaborative team.

title: STMicroelectronics transforms research and development, manufacturing, supply chain, and internal processes with Azure
executive_summary: STMicroelectronics believes technology can unlock capabilities to grow its business and streamline its processes. The company is always looking for ways to be more innovative and stay ahead of future trends. By utilizing Microsoft Azure high-performance computing and other Microsoft technologies, the organization is advancing its research and development, transforming its supply chain, scaling manufacturing, and giving its employees the right tools to secure its position as a world leader in semiconductor solutions.

title: Majid Al Futtaim embraces insights driven future with Microsoft Intelligent Data
executive_summary: A relentless focus on its customers has turned Majid Al Futtaim into a real estate and retail conglomerate, and leisure destination powerhouse across the Middle East, Africa, and Asia. The grocery retail arm of this company is Majid Al Futtaim Retail, the exclusive franchisee for Carrefour in over 30 markets, and currently operating more than 460 outlets.

title: STMicroelectronics transforms research and development, manufacturing, supply chain, and internal processes with Azure
executive_summary: STMicroelectronics believes technology can unlock capabilities to grow its business and streamline its processes. The company is always looking for ways to be more innovative and stay ahead of future trends. By utilizing Microsoft Azure high-performance computing and other Microsoft technologies, the organization is advancing its research and development, transforming its supply chain, scaling manufacturing, and giving its employees the right tools to secure its position as a world leader in semiconductor solutions.

title: Majid Al Futtaim embraces insights driven future with Microsoft Intelligent Data
executive_summary: A relentless focus on its customers has turned Majid Al Futtaim into a real estate and retail conglomerate, and leisure destination powerhouse across the Middle East, Africa, and Asia. The grocery retail arm of this company is Majid Al Futtaim Retail, the exclusive franchisee for Carrefour in over 30 markets, and currently operating more than 460 outlets.

title: eClinical Solutions uses Dalikoo’s My Links to enhance intranet built with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: eClinical Solutions, a leading provider of clinical trial software solutions, created a new intranet to transform its employee experience by improving internal and human resources communication, employee collaboration, and knowledge sharing. The new intranet, eClinical Connect, is built natively in Microsoft 365 and enhanced with a leading solution from Microsoft partner Dalikoo, called My Links. Strategy, design, configuration, integration, and ongoing support was provided by sister company and Microsoft partner Velaku. eClinical Connect coupled with Dalikoo’s My Links app and user-centric design by Velaku have improved productivity, collaboration, visibility, and engagement across eClinical Solutions’ 400+ employees in North America, Europe, and India.

title: Azure Rehab utilizes Azure AI solutions to empower people with disabilities
executive_summary: Accessibility and AI are imperative topics of discussion globally and technology is a key enabler to empower people with disabilities. Microsoft called on the LATAM Developers Community (including students, customers, and partner developers) to challenge them to create applications which utilize Azure AI solutions that could empower advancement of people with disabilities. Azure Rehab was the hackathon winner showcasing innovative use of technology with purpose.

title: Taoyuan Builds Smart City with Microsoft Hybrid Cloud
executive_summary: Taoyuan city is known as the gateway of Taiwan, connecting the country to the rest of world through Taoyuan International Airport. Located in northern Taiwan, it is also the center of country’s economy. As part of their multi-year Smart City initiative, Taoyuan City partnered with Microsoft to power Taiwan's first government hybrid cloud platform. With Azure Arc-enabled SQL Managed Instance and together with Synapse and Power BI, the city was able to deliver improved city services to their citizens and unlock the power of data.

title: University of Debrecen delivers future-ready skills and knowledge with Microsoft
executive_summary: The University of Debrecen, one of the largest higher education institutions in Hungary, was looking to integrate more market-oriented, industry-relevant skills and certificates in its computer science programs. With the Microsoft Learn for Educators program (MSLE), the university introduced several courses in Azure technologies in its curricula and empowered its teachers and several dozen students to gain industry-recognized Microsoft Certifications for free, thereby enhancing their employability and university ranking.

title: Georgia Banking Company turbocharges growth with cloud adoption and Microsoft Security
executive_summary: When a thriving community bank aspires to a faster growth path, security can be a highly effective accelerator. Georgia Banking Company’s growth from a $600 million bank to a $1.5 billion phenomenon in only two years exemplifies the success that’s possible with a tightly connected security tool set. It completed its cloud transformation within 13 months, gaining scalable security and efficiency with Microsoft Azure, rolling out Microsoft 365 productivity apps, and replacing a collection of disconnected products from multiple vendors with Microsoft Security solutions. The highly bankable result? Substantial savings, best-in-class user experience for employees and customers, and heightened security draw rave reviews from IT and other employees.

title: CTT—Correios de Portugal migrates to Azure to be AI-ready and more secure
executive_summary: Even 500-year-old businesses can make room for innovation. CTT—Correios de Portugal realized its existing IT environment was not supporting its business effectively. Bottlenecks and delays prevented the company from meeting its needs during peak seasons, leaving it challenged to give its customers the best possible service.  CTT chose to migrate its critical workloads to Microsoft Azure, gaining AI readiness, 15% cost savings, security, and the flexibility to meet new challenges.

title: Domino’s unites and engages a global workforce with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: With thousands of stores across 12 markets, Domino’s Pizza Enterprises Limited has carved out a special place in the hearts (and stomachs) of pizza lovers. With a geographically diverse workforce speaking multiple languages on three continents, the fast-moving company aimed to unite its geographically diverse workforce and recognized the need for effective, centralized communication at scale. Domino’s turned to Microsoft Viva, an integrated employee experience platform, to enhance engagement, improve productivity, and foster connection among team members.

title: Enerjisa Üretim unleashes employees’ true potential with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Enerjisa Üretim, a trailblazer in Türkiye's energy sector, is leading the way in unlocking the potential of its workforce. The company embraced artificial intelligence in day-to-day processes, fostering an innovative work environment. More recently, the energy company has adopted Microsoft Copilot to streamline meeting summaries, reformat documents, and compile reports. The move has significantly reduced administrative work and increased mental bandwidth, enabling employees to concentrate on more strategic and fulfilling activities instead of spending six hours in meetings.

title: Sapiens uses Azure Kubernetes Service and Azure-managed DBs to get AI-ready and streamline developer efforts
executive_summary: N/A

title: AI at the helm: How Wallenius Wilhelmsen’s adoption of Viva and Copilot is shaping its future
executive_summary: Wallenius Wilhelmsen is harnessing the power of AI technology to modernize its workplace and align operations with its objectives. By implementing Copilot for Microsoft 365, and using Microsoft Viva to drive sustainable adoption, the company is streamlining processes, empowering better decision making, and cultivating a culture of innovation and inclusion. This tech-driven transformation is breaking down barriers, promoting learning, and positioning Wallenius Wilhelmsen as a company that’s committed to finding innovative solutions that align with its strategic goals.

title: Accenture transforms its infrastructure using RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: To continue to extend its cutting-edge solution and service offerings, Accenture needed to enhance its infrastructure and unify operations to support more simplified and accelerated digital transformation for current and future customers. The company chose RISE with SAP on Microsoft Azure as a comprehensive solution to enhance security, interoperability, and innovation and to simplify infrastructure management. By using RISE with SAP on Azure, Accenture strengthened its infrastructure and improved integration of financial data, reporting capabilities, and transaction processing across multiple lines of business and regions—all of which is critical for regulatory compliance and operational resilience. With this foundation, Accenture is poised to revolutionize its business with AI, starting with the financial advisor application, an AI-driven tool supporting the company’s financial services.

title: A modern workspace in transition: E.ON relies on generative AI to manage data floods with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Germany’s energy transition is changing two fundamental aspects of the country’s energy supply. First, the shift away from conventional, centralized provision through large power plants and toward green electricity is making supply more volatile. And second, energy production is becoming more decentralized through the use of geographically dispersed micro-facilities. It’s up to energy providers such as E.ON to manage this complex grid and connect all its components logically and in real time. This ties up a great deal of the workforce, whose capacity is then unavailable for other tasks. That’s why E.ON is using artificial intelligence to make its employees’ lives easier. By increasing productivity and efficiency, Copilot for Microsoft 365 is helping to transform the energy market.

title: Domino’s unites and engages a global workforce with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: With thousands of stores across 12 markets, Domino’s Pizza Enterprises Limited has carved out a special place in the hearts (and stomachs) of pizza lovers. With a geographically diverse workforce speaking multiple languages on three continents, the fast-moving company aimed to unite its geographically diverse workforce and recognized the need for effective, centralized communication at scale. Domino’s turned to Microsoft Viva, an integrated employee experience platform, to enhance engagement, improve productivity, and foster connection among team members.

title: Clifford Chance adopts Microsoft 365 Copilot for smarter ways of working
executive_summary: Clifford Chance was facing challenges from increasing data complexity and fast-evolving regulations. It sought to improve efficiency while empowering teams to focus on high-value work and upholding ethical standards.

title: DHS South Australia leverages Dynamics 365 to support vulnerable community members
executive_summary: The Department of Human Services South Australia needed to digitise its infrastructure to support the management of high-risk domestic violence cases. Reliance on paper-based methods and COVID-19 restrictions hindered timely support for victims.

title: Dow reimagines productivity and supply chain efficiency with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Dow faced challenges in cost management and operational efficiency within its supply chain. With millions at stake in logistics spending, the company sought a solution to improve billing accuracy, streamline processes, and reduce costly overcharges.

title: BESTSELLER ONLY dresses up omnichannel retail with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: BESTSELLER’s ONLY set out to power customer loyalty and drive new growth by adding the online, first party eCommerce experience to its Dynamics 365 Commerce solution to enable frictionless omnichannel customer journeys.

title: Students excel with EANI's Microsoft Copilot integration
executive_summary: Education Authority of Northern Ireland (EANI) faced challenges: varying student abilities requiring tailored educational approaches, limited resources in rural schools, administrative burdens on teachers, and rising complexity in special education needs necessitating better tools.

executive_summary: Dow faced challenges in cost management and operational efficiency within its supply chain. With millions at stake in logistics spending, the company sought a solution to improve billing accuracy, streamline processes, and reduce costly overcharges.

executive_summary: BESTSELLER’s ONLY set out to power customer loyalty and drive new growth by adding the online, first party eCommerce experience to its Dynamics 365 Commerce solution to enable frictionless omnichannel customer journeys.
