executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Green Roads positions its CBD business for hyper-growth with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Green Roads is a leading manufacturer and distributor of hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) products. As a leader in a $5 billion industry that is growing significantly, Green Roads needed a technology solution that could support rapid expansion. The company needed to consolidate its siloed, small-business software solutions into a single enterprise resource planning (ERP) system that would help its growing company stay on top of the changing regulatory landscape, predict demand requirements, and prioritize the mixed-mode manufacturing environment. Working with Alithya, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network, Green Roads deployed Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations.

title: Telstra eyes monitoring and securing its hybrid cloud with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Australia’s leading telecommunications company, Telstra has been expanding into the technology sector for at least a decade. As part of a modernization project, the company is considering consolidating its internal cloud environments and expanding its use of the public cloud. When Microsoft Azure Arc, with its ability to extend the Azure control plane to on-premises and edge computing applications, became available for testing, Telstra recognized the opportunity to create a single pane of glass for its servers, Kubernetes clusters, and databases.

title: South African fintech meets infrastructure challenges with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Allegiance Consulting (Pty) Ltd is a South African fintech that specializes in complex financial planning systems in the South African market. When the COVID-19 health crisis struck, clients were uncertain about the future, and working from home was a new challenge. The company faced these new challenges quickly, proactively, and successfully, thanks to Microsoft solutions—including a highly secure and scalable infrastructure.

title: AIA Hong Kong & Macau connects customers to a world of secure and trusted digital experiences using Microsoft Azure Active Directory B2C
executive_summary: Smooth, seamless, reliable, and secure are critical features for a superior customer experience in today’s demanding digital landscape. Across the board in insurance and all businesses, accelerated digital transformation in the last 12 months is driving an unprecedented urgency to provide an all-digital service. But the challenge AIA Hong Kong & Macau faced when the business opened itself and its customers to a new world of digital opportunity, was the huge responsibility to ensure this world could be trusted and secure.

title: Belgian railway operator, Infrabel, drives up data management with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Formed in 2005, Infrabel is responsible for creating and maintaining Belgium’s railway network. Needing more scalable, flexible and effective log management capabilities to efficiently manage its vast rail infrastructure, the company chose Azure Data Explorer to replace its on-premises solution. Today, Infrabel benefits from seamless data ingestion, rapid scaling, easy visualization, and high availability. Travelers also feel the difference as they enjoy safer, more efficient journeys across Belgium’s rail network.
products: Azure Data Explorer

executive_summary: Formed in 2005, Infrabel is responsible for creating and maintaining Belgium’s railway network. title: LinkedIn simplifies log management with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Millions of people around the world turn to LinkedIn to build their professional network, explore new career opportunities, and develop their reputation within their industries. Yet, serving such a large customer base was proving to be a challenge for the company. To overcome operational issues, centralize logs, and build scalability, LinkedIn made the switch to Azure Data Explorer. Today, the professional networking site is reaping the benefits—accelerating new service onboarding, lifting its operational burden, and reducing costs.

title: Engineering goes cloud-native: Driving competitiveness and agility with simulations in the cloud
executive_summary:
Engineering companies must constantly reinvent themselves in the global and dynamic market environment—most recently reinforced by the trend toward sustainability and positioning in the field of e-mobility. This puts high pressure on the research and development (R&D) departments, which have to realize ever faster innovation cycles and develop and test new products for a wide range of challenging operating conditions.

Computer-aided engineering (CAE) and numerical simulations accelerate this product development process: with these tools, engineers can, for example, predict the optimal configuration for cooling an electric motor or optimize gearboxes in terms of losses and longevity. Dive uses a cloud-native simulation environment to take the complexity out of this process and offers a modern Software as a Service (SaaS) package—all based on Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure, Azure HPC

title: A Saudi family-owned group with a diversified business presence unifying legacy ERP systems, empowering and leading digital transformation.
executive_summary: Established in 1958, Ali Zaid Al Quraishi and Brothers Company (AZAQ) is a 100% family-owned group in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Today, the group is a large diversified organisation with a presence in various sectors and a strong footprint across the nation. AZAQ has helped many multi-nationals enter the market including Fiat, Chrysler, United Biscuits, Red Bull and Microsoft. AZAQ takes pride in its Saudi roots and continues to build strategic business partnerships to contribute towards the Saudi Vision 2030. Their cumulative experience spanning over decades has enabled the group to have first-hand knowledge and experience across a range of sectors

title: Adobe gets control plus flexibility in its development platform from the Azure Service Operator project
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: RBL Bank ushers in the new normal of work; collaborates more on Teams than pre-pandemic levels
executive_summary: RBL Bank is one of India’s leading private sector banks with an expanding presence across the country. The bank offers specialized services under five business verticals, namely: Corporate & Institutional Banking, Commercial Banking, Branch & Business Banking, Retail Assets and Treasury and Financial Markets Operations. It currently services over 10.66 million customers through a network of 500 branches; 1,424 business correspondent branches (of which 274 are banking outlets) and 407 ATMs spread across 28 Indian states and union territories. RBL Bank is listed on both NSE and BSE.

title: Swiss Re Drives Deeper, Faster Insights with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Swiss Reinsurance Company Ltd, commonly known as Swiss Re, is all about big data. As the world's second-largest reinsurer, the company relies on a continuous stream of analysis to help its clients better understand risk, enhance operations, and lower claims-processing costs.

title: World-Leading Football League, LaLiga, Leads Decision Making with Power BI
executive_summary: The largest sport in the world, football, has an estimated 240 million players, and a global fandom size in the billions. Around the world, people are coming together every day to play the sport and root on their favourite football clubs.

title: DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION WITH SPEED
executive_summary: Change is probably the greatest hurdle people face on a day-to-day basis, but there is no denying that change in most circumstances is the catalyst to an improved environment or system. It has been said “don’t fear change. Yes, you may lose something good, but you may also gain something great.” What makes the AfroCentric Health digital story such an amazing story is its quick ability to change, adapt, and flourish in a short period of time.

title: Sensor-based sorting provider converts IoT data into sustainable solutions with ADX
executive_summary: Norway-based TOMRA is driving a more sustainable future with its sensor-based systems to scan and sort products and materials for the food, recycling, and mining industries. To increase workflow efficiency and perform quicker queries on massive data volumes, it transitioned from a monolithic SQL server infrastructure to Azure Data Explorer (ADX). With the new solution, TOMRA can process up to five billion data points per day, enabling more machines to identify and sort materials for recycling quickly and accurately.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer

title: PwC uses Azure Synapse and Power BI to Help Clients Gain Valuable Insights
executive_summary: PwC is one of the world’s largest accounting firms. The company’s network spans 156 countries with over 250,000 employees who deliver Assurance, Advisory, and Tax services. PwC prides itself on their ingenuity and drive to stay on the forefront of technology. Vince Powell, a Partner at PwC, leads technology and analytics for the Deals, Insights, and Analytics team (DIA). The DIA team provides deep Financial, Operational, Forensic and Analytical services to clients across the full lifecycle of a business. The team, based in the UK, is part of a PwC Network of over 3,000 Financial, Forensics, Data and Analytics experts.

title: County council works smarter, saves conversion time and cost with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Nottinghamshire County Council is one of the largest county councils in the United Kingdom. Delivering services to about 800,000 people in the county, the Council faced a mammoth task when it began work on a central mandate to move 750 applications and data to the cloud. Despite far more than the usual migration wrinkles—a global pandemic and an IT department restructuring—Nottinghamshire County Council prevailed. It turned to Microsoft Azure VMware Solution to simplify and expedite its migration (now underway), saving time, both licensing and platform costs—and headaches. With the pilot project completed remotely under difficult circumstances, Nottinghamshire County Council has created a blueprint for completing a complex project with minimal issues.

title: Unit4 reduces go to market by 50 percent and future-proofs business by transitioning to Azure
executive_summary: Unit4 provides user-friendly enterprise resource planning (ERP), human capital management (HCM), and financial planning and analysis (FP&A) systems for service organizations such as higher education institutions, nonprofits, and public service entities. Customers use Unit4 solutions to help their finance, HR, projects, procurement, and FP&A teams transform the way they work.

title: RMIT future-proofs the university-to-student connection with Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Widely regarded as a technology leader in the education space, the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology (RMIT University) furthers cutting-edge technology through its IT programs. Its Blockchain Innovation Hub, which teams up with leading technology partners to perform projects for clients, offers innovation for internal projects as well. When RMIT wanted to create a convenient, groundbreaking student-credentialing system to keep alumni connected for life, the Blockchain Innovation Hub and project stakeholders unanimously chose to use Microsoft Entra Verified ID. The result: a pilot program that ingeniously solves three key use cases with one technology.
products: Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Entra Verified ID

title: Covenant Technology creates 3D CAD/CAM secure enclave with Azure Virtual Desktop in Azure Government
executive_summary: Covenant Technology recognized the need to provide scalable, highly secure cloud-based virtual desktops to customers who needed to quickly move to the cloud and support remote workers. Covenant Technology turned to Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop to rapidly build customers a reliable, virtual secure enclave that employees access from any location. Because the virtual desktops run multi-session Windows 10 on Azure NV-series instances with NVIDIA GPUs, employees have the flexibility to connect to a highly secure virtual desktop using nearly any endpoint device and 3D peripherals to run their engineering software.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Arxus ensures that Resengo's reservation system is permanently available
executive_summary: Resengo is a Belgian digital company that develops online reservation systems. Primary target groups are restaurants, saunas & wellness centers, and sports & recreation facilities. In recent years, Resengo has experienced significant growth. The company now has over three thousand customers and records 1.3 million online restaurant reservations each month. Across all sectors, this amounts to nearly 3 million reservations every month. Behind the scenes, Resengo often needs to move quickly. This has proven to be a problem in the past. Resengo's ambition is to eventually switch entirely to Microsoft Azure. Arxus has taken responsibility for the entire infrastructure component. This ensures that Resengo does not need to invest in machines or in infrastructure knowledge. At the same time, Arxus offers guarantees of availability, performance, and security that would not be immediately feasible for Resengo under its own management. It works much better and more efficiently for Resengo to fill the need for scalability via Arxus.

title: Jewelry lifestyle brand Kendra Scott lets teamwork shine with Tasks in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Kendra Scott’s unique culture is built on three pillars of “Family, Fashion, and Philanthropy,” and it shines when every team member has the tools to work effectively, support their well-being, and deliver great customer service. Today, the company uses task publishing in the Microsoft Tasks app in Teams to bring the entire organization closer together and empower every Kendra Scott “family member” with the information they need to excel at their jobs. With the goals of making every customer feel at home and giving every employee the tools that they need to work effectively, Kendra Scott is embracing technology to build future success.

title: Menzies Aviation empowers frontline staff with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Menzies Aviation delivers time critical aviation services to customers around the globe, including ground services, fuelling services and air cargo services. The company was established in 1833 in Edinburgh and is still headquartered in the city. Today, Menzies is an international business employing more than 25,000 people in 37 countries. While office staff enjoyed all the benefits of Microsoft 365, its frontline workers lacked a corporate digital identity – making communication difficult. The Menzies Aviation team spotted an opportunity to use Microsoft Teams to improve communication and engagement with frontline workers. In doing so, they delivered some extra, unexpected benefits. Their achievement of delivering throughout the pandemic offers an optimistic vision of what can be achieved through passion and innovation – even with a small team.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Polish environment fund joins forces with Microsoft to help citizens save energy and reduce air pollution
executive_summary: The National Fund for Environmental Protection and Water Management powers a greener future for Poland. Its environmental grant programs allow citizens to obtain funding for air pollution prevention and energy efficiency home improvements. To speed up the process, it developed an online application portal based on Azure. The entire grant submission and verification process has been considerably simplified.

title: VuNet Systems leverages Azure to provide observability and AI-driven insights to customers
executive_summary: VuNet Systems (VuNet) has an integrated platform which uniquely combines Big Data, Domain-Centric ML Models and MLOps to accelerate digital transformation at organizations. Its AI-led business observability platform vuSmartMaps™, connects business, operations, and user experience at scale through an intelligent unified view of business journeys for digital enterprises.

title: Microsoft workers’ council partnerships boost the company’s product and service rollouts
executive_summary: The Microsoft Digital team, charged with deploying new features and services, needed a way to avoid delays and rollbacks while meeting regulatory obligations across all of Europe. Microsoft Digital, in partnership with Microsoft Human Resources and the company’s legal team, developed a collaboration with the Microsoft workers’ council in Germany that would triage and streamline approvals and then take that framework and use it to inspire similar collaborative efforts across all the countries that have workers’ councils. As a result of this close collaboration between Microsoft Digital and the German workers’ council, an unofficial rule has emerged across Europe. “If it works in Germany, it should work everywhere,” Kopp says.

title: Accelerating healthcare research with Leidos and Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Leidos is a science, engineering and technology organization focused on solving some of healthcare’s most demanding challenges.  To drive better healthcare outcomes, sharing and aggregating real-world patient data and evidence is key. Yet, it needs to be done while ensuring patient privacy and maintaining the security of medical records.  Leidos has employed Microsoft Azure confidential computing using Intel Software Guard Extensions to accelerate clinical trials and drive new insights that result in better patient outcomes while addressing privacy concerns.

title: Bancolombia protects 23,000 devices in a highly secure environment using BitLocker
executive_summary: In early 2020, the bank wanted to update its device encryption practices to improve general device security and more easily comply with government regulations regarding encryption. Bancolombia needed to ensure its 23,000 bank-issued devices were encrypted, and ultimately chose Microsoft BitLocker as the best solution for its encryption needs. As a data protection feature, BitLocker Drive Encryption helps safeguard devices’ operating systems and provide better management for lost or stolen devices.

title: GEDI Group: Enhancing the employee experience through data
executive_summary: The GEDI publishing group relies heavily on its exclusive advertising agency Manzoni to ensure it has a clear, best-in-class communications strategy. With more than 600 employees based across Italy, Manzoni offers guidance and support to ensure GEDI make the best media decisions. But, when COVID-19 struck, the agency had to rethink its way of working and adapt to life outside the office – sparking the HR department to implement new workplace analytics tools to help understand employee challenges and offer essential remote-working support.

title: Inspired by superheroes: Kindheitstraum Stuttgart makes children’s dreams come true with Dreamflow, based on Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: A trip to a theme park, a letter from a friend on vacation, a new toy, ten days of dolphin therapy—a wide range of wishes get submitted to the German charity Kindheitstraum Stuttgart e.V. Its volunteers make dreams come true for children who are sick or are from disadvantaged backgrounds. After 70 success stories in 2021, the charity recently found a way to use its resources even more efficiently—and it now hopes to fulfill still more wishes in the future. The new solution, Dreamflow, was developed together with Microsoft, Prodware, and Fellowmind after they met at Microsoft’s Ideafest. Based on Microsoft Dynamics 365, Dreamflow is the result of hours of work by volunteers, outstanding IT skills, and genuine passion for the project. Now many more children can see their dreams brought to life.

title: How MSO successfully digitalized with Azure
executive_summary: Created in 2007, the sports timing system company, MSO, needed to change its IT system to a solution perfectly suited to the company's business activities. They selected the Azure cloud as it has a subscription model that allows them to adapt their solution and its costs to their varying needs. The company enlisted the services of the digital innovation agency Apptitude to implement this new system and ensure a smooth transition between the original legacy system and the Azure cloud before handing over the reins to the Silicom Group. Thanks to the expertise of Apptitude and the Silicom Group, MSO will be able to benefit from a flexible and easy-to-access system for its teams and customers while also controlling its costs.

title: Kahoot! implements Microsoft Dynamics together with inspirit365
executive_summary:
Kahoot! is a global learning platform company empowering everyone, including children, students, and employees, to unlock their full learning potential. With a growing global operation, Kahoot! needed a powerful ERP system. This is why they chose Microsoft Dynamics 365, provided by inspirit365.
Inspirit365 and Kahoot! worked closely together to define the scope and goals of the implementation project. We defined all processes that needed to be included and Dynamics 365 was configured and implemented in line with Kahoot!’s requirements. Kahoot! are now running their financial system on the Dynamics 365 platform.
With Dynamics 365, Kahoot! has an ERP system supporting daily business operations and facilitating standardization across finance operations in multiple jurisdictions.

title: Massachusetts Bureau of Housing Development and Construction Modernizes Government Services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: In Massachusetts, the Bureau of Housing Development and Construction within the Department of Housing & Community Development (DHCD) is responsible for managing capital improvement projects at 232 local housing authorities through planning, design, and construction. The Bureau uses its budget of approximately $110,000,000 in annual funding for these projects to maintain and modernize nearly 45,000 units of state-aided public housing. This is a critical infrastructure service that supports the preservation of vitally needed affordable housing located widely throughout the state’s communities. Hampered by complex manual paper processes and traditional mail, the Bureau turned to Tallan and Microsoft Azure to create a cloud-based interactive system that modernizes and streamlines processes and communications and facilitates government transparency.
customer: Massachusetts Bureau of Housing Development and Construction
products: Azure

title: thyssenkrupp Automotive: Dynamics 365 as cloud-based CRM solution for best-in-class automotive supplier processes
executive_summary: A spring is just a spring. A vehicle steering system, however, is a complex control system comprising many individual components, and it requires extremely complex planning and development. For a company that sells everything from suspension components to steering systems, it is almost impossible to map the entire range with a single CRM solution. That’s why thyssenkrupp Automotive Technology relies on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the CRM industry solution ORBIS AutomotiveOne. The CRM team uses templates to ensure that the software can be quickly adapted to the specific requirements of the different business areas. Microsoft Azure serves as a reliable, globally available basis for operations.

title: Energy giant upscales system security with multifactor authentication and passwordless access
executive_summary: DTEK Group is a diversified energy holding that includes 6 businesses and а corporate university Academy DTEK. The company produces natural gas, coal, and renewable energy. To operate this critical infrastructure, DTEK requires a high level of security for its assets, including IT systems. Recently, the company strengthened authentication to IT services by combining Microsoft Azure Active Directory, Multi-Factor Authentication, and passwordless login. Now, the energy giant is much better protected from security incidents, preventing financial or reputational losses. The company has also built a solid foundation to continue its digital transformation journey.

title: P97 drives into the future with Azure
executive_summary: P97 delivered a secure and reliable mobility services platform by using Microsoft Azure. The company, which facilitates payments and connected commerce for some of the largest convenience retailers across the globe, needed a platform that could scale across Asia-Pacific, Europe, the Americas, and Canada. It also needed its platform to provide security and controls for its clients. So P97 used IaaS and PaaS on Azure to deliver its offering without having to develop the platform. It also used Microsoft services for identity management, compliance, and geolocation. Now P97 can provide mobile payments and integrated site connectivity at 99.9 percent uptime year-round.

title: Leading German marketing data provider panadress powers its small business with Microsoft Teams Essentials
executive_summary: panadress is a small business with a big reach. The German marketing data provider helps companies use data to connect with customers. “We support companies in aligning their marketing and sales in a customer-centric way,” explains Jan Woschofius, Cofounder and Senior Project Manager IT at panadress.

title: CONA Services sweetens identity management in IT services for Coca-Cola bottlers
executive_summary: CONA Services operates and supports IT business applications for 12 of the largest independently owned Coca-Cola bottling companies in North America. By providing IT support, bottlers can concentrate on distributing Coca-Cola products rather than duplicating IT administration and systems. But siloed identity management gave rise to protracted support cycles for bottlers’ employees who needed to reset multifactor authentication for new devices and made guest access difficult. It also increased the risk of process breakdowns and made extra work for CONA Services and the respective bottler IT departments. After rolling out Microsoft Azure Active Directory to avoid duplicate effort, CONA has redeployed IT teams to more productive work, saved hundreds of hours, and strengthened user identity security.

title: Modern internal corporate communication: GC GROUP relies on Microsoft Viva Connections
executive_summary: The GC GROUP is an international specialist wholesaler for building technology. Between its five business units and over 100 partner companies, the Group employs more than 24,000 people in 15 countries. This decentralized corporate structure made internal communication difficult: the Group’s steady growth gave rise to a variety of local solutions but without standardized interfaces or options for interaction. Thankfully, the GC GROUP now has L.I.S.A, a central employee portal based on Viva Connections. It does what the previous solutions could not, and allows content to be posted quickly and easily. Employees have a straightforward and intuitive way of exchanging information, no matter whether they work for one of the Group’s business units, partners, or other brands.

title: Bank of Canada invests in cloud, builds complementary staff upskilling with Microsoft Learn
executive_summary: Today’s Bank of Canada is a smart, agile, cloud-first organization. Adopting the latest cloud technologies to transform its central banking operations required a corresponding upskilling of staff. IT leadership has been working with Microsoft Learn to help empower employees of all specializations to take fullest advantage of a new cloud-first environment, and fulfill a mission to develop the next-generation digital Bank of Canada.

title: Heading into the future together: Hermes Fulfilment explains digitization to the workforce via Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Logistics companies must meet tough requirements placed on them both by online retailers and consumers. The industry is responding with a surge in innovation: today’s warehouses are more advanced than ever and digital twins, artificial intelligence, and paperless accounting are now well established. This is the future that Hermes Fulfilment GmbH has chosen and the company is determined to keep all its employees—both in the offices and in the warehouses—up to speed. Hermes uses Microsoft Teams to reach frontline employees, while administrative staff offer their support and the benefit of their experience in all matters related to the digital transformation. That way, no employee feels left behind.

title: Fiserv uses Microsoft Azure to simplify payment operations and reduce costs for its financial institution clients
executive_summary: Global financial services company Fiserv wanted to help its financial institution clients modernize and transform their payment processing infrastructure. As part of its continual product enhancement, Fiserv extended its Enterprise Payments Platform solution to the cloud on Microsoft Azure. The resulting solution provides modern real-time payment processing, simplifying payment operations and reducing costs for financial institutions. Enterprise Payments Platform also delivers data insights, so banks can provide their clients with visibility into their financial health.

title: Bayer accelerates drug research through data analysis in Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Hundreds of millions of people are in desperate need of new or more effective treatments for everything from cancer to autoimmune diseases to rare conditions. But pharmaceutical research takes time: according to the vfa, the association of research-based pharmaceutical companies in Germany, it takes 13 long years for a new drug to reach the German market. Analyzing data collected during clinical trials plays a key role in this. To get help to people in need sooner, the life science company Bayer collaborated with Microsoft to develop ALYCE, a data engineering and data science platform. Using artificial intelligence and machine learning, ALYCE helps Bayer evaluate data from clinical trials faster and more efficiently. Complying with all relevant regulations, this high-performance, scalable data analysis is based on Microsoft Azure.

title: Piramal Enterprises drives efficiency and employee engagement with a communication app on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) is one of India’s leading diversified companies, with a presence in financial services and pharmaceuticals. It is the flagship company of Piramal Group – an Indian multinational and diversified global business conglomerate. The group has presence across various sectors such as healthcare, life sciences, drug discovery, healthcare information management, financial services and real estate. It operates in more than 30 countries and has a brand presence in over 100 markets.

title: Canadian marine services fleet jettisons risk with Microsoft HoloLens tech support solution
executive_summary: For centuries, the strong and courageous have taken to the sea in search of adventure. Today, the sea is no longer just a channel for hardy sailors seeking their fortune. For LeeWay Marine, it’s the setting for innovation, for using inspired thinking and best-in-class technologies to solve modern problems. This marine services company has taken a new, more sustainable approach to providing technical expertise and support for crews on its vessels, both at sea and in port. LeeWay Marine worked with Kognitiv Spark to roll out a future-ready Microsoft Azure mixed reality solution on Microsoft HoloLens 2 devices, augmenting its in-person support model and reducing its risk, overhead, downtime, and overall carbon footprint.

title: Consulting firm delights customers and finds growth with Microsoft Teams Essentials
executive_summary: When COVID-19 hit in 2020, businesses of all types faced unprecedented challenges, necessitating quick adjustments, often with white-knuckle adoptions of new technologies to stay competitive. Presented with this new business landscape, Lopez de la Fuente turned to the free version of Microsoft Teams, and he later adopted Microsoft Teams Essentials for its expanded capabilities. Every Morning Consulting counts on Teams Essentials to get closer to customers, but another important benefit has emerged: retaining and empowering happy team members, who enjoy a more flexible and effective hybrid workplace.

title: Welsh Government leads the way for seamless bilingual scheduled meetings with a new Microsoft Teams feature
executive_summary: When most meetings went online in response to COVID-19, the Welsh Government moved decisively into the era of hybrid work, which is still reshaping how the organization collaborates. From that moment on, the goal has been to find a way to deliver bilingual, scheduled meetings and recreate the experience of live interpretation on a digital platform. This led to a collaboration with Microsoft to create a brand-new Teams feature that brings human interpreters into scheduled meetings and helps support working bilingually.

title: GWC changes the game by migrating to RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: GWC is a powerhouse name in Qatar, with good reason. The company maintains a sweeping infrastructure that includes more than 3.84 million square meters of logistics infrastructure, nearly 1 million square meters of warehouses and distribution centers, and one of the largest transport fleets in the State of Qatar. Its rapid rise since its 2004 inception to being named one of the 30 most valuable companies in Qatar by Forbes Middle East was fueled by an innovative spirit and the drive to be first and most reliable. So although most people in Qatar know the company by the fresh greens and blues of the GWC logo on its trucks and buildings, GWC knows that the leverage to build a thriving business lies in the resilience and agility of its information technology.

title: Cargolux Airlines International takes to the skies with business-critical Azure infrastructure
executive_summary: The business was evolving, customers were moving forward, and Cargolux needed to adapt and transform if its IT was to continue supporting business growth and help Cargolux maintain a leadership position in the air cargo industry. Cargolux chose Microsoft Azure to keep the lift and shift as simple and straightforward as possible. Cargolux now has a much more agile and adaptive IT environment, with a high degree of automation and programmatic control over platform resources.

title: The Co-op leverages Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI to build a stronger community
executive_summary: As one of the largest cooperatives in the world, The Co-op needed a modern, long-term reporting tool to centralize and better utilize its massive amounts of data. With a focus on standardization and scalability, the organization had a strategic vision of migrating their reporting capabilities to the cloud so that users could access data and reporting all in the same place. Microsoft Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics proved to be the right solution, empowering co-op member-owners with accessible company-wide data to make better decisions about how to improve the cooperative shopping experience and build the overall community.

title: United Tractors melakukan transformasi ke dunia digital dengan menggunakan Azure Center untuk solusi SAP
executive_summary: United Tractors (UT) adalah distributor alat berat terbesar di Indonesia dan pemain utama di sektor pertambangan, konstruksi, serta energi. Setelah mengadopsi penggunaan aplikasi ERP sejak dini, UT memutuskan untuk mendorong pertumbuhan perusahaan lebih jauh  menggunakan teknologi cloud. Dengan mengacu pada Industri 4.0, perusahaan memigrasikan sistem SAP S/4HANA on-premise mereka ke Azure. Langkah ini memungkinkan UT untuk  menghasilkan insight dari data, serta meningkatkan kemampuan perencanaan atas persediaan barang, menyediakan solusi pemeliharaan prediktif dari alat berat, dan memungkinkan adanya layanan mandiri karyawan. Dengan penggunaan Microsoft 365, produktivitas serta kolaborasi di seluruh lini organisasi mengalami peningkatan.

title: American Airlines gains speed and boosts reliability by flying real-time data to the cloud with Azure
executive_summary: American Airlines wanted to move its real-time customer data domain from an aging on-premises datacenter to the cloud. After evaluating several possible routes, the airline’s Customer Hub team chose Microsoft Azure SQL Managed Instance because it satisfied every one of their demanding requirements. The complex process unfolded in multiple phases to shift both data and apps to Azure, resulting in greater flexibility, automated maintenance, and alignment with the airline’s transformation goals so that American Airlines can deploy solutions to customers faster.
products: Azure App Service, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Managed Instance

title: Grundfos extends its culture of learning to every area of its business with Microsoft Viva Learning
executive_summary: Grundfos began in a moment of self-directed learning. Nearly 80 years ago, a Danish blacksmith named Poul Due Jensen created a new, more efficient irrigation pump in his basement and started the business that would become Grundfos, a heritage manufacturing company. To this day, the company maintains a culture of learning, even as it’s grown to 20,000 global employees and expanded the scope of its products and services.

title: John Hancock supports call center teams with Microsoft conversational AI tools
executive_summary: At the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, many companies’ customer contact centers were overwhelmed due to shutdowns and resource constraints. Working with Microsoft, John Hancock, a trusted source for investing, insurance, retirement, and financial advice, implemented Azure Bot Framework SDK, Azure Bot Service, and Azure Cognitive Service for Language to provide support for common customer issues and questions. This allowed call center representatives to focus their efforts and expertise on the most complex cases, resulting in better customer experiences, reduced wait times, and manageable workloads.

title: Aves prepares students for the challenges of tomorrow using Microsoft Education tools and Surface devices
executive_summary: Educational organization Aves has been championing innovation across its network of schools since its very early days. As part of this mission, the Dutch organization has been on a decade-long digital transformation program aimed at making digital literacy a core pillar of its curriculum. Started with an initial adoption of Surface devices and software, the initiative has since expanded to implement a new cloud-based platform allowing teachers to create unique, tailored curricula and more. All with the aim of helping prepare students for the digital challenges of tomorrow.

title: Dutch Financial Services Company, Rabobank, Creates Global Data Platform with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Rabobank is a cooperative bank focused on serving clients ranging from consumers and retailers to global agriculture companies. Traditionally, each time there was a request for data, Rabobank’s data team would build a singular solution that couldn’t be reutilized for other needs or use cases. Rabobank is determined to change this process and create scalable data platforms ready for the development of new, user-friendly solutions that can be reused, optimized, and scaled. To meet these needs, the Global Data Platform (GDP) was created to build a single “platform of truth” and a place where users can work with data owners to quickly get access to data to build dynamic and scalable solutions. With GDP, Rabobank has been able to break down the walls of their siloed data and applications and make data significantly more accessible across the board. Singular data touch points—information factories-- have increased speed to insights tremendously; data that once took months or years to prioritize are now readily available.

title: TIBCO preserves personal banking in the digital world by using Azure
executive_summary: The challenge for ABN AMRO was a desire to use cloud technology to improve the customer experience, but the company wanted the personal part of banking to be preserved, digitally. Together, the combined capabilities of Azure and TIBCO Cloud Integration are helping ABN AMRO build modern applications and quickly respond to rapidly changing business needs. Banking transactions are now swifter and smoother. Customers receive credit cards in a couple of days, a process that used to take weeks. They can bank from their mobile devices anytime, anywhere. Loan processing is faster and smarter than ever, increasing company efficiency and improving client management.

title: USA Surfing Joins the AI Wave with Azure
executive_summary: USA Surfing is the official national federation for the sport of surfing in the United States. The original partnership between Microsoft and USA Surfing began with a hackathon centered on using AI to improve performance and reduce injuries for athletes. The project has grown into a unique partnership between Azure AI, Cognitive Services for Vision, the Microsoft AI Developer Accelerator Program, and FTA. By simply uploading a surfing video, coaches and surfers have access to AI-generated insights on the surfer, the surfboard, the changing playing field and environment that will lead to improved performance and fewer injuries.

title: Leading IT infrastructure and services company NTT Ltd. achieves unified, global cloud transformation with Azure
executive_summary: NTT Ltd. is a global leader in IT infrastructure and services. The company provides a broad variety of business expertise in networks, security, managed services, and other areas, serving more than 75 percent of the top 100 companies on the Fortune Global 500 list. In digital terms, NTT is also enormous, with a diverse and often complex set of digital environments to run and maintain, comprising more than 25,000 servers and 2,200 applications hosted in more than 50 datacenters.

title: Amrita University begins Zero Trust journey by protecting identities with Azure AD and other Microsoft enterprise solutions
executive_summary: If you think of humanity’s intellectual endeavors as some of its most valuable riches, you’d probably consider universities to be treasure houses. Their vast reserves of research materials and new ideas might hold the answers to some of the world’s pressing problems. This analogy illustrates why Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham, a leading Indian university, scrupulously manages identities. It trusts Azure Active Directory to verify that people who access its data are who they say they are. The university is also on the path to deploy Microsoft Defender suite to advance its security journey and pave the way to a Zero Trust infrastructure.

title: Deutsche Post engineers flexibility and scalability with Azure SQL Database Hyperscale
executive_summary: Deutsche Post DHL Group is one of the world’s largest logistics companies managing national and international deliveries, warehouses and more. Its Track and Trace Parcel System allows internal services to track parcel deliveries and provides information to customers on the front end. Originally using a costly on-premises solution, the company needed a more scalable database to meet increased traffic and prepare for the future. With Azure SQL Database Hyperscale, Deutsche Post has achieved scalability and flexibility, reduced downtime and response time for requests, and greatly increased their number of service updates per year.

title: Verofax bridges gap between brands and consumers with Martech tool on Azure
executive_summary: Verofax, a Martech solution company from the United Arab Emirates, specializes in transforming how brands connect and nurture direct engagement with customers with product twinning, create immersive experiences and virtual assets rewards direct-to-consumer. Verofax is built on Azure-powered technology to tag items and direct consumers into immersive digital experiences and offer virtual assets as rewards to boost customer long term value (CLTV). Fortune 500 beverage brands had applied the solution offering to give consumers a chance to win tickets to the FIFA World Cup by scanning the unique QR code on every product and having their purchase verified to access rewards. The frictionless interaction, led to over a million customers acquired, while lowering acquisition costs 20-fold and increasing conversion rates 50-fold vs under the cap or behind the label consumer promotions.

title: Isabel Group automates operations, takes efficiency to the next level with Azure data platform
executive_summary: Through a variety of multi-banking services, Belgium-based Isabel Group has provided a reliable link between the business world, fiduciaries, banks, software providers, and consumers since 1995. The organization’s original on-premises data platform lacked flexibility and was used only for BI purposes. Some tasks required manual operation and both employees and customers were limited in what they could accomplish. With a need to do more with its data, automate manual processes and add more complex ones, and also scale to accommodate growth and critical unstructured data, the company decided to reinvent its platform using Microsoft Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, and Power BI Premium. The expanded platform offers greater flexibility, supports unstructured data, and includes machine learning use cases, giving Isabel Group employees and customers the ability to do more with greater autonomy.

title: Planning a digital journey for fruits and vegetables: IFCO optimizes its circular economy with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Avocados, ginger, potatoes, bananas—when supermarket shoppers select these or virtually any other fresh produce, they will invariably do so from reusable packaging containers made by IFCO SYSTEMS GmbH. Headquartered in Bavaria, the company is a world market leader in reusable packaging containers for the global food industry. A total of 1.9 billion times a year, these robust foldable containers complete their journey from IFCO to food producers to food retailer warehouses to point of sale and back to IFCO for cleaning before the whole cycle starts again. Ensuring that this loop works smoothly calls for a consistent data pool, fast and efficient reporting, and optimized processes for planning and logistics. Today, this is covered by numerous services belonging to the Microsoft Azure cloud computing platform.

title: Putting IoT to work for a sustainable future
executive_summary: Priorities for facilities management have evolved, with increasing focus on environmental sustainability, energy efficiency, and occupant well-being. To meet sustainability demands and cost pressures, building operations need to be smarter, more energy efficient, carbon negative, and water positive. A way to achieve these goals is to use IoT-powered building management solutions. Such solutions provide perceptive insight into the health of buildings and their assets by collecting and analyzing captured sensor data and giving owners and operators visibility and control of their building systems. Two companies that strive to bring about sustainability through Microsoft Azure services and IoT technology are ICONICS and Microsoft.

title: Westpac transforms IT and enables secure, inclusive, flexible work with Windows 11 Enterprise and Autopatch
executive_summary: Westpac, one of the largest banks in Australia, wanted to improve support for its more than 40,000 people, including its hybrid workforce, by transforming its IT environment. In 2023, the bank chose a solution based on Windows 11 Enterprise E5 and Microsoft cloud services which has since improved user experience for staff and supported secure flexible work that is inclusive of all work styles.

title: VITAS Healthcare improves patient care and saves a million pieces of paper using Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: VITAS Healthcare, the largest single-source provider of end-of-life care in the United States, is using Microsoft technology to simplify paper-based and time-consuming tasks, such as payroll reconciliation and care plan documentation. VITAS began using Power Apps in 2021 but saw further opportunity to reduce paperwork for hospice aides, a process it began in late 2022. VITAS built an intuitive tool using Power Apps that helps nurses and healthcare aides create care plans and document notes accurately and efficiently, reducing paperwork for aides and providing better experiences for hospice patients and families.

title: Okinawa FG achieved DX & New Service Launch with Teams and Azure PaaS in just 4 months by in-house development and use of Low-Code.
executive_summary: Based in Okinawa, The Bank of Okinawa has been operating its banking business over the past half century. In 2021, its 10 group companies constituted Okinawa Financial Group, which is accelerating its initiatives for regional DX. They are intending to support regional business operators in resolving their issues by fully utilizing ideas, know-how incubated through internal DX promotion as well as various services. Okinawa Financial Group, which had been utilizing Microsoft products such as Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Surface for some time, established “Microsoft Base Naha” on the first floor of its head office in collaboration with Microsoft. Furthermore, they have been working on internal development of a new digital service “more series” intended for improving efficiency of in-house development and customer services. The more series is Japan’s first case in customer financial service that linked Microsoft Teams and Azure Communication Services. The combination of low-code development using Azure PaaS and no-code development utilizing Microsoft 365 allowed for quick development that took only four months. With respect to what effects the more series have created and how it would contribute to Okinawa region, we asked the background of the initiatives and future prospects.

title: INPEX Migrates AVEVA PI System to Azure for Enhanced Data Analytics Promoting Sustainable Energy Development
executive_summary: INPEX, known for enabling sustainability for the energy industry, has migrated its IoT data management software, AVEVA™ PI System™, from on-premise servers to Microsoft Azure. The company's system operations have not only been streamlined with the move to a cloud-based IoT platform, but also allows a variety of possibilities. These include data visualization, business insights, and in-house app development through integration with Microsoft 365 E5. Azure is now empowering the company’s drive for its digital transformation strategy.

title: Securing consumers' rights: ANPC eliminates bureaucracy and boosts efficiency with Azure
executive_summary: In its commitment to empower consumers, Romania's National Authority for Consumer Protection (ANPC) embarked on a transformative journey to digitize its operations. Tasked with transitioning its workforce to paperless workflows, ANPC implemented the intuitive Azure-powered app, Regista. This innovative solution revamped document and workflow management, saving two work hours daily and up to US$4,000 annually while delivering enhanced services to consumers.

title: Discover why ING banks on Windows 365 to improve management and performance for a remote workforce
executive_summary: ING is a leading global bank empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business by bringing mobile-led digital experiences to customers worldwide. To optimize operations ING replaced their on-premises virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) with Windows 365 Cloud PCs to meet the needs of employees wherever they work. The bank can easily manage Cloud PCs with its existing IT team and reduce costs by eliminating 1,200 servers, helping to facilitate ING’s pathway to net zero carbon emissions. Windows 365 is fast and simple to deploy, and remote employees appreciate seamless access and remote collaboration. The solution is improving agility and providing the bank with a model for a worldwide, cloud-powered future.

title: Netstar achieves impeccable connectivity for its telematics with Azure solutions
executive_summary: Netstar is a leading provider of vehicle tracking and fleet management solutions in South Africa, Australia, and select African countries. With its legacy on-premises hardware struggling to keep up with day-to-day operations, the company migrated its workload to Microsoft Azure. Netstar partnered with NBConsult and Microsoft to ensure the process was seamless, with zero downtime for customers—despite migrating in its peak month. This move resulted in excellent connectivity and tighter security for Netstar's telematics, enhancing its service offerings.

title: Renewi deploys Elastic Observability on Microsoft Azure to optimize performance of business-critical applications
executive_summary: Renewi is a leading waste-to-product company that focuses on extracting value from waste rather than disposing of it. The company wanted to improve its operational efficiency, customer service, and environmental impact by using data and analytics more effectively. Renewi chose Elastic, a leading platform for search-powered solutions, to help it achieve its goals. Elastic’s solutions are supported and enhanced by Microsoft Azure, which provides a reliable, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure for Elastic deployments. With Elastic on Azure, Renewi gained real-time insights into its waste streams, optimized its routes and processes, and reduced its carbon footprint.

title: ​​Arvato optimizes warehouse operations, deploys new environments within minutes using SAP on Azure​
executive_summary: Logistics provider Arvato uses interconnected Microsoft solutions, and it wants to expand to the cloud with some edge computing to maximize warehouse operations. With its latest project, Arvato sought to migrate and optimize its critical SAP systems, including its SAP S/4HANA environment. Working toward being cloud-first, the company deployed as many Microsoft resources as possible, including Azure ExpressRoute and Azure NetApp Files, to help protect against system failures or forced rollbacks in advance of its accelerated SAP on Azure go-live. With the SAP on Azure migration complete, Arvato has greatly sped up maintenance and patching time and reduced and consolidated dozens of domains. Now, it can better support clients throughout their supply chain journeys.

title: Netstar achieves impeccable connectivity for its telematics with Azure solutions
executive_summary: Netstar is a leading provider of vehicle tracking and fleet management solutions in South Africa, Australia, and select African countries. With its legacy on-premises hardware struggling to keep up with day-to-day operations, the company migrated its workload to Microsoft Azure. Netstar partnered with NBConsult and Microsoft to ensure the process was seamless, with zero downtime for customers—despite migrating in its peak month. This move resulted in excellent connectivity and tighter security for Netstar's telematics, enhancing its service offerings.

title: Renewi deploys Elastic Observability on Microsoft Azure to optimize performance of business-critical applications
executive_summary: Renewi is a leading waste-to-product company that focuses on extracting value from waste rather than disposing of it. The company wanted to improve its operational efficiency, customer service, and environmental impact by using data and analytics more effectively. Renewi chose Elastic, a leading platform for search-powered solutions, to help it achieve its goals. Elastic’s solutions are supported and enhanced by Microsoft Azure, which provides a reliable, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure for Elastic deployments. With Elastic on Azure, Renewi gained real-time insights into its waste streams, optimized its routes and processes, and reduced its carbon footprint.

title: ​​Arvato optimizes warehouse operations, deploys new environments within minutes using SAP on Azure​
executive_summary: Logistics provider Arvato uses interconnected Microsoft solutions, and it wants to expand to the cloud with some edge computing to maximize warehouse operations. With its latest project, Arvato sought to migrate and optimize its critical SAP systems, including its SAP S/4HANA environment. Working toward being cloud-first, the company deployed as many Microsoft resources as possible, including Azure ExpressRoute and Azure NetApp Files, to help protect against system failures or forced rollbacks in advance of its accelerated SAP on Azure go-live. With the SAP on Azure migration complete, Arvato has greatly sped up maintenance and patching time and reduced and consolidated dozens of domains. Now, it can better support clients throughout their supply chain journeys.

title: LG Uplus is building a social media-based digital communication platform with Viva Engage
executive_summary: LG Uplus Corp. decided to introduce Microsoft Viva Engage to enhance employee communication. With Viva Engage, LG Uplus added a social media-based communication platform to the collaboration environment, in addition to email, Microsoft 365 document collaboration tools, and Microsoft Teams. By introducing Viva Engage, LG Uplus could build an easy-to-access digital communication platform where employees can get to know about internal campaigns, share knowledge, and engage with each other with comfort and ease.

title: Azure Cloud Services Bringing Winds of Change in the Dental Industry
executive_summary: DentaLight, a Fukuoka-based company that provides cloud services for dental clinics, such as “Genie” and “myDental,” is aiming for new horizons with Azure. The company is trying to breathe new life into the dental industry, which is said to have “more dentists than the number of convenience stores” and to have “many analog procedures such as paper and manual work”. In 2022, with the theme of automated and unmanned reception, the company has added new functions such as web-based medical interview sheets, cashless payment, and digitalization of sub-charts. The service delivery platform fully utilizes Microsoft Azure PaaS services and Microsoft for Startups, a startup support program provided by Microsoft.

title: Hellmann Worldwide Logistics improves lead generation and opportunity conversion by more than its target of 20 percent with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: With freight rates still sunk at pandemic levels, a global shipping giant needed to enable its sales and marketing functions to close more deals faster. Heavy drag from an outdated CRM system threatened to scuttle those efforts, but thirteen months later, the company is exceeding its targets with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.

title: EY enables video collaboration for its global workforce using Microsoft Stream
executive_summary: As a leader in Assurance, Advisory, Tax, Strategy and Transaction, the EY organization has a global footprint and a leading-edge vision for how all types of businesses can thrive, including its own. The company wanted to make videos a more prominent, dynamic part of how employees engage. “Our vision for videos is to boost retention, productivity, and innovation by helping drive engagement and more effective sharing of information among EY people,” explains Ed Chen, Enterprise Video Product Manager at EY Technology. In short, videos have the potential to bring a new dimension to how employees across the enterprise work, share knowledge, and excel on behalf of the business.

title: SA Power Networks makes rooftop solar smarter
executive_summary: SA Power Networks has invested to provide increased network hosting capacity for rooftop solar. A significant share of renewables on its electricity distribution network comes from excess solar energy exported into the power grid from customers’ rooftop solar panels. To dynamically manage the volume of exports, in addition to avoiding waste or damage to the system at peak generation times, the utility developed the Flexible Exports solution, using Azure IoT for monitoring. In a trial of Flexible Exports, the average customer more than doubled their exported energy. Data collected over the internet from participant households also provides the utility with better network visibility at street level to help improve performance and safety.

title: Enhancing education: AUEB helps students compete in the job market with Microsoft Learn for Educators
executive_summary: With a rich history of over 100 years, Athens University of Economics and Business (AUEB) is the leading business school in Greece and one of the top universities in Southeast Europe. Its Department of Management Science and Technology (DMST) turned to Microsoft Learn for Educators to enhance its curriculum and offer proper training in today’s cutting-edge technologies and IT applications such as Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power BI, and Azure. These efforts enabled more than 80 percent of DMST/AUEB’s students to secure jobs before graduation, jumpstarting their professional development.

title: Swiss Re accelerates Java app modernization using Azure Spring Apps
executive_summary: For more than 150 years, Swiss Re, one of the world’s largest reinsurers, has used data to make the world more resilient. These days, the company uses Microsoft Azure to power a digital transformation that includes the modernization of business-critical financial systems. To speed up deployments and take advantage of the Azure ecosystem, developers traded their existing solutions for Azure platform as a service (PaaS).

title: Aifi and Microsoft Cloud for Retail partner together to shape the future of retail
executive_summary: Despite the prevalence of online retail experiences, two-thirds of global retail trade is transacted in stores. AiFi is bridging the gap between online and brick-and-mortar shopping with AI-powered computer vision that demystifies customer behaviors in stores. By partnering with Microsoft, AiFi has unlocked brand-new insights that help retailers streamline their in-store experience and help vendors optimize product placements and shelf stocking. With Microsoft Cloud for Retail and Azure, AiFi and Microsoft are working together to shape the future of retail.

title: Dutch railway builds real-time crowdedness app with Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: Dutch railway operator Nederlandse Spoorwegen strives to provide fast, safe, and affordable train travel throughout the Netherlands. It discovered that customer satisfaction depends, among other things, on a train’s level of crowdedness and the ability of passengers to find a seat. Building on Microsoft Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, and several other Azure services, Nederlandse Spoorwegen developed an application that delivers real-time crowdedness indicators and travel disruption alerts. Customers have enthusiastically adopted the solution, which also has the potential to improve resource utilization.

title: Live Tech Games massively scales its gaming platform with Microsoft Azure during the FIFA World Cup
executive_summary: Live Tech Games is on a mission to create unique, massively multiplayer mobile gaming experiences that people genuinely want to be a part of. To achieve this, Live Tech Games runs live social tournament games. At set times (for example, 7 PM each evening), a push notification announces the game is starting, and users play live against each other at that moment. Live Tech Games also runs games that are televised live in event halls and pubs after live shows and sporting events to help draw in large audiences from across the United Kingdom. In September 2022, Live Tech Games began working on Knockout, a new football trivia game in which players go head-to-head in three rounds televised at the end of each match of the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar.

title: Inovalon reaches enterprise-wide objectives and empowers employees with Microsoft Viva Goals
executive_summary: Inovalon, a leading provider of cloud-based software solutions empowering data-driven healthcare, had disparate tools and a reactive approach to goal setting. The business searched for an objectives and key results platform that could help teams align on enterprise-wide goals and keep key objectives front and center throughout the year. The business implemented Microsoft Viva Goals in 90 days and reached 100% of enterprise-wide objectives in the first year.

title: Idemitsu Kosan says goodbye to ADFS through switching authentication infrastructure to Microsoft Entra ID in pursuit of diverse work styles
executive_summary: Idemitsu Kosan is known as a company that manufactures and sells fuel oil such as gasoline, kerosene, light oil, and heavy oil, but is actually engaged in a wide range of businesses, including manufacture and sale of basic chemicals, such as olefin (ethylene, propylene, and butadiene) and aroma chemicals, and lubricating oil. In recent years, in order to achieve carbon neutrality, Idemitsu Kosan is working on the generation of synthetic fuels that are free of carbon dioxide emissions, manufacture of sustainable aviation fuel (SAF), and use of ammonia as a fuel.

title: Porsche Informatik boosts performance and security for customer-facing applications with Elastic on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Porsche Informatik needed to streamline and reduce delays across its IT operations, used by millions of customers and employees. To do so, it enlisted Elastic and Microsoft Azure cloud solutions. Today, Porsche Informatik has a more secure network that operates on a single stack thanks to Elastic and Azure Private Link.

title: Siemens Healthineers China expedites product time to market with Microsoft Dev Box
executive_summary: Siemens Healthineers China develops new image applications for online systems to help doctors with remote consulting for patients. Developers were using local workstations to develop and test for multiple platforms, but just setting up each platform could take days—time better spent on development and testing. Healthineers began piloting Microsoft Dev Box in 2023. It enabled them to prebuild multiple bespoke dev and test environments in the cloud, enabling developers worldwide to collaborate and complete projects faster.

title: Design for Leisure improves efficiency 30% with iGlobe solutions and Microsoft Planner
executive_summary: Design for Leisure sought a solution to enhance project management efficiency, streamline planning processes, and ensure alignment with deadlines.
products: Excel, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Planner, SharePoint

title: From siloed teams to a global collaboration culture - Arvato is undergoing a culture change supported by Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Arvato, a leader in global supply chain management, needed to standardize platforms across its worldwide network of locations and reporting for external clients and internal parties alike. The company embraced Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Power BI to create a more transparent, connected organization and modernize the time-consuming process of compiling business-critical reports. Today, Arvato has established a global culture of collaboration and a higher transparency towards its clients through the introduction of the Microsoft Modern Workplace – especially through Teams and Power BI.

title: HB Antwerp's game-changing move: A transparent transformation of diamonds with Azure Confidential Ledger
executive_summary: Belgian company HB Antwerp is redefining how natural diamonds are sourced, crafted, and sold. Supply chains for natural resources are often complex and opaque, but the company is on a mission to give miners and governments complete insight into the post-production retail value of their resources. To gain this insight, HB Antwerp turned to Microsoft and its Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Project Operations, and Azure solutions, using ledger technologies to record immutable data points across the diamond’s journey, ensuring sustainability and visibility every step of the way. Now HB Antwerp can predict its profit more accurately, reduce errors, increase communication, and ensure maximum value for everyone involved. Miners and governments reap the financial benefits and consumers can see how their diamond purchases contribute to transforming Botswana’s economy and the lives of its citizens.

title: Hampton secures warehouse efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: For 30 years, Hampton Products International Corporation (Hampton) has provided reliable and innovative security solutions to home and commercial hardware product sellers. From its first weatherproof padlock design to today’s smart home, travel security, and cargo management solutions, Hampton has consistently upheld its reputation for innovation and quality—and its retail customers depend on it. An impressive lineup of trusted brands, outstanding service, and speed-to-market infrastructure make Hampton a leader in the security hardware and cargo management industry. Hampton distributes products to thousands of retail locations around the world.

title: ABB’s Genix Edge AI extends the potential of industrial condition monitoring and analytics to micro-PCs with AKS Edge Essentials
executive_summary: ABB strives to continuously improve the technology it uses to optimize how things are manufactured, moved, powered, and operated to build a more sustainable and resource-efficient future around the globe. Remote condition monitoring is a key part of keeping those operations running efficiently, but the exponential growth in the number of sensors and data they collect has made it a challenge to extract value from the information in a timely way. By moving its orchestration and operation of remote condition monitoring applications to Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Edge Essentials, ABB has a single end-to-end Kubernetes solution that helps unify edge and cloud assets to streamline application development and simplify deployment and management. As a result, ABB only needs to create one version of applications that can run on Windows, Linux, and in the cloud. This significantly reduces development and deployment time and frees resources to create even more effective AI-driven data analysis solutions from all the rich data collected from large manufacturing operations. Reduced administration requirements also allow ABB to handle a rapidly expanding edge ecosystem with a shrinking number of available workers.

title: World Wide Technology achieves 20% time savings on emissions calculations using Microsoft Sustainability Manager
executive_summary: World Wide Technology (WWT), a global technology solutions provider and a leader in the AI and digital revolution, began using Microsoft Sustainability Manager in 2023 to better understand its direct and indirect carbon emissions footprint. Within five months, WWT migrated thousands of data points on its carbon emissions to Microsoft Sustainability Manager, replacing time-consuming calculations across dozens of facilities and a large supply chain. The company estimates that it has reduced time spent on calculations by up to 20%. WWT has committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050. The company is optimistic about the advancing capabilities of Microsoft Sustainability Manager, viewing it as a valuable tool in helping them meet this goal.

title: Enterritorio, a national company promoting territorial development in Colombia, strengthens its entire operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: In addition to generating contracts and paying for construction and salaries to more than 15 thousand people associated with the work, the industrial and commercial company of the Colombian State managed – through Dynamics 365 – to streamline the complex processes of its operations, which consist of making disbursements and settlements of different taxes in each municipality of the country.

title: Rituals builds a foundation for future expansion with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Rituals creates body, beauty, and home products with a conscience. Inspired by ancient wisdom and modern wellness, the Netherlands-based company blends natural ingredients and biodegradable formulas with elegant design and innovative packaging. Since its founding in 2000, Rituals has been committed to ethical and sustainable business practices. Its cosmetics, scents, skincare, home accessories, and specialty apparel products—all ethically produced—can be found at one of the company’s 1,200 stores around the world, online channels like rituals.com and its associated mobile app, and through well-known retailers such as Ulta Beauty, QVC, and Saks Fifth Avenue. Customers also enjoy experiencing Rituals products at luxury hotels, major airports, and its flagship physical store, House of Rituals, in the center of historic Amsterdam. With a presence in more than 100 countries, Rituals is a global leader in sustainable and ethical beauty.

title: Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and more: Microsoft Skilling helps ZF achieve company-wide IT transformation
executive_summary: ZF Friedrichshafen (ZF) is a global technology company that produces mobility systems for cars, commercial vehicles, and industrial engineering. It is also in the middle of a comprehensive IT transformation. At locations around the world, lots of digital applications have been migrated from local datacenters to the cloud. To make this transition easier on its employees, ZF is offering basic training through Microsoft Skilling—standardized worldwide, available anytime, and managed centrally. Microsoft Skilling also serves as the basis for ZF to offer additional, customized training.

title: NSW Ports shaves up to 80% off its invoice approval time using Dynamics 365
executive_summary: NSW Ports, a key player in Australia’s trade ecosystem, streamlined its finance operations by replacing its existing enterprise resource planning platform with Microsoft Dynamics 365. Leveraging the expertise of Microsoft partner Professional Advantage, NSW Ports transitioned to Dynamics 365 through an agile reimplementation strategy. This shift led to a significant reduction in invoice approval lead times for the organisation, boosting productivity and accuracy in financial transactions.

title: Fulton County Schools transforms data-driven decision-making by using more than 400 Power BI visualizations to improve student outcomes
executive_summary: N/A

title: Dynamics 365 drives Cat® dealership into the 21st century
executive_summary: Foley, Inc. is the Cat dealer covering New Jersey, Staten Island, NY, the southeastern part of Pennsylvania, and northern Delaware, as well as Bermuda. From its founding as an automobile dealership in the early days, the company shifted to heavy equipment sales and rentals in 1957. Since then, it has grown to encompass six locations and a workforce of more than 800 employees.

title: The Stour Academy Trust uses Reading Progress and Reading Coach to inspire a love of reading and support students with reading difficulties
executive_summary: The Stour Academy Trust is a multi-academy trust serving the county of Kent in Southeast England. The staff and faculty work diligently to create a pedagogical model that focuses on student voice, choice, and collaboration. As part of this model, the Trust was interested in testing two powerful Microsoft education tools—Reading Progress and Reading Coach—to boost literacy and help all readers succeed.

title: FNSS empowers employee unity and innovation with Microsoft Viva Engage
executive_summary: FNSS, a leading defense company based in Türkiye, has transformed its internal communication with Microsoft Viva Engage. With a limited talent pool, FNSS prioritizes nurturing and retaining talent. With Microsoft Viva Engage, FNSS expanded access to corporate information and content, and helped build bridges between teams. With hundreds of departmental or interest-based working groups and communities, FNSS staff can easily exchange ideas, collaborate, and connect.

title: Knorr-Bremse moves on the path of digitization and cuts costs with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Global manufacturer Knorr-Bremse makes industry-leading braking systems for rail and commercial vehicles. It regularly enhances its operations using digital technology, and when its on-premises datacenter hardware reached end of support, the manufacturer had to choose between renewing the costly infrastructure or moving to the cloud. Given its positive experiences with other Microsoft solutions, Knorr-Bremse went all in on Microsoft Azure, using Azure VMware Solution to help relocate applications and servers. It’s now saving millions in costs while gaining flexibility, faster time to market, and new opportunities for the future.

title: World Wide Technology achieves 20% time savings on emissions calculations using Microsoft Sustainability Manager
executive_summary: World Wide Technology (WWT), a global technology solutions provider and a leader in the AI and digital revolution, began using Microsoft Sustainability Manager in 2023 to better understand its direct and indirect carbon emissions footprint. Within five months, WWT migrated thousands of data points on its carbon emissions to Microsoft Sustainability Manager, replacing time-consuming calculations across dozens of facilities and a large supply chain. The company estimates that it has reduced time spent on calculations by up to 20%. WWT has committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050. The company is optimistic about the advancing capabilities of Microsoft Sustainability Manager, viewing it as a valuable tool in helping them meet this goal.

title: Enterritorio, a national company promoting territorial development in Colombia, strengthens its entire operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: In addition to generating contracts and paying for construction and salaries to more than 15 thousand people associated with the work, the industrial and commercial company of the Colombian State managed – through Dynamics 365 – to streamline the complex processes of its operations, which consist of making disbursements and settlements of different taxes in each municipality of the country.

title: Financiera Juriscoop grew 45% leveraging Microsoft technologies
executive_summary: The Colombian finance company chose Dynamics 365 to support its business strategy, putting the customer at the center of the experience.

title: Employer Federation Gets 360° Profile of Producers with Dynamics 365 Sales Implementation
executive_summary: The Federación Patronal insurance company adopted Microsoft's CRM to unify data from more than 11,000 producers and organizers into one place. Today, 12 business units nationwide view updated information in Dynamics 365.

title: Parexel speeds operational insights by 70% using Microsoft Azure, accelerating data product delivery and reducing manual work
executive_summary: Parexel International Corporation (Parexel), a global provider of clinical development services, transformed its operations and unified its data using Microsoft technology.
