Faced with complexities and high operational costs after rapid growth, the organization needed to consolidate a fragmented data landscape. Parexel adopted Azure Databricks to consolidate 100 data sources and used Microsoft Power BI to visualize analyzed data swiftly and accurately. It achieved an 85% reduction in data engineering tooling costs, a 30% increase in staff efficiency, and a 70% reduction in time to market for data product delivery. It reduced costs, enhanced employee productivity, and drove industry progress by advancing clinical research and patient care.

title: Anadolu Efes speeds up threat detection and response using Microsoft Defender and Sentinel
executive_summary: Anadolu Efes, one of the top 10 largest brewers in the world operating in over 180 countries, faced increasing complexity in managing a mix of on-premises and cloud cybersecurity solutions. This hindered its ability to address emerging cybersecurity threats efficiently.

title: BISA Seguros saved $23,000 annually and improved teamwork with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: BISA Seguros needed to replace its legacy telephony systems, overhaul the network architecture, and train its staff to move from analog to digital communication, unifying all communications in one collaborative platform.

title: More governance and optimized operation: Embraer's journey with low-code Power Platform solutions
executive_summary: With support from Microsoft, the global aerospace company based in Brazil was able to improve its governance with the Microsoft 365 suite and empower its teams through the low-code Power Platform solution integrated with Microsoft Teams.
products: Microsoft 365, Power Apps, Power BI, SharePoint, Word

title: MESCyT Takes Digital Transformation to the Next Level with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With the aim of accelerating its digital transformation, the Ministry of Higher Education, Science and Technology, within the framework of the guidelines of the 2030 digital agenda of the Government of the Dominican Republic, implemented a "digital adoption cycle" based on Microsoft 365 solutions that improve productivity and strengthen the digital skills of employees, optimizing processes and generating new opportunities through the use of technology.
customer: Ministerio de Educacion Superior Ciencia y Tecnologia
products: Outlook, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint

title: Bankingly leverages financial inclusion with Microsoft Azure technologies
executive_summary: Built on Microsoft's cloud, Bankingly provides web services and mobile applications to microfinance institutions in rural Latin America with the goal of promoting digital inclusion.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure SQL Managed Instance, SQL Server, Azure DDoS Protection

title: cellcentric secures assignment of administrative privileges with Microsoft Entra Verified ID and Microsoft Entra entitlement management
executive_summary: cellcentric is responsible for all activities along the entire value chain for fuel cell systems. The company needed a solution that could help maintain its security posture by ensuring the identities of its authorized and privileged users.

title: Amref Health Africa predicts and prevents malnutrition in Kenya with AI
executive_summary: The global health nonprofit Amref Health Africa works to create lasting change across Africa, including nutrition projects in Kenya. Amref wanted a way to address malnutrition more proactively to stop this widespread condition and save lives.

title: Kurt J. Lesker Company modernizes business operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: A dated Microsoft AX ERP was aging past support, slowed operations, kept Human Resources separate, and didn’t provide a Sales support tool. The company’s growth highlighted the need to modernize and integrate its business software solution.

title: Grand & Toy honors legacy of excellence with future-proof innovations and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Grand & Toy embarked on a digital transformation to replace disparate and aging systems with a single source of truth for sales, sales operations, customer care, and marketing teams.

title: E-discovery company uses serverless computing to speed internal development of its SaaS solution
executive_summary: Based in Chicago, Illinois, Relativity wanted to improve the customer experience of its RelativityOne cloud-based e-discovery platform. The company decided to create a monitoring solution based on a serverless architecture powered by Microsoft Azure Functions that proactively identifies and resolves performance issues. Now, developers have more time to apply their talent to writing task specific code and enhancing functionality, without worrying about underlying systems and servers. Some projects that used to require a few months can now be completed in a few days.

title: Grocery chain in northern California and southern Oregon boosts customer relationships with custom app
executive_summary: One of the highest priorities for North State Grocery is keeping customers happy at both of its chains. When a popular customer service program became a bottleneck for responding to customer requests for new products, the customer service team worked with SkyLite Systems to replace it. The new solution unlocks customer data from Microsoft SharePoint Online—a familiar tool for the staff—making it possible for all stakeholder departments to access and update the database from any connected device. It also helps keep data and alerts moving smoothly, preventing requests from falling through the cracks—all while increasing the value of Office 365 and the company’s Microsoft investment.

title: Serious responsibility, high requirements
executive_summary: The energy market is highly competitive, and the liberalization of the electricity market has spurred the rise of strong competition. In addition to the security of confidential data, additional customer value has become essential for the industry. This was the case at Stadtwerke Krefeld AG (SWK). A group with more than 2,700 employees, SWK is a comprehensive provider of energy, water, waste disposal, and transport services. Working with Microsoft Partner Network member Bechtle AG, the company has not only modernized its customer portal on Microsoft Azure, but it has also optimized its security software and communication and collaboration systems with Microsoft 365 E5. Fortunately for SWK, this allowed the company to keep working, even during the COVID-19 crisis.

title: Cloud Services improves Delivery Auto operations and realizes 30% infrastructure savings with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: With over 400 warehouses, Delivery Auto provides domestic and international shipping logistics across Ukraine. The company retained Cloud Services to optimize and scale its existing Microsoft Azure implementation. Implementing resource governance and management was crucial for Delivery Auto to managing costs, accelerate innovations, and deliver packages more efficiently. Cloud Services worked closely with high-level stakeholders and IT staff to transform use of Azure services and realize a 30% savings in infrastructure costs.

title: Romanian university enhances traditional learning formats by going online with Office 365
executive_summary: Professors at the Technical University of Cluj-Napoca (TUCN) are ushering in a new era for education. As one of Romania’s most recognized higher education institutions, the university is spearheading digital transformation of the classroom through the comprehensive integration of Office 365 solutions. With Microsoft Teams as a centralized collaboration hub, the school delivers online learning to more than 15,000 students who exchange at minimum 20,000 messages daily on more than 6,500 active Teams channels.

title: Bringing back house calls: St. Luke’s Hospital uses Microsoft 365 to reimagine care for patients
executive_summary: It’s midafternoon and Alycia Walty, MD, pediatrician and Chief Medical Officer of Star Wellness, is trying to look up the nose of a four-year-old. Dr. Walty is in her office, and the patient is at home with his mom. How does this work? A flashlight helps. A smartphone is essential. So is plenty of patience with little kids. But the whole encounter is made possible by Microsoft Teams, the digital collaboration service in Microsoft 365. Eventually, Dr. Walty makes her diagnosis: a common cold, not COVID-19. The visit ends with a very thankful and relieved mom.

title: Brandt finds success using FormsPro mobile forms platform delivered with Microsoft technology
executive_summary: Brandt is a leading mechanical, electrical, and sheet metal specialty contractor with operations and services across Texas. Brandt selected OmniByte Technology’s FormsPro to enhance field operations, address specific use cases, solve workstream challenges in multiple divisions, reduce or avoid technical debt, integrate with business software and other technologies, and facilitate end-user adoption. FormsPro is deployed on-premises, leveraging Brandt’s preferred and easily supported Microsoft technologies, including Internet Information Services (IIS) and SQL Server 2016. Cloud deployments of FormsPro use Microsoft Azure services, including Azure Web Apps, Azure Cognitive Services, Azure App Service, and Azure SQL Database. Brandt now has 600 mobile users and 2,500 web FormsPro users, and since 2019, Brandt has increased revenue by $4.8 million, with a 44 percent increase in extra work authorizations and a 43 percent increase in the number of forms submitted.

title: Siemens Healthineers delivers services to customers’ on-premises machines with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Siemens Healthineers delivers digital services to cloud-connected customers through the teamplay digital health platform, a software platform it developed and manages in Microsoft Azure. By using Azure Arc, Siemens Healthineers can manage and set governance rules for clients’ scanners and other hospital machines remotely, while still keeping critical customer data in the on-premises machines. Siemens Healthineers can also use teamplay to provide near real-time software updates to on-premises equipment and provision it with a variety of new services and capabilities developed by its software partners.

title: Modern law firm fights impact of COVID19 by securing its endpoints with the Microsoft Surface family of products
executive_summary: For UK law firm Shakespeare Martineau, a roll-out of new Microsoft Surface devices was driven by the desire to marry greater agility and freedom with improved end-point security, flexible productivity and practicality. In practice, switching to Microsoft Surface has resulted in improved morale, increased productivity, reduced downtime, an increase in billable hours and enhanced client satisfaction. It has brought unexpected benefits throughout the time of the pandemic by enabling the firm to continue with operations and demonstrate their expertise across a wealth of areas impacted by the pandemic through enhanced services and a much-improved digital presence.

title: Chipotle serves up fresh, personalized marketing with Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill lets its customers personalize food to their individual tastes, and the company wants to personalize its marketing efforts to target individual patrons’ interests and activities. The company traditionally had lots of data but no comprehensive customer data platform to make sense of it all. By deploying Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Chipotle can now organize, analyze, and enrich its customer information to target marketing efforts so they’re as meaningful and effective as possible.

title: Global restaurant chain dishes on the benefits of cloud computing
executive_summary: Vapiano Restaurant, a global restaurant chain, serves up innovative dining experiences in order to differentiate itself from others in the market. Because it runs its business on the Microsoft Azure platform, Vapiano takes advantage of the inherent agility and extensibility of cloud computing to expand operations and raise the bar for the “fast-casual dining” experience everywhere.

title: How Edsby uses the Microsoft Cloud to transform K-12 school districts with a comprehensive learning and analytics platform
executive_summary: Millions of students, teachers, and parents rely on learning applications. But for all their popularity (and varying levels of success), ad hoc, fragmented ecosystems of mobile applications and online software consistently provoke questions and concerns at school districts.

title: Carlsberg Group adds security, lowers costs, with Azure migration including SAP
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Sharing the stories of a human rights museum around the world with Microsoft Azure Stack HCI solutions
executive_summary: The Canadian Museum for Human Rights works to engage people all over the world in the human rights conversation, promoting respect and dialogue through education and its thought-provoking installations. To make its content available to people globally, the Winnipeg, Manitoba, institution offers a rich media storytelling experience online. It also optimizes its onsite installations with interactive digital experiences. The museum uses a hybrid hyperconverged infrastructure (HCI) with Microsoft Azure Stack HCI solutions to establish the wholly software-defined datacenter it envisioned for maximum security and efficiency.

title: Eneco: Creating a sustainable workplace with modern devices
executive_summary: As a modern energy supplier, Eneco proudly helps consumers and businesses make the switch to renewable-energy sources. It’s a sustainability commitment the company takes seriously internally too, which has helped it build a strategic partnership with Microsoft where both companies can help the other achieve their sustainable goals. It also proved valuable in 2020, when Eneco started a project to create a stable modern workplace—choosing both Microsoft hardware and software to help create a seamless remote-working experience for everyone across the energy group.

title: Telia simplifies processes, streamlines POS, and improves customer experience with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As the largest telecommunications company in Sweden, Telia wanted to streamline its inventory and sales processes and create a trusted experience for customers. It considered how to connect Microsoft Dynamics 365 with its existing SAP systems while reducing the number of total systems and simplifying day-to-day tasks for staff. Telia adopted several Dynamics 365 business applications—Commerce, Supply Chain Management, and Finance—along with Microsoft Power BI. As a result, the company cut its number of disparate systems in half, gained the ability to tightly track inventory, improved its sales, and created a faster, more personalized shopping experience for its customers.

title: Edible Arrangements finds the personalized sweet spot for customer experience with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Throughout 2020 and into 2021, gift delivery services have been a lifeline for people looking to celebrate special occasions remotely or just show someone they care. Edible Arrangements helps make moments like these possible, with a diverse selection of handcrafted products made from fresh, wholesome produce. The company adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Power BI to get a clearer view of its customer data. It now creates more personalized promotions, offering meaningful gifting experiences, encouraging more frequent purchases, and spreading more joy.

title: Grand & Toy honors legacy of excellence with future-proof innovations and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Grand & Toy embarked on a digital transformation to replace disparate and aging systems with a single source of truth for sales, sales operations, customer care, and marketing teams.

title: E-discovery company uses serverless computing to speed internal development of its SaaS solution
executive_summary: Based in Chicago, Illinois, Relativity wanted to improve the customer experience of its RelativityOne cloud-based e-discovery platform. The company decided to create a monitoring solution based on a serverless architecture powered by Microsoft Azure Functions that proactively identifies and resolves performance issues. Now, developers have more time to apply their talent to writing task specific code and enhancing functionality, without worrying about underlying systems and servers. Some projects that used to require a few months can now be completed in a few days.

title: Grocery chain in northern California and southern Oregon boosts customer relationships with custom app
executive_summary: One of the highest priorities for North State Grocery is keeping customers happy at both of its chains. When a popular customer service program became a bottleneck for responding to customer requests for new products, the customer service team worked with SkyLite Systems to replace it. The new solution unlocks customer data from Microsoft SharePoint Online—a familiar tool for the staff—making it possible for all stakeholder departments to access and update the database from any connected device. It also helps keep data and alerts moving smoothly, preventing requests from falling through the cracks—all while increasing the value of Office 365 and the company’s Microsoft investment.

title: NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory better manages communication with space missions using Azure Quantum
executive_summary: For every NASA space mission, there is a team on the ground coordinating contact with spacecraft through the Deep Space Network (DSN), an array of huge radio antennas located in Spain, Australia, and the United States. As the number of active missions continues to grow and demand on the DSN increases, NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) sought the intensive computing resources necessary to better manage scheduling requests and access to the DSN antennas. JPL tapped into Microsoft Azure Quantum to adapt quantum-inspired optimization algorithms to a custom-fit solution for improving both scheduling and the overall flow of communication with the growing number of spacecraft unlocking new understandings of the universe.

title: HP aims to deliver highly personalized customer service and build customer loyalty
executive_summary: HP wants to provide both enterprise customers and home consumers with exceptional customer service. The company is looking at enhancing its support experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing for customer journey orchestration. This offers HP the ability to give service agents a 360-degree view of customers in real time, including their needs and support history, so agents can quickly guide customers to an issue resolution. By providing a more personalized experience, HP keeps the customer experience positive and builds lifetime loyalty, while also reducing support call times and lowering operational costs.

title: Fit for the Future in Financial Services
executive_summary: “In the beginning, the project’s two primary objectives were to utilise the Cloud to enhance business resilience and to deliver a more flexible modern way of working for our front-office and client facing teams,” explains Michael Allen, Chief Operating Officer at Waverton Investment Management.

title: Alpega Group is improving sustainability in the transport industry with a container solution managed by Microsoft and Red Hat
executive_summary: Leading global logistics software company, Alpega Group, helps coordinate the transportation of freight in 80 countries. Working with 80,000 carriers and 200,000 members, it is a huge and complex operation that relies on the company’s Transport Management System (TMS). So, when the company decided to implement a new container management system built on Microsoft Azure Red Hat OpenShift, it meant changing the infrastructure that underpins the entire business. That change has facilitated greater agility, flexibility, and stability for Alpega’s Smart Booking system, allowing the company to respond to demand and scale its operations accordingly. This transformation is helping Alpega to optimize freight transportation and create a more sustainability within the industry.

title: Britax Römer creates a unified e-commerce solution to help get car seats in more hands and protect children
executive_summary: Britax Römer prides itself on producing some of the world’s safest and most comfortable child mobility solutions, including car seats and strollers. In Europe, the company works with a wide range of retail customers who increasingly expect comprehensive, real-time digital selling solutions. To provide more robust experiences and discoverability for retailers and streamline the customer’s buying journey, Britax Römer is deploying the AI-powered business-to-business (B2B) e-commerce capabilities in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce. With all product and customer journey information in a single location and the ability to provide experiences for both traditional and emerging channels, Britax Römer retailer partners can focus on delivering exceptional service to consumers and get more car seats into the hands of parents to help protect more children on the road every day.

title: Northumbrian Water uses SharePoint Syntex and Microsoft Viva Topics for knowledge delivery
executive_summary: Northumbrian Water, a UK-based water and sewage service provider, delivers vital public health services that are woven into customers’ day-to-day lives. Faced with a large amount of aging assets and processes, the company tapped into Microsoft 365 tools including Microsoft Viva Topics, SharePoint, and SharePoint Syntex to automate documentation and better identify the right information at the right time.

title: HCA Healthcare secures its endpoints to ensure highest quality patient care
executive_summary: HCA Healthcare believes security is essential to providing a positive patient experience. They want the patient experience to focus on getting well and staying well, not worrying about whether their personal health information is safe. The average person may not consider a security team a critical part of patient care, but Jason Barnett, Chief Information Security Officer at HCA Healthcare, says his team considers themselves healthcare workers first; they are just not at the bedside. They enable quality care by securing and protecting the very devices and systems their caregivers rely on daily with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

title: Arm enables low-code adoption with a thriving Power Platform Center of Excellence
executive_summary: Arm is a leading semiconductor and software design company headquartered in Cambridge, England. To improve governance, reduce app sprawl, and support its citizen developer community, Arm has relied upon the Microsoft Power Platform Center of Excellence (CoE) Starter Kit. Results have driven more informed decision making, streamlined environments, and development of higher value apps for the company.

title: PrimeKey's certificate management solution on Microsoft Azure helps Erie 1 BOCES authenticate mobile devices for Wi-Fi access
executive_summary: New York public school cooperative Erie 1 BOCES was looking for a solution to authenticate mobile devices for Wi-Fi access. After success in the request-for-proposal process, Microsoft partner PrimeKey implemented its EJBCA Enterprise certificate issuance and management system, which works with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Intune. Erie 1 BOCES integrated EJBCA Enterprise with Microsoft Intune in about two weeks and issued certificates to thousands of devices. Now there are plans to extend this deployment to thousands of other devices as well.

title: Mazars Slovensko realizes effective teamwork with Microsoft Teams and Power Apps
executive_summary: Mazars Slovensko offers expert services in audit and accounting, tax, financial advisory, outsourcing and consulting in Slovakia under the global professional services group Mazars. Striving to make collaboration easier and reduce the burden of repetitive tasks for staff, the company turned to Microsoft Teams. By integrating Power Apps and other tools within the Teams platform, Mazars Slovensko created a user-friendly hub for daily operations. Today, staff benefit not only from more effective collaboration, but also enhanced team capacity planning, automated tax data submission, and streamlined parking reservation.

title: Kontent by Kentico helps brands publish faster with Microsoft Azure-based content management system
executive_summary: Kontent by Kentico is a headless content management system (CMS) that helps companies improve their content operations. Built for the enterprise market, the platform enables large teams to create modern digital experiences. The CMS was developed by Kentico Software, a company that offers quality content management products to businesses around the globe. When building Kontent, the team turned to Azure, leveraging the power of the cloud in developing a product that answers the needs of top organizations.

title: Kuwait University introduces the highest level of remote education with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Kuwait University is the only governmental university in its country, with 40,000 students and 1,600 faculty members. The university has built a unified, remote learning environment adopting Microsoft 365, Azure, and Surface devices. Through this change, Kuwait University enhanced the educational experience for all, gained valuable data, and improved communication between students and professors.

title: The Commonwealth of Massachusetts achieves breakthrough success shaping the future of work for state employees—eight years ahead of schedule
executive_summary: For decades, the Commonwealth of Massachusetts' 125 separate executive departments and divisions operated as technology siloes. To remedy this while enabling its 40,000 employees to work securely from anywhere, as well as reducing the size of its facilities footprint, the commonwealth embarked on an ambitious modernization plan that few government entities had ever tried. Built around a cloud-based strategy, the state's bold Workforce 2030 initiative helped modernize and standardize state employees on Microsoft productivity and collaboration solutions and devices—accomplishing a 10-year plan in just 18 months—and created a foundation for the future of work.

title: Collaboration reaches new heights at United Airlines with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: United Airlines, the global airline based in Chicago, Illinois, has been connecting people for more than 90 years. But, even after decades in the industry, there is still room for a fresh challenge, like when the airline was asked to help coordinate a “civilian air activation” and help move Afghan refugees out of the Middle East and Germany. When Harel Magaritz, Managing Director of Network Operation Center, Daily Operation at United Airlines, remembers the event, he calls it “one of the more remarkable things we’ve ever done.” The story he shares is a testament to teamwork. “In August of 2021, United Airlines gathered 250 employees in Microsoft Teams to coordinate the civilian air activation,” he says. Over a period of nearly two months, employees from across United collaborated in Teams to arrange a total of 70 flights, all while continuing to run a worldwide airline. Ultimately, the effort helped assist some 10,000 refugees. “We had multiple Teams channels going 24 hours a day,” says Magaritz. “It was phenomenal, getting everyone together in real time to make sure no information was missed and support was constantly there.” Everything from providing coloring books for young passengers to sourcing Gatorade for dehydrated guests was discussed in Teams, along with the paperwork and logistics needed for such an operation. Without Teams, the undertaking would have been significantly more challenging, notes Magaritz. “If we didn’t have Teams, this mission would have involved hundreds of emails and phone calls,” he says. “Would we have completed the missions? Yes, but it would have been nowhere near the product and level of collaboration we delivered with Teams.”

title: Microsoft substantially boosts capacity, efficiency, and scale for Azure Storage using Azure Quantum
executive_summary: Handling the data, applications, and workloads of millions of customers all at the same time, processing more than 500 trillion transactions monthly, requires serious management capabilities. To be able to fully support its customers, Microsoft must be nimble enough to respond quickly and easily to rapid, real-time fluctuations in storage usage and demand. Simultaneously, it needs to conserve resources for overall storage optimization. Facing these challenges, and the prospect of even greater complexity down the road with expected data growth nearing 175 zettabytes by 2025, the Storage team looked to Azure Quantum.

title: The Cyber Attack Against Kalix Municipality
executive_summary: "Nothing worked. We couldn’t even print papers from the printers. Our homecare staff didn’t have access to medical records, no one was spared."

title: Wales amplifies effectiveness of Minecraft: Education Edition through countrywide educator training program
executive_summary: What began as a pilot project with 18 teachers in 2018 has grown to a £1.2 million investment by Welsh government to provide all educators and nearly half a million learners access to Microsoft 365 and Minecraft: Education Edition via the country’s digital learning platform, Hwb. This successful implementation now serves as a model for sustainable educator professional development at scale. Minecraft: Education Edition is an engaging way to help learners build important 21st century skills, and an integral tool for teaching and enriching the Curriculum for Wales.

title: Minecraft empowers students to solve climate issues, builds skills for green careers
executive_summary: During the pandemic, educators and students at John Dewey High School in Brooklyn established a Minecraft Club to foster school community. Students participated in global Minecraft sustainability challenges that dovetailed with existing schoolwide efforts to protect the local environment. When the New York City Department of Education codified Minecraft in sustainability curricula, it prioritized student-directed learning—and started building career pathways in the future green economy.

title: CIAT drives innovation and productivity for national tax agencies
executive_summary: The Inter-American Center of Tax Administrations (CIAT) provides technical assistance, studies, and training to strengthen the tax administrations of its 42 member countries. In addition to its established offerings, CIAT has a strategic intent to provide advanced technology products that helps strengthen government tax administrations around the world. As part of Microsoft’s investment program into industry, it develops accelerators that outline how agencies can adopt cloud technology to drive innovation. CIAT, with direct collaboration from Microsoft, deployed the Microsoft Public Finance accelerator in Costa Rica to help free the government’s tax administration by optimizing data collection, automating routine tasks, and using machine learning strategically allocate efforts where they are needed most.

title: The City of Corona delivers resiliency, security, ease of use from anywhere with Windows 365 and Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Corona, California, just 50 miles east of Los Angeles, began as a small, rural community in 1896 and has blossomed into a modern, full-service city with 160,000 residents. In 2017, the hills above Corona caught fire while key city leaders were across the country for a conference in Florida. Without an established remote working solution, Deputy Chief Information Officer for the City of Corona, Kyle Edgeworth, had to quickly come up with a way to remotely deploy services and manage the emergency across state lines. Once the fire was out, Edgeworth and other city leaders took a hard look at the disaster preparedness and remote accessibility of their then-emergent cloud infrastructure. “Our servers were being migrated to the cloud, but the desktops we used to sign in to them weren’t,” says Edgeworth. “We needed trustworthy remote access to our government cloud.” Ultimately, the City of Corona met that need—and others—with Windows 365 Cloud PCs.

title: Home Trust increases performance, reduces time to market with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Home Trust Company faced a costly and time-consuming upgrade project for its datacenter exit. Moving forward, it sought to increase reliability and resilience and reduce operating costs with a managed VMware solution. The Canadian financial services institution exited its cloud-hosted solution running VMware and is now 100 percent in Microsoft Azure. It’s using Azure VMware Solution to tap into significant ease of management, seamless scalability, and cost savings. With Azure VMware Solution, the company improved performance over its former on-premises solution, and it can bring products to market faster than before. The IT team is now considering new, innovative ways to expand the business and modernize applications in Azure.

title: Rimac Group invents ground-breaking new technologies relying for security and productivity on Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Rimac Group, a Croatia-based company, “challenges convention and pushes technology to the edge of possibility” by developing and manufacturing hypercars and building new technologies for electric vehicles. As the company has grown from 600 employees in 2019 to more than 2,100 employees in 2023, the need for further enhancement of the Group’s security posture was identified. With help from its implementation partner Combis, it made its IT ecosystem more secure and efficient based on Microsoft 365 E5. The company has upgraded its detection and response capabilities and can now onboard new employees faster.

title: HSBC innovates with Microsoft Power Apps to make impressive savings
executive_summary: “Technology is helping us to streamline our customer journeys,” explains Richard Lord, MD, Regional CIO, Wholesale – Asia Pacific at HSBC. “We are streamlining transactions and reducing the time it takes for customers to get on with the business they need to do.”

title: Telefónica takes control of connectivity data for 10M+ home routers with an Azure IoT–based platform
executive_summary: For 99 years, Telefónica has thrived as a telecommunications provider by exploring the use of the latest technology to streamline business growth and satisfy customer demand. The company recently built a new service delivery and communications platform called Home Advanced Connectivity (HAC) that enables operations and customer services teams for the first time to have real-time, bidirectional data flows between customers’ in-home gateway devices and the Telefónica cloud at scale. Developed on the Microsoft Azure IoT platform, HAC simplifies and enhances connectivity management by overcoming technical barriers previously posed by third-party agents that were required to run on the routers. Today, 4.5 million devices process 6.5 billion messages per day, with plans to easily scale to 20 million devices in the next few years. The solution has streamlined device management across this huge install base and enabled new opportunities to rapidly develop and deliver new value-added services.

title: AG Insurance gets closer to its customers by modernizing on Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: For nearly 200 years, AG Insurance has been providing a wide range of insurance products to its customers across Belgium. As insurance customers have become more digitally savvy, companies have started to capitalize on data to provide personalized products and reduce friction, for instance, during the claims process. As AG Insurance moved in the same direction, its on-premises solution became strained from the sheer volume of data it was processing. To revitalize its platform and offer more scalability and elasticity, the organization partnered with Microsoft and Hexaware to design an intelligent data platform that allows AG Insurance to utilize accurate and timely data to enhance customer service. AG Insurance now has the tools to effectively harness customer data and build solutions that provide an improved, personalized experience to keep it at the forefront of the insurance industry.

title: O.C. Tanner uses Microsoft Viva Goals to align on objectives and key results and create “unity in focus”
executive_summary: O.C. Tanner began as a manufacturing company and pioneer of the employee recognition industry. For almost a century, the company has helped enterprise clients, which include American Airlines, Bayer, and Taco Bell, develop workplace cultures that empower people to thrive at work.

title: How the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform enables Ahold Delhaize to drive value across its brand ecosystem
executive_summary: As one of the world’s largest food retail groups, Ahold Delhaize is devoted to improving the lives of its customers using technology. To do this, the company has embarked on a digital transformation journey that centers around boosting its loyalty and personalization programs. Powered by the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform, Ahold Delhaize’s solution is helping to provide more personalized services to the millions of people in its customer base. All while allowing it to be more environmentally conscious and to make more of its data.

title: Kyunghee Girls’ Middle School in South Korea is providing future-oriented learning experience to its students with Microsoft 365 and Surface
executive_summary: Founded in 1960, Kyunghee Girls' Middle School is a secondary educational institution that has nurtured numerous talented individuals in the past 60 years with its educational policy of "Creating a Cultural World." Kyunghee Girls' Middle School is partnering with Microsoft to empower students with the latest digital education solutions to become future leaders of the 21st century’s information and knowledge society.

title: The City of Corona delivers resiliency, security, ease of use from anywhere with Windows 365 and Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Corona, California, just 50 miles east of Los Angeles, began as a small, rural community in 1896 and has blossomed into a modern, full-service city with 160,000 residents. In 2017, the hills above Corona caught fire while key city leaders were across the country for a conference in Florida. Without an established remote working solution, Deputy Chief Information Officer for the City of Corona, Kyle Edgeworth, had to quickly come up with a way to remotely deploy services and manage the emergency across state lines. Once the fire was out, Edgeworth and other city leaders took a hard look at the disaster preparedness and remote accessibility of their then-emergent cloud infrastructure. “Our servers were being migrated to the cloud, but the desktops we used to sign in to them weren’t,” says Edgeworth. “We needed trustworthy remote access to our government cloud.” Ultimately, the City of Corona met that need—and others—with Windows 365 Cloud PCs.

title: Home Trust increases performance, reduces time to market with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Home Trust Company faced a costly and time-consuming upgrade project for its datacenter exit. Moving forward, it sought to increase reliability and resilience and reduce operating costs with a managed VMware solution. The Canadian financial services institution exited its cloud-hosted solution running VMware and is now 100 percent in Microsoft Azure. It’s using Azure VMware Solution to tap into significant ease of management, seamless scalability, and cost savings. With Azure VMware Solution, the company improved performance over its former on-premises solution, and it can bring products to market faster than before. The IT team is now considering new, innovative ways to expand the business and modernize applications in Azure.

title: Rimac Group invents ground-breaking new technologies relying for security and productivity on Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Rimac Group, a Croatia-based company, “challenges convention and pushes technology to the edge of possibility” by developing and manufacturing hypercars and building new technologies for electric vehicles. As the company has grown from 600 employees in 2019 to more than 2,100 employees in 2023, the need for further enhancement of the Group’s security posture was identified. With help from its implementation partner Combis, it made its IT ecosystem more secure and efficient based on Microsoft 365 E5. The company has upgraded its detection and response capabilities and can now onboard new employees faster.

title: EY brings more data into focus with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: As a trusted provider of financial and tax services, the EY Global Tax team processes, manages, and protects huge volumes of data so they can gain insights to help thousands of clients around the world thrive in a rapidly changing and unpredictable business environment. To focus those efforts even more precisely, while addressing security, the EY Global Tax team previewed Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 and developed a plugin to evaluate the ability to extend the capabilities of Copilot to fit the Tax organization’s specific, internal needs. The EY Global Tax team built a proof of concept of the plugin on a developer tenant provided by Microsoft. The goal is to use Copilot to add an AI-powered productivity layer to Microsoft 365 apps. This productivity layer will allow authorized users to query specified data sources in their natural language to generate a single, unified view of all relevant information—and all within security and compliance guidelines. Once the plugin for Copilot is fully deployed, the EY Global Tax team expects to spend less time hunting for information and more time using the latest, most relevant data to drive smarter business decisions for itself and its clients.

title: University of Sharjah leaps ahead into AI-enhanced IT security with Microsoft Sentinel, Azure, and Defender for Cloud
executive_summary: UAE’s University of Sharjah is blazing the TechEd trail, keeping sensitive research projects, student records, and online classes highly secure while also saving on manpower and system downtime. In a game-changing cybersecurity move, the University transitioned from a cumbersome manual platform to Microsoft Sentinel. When correlated with Defender and Azure, it covered 70 percent of threat vectors overnight and automated 20 percent of security use cases within 48 manhours. With AI-driven defense against thousands of daily alerts, the University has swiftly moved from complexity to confidence, handling 80 percent of security operations with a standard system administrator.

title: SPAR ICS enhances shopping and optimizes supply chain with Cloud for Retail
executive_summary: SPAR ICS—the independent IT unit of SPAR Austria Group—aims to make shopping seamless and efficient for SPAR customers. Building on a years-long relationship with Microsoft, SPAR ICS recently used Cloud for Retail to create and release the scalable, manageable, and highly secure SPAR app to enhance the SPAR shopping experience. Performance has been excellent, even at times of peak demand. SPAR ICS also created an award-winning, AI-enabled demand forecasting system with Azure Synapse Analytics and is moving it to Microsoft Fabric. With the new system, SPAR Austria Group is optimizing its supply chain and achieving 90 percent inventory prediction accuracy.

title: SOPHiA GENETICS leverages Microsoft 365 E5 and Microsoft Sentinel to minimize security risks and reduce costs
executive_summary: SOPHiA GENETICS pursued an IT security strategy based on the Best of Breed approach. This resulted in significant time, personnel, and cost expenditures, and posed a security risk because the then Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) was not connected to Microsoft technologies such as Microsoft Azure.

title: Hokkoku Bank enhances customer service and transforms its business with the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Hokkoku Bank has served communities within the Ishikawa Prefecture in Japan for eight decades establishing a reputation of trust and superior customer care. But with its critical systems and tools on-premises, the organization wanted to move its operations to the Microsoft Cloud. Working with Microsoft, Hokkoku Bank embarked on a digital transformation journey that included embracing innovations powered by Azure, Microsoft 365, and Teams across the organization. The changes are helping the bank open lines of communication across previously rigid roles, freeing employees to provide better customer experiences by making formerly siloed information more accessible.

title: Kotsovolos transforms operations, brings sustainability, and boosts efficiency in just six months with Azure-powered solution
executive_summary: Kotsovolos-Dixons South East Europe is one of the leading electrical and electronics retailers in Greece. Managing about 100 stores and an inventory of thousands of products per store, it has embarked on a digital transformation journey aimed at revolutionizing its operations. The company asked Microsoft partner Yodiwo to devise a dynamic digital replica of each store, operating in real time. Using Plano360, Yodiwo’s all-in-one retail optimization platform powered by Azure, Kotsovolos managed to increase the efficiency of its premises and operations, as well as the adherence to planograms. It has also enhanced collaboration and paved the way for future AI applications.

title: Mr. Turing uses AI and Azure Kubernetes Service to unlock and retain company information—and make it searchable
executive_summary: Mr. Turing, an AI company, exists to organize, manage, and make available one of the greatest assets companies have: its own knowledge base. Mr. Turing, along with Alan, its natural language processing platform, are becoming more efficient and intelligent through partnership with Microsoft. Read the full story to learn how Microsoft Cloud Native development and Azure Kubernetes Service empower Mr. Turing in its mission to drive innovation by collecting and making internal business information searchable.

title: SAS - Scandinavian Airlines boosts operational efficiency and customer experiences with Azure modernization
executive_summary: SAS - Scandinavian Airlines wanted to improve its technology platform to better accommodate the more than 30 million customers it serves each year. The airline’s overarching vision was to increase operational efficiency and empower its developers to spend less time maintaining infrastructure and more time building innovative solutions to support its customers at every touch point during their travel experience. The airline chose to move from an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) solution to a fully managed platform as a service (PaaS) and elected to migrate critical databases and applications first, using Microsoft Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, Azure App Service, and Microsoft Defender for Cloud. With support from Microsoft Customer Success Migration Factory, SAS completed the complex migration quickly, and without incident—immediately enhancing its security posture and creating an environment for more streamlined DevOps workflows. With Azure PaaS, the airline can more proactively meet customer demands, minimizing disruptions and ensuring a seamless travel experience.

title: From HR to marketing, Motor Oil Group eliminates mundane tasks with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Motor Oil Group, a leader in Greece's energy sector, has transformed its operations with Microsoft Copilot for M365, achieving remarkable efficiency gains. By integrating artificial intelligence into its workflows, it now spends minutes on tasks that used to take weeks. Crafting speeches, presentations, and job descriptions is now a breeze, transforming everything from human resources to financial operations. With Copilot, Motor Oil Group’s staff can focus on strategic initiatives, keeping the company at the forefront of the industry.

title: Futura Schools drives cross-sectional and hybrid education with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: The Peruvian educational network uses different technological tools to offer a socio-emotional education at the forefront and with the highest quality standards.

title: Eastman catalyzes cybersecurity defenses with Copilot for Security
executive_summary: You could call specialty materials manufacturer Eastman an idea company. It protects a trove of sensitive IP detailing formulae and processes. In an age where cybercrime constantly threatens forward-thinking companies like Eastman, fielding a top-level security team is paramount to business continuity and success. But finding the people with the right skills is one of the biggest challenges facing security managers today. Always the innovator, Eastman is discovering the potential of AI tools to bring junior security staff up-to-speed faster and save precious time for even the most senior staff members as well. Soon after rolling out Microsoft Copilot for Security, Eastman began to realize the benefits of accelerated upskilling, step-by-step guidance for response, and faster threat remediation.

title: Streamlining business processes with Low-Code and Power Apps: the Galeries Lafayette Group's challenge
executive_summary: Fashion, beauty, food product lines... For 130 years, the Galeries Lafayette group has been one of the most emblematic brands in retail. Present in every corner of France and around the world, this family-run business sees no fewer than 60 million visitors pass through its stores every year, whether in Bordeaux, Toulouse, China or the Middle East – and of course Galeries Lafayette Haussmann, the world's largest department store and second most visited place in Paris.

title: Asahi Europe & International charts new paths in employee productivity with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: N/A

title: Dominican Republic repels cyberattacks with help from Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The Dominican Republic's National Cybersecurity Center (Centro Nacional de Ciberseguridad, CNCS) adopted a variety of Microsoft solutions to monitor, analyze, and manage cyber threat cases across the country.
products: Dynamics 365, Azure Data Explorer, Microsoft Sentinel, Azure, Azure Data Factory

title: Automotores y Anexos S.A. moves to the digital economy with Microsoft
executive_summary: The Ecuadorian company decided to adopt Microsoft solutions to institutionally restructure the company and establish a long-term IT strategy.

title: UST migrates 20 years of data, unifies employee experience using Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Rapid growth catalyzed the need for UST to better manage and integrate employee data across diverse regions and systems.

title: Abercrombie & Fitch Co. embraces Azure infrastructure to better serve customers
executive_summary: A&F Co.’s traditional, disparate infrastructure systems were limiting its ability to initiate customer innovation strategies and more personalized digital journeys.

title: Maxim’s brews success in Starbucks operations across Southeast Asia with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Maxim’s Group wanted to harmonize business operations with a modern ERP system to optimize resources and boost productivity.

title: Maxim’s brews success in Starbucks operations across Southeast Asia with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Maxim’s Group wanted to harmonize business operations with a modern ERP system to optimize resources and boost productivity.

title: Centrally secured: Körber entrusts its security system to Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Körber, a global technology group, is facing increasingly complex cyberattacks that affect all its business areas. Keeping this business data secure is a top priority for the company.

title: Obungi develops data platform for ALLPLAN with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: ALLPLAN required an upgrade from its traditional on-prem data warehouse to analyze and report on marketing and sales operations. It needed a solution that would expedite development cycles and adapt to the needs of its internal business users.

title: Komatsu achieves breakthrough performance gains and savings with Azure SQL Database Managed Instance
executive_summary: Komatsu builds and sells a lot of heavy equipment, but the company knows that it takes more than machines to be successful. Using data to gain a better understanding of its own business—and to help customers better understand theirs—is key to developing innovative services and leading its industry. By moving mainframe applications to Microsoft Azure SQL Database Managed Instance, Komatsu Australia is improving performance, reducing costs by half, and providing employees and customers with the data they need, when they need it.

title: American Cancer Society uses Azure DevOps to connect volunteers and reduce costs, helping save lives from cancer
executive_summary: The American Cancer Society counts on its volunteers, and its volunteers count on American Cancer Society mobile apps. To ease collaboration, accelerate development, organize processes, and reduce high database costs, the society’s IT team decided to adopt Microsoft Azure DevOps. The team drove its DevOps strategy by combining open-source technologies like .NET Core with Azure DevOps Services (previously called Microsoft Visual Studio Team Services), Visual Studio Tools for Xamarin, Azure App Service, and Azure Cosmos DB. In the first year after adopting DevOps, the American Cancer Society increased funds raised by 86 percent and reduced data storage deployment costs by a phenomenal 1,000 percent.

title: Adobe runs its vast open-source application portfolio in Azure
executive_summary: Once again, Adobe leads the way. After transitioning its well-known Creative Suite to a software as a service model (Adobe Creative Cloud), the company introduced Adobe Experience Cloud, a set of marketing, analytics, and advertising tools to help brands deliver amazing customer experiences. Adobe has made Microsoft Azure its preferred cloud platform to ensure that its growing portfolio of cloud offerings—most based on open-source software—runs fast, reliably, and more securely, giving customers an exceptional digital experience.

title: Georgian Ministry of Education embraces the future, making digital learning a reality
executive_summary: Georgia‘s Ministry of Education, Science, Culture and Sport pursues innovative teaching strategies, including virtual classes, chatbots, and game-based learning, to materialize its visionary concept of technology- empowered hybrid education. To enable this sweeping school reform, the Ministry selected Microsoft 365, and Teams, to help open a new chapter for digitally driven instruction.

title: St. Luke’s Hospital responds to COVID-19 with Microsoft 365 and virtual command centers, improves treatment and saves lives
executive_summary: Ask Dr. James Balshi, Chief Medical Information Officer at St. Luke’s University Health Network, what it was like when COVID-19 arrived, and he’ll use various metaphors—a runaway train, a ball racing down a hill, barely controlled chaos. But this belies what actually happened. When patients came to the network’s 12 hospitals, the entire organization mobilized in an unprecedented display of coordinated resolve to fight the virus.

title: Surface Hub 2S makes collaboration easy and fun in Burlöv Municipality
executive_summary: Burlöv Municipality is one of Sweden's smallest municipalities in terms of total area. Beautifully located, between the Öresund Sound that forms the Danish-Swedish border and vast arable land, it is a municipality in rapid development. The Malmö-Lund region and the proximity to the greater European continent make the area popular for both residents and businesses. It is also a communicative hub, two highways and two main lines run through the municipality. In similar spirit, Burlöv Municipality has recently adopted Surface Hub 2S devices to enable streamlined communication between its employees and other organizations beyond the municipality's limits.

title: Information intelligence company, METIS, helps ships sail safe and smart using predictive AI
executive_summary: The maritime industry faces numerous challenges today, from increased environmental concerns to rising costs. Through an end-to-end assessment of a vessel's past, present, and future performance, METIS Cyberspace Technology helps shipping companies improve safety, minimize the environmental impact, and increase profitability. This is done using AI predictive analytics powered by Microsoft Azure coupled with a virtual support agent in Microsoft Teams.

title: Maltese government aligns cross-agency work, connecting more than 23,000 public service employees with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Malta Information Technology Agency (MITA) drives information and communications technology programs and initiatives aligned with the government’s vision of collaborative public service delivery. As part of these initiatives, and as a way to foster new ones, MITA implemented Microsoft 365 productivity tools, such as Microsoft Teams and SharePoint Online. More than 23,000 public service employees across all ministries are now connected on a single platform. Thanks to streamlined communication lines and process flows, employees can work faster and better toward enhancing citizen-centric services.

title: Michael Hill optimizes inventory allocation and boosts sales with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce
executive_summary: Australia-based jeweler Michael Hill is known for high-quality, exceptional service and long-term customer loyalty. To sustain its reputation, the company used Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce to build a digital retail operations platform with end-to-end, multichannel capabilities and connected processes. By optimizing in-store operations, customer service, and other retail processes, Michael Hill has been able to successfully drive efficiencies, improve margins, and deliver stellar customer experiences.

title: Oppimisen ja hyvinvoinnin tukeminen Helsingin kaupungissa datan ja tekoälyn avulla
executive_summary: “In Finland, we want every child to reach their full potential,” says Pasi Silander, Head of ICT Development Programs in the City of Helsinki Education Division. “Finland isn’t a country rich in oil or other natural resources, so we have to focus on human capital by building knowledge capital and providing excellent learning possibilities for every student.”

title: AT&T migration to Azure Databricks catalyzes technical staff, advances business goals
executive_summary: AT&T’s on-premises data architecture prevented decision-makers from connecting to a single source of truth and created data silos, costly compute workarounds, and barriers to innovation.

title: Unleashing the value of instrumentation data
executive_summary: Malvern Panalytical is a global business that designs, develops and commercialises analytical instruments for materials analysis across a wide range of industries and applications.

title: RTGS.global automates financial transfers, unlocks trillions in capital with Azure
executive_summary: Liquidity transfers can be complex and time-consuming, sometimes taking days to clear and leaving trillions of dollars in capital tied up worldwide. To solve this problem, RTGS.global used Microsoft Azure SQL Database ledger to create an immutable record of liquidity. With this ledger, RTGS.global can provide 44,000 banks across the world and their regulators with instant visibility of liquidity, freeing capital for customers worldwide, helping banks deliver better customer experiences, and providing them with a platform for future growth and innovation.

title: Dorbar improves customer and employee satisfaction with Dalikoo CRM for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With offices in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, insurance provider Dorbar has been providing employee benefit solutions and insurance services to small and midsize businesses since 1988. Dalikoo CRM is a customer relationship management suite that runs natively on Microsoft 365. Dorbar was looking to implement a user-friendly, customizable CRM solution to further improve its customer service. Following a quick implementation and training period, Dorbar’s employees are using Dalikoo CRM as their daily hub for all customer-related transactions.

title: Wayve’s AV2.0 builds a brighter future with Azure Machine Learning and PyTorch
executive_summary: Wayve wants to accelerate and scale autonomous vehicle (AV) development by using vision-based machine learning for rapid prototyping and quick iteration. So, it developed a platform that uses the open-source machine learning framework PyTorch with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to gather, manage, and process millions of hours of driving data per year—petabytes of data—consisting of images, GPS data, and data from other sensors. Wayve now has the scalable capacity to build and iterate driving models for complex urban environments, adjust models more nimbly, and adapt to new environments more readily.

title: In the face of disruption, GEP powers global supply chain resilience with Azure
executive_summary: GEP is a global leader in procurement and supply chain management solutions. It uses Microsoft Azure to offer well-architected, cloud-native solutions that provide customers with a reliable, resilient, AI-powered supply chain management platform. GEP uses Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and Azure availability zones to minimize the threat of downtime and maintain accurate information. GEP’s microservice-driven architecture and use of Azure Cognitive Services enhances the functionality and responsiveness of its platform to deliver a reliable, agile, user-friendly, and data-driven supply chain management solution.

title: La Pontezuela launches transformation of olive oil business in two hours with Tipsa OliTEC suite for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Since 1974, La Pontezuela has manufactured Spanish extra virgin olive oil and offered an innovative approach for consumers to experience olive oil culture through quality gastronomy and leisure in Toledo, Spain. Seeking guidance for business modernization, La Pontezuela’s board of directors engaged Tipsa S.L., a Microsoft gold partner with decades of experience in automating food and beverage production. Tipsa quickly assessed La Pontezuela’s requirements and presented a cloud-based solution built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and powered by industry-specific apps. Today, La Pontezuela benefits from an accurate digital ecosystem that streamlines internal collaboration, simplifies production processes, eases online transactions through an e-commerce platform connected to CRM, and uses intuitive, real-time data analysis to make decisions with confidence, all built on Microsoft technologies.

title: Vega de Yuco cuts through business information silos in a few clicks with TIPSA VinoTEC suite for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: At the beginning of 2020, prior to the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, an entrepreneurial generation of winemakers and business managers at Bodegas Vega de Yuco S.A.T. sought to embrace digitization toward their goals of expanding productivity, enabling a secure hybrid workspace, enhancing collaboration, and increasing the confidence and agility of their decision-making. The board of directors engaged TIPSA S.L., a Microsoft gold partner with expertise in automating food and beverage production, to solve specific winemaking business needs for finance, supply chain management, sales, and customer services. After a two-hour TIPSA briefing on Microsoft technology for SMBs, Vega de Yuco undertook a strategic transformation to implement VinoTEC, a cloud-hosted, subscription-based winery management solution that integrates natively with Microsoft 365. Thanks to the modern business management ecosystem built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the Microsoft Power Platform, Vega de Yuco saves costs, protects its business from cyberattacks, and easily performs daily operations with a few clicks.

title: Barracuda uses Azure to develop a cloud-native service for discovering sensitive data
executive_summary: Barracuda provides email and data protection and application, cloud, and network security to more than 220,000 customers worldwide, in addition to its on-premises and cloud backup solutions. The company’s customers wanted to be able to find sensitive personally identifiable information stored in Microsoft 365. So, in collaboration with Microsoft and building on top of Microsoft Azure services, Barracuda developed Data Inspector, which uses AI to discover sensitive categories of information to make compliance easier.

title: DenizBank supports data scientists with its pioneering Data Warehouse Project
executive_summary: Since its foundation in 1997, DenizBank has invested heavily in technology, R&D, and innovation. The bank, which had founded Türkiye's first Digital Generation Banking Department in 2012, was multiple times acclaimed as the "World's Most Innovative Bank" in the United States and Europe. Integrating all physical and digital touchpoints with the customer through a "phygital" strategy, the organization has blazed a new trail in Türkiye with Microsoft and its affiliate Intertech, which offers information technology services with finance industry-focused solutions. Denizbank launched a Private Cloud Project, paving the way for innovation in data science with the strength of Azure.
products: Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Machine Learning

title: Qatar’s new Lusail University powers operations and learning with cloud technology
executive_summary: Lusail University (LU) is the first private national university in Qatar offering several bachelor degree programs in Law, English, French Literature, Business Administration, and Marketing. Born amid the global pandemic, the newly-founded university had to abandon on-campus education and kickstart its first semester online. Committed to offering enterprise-grade IT infrastructure to incoming staff and students, the university switched to an entirely cloud-based model using Microsoft 365 and Azure just in time for the new academic year.

title: Bodega Doña Felisa migrates ERP to TIPSA VinoTEC suite for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and simplifies quarter-end closing from days to hours
executive_summary: Bodega Doña Felisa S.L., a family-owned business dedicated to producing and selling select wines, required extensive, lengthy reporting to regional, national, and wine authorities. The young and dynamic board of directors engaged TIPSA S.L., a Microsoft gold partner providing business expertise for the wine, food, and beverage industries. TIPSA recommended migrating Bodega Doña Felisa to VinoTEC, a cloud-hosted, subscription-based winery management solution developed by TIPSA on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and natively integrated with Microsoft 365. The modern, collaborative, and secure workspace enabled the winery to grow operations and reduced quarterly reporting from days to hours.

title: Hisar Schools Include Artificial Intelligence in Education with Microsoft!
executive_summary: Hisar Schools, which has been raising researchers, self-confident and high-aware individuals for 25 years, reflects its modern and future-oriented vision to all its students.

title: Colin’s till application scores a modernization story in retail digitalization
executive_summary: Colin's, part of Eroğlu Holding, is a Jean-focused fashion retailer operating at 600 points of sale in 38 countries. A prominent name in business since its establishment in 1983, it has proved itself as a popular brand: In Russia, where it has 190 stores, one of every two jeans sold has Colin’s tag on it. Colin's long-established cooperation with Microsoft is going to new heights recently with the onboarding of a pioneering project set off in 2021. Have a look at the specifics of this one-of-a-kind thinking and explore what Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)`s centralized and scalable solutions can offer for fashion retail going forward.

title: Hello Lamp Post builds on Microsoft Azure to smartly connect people and places
executive_summary: “We want to help every community in every corner of the world to bring people and places closer together,” enthuses Tiernan Mines, CEO and Co-Founder at Hello Lamp Post.

title: Progressive harnesses fusion development using Power Virtual Agents to build “Cloudie”
executive_summary: Progressive Mutual Insurance Company was founded in 1937 in Ohio by two lawyers with ambitions of adding innovation to the auto insurance business. Today, innovation, collaboration, and culture are key at the 50,000-plus-employee enterprise. When several cloud teams at the business sought a solution to get internal customers, especially those without IT resources, quick answers to cloud-related queries, two professional developers used Power Virtual Agents and fusion development to quickly create the Cloudie chatbot. That work spurred other teams to create their own intelligent conversation chatbots using the no-code application.
products: Azure AI Language, Microsoft Teams, Power Automate, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Copilot Studio

title: Johnson & Johnson transforms business through intelligent automation
executive_summary: As the healthcare environment continues to rapidly change and with the increasing role of digitization, Johnson & Johnson is transforming its business by embedding Intelligent Automation into the fabric of the organization. The opportunity to reimagine work is significant and has the potential to empower and equip employees with new skills, capabilities, and the freedom to focus on more fulfilling, engaging and purpose-driven work.

title: Music Tribe “hits refresh” with “customer and digital obsession” through Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: In 2019, Music Tribe went on a disruptive journey to rediscover its purpose and build a sustainable future. The company went on an “extreme lean” exercise, where it eliminated all data centers, physical servers, legacy applications and terabytes of outdated and redundant data. Today, Music Tribe is completely IT-free and runs entirely on Azure. By eliminating all waste, Tribers (Music Tribe employees), can now spend more time gaining new skills with Microsoft Viva. This radical change also provided them with more time for customer engagement, which follows the company’s “customer and digital obsession” mission.

title: City government powers customer-centric transformation with Microsoft Purview Records Management
executive_summary: Providing residents with government services generates a lot of information in the form of records. Conventional records management practices at City of Marion in South Australia needed an upgrade. Corporate Services General Manager Sorana Dinmore and Records and Information Management Team Leader Karlheins Sohl deployed Microsoft Purview Records Management (previously known as Records Management in Microsoft 365), a breakthrough technology that transforms record management practices with a more efficient and effective solution that works seamlessly with their Microsoft 365 communications and collaboration infrastructure.

title: Falck develops a salary management app for greater transparency and fairer pay
executive_summary: Providing people-centric services has been at the heart of healthcare company, Falck, for nearly a century. But while the Danish organization continues to care for its customers, recently it has been working to improve the day-to-day lives of its employees too. With a push to digitally transform internal operations, Falck is establishing a foundation for applications to be built using Microsoft Power Platform. Its most recent engineering success was its Merit app. It not only provides transparent, cost-effective and efficient management of the salary negotiation process, but its success has inspired Falck’s employees to innovate further with the powerful technology they now have in their back pocket.
products: Power Automate, Dataverse, Power Apps, Power BI

title: With Microsoft Teams, Yapı Kredi fulfills its vision of secure remote work and robust collaboration
executive_summary: A well-established name in the banking sector, Yapı Kredi works with a vision focused on change and progress. Paying particular attention to innovation, open communication, and teamwork, the bank extended Microsoft Teams to its 16,000 employees to provide uninterrupted, secure communication and a modern collaboration experience for remote working.

title: Microsoft Azure improves healthcare delivery for Doctor Care Anywhere
executive_summary: “As we move into a new world of digital healthcare, the challenges are how can we get people to adopt a new way of working and show them the benefits of that way of working,” says Dr Bayju Thakar, Co-Founder and Director of Doctor Care Anywhere. Over the last eight years, Doctor Care Anywhere has grown to cover 2.5 million patients. Its online consultation services and digital tools enable video and phone GP appointments, employee health services, patient notes and health tracking, prescription services, referrals and people travelling abroad. Through them, Doctor Care Anywhere supports thousands of clinicians across the UK, Ireland and Australia.

title: MYTILINEOS streamlines large-scale logistics with Azure Custom Vision
executive_summary: MYTILINEOS, a leading global industrial and energy company with a strong presence in all five continents, places inventiveness, effectiveness, and sustainability at the heart of its global operations. Needing a more efficient and accurate way to ensure the correct loading of products at port of Aluminium of Greece, MYTILINEOS turned to a cutting-edge solution with Azure Custom Vision. Today, the largest vertically integrated alumina and aluminium producer in the European Union is benefitting from almost zero error rates when loading final products and is unlocking ever more efficiencies along its massive logistics chain.

title: Adopting Minecraft: Education Edition for game-based learning in Pinagbuhatan High School
executive_summary: Pinagbuhatan High School, a school under the Department of Education, is one of the pilot implementers of Minecraft: Education Edition. Through the Microsoft Showcase School Accelerator Program, the school continues to work closely with Microsoft Philippines and ACER Philippines to further transform teaching & learning with game-based learning with the right resources, training, and devices.

title: Snam: Aiding the global energy transition with cloud technology
executive_summary: Italian energy infrastructure operator Snam operates a gas pipeline network of around 41,000km that spreads across Italy and Europe and plays a key role in guaranteeing security and supply diversification throughout the region. Enabling the global energy transition is a key strategic pillar for Snam, prioritized through the use of digital technology. In 2018, Snam introduced its long-term digital transformation strategy ‘Snamtec’, with Microsoft identified as a key strategic partner in its delivery. As part of Snamtec, the company has recently been using the power of Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform and a full stack of Azure IoT services to reduce carbon emissions and democratize its data. It is all helping Snam to meet its net-zero targets forecasted for the coming decades, as it leads the way to a more sustainable future.

title: Falck develops a salary management app for greater transparency and fairer pay
executive_summary: Providing people-centric services has been at the heart of healthcare company, Falck, for nearly a century. But while the Danish organization continues to care for its customers, recently it has been working to improve the day-to-day lives of its employees too. With a push to digitally transform internal operations, Falck is establishing a foundation for applications to be built using Microsoft Power Platform. Its most recent engineering success was its Merit app. It not only provides transparent, cost-effective and efficient management of the salary negotiation process, but its success has inspired Falck’s employees to innovate further with the powerful technology they now have in their back pocket.

title: With Microsoft Teams, Yapı Kredi fulfills its vision of secure remote work and robust collaboration
executive_summary: A well-established name in the banking sector, Yapı Kredi works with a vision focused on change and progress. Paying particular attention to innovation, open communication, and teamwork, the bank extended Microsoft Teams to its 16,000 employees to provide uninterrupted, secure communication and a modern collaboration experience for remote working.

title: Swedish Television improves public news accessibility with AI
executive_summary: SVERIGES Television AB (SVT) is the Swedish national public television broadcaster, with 21 regional news stations. For accessibility and inclusion, SVT wanted to transcribe their video content and generate closed captioning. With so much content, using a non-automated transcription process is time consuming and costly. SVT found a solution with Microsoft Azure Cognitive Speech Services and Speech Studio.

title: MultiChoice fast-tracks video captioning and accessibility with Microsoft AI solution
executive_summary: Microsoft has helped Africa’s leading video entertainment company, MultiChoice, to harness the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to make video captioning, subtitling and translations faster and more efficient.

title: Qatar's public transportation company drives better employee engagement and improves operations with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Founded in 2004 by the Qatar Government, Mowasalat is the country’s end-to-end transport service provider. Its mission is to connect the entire country safely and sustainably, being one of the central driving forces of Qatar’s National Vision 2030. To better maintain and operate its growing fleet, the organization needed to digitize for efficiency. It used Azure and Microsoft 365 to create scalable solutions that connect drivers and supervisors. As a result, Mowasalat now has live data visibility that enables fast decision making and a better understanding of the challenges its employees face in the field.

title: Introducing Audio Articles: A New Service for Subscribers of Le Monde Powered by Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services.
executive_summary: Founded in 1944, Le Monde, generally considered to be the French newspaper of reference, is acknowledged in France and around the world for the excellence of its writing. It currently has 555,000 subscribers, 85% of whom are digital, and the numbers are still rising.

title: Project Gutenberg brings free audiobooks to the global community with AI-generated book narration
