executive_summary: The oldest digital library and a leading distributor of free eBooks, Project Gutenberg wanted to make its collection more accessible to a broader community of members, including people who have visual impairments and those around the world who might not have access to traditional libraries. To achieve this goal, the organization collaborated with Microsoft on an AI-driven solution to create audiobooks at scale, creating nearly 5,000 new audio books.

title: Chop Cheong Bee pioneers smart farming in Malaysian poultry sector with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: From traditional poultry farming in the 90s to being the first e-farm to smart farming today, Chop Cheong Bee embodies the spirit of innovation. To make farming a more profitable and sustainable business in Malaysia, it developed ways to transform raw data into actionable insights. Partnering with Infront Consulting Group, Chop Cheong Bee developed a cloud solution powered by Microsoft Azure, creating something that can truly revolutionize Malaysia’s farming landscape.

title: Η Classter βοηθά τα σχολεία και με το παράδειγμά της εμπνέει τις τοπικές επιχειρήσεις να επεκταθούν στις διεθνείς αγορές, μέσω μιας πλατφόρμας διαχείρισης εκπαίδευσης που βασίζεται στο Azure
executive_summary: Classter's CEO Nikolaos Nikou envisioned a solution that improves global education with a state-of-the-art cloud solution at a reasonably low cost. He founded a Greek company in his hometown Kavala, and with his team help, he created an Azure-based education management platform that covers the educational and operational needs for schools of all sizes from all over the world. Classter is now helping more than 500 educational organizations to make learning more efficient, while inspiring other small businesses from Greece to go global.

title: Epiroc advances manufacturing innovation with Azure Machine Learning and Azure Data Factory
executive_summary: With its headquarters in Sweden, Epiroc is a leading manufacturer of rock excavation equipment. The company sources premium steel and then processes it at locations across the globe to produce drilling tools and equipment for the mining and construction industries. Epiroc also provides round-the-clock equipment service and technical expertise for its customers. Epiroc wanted to improve and automate complex processes at its manufacturing locations worldwide to ensure consistent quality of the steel used in its products. With the help of Microsoft, Epiroc created an ESML AI Factory on Microsoft Azure. The company was able to get it up and running within 60 hours. The scalable solution gave Epiroc’s manufacturing teams across the globe the ability to share data, best practices, and create consistent, repeatable processes to ensure the highest quality steel—and equipment—while increasing efficiencies and reducing waste.

title: SymphonyAI helps financial crime investigators be more efficient with Azure
executive_summary: The cost of financial crime is estimated to represent about 5 percent of the global GDP, a significant burden on the economy and an enormous impact on people and organizations. Financial crimes such as money laundering and fraud are linked to human trafficking, child exploitation, terrorism, theft, and wildlife trafficking. To tackle this, banks and other financial institutions maintain large teams of financial investigators and systems to detect, assess, and report crime. Solutions that can improve the efficiency and accuracy of detecting money laundering can help fight crime and significantly affect our world.

title: Türkiye’s largest private bank İşbank deploys new bank apps faster and reduces time to market by 27%
executive_summary: İşbank, the largest private bank in Türkiye, strives to become the bank of the future, creating sustainable value with an inclusive and participatory approach. To bring that vision to life, İşbank Unit Manager İlker Anaç decided to enhance developer productivity. With his teams’ help, Anaç transformed the entire software delivery process of mainframe with Azure. Now, the bank has faster onboarding for newcomers and a better time-to-market for its apps.

title: SymphonyAI helps financial crime investigators be more efficient with Azure
executive_summary: The cost of financial crime is estimated to represent about 5 percent of the global GDP, a significant burden on the economy and an enormous impact on people and organizations. Financial crimes such as money laundering and fraud are linked to human trafficking, child exploitation, terrorism, theft, and wildlife trafficking. To tackle this, banks and other financial institutions maintain large teams of financial investigators and systems to detect, assess, and report crime. Solutions that can improve the efficiency and accuracy of detecting money laundering can help fight crime and significantly affect our world.

title: Türkiye’s largest private bank İşbank deploys new bank apps faster and reduces time to market by 27%
executive_summary: İşbank, the largest private bank in Türkiye, strives to become the bank of the future, creating sustainable value with an inclusive and participatory approach. To bring that vision to life, İşbank Unit Manager İlker Anaç decided to enhance developer productivity. With his teams’ help, Anaç transformed the entire software delivery process of mainframe with Azure. Now, the bank has faster onboarding for newcomers and a better time-to-market for its apps.

title: Türkiye İşbank moves its London branch to cloud with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: İşbank had upgraded IT infrastructure of its global branches as part of its digital transformation. Bank`s London branch, a strategically-important overseas office for İşbank, has now switched to Azure, a platform that consists of products and cloud services designed to help organizations implement new solutions. Thus, the first stage of digitalization, which will speed up the business processes of the branch staff, has been successfully finalized.

title: Nota strengthens local news—and American democracy—with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Nota believes that a robust local news industry is essential to the proper functioning of democracy. Unfortunately, local news in the United States faces increasing competition from media conglomerates and many small newsrooms have closed, turning large parts of the country into “news deserts” with no local coverage. To help the remaining organizations compete more effectively and continue to bring important stories to their constituents, Nota has used Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service to build two AI-assisted tools—SUM and VID. These tools do a lot of the heavy lifting needed to optimize stories for distribution and turn written pieces into engaging videos that can produce up to 10 times as much revenue as written pieces. Early response from users has been extremely positive and Nota is attracting the attention of a wide range of news firms of all sizes.

title: AT&T develops a new way to work, with a cloud-first approach in Azure
executive_summary: AT&T had reached a point where the complexity of its IT environment was hampering its ability to respond quickly to new customer needs and market opportunities. It decided to move to a cloud-first approach in Azure, migrating approximately a third of its 7,500 applications to the cloud and retiring another third. This reduced its on-premises infrastructure requirements by about 70 percent and reduced IT costs by about 30 percent. Moving development to Azure saves developers weeks of setup time, enabling much quicker product and services development cycles.

title: Arrow Lift Boosts Efficiency and Collaboration with Microsoft Cloud Platform
executive_summary: Arrow Lift, a company that specializes in elevators, has recently adopted a unified Microsoft cloud platform provided by sa.global. This has resulted in internal teams being more connected than ever, with access to a single version of the truth. The company has also enjoyed a similar user interface across various functions such as marketing and sales, service delivery, and finance. The integration of Microsoft 365 has made it effortless for employees to adopt and eliminated the need for custom codes, making it easier for the IT team to manage. Overall, the changes have significantly reduced the workload and improved security for the IT team, leading to increased satisfaction.

title: Orca Security combines the power of GPT-4 with the security and reliability of Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Agentless cloud security pioneer Orca Security has always sought to provide exceptional service to hundreds of enterprises worldwide. It was the first security provider to integrate OpenAI’s GPT API into its solution, enabling customers to quickly respond to security alerts with AI-generated instructions. This brought about the challenge of ensuring data privacy and compliance. Orca Security bridged this gap with Azure OpenAI Service, securing customer data, guaranteeing a 99.9 percent uptime and full regulatory compliance, and backed by Microsoft's strong support.

title: Multinational insurance company motivates employees to return part time to offices with a smarter workplace solution
executive_summary: Employee empowerment is at the heart of flexible work. Giving workers the freedom to determine when, how, and where they work creates positive employee experiences and has been proven to affect retention rates. But opening the door to that kind of agency can be a challenge for employers. That’s why one global insurance company turned to Campana & Schott to think through ways in which digital technologies could help them power productivity across an expansive hybrid workforce. Campana & Schott and Microsoft worked together to design and deliver an intelligent workplace solution integrated with Microsoft Teams. Campana & Schott Smart Workspace has now been implemented across 10 different organizations with 7,500+ daily active users.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure AI Language, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Power Apps, Power Automate

title: BPiON expands its business and ensures data security for stakeholders with Azure solutions
executive_summary: BPiON is a technology-driven business process outsourcing (BPO) company in Central and Eastern Europe, offering digital solutions built on Microsoft Azure for accounting, human resources, and payroll administration. As BPiON started to expand rapidly, it needed to achieve faster business scalability while keeping rigorous data security. To do this, it expanded its Azure-based solutions to manage devices remotely and improve security. Now, BPiON has the flexibility to grow its business in new countries with a click of a button, while knowing its stakeholders’ data are always safe and secure.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Network, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune

title: HelloTalk: The world's largest language exchange platform empowers language learners with Azure AI
executive_summary: HelloTalk is the world's largest language exchange app, founded in 2012. The app connects language learners based on their native language and the language they want to learn, allowing them to practice and exchange language, culture and more. With support for over 160 languages and users from over 200 countries, HelloTalk is a truly global platform that provides a diverse and inclusive community for language learners.

title: Thread creates game-changing solution for IT service providers with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: For IT technicians, logging time entries and summarizing customer interactions are critical to profitability and quality assurance but consume valuable time and resources that could be spent helping customers. These tasks can also lead to service request response delays, creating a disconnect between customers and service desks.

title: Roquette leverages Azure OpenAI Service in the age of generative AI
executive_summary: The mission of global family-owned group Roquette is to supply ingredients of natural origin to the pharmaceutical, food, nutrition and cosmetics industries. As a market leader, the company and its 10,000-strong workforce fulfills its mission by designing cutting-edge products capable of addressing society's health and nutrition challenges.

title: Capitalizing on the cloud with Nutanix, WEI, and the Microsoft commercial marketplace
executive_summary: A prominent financial corporation wanted to leave its datacenters and move its workloads to the public cloud, but it needed a custom solution that would be cost-effective and further its cloud journey. Nutanix and WEI together designed a solution that was tailored to their customer’s requirements. The solution took advantage of Nutanix Cloud Clusters on Microsoft Azure and was sold through the Microsoft commercial marketplace with a multiparty private offer. Because the Azure benefit–eligible solution was sold through the marketplace, their customer was able to count its purchase toward fulfilling its Azure consumption commitment, unlocking discounts on its cloud infrastructure.

title: NaturalReader’s AI text-to-speech application built on Microsoft Azure makes education accessible for millions of students
executive_summary: As a leading AI text-to-speech service provider based in Canada, NaturalReader innovates with the power of AI to improve education for millions of students globally. The 25-employee company aimed both at scaling up to meet the demand of a booming education technology market and at enhancing the quality of its product to reach more students. With the help of Microsoft Azure, it improved the authenticity of its AI voices and developed a mobile app so that students can access the service anytime and anywhere. As a result, NaturalReader increased global sales by 100 percent from 2022 to 2023 and welcomed several Ivy League colleges as customers.

title: Claro improves the experience of 1,500,000 customers with Azure Synapse and Machine Learning
executive_summary: Using Microsoft Cloud technologies, and with the help of Microsoft Partner Octupus, Claro has deployed a new platform providing dashboards with data of about 1,500,000 customers in Argentina and Paraguay. As a result, the telecommunications company was able to view 26,000,000 daily records in real time to focus on providing optimal Wi-Fi service.

title: Cognizant makes performance management more effective and meaningful with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Cognizant, one of the world’s leading professional services companies, works with businesses to make everyday life even better—for their employees, their customers, and the communities they serve. The company leverages IoT, AI, software engineering, and the cloud to digitize the products, services, and customer experiences of its clients; automate their business processes; and modernize their technology infrastructure. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant has a rapidly expanding footprint that extends from India and China to Europe, North America, South America, and the Middle East. It helps clients across industries envision, build, and run innovative digital enterprises.

title: AudioCodes leverages Azure to cut Teams Phone deployment time and facilitate native CCaaS offering for Teams
executive_summary: AudioCodes has been on a mission to transform enterprise telephony for 30 years, and its partnership with Microsoft has been central to its growth. After migrating most of its solutions to Microsoft Azure, AudioCodes achieved faster deployment for its solutions, lowered costs, and improved SLAs. Thanks to its solutions being transactable on Azure Marketplace AudioCodes can also reach more clients than ever before, for maximum impact.
products: Azure, Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure AI Services, Azure Communication Services, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Marketplace, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Phone, Microsoft Copilot Studio

title: Arrow Lift Boosts Efficiency and Collaboration with Microsoft Cloud Platform
executive_summary: Arrow Lift, a company that specializes in elevators, has recently adopted a unified Microsoft cloud platform provided by sa.global. This has resulted in internal teams being more connected than ever, with access to a single version of the truth. The company has also enjoyed a similar user interface across various functions such as marketing and sales, service delivery, and finance. The integration of Microsoft 365 has made it effortless for employees to adopt and eliminated the need for custom codes, making it easier for the IT team to manage. Overall, the changes have significantly reduced the workload and improved security for the IT team, leading to increased satisfaction.

title: Orca Security combines the power of GPT-4 with the security and reliability of Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Agentless cloud security pioneer Orca Security has always sought to provide exceptional service to hundreds of enterprises worldwide. It was the first security provider to integrate OpenAI’s GPT API into its solution, enabling customers to quickly respond to security alerts with AI-generated instructions. This brought about the challenge of ensuring data privacy and compliance. Orca Security bridged this gap with Azure OpenAI Service, securing customer data, guaranteeing a 99.9 percent uptime and full regulatory compliance, and backed by Microsoft's strong support.

title: PETRONAS drives quality decision-making with fast, easy access to intelligent data hub built on Azure
executive_summary: The dynamic Malaysian energy group, PETRONAS, has produced and delivered responsible and sustainable energy solutions globally since 1974. With more than 300 subsidiaries and operations in over 100 countries, PETRONAS has amassed an extensive wealth of data across its integrated value chain since its incorporation, making data a key business asset to drive strategic value. In 2020, PETRONAS embarked on its data transformation journey with the objective of making data available and accessible to everyone at the company through the Enterprise Data Hub (EDH), a unified enterprise platform supported by Microsoft Azure at the core. This platform has empowered employees with accelerated knowledge extraction and enabled enterprise analytics at scale, supporting PETRONAS’ ambition of becoming a data-driven organization.

title: ASOS uses Azure AI Studio to surprise and delight young fashion lovers
executive_summary: United Kingdom–based ASOS is a destination for fashion lovers in their 20s, that continuously explores technology options to enhance the customer experience. The company delivers inspiration to its customers, along with a catalog spanning thousands of products through powerful computing capabilities and a vast recommendations engine built on Microsoft Azure. With the recent prevalence of generative AI platforms like ChatGPT, ASOS recognized a triple opportunity to expand its business model, enrich its technology infrastructure, and meet the modern tech expectations of its young customers. ASOS used Azure OpenAI Service and Azure AI prompt flow with ChatGPT language models to rapidly develop and test an Azure OpenAI-powered customer experience that helps customers discover new looks.

title: Managing documents with the help of AI: docunite ensures greater efficiency with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: Managing real estate also means managing piles of documents relating to each property in a way that’s always complete, transparent, and up to date. But reality often paints a vastly different picture: files are stored in a variety of systems, and both internal and external stakeholders require their own versions of the documents at varying points in the process. That’s why docunite harnessed the potential of Azure Cognitive Services to develop a solution that bundles all the industry’s requirements and automatically processes and classifies documents. The result is greater efficiency in the kind of document management required in the real estate industry.

title: Roquette leverages Azure OpenAI Service in the age of generative AI
executive_summary: The mission of global family-owned group Roquette is to supply ingredients of natural origin to the pharmaceutical, food, nutrition and cosmetics industries. As a market leader, the company and its 10,000-strong workforce fulfills its mission by designing cutting-edge products capable of addressing society's health and nutrition challenges.

title: Meesho elevates customer experience and boosts developer productivity with Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Founded by IIT-Delhi graduates Vidit Aatrey and Sanjeev Barnwal in 2015, Meesho is India’s leading e-commerce marketplace. Meesho, which stands for "meri dukaan" or "my shop," started as a social commerce platform but it’s now a thriving e-commerce ecosystem connecting millions of consumers with sellers and entrepreneurs.

title: Zavarovalnica Triglav modernizes customer service with Dynamics 365 and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Zavarovalnica Triglav is reimagining insurance workflows in Slovenia. By implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Azure OpenAI Service, the insurer streamlined its operations with automated responses and smart rerouting of customer enquiries. The company also gained a 360-degree customer view, enabling agents to serve its customers more effectively. Zavarovalnica Triglav’s journey from manual work to AI-driven automation led to significant time savings in manual work for its employees and enhanced personalization for its customers.

title: Bank of Montreal runs risk calculations twice as fast and at 30% less cost with Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Lexmark Translation Assistant uses Azure AI Translator to connect schools, families
executive_summary: School districts across the US struggle each day to communicate with students’ family members who speak a variety of languages. Translation services are slow, expensive, and prone to errors. The Lexmark Translation Assistant can translate scanned files from one language to or from more than 100 languages in minutes, producing printed copies that retain all design and formatting. Lexmark’s scanner, printer, and translator uses Azure AI Translator for the actual translation, ensuring highly accurate output while saving significant time and money.

title: Oklahoma State University engaged 90% of academic programs in more effective assessment practices with Nuventive and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Oklahoma State University (OSU), a land-grant university, administered an efficient assessment and reporting system using the Nuventive Improvement Platform built on Microsoft Azure. In previous years, the assessment process at OSU operated in isolation and assessment was viewed as more of a box to check than as a chance for improvement. With help from Microsoft partner Nuventive, OSU simplified assessment and created a space where faculty could use assessment data to identify gaps in student learning and create action plans to close the loop. Since deploying this solution, OSU has engaged 90% of academic programs in better assessment practices to help them troubleshoot and improve student learning with innovative solutions.

title: PwC scales GenAI for enterprise with Microsoft Azure AI
executive_summary: PwC, a global leader in assurance, tax, and advisory services, has collaborated with Microsoft to develop scalable and secure Generative AI (GenAI) architecture that enables solutions like ChatPwC and provides PwC employees access to proprietary GenAI plugins that help them work differently. ChatPwC has achieved widespread adoption with hundreds of thousands of employees benefiting from increased productivity and the capacity to realize additional value for customers.

title: JERA realizes data-driven operation and maintenance by utilizing database of user technology and power-plant operation know-how with Azure
executive_summary: JERA Co., Inc. (hereafter JERA) is the largest energy company in Japan, supplying approximately 30% of the electricity generated domestically. With the mission of “providing cutting-edge solutions to the world’s energy issues,” JERA is engaged in the procurement of fuel, as well as the operation and maintenance of power plants for the stable supply of electricity both domestically and internationally.

title: ITOCHU uses Microsoft Fabric and Azure AI Studio to evolve its a data analytics dashboard into a service delivering instant recommendations
executive_summary: In May 2023, ITOCHU Corporation (“ITOCHU”) launched a cross-company task force to promote the use of generative AI across all businesses. This included incorporating generative AI into FOODATA, a data analytics dashboard which the ITOCHU Food Company provides to customers. ITOCHU is using Azure OpenAI Service and Azure AI Studio to evolve its data analytics dashboard into a service that provides immediate recommendations by automatically creating evidence-based product proposals. The corporation has already forged more than 70 ideas for using generative AI and has begun developing a data integration platform to bring these ideas to fruition. Microsoft Fabric is a front-runner for this platform for its potential to leverage retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) in higher quality generative AI responses.

title: Visier achieves performance improvements of up to five times using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: N/A

executive_summary: With the support of Dataside, a Microsoft partner, the nation's largest Oncology group was able to transform its entire data ecosystem with a web portal and mobile application that performs all image processing and storage with Azure support and the use of AI and Machine Learning tools.

executive_summary: Financial services provider Aditya Birla Capital has a massive market presence with more than 40 million customers, nine business lines, and multiple business functions. It wanted to streamline the business and deliver a more connected customer experience using generative AI.

executive_summary: With its Facilities and Operations of the Future initiative, Chevron is reimagining the monitoring of its physical operations to support remote and autonomous operations through enhanced capabilities and real-time access to data.

executive_summary: Région Sud, also known as the Southern Region of France, is a connected territory investing heavily in AI to develop use cases and accelerate its economic development.

But Uniper wants to do more; the energy company wants to lead the way and actively shape the transition, which is why it is striving to become climate-neutral by 2040. To this end, Uniper is investing not only in low-carbon and carbon-neutral energy sources but also in suitable technology. Employees are assisted in their day-to-day work by AI and Copilot for Microsoft 365. The ultimate goal is to extend the benefits from the workforce to the company and the environment.

executive_summary: To meet consumers growing expectations for brands to offer a steady stream of immersive personal experiences, Coca Cola needed its AI-ready platform to support the execution of innovative global campaigns within weeks—not months.

title: Skylark Group serves up better dining experiences with generative AI and Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: The Skylark Group embraces IT initiatives, including cat-shaped robot waiters, to enhance its restaurants. However, having also lost valuable customer contact opportunities, it turned to generative AI to complement human workers.

title: Zones soars from servers to the sky with Dynamics 365 cloud transformation
executive_summary: Zones needed to support scalable growth across different geographies and enhance efficiency while modernizing its core systems and ensuring consistent customer experiences worldwide.

title: Intralox enhances customer service efficiency with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Before implementing Microsoft 365 Copilot, Intralox wanted to enhance customer service efficiency and deepen customer relationships. The company needed advanced technology solutions to streamline operations and improve access to information.

title: EcoVadis uses Microsoft Azure to power supply chains with AI-driven insights
executive_summary: EcoVadis uses Azure OpenAI Service capabilities to streamline procurement.

title: LaLiga boosts fan engagement with multiple digital channels and conversational AI
executive_summary: The Madrid-based Spanish football (soccer) organization LaLiga has hundreds of millions of fans around the world. LaLiga fans are passionate about the game, and the league is passionate about making it as fun as possible for them. To do this, LaLiga developed a digital innovation platform based on Microsoft Azure. The league now creates websites and apps that help fans enjoy the game in new ways, including a voice-based personal digital assistant that helps fans learn more about players, teams, and the LaLiga fantasy league through conversational AI. With a robust digital experience for fans, LaLiga can quickly develop, deploy, and scale its innovations—continually elevating its brand identity.

title: Building a modern SharePoint intranet for A-Gas
executive_summary: A-Gas is a global market leader in the supply of refrigerants and associated products and services to a wide range of industries, including automotive, aviation, medical and manufacturing, among others. With over 500 employees across five continents, A-Gas wanted to bring their team together by introducing a new global intranet to become their central, go-to communication platform.
products: SharePoint

title: Walgreens Boots Alliance puts customers first in its digital transformation journey
executive_summary: Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) operates retail pharmacies that serve millions of people a day, and the company aims to give every customer exceptional service. To help that happen, WBA is on a digital transformation journey that seeks to modernize IT operations, the workplace, and the healthcare industry. The first step involves moving IT resources to the cloud, and WBA chose Microsoft Azure as its platform. With Azure and other Microsoft solutions, WBA is positioned for omnichannel innovation that delivers everything customers are looking for and more.

title: Funding the next generation of entrepreneurs with Farnam Street Financial and Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: For 20 years, Farnam Street Financial has provided custom leasing solutions to help small and mid-sized businesses secure the technology and equipment they need. Now, with equipment in all 50 states and hundreds of millions of dollars invested, Farnam needed a business management solution that could deliver more transparent, accessible, and efficient data analytics to keep its team operating effectively. Its solution? Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.

title: Global service and business solutions provider, Endava, empowers its people with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Endava is reimagining the relationship between people and technology, providing digital transformation consulting and automation solutions to top-tier brands. Leading by example, the company’s IT hub in Romania steers its digital initiatives internally before bringing them to customer sites. To streamline workflows, it brought its workplace tools, apps, and services into Microsoft Teams. Now, 98 percent of its more than 7,100 employees start and end their workdays with a platform that meets the company’s goal—to drive change for clients.

title: EY helps enhance the inclusivity of AI development with Azure AI
executive_summary: With an estimated 20% of the global workforce identifying as neurodivergent, inclusive AI solutions are crucial. Employees from EY Neuro-Diverse Centers of Excellence worked with Microsoft to ensure AI tools foster productivity for all.

title: DraftWise helps lawyers reduce tedium, focus on strategy with Azure AI Foundry Models
executive_summary: When legal tech startup DraftWise needed cutting-edge technology to realize its vision for reducing the time-consuming, mundane work that lawyers put into drafting and negotiating contracts, it sought the most sophisticated AI technology available.

title: NFL Combine gains real-time insights for informed draft day decisions with Azure AI
executive_summary: At the NFL Combine, scouts and coaches struggled to access timely, actionable insights during live drills, making it harder to evaluate talent and build accurate draft boards across more than 300 elite prospects.
products: Azure Container Apps, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Monitor

title: KDDI and Azure OpenAI Service cut middle office sales preparation work by 74 percent
executive_summary: KDDI is harnessing the power of generative AI to enhance its core 5G communication services and reinforce the power of connection. As part of these efforts, the company aimed to foster generative AI internally and streamline sales preparation work.

title: McMaster University's DeGroote School of Business collaborates with Microsoft to design advanced digital literacy curriculum
executive_summary: Based in Ontario, Canada, McMaster University is a leading higher education research and teaching institution with a deep commitment to preparing students for a successful and productive future. Recognizing a need, the university’s DeGroote School of Business built upon its multidisciplinary approach and collaborated with Microsoft to add AI, data science, and analytics classes. Through this forward-looking curriculum, students gain a distinct advantage in the employment marketplace. The school’s pilot program met with such success that it plans to expand its offerings and broaden its relationship with Microsoft.

title: Siemens Gamesa fuels business growth and cultivates a data-driven mindset with Microsoft Industry Solutions
executive_summary: Microsoft Industry Solutions guided Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy through a digital and cultural transformation that included upskilling its people, changing its culture, and becoming more self-sufficient in managing new, technology-based business processes. It was a far cry from the narrower move to the cloud that the manufacturer first envisioned—but one it readily adopted when Microsoft showed Siemens Gamesa how the bolder initiative could not just support scalability, but fuel genuine business growth.

title: EY teams speed time to market using Microsoft Power Platform, delights clients with flexible, all-in-one solution
executive_summary: Business travel and living abroad for work can be exciting career milestones—and also require a lot of legwork to coordinate changes in tax status, compensation, and immigration. To centralize that coordination for its clients, EY teams created the EY Mobility Pathway (EYMP). Despite the complexities and massive amounts of data involved, the firm launched EYMP quickly using Microsoft Power Platform, Dynamics 365, Azure, and a custom React portal. EY teams brought the product to market in record time, delivering a better user experience and value-added services to its clients.

title: Global manufacturing group, Metinvest, lays foundations for long-term growth by moving to Azure
executive_summary: One of the top global 50 steel producers and top 10 mining companies, and headquartered in Ukraine, Metinvest comprises more than 30 manufacturing enterprises, selling products to more than 100 countries. In 2018, it faced the need to scale and expand the capacities of its existing datacenters. Supported by its IT and innovation partner, Metinvest Digital, the group forged a strategic alliance with Microsoft and local partner Infopulse to move 680 servers to the Azure cloud platform. The migration and re-platforming of its IT infrastructure, along with a significant volume of data to the cloud, took less than a year, and generated projected savings of USD3 million over the next 10 years.

title: ABN AMRO embraces an Azure-first data strategy to drive better business decisions
executive_summary: ABN AMRO is the third-largest bank in the Netherlands, with 100 branch offices and more than 30,000 employees. Its mission statement, “Banking for better, for generations to come,” is embodied by the way it uses digital services and data to support customers during key life moments. When ABN AMRO needed a more efficient way to access and act upon data, it embraced a data mesh architecture on Microsoft Azure and Azure Data Lake Storage to unlock data insights and drive business decisions.

title: A dynamic platform for social housing
executive_summary: Clarion Housing Association is the UK’s largest housing association, serving more than 360,000 residents in more than 125,000 properties across the UK.

title: University of North Carolina at Charlotte uses Azure PaaS to bootstrap an EV charging solution
executive_summary: Electric vehicles (EVs) are growing in popularity, but the lack of charging stations on public streets is a hurdle to widespread adoption. Installing new charging stations can be costly and disruptive. To meet this need, a team at the Energy Production and Infrastructure Center (EPIC) at the University of North Carolina (UNC) at Charlotte developed a solution to retrofit existing streetlights for use as multi-vehicle smart charging stations. Alex Miller, a sophomore undergraduate with no previous Microsoft Azure experience, served as the team’s developer. Learning as he went along, he used Azure platform as a service (PaaS) and Internet of Things (IoT) technology to bring the project to life in less than six months.

title: Lillestrøm municipality adopts digital smart city solution to remotely monitor hydro utilities, anchor broad sustainability effort
executive_summary: To the environmental engineering folks at Lillestrøm municipality, water is both a blessing and the source of a few headaches.

title: GNC puts customer needs first as part of a digital transformation with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Azure
executive_summary: During 2020, GNC went through both bankruptcy and the retail turmoil of COVID-19. However, the company has already emerged and is driving positive business trends thanks to a newfound focus on innovative technology and customer personalization. GNC is using Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Azure to break down data silos and create a single source of truth about customers so that it can produce highly individualized and relevant messaging. The company is rolling out Dynamics 365 Customer Insights and planning to implement additional applications such as Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management to optimize warehouse and inventory management.

title: Nebraska Furniture Mart embraces Microsoft 365 to work smarter and improve customer connections
executive_summary: Nebraska Furniture Mart (NFM), North America’s largest furnishings retailer, is known for its extensive showrooms and varied inventory. “We have basically everything for the home, and then some,” says Robyn Messerly, Director of IT at Nebraska Furniture Mart. The retailer prides itself on creating a family-oriented culture among employees and customers. “We take care of each other and put people first,” says Messerly. Technology plays an important role in supporting that culture—helping employees work more effectively and continue to offer the level of service that NFM takes pride in.

title: Slovakian company PosAm makes car parking easier with Azure-based mobile app
executive_summary: If you’re a driver, chances are you know the struggle of finding a parking lot in a crowded urban area. Slovakian software provider, PosAm, came up with a solution. The company's smart parking app, ParkDots, is used each day to optimize parking for more than 21,000 drivers. Connected to IoT sensors, it reduces the time it takes to park while helping parking operators manage occupancy and enforce fee collection. The app is hosted entirely in Microsoft Azure for easy workflow management, fast service deployment, and scalability.

title: Nationwide brings its culture of care to a hybrid work environment with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: In the midst of COVID-19, Nationwide experienced a radical shift in how and where associates got work done. Today, the company continues to embrace change by finding new ways to bring their people-focused mission to a hybrid work scenario. It’s a big change, and Microsoft 365 tools are at the heart of how Nationwide delivers the future of work. A hybrid strategy continues the organization’s culture of care in a digital world for the 25,000 Nationwide associates experiencing the future of work firsthand.

title: The technology behind dinosaurs, wild animals, and Horse Club: Strategic digitalization at Schleich based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Schleich’s highly detailed and authentic-looking creatures light up every child’s eyes. The toys made by this long-established company, which was founded in Schwäbisch Gmünd in southwest Germany, have been fueling people’s imagination since 1935. Today, Schleich sells its products in over 70 countries and operates locations all around the globe. To support the internationalization of its business with the right IT infrastructure, the company migrated its fragmented on-premises solution to the Azure cloud platform. The modern workplace ensures collaboration across national borders that is scalable, flexible, and has a firm focus on data security.

title: Avanade inspires employees and customers alike using design-led, hybrid work experiences and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Avanade is a technology solutions provider that creates business value for its customers by fostering a connected, modern employee experience within its own organization. Because the company is an early adopter of Microsoft technology and uses expertise garnered from providing solutions like Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams to its globally distributed workforce, Avanade is well positioned to speak to its customers about solution benefits and obstacles to avoid.

title: Firstlight Media runs on Azure to provide an uninterrupted, high-definition streaming experience
executive_summary: Firstlight Media is building on a long history of OTT platform innovation for streaming providers around the world, including AT&T, Rogers Sports & Media (including Sportsnet), newcomer Struum, and others. OTT refers to going “over the top” of the cable box to provide streaming, like Netflix and Roku. Firstlight Media’s mission is to help the company’s customers—multichannel video programming distributors (MVPDs), telcos, and entertainment and sports providers—deliver best-in-class content via live and video on-demand (VOD) streaming.

title: Nivy Watch gains unmatched scale and simplicity with Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: Nivy Watch is a leading maker of smartwatches designed for professional use. Originally used primarily as personal fitness trackers, smartwatches are quickly gaining a foothold in the business world by offering crucial insight into employee and process efficiency. Using specialized sensors, antennas, and software, Nivy watches can calculate how long it takes an employee to perform a task, along with the distance they traveled—allowing businesses to make on-the-fly adjustments that streamline workflows. When Nivy Watch’s existing database struggled to keep up with increasing demands, it turned to Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB to gain the speed, scale, and simplicity the 10-person team needed to win customers and drive growth.

title: Microsoft Viva and Microsoft Power Platform drive communications innovation at rebranded credit union
executive_summary: connectFirst Credit Union needed to consolidate four regional brands under one rebranded umbrella organization. It faced challenges from existing on-premises technologies, separate processes and procedures, and a fragmented communications infrastructure. With the help of its partner, the credit union adopted Microsoft Viva to help bring the consolidated organization together with universal access to company news, archived information, and role-related resources. Incorporating embedded canvas and model-driven apps, created using Microsoft Power Apps, within Microsoft Viva added to an overall boost in efficiency. It also helped underpin a roadmap for future communications and collaboration innovation for related branch and corporate business processes such as mortgage renewals, expense submissions, fraud reporting, and education reimbursements.

title: Sumitomo supports diverse working styles and increases productivity with Surface devices and Windows Autopilot
executive_summary: Working at Sumitomo Corporation typically means a lot of travel. The firm has long since focused its ICT environment on laptops to make it easier for employees to work flexibly, and it is now extending that model to support telework. In 2021, the firm needed to replace its computers and rolled out three types of Microsoft Surface devices to 5,500 employees to meet diverse needs. With an emphasis on the 2-in-1 Surface Pro 7+ for ultralight business applications, Sumitomo aimed to accelerate workstyle innovation and digital transformation within the company. To distribute the devices quickly and efficiently, the program used cloud-based Windows Autopilot to set up and pre-provision devices. Sumitomo’s ICT environment is now ready for a new generation, one familiar with new tools that considers remote work normal.

title: Microsoft Teams-based app Qbo enables users to converse and collaborate with insights
executive_summary: Augmented analytics company Unscrambl helps non-technical business users unlock data and insights through machine learning. Their partnership with Microsoft allows Unscrambl to reach businesses that need innovative data reporting solutions. The company’s  AI analytics-driven app Qbo with the help of Microsoft Teams lets users access their company data easily. They can converse and collaborate during Teams meetings for instant reports, storyboards, forecasts, and charts, making real-time and fact-based decisions possible.

title: CP ApS adopts DynaRent solution leveraging Dynamics AX to streamline operations and improve productivity
executive_summary: Aiming to offer the best products and services to its customers, reduce manual processes and human errors, and simplify its overall operations, CP ApS chose To-Increase’s DynaRent solution—a sales, rental, financial, and supply chain solution that provides cradle-to-grave management of various customer rental assets. DynaRent is fully integrated with CP ApS's legacy on-premises Microsoft Dynamics AX instance (now Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management for Microsoft cloud customers) and leverages Microsoft Azure. DynaRent also offers mobile solutions, and the ability to operate the business in the cloud ensures that service and maintenance are now undertaken with minimal effort. The solution also helps CP ApS optimize many of its processes, including rental, returns, internal invoicing, service, and maintenance.

title: GiveLife 365 helps nonprofits maximize their mission outcomes
executive_summary: Volunteer MBC, a registered charity, fuels purposeful connections between people to respond to pressing social issues in the greater Toronto area. Volunteer MBC serves as a backbone for nonprofits by supporting their volunteer recruitment and recognition, as well as by providing resources and training to engage volunteers effectively.

title: “Our devices save lives”: Dräger optimizes its global customer approach along the entire customer journey with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Sometimes they’re really hot, sometimes they’re deep underground, but always it’s an extreme situation: Dräger’s products protect lives or help preserve them. Whether in the medical technology sector in anesthesia and ventilation or in the safety technology sector for fire and mine rescue services—the equipment used in these situations must be absolutely reliable and meet the highest technological standards. To continue to satisfy these customer expectations in the future, Dräger relies on Microsoft Dynamics 365 for sales, service, and customer support. As a global cloud CRM system, this solution creates a sustainable, company-wide IT foundation.

title: Top pizza chain slices through data recovery spend with Azure
executive_summary: When the company started, the total cost of ownership, in addition to all the branch offices’ equipment, was quite high. In the end, the company chose to move three branch offices and the company datacenter to Azure. As a result, the total cost of ownership has met the 30 percent spend decrease expectation, and the DR time has reduced from 30 days to just a few hours.

title: Storm Technology Ltd enables growth-ready CRM with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: SalesSense International Ltd provide a range of customer services sales and advisory programs through its Sales-Oriented-Service/Service-Oriented-Sales (S.O.S.) methodology. The company sought to formalise its commitment to delivering excellence to clients. Key to realising this objective was the introduction of a modern CRM solution, and to that end, SalesSense decided that the solution from Storm Technology Ltd—powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365—was the right fit for its operating model. The solution’s business process flow enables better tracking and reporting at each stage of the sales process.

title: CP ApS adopts DynaRent solution leveraging Dynamics AX to streamline operations and improve productivity
executive_summary: Aiming to offer the best products and services to its customers, reduce manual processes and human errors, and simplify its overall operations, CP ApS chose To-Increase’s DynaRent solution—a sales, rental, financial, and supply chain solution that provides cradle-to-grave management of various customer rental assets. DynaRent is fully integrated with CP ApS's legacy on-premises Microsoft Dynamics AX instance (now Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management for Microsoft cloud customers) and leverages Microsoft Azure. DynaRent also offers mobile solutions, and the ability to operate the business in the cloud ensures that service and maintenance are now undertaken with minimal effort. The solution also helps CP ApS optimize many of its processes, including rental, returns, internal invoicing, service, and maintenance.

executive_summary: Volunteer MBC, a registered charity, fuels purposeful connections between people to respond to pressing social issues in the greater Toronto area. Volunteer MBC serves as a backbone for nonprofits by supporting their volunteer recruitment and recognition, as well as by providing resources and training to engage volunteers effectively.

title: “Our devices save lives”: Dräger optimizes its global customer approach along the entire customer journey with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Sometimes they’re really hot, sometimes they’re deep underground, but always it’s an extreme situation: Dräger’s products protect lives or help preserve them. Whether in the medical technology sector in anesthesia and ventilation or in the safety technology sector for fire and mine rescue services—the equipment used in these situations must be absolutely reliable and meet the highest technological standards. To continue to satisfy these customer expectations in the future, Dräger relies on Microsoft Dynamics 365 for sales, service, and customer support. As a global cloud CRM system, this solution creates a sustainable, company-wide IT foundation.

title: Eneco: fighting the climate crisis through smarter use of data
executive_summary: Eneco is on a mission: to become the biggest green energy supplier in the industry by inspiring customers to switch to sustainable energy. To achieve that, the company has changed the way it operates, making smarter use of data, and starting to speak to its customers in a more personalized way. Key innovations supporting this agenda have included the introduction of chatbots to manage online interactions with customers, and the creation of a user-friendly platform that unifies customer data, allowing Eneco’s call center agents to make smarter decisions. Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service lies at the heart of both solutions, paving the way for further innovations – and a greener, more customer-centric future for the company.

title: Edible Arrangements uses Azure Synapse Analytics to turn data into delicious treats
executive_summary: Best known for its gift bouquets made of juicy, fresh fruit, Edible Arrangements (Edible) started as a store front in East Haven, Connecticut, at the turn of the century. Now, Edible serves 100 million customers—50 million gift givers and 50 million gift recipients—around the world, having branched out from bouquets to other sweet and chocolatey gifts.

title: Kidney Research UK gain round-the-clock security via Softwerx expertise
executive_summary: Kidney Research UK partnered with Microsoft security experts Softwerx to support the charity's cybersecurity aims whilst staying within budget. Softwerx advised them to adopt a Microsoft-first approach by adopting enhanced Microsoft security features and reducing spending on alternate third-party solutions. The charity had no capacity or desire to build their own internal security team, so they took advantage of Softwerx’s 24/7 Managed Detection and Response (MDR) offering via the Softwerx Security Operations Centre (SOC). Kidney Research UK now enjoy affordable, eyes-on, round-the-clock, enterprise-grade security support.

title: Mechanical moles, digitally tweaked: TRACTO uses telemetry data in Azure to offer customers real advantages
executive_summary: How do pipelines for water and gas, or indeed fiber optic cables, get under the ground? The obvious way is by digging a trench. But TRACTO-TECHNIK GmbH & Co. KG offers a different solution—using equipment for trenchless pipe laying that doesn’t require tearing up streets and sidewalks. TRACTO has continuously refined this technology. Today, the company takes advantage of big data to offer innovative, digital solutions to customers around the world, to increase reliability, and to optimize drilling processes.

title: Vodafone employees achieve big productivity gains with Power Platform while maintaining high governance standards
executive_summary: Vodafone is a leading telecommunications company in Europe and Africa. As part of its strategy to streamline internal business processes, Vodafone has enabled Power Platform for all its employees and now has more than 1,000 solutions.

title: Modern workplace for USM: the successful switchover while employees worked from home
executive_summary: Migrating an international company to the cloud and modernizing its workplaces was a major project undertaking. The two teams from USM and Experts Inside proved with a lot of creativity and motivation how this could be done even in challenging times. While the employees were all working from home, the IT infrastructure was converted to Microsoft 365, the data was migrated to the cloud, and the various applications were successfully connected. Detailed and transparent information about the progress of the project was provided on the intranet through videos, FAQs, Quick Guides, planning boards, and various other tools. Employees are delighted at how fast and uncomplicated communication has become, and the newly gained flexibility makes everyday work much easier.

title: Grupo Bimbo takes a bite out of production costs with Azure IoT throughout factories
executive_summary: Grupo Bimbo nourishes people all over the world. Producing its tempting breads, cookies, tortillas, and other baked goods is a low-margin, high-volume enterprise that depends on peak efficiency to keep the company on top. Grupo Bimbo turned to Microsoft Azure IoT solutions to help the company transition from a large-scale bakery to a data-driven enterprise, starting with its US factories, Bimbo Bakeries USA. Rather than distancing people from the production process, it connects them more intimately than ever before with the power of data delivered through Azure IoT technology.

title: USC’s Viterbi iPodia Program invests in collaborative hybrid learning to break down barriers in traditional education with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Educating tomorrow’s visionaries and leaders requires a new learning paradigm in today’s increasingly connected but more diverse world. Traditional e-learning, focusing on delivering lectures by faculty, limits students’ learning experiences and confines them to local campus resources. However, good learning happens anywhere and anytime. And great learning occurs when students work together with their global classmates as local peers—the goal of the new iLearning paradigm.

title: Fraser Health boosts post-pandemic health services with holistic communications solution
executive_summary: Fraser Health was already on a digital transformation journey as staff and patients alike adapted to changing work and life circumstances, accelerated by the pandemic. The organization’s Collaboration & eHealth Services team was tasked with providing the latest tools and services to best support office, frontline, and patient services with particular emphasis on the new demands and opportunities introduced by a shift from in-person to virtual care. Fraser Health partnered with Microsoft Gold Certified Partner Calian to introduce new solutions, such as Microsoft Teams, which serves as a hub for enhanced patient communications, scheduling, data exchange, and physician collaboration.

title: Delta Electronics brings smart manufacturing to small and midsized customers
executive_summary: Delta Electronics is on a mission to make sure smaller companies aren’t left out of Industry 4.0—the digital transformation that is revolutionizing global manufacturing. To cater to the unique needs of industrial machinery makers, Delta Electronics, a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner, Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider (CSP), and winner of the 2021 Microsoft Partner of the Year Award, worked with Microsoft to develop a software as a service (SaaS) solution for manufacturing execution systems (MES), called edgeMES for Machine Making. Designed for use in factories, edgeMES runs on a readily available industrial PC (IPC) to put the flexibility of Azure services at the edge. The edgeMES combines Azure SQL Edge and Azure IoT Hub to deliver the speed and efficiency of on-premises data collection plus powerful cloud-based AI and analytics. The result is a first-of-its-kind industrial internet of things (IIoT) solution for small- to medium-sized machinery and equipment makers. With edgeMES, they can rapidly deploy digitalized green factories and benefit from end-to-end visualization and management.

title: Toyota Motor Europe: Building a happier workplace by putting people first
executive_summary: The name Toyota has long been synonymous with innovation and excellence, known across the world for pushing boundaries and pioneering new ways of thinking. As it now pivots to a new marketplace, reimagining itself as a mobility company, it is also reviewing the way it operates internally. The hybrid workplace has become a reality and Toyota Motor Europe is using the Microsoft 365 suite of tools to usher in not only new ways of working, but a new way of thinking too. It is all contributing to the company’s overall goal: to produce happiness for all.

title: Top pizza chain slices through data recovery spend with Azure
executive_summary: When the company started, the total cost of ownership, in addition to all the branch offices’ equipment, was quite high. In the end, the company chose to move three branch offices and the company datacenter to Azure. As a result, the total cost of ownership has met the 30 percent spend decrease expectation, and the DR time has reduced from 30 days to just a few hours.

title: Storm Technology Ltd enables growth-ready CRM with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: SalesSense International Ltd provide a range of customer services sales and advisory programs through its Sales-Oriented-Service/Service-Oriented-Sales (S.O.S.) methodology. The company sought to formalise its commitment to delivering excellence to clients. Key to realising this objective was the introduction of a modern CRM solution, and to that end, SalesSense decided that the solution from Storm Technology Ltd—powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365—was the right fit for its operating model. The solution’s business process flow enables better tracking and reporting at each stage of the sales process.

title: River Island responds to changing tides in retail with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: For 70 years, River Island has brought trend-led styles to British shoppers, with more than 250 stores in the United Kingdom, Ireland, and around the world today. Despite its remarkable growth and global scale, employees invariably note the close-knit family culture that defines the company. “At River Island, you’re encouraged to be an individual, have a voice, and be part of the family,” says Paul Cooper, Head of Technology at River Island.

title: Restaurant operator Cravia centralizes and streamlines operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Headquartered in Dubai, Cravia is one of the fastest growing food and beverage (F&B) organizations in the region. With different brands and chains in its portfolio, Cravia needed to centralize its business processes and operations on a single platform. It streamlined its financial records and achieved more supply chain efficiencies by implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and Finance and Operations. Using Microsoft Power platform, Cravia also boosted its workflow efficiency and data visibility. With reduced manual processes, human error, and dependencies, the company now has more freedom to grow.

title: ÖBB gains greater scale and state-of-the-art security measures by moving ticket sales to the Azure cloud platform
executive_summary: ÖBB moves a lot of people, quickly and reliably. Austria’s largest mobility services provider transports 477 million passengers per year, 1.3 million passengers per day, and was ranked as the most punctual railway operator in Europe in 2019. With results like these, ÖBB knows that being a leading mobility company means not only ensuring the trains run on time, but that they’re filled with contented passengers.

title: Post-it® Brand and Microsoft join up to create the Post-it® App for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Pasting your favorite inspirational quote to your workstation, leaving a reminder for a coworker (or for yourself), or jotting down a grocery list —the reasons to reach for a Post-it® Note are numerous, especially in the workplace. When it comes to brainstorming with colleagues, Post-it® Notes can help be a catalyst for great ideas. “Brainstorming is synonymous with the Post-it® Brand,” says Liz Thompson, New Product Marketer for Post-it® Brand. Yet as hybrid work becomes the norm, collaborating with colleagues in various locations can be a disjointed experience, lacking the easy flow of ideas that often happens when people come together in the same room. “With people scattered here, there, and everywhere, it’s more challenging to get that creative magic to come to life,” says Thompson.
products: Microsoft 365, Planner, Microsoft Teams

title: Ready for a hybrid future with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: “I’ve had a Surface device for a long time,” says Kieron Nolan, VP of IT and Operations at Future Plc. “It looks like a premium device. It operates like a premium device. It is as robust as a premium device. Yet the cost of the device makes sense from a business point of view. They are really good devices and they look the part.”
products: Azure, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Surface Go, Surface Laptop, Windows 11

title: MCT streamlines invoice processing with AQL Technologies and Power Automate
executive_summary: Since 1986, MCT has been among the leading authorized Carrier Transicold dealers for truck, trailer, rail, and auxiliary power unit (APU) sales and repair services across the United States. Now consolidated as a family of companies, MCT Companies provides a complete range of services for the transport refrigeration industry from coast to coast, across 16 locations in seven states. MCT's dedication to consistency drove an operational evolution that eventually required that the business adopt a new system for its Accounts Payable team. The company turned to AQL Technologies, which leveraged its extensive knowledge of Microsoft best practices to streamline MCT’s invoice processing system through robotic process automation (RPA).

title: Beiersdorf builds on decades of skin care research and accelerates innovation with Azure AI
executive_summary: Beiersdorf’s team of more than 900 scientists have been researching innovative, cutting-edge skin care solutions for decades. By centralizing its immense data library and leveraging AI-powered knowledge mining with Microsoft Azure Cognitive Search, its researchers can find the information they need quickly. Features such as document summarization, semantic search, document tagging, and optical character recognition allow researchers to extract key information fast, enabling them to spend less time searching and more time on industry-leading product development.

title: Tenable FEC transforms connectivity and collaboration with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Tenable Fire Engineering Consultancy (FEC) is a key player in the building industry, specializing in combining innovative fire engineering techniques with local codes and laws for optimized, cost-effective, and safe builds. With multiple locations and clients from across the globe, the company needed to create a secure and collaborative platform for smoother operations. Since deploying an Azure Virtual Desktop, employees can easily and securely access their desktops from anywhere, on any device.

title: Condatis revolutionizes staff management with Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Condatis sees digital, verifiable employee credentials as the next wave in hybrid work. Using them gives organizations an easy but trusted way to protect and support employees and create a seamless hybrid work experience. Condatis used Microsoft Entra Verified ID to help keep track of its employees in the event of an emergency or drill, create a record of their skills and training history, facilitate visitor access to locations and services, and give people more power over their digital identities. Condatis and its customers are saving time and money, building trust, increasing transparency, and becoming better prepared for unexpected business disruptions.

title: Forward-thinking energy company embraces Power Platform to increase process efficiency while cutting costs
executive_summary: Equinor is an international energy company with more than 21,000 employees and present in 30 countries worldwide. To optimize existing complex business processes in support of its transition to a broad energy company, it established a Microsoft Power Platform Center for Enablement to nurture greater innovation through low-code development.

title: Piramal Capital & Housing Finance leverages Microsoft solutions to cut turnaround times of loans by 30%
executive_summary: Piramal Capital & Housing Finance Limited (PCHFL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Piramal Enterprises Limited, is a housing finance company engaged in retail and wholesale lending. In retail lending, PCHFL is one of the leading players that addresses the diverse financing needs of the under-served and unserved market in India.

title: United Tractors drives digital transformation with Azure Center for SAP solutions
executive_summary: United Tractors (UT) is Indonesia’s largest heavy equipment distributor and a key player in the mining, construction, and energy sectors. Having already adopted enterprise resource planning (ERP) early on, UT decided to push its growth further by adopting cloud technology. With an eye on Industry 4.0, the company migrated its on-premise SAP HANA system to Azure. The move enabled UT to gain actionable insights, as well as deploy business apps for inventory planning, predictive maintenance, and employee self-service. Coupled with the use of Microsoft 365, UT now enjoys increased productivity and collaboration across the organization.

title: Luminous accelerates integration, innovation, and efficiency through RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: When it comes to innovation, Luminous is by no means in the dark. The manufacturer has been producing a wide range of cutting-edge products in the power backup, battery, home electrical, and solar spaces for the past 30 years by sticking closely to its mission of creating customer delight through innovation and passion.

title: Kingston Builds Cloud-Based BPM System with Microsoft Power Platform, Sees Soaring Business Agility
executive_summary: The impacts of the pandemic have made clear the need for businesses to find agility and flexibility in their operations to cope with the rapidly changing business environment. As such, business process optimization (BPO) has become a universal goal among enterprises around the globe. According to research from Gartner, it is estimated that by 2025, 70% of new enterprise applications will employ low-code solutions. Projects will be able to be completed faster than ever through the use of development tools with intuitive UI. Project staff—regardless of coding ability—can thus quickly turn their ideas into highly functional applications, easily overcoming a variety of challenges.

title: Driving experience excellence with SAP on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: McLaren Automotive creates some of the most breathtaking performance road sports cars in the world from its McLaren Production Centre in Woking, UK. The iconic motor racing brand rolled out its first supercar, the McLaren MP4-12C, in 2011. In June 2022, McLaren launches the Artura, the next-generation hybrid supercar with a new high-performance Hybrid powertrain and a beautiful, aerodynamic new design for sublime agility and engagement.

title: Vietnamese English school VUS transforms operations and streamlines finances with cloud solutions
executive_summary: VUS (Vietnam USA Society English Training Services Center) underwent a complete digital transformation to combat a drastic decline in student numbers due to COVID-19. Working with multiple implementation partners, the school turned to the cloud to create an AI-driven, connected, collaborative solution. It combined Microsoft 365, Azure, and Dynamics 365 to build secure, streamlined, and scalable operations.  With new tools, the center has reinvented its learning environment for today’s students.

title: Bringing Blind Veterans UK together with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: “On 1 September 1997, I woke up in bed catapulted into a world of complete darkness. I was absolutely terrified,” says Billy Baxter. Billy was a soldier in the Royal Horse Artillery, but contracted a virus in Bosnia that robbed him of his eyesight. When he woke up that morning, his life changed completely. He soon became detached, isolated, and depressed. The army had been his whole life. But then he got in touch with Blind Veterans UK, a charity with centres in Sussex and North Wales that supports anyone who has served in the UK Armed Forces and who is now living with significant sight loss. Their support, rehabilitation and training helped Billy turn a corner. He knew he wasn’t alone anymore and that he could finally talk to people who understood what he was going through.

title: Tenable FEC transforms connectivity and collaboration with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Tenable Fire Engineering Consultancy (FEC) is a key player in the building industry, specializing in combining innovative fire engineering techniques with local codes and laws for optimized, cost-effective, and safe builds. With multiple locations and clients from across the globe, the company needed to create a secure and collaborative platform for smoother operations. Since deploying an Azure Virtual Desktop, employees can easily and securely access their desktops from anywhere, on any device.

In June 2022, McLaren launches the Artura, the next-generation hybrid supercar with a new high-performance Hybrid powertrain and a beautiful, aerodynamic new design for sublime agility and engagement.

executive_summary: VUS (Vietnam USA Society English Training Services Center) underwent a complete digital transformation to combat a drastic decline in student numbers due to COVID-19. Working with multiple implementation partners, the school turned to the cloud to create an AI-driven, connected, collaborative solution. It combined Microsoft 365, Azure, and Dynamics 365 to build secure, streamlined, and scalable operations.  With new tools, the center has reinvented its learning environment for today’s students.
