title: St. Luke’s uses Azure NetApp Files for robust, flexible performance of Epic health records
executive_summary: St. Luke’s University Health Network uses Epic to manage its patients’ medical records. Clinicians and providers rely on the electronic health records (EHR) system for a holistic view of patient health so they can provide high-quality care. When St. Luke’s embarked on a cloud transformation and migrated its EHR system to Microsoft Azure, it needed a way to ensure robust, flexible performance of its Clarity databases in the cloud.

title: Cricket Australia wins a test for its employees using Viva Insights to improve employee work-life balance
executive_summary: Like many companies, Cricket Australia saw the pandemic lockdowns cause additional strain for employees. Engage Squared recommended a trial of Viva Insights and helped Cricket Australia set it up to generate insights using real organizational data from select employees across the organization. Employees at Cricket Australia have changed the way they view their wellbeing and productivity after using Viva Insights.

title: Bahrain Public Transport Company (BPTC) increases transport usage at competitive costs
executive_summary: Bahrain Public Transport Company (BPTC) needs to keep operational costs down and at the same increase public transport usage. In early 2018, the public transport usage was decreasing–attributed to two factors: punctuality and reliability. The adoption of Microsoft Navision for Finance and HR, Microsoft 365 suite of applications for collaboration, of PowerBI for reporting and general productivity measurement and migrating their infrastructure to Azure Cloud allowed BPTC to achieve better services, higher transport usage rates, data security and 30% cost savings while delivering increased punctuality and reliability to its customers.

title: AbleLight uses Dalikoo’s My Links, powered by Microsoft SharePoint, to connect remote frontline workforce
executive_summary: AbleLight, a nonprofit that supports people with intellectual and developmental disabilities, sought a solution that would allow employees to publish links once and have those links available everywhere on AbleLight’s intranet. AbleLight obtained a free trial of My Links from Microsoft partner Dalikoo through the Microsoft commercial marketplace, then later expressed interest in buying a subscription. Dalikoo learned about AbleLight’s inspirational work and created a not-for-profit subscription tier for My Links within the marketplace. My Links enabled AbleLight's frontline employees, who work in clients' homes, to easily find and use organizational applications and links via the intranet.

title: AQL empowers global nonprofit by implementing efficient digital workplace
executive_summary: Founded in 1952 and headquartered in New York City, the nonprofit organization Population Council addresses critical health and family-planning issues, helps people avoid and combat HIV infection, and promotes uplift of women worldwide. Facing increasing pressure to digitally transform and adapt to the new remote work culture, the organization sought to update its existing content infrastructure and management system. AQL Technologies leveraged its extensive knowledge of Microsoft best practices to optimize Population Council’s existing IT infrastructure and build a coherent digital workforce, guided by agile methodology.

title: Global consulting firm CAI boosts business agility and operational alignment with Viva Goals and the OKR framework
executive_summary: CAI helps clients design, deliver, operate, and maintain quality, critical manufacturing facilities by pooling its global resources of more than 800 employee-owners. The company’s engineering, technical, and consulting services integrate people, processes, equipment, systems, and facilities into a high-performance, global manufacturing operation. It serves clients in business areas that include Commissioning and Qualification; Quality, Regulatory, and Compliance; Human Performance; and Automation and Information Technology. A business area consists of a set of services that requires a unique quality system, a set of personnel with skills and experience, a potentially unique client base, and requires unique knowledge of a market segment.

title: Košík.cz gains agility to expand to new markets and deliver customer satisfaction with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With daily deliveries to about 6,000 customers, Košík.cz is one of the Czech Republic’s largest online food retailers. Operating at that scale requires serious IT support to ensure that deliveries are met and customers are happy. However, Košík.cz’s digital infrastructure was increasingly unable to meet its growing demand.

title: Wunderman Thompson says goodbye to paper-based feedback processes
executive_summary: Wunderman Thompson unites nearly 20,000 professionals in 90 markets globally, around one shared vision: To inspire growth for ambitious brands. Similarly, the organization’s vision for employees is: To inspire growth for ambitious people. Wunderman Thompson does this by applying the same branding expertise they use with their clients to help employees better know, grow, and project an authentic personal brand (APB). Developing a strong APB will increase the value employees bring to their work at Wunderman Thompson and help them grow in their careers. Wunderman Thompson wanted to offer a global tool, the THRIVE application, to help employees facilitate personal development and career growth through building their personal brand.

title: Năvodari Town Hall builds on the power of Microsoft Azure to bring citizens together
executive_summary: Transparency, accessibility, responsiveness to citizen needs—these are the pillars of an open government. Năvodari’s Town Hall in Romania delivers them using the power of Regista, a Microsoft Azure-based cloud platform providing document management, registration services, tax payments, and management of public requests. As a result, Navodari’s citizens can seamlessly submit requests, track cases, and review regulations from their phone or computer. While they save hours on town hall visits, civil servants keep a close check on over 200,000 documents and work more efficiently.

title: Strauss Group gears up to revolutionize the food industry using Azure cloud-enabled data
executive_summary: Food and beverage manufacturer Strauss Group is working to make an impact on the world through food. Yoram Sadan, Vice President, Group Chief Information Officer and Digital Officer at Strauss Group, knew that investing in technology and cloud infrastructure was essential to take Strauss’s vision to the next level and connect its many offices across the globe. With Microsoft, Strauss didn’t just find a service provider, but rather a technology partner with a shared vision of the future.

title: Irth uses .NET MAUI to modernize its mobile app, helping workers who service critical network infrastructure operate safely and efficiently
executive_summary: Technology company Irth Solutions (Irth) rebuilt its risk management, damage prevention, and infrastructure protection mobile app using .NET Multi-platform App UI (.NET MAUI) to better safeguard critical network infrastructure. The company wanted to modernize its app to be more responsive on multiple operating systems but without developers having to write code in different programming languages. Irth became an early adopter of .NET MAUI so that its team could develop apps for Android, iOS, and Windows from a single shared code base. Now the company is advancing a mobile-first strategy to enhance resilience and reduce risk in the delivery of essential services.

title: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign graduates 350,000 identities to cloud in 48 hours
executive_summary: In an identity management landscape where change and challenge are the only constants, the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (U. of I.) Technology Services team manages user identities with a “people-centric” approach. Its recent Microsoft Azure Active Directory migration of 350,000 identities took one short, drama-free weekend. The university’s team offers advice and lessons learned for other organizations.

title: Bank of Queensland reduces service desk calls and simplifies work with Microsoft Edge
executive_summary: Employees from Bank of Queensland (BOQ), Australia’s sixth-largest financial institution, once relied on a “confusing hodgepodge” of browsers. To address the fragmentation, the bank consolidated with Microsoft Edge, which provides modern capabilities plus compatibility with BOQ sites tied to Internet Explorer. Using internal “change champions” to drive adoption, BOQ saw high rates of user uptake and significant reductions in service desk calls, as well as benefits from automatic browser updates, such as improved security.

title: Email cybersecurity specialist SMX boosts cost savings and security while improving customer experience with Azure
executive_summary: As the saying goes, reputation is everything—it takes a long time to build and only a short time to lose. This is particularly apt for email cybersecurity provider SMX, given the ever-increasing frequency and sophistication of email cybersecurity threats. When you’re scanning and delivering millions of emails a month, reliability, reputation, and long-term usage and buildup of reputable IP addresses are vital core assets enabling business success.

title: Indian School of Business enjoys teaching continuity, seamless hybrid operations, and robust cybersecurity with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Indian School of Business (ISB) is a world-class business school established in India in 2001. The not-for-profit institution is committed to developing leaders through innovative programs, outstanding faculty, and thought leadership. The school has two state-of-the-art campuses in Hyderabad and Mohali, where students learn the best global management practices.

title: Infrabel: connecting its workforce to connect a country with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Belgian railway infrastructure management company Infrabel is responsible for keeping the country connected. That begins with its employees. Starting in 2018, Infrabel underwent a culture-shifting transformation, moving from its old communications system to Microsoft Teams to enable better efficiency, flexibility, and connectivity between its employees in the hybrid work environment. To help its employees adapt to the change, the company underwent several training programs, ultimately resulting in a better-connected office community, a more flexible work environment, and a solid platform for a digitalized future.

title: Astellas Pharma Inc. achieves security measures at a global scale using Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Global pharmaceutical company Astellas Pharma Inc. develops, manufactures, and markets pharmaceuticals, and it has a high awareness of security management from the viewpoint of business continuity, continuously looking for optimal security measures. In response to the rise of cloud services and increasingly sophisticated cyberattacks, the company deployed Microsoft Sentinel, a cloud-native security information and event management solution in 2021. After a year of operating Microsoft Sentinel, Astellas has established a foundation that enables centralized management of data logs on a global scale and promotes enhanced threat detection and security measures.

title: UST unifies essential applications on Microsoft Teams to empower 33,000 employees to achieve more
executive_summary: UST is a global digital transformation solutions provider. Staying true to its mantra – Digital is our DNA - UST has enabled the world’s best companies to make a real impact through transformation. Powered by technology, inspired by people and led by purpose, UST partners with its clients from design to operations to embed innovation and agility. With more than 33,000 employees in over 25 geographies, it leverages the power of technology to engineer a better future and make a positive impact on billions of lives.

title: HELLENiQ ENERGY optimized its document signing process with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Greece-based HELLENiQ ENERGY is one of Southeastern Europe’s leading energy groups, with a presence in six countries and activities spanning the energy value chain. To accelerate its digital transformation, the company needed to automate its vast Document Management processes. Together with Partner Team Candi, HELLENiQ ENERGY deployed a Microsoft Cloud-based system with DocuSign integration—shortening the document signing process from days to mere hours.

title: Competitive Capabilities International transforms performance management and empowers collaboration with Teamflect and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: With worldwide locations and global customers, Competitive Capabilities International (CCI) enables manufacturing and supply chain organizations to implement multi-site operational excellence, world-class practices, and enhanced performance through expert coaches and its digital continuous improvement system. CCI needed to replace an outdated system with a modern performance management solution integrated into Microsoft Teams, their communication and collaboration platform of choice, to further support high-performing teams. With engaging features, outstanding support, and native integration with the Teams ecosystem, Teamflect provided the flexibility, agility, clarity, and high standards that CCI requires. Teamflect enabled CCI to empower employees, make sure people are accountable, and create an amazing employee culture.
products: Microsoft Teams, Outlook

title: SparePartsNow revolutionizes a multibillion-dollar market using highly scalable Azure services
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: How Microsoft 365 change communications best practices can serve as a template for enterprise IT
executive_summary: This document is for informational purposes only. MICROSOFT MAKES NO WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, IN THIS SUMMARY.

title: Premera Blue Cross auto-scales operations on demand by migrating to Azure Kubernetes Service, reducing costs by up to 60 percent
executive_summary: Premera Blue Cross (Premera), a health plan based in the Pacific Northwest, chose Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) to save time and money, freeing up staff to focus on improving services for its members. The organization had migrated to Microsoft Azure, but it found that significant time and effort were required to manage its previous Kubernetes service. Premera needed a stable, secure environment to support rapid growth. The organization realized that it could lower costs and liberate staff from maintenance work by using AKS. With AKS, Premera reduced the total cost of ownership by up to 60 percent and freed up a team of 10 people.

title: Walgreens Boots Alliance moves a mountain of SAP assets to Azure in a key modernization move
executive_summary: With stores in every state and around the world, Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) is a giant in retail. It’s also the friendly neighborhood pharmacy on the frontlines of the pandemic response, dispensing lifesaving aid to 8 million people each day in stores and online. Even before its designation as an essential services provider, the company knew that it needed more flexibility across its global supply chain to serve its customers better and faster. A key step in the company’s digital transformation occurred when its massive SAP landscape—an estimated 100 terabytes (TB)—was migrated to Azure. It was the biggest SAP S/4HANA scale-out deployment on Azure to date.

title: Pet care leader turns monolithic app into a global distributed solution on Azure
executive_summary: Pets, like their owners, need specialized care from time to time, but the referral system used by one major network of pet care providers needed care itself. The medical records didn’t always follow the client, and often the records got duplicated in the process. VCA, one of the largest pet healthcare companies in the United States, wanted to streamline referrals across more than 800 of its veterinary hospitals. The company turned to Microsoft Gold Certified Partner CloudIQ Technologies, which created a cloud-native application on Microsoft Azure that solved the messy referrals problem.

title: Boggi Milano automates its supply chain replenishment with Evo Pricing’s AI solution, built on Microsoft technology
executive_summary: Innovation is core to Boggi Milano. It’s the founding value that enabled the company’s transformation from a small boutique in 1939 to a rapidly growing ambassador of premium Italian style for cosmopolitan men all over the world, with 190 stores in 38 countries. The latest example is the company’s adoption of fully automated supply chain replenishment, an innovation introduced in partnership with Evo Pricing. This artificial intelligence solution powered by Microsoft services enabled 4 percent like-for-like revenue growth, even while overall stock shrank by 12 percent, thanks to accelerated learning and greater local relevance.

title: Bringing back house calls: St. Luke’s Hospital uses Microsoft 365 to reimagine care for patients
executive_summary: It’s midafternoon and Alycia Walty, MD, pediatrician and Chief Medical Officer of Star Wellness, is trying to look up the nose of a four-year-old. Dr. Walty is in her office, and the patient is at home with his mom. How does this work? A flashlight helps. A smartphone is essential. So is plenty of patience with little kids. But the whole encounter is made possible by Microsoft Teams, the digital collaboration service in Microsoft 365. Eventually, Dr. Walty makes her diagnosis: a common cold, not COVID-19. The visit ends with a very thankful and relieved mom.

title: Cyprus-based Hellenic Bank builds a more productive workplace with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: One of the largest retail banks in Cyprus, Hellenic Bank emerged as a forerunner of digital transformation in the Central and Eastern Europe financial sector in 2017, when it started adopting digital tools to serve its customers better. It adopted Microsoft 365 tools like SharePoint Online and Microsoft Teams to its core processes, creating a productive workplace environment that empowers more than 3,000 employees to collaborate more easily to meet customers’ needs.

title: Nonprofit digitally transforms to enable remote collaboration and respond to a community in crisis
executive_summary: The San Diego Workforce Partnership funds and delivers programs that empower job seekers to meet the current and future workforce needs of employers in San Diego County. When COVID-19 forced the Workforce Partnership to close its offices and headquarters, it became more difficult to serve the high volume of workers that the pandemic recently displaced. Using Microsoft Teams, a website chatbot built with Power Virtual Agents, and omnichannel capabilities within Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Workforce Partnership employees have been able to increase remote collaboration and engage with more people in need of support.

title: Growing an innovative energy partnership across Australia
executive_summary: AGL, one of Australia’s leading integrated energy companies, is rolling out an innovative energy partnership with the help of Microsoft Azure Data Explorer. By allowing customers across the country to give back to the grid through remote management of networked solar batteries, AGL has created an innovative virtual power plant (VPP) that improves grid reliability, putting downward pressure on energy prices and helping customers save on energy costs.

title: PHDC manages projects more efficiently and serves clients faster with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: PHDC helps low-income residents make needed repairs to their homes. The agency used disparate, manual processes to plan projects, track documents, schedule inspections, and pay for repairs. To streamline its complex processes, PHDC adopted the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Field Service business applications and Power Pages. Now, the agency has increased productivity, made remote work possible, improved reporting, and pays its valuable contractors in half the time.

title: Azerbaijani Ministry of Education unlocks the power of data-driven education
executive_summary: For the Azerbaijani Ministry of Education, connected, data-driven education is the future of learning. With the aid of its recently launched online education platform, the Ministry is helping more than 1.3 million K–12 students advance their knowledge from wherever they study. Using Microsoft Teams for Education and Microsoft Power BI, the Ministry and teachers are equipped with key educational content, insights, and statistics. This helps improve teaching methodologies over time, ensuring students stay engaged with lessons. Teams enables students to connect to personalized learning content seamlessly, making exceptional education possible in any location.

title: WTW raises certainty in an uncertain world with AI-driven Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Customers from around the world rely on professional services organization WTW for its innovative risk strategies, insurance placement, HR consulting, and compensation and benefits planning. All of these services depend on enormous volumes of data that engender the clarity and perspective organizations need to make the best possible decisions in a world that guarantees only uncertainty. So, protecting client data and intellectual property are a WTW hallmark. Over the years, the company had built up a raft of unrelated, legacy security solutions that were increasingly difficult to maintain. Its vision for a more streamlined, productivity-first security posture called for a tightly coordinated tool set. WTW found what it needed with the full suite of Microsoft Security solutions, including Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Purview, and Azure. It’s excited to use the latest security innovation, AI-driven Microsoft Security Copilot.

title: ASAPCLOUD provides modern security, compliance for on-premises infrastructure with Azure Arc
executive_summary: ASAPCLOUD has been providing IT services to private organizations and governmental entities since 2005. To expand the type of customers for its security, monitoring, and compliance software as a service (SaaS) offerings, ASAPCLOUD has been developing new services. Using Microsoft Azure Arc and Azure Monitor, these services extend the Azure control plane to infrastructural components in multiple clouds, on-premises, and at the edge. When a ransomware attack caused a nearby municipality to lose access to its infrastructure, halting services for all of its citizens, the municipality of Houten asked ASAPCLOUD if its Azure Arc services would be a good fit for its on-premises infrastructure.

title: Vestas supercharges its wind farm control models for sustainable energy with Azure HPC
executive_summary: Global leader in sustainable energy solutions Vestas Wind Systems A/S wanted to optimize wind energy production by reducing the negative impact of turbine wakes. Working with Microsoft and partner minds.ai, Vestas ran a reinforcement learning engine using machine learning and Microsoft Azure high-performance computing and storage resources. Proof of concept complete, Vestas now has the tools to generate simulations that offer the potential to help wind farms mitigate wake effect, generate more wind energy, and build a sustainable and prosperous energy future.

title: Kantar Worldpanel Plus uses Azure Databricks to produce real-time shopper insights
executive_summary: Kantar’s new Worldpanel Plus service was planned to deliver insights about UK shopper behaviour. They opted for Microsoft Azure, running Azure Databricks and Azure Data Lake with additional Microsoft security and Power Platform tools. Worldpanel Plus launched in 2018. A large sample of shoppers now upload 100,000 receipts per day. This scalable solution enables Kantar to deliver UK shopper insights to the brands with which it works.

title: A bid for sustainability: ASCORP amplifies offers for green energy projects with Power Apps
executive_summary: ASCORP, a green energy trailblazer in Romania, faced challenges managing and standardizing its green energy projects’ bidding process. Driven by a vision of sustainability, ASCORP sought a solution to streamline its operations. Collaborating with Pepas Cloud, ASCORP developed an innovative app called Deep Quotes, on Power Apps. The solution helped ASCORP enhance its efficiency and improve collaboration by cutting down the time it takes to create an offer from 2-4 hours to five minutes.

title: TAS United protects caller data 24/7 with Azure-based Safetica data loss prevention
executive_summary: Come rain or shine, TAS United agents are there for their clients, handling customer calls around the clock. To ensure that sensitive caller information remains confidential, the company implemented Safetica's data loss prevention (DLP) solution, run on Microsoft Azure. It applies machine learning and automation features to detect and prevent data leaks and help TAS United meet strict compliance requirements. Delivered in the cloud, it eliminates the cost and hassle of maintaining physical servers while reducing the time spent on manual data monitoring by 41 percent.

title: Sage improves retention 30% with employee listening powered by Viva Glint and Viva Insights
executive_summary: Sharon Oley, Customer Services Director at Sage, oversees 500 colleagues who maintain the great customer support that the payroll, HR, and finance software provider has become known for. “We’re very focused on giving the customer great access and a great experience,” she says. Key to that standout customer experience is a frontline workforce of engaged employees who buy into Sage’s people-focused, supportive workplace culture. For a global business operating in a hybrid world, however, keeping a finger on the pulse of organizational culture can be a challenge. “We use Microsoft Viva Glint and Viva Insights to gain real-time insights into how employees are feeling and workplace behaviors,” says Oley. “We understand the importance of listening to employees.”

title: Cranfield University deploys Elastic SIEM on Azure to protect vital IT infrastructure and support revenue opportunities
executive_summary: Cranfield University, a postgraduate university focusing on science, engineering, design, technology, and management, uses large volumes of data from different sources for research and needs to keep its security infrastructure compliant with business partner requirements. Seeking to accelerate compliance with partners, Cranfield turned to Elastic Cloud powered by Microsoft Azure, enabling the university to analyze data, automate processes, and protect systems across the enterprise.

title: Virtual inspections optimize carbon footprint: Siemens Energy uses Microsoft Teams to simplify acceptance testing for its energy solutions
executive_summary: In 1867, Werner von Siemens discovered the dynamo-electric principle, setting things in motion that would make Siemens Energy one of the world’s most important suppliers of energy solutions. One-sixth of global power production is based on this company’s technology. In the past, Siemens Energy customers would travel thousands of kilometers to inspect and approve the solutions they ordered before initiating the complex process of shipping them. Today, Siemens Energy uses Microsoft Teams and HoloLens 2 to create virtual test beds that make these long journeys superfluous. This saves money and reduces the carbon footprint of the company and its customers.

title: Windows 11 Pro gives a competitive advantage to an ancient craft
executive_summary: Hakutsuru Sake Brewing Co., Ltd. has been creating fine sakes in Kobe, Japan since 1743. When the company transitioned to flexible work styles, they needed a way to streamline security management across their 22 locations around the world. Secure-by-default Windows 11 Pro devices enabled their 500+ employees to outperform anywhere while freeing up their IT team to focus on strategic business initiatives.

title: Hepsiburada teams up with Toloka and makes product search as easy as it gets with Azure-based solution
executive_summary: Envision the exhilaration of a shopper when their product search unlocks the perfect find – this is the realm of retail where Turkish Hepsiburada aimed for nothing short of excellence. To revolutionize its search capabilities for the millions of products available on its e-commerce platform, Turkish Hepsiburada teamed up with Serbian Toloka and developed a solution based on Microsoft Azure. The result was a 9-percent increase in search quality. Hepsiburada is now one of the leading Turkish e-commerce platforms.

title: ABN AMRO modernizes its infrastructure in 9 months with Datometry and Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Dutch bank ABN AMRO was looking to move business-critical workloads from Teradata to Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics. The deadline was tight, and the job needed to be performed with little to no downtime for business analysts and other internal customers. ABN AMRO worked with Microsoft partner Datometry, whose qInsight and Hyper-Q solutions enabled a seamless migration and allowed ABN AMRO to leave applications intact, avoiding time-consuming rewrites. As a result of leaving its legacy vendor, ABN AMRO realized significant scaling advantages, gained flexibility, and laid the foundation for a comprehensive cloud strategy.

title: Sogei transforms its culture and achieves 1,100 return on investment with Microsoft Adoption and Change Management services
executive_summary: Sogei, the IT company fully owned by the Italian Ministry of Economy and Finance, had to address low adoption of Microsoft 365 tools so its employees could work from anywhere with high productivity. But its initiative was reactive, lacking identity and roadmap clarity. Sogei commissioned Microsoft to help transform its working culture from the ground up with a Microsoft 365 adoption program and Center of Excellence. The unique solution developed by the Adoption and Change Management (ACM) services team has saved the typical user an average of 4.5 hours per week that has been reinvested into productive time, personal wellbeing, and upskilling. The program also introduced a 194 percent increase in collaboration with Microsoft Teams, 60 percent reduction in email volume, and provided a 1,100 percent return on investment for Microsoft 365 E3 licenses.

title: Générale pour l’Enfant leverages Power Apps and new technologies for its business applications
executive_summary: Since 1987, the Générale Pour l’Enfant group’s objective has remained the same: to imagine and design children and toddlers’ clothing that is comfortable, playful, and high-quality. This ambitious approach shared by all employees makes this family-based business a major player in children's fashion through its three flagship brands: Sergent Major, Du Pareil Au Même, and Natalys.

title: From “DX x Work Style Reform” to “DX x Data-Driven Management” - The current state of TIS’s “Internal DX” with Microsoft products.
executive_summary: TIS, part of the TIS INTEC Group, is developing its business into one of Japan’s IT leaders. As a business partner for over 3,000 companies in a wide variety of fields including finance, industry, government, and distribution services, the company delivers IT services to support their growth strategies. Today, is TIS leveraging industry knowledge and IT construction capabilities accumulated for over 50 years to support the DX (Digital Transformation) of society and companies, and is proactively developing its own DX as well.

title: Machines raise their voice when they need help: Bosch’s Digital Twin – IAPM takes human–machine collaboration thanks to Microsoft Azure to the next level
executive_summary: Factories are like organisms—processes intertwine, conveyor belts carry important parts from A to B, and every element serves a purpose. They also have something that could be called a heart: turbines or electric motors that in expert circles are also known as rotating machines. As long as these are up and running, everything else in a factory runs, too. If they break down, companies lose valuable time, money, and resources. To prevent such untowardly incidents, Bosch has developed an Integrated Asset Performance Management (IAPM) solution powered by a Digital Twin that runs on Microsoft Azure. This solution lets rotating machines themselves indicate when they need maintenance, helping them to run with optimal costs and maximum efficiency.

title: Florida university gives students hands-on skills, job-hunting success with Microsoft courseware
executive_summary: Students need to know about changing technology more than ever, while professors have less time than ever to enrich their classes to meet that need. Florida’s St. Leo University is among the 500 universities worldwide that are addressing that gap with Microsoft Learn for Educators. The Microsoft Learn for Educators program enables faculty members to infuse Microsoft curriculum, hands-on labs, and tools into the courses they already teach, better preparing their students for Microsoft certification and successful job hunts.

title: Plus Malaysia Berhad streamlines internal processes with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: PLUS Malaysia Berhad (PMB) is the country’s largest highway service provider and one of the largest in Southeast Asia. To ensure a safe and efficient highway network for citizens, its stakeholders always seize opportunities to improve internal processes. PMB adopted a low code Microsoft Power Platform to automate time-consuming manual tasks and empower non-technical teams to build business apps quickly. Shorter cycle time, simplified work process, and faster report generation have increased internal efficiency, enabling the workforce to focus more on value-added activity to improve customer experience.

title: Partnership between California Child Support Services and Microsoft on Cloud Adoption leading to a more efficient system protecting Californian children and families
executive_summary: Businesses and organizations have rapidly transitioned to intensify digital integration following COVID-19. And with the transition to digital adoption also came a rise of cyber threats. As a state organization, the existing cyber infrastructure at the California Child Support Services (DCSS) had impeded timely remediation of business continuity and was vulnerable to security threats. To meet changing business needs, DCSS engaged Microsoft Consulting Services to help tackle several challenges associated with their on-premises Child Support Enforcement (CSE) business system. Through Microsoft services, DCSS is now better able to meet their mission to enhance the well-being of children by providing payment services to Californian families faster than ever before.
customer: California Health and Human Services Department of Child Support Services
products: Azure Automation, Azure Firewall, Azure Monitor, Azure Storage, Azure Traffic Manager, Azure VMware Solution, Azure Virtual WAN, Azure Key Vault

title: AlphaBOLD streamlines customer service for Calpine Energy Solutions
executive_summary: Calpine Energy Solutions faced significant challenges in maintaining visibility into its financial information and customer support activities. Calpine’s legacy system wasn’t fully integrated, so the company had limited access to its data as well as disparate data stores, ultimately reducing the quality of its customer service. AlphaBOLD solved Calpine's challenges with a solution built on Microsoft Power Platform and driven by Dataverse and Power Apps that improves visibility, streamlines program management, and integrates with the company’s legacy systems to improve its billing processes.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Dataverse for Teams, Power Apps

title: Etihad Airways raises the bar for customer service with Power Virtual Agents
executive_summary: For years, Etihad Airways has capitalized on innovative solutions that help offer a seamless customer service experience that makes travel easier and more stress free. New and complex travel restrictions during the global pandemic created a surge in customer inquiries. The team developed a chatbot using Microsoft Power Virtual Agents to be able to respond to all of them. Etihad Airways has empowered its agents with sustainable, scalable tools that helped revamp its customer experience, and improve its net promoter score (NPS).

title: Digitalization of heat exchangers reduces the world's carbon emissions
executive_summary: The world’s energy demand will double by the year 2050. That is why we must make the most of the energy we already produce. The partnership with Microsoft enables Alfa Laval to optimize the energy efficiency in their customers' processes.

title: NatWest moves to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service resulting in £10m+ software savings
executive_summary: “At NatWest, we are responding to the needs of all of our customers in building a relationship bank in a digital world,” states Angela Byrne, COO Retail Bank at NatWest Group.

title: Ernst & Young LLP (EY) improves their employee experience with Microsoft Search
executive_summary: Employees at Ernst & Young LLP (EY), one of the largest professional services networks in the world, introduced Microsoft Search to help employees easily search for people, files, sites, and more. In parallel with a campaign to strengthen and update permissions on the company’s two million Microsoft SharePoint sites, the global firm rolled out user education campaigns to its employees to create the best search experience possible. Now, EY teams use work search to facilitate better collaboration among teams and higher productivity companywide.

title: Azure Rehab utilizes Azure AI solutions to empower people with disabilities
executive_summary: Accessibility and AI are imperative topics of discussion globally and technology is a key enabler to empower people with disabilities. Microsoft called on the LATAM Developers Community (including students, customers, and partner developers) to challenge them to create applications which utilize Azure AI solutions that could empower advancement of people with disabilities. Azure Rehab was the hackathon winner showcasing innovative use of technology with purpose.

title: Using Advanced Analytics to automate processes and prevent failures: A data platform for Clearstream based on Azure
executive_summary: Every day, Clearstream carries out more than 250,000 settlement transactions, while holding more than 300,000 nationally and internationally traded bonds, securities, shares, and investment funds in custody. That’s another way of saying that this subsidiary and central securities depository of Deutsche Börse Group carries a great deal of responsibility. In a strictly regulated industry, the company carries out its processes promptly, accurately, transparently, and securely. In the past, Clearstream used an on-premises data platform for this purpose. Today, data is made available from a central source with the help of Microsoft Azure. This ensures more efficient processes and speeds up the development of new services.
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Functions, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Nagarro powers HR operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365 to gain efficiency
executive_summary: Nagarro is a global leader in digital product engineering. With its agile and caring values, it drives technology-led business breakthroughs to help clients transform, adapt, and build. Listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, the company enables enterprises to future-proof their business by leveraging its expertise across cutting-edge technologies and multiple industries. It has a broad international customer base, primarily in Central Europe and North America. Nagarro employs over 19,000 people across 36 countries and is growing exponentially.

title: CATA Center for Astrophysics simultaneously connects more than 300 schools over 4,300 kilometers with the help of Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: In observance of Astronomy Day, the Chilean Centro de Astrofísica (Center for Astrophysics) developed a collaborative activity through Microsoft Teams to measure the planet's radius alongside students across the country.

title: The Tile Shop enhances security and agility with SAP on the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: The Tile Shop is a large, growing US-based tile supplier. The company’s continuing expansion necessitates new, more advanced technological infrastructure and robust cybersecurity solutions. The Tile Shop recently transitioned from outdated, on-premises infrastructure to Microsoft 365 E5 and SAP on the Microsoft Cloud. Adopting Microsoft Sentinel, Defender for Cloud, and Intune, among others, the company has unified and strengthened its cybersecurity posture, saving hundreds of thousands of dollars in the process.

title: Availability, safety, and expense reduction: FRAM Capital undergoes digital transformation with Microsoft tools
executive_summary: With support from partner company Microsoft CloudData, FRAM Capital, an investment manager, implemented an integrated ecosystem based on Microsoft 365, Microsoft Azure, and the use of Microsoft Sentinel for security. The solution was easily implemented by the financial market’s familiarity with the tools, and there was an increase from 25 to 100 users with no additional infrastructure costs.

title: Achieving One Fujitsu with Red Hat Enterprise Linux on Azure for Enhanced Security and Operational Efficiency
executive_summary: As Fujitsu Limited fulfills its digital transformation, it’s adopting a new One Fujitsu model. This initiative aims to build trust in society and realize a more sustainable world through innovation by working with customers undergoing a sustainability transformation.

title: Sandvik Coromant delivers ultimate customer service with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Part of global industrial engineering group Sandvik, Sandvik Coromant is a company at the forefront of manufacturing tools, machining solutions and expertise that drive industry standards and innovations demanded by the field of metalworking. Founded in Sandviken, Sweden in 1942, the company’s solutions enhance productivity, profitability, and sustainability for multiple manufacturing industries.

title: Dynacare uses Microsoft Surface devices to optimize total cost of ownership, enhancing operational efficiency and value in just four months
executive_summary: Dynacare, a provider of diagnostic testing and lab services with more than 170 locations in Canada, used Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Surface devices to improve efficiency for employees, enhance provider experiences, and empower its organization with innovative technology that would help it grow moving forward. Dynacare saw an opportunity to help providers and patients address health concerns more quickly by collecting, locating, and sharing test results faster. It deployed Surface devices so that employees could create simpler, more accessible records and share them more effectively. Now, providers get results more quickly, and the company has improved its total cost of ownership with the use of enduring, reliable, and effective devices.

title: Azerbaijan Airlines expands data access to increase efficiency by 70% with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Infosys deploys central identity and access management platform based on Microsoft Azure Red Hat OpenShift
executive_summary: Established in 1981, Infosys, an NYSE listed company, is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. It enables clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation with ease. With an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change, it empowers businesses with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. In 2022, Infosys received the ‘Top Employer’ certification in 22 countries and is recognized as the fastest-growing IT services brand in the world by Brand Finance. Infosys needed a highly secure end-to-end cloud-native and platform-agnostic identity platform that can broker the access across applications.

title: Tyler Technologies lays the foundation for its future with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Plano, Texas-based Tyler Technologies (Tyler) provides software solutions and digital infrastructure that help the public sector create smarter, safer, stronger communities. Tyler has more than 7,300 employees—45% of whom previously worked in the public sector—in 56 locations in the U.S., Canada, the Philippines, and India. The company’s clients include 44,000 installations in 13,000 locations, from local governments as large as the County of Los Angeles (population: 10 million) and as small as Loving County, Texas (population: 94), to state agencies, municipalities, and schools. Tyler solutions encompass public administration, courts and public safety, health and human services, and K-12 education. They include data and insights, civic experience, cybersecurity, enterprise resource planning (ERP), platform technologies, and productivity tools.

title: North Wales Fire and Rescue Service work with Valto to achieve ‘Intranet Anywhere’ with Microsoft 365.
executive_summary: North Wales Fire and Rescue Service (NWFRS) relies on full-time and on-call staff at 44 stations to respond to thousands of incidents annually over an area covering 2,400 square miles. NWFRS chose Valto for professional assistance upgrading its on-premises information systems. Valto’s one-day scoping workshop for Microsoft 365, SharePoint, and Teams enabled NWFRS to rapidly start implementation. Using existing Microsoft 365 licenses, NWFRS deployed a secure intranet with remote access and self-service options.

title: Finagraph helps accounting firms, financial institutions save 20 hours per engagement and improve work-life balance with Azure SQL Database
executive_summary: Finagraph, a US-based fintech startup, turned to Microsoft Azure solutions, such as Azure SQL Database and Azure DevOps, to build a tool that accounting firms worldwide use to save time and improve efficiency in data collection and analysis. Accountants often face long hours performing routine tasks, like manual data extraction and formatting. Finagraph wanted to help its clients reduce hours spent on such tasks, increase efficiency, and spend more time on higher-value analysis and interpretation. Finagraph deployed Strongbox, a solution built on Azure that helps accountants to extract and format data directly from accounting systems while maintaining security and compliance, saving them 20 or more hours per client engagement.

title: SAS - Scandinavian Airlines boosts operational efficiency and customer experiences with Azure modernization
executive_summary: SAS - Scandinavian Airlines wanted to improve its technology platform to better accommodate the more than 30 million customers it serves each year. The airline’s overarching vision was to increase operational efficiency and empower its developers to spend less time maintaining infrastructure and more time building innovative solutions to support its customers at every touch point during their travel experience. The airline chose to move from an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) solution to a fully managed platform as a service (PaaS) and elected to migrate critical databases and applications first, using Microsoft Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, Azure App Service, and Microsoft Defender for Cloud. With support from Microsoft Customer Success Migration Factory, SAS completed the complex migration quickly, and without incident—immediately enhancing its security posture and creating an environment for more streamlined DevOps workflows. With Azure PaaS, the airline can more proactively meet customer demands, minimizing disruptions and ensuring a seamless travel experience.

title: Close Brothers gains agility and streamlines IT effort by switching to Windows 365
executive_summary: Close Brothers wanted to modernise its IT estate to reduce support overheads, simplify IT, improve the user experience and make it easier to offshore services. They switched to a number of Microsoft solutions, including Microsoft Surface devices, Windows 11, Microsoft Intune, Entra ID and, notably, switching from a poorly performing incumbent remote desktop app to Windows 365. Performance tickets raised dropped by 80 percent, software requests have been cut by 50 percent, and at the same time, users are happier with the end user experience.

title: Elcome delivers fast, reliable broadband at sea with Microsoft Fabric and Copilot
executive_summary: Marine electronics expert Elcome understands the importance of reliable broadband connectivity to keep its customers safe at sea and keep their businesses operating smoothly. Working with Microsoft AI Cloud Partner Program member Onyx Data, Elcome deployed Microsoft Fabric—including the Real-Time Intelligence, real-time hub, and data activator features—along with Copilot to build Welcome, an industry-first, ISP-grade monitoring and management platform that is scalable, flexible, and future-proof. With its Microsoft-powered solution, Elcome has reduced data latency from minutes to seconds, giving customers high-speed connectivity that keeps vessels and crews safe and well-informed in the ever-changing marine environment.

title: Florida nonprofit Agape Source scales to support more newcomers through AI-powered web chat, Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Agape Source runs Orlando Welcome, which serves international students, temporary workers from other countries, and refugees in Florida. The nonprofit operates with a staff of just three people plus volunteers and needed ways to be more efficient. They began using Microsoft Copilot, the AI-powered web chat assistant, to get more done, faster. The nonprofit is ramping up the number of people it supports with the help of generative AI.

title: SPAR helps customers make grocery savings with an Azure-based customer app
executive_summary: Austrian supermarket chain SPAR is committed to helping its customers save on their grocery shopping with the help of technology. A traditional brick-and-mortar retailer, the company is embracing digitalization and innovation by moving to the cloud – and using it to develop a new customer app that’s helping SPAR to push out more promotions and discounts while also phasing out paper-based systems.

title: Domino’s unites and engages a global workforce with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: With thousands of stores across 12 markets, Domino’s Pizza Enterprises Limited has carved out a special place in the hearts (and stomachs) of pizza lovers. With a geographically diverse workforce speaking multiple languages on three continents, the fast-moving company aimed to unite its geographically diverse workforce and recognized the need for effective, centralized communication at scale. Domino’s turned to Microsoft Viva, an integrated employee experience platform, to enhance engagement, improve productivity, and foster connection among team members.

title: Staying ahead of fierce competition: Sunrise employees use Copilot for Microsoft 365 to free more time for innovation
executive_summary: How do you stay on top amid fierce competition? For Sunrise, this hinges on harnessing the experience and drive of their employees. This approach has made Sunrise one of Switzerland’s leading telecommunication companies, a position Sunrise maintains by moving fast and always looking out for new, innovative opportunities. To give employees more time for the tasks they love rather than the mundane, tedious ones—Sunrise uses Copilot for Microsoft 365.

title: Microsoft empowers support engineers to shine brighter with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Microsoft operates one of the largest customer support teams in the world with tens of thousands of customer support engineers and more than 145 million contacts per year. Prior to 2020, the team was using 16 different case management systems and over 500 individual tools. This slowed down service, hindered collaboration between engineers, led to more redundant engagements, and produced inefficient workflow. To provide better resolution of customer issues, leverage the full expertise of the engineers on staff, and use its own tools to show how Microsoft can power one of the most complex customer support organizations in the world, the support team migrated to Dynamics 365 Customer Service. This resulted in a 31 percent increase in first call resolution and a 20 percent reduction in missed routes.

title: London Stock Exchange Group increases productivity with Windows 365.
executive_summary: London Stock Exchange Group’s developers had previously navigated between multiple desktops. Using Windows 365 has streamlined this process.

title: HERON Group more than doubles client base while reducing costs and effort with Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: HERON Group, a leading energy group in Greece, faced operational challenges as its legacy customer relationship management (CRM) system couldn't support its growing customer base and complex multi-channel journeys.

title: ProCredit Bank improves contact center operations, cuts wait times by 30% using Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: ProCredit Bank Romania’s contact center used to rely on spreadsheets and scattered emails, making it hard to resolve customer issues promptly, let alone track performance.

title: Bank of Queensland reduces time to deliver updates by 80% with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Bank of Queensland had goals for technology modernization and business growth that would improve people productivity and  operational agility and automate regulatory compliance. They also needed a solution that would improve security and protect customer data.

title: Daimler embraces the cloud to innovate faster
executive_summary: Daimler AG, one of the world’s largest manufacturers of premium cars and trucks, is driving hard to be a key player in software. To speed up software development and thus innovation, Daimler uses Microsoft Azure DevTest Labs. By developing in Azure, the company can onboard developers in hours versus weeks, get new ideas underway faster, and attract top talent with a state-of-the-art development environment. Peter Rothlaender, Manager of Cloud Solutions at Daimler, explains why Daimler is honking its horn about Azure DevTest Labs.

title: Transport for NSW uses Agile Analytics and Azure to harness the power of data and improve customer services across New South Wales
executive_summary: Transport for NSW is a state government enterprise responsible for delivering safe, integrated, and efficient transport systems to the people of New South Wales, Australia. Its Multi-Modal Performance Reporting Program harnesses the power of data to improve customer services and manage the performance of bus, ferry, light rail, and metro operators. With large volumes of data arriving every day, often in 10-second intervals, Transport needed a way to ingest, store, and analyze it. After extensive evaluation, Transport contacted Agile Analytics to implement its Data Insights offering powered by Microsoft Azure. Now after data is ingested and modeled, Power BI dashboards are created and shared with Transport operators, delivering full transparency into whether performance meets contractual obligations and identifying areas of improvement.

title: KPMG helps accelerate relief fund disbursement, improves tracking and management of federal grants
executive_summary: The State of Georgia wanted to quickly help its citizens manage the challenges brought on by COVID-19. It set out to give its Office of Planning and Budget a user-friendly platform to manage $3.58 billion in Coronavirus Relief Fund aid. In just three weeks, KPMG and GrantCare launched a new grant management solution built on GrantCare and Microsoft Dynamics 365. The team used Power BI and Power Apps to customize dashboards, templatize views, and automate processes to help the State of Georgia deploy a robust solution that not only met its immediate needs but that will support its grant management work in the future.

title: Closing the loop on the materials supply chain
executive_summary: “Only eight percent of waste is recycled,” points out Sneha Shah, Head of Communications at Recycleye. The company’s vision is to change this for the better.

title: Art meets technology: Digital dance classes at Skyline Tanzstudio on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Stephanie Schlund has been running Skyline Tanzstudio for many years. Located in Bavaria, the dance studio offers around 20 courses ranging from ballet to jazz and aimed at everyone from preschoolers to seniors. Every two years, Stephanie also stages a huge sellout show, attracting over 1,000 spectators. That was the rhythm at Skyline until the COVID-19 health crisis hit, closing businesses and changing everything from one day to the next. Stephanie and her husband Marcel invested in digitalization and technology—and in Microsoft Teams. This helped them keep their studio running, and gave their students a valuable diversion in a time of crisis.

title: ASAPCLOUD provides modern security, compliance for on-premises infrastructure with Azure Arc
executive_summary: ASAPCLOUD has been providing IT services to private organizations and governmental entities since 2005. To expand the type of customers for its security, monitoring, and compliance software as a service (SaaS) offerings, ASAPCLOUD has been developing new services. Using Microsoft Azure Arc and Azure Monitor, these services extend the Azure control plane to infrastructural components in multiple clouds, on-premises, and at the edge. When a ransomware attack caused a nearby municipality to lose access to its infrastructure, halting services for all of its citizens, the municipality of Houten asked ASAPCLOUD if its Azure Arc services would be a good fit for its on-premises infrastructure.

title: Longtime innovator SKF unveils the factory of the future on Azure hybrid cloud
executive_summary: For more than a century, Swedish industrial giant SKF Group has been producing bearings, seals, and other solutions and services for global manufacturers. Already an industry leader, the company is now turning heads to the way it does business. One of the key growth enablers for the company is to digitalize the full value chain to make SKF easier to do business with and to enable SKF to make more intelligent decisions in its own operations. Digitalizing operations will power that shift to data-driven manufacturing, and to support this transformation, SKF partnered with Microsoft to deploy a hybrid cloud solution.

title: Taking the high road to remote and hybrid learning at Davis School District
executive_summary: The Davis School District has recently adopted an approach they refer to as High Access, which includes everything from a one-to-one ratio of student to device, to school-specific applications designed to meet the needs of its curriculum and its students, to Microsoft Teams for collaboration. In pursuit of these objectives the technology leadership team at the district has, in the last two years, deployed more than 45,000 new Windows 10 devices, to accommodate the need for remote and hybrid learning.
products: Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Microsoft Teams, Office 365, Windows 10

title: Amid COVID-19, Banco Comafi develops app with Microsoft Power Apps to transform its sales process in less than a week
executive_summary: The arrival and spread of COVID-19 prevented approximately 400 sales executives from sending business offers to the bank’s customers. In five days, Banco Comafi developed an automated digital selling solution with the support of Microsoft Power Apps. This successful response to a global emergency has encouraged the company to permanently establish a new digital selling modality.

title: 12 weeks to pivot new integrated university experience
executive_summary: STADIO Higher Education was formed from the consolidation of four highly prestigious institutions—Southern Business School, Embury Institute for Higher Education, LISOF, and Prestige Academy—with a collective experience of more than 100 years in providing quality, affordable higher education. STADIO offers more than 50 accredited qualifications via contact and distance learning, across 10 campuses, to more than 20,000 students. The aim of STADIO is to empower the nation by widening access to higher education.

title: Keeping Local Without Sacrificing Innovation
executive_summary: If you happen to live in a Norwegian community, chances are high that your digital everyday banking experiences are powered by Eika, one of the largest financial service providers in the country. Eika differs from its competitors in its truly unique value proposition. Composed of 66 independent, competing local banks, Eika brings together the best of two worlds: the unmatched experience of a local bank committed to the community where customers live , and the ability to enable secure, modern, and comprehensive financial services based on a state-of-the-art banking platform and infrastructure.

title: SAE Digital Transformation Initiative
executive_summary: SAE breaks paradigms in Public Administration with the migration of its 3 Data Centers to Microsoft Azure public cloud. With the evolution of modernization and redesign, aligned to the National Digital Strategy, SAE aimed to guarantee the prompt attention to the needs, and to strengthen the service to the transferring; achieving an approximate 40% reduction in costs vs. the previous contract, and important benefits like the increase from 90% to 99.9% in the availability of its technological services.

title: Community Health Network removes friction for patients with Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare
executive_summary: The relationship between patients and healthcare providers can have a tremendous impact on patient outcomes. Patients who feel heard and understood are more likely to stay engaged and follow healthcare guidance, leading to better results. Community Health Network provides healthcare services through more than 250 locations across central Indiana. It wanted to streamline how it communicates with patients, including incoming caller activity and outgoing distribution of information to patients and their families. Community chose Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare and Dynamics 365 to modernize its contact center, unite its customer data with real-time journeys, and enable greater data insights to streamline the patient experience.

title: ENGIE’s journey to a modern workplace with Windows 11 and Intune
executive_summary: ENGIE used Windows 10 with Microsoft Configuration Manager and VPN for device management.
