title: Egyptian Tax Authority improves tax compliance using Microsoft SQL Server
executive_summary: A longstanding shadow economy in Egypt was costing the country significant tax revenue. The Ministry of Finance, via the Egyptian Tax Authority, decided the best solution was to digitize the tax return system to create a single, unified platform.

title: CQC drives high-quality health and social care in the most testing times with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Care Quality Commission (CQC) is responsible for monitoring the quality of care providers across England. In the middle of its transformation into a data- and insights-driven care assurance model, CQC used Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Voice and Dynamics 365 Customer Service Enterprise to develop its Emergency Support Framework to support the United Kingdom’s COVID-19 response. In doing so, CQC is laying the foundation for a new regulatory platform and better health and social care for the English public.

title: Spirit of Math delivers engaging online learning with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Spirit of Math provides after-school classes for students seeking to excel in mathematics. When COVID-19 disrupted its in-person teaching model, Spirit of Math quickly adopted online teaching with Microsoft Teams. While maintaining the collaborative learning and live, teacher-led classes that it attributes its success to, Spirit of Math not only saved 400 jobs and retained 11,000 students, the company has set itself up for continued growth for years to come.

title: Flexing a new working from home capability
executive_summary: Charterhouse Holdings plc was founded in 1970. The company has a rich history in garment manufacture, initially supplying some of the biggest names on the High Street and producing licensed merchandise for the likes of the NFL and The Simpsons.

title: Additiv breaks down virtual borders with expert guidance from FastTrack for Azure
executive_summary: Additiv is a leading catalyst for change in the financial services industry, helping the world’s biggest financial institutions capitalize on digitalization. Operating within a highly regulated industry means that Additiv must uphold the highest standards of security and compliance. When the company decided to move its infrastructure to Azure, it worked with FastTrack for Azure to ensure a seamless transition that would strictly adhere to compliance regulations across multiple locations. Now, Additiv can take advantage of more efficient operations to offer its clients innovative, flexible solutions that can easily scale and adapt to their specific needs, no matter where they’re located.

title: Taking medical instruction remote and to mixed reality at Case Western
executive_summary: When Case Western built a new Health Education Campus, it did so with the understanding that the new campus would house the most advanced medical learning facilities and technology available. Central to this effort is the Sheila and Eric Samson Pavilion, where medical, dental, and nursing students engage in lectures, special speaking events, and cutting-edge education.
products: HoloLens

title: Simplifying complexity for the benefit of clients
executive_summary: Dentsu Aegis Network is a global agency group that supports global clients, such as General Motors, P&G and Kraft Heinz, with media, creative and CRM agency services.  It helps its clients to speak to their customers in a personal way, boost creative optimisation and understand marketing effectiveness.

title: Jacobs Solutions Inc. builds Alluvial Platform with Microsoft Fabric and Power BI
executive_summary: Dallas-based organization Jacobs Solutions Inc. (Jacobs) is focused on creating a more integrated and sustainable world with their innovative and advanced engineering solutions ranging from advanced manufacturing, infrastructure, health, and life sciences and more. Comprised of more than 60,000 employees across 50 countries, Jacobs builds solutions in a diversity of fields ranging from national security and space exploration to transit and water.

title: Cognite Data Fusion® and Microsoft Sustainability Manager provide simple access to complex industrial data
executive_summary: Industrial data is complex, spanning everything from the performance of individual equipment to energy outputs for entire regional systems. Businesses committing to sustainability look for partners to help them increase efficiencies and reduce energy consumption with rich, actionable insights. Cognite provides exactly that with AI-powered data contextualization, exploration, and analysis. In a single, organized platform, Cognite Data Fusion® makes data consumable by providing a holistic, nuanced view of all existing data, enabling customers to take meaningful action to drive sustainability.

title: Tecnicas Reunidas cuts costs and builds a highly secure digital energy future with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Global engineering and energy innovator Tecnicas Reunidas needed to improve its security posture and increase efficiencies across its expanding footprint of both on-premises and cloud environments. The company adopted Microsoft Azure Arc, along with Microsoft Security solutions, to help its IT team to unify its deployments and establish central control over the company’s hybrid infrastructure and apps. Tecnicas Reunidas enhanced its security posture while saving costs, gaining data analytics, and forging new paths for innovation and efficiency as part of its efforts to achieve net zero carbon emissions.

title: TeamViewer Streamlines User Experience with Microsoft Edge WebView2 Tool Integration​
executive_summary: Striving for connection. TeamViewer provides remote access and remote control computer software that has already been installed over 2.5 billion times worldwide. Their goal is to enable remote connectivity and make the working environment much simpler for all.

title: Lynk & Co is “changing mobility forever” with a customer-focused business driven by Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Lynk & Co is transforming the way people use cars by offering people a simple and flexible experience where they can choose to buy, borrow, or subscribe to a vehicle. With ambitions to disrupt the automobile industry and launch its business in seven markets in less than two years, the Sweden-based company needed to quickly build an infrastructure that could support multi-channel customer engagement and drive highly personalized experiences. The company chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 for its out-of-the-box and customizable tools and the ability it provided to build in modules to create unique processes and prioritize specific customer experiences. Within eighteen months, Lynk & Co was able to ramp up a significant digital presence in Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Spain, and Sweden, as well as opening social clubs designed to bring the company’s online brand to life through community focused events.

title: Microsoft 365 Empowers Smart Office and the Digital Transformation of AXA Tianping
executive_summary: A smart collaboration platform is the foundation vital to AXA Tianping’s digital transformation. The platform, instead of a mashup of multiple products, shall incorporate various solutions with a core, which is Microsoft 365.

title: isLucid scales AI-powered digital meeting assistant for Microsoft Teams with Azure Marketplace
executive_summary: Lithuanian startup isLucid built an AI digital meeting assistant to help companies have more productive meeting outcomes.  After creating its first product for Microsoft Teams, isLucid grew its business by joining Microsoft for Startup programs, leveraging valuable expertise and resources. By introducing its app on Microsoft Azure Marketplace, isLucid gained customers from more than 40 countries in six months. The company has since helped people save up to 25 percent of time spent on meetings.

title: NatWest moves to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service resulting in £10m+ software savings
executive_summary: “At NatWest, we are responding to the needs of all of our customers in building a relationship bank in a digital world,” states Angela Byrne, COO Retail Bank at NatWest Group.

title: Mbanq uses Temenos Banking Cloud to offer cost-effective, scalable fintech solutions at speed
executive_summary: Fast-growing fintech Mbanq worked with Microsoft partner Temenos to enhance and accelerate the growth of its business with composable banking using Microsoft Azure. Mbanq works with credit unions, banks, and nonfinancial institutions globally. The company wanted to develop a SaaS solution that could deliver seamless fintech services at scale while meeting regulatory and compliance requirements. By collaborating with Temenos and building a secure, scalable SaaS solution on Azure, Mbanq revitalized its services, facilitating smoother transitioning, faster deployments, and seamless integration for its clients.

title: VeriPark transforms fintech through apps built on Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services
executive_summary: VeriPark is a global solutions provider enabling financial institutions to become digital leaders with its Intelligent Customer Experience suite. With significant changes happening in banking, capital markets, and insurance, the way people bank has changed massively. VeriPark worked with Microsoft Azure to deploy solutions in Power Platform that enable the company to deliver business applications that help its clients meet the changes in the industry.

title: Sulava keeps its employees connected and its audience engaged with Microsoft Teams Premium
executive_summary: With Teams Premium, Sulava is taking advantage of capabilities like intelligent recap, real-time collaboration, advanced security, and branding to expand the reach and security of its meetings.

title: PMC Hydraulics Group migrates to the cloud and transforms with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: PMC Hydraulics Group (PMC), with roots all the way back to 1957, is the leading Nordic provider of complete solutions in the PMC—Power, Motion, and Control—segment. The company designs, develops, builds, and markets everything from hydraulic components for lifting tables to complex, turnkey hydraulic systems for wind power and the offshore industry. The company has operations in Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Poland, Estonia, Latvia, China, and India, with sales around the world.

title: PMC Hydraulics Group migrates to the cloud and transforms with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: PMC Hydraulics Group (PMC), with roots all the way back to 1957, is the leading Nordic provider of complete solutions in the PMC—Power, Motion, and Control—segment. The company designs, develops, builds, and markets everything from hydraulic components for lifting tables to complex, turnkey hydraulic systems for wind power and the offshore industry. The company has operations in Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Poland, Estonia, Latvia, China, and India, with sales around the world.

title: Scottish Water uses Copilot for Microsoft 365 to eliminate mundane tasks and free up time for work that really matters
executive_summary: Water is the planet’s most precious resource. It is life. In Scotland, Scottish Water’s 4,500 people provide water and wastewater services to 2.6 million households. In addition to field operations and the treatment works themselves, digitalisation plays a big role at Scottish Water: it helps the company to analyse the water cycle and better understand water demand. This crucial work is often interrupted by tedious tasks that keep people from doing what they love most—delivering safe drinking water to Scotland’s homes and recycling waste water in ways that are good for the environment. Reducing mundane tasks to a minimum, and thus freeing up time for employees to work on the more meaningful tasks, makes for an even more motivated workforce. This is exactly what Scottish Water achieved when it implemented Copilot for Microsoft 365.

title: Arinco boosts resiliency, security for managed services customers by using Azure Business Continuity Center
executive_summary: Backed by years of industry specialization, Arinco blends automation, reliability, quality, and proactivity to provide a professional Microsoft Azure managed services solution. The Arinco Managed Services team, Co-Ops, sought a more holistic view of the business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) estate across its customer environments. With Azure Business Continuity Center, Arinco's Co-Ops team no longer needs days to display customers' full BCDR estate and security posture in a single view. It easily onboards customer environments using Azure Lighthouse and helps protect them with Microsoft Defender for Cloud and Microsoft Sentinel. With Azure Business Continuity Center, Arinco’s full business continuity and disaster recovery solution boasts enhanced security, reduced overhead, and improved productivity—helping the team deliver value with fewer resources and less effort.

title: HP embraces GitHub Copilot, boosts software innovation and speed
executive_summary: Wanting to provide more integrated value across its devices, software, and services ecosystem, HP has been transforming its approach to software development—including the developer toolchain, management platforms and applications that support HP’s developer community as it builds solutions to meet the changing needs of modern consumers. To stay competitive, the company wanted to embrace AI and give its developers tools and resources they need to create and collaborate efficiently, unlocking new value and new speed. HP incorporated GitHub Copilot into its workflow, and developers quickly found that they code faster and solve issues more quickly without getting bogged down in tedious code scaffolding and syntax. Since HP embraced GitHub Copilot, its developers say they are feeling more supported and are better able to collaborate—reporting substantial increases in productivity.

title: Floww maximizes its employees productivity with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With 100+ employees, UK-based Floww is taking on the difficult mission of bringing innovators and investors together in a way that focuses on information clarity and sophisticated communication. Its software platform lets both sides find and interact with the other using financial and performance data so investment decisions are based on merit rather than connections or guesswork. Copilot for Microsoft 365 has eased almost every aspect of the highly complex problems Floww’s lean team faces every day, easing content creation, speeding up data analysis and increasing employee efficiency by up to 20%.

title: ESW embraces innovation and more efficient coding with GitHub Copilot
executive_summary: Based in Dublin, Ireland, ESW unlocks cross-border ecommerce success for the world’s best-loved brands. It provides localized checkouts that boost conversion rates, solutions that simplify complex logistics, duties and taxes, and a dedicated client-partner approach that provides data-driven strategies to ensure profitable growth.  As part of its work, the company is looking to empower more than 150 of its developers with AI. After a two-stage trial period, the organization deployed GitHub Copilot, and successfully promoted its adoption through a training program.

title: Seair Exim Solutions delivers data at lightning speed with Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Analytics
executive_summary: Seair Exim Solutions provides export-import trade data to thousands of customers globally. When its specialized data platform, Eximpedia, started slowing down with the increasing volume of data it handled, Seair knew it needed to take action. The company teamed up with Mandelbulb Technologies to migrate its back-end system onto Microsoft Fabric. The move increased data ingestion speed by 90% and added more advanced search and visualization features, creating an even more robust solution that provides fast and reliable insights into the shipping industry.

title: LS ELECTRIC uses data to optimize power consumption with Sight Machine and Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing
executive_summary: LS ELECTRIC, in collaboration with Sight Machine and Microsoft, is revolutionizing manufacturing sustainability and productivity through data optimization. By standardizing unstructured data, LS ELECTRIC gleans detailed insights into energy consumption, leading to a 20% reduction in power use on some manufacturing lines and integrating systems for better decision-making. This partnership drives towards a future of sustainable manufacturing, leveraging Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing and Microsoft Copilot to drive efficiency and competitive operation.

title: Agnostic Intelligence transforms risk management with Azure OpenAI Service, achieving up to 80% time savings
executive_summary: Agnostic Intelligence, a Swiss start-up, developed an AI-based platform to tackle supply chain risks. Using advanced algorithms and machine learning, it provides real-time insights and proactive risk management, addressing cyber-attacks, compliance, and legal risks.

title: Microsoft Finance delivers insights over 60% faster with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Reduced processing times by two-thirds. Reports delivered five hours sooner. Data generation costs were reduced by 50%. Microsoft plans to expand Fabric to 50 more solutions and bring it into Copilot for more insights.

executive_summary: BrabantWonen had concerns with its devices, including security vulnerabilities, poor camera quality, and short battery life. It needed better IT efficiency and manageability. It also wanted zero-touch deployment and a unified, secure device ecosystem.

title: Banco de Crédito del Perú transforms customer experience with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Banco de Crédito del Perú (BCP) needed to innovate to stay competitive by improving the delivery timeline of financial products to its customers, overcoming challenges that included reducing processing time and responding more quickly to customers.
products: Microsoft Power Platform, Power Apps, Dataverse, Power Automate

title: One of the world’s largest data teams, Microsoft IDEAS uses Fabric to usher in new era of AI
executive_summary: In today’s era of AI, brands that don’t invest in cloud and data infrastructures designed to support robust analytics may hinder their innovation and growth. Microsoft itself took action to fortify its future growth and innovation.

title: HERON Group more than doubles client base while reducing costs and effort with Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: HERON Group, a leading energy group in Greece, faced operational challenges as its legacy customer relationship management (CRM) system couldn't support its growing customer base and complex multi-channel journeys.

title: UFA modernizes vital retail and fueling solutions with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: United Farmers of Alberta Co-operative Limited (UFA) is a market-leading agriculture cooperative that provides a variety of products, services, and solutions to its members and customers. With its on-premises SAP infrastructure beginning to cause errors and slow productivity, the organization needed to modernize quickly. With the help of the SAP on Azure experts at Qnovate, UFA moved its SAP landscape to Microsoft Azure in just six weeks. UFA eliminated its performance issues, reduced the time it took to implement new software from weeks to days, and gained the scalability required to expand its SAP footprint.

title: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences relies on Azure and Visual Studio to innovate and increase efficiencies
executive_summary: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences is the world’s preeminent movie-related organization, and it’s best known for its annual awards ceremony, the Oscars®. Much of the organization’s information existed on paper or in isolated on-premises databases. To streamline its IT development and better serve its membership, the Academy migrated its infrastructure to the cloud. Using Microsoft development tools on the Azure cloud platform, the Academy now delivers a rich, responsive online experience to its members across a range of devices.

title: Taking medical instruction remote and to mixed reality at Case Western
executive_summary: When Case Western built a new Health Education Campus, it did so with the understanding that the new campus would house the most advanced medical learning facilities and technology available. Central to this effort is the Sheila and Eric Samson Pavilion, where medical, dental, and nursing students engage in lectures, special speaking events, and cutting-edge education.

title: Asda seamlessly modernized its Scan & Go shopping app using Azure
executive_summary: Asda needed to rebuild its IT infrastructure to separate from Walmart. The grocery retailer, which operates more than 1,000 locations, migrated to Microsoft Azure and modernized its Scan & Go system to drive future business innovation.

title: GEICO turbocharges insurance innovation in the cloud
executive_summary: By adopting a DevOps development strategy and transitioning development to Microsoft Azure, GEICO is working to engage customers more personally and dynamically. With the help of partner Applied Information Sciences, GEICO is moving to the cloud with a focus on increased efficiency, greater application availability, and lower costs.

title: Online retailer uses cloud database to deliver world-class shopping experiences
executive_summary: London-based ASOS is an online fashion retailer on a mission to be the world’s number-one fashion destination for twentysomethings. To support its digital offering, ASOS uses Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB, a scalable, managed database that makes possible such innovations as real-time product recommendations and instant order updates for 15.4 million customers.

title: NEC enhances user experience with 90,000 Azure Virtual Desktop instances
executive_summary: NEC embraced digital transformation upon launching Project RISE in 2018 to create a culture of continuous transformation while modernizing the company’s work style with thin clients, cloud services, and DX. Microsoft solutions empowered the company to overcome limited network bandwidth, inadequate desktop performance, and lengthy lead times.

title: Salud Digna brings peace of mind to its patients with Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: The nonprofit organization has more than 10,500 employees, of which 1,500 are directly impacted by Azure Synapse Analytics. This solution enabled it to provide critical information for collaborative and proactive decision-making through Microsoft Power BI, impacting strategic indicators such as efficiency and quality in patient care and control of each clinic.

title: Gibson Brands streamlines its business and creates an immersive customer experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Gibson Brands, the world’s most iconic guitar brand, was already focused on growing its online presence when COVID-19 necessitated a shift in sales strategy. With the goals of simplifying internal processes and providing a more immersive experience for its customers, Gibson transitioned to the Microsoft Dynamics 365 platform. The decision to transform retail sales was motivated by a desire to meet its customers everywhere they are—whether through retail, direct sales, or a dealer network. Using Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Teams has led to a significant improvement in communications and cross-functional collaboration within the company. Gibson Brands has not only survived but thrived.

title: Jacksonville University creates a data-driven culture with Power BI
executive_summary: Named an “America’s Best College” in the south for more than 10 consecutive years by U.S. News & World Report, Jacksonville University is a premier private institution in northeast Florida. The university recently identified the need to have current data and analytics on areas such as student registrations, retention details, demographics, course evaluations, student engagement, and financials. The institution partnered with Trivium BI and began a shift to become data-driven, replace a lengthy and reactive process for data access, and move to a proactive and rich data culture.

title: HERZ Armatura supports business continuity and growth with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: With a thirty-year history, HERZ Armatura Hungaria is subsidiary of a leading European distributor of valves and fittings. When the ten-person company needed deeper insight into its growing operations and a smarter way to manage products and logistics, it chose Dynamics 365 Business Central. Today,  seamless, rapid data flows and a connected business journey supports the small company’s continued growth and streamlines daily workflows.

title: System infrastructures for data analysis were innovated with Azure Kubernetes Service! What is the “consolidation” at the level of customer experience aimed by Eltes?
executive_summary: Eltes Co., Ltd. utilize its data analysis technology specialized for risk detection to detect signs of digital risks that can possibly harm a company, prevent them in advance and support a company to prepare measures against them. Eltes provides solutions including monitoring of web media such as SNS (risk monitoring) and consultation related to risk measures for responding to digital risks that is constantly being sophisticated. Eltes is also recently involved in security business, as well as supports DX of local governments.

title: Head Start program increases efficiency, empowers hybrid teaching and learning with Surface devices
executive_summary: East Coast Migrant Head Start Project (ECMHSP) has provided high-quality and comprehensive Head Start services to the children of farm workers since 1974. As the program has grown, it’s evolved its IT strategy to focus on cloud-based apps and user-friendly technology. During the COVID-19 pandemic, ECMHSP adopted hundreds of Microsoft Surface devices for its staff and teachers and began to use Microsoft Teams for meetings and collaboration. Teachers seamlessly transitioned to remote work, using Surface to record lessons and post videos online for students. Staff increased efficiency and continued providing important services to the farm worker families that ECMHSP is privileged to serve.

title: Automotive parts manufacturer uses Microsoft 365 to deliver remote working and enterprise information management
executive_summary: The automotive sector is one of the key growth engines of the Chinese economy. As a major parts manufacturer, BWI Group has consistently proven itself as a pioneer in enterprise information management, and it has accumulated extensive experience and expertise. Manufacturing plays a pivotal role in all economies. However, it is also a sector that is experiencing rapid change.

title: Ingage streamlines digital marketing reporting with Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Headquartered in Istanbul, Türkiye, Ingage was founded by Koç Holding and WPP in 2018. Its vision is to provide one-stop-shop digital marketing services to clients. Needing to replace its manual reporting processes with a modern data warehouse and self-service BI platform, Ingage turned to Microsoft Azure for a comprehensive, scalable solution. Now, Ingage has streamlined its own internal reporting and can provide comprehensive, industry-leading data insights to clients at the touch of a button.

title: LoxamHune, first Spanish company in the equipment rental sector to receive official zero carbon footprint certification, relies on Microsoft technology
executive_summary: LoxamHune, the first company in the equipment rental sector to measure its carbon footprint, is firmly committed to continue reducing its impact each year and become a 100% environmentally friendly company.

title: Sensyne Health aids National Health Service in the COVID-19 struggle with Microsoft HPC and AI technologies
executive_summary: When the United Kingdom’s National Health Service envisioned an app that could read COVID-19 tests at scale with an accuracy and speed not possible by human readers, Sensyne Health answered the call. The app connects users to a web service that uses AI to deliver an Azure high-performance computing (HPC) solution that’s adeptly orchestrated with NVIDIA Triton Inference Server on graphics processing units. The result: the incredibly fast and accurate MagnifEye solution.

title: SOS Children’s Villages builds an always-on AI friend for caregivers with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: SOS Children’s Villages helps children in more than 130 countries and offers childcare training to parents and caregivers. When the nonprofit needed to expand training beyond the classroom, it used Microsoft Azure Bot Service and Azure Cognitive Services to build a multilingual digital care assistant. Parents and caregivers now have constant access to instant support, and non-IT staff can easily maintain FAQ content. The nonprofit is scaling the bot to support more languages and communities to help even more parents deliver the healthy, loving care children need.

title: Iberia Express: building better customer experiences with cloud technology
executive_summary: Iberia Express entered into the competitive low-cost airline market in 2012 with a vision of being a major player. Less than a decade on and the company has succeeded in its mission and grown significantly – thanks in no small part to the e-commerce platform the company built on Microsoft Azure. The airline has now developed that architecture further and is using the latest cloud technologies to provide more personalized and immediate experiences for its customers. It is helping to secure a loyal customer base and paving the way for an intelligence-driven future.

title: Zammo brings conversational AI, cross-platform voice apps, and chatbots to customers with Microsoft Azure Cloud Services
executive_summary: Voice technology is experiencing explosive growth. Customers increasingly expect the companies, organizations, and government agencies they interact with to have a voice presence on mobile phones and smart speakers. Zammo, a Microsoft technology partner, uses Azure to make it simple and cost effective for organizations of all sizes to build enterprise-level, cross-platform voice applications with no coding experience.

title: Dow uses vision AI at the edge to boost employee safety and security with Azure
executive_summary: Dow makes safety a priority in everything it does. To help reach the goal of zero safety-related incidents, the technology innovators at the company’s Digital Operations Center built an AI and Internet of Things solution for detecting possible containment leaks within its production environment. Using Microsoft Azure Video Analyzer and other Azure services, the team quickly put in place a sophisticated, flexible, and highly scalable solution that Dow can easily adapt for other computer vision scenarios, such as personal protective equipment (PPE) detection and entrance gate monitoring to further promote safety in the workplace.

title: TRL Krosaki leverages Microsoft Dynamics 365 to improve customer experience
executive_summary: TRL Krosaki is an Integrated Management Systems certified company and is the foremost among refractory manufacturing companies in India. It manufactures a wide range of products such as Basic, Dolomite, High Alumina, Monolithics, Silica, Taphole Clay and RH Snorkel Refractories. The company also provides technical services to customers in the form of Refractories Management Services, Refractories Engineering Services and Technical Support Services. The organization wanted to automate its sales and marketing processes and create a central data repository to make customer-related operations more efficient and effective, and selected Microsoft Dynamics 365 for this purpose. Intech Systems, a Microsoft Gold-Certified partner, helped implement the solution in the organization’s operations.

title: Xoriant streamlines HMEx materials classification via Dynamics 365 platform
executive_summary: HMEx supports architecture, construction, high-tech, and other industries in classifying and managing hazardous materials to meet international fire and building-code compliance. Its HMEx Assistant solution is endorsed by the International Code Council (ICC). The solution assists fire-code officials in validating materials hazards to help ensure firefighter and public safety. Xoriant’s engineering and in-depth industry expertise helped the client transform its legacy application to a software-as-a-service (SaaS) multitenant app that includes features to automate chemical classification and inventory management in compliance with international fire and building codes.

title: Panhuijsen Verpakkingen & ABC E BUSINESS
executive_summary: Panhuijsen Verpakkingen supplies packaging materials and machines. This Tilburg family business has been operating for 117 years, supplying packaging materials to ensure goods get from A to B in excellent condition. But the Panhuijsen Verpakkingen team is well aware that the customer wants more than just deliveries. Their real added value lies in providing packaging advice in the broadest sense of the word. The Panhuijsen Verpakkingen motto is a play on words in the Dutch language, combining the Dutch words for inventory and advice: Panhuijsen, voorRAAD in Verpakkingen.

title: Housing provider Volkshuisvesting Arnhem upskills employees with WorkplaceBuddy in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Michel van Dalen, Information Manager for Volkshuisvesting Arnhem, believed that he and his colleagues could serve their customers better if they could get trained on the latest Microsoft productivity tools. His objectives were to save time and drive efficiency while preparing workers with more up-to-date skill sets. Volkshuisvesting uses Teams to communicate and collaborate, and because WorkplaceBuddy integrates directly into Microsoft Teams, employees don’t have to leave the platform in which they’re already working. WorkplaceBuddy created a custom learning path for Volkshuisvesting, recommending videos relevant to the company as a whole, in addition to each employee in Teams.

title: Thai lingerie company makes sense of production and sales data with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: With a market that extends beyond Thailand into the US, UK, and Europe, Thai lingerie company Sabina realized its need to continue streamlining its operations. The COVID-19 pandemic accelerated Sabina’s transformation journey, and led its people to embrace Microsoft Teams and Azure in their day-to-day activities. Thanks to some adjustments, meetings in Sabina are now shorter, leading to greater efficiencies. Data are also more organized and meaningful, resulting in more accurate forecasts for manufacturing and sales.

title: Tangiblee delivers immersive shopping experiences for retailers with virtual try-on software built on Microsoft Azure technology
executive_summary: Tangiblee, an immersive shopping commerce provider, is using Microsoft Azure to change the way people shop online with a virtual try-on solution. Using Tangiblee, consumers can experience fashion, furnishings, and more from anywhere. Through an innovative approach that uses 2D images, retailers can deploy Tangiblee faster and at lower cost than competitive solutions, increasing conversion rates and reducing costly product returns.

title: Broward College harnesses the power of Azure Machine Learning and responsible AI to increase student retention rate
executive_summary: Broward College is committed to the long-term success of its community. The nationally recognized public college wanted to harness the power of its data to better understand student pathways, with the goal of increasing its student retention rate. Using Azure Machine Learning and responsible AI, the organization identified five key predictors of student attrition, leading to data-driven, actionable strategies to help more Broward College students transform their lives and reach their goals.

title: Storebrand ASA transforms asset management with unified, cloud-based identity governance
executive_summary: Storebrand is a Nordic financial group, delivering increased security and financial wellness for people and companies. Storebrand has about 40.000 corporate customers, 2 million individual customers and manages NOK 1.009 billion. As Storebrand’s cloud footprint expanded, it needed to improve access to cloud resources with adequate controls and monitoring without affecting productivity. And because of the inherent complexity of its hyperconnected digital workspace, managing multiple user access rights as various applications enter its environment was a challenge. It deployed Microsoft Azure Active Directory Identity Governance to enable identity and access management capabilities that also enhanced productivity. As a result, the company reduced the identity and access auditing cycle from months to days for the currently onboarded applications and created more user-friendly self-service access reviews and entitlement management capabilities with cloud-based applications.

title: Queensland Department of Education enhances endpoint security for more than 650,000 students and staff
executive_summary: The Queensland Department of Education (QDoE) has always been focused on child safety, which includes ensuring that its information and technology systems are secure. As part of this commitment, it sought a better solution to protect its 257,000 shared devices and 14,000 servers across the state.

title: Pegasus uses Microsoft Unified services to provide uninterrupted service
executive_summary: Pegasus, which is one of the major airlines of Europe with 600 flights every day while it's annual number of passengers reaching 30 million, uses Microsoft Unified Support & Maintenance service in order to reach best support services in the IT infrastructure with fast response times and resolutions in the shortest period of time.

title: Virtual inspections enhance security of the energy supply: E.ON inspects power lines with drones and artificial intelligence based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Walk, climb, inspect, note, repair: this is the classic procedure for power line maintenance. Much of this work is done manually and requires a huge amount of effort; therefore, it was sensible to see whether it can be made more efficient and safer using digital solutions. To minimize risks while fulfilling its responsibility to supply households in Germany with electricity, E.ON sends up drones to take photos of power poles and lines. These photos are uploaded to Microsoft Azure and transferred to Grid Vision®, an AI-supported inspection tool supplied by eSmart Systems, which evaluates the images—thus making the maintenance process more efficient and safer.

title: Drone Express uses Azure Machine Learning to train drones to make safe autonomous deliveries to customers’ front doors
executive_summary: Logistics company Drone Express is using Microsoft AI to make drone deliveries possible without the need for constant human observation. The company, which is tracking to be one of the first to attain FAA certification for truly autonomous drone deliveries, uses mesh network–powered drones to bring groceries and supplies to customers’ homes. Landscapes change and objects move, so drones must make split-second decisions to safely deliver packages. Drone Express chose to adopt Microsoft Azure to host its AI solutions and AutoML for computer vision in Azure Machine Learning to train its machine learning models. The company is now preparing to launch autonomous drone deliveries and expand sustainable, safe, and cost-effective last-mile drone deliveries to urban areas.

title: Business Central allows Canvas Worldwide to mitigate its financial exposure
executive_summary: Migrating from its on-premises finance system to Business Central provided all the benefits of the Microsoft cloud including reduced costs, regular upgrades, better security, and reduced risks. VetaTek integrated it tightly with the media buying system from Mediaocean and tailored it to meet the unique needs of its finance team. A “Sequential Liability” process was created to streamline the timing of cash receipts and the sequence of payments to vendors. A cash flow report in Power BI providing timely and accurate understanding of its liability to vendors. This helped Canvas to greatly mitigate its financial exposure.

title: IPLAND helps top brands score in-store sales with Microsoft Azure AutoML
executive_summary: IPLAND helps major fast-moving consumer goods companies optimize their products’ on-shelf presence. Its Image Recognition (IR) service analyzes photos of store shelves, extracting and surfacing critical performance data to help fine-tune retail displays. When a rapidly growing customer base drove the company to find more scalable solutions, IPLAND updated its IR service to take advantage of Microsoft Azure Automated Machine Learning. This updated and refined solution has improved image recognition speed and data collection, creating a future-ready service that can scale up in a cost-effective manner.

title: NHS makes data more discoverable using Azure Cognitive Search to save clinician’s time
executive_summary: “This problem is not unique to our Trust,” states Jonathon Artingstall, Associate Director Information & Performance at Cambridgeshire and Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust. “We’ve taken lots of data in all shapes and formats from different systems and put it into a cloud storage solution so it can be used today. Who knows what lies in those 23 years of data? Now we have the capability to explore that.”

title: Stantec uses Azure to build a digital innovation platform with real-world impact
executive_summary: Stantec is a global leader in sustainable design and engineering with an impressive track record of success in large-scale infrastructure and facilities projects. Supplementing its expertise in real-world projects, the company is charting an innovative path into the future, focusing on digital transformation, technology services, and data built on Microsoft Azure.

title: From customer contact to accounting: Dynamics 365 Business Central helps RECARO Gaming manage data with ease
executive_summary: RECARO Gaming GmbH & Co. KG is an expert for high-quality gaming and eSport chairs. The former gaming start-up has now established itself internationally as a premium provider, which presents its corporate IT with certain challenges: getting each gaming chair to the customer involves different partners, systems, and interfaces, while the many process steps and the sheer amount of coordination required make for complex workflows. So, with a view to reducing tool discontinuities, increasing transparency in data and processes, and integrating new sales channels and markets, RECARO Gaming made Dynamics 365 Business Central the linchpin of its centralized ERP landscape.

title: Experience management platform Pisano uses Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Pisano, the experience management platform, delivers its cloud services to more than 60 customers in more than 20 countries. Moving its cloud services to Microsoft Azure a while ago, the company used Azure's tools to facilitate the transition.

title: ​​Hokkoku Bank reimagines banking innovation, saves 10 percent on costs with Azure and the Microsoft Cloud​
executive_summary: Hokkoku Bank needed to modernize and keep pace with technological advances, but as a regional bank, its resources were limited. The bank laid the initial groundwork for modernization by moving its entire on-premises estate to Windows Server. This created a seamless path to full cloud transformation on Microsoft Azure. Currently, most of the bank’s operations run on Azure, and it plans to move to a fully cloud-based estate. By adopting a wide range of Azure solutions, Hokkoku Bank has been able to stay competitive, reduce infrastructure costs, and streamline processes for greater efficiency.

title: VK Industries harnesses digital transformation with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: ​​Intapp and Microsoft deliver AI-based solutions built on Azure to financial and professional services firms​
executive_summary: Financial and professional services firms represent a $3 trillion market. General software solutions don’t adequately address the needs of these firms. With their complex relationships, partner-led operations, and compliance and regulatory mandates, they require purpose-built cloud solutions. This is where Intapp, a key global Microsoft partner, and its unique software as a service offering steps in. Since its inception more than 20 years ago, the company has been developing solutions for the specialized needs of these firms’ dealmakers, bankers, lawyers, accountants, and consultants.

title: Aprimo launches first ChatGPT within Azure OpenAI DAM integration, giving marketers enhanced, scalable automation
executive_summary: Aprimo develops and sells marketing automation software and digital asset management (DAM) technology to support enterprise marketing and customer experience teams. With a solution that is 100 percent on Azure, Aprimo is dedicated to delivering helpful, cutting-edge SaaS (software as a service) solutions to help modern brands bring powerful, omnichannel customer experiences to life, at scale. Aprimo focused on creating an embedded generative AI assistant using Azure OpenAI Service and ChatGPT to develop the solution and address specific use cases, such as accelerating the creation and delivery of concise, engaging, and personalized content that is trained on a customer’s brand voice and tone. The company hopes that with an embedded generative AI assistant customers can create more concise, engaging, and personalized content.

title: TMI Systems’ Verto 365 harnesses the power of the commercial marketplace to scale and reach new markets
executive_summary: Verto 365 is a collaborative workplace management solution from TMI Systems. This nimble UK-based company of 20 is using the Microsoft commercial marketplace and ISV Success to make huge strides in expanding transactable offers, increasing scalability, and reaching new geographies. By taking advantage of specific ISV Success benefits and working closely with Bytes, a UK-based cloud service provider, the team behind Verto 365 has accelerated its Microsoft Teams integration and time to market.

title: Spanish telco builds digital assistant based on natural language bot, engages customers on new level
executive_summary: To change how it engages with customers, the multinational telco Telefonica used Microsoft Azure Bot Service and Cognitive Services to build and support Aura, an intelligent conversational agent for multiple services. With Aura, Telefonica customers can manage their products and services with the company, get real-time support, or just change the TV channel, all through natural voice interaction and personalized user experience. Telefonica used Microsoft AI technology to meet its deadlines, reduce development cost and effort, move customer loyalty to a new level, and generate new business opportunities.

title: DeepBrain AI turns to Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service and Azure Cognitive Services to power its groundbreaking AI-charged avatars
executive_summary: Founded in 2016 by Eric Seyoung Jang, DeepBrain AI has been on a mission to design AI that helps people be the most creative and meaningful versions of themselves. Based out of Palo Alto, California, DeepBrain AI supports customers around the globe with its groundbreaking AI solutions across several industries, including finance, commerce, retail, education, and media. Now, with the power of Azure AI solutions and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), DeepBrain AI can supercharge its offerings to bring its customers exciting new capabilities.

title: Datadog enhances AI application monitoring with Microsoft
executive_summary: Organizations are adapting cutting-edge technology to support their growing customer base. With AI at the forefront, there are more innovative ways to build, use, and monitor AI-based applications to scale their businesses. Once these apps are built, organizations depend on the AI solution to continuously run smoothly so that they can optimize costs and find new ways to help customers. However, these applications demand routine maintenance to perform business-critical tasks, which can take time away from focusing on the customer’s needs. One organization created an integration with Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service to solve this problem to alleviate mundane work processes, like performance monitoring and compute optimization, to focus on product development that drives the future forward.

title: Coşkunöz Metal Form develops applications for business processes with Microsoft Power App
executive_summary: Coşkunöz Metal Form, one of Türkiye's largest companies in the automotive sector, is developing their own applications with Microsoft Power Apps to digitalize their business processes. Barış Karaadak, the General Manager of Coşkunöz Metal Form, stated that they have implemented more than 110 projects in their digitalization journey, with 46 of them using Microsoft Power Platform and providing significant benefits.

title: Rowan University faculty boost instruction time by up to 50% with reliable Microsoft Azure architecture
executive_summary: Rowan University (Rowan), a rapidly expanding public university in New Jersey, modernized its IT infrastructure and adopted a cloud-smart strategy that showcases how colleges and universities can boost accessibility, affordability, reliability, and security. As Rowan embraces a cloud-based architecture with Microsoft Azure, the university is providing seamless IT services to students and faculty alike. Some professors estimate that they have up to 50% more time for instruction due to improved infrastructure. Rowan sees its collaboration with Microsoft as a long-term partnership, and the university plans to expand its IT solutions to include emerging technologies like AI.

title: KPMG to revolutionize productivity with Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: For nearly a decade, KPMG Australia has used AI technologies to increase the efficiency, accuracy, and quality of a range of data discovery tasks. Seeing the potential of generative AI to further enhance its services, the firm tested offerings from multiple vendors before deciding to build a proof of concept of its ESG Comply AI platform using Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Search, and Copilot for Microsoft 365. Guided by natural language prompts that subject matter experts enter, the compliance checker performs advanced text analysis of dozens of client source documents to identify full or partial compliance, or noncompliance, in a fraction of the time required for manual assessments. The organization is looking to use Comply AI and Copilot to transform how employees work by expediting data discovery, automating time-consuming administrative tasks, and enhancing collaboration with clients and coworkers.

title: SdNcenter and Ascensia deliver online diabetes support globally with Azure
executive_summary: Diabetes care is stepping into the future, and SdNcenter is leading the charge alongside partner Ascensia. By developing GlucoContro.online together with a leading diabetes care company, SdNcenter has given healthcare providers online updates on blood sugar levels, exercise, and diet of people with diabetes. This rich data is empowering health professionals to provide data-backed and life-altering recommendations. Ascensia’s world-leading diabetes portfolio and SdNcenter's scalable digital solution, powered by Microsoft Azure, has created a seamless, interconnected healthcare ecosystem within the market serving over 150 million people with diabetes.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure SignalR Service, Microsoft Entra ID Governance, Power BI

title: PayU GPO verifies customers faster with AU10TIX’s Azure-based solution
executive_summary: In financial services where milliseconds matter, PayU Global Payment Organization (GPO) took a decisive step to accelerate its customer onboarding. PayU provides payment solutions for over 450,000 merchants and counting. Hence, the need for a swift and error-proof identity verification workflow is high. That’s where AU10TIX came into play. The firm boosted PayU's Know-Your-Customer (KYC) process with its Microsoft Azure-based Identity Verification (IDV) solution. ID verification has been reduced to an average of six seconds, making the entire process more efficient and customer-friendly. The partnership also brought scalability, enabling PayU GPO to smoothly manage influxes of new customers in the most intense periods with Azure's flexible infrastructure.

title: Full steam ahead to a digital future: The Flurina chatbot based on Azure OpenAI Services
executive_summary: Rhaetian Railway (RhB) has a long and illustrious tradition. Not least thanks to the spectacular routes it covers, it commands deep international respect: Customers from around the globe plan their trips on the Bernina and/or Glacier Express months in advance. Yet in light of this long-standing tradition and such high esteem, the company is naturally responsible for looking ahead in good time and charting its course to a successful future. RhB has therefore set itself the goal of being a technological pioneer in the rail space. Armed with a comprehensive innovation and digitalization strategy, it is seeking robust answers to the most pressing challenges of our time. One concrete example is the AI chatbot Flurina, which RhB developed in collaboration with Microsoft partner ParetoLabs. Based on Microsoft Azure OpenAI, the chatbot complements RhB’s existing service channels while also easing the burden on human staff.

title: Together, DataRobot and Microsoft Azure unlock the power of generative AI for their customers
executive_summary: For data scientists, solving use cases can be a laborious process. DataRobot empowers them to use data in a way that is more accessible and easier to understand. DataRobot deployed on Microsoft Azure is a solution that saves data scientists time and effort to ultimately improve workflows.

title: World Bank invests in greater efficiency and security with Microsoft Azure Arc
executive_summary: The World Bank is working tirelessly to end extreme poverty and boost prosperity on a livable planet. To achieve its mission, the organization offers lending services in developing countries around the world. The institution’s IT and Information Security Office teams were using a duplicative decentralized solution for network monitoring and management. Recognizing an opportunity to improve efficiency and reduce costs, World Bank replaced their existing technology stack with a new solution based on Azure Arc. The centralized, single pane of glass solution has greatly improved efficiency and security while reducing operating costs.

title: City of Lokeren uses Microsoft Security to drive operational efficiency and optimization
executive_summary: The City of Lokeren is a Belgian municipality tasked with providing essential services to the 50,000 people who live there. The city has invested in a modernization project aimed at creating a flexible and modern workplace for its employees to thrive in as they focus on providing these essential services. Centered around Microsoft’s cloud and security solutions, the project has radically transformed working habits and culture at the municipality. It is also playing a crucial role in the City’s wider goal: to provide more and better services for its growing community.

title: MediaKind improves video delivery in minutes with move to Azure
executive_summary: MediaKind knows that media workloads are compute and egress intensive and often rely on on-premises equipment. It wanted to move to the cloud for current and future innovation and to extract value from existing content and ways of consuming media.

title: Wrtn rewrites the next generation of its consumer-enabling superapp with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: South Korean startup Wrtn Technologies is transforming everyday life with its AI "superapp," designed to enhance productivity, entertainment, and emotional connections.

title: Gojob augments recruiters with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Specializing in temporary work recruitment, Gojob is banking on generative AI to transform the daily work of its recruiters and speed up the jobseeker hiring process.

title: Microsoft 365 Copilot: How mci group is embracing AI
executive_summary: mci group plans to expand the use of innovative technologies to deliver better data-driven solutions, improve collaboration, and boost operational effectiveness among employees, thereby better supporting them in their work.

title: Louisiana State Government boosts efficiency, visibility, and security with Azure Arc
executive_summary: When Louisiana State Government consolidated IT for all its divisions and entities, it wanted observability across its entire estate, on-premises and in the cloud. It adopted Microsoft Azure Arc for maximum visibility, control, and efficiencies.

title: Arla Foods uses Azure OpenAI Service to help its staff create recipe collections
executive_summary: Arla Sweden was looking for ways to ensure that its online database of nearly 6,500 food recipes continued to be relevant to the tastes of its audience—ultimately attracting more traffic and delivering relevant content.

title: Properstar revolutionizes real estate searches with Microsoft Azure services
executive_summary: Properstar was looking for a solution to simplify the analysis of unstructured real estate data and create a dynamic, AI-powered filtering system that would provide more nuanced search results.

title: Cincinnati Children’s makes tough times easier with family-friendly mobile app
executive_summary: Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center is well known for the excellence of its care and its commitment to the well-being of the families it serves. To reduce strain for parents and make their lives easier, the hospital created the Caren mobile app using Microsoft Azure and Azure services. Parents turn to Caren for help navigating the hospital, to get answers to their questions, and to help them entertain their children. Using the app lets parents focus more on their families and less on stressful details.

title: LaLiga boosts fan engagement with multiple digital channels and conversational AI
executive_summary: The Madrid-based Spanish football (soccer) organization LaLiga has hundreds of millions of fans around the world. LaLiga fans are passionate about the game, and the league is passionate about making it as fun as possible for them. To do this, LaLiga developed a digital innovation platform based on Microsoft Azure. The league now creates websites and apps that help fans enjoy the game in new ways, including a voice-based personal digital assistant that helps fans learn more about players, teams, and the LaLiga fantasy league through conversational AI. With a robust digital experience for fans, LaLiga can quickly develop, deploy, and scale its innovations—continually elevating its brand identity.

title: Lowell improves customer interactions and delivers better client outcomes with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: As one of the largest credit management services in Europe, Lowell wants credit to work better for everybody. So, it works hard to make every consumer interaction as painless as possible. But a complicated debt-collection framework in Norway kept the company’s highly trained credit counselors too busy with consumer inquiries, posing challenges for bringing in timely payments. Lowell turned to Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services to create an AI-enabled chatbot that now handles 40 percent of all inquiries—making it easier for service agents to deliver greater value to consumers and better outcomes for Lowell clients.

title: BBC innovates how it delivers trusted news and entertainment with Azure AI
executive_summary: As one of the world’s oldest and largest global news and entertainment broadcasters, the BBC has built its reputation by delivering high-quality journalism with integrity to global audiences. It was looking for a strong partner that could help it build its own custom-branded voice assistant—but it needed full control over the experience, the customer relationship, and its customers’ data. With Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services and Azure Bot Service, the BBC created an end-to-end, customized digital voice assistant that captures its brand identity and helps establish a new conversational relationship with its many audiences.

title: Mitie provides facility management of the future with AI, ML and IoT technology in the Azure cloud
executive_summary: Mitie is the number one facilities management company in the UK, employing 50,000 people and supporting services through which about 5 million people a day pass through.

title: YunTech’s move to Azure positions the school and its students for continued innovation
executive_summary: YunTech needed a cloud solution that could handle high-traffic periods such as course registration while also solving system interruptions caused by power outages.

title: YoungWilliams cuts call center response time 99% with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service
executive_summary: High call center turnover, complex inquiries, and growing security risks slow government service delivery. YoungWilliams needed an AI solution to improve its efficiency, advance service quality, and help ensure compliance.
products: Azure AI Agent Service, Azure AI Model Catalog, Azure AI Foundry, Azure AI Search, Bing Search APIs, Power BI, Azure OpenAI Service

title: HEINEKEN unites data and global teams with AI assistant fueled by Azure AI Foundry
executive_summary: HEINEKEN’s disconnected data silos slowed insights and affected employee productivity and innovation. The company realized that creating an AI assistant could help employees gain fast access to data and tools.

title: From idea to orbit: Terra Mater Studios builds Hera AI companion with Azure data, AI
executive_summary: Terra Mater Studios envisioned an AI platform enabling public interaction with ESA’s Hera spacecraft, a planetary defense mission investigating asteroid deflection methods to protect Earth and promote long-term sustainability.

title: Somerset Council employees save 10 hours per month with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Somerset Council aims to improve public services amidst funding reductions and changes in policy.

title: From clinic to home: Neuroblast transforms neurorehabilitation with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Marija Grujic, co-founder of Neuroblast, was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis after giving birth. She attended neurorehabilitation clinics but found them costly and the exercises repetitive and demotivating.

title: JLL transforms real estate with Azure AI Services, delivering a year’s worth of insights in a week
executive_summary: Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL) helps its clients manage, lease, and invest in real estate. JLL’s business intelligence solutions varied in scale and applicability, resulting in inconsistent client experiences and dependence on costly data processes.

title: The Royal Horticultural Society cultivates a greater love of gardening through Dynamics 365 and Azure
executive_summary: The UK's Royal Horticultural Society (RHS) grows a passion for gardening and contributes to vital horticultural research. It needed a way to consolidate and leverage data, and to personalize interactions with members, to continue to inspire the community.

title: Lavender Confectionery & Bakery halves weekly planning time with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Lavender Confectionery & Bakery wanted to make use of data to understand its customers’ needs, allowing it to more effectively manage stock levels and reduce food waste.

title: Delta Dental of California transforms claims processing with Azure Local, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
executive_summary: Delta Dental of California needed to move off an aging operating system, shift its critical payor system to a containerized application, and build the foundation for a more efficient business. It wanted to explore the cloud but keep some data on-premises.

title: Wemex Uses Azure OpenAI to Create SOAP Text for Medication History Input in 10 Secs
executive_summary: Wemex offers medication history solutions for pharmacies to support the Ministry of Health's initiative. Manual input by pharmacists was inefficient, and templates failed due to patient-specific needs. AI opened a new path for solutions.

title: JATO Dynamics uses Azure to revolutionize automotive sales
executive_summary: To further support customers, JATO Dynamics wanted to create a reporting tool to offer car dealerships insights into their own performance compared to the market, including metrics like sales price, discount rates, and feature popularity.

title: Microsoft Power Platform transforms engagement center process to deliver faster impact for animal health
executive_summary: Patterson Companion Animal Health Division provides everything a veterinarian needs to run their business and help their furry and non-furry patients. This includes sourcing specially requested items, which was a manual and inconsistent process. The process ultimately led to SKU proliferation, dead stock, and inflated inventory levels. Microsoft Power Automate generates emails throughout the process, proactively providing status, helpful details, and final decision. Mapping the process highlighted opportunities for improvement that were addressed and automated. This has reduced the number of items being set up unnecessarily—saving time and ongoing maintenance.

title: Ensuring true sustainability in renewable energy production
executive_summary: SSE Renewables is a leading developer and operator of renewable energy across the UK and Ireland. With a portfolio of around 4GW of onshore wind, offshore wind and hydro, the company has a key role in helping the UK reach its sustainability and net zero carbon goals.

title: Slovakian company PosAm makes car parking easier with Azure-based mobile app
executive_summary: If you’re a driver, chances are you know the struggle of finding a parking lot in a crowded urban area. Slovakian software provider, PosAm, came up with a solution. The company's smart parking app, ParkDots, is used each day to optimize parking for more than 21,000 drivers. Connected to IoT sensors, it reduces the time it takes to park while helping parking operators manage occupancy and enforce fee collection. The app is hosted entirely in Microsoft Azure for easy workflow management, fast service deployment, and scalability.

title: Real estate investment trust Host Hotels transforms data into actionable business insights using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Host Hotels & Resorts’ IT team faced the efficiency and cost-benefit challenges of an outdated datacenter running legacy software. The infrastructure needed constant maintenance to stay current with the latest security and compliance specifications for a publicly traded Fortune 500 company. The decision to switch to Microsoft Azure cloud services has been a gamechanger. The organization has achieved major gains in resiliency, security and compliance, in addition to remote work capability. And Host’s IT team has been freed up to contribute to the company’s bottom line by providing critical, real-time data that informs business decisions and keeps the organization ahead of its competition.

title: Reinsure globally, analyze locally: Munich Re relies on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As a leading global provider of reinsurance, Munich Re needs to maintain a clear view of the risk situation and trends worldwide. As such, big data analyses on a grand scale are nothing new for the company. However, restrictive laws on data storage around the world were presenting challenges. At the same time, Munich Re was seeking to further increase its rate of innovation and operate in even closer proximity to its global customers by spreading its in-house analytics know-how more widely. This is why Munich Re moved its data analyses to the Microsoft Azure Cloud.

title: Knowledge shared is knowledge doubled: Tandemploy’s solutions ensure knowledge transfer among employees thanks to Azure Kubernetes Service
executive_summary: “Generation Streaming” wants to consume content when and how it wants: on demand, fast, and simple. It also wants the experience to be enjoyable. The same goes for learning processes. These days, the only way to achieve efficient knowledge transfer within a company is through tailored, engaging content, that puts the employee front and center. Tandemploy, a company based in Berlin, offers the ideal solution: software that allows each company to design its own “talent marketplace.” The technological basis for mentoring, finding experts, arranging lunch dates, and a whole lot more is provided by Microsoft Azure and Azure Kubernetes Service.

title: Mitie: Leveraging Microsoft Azure for the Modern Workplace
executive_summary: Mitie is one of the UK's leading facilities management and professional services companies. It manages and maintains some of the nation's most recognised landmarks from its headquarters in London’s Shard. With the goal of helping its customers be exceptional every day, the award-winning business is currently supporting organisations across the UK to return to the workplace safely, productively and efficiently following the disruption of COVID-19.

title: AutoZubak increases productivity and user experience through Power Platform
executive_summary: Movens fleet management service is an innovative solution of AutoZubak – a leading motor vehicles sale and maintenance company. AutoZubak Movens is responsible for selling, renting, and maintaining cars nationwide through a network of its eight branches. By implementing solutions for automated bid creation, price calculation, contract creation and monitoring the use of contract services via Power Platform and Dynamics 365 solutions, AutoZubak has upgraded its sales and after-sales processes within the Movens service. This way, sales work processes are shortened from days to minutes, a comprehensive rental management portal for customers is launched, and at the same time greater employee engagement is achieved.

title: Grant Thornton gives customers secure access to personalized finance insights with Azure Active Directory B2C and Power BI embedded analytics
executive_summary: Professional services firm Grant Thornton knew that finance insights from Microsoft Power BI could prove valuable to its customers. The question was how to give them secure access to its customer portal and also make sure those insights were tailored to a client’s sector and particular interests. The firm implemented Azure Active Directory B2C, part of Microsoft Entra, and wrote user policies that enabled it to offer that secure access. In the process, the firm gave employees beyond the IT team the ability to administer client access.

title: Emirates Group creates digital, accessible workplace for employees
executive_summary: Using technology to improve its processes is not new to Emirates Group. The group includes the largest airline and flag carrier of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and one of the world’s largest air services providers, dnata. Having Microsoft as a trusted partner for years, Emirates decided to take the next step in their digitalization journey and focus on productivity, collaboration and communication capabilities for its employees. It used Microsoft 365, the Power Platform, and Azure and established a powerful and productive digital workplace.

title: Meratus optimizes operations with Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Meratus is Indonesia’s leading integrated maritime and logistics company. In 2018, the company set out on a digital transformation journey to increase internal efficiency and improve workplace agility. It has since implemented Microsoft cloud solutions across various business processes. As a result, Meratus has enabled workplace mobility, cut performance complaints, and reduced infrastructure costs significantly.

title: Jane Goodall Institute uses AI to unlock research potential with MediaValet and Azure
executive_summary: For more than six decades, Dr. Jane Goodall and her research team have studied chimpanzees. In 1977, she founded the Jane Goodall Institute (JGI) to help understand and protect chimps and work with local people to restore and protect the shared environment around them. Digitizing field research materials took a lot of manual effort and time. In December 2020, JGI started collaborating with Microsoft and Microsoft Partner Network member MediaValet to aggregate, connect, and preserve multiple data sets spanning six decades of research. Now, JGI uses AI and MediaValet to automatically tag assets with specific metadata and make assets widely available to researchers.

title: Major agricultural producer speeds up brand transformation via citizen development and automation
executive_summary: MHP is the largest poultry and grain producer in Ukraine, selling its goods in 80 countries around the world. Recently, MHP decided to transform into a culinary company with an emphasis on ready-to-eat food. To support the massive change, MHP sped up its digital transformation with Microsoft Teams and Power Platform. As a result of a citizen development program, a group of non-IT employees started automating and enhancing daily business processes, which they shared with their colleagues. Some even got formally certified in Power Platform technology too, having passed respective certification examination by Microsoft. The company has also engaged more field workers in digital interactions, saving time and increasing job satisfaction.

title: Idaho Transportation Department provides cutting-edge safety and mobility services with systems powered by Microsoft Dynamics
executive_summary: The Idaho Transportation Department (ITD) launched a comprehensive initiative in 2016 to address the limitations of applications running on its decades-old mainframe infrastructure. The department required a more scalable system to support operations for the state’s expanding population, and the key services provided by the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) – driver’s licenses and vehicle registrations, titles, and license plates – needed to be modernized. Considering factors like integration with existing systems and data security requirements, ITD decided to implement Microsoft Dynamics CRM to transform its DMV applications. Service delivery is now more streamlined, applications are more efficient, and data is more secure.

title: ZEISS accelerates cloud-first development on Azure and streamlines order processing
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Microsoft Core Marketing Engineering turns audiences into customers with Dynamics 365 Marketing
executive_summary: The Core Marketing Engineering unit at Microsoft runs the marketing events platform. It wanted to enhance capabilities and reduce operational complexity around in-person and digital events. The business unit adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing and used the event marketing capabilities to create a centralized portal to easily track event details. Now its marketers offer engaging attendee experiences for in-person events and for digital events with Microsoft Teams. With a dedication to using technology to support events, the unit increased event scalability, lowered costs, and generated a significant increase in leads.

title: AGC gains scalability by migrating complex SAP environment to Azure with the help of KochaSoft
executive_summary: The AGC Group, a major global glass manufacturer, wanted to transition from on-premises hardware to infrastructure on Microsoft Azure, which would improve cost efficiency and provide scalability benefits. AGC’s presence in Europe and Japan meant its migration to the cloud needed to be handled with the utmost care. When AGC evaluated Azure partners that would help with an on-time, on-budget infrastructure build, KochaSoft stood out. KochaSoft migrated AGC’s datacenters and conducted a wide range of related work, improving security and outfitting AGC for an even stronger market position.

title: Global bank deploys Microsoft 365 data connectors for more secure, compliant use of popular apps
executive_summary: The Microsoft 365 open, extensible compliance ecosystem helped financial services leader BTG Pactual take secure, compliant advantage of productivity-boosting social media apps in the workplace. Using TeleMessage data connectors, the bank’s Microsoft 365 platform was able to ingest data from WhatsApp within a month in a highly safe and secure manner, making the data available to its compliance administrators. There are dozens of connectors in the Microsoft 365 compliance center catalog that can open up popular devices, applications, and services for adoption.

title: Transformation to serve the community
executive_summary: Southend-on-Sea is a vibrant town on the Thames estuary in Essex, south-east England. The local borough council delivers services and support to nearly 200,000 residents and nearly 6,000 local businesses. Despite the wonderful seaside location, culture and history, the region has a need to transform and the borough council has developed, in collaboration with residents and businesses across the community, it’s Southend 2050 ambitions. These include the transition of Southend to become a leading smart city.

title: Zooniverse’s move to Azure enhances citizen science
executive_summary: Zooniverse is the world’s largest platform for people-powered research. In 2020, based on a desire to do more with Microsoft from a research perspective, the development team at Zooniverse moved its platform from Amazon Web Services (AWS) to Microsoft Azure. The Zooniverse platform is now more cohesive, with more consistent performance and less downtime. Less time is required for day-to-day operational tasks and new code can be deployed much more quickly, leaving the development team with more time to support new feature development and additional platform improvements.

title: Empowering a community of low-code, no-code developers to enhance fire service operations
executive_summary: Each of the 50 or so fire services in the UK has its own specialist skills and competencies tailored to the communities and geographies it serves. As a result, there isn’t a full suite of off-the-shelf solutions that can meet the varied needs of a service like Hampshire & Isle of Wight. The fire service began to look for low-code and no-code solutions that might allow it to achieve these quick wins rapidly. Initially, it tested Microsoft PowerApps by using what was available through the service’s existing Microsoft 365 licencing. It streamlined numerous documents and manual processes into a single app with clear reporting.

title: Procter & Gamble moves some mission-critical manufacturing to the cloud with Azure Ultra Disk Storage
executive_summary: With operations across 70 countries, Procter & Gamble was looking to move a critical app, housed in on-premises servers, to the cloud.
