The move would provide factories in less accessible regions equal access to mission-critical manufacturing data. However, finding a cloud-based solution that could match the throughput speeds of its on-premises servers proved challenging. Adopting Microsoft Azure Ultra Disk Storage, Procter & Gamble could meet or exceed its needs while simultaneously gaining the scalability, agility, and security of the cloud.

title: Peet’s Coffee meets market changes with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Peet’s Coffee, founded in California in 1966, prides itself on providing customers with the highest quality craft coffee and tea. You can stop by a Peet’s Coffee shop for a cup, or purchase Peet’s products in the supermarket and online—from whole beans to K-cups to capsules and more—to brew at home.

title: Dynea - MSC - Microsoft Dynamics improves the quality of information and streamlines production for Dynea
executive_summary:
Dynea are working hard and purposefully with inspirit365 to achieve an optimal standardized Dynamics solution, in other words, to take advantage of Microsoft's state-of-the-art solutions. Dynea has chosen to use standardized, proven processes instead of adapting the system to Dynea’s own procedures.
Together with increased automation of production and processes, the new ERP system will contribute to further quality improvement and better traceability associated with the individual assets in Dynea's products.

title: Innovative cloud technology consultancy LAB3 chooses Microsoft Security platform for itself and its customers
executive_summary: Trusted IT consultant and Microsoft Gold partner LAB3 specializes in cloud-forward IT solutions for enterprise and government clients. So it makes sense that its own infrastructure can serve as an example for customers looking for their own state of the art security and compliance solution. LAB3 chose technology from Microsoft Security, protecting its internal production and development networks with Microsoft Defender extended detection and response tools, and including orchestrated organization-wide security information and event management (SIEM) from Microsoft Sentinel.

title: LBV modernizes supporter relationship management via Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The LBV (Landesbund für Vogelschutz in Bayern e. V.) is a nature conservation association that relies on fundraising and volunteers in its focus on the preservation of biodiversity. As their supporter network grew, managing it became increasingly challenging, a problem that was aggravated by its aging and increasingly inefficient IT solution. To solve this challenge, proMX developed a customized, scalable platform solution for fundraising. proMX experts improved the LBV's engagement with supporters, facilitated donation management, and enabled the visualization of business data for easier interpretation, further saving the LBV valuable time.
products: Dynamics 365, Dataverse for Teams, Power BI

title: Improved decision-making streamlines operations for PJS Global
executive_summary: PJS Global is a diversified business conglomerate managing operations across more than 30 countries in Asia, Middle East, and Africa. With over 15 years experience, the business specializes in commodity trading of agriculture, metal and petrochemicals; with business activities spanning across manufacturing, trading, distribution, logistics and corporate farming. PJS Global needed a unified solution to track transactions being made in different countries and in different currencies in real time. Dynamics 365 proved the perfect application to help them transform and enable their core business activities and make the right decisions, at the right time.

title: Everseen and NVIDIA create seamless shopping experience that benefits the bottom line
executive_summary: Shrinkage, or inventory loss, is a major problem that large retailers and grocers deal with every day. According to the National Retail Federation (NRF), the retail industry is losing more than $61 billion a year in North America alone. And it’s only getting worse—more than 23 percent of retailers have seen their shrink rate increase from 1.8 to 2 percent. So, if you have a $20 billion grocery retailer, with the industry shrink rate average, the company’s US business would have lost more than $4 billion a year to theft and other related losses.

title: St. Luke’s delivers exceptional, scalable service for providers and patients with Epic on Azure
executive_summary: St. Luke’s University Health Network has gained a reputation for using innovative technology to deliver services to patients and streamline operational procedures for employees. After beginning a cloud transformation by moving IT resources to Microsoft Azure, St. Luke’s embarked on a migration of its critically important Epic healthcare system. Through careful planning and a phased approach, it has successfully migrated 20 of 20 Epic environments to Azure. St. Luke’s benefits from its new platform’s increased scalability and the agility to quickly respond to acquisitions, upgrades, and changes in the healthcare market.

title: Cerved Group reimagines hybrid work with Microsoft Teams and YAROOMS
executive_summary: Cerved Group is a leading information provider in Italy and one of the major rating agencies in Europe, offering a range of consumer information, consulting, credit recovery, and assets management services. While Cerved Group’s more than 2600 staff are fully equipped to work remotely, the company wanted to improve collaboration and work-life balance by reintroducing safe face-to-face interaction in its offices. By integrating desk-booking software YAROOMS with Microsoft Teams, Cerved Group is now making effective hybrid work a reality—and shifting to a whole new vision for the future of its business.

title: Invitalia implements secure cloud-first strategy with Check Point and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Invitalia is Italy’s national agency responsible for inward investment and economic development across the country. To effectively support its growth and emerging infrastructure needs, Invitalia implemented Microsoft Azure and tapped Check Point Software Technologies to secure the cloud environment. This enabled Invitalia to expand as quickly as needed, especially during Italy’s COVID-19 peak, and enhanced infrastructure protection from Check Point CloudGuard Network Security allowed Invitalia to adopt additional cloud resources with confidence.

title: NextBillion AI enables seamless location data services with Azure
executive_summary: NextBillion AI (NextBillion) is an industry-leading spatial data and AI platform that helps enterprises build, scale, and manage their own mapping ecosystem. The company enables enterprises to tackle highly complex location problems with the help of tailored location and navigation technology solutions. It offers location tools and APIs such as last-mile delivery, telematics, logistics, transport, food delivery, automotive, and ride-hailing/ride-sharing.

title: Cooperative Bank of Epirus transforms the user experience with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Cooperative Bank of Epirus is leading the social and economic development of the Epirus region, thanks to the greater efficiency and increased security of its financial services. With the help of Microsoft 365 solutions, it empowers its employees to commit to the development of local businesses and the prosperity of financial services customers.

title: Empowering partners to take the complexity out of digital transformation in higher education
executive_summary: As the world of education continues to advance further into the digital age, many higher education institutions are realizing that to stay competitive and meet the needs of modern students they will have to transform critical components of their digital architecture. But this is no easy feat—especially with many universities using a variety of siloed systems and software; however, solutions are within reach. Advanced Network Solutions (ANS), leveraging Dynamics 365 and Power Platform, was able to support universities with developing engaging digital experiences that students increasingly come to expect.

title: Memo Migrates Critical Call Center Systems To Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: When you’re providing call center support to critical business services, medical emergencies, healthcare professionals, pharmaceutical companies and alarm systems, any interruption to services can result in adverse outcomes for patients and often demanding customers. So as your company scales, how do you bring the IT systems alongside it without affecting customer service?

title: DEKRA is transforming its cloud and relying completely on Microsoft Azure and the Cloud Adoption Framework
executive_summary: In early 2020, DEKRA, an expert organization with a worldwide mission, took a critical look at its global IT. Based on the findings, it decided to centralize its IT and adopt a hybrid strategy to standardize it. For cloud services, it turned to Microsoft Azure. DEKRA operates primarily in sensitive and regulated markets, so with the support of Microsoft Consulting Services and members of the Microsoft Partner Network, it created a governance structure based on the Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) and put it in place for a secure digital transformation.

title: Carhartt gears up for growth with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Since sewing its first bib overalls for railroad workers in 1889, Carhartt has built a reputation as an American apparel icon. The privately owned company operates manufacturing, distribution, and wholesale organizations, along with retail stores, and employs more than 5,300 associates worldwide.
products: Azure, Azure VMware Solution, SAP on Azure

title: How SURF is empowering the Dutch education sector to upskill
executive_summary: As the organization responsible for representing most Dutch higher education institutions, SURF is committed to promoting technology and innovation across its members. With cloud usage on the rise in the education sector, demand for relevant skills has been growing alongside it. To help its members upskill their workforce and ensure this demand is met, SURF has partnered with Microsoft to roll out training sessions aimed at teaching institutions’ IT staff anything from cloud fundamentals to data and AI. The initiative has since blossomed into a wider, greater series of trainings taking place all around the country.

title: Zeti is driving towards cleaner air and a healthier planet with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: UK-based Zeti is a startup with a huge ambition: it aims to revolutionise transport finance for good. By connecting fleet operators with institutional financiers through its proprietary FinTech platform, Zeti supports the transition to no-carbon and ultra-low carbon vehicles in a simple and affordable way with pay-per-mile vehicle finance. Since its founding, Zeti has helped its customers to avoid nearly 8,000kgs of nitrous oxide into the atmosphere and the avoidance of nearly three million kilograms of carbon using the Azure platform - Azure API Management.

title: Metro South Health embraces Azure VMware Solution to enable agility and responsiveness to health service needs
executive_summary: Metro South Health, a major provider of high-quality public health services, education, and research in the Brisbane Southside delivers integrated care to more than 23 percent of the Queensland, Australia, population. Metro South Health operates five major hospitals with more than 17,000 dedicated clinicians, administrators, and other healthcare professionals who serve patients in a large geographical area across several communities in and around Brisbane; it is also Australia’s largest digital health service. With the goal of improving the integration of hardware-based IT infrastructure within the overall healthcare ecosystem, Metro South Health wants to improve the way its services leverage this technology to engage with people in its communities.

title: Molecular Modelling Laboratory delivers drug formulation breakthroughs with Azure HPC + AI, AMD
executive_summary: MML deployed Azure HPC + AI resources on more than 18,000 Azure HBv2 VM cores for about 120 ASD use cases optimally configured for high-performance computing with efficient node-to-node interconnectivity, AMD EPYC™ processors, and NVIDIA InfiniBand-enabled SKUs. As a Microsoft Partner Network member, MML found its perfect match both in Azure and in AMD as an implementation vendor for MML’s critical high VM density. Above all, MML is proud that it has enhanced its core capabilities, particularly with respect to simulating ASD.

title: Transportation services provider digitizes operations with Power Platform and dramatically cuts costs
executive_summary: MV Transportation, Inc. is the largest privately owned passenger transportation contracting services firm in North America, serving more than 110 million passengers each year across the United States and Canada. With a team of nearly 20,000 transit professionals, MV provides paratransit, fixed-route bus, public and private shuttle, and student transportation for more than 200 customers. MV has been on a quest to transform as many paper-based processes as possible, and Power Platform has been a key driver for multiple digitization projects.

title: CEMAsys: A Leading Model for Building Sustainability Success
executive_summary: As they embarked on a global expansion strategy, CEMAsys needed a partner to help them centralize their technology stack in a way that enabled remote work, fostered collaboration, and simplified processes. They needed to move beyond their status quo, which was made up of siloed systems and fragmented processes. To make sure they got it right, the ESG solutions and consulting company turned to their long-term partner Procano. With Procano’s help, they have now deployed a comprehensive Microsoft environment where Dynamics, Teams, and Sharepoint all work seamlessly together to enhance CEMAsys’s business operations. Beyond facilitating international expansion, this move has also been key to improving how their sales and customer delivery teams work together.

title: A scalable IT environment at Bossuyt Shop Interiors thanks to ConXioN
executive_summary: Bossuyt Shop Interiors develops inspiring interior concepts for artisan producers, so they can focus on their passion for creating. They translate their customer's brand DNA into an experience – a look and feel – for the end consumer. The company transfers successful concepts from one retail sector into other retail sectors. Bossuyt Shop Interiors is involved in the entire process of rolling out state-of-the-art shop projects, from the development of the concept to the actual furnishing of the shop. In recent years, Bossuyt has also been helping its customers explore the possibility of online sales with a digital sales platform. The progressive Belgian company has built its philosophy around making life easier for the client.

title: Two Qatari schools empower students and teachers with Reading Progress on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Qatar is on a mission to establish itself as a self-sustainable society under its 2030 national vision. Education is key in empowering the younger generations with 21st-century skills that will translate into the workplace and in people’s lives. In line with the Ministry of Education and Higher Education’s mission, two schools launched Microsoft’s Reading Progress, which has helped transform how students learn and educators teach. The AI-powered solution helps students reach reading fluency independently with help in pronunciation, reading speed, accuracy, and instant analysis of reading assignments via Insights.

title: PMG: Building an Integrated, Cloud-Focused Approach with Microsoft
executive_summary: As a leader in the Swiss financial services space, PMG Investment Solutions AG knew that if they wanted to stay ahead of the curve, they needed to adopt a cloud-first model. Their on-premises systems and a lacking ability to enable remote work meant that their tech stack was lagging behind best practices. As such, they needed to replace this with scalable, safe, and reliable infrastructure – and they wanted Microsoft solutions at the heart of it. That’s where Weibel/IT came in.

title: dnata Travel Group delivers better booking experience with Azure Event Hub
executive_summary: dnata Travel Group is a travel services provider headquartered in Dubai, and part of the Emirates Group. It needed a simple, cost-effective way to integrate the complex flight systems of its partner airlines. Thanks to a forward thinking, open-source platform and the power of Azure, the company has significantly reduced new client onboarding times and now benefits from a seamlessly scalable, fully managed platform, which adapts instantly to peaks and troughs in booking demand.

title: Digital Transformation at Computer History Museum creating a critical foundation for continued growth and unforgettable visitor experiences.
executive_summary: Computer History Museum makes their unprecedented collection and unique perspectives accessible to visitors of all ages, backgrounds and interests through comprehensive exhibits, interactive learning experiences, dynamic programming, and original media productions. The Museum’s Digital Transformation journey helped them take important steps to enable the technology vision today and create a strong foundation for a bigger and bolder future.

title: A1: Creating a digital space for collaboration
executive_summary: When the pandemic hit in early 2020, many saw the interruption to face-to-face working as an impediment to collaboration. This wasn’t the case for Austrian telecommunications giant A1, which took a different approach to remote working. They saw it as an opportunity to reimagine the workplace, using the switch to digital communication tools to enhance teamwork and co-operation across the entire organisation. Relying solely on the Microsoft environment, they embarked on perhaps the greatest test of their new way of working – a virtual festival focussed on the topic of collaboration and co-creation.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure SQL Database, BizTalk Server, Microsoft Entra ID, Exchange Online, Power BI, SQL Server

title: Engineering firm CDG boosts data accuracy and reporting with Aptude and Microsoft
executive_summary: Engineering firm CDG, Inc., had relied on manual processes for storing its financial data and project information. To generate monthly reports for analysis, the firm was also manually downloading data to an Excel spreadsheet. These processes were error-prone and of limited use. CDG turned to IT consulting and development company Aptude, which helped the firm modernize its data storage and project management and improve its reporting by implementing a Microsoft Azure SQL-driven approach, supplemented by the reporting capabilities of Power BI.

title: Tech Unicorn fast tracks better collaboration in virtual courtrooms with Azure and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Built from Azure Communication Services and Microsoft Teams, Unicorn Digital Courtroom delivers a full-featured virtual hearings solution that’s optimized for all parties involved, including judges, court clerks, defendants, claimants, and legal counsel. The Superior Court of California, County of Los Angeles—the largest court system in the United States—is the first court in the country to adopt the solution, with some 600 judges in 400 courtrooms now using it to handle 37,000 hearings per month. Today, the Court is benefiting from improved service delivery, increased efficiency, and lower costs—all quickly realized because the Court was able to deploy Unicorn Digital Courtroom on the Microsoft Azure infrastructure it already had in place.

title: Orbit Healthcare increases scalability with Azure migration
executive_summary: Orbit Healthcare Inc. has spent more than a decade disrupting healthcare administration through innovative workflow automation solutions. Orbit systems help resolve the challenges of patient intake, insurance eligibility, prior authorization, document capture, claims, and payment processing. Its API-based solutions help clients easily transfer data that otherwise requires complex back-end processing.

title: Orica streamlines provisioning and efficiencies with Microsoft Endpoint Manager
executive_summary: With operations in more than 100 countries, Orica, the multinational infrastructure and solutions provider that has supported mining customers for more than 140 years, flexes with the ever-changing needs of a complex supply chain and customer demand for more sustainable mining technologies. Supporting that innovation wouldn’t be possible without the 14,000 devices that Orica employees depend on. The company initially used an alternative on-premises solution for mobile device management but wanted one solution to manage every device, adopting Microsoft Security solutions to facilitate endpoint management and support its broader strategy to improve security.

title: Agero modernizes call centers to deliver critical services for 115 million drivers with help from Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: To help it deliver timely, often critical remote services to tens of thousands of drivers a day, wherever and whenever needed, Agero wanted to modernize its workplace and deploy a cloud-based, resilient virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) for its call center agents. With Azure Virtual Desktop, Agero now has the flexibility to scale its operations up and down to accommodate spikes in demand related to seasonal but unpredictable weather events, high-volume holiday travel, and other causes. Rapid scalability, coupled with the management and user experience capabilities of VMware Horizon Cloud, helps the company maintain service quality while holding down costs.

title: A move to Windows containers helps Relativity boost reliability and security while lowering costs
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Elite Construction + Development builds success and a connected workplace with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Elite Construction + Development is a small company with an incredible vision. It owes much of its success to unfettered collaboration and a communication-first approach, which is now at the center of the company’s enthusiastic adoption of Microsoft Teams. Elite solved its telephony woes with Microsoft Teams Phone by embracing a single source of truth strategy that simplifies IT management, reduces costs, and amplifies productivity.

title: Xelya creates scalable, highly secure modern hybrid environment with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: Xelya is an intelligent cloud solutions provider specializing in information telecommunications systems for small to medium-sized businesses, such as personal care service providers and law firms. Xelya aims to help its customers reduce the complexity of their daily operations with enterprise resource planning (ERP) software that works seamlessly with Office 365. To keep up with customer growth and rising demand for its software solutions among home health service providers, Xelya wanted to modernize its on-premises architecture to run its high-performance workloads and applications at scale without incurring high operational costs. The company migrated its existing Hyper-V solution built on storage area network architecture to Microsoft Azure Stack HCI to scale for demand, maximize peak performance, and extend its current environment to the cloud to optimize for growth.

title: Franz Morat Group gears up for the future with Azure Stack HCI powered by Intel technologies
executive_summary: Gears truly do make the world go round. Without ever knowing it, we’ve all probably used products that in some way depend on the high-precision gears and drive systems produced by Franz Morat Group, a multinational manufacturer headquartered in Eisenbach, Germany. The company anticipates its customers’ needs for ever-more refined designs, backing more than a century of gear production with new innovations, including its high-precision metal gears, and pioneering plastic injection-molded parts along with complete custom-designed drive units for a multitude of industries.

title: ShipServ delivers new solutions and features quickly on its new platform by using Azure DevOps pipeline automation
executive_summary: ShipServ decided to move its on-premises platform to the Cloud to achieve scalability, ease of maintenance and support while enhancing platform security.

title: Dah Chong Hong Electrical Appliance Division and Gilman gain speed, agility, security and readiness, Digital transform with Dynamics 365 ERP
executive_summary: Dah Chong Hong (DCH) Holdings knew that digital transformation was key to achieving its “One DCH” vision. DCH, an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of CITIC Limited, is an integrated trading and distribution company operating in Asia. Supported by an extensive logistics network, it is a leading distributor and dealer of motor vehicles in Greater China as well as a provider of a full range of associated services. DCH’s consumer business comprises the manufacture, retail and distribution of food, healthcare, electrical appliances, beauty and lifestyle products. It has over 16,500 staff and operations in 13 Asian markets. To position itself for future growth, meet the needs of its diverse business units and customer base, DCH chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations to serve as a base for the digitizing and streamlining operations across the group.

title: Porsche Holding standardizes business analyses in the cloud with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Porsche Holding Salzburg is a subsidiary of Volkswagen AG, and has a name that stands for innovation like few others in the automotive industry. It comes as no surprise, that this company began its cloud transformation early on – in 2017. But until recently, the efficiency gains that came with this step were realized primarily in software development. Now, taking business intelligence as an example, the company is seeing how cooperation between central IT and business units turns the public cloud into a driver of business innovation.

title: Vietnam’s ICT leader FPT achieves operational excellence with real-time big data insights through Azure
executive_summary: FPT is the largest private Vietnamese ICT company, spanning 27 countries with ten subsidiaries and affiliates. It implemented Azure Big Data Analytics services to empower its global teams with timely insights, providing a 360-degree view of enterprise-wide data. With on-demand access to real-time business reports, management can now make decisions at the speed of their business. Additionally, a detailed picture of all company data makes employees more productive, enabling them to respond to business demands faster and more accurately.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: Digicel Group's Infrastructure Transformation led to the standardization of processes, increased stability and recoverability with Azure
executive_summary: The Digicel Group implemented an Azure Digital solution, along with their partner Maureen Data Systems, and is now completing the most extensive Azure deployment in the Caribbean. This move is part of the company's Infrastructure Transformation to support increased business agility and cost control, augmenting their Digital journey. This, paired with the benefits of avoiding system outages and focusing on increasing scalability and stability, were key influencers in pursuing this change.

title: National Railway Company of Belgium takes a security-focused route with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: The National Railway Company of Belgium answers the challenges of today’s transportation industry with a two-pronged approach. It prioritizes customer safety and travel experience along with cutting-edge technology that makes it easier for its employees to be proactive and efficient. And because cybersecurity is ever more important, it protects its digital assets with both built-in platform security and Microsoft Security solutions. The company deployed Microsoft Intune for mobile devices and the Microsoft Defender solution family to monitor its endpoints, cloud workloads, and Microsoft 365 apps. It oversees the entire estate with Microsoft Sentinel for proactive, efficient security.

title: Bayer builds crisis management dashboard for data-driven decisions using datamarts in Power BI
executive_summary: Bayer is a life science company and a global leader in healthcare and nutrition—and the organization’s work became even more critical during the COVID-19 pandemic. To keep its employees safe and business production on track, the Bayer crisis management team needed access to critical COVID information for the ASEAN country group. Using datamarts in Power BI, the organization built a dashboard that delivers insights in real time, enabling better decision making and enhancing cross-team collaboration for future crisis management needs.

title: Liebherr-Components and Reycom deliver end to end RISE Security with Microsoft Defender for IoT for Linux and Windows IoT
executive_summary: A time of profound technological advances calls for equally innovative strategies to support that change. Liebherr-Components answered that challenge by joining forces with Reycom AG, a global player in the TV, smart living, and Internet of Things (IoT) sectors. Together, they provide a ready-to-use, highly secure, end-to-end IoT solution, RISE (Reycom Industrial Secure Edge platform), to external customers. The partners needed an IoT security solution to support their innovation, and they found it in Microsoft Defender for IoT and Device Update for Azure IoT Hub. The synergy between the companies points to a promising new era in connected IoT solutions for a smarter, safer world.

title: Automotive Quality Control leader HOLLEN grows business, boosts security with Microsoft 365 Business Premium
executive_summary: When automotive manufacturers and suppliers need to ensure that their products adhere to a high standard of excellence, HOLLEN technicians arrive onsite to deliver quality control services. “We provide everything from simple visual control to highly complex quality control solutions,” explains Branislav Krampl, Director of Information and Communications Technology, Internal Processes Optimalization and Marketing at HOLLEN s.r.o. HOLLEN has already experienced remarkable growth since its origins as a small, family-run business in 2001. The company expanded from a single location in a family home in Slovakia―where business meetings were held in the living room―to multiple locations, and it now operates in four countries across 14 sites. From the beginning, HOLLEN focused on quality, flexibility, and well-trained people, with a goal to be the best in the market.
products: Exchange Online, Microsoft 365 Business Premium, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Secure Score, SharePoint

title: NTT Communications adds insider risk management to enhance data security with Microsoft Purview
executive_summary: NTT Communications Corporation has long focused on updating its cybersecurity risk posture against external attacks. Based on an analysis of the evolving threat landscape, the company decided to take a new approach in protecting its information assets. NTT Communications is using Microsoft Purview to provide communication transparency and data protection so that it can quickly identify internal risks in its remote work environment. Additionally, the company has created a work environment that fosters productivity and collaboration while still giving IT security staff peace of mind by enabling them to investigate anomalies before critical incidents occur rather than excessively relying on past log events after the fact.

title: Building a Pathway to Success: Abraham Lincoln High School's Use of Microsoft Technology in Computer Science Education
executive_summary: Corissa Fontana began her career at Abraham Lincoln High School in Brooklyn, New York, as an English teacher. Nine years later, the school’s principal called her into the office, sat her down, and asked her to become the assistant principal of the math department. The abrupt shift in field wasn’t the challenging part, as Corissa had always been skilled at math. No, the challenge came from the fact that the role required her to spearhead a computer science program, from scratch, with nothing but a few iPad carts and some laptops from 2008, several of which were missing keys. Five years later, Abraham Lincoln High School is now a Microsoft showcase school.

title: Elections Ontario scales critical capacity, strengthens election security with Azure
executive_summary: For more than 100 years, Elections Ontario, a nonpartisan agency of the Legislative Assembly of Ontario, has administered the election process and the tabulation of election results in Canada’s most populous province. Ontario’s sheer size and scale translates to nearly 11 million eligible electors across 6,885 polling locations voting to elect 124 representatives during each election. While elections have fundamentally remained consistent over the last century, technological advancements have brought computers and other devices into the electoral arena.

title: IsoMetrix unlocks ESG and EHS compliance for businesses worldwide with Azure-based solutions
executive_summary: With its software deployed in over 100 countries, IsoMetrix is the leading integrated risk management software developer that provides cutting-edge technology for environmental, social, and governance (ESG) compliance and environment, health, and safety (EHS) management. The company migrated its solutions to Azure to meet the growing need for sustainability targets, a project driven by Chief Revenue Officer at IsoMetrix, John Castner. As a result, the company provides clients with an all-in-one platform that saves time and resources collecting, organizing, and generating reports.

title: Rabobank streamlines and personalizes customer support with AI powered virtual agents
executive_summary: Rabobank, a multinational banking institution headquartered in the Netherlands, has a long history of cooperation, innovation, and people-centered solutions. As part of its mission to grow a better world together, Rabobank aspires to “conversational banking,” which prioritizes friendly, efficient customer service on demand. Reconstructing its virtual agent solution with Microsoft Power Virtual Agents allowed Rabobank to simplify operations, reduce costs, and create a better, more cohesive experience for customers.

title: BPO American answers the call for a highly secure, easy to deploy Windows experience with Windows 365 Cloud PCs
executive_summary: When a customer calls BPO American, starts a web chat, or initiates an email conversation, they’re instantly connected to one of 215 US-based agents. Although these agents are located across the country, they share one thing in common: they work from home. “Ninety percent of our company is remote workers,” says Christy Gosnell, Director of IT at BPO American. The agents answer calls for companies that have outsourced their contact center capabilities to BPO American, which means that agents not only represent multiple businesses, but they also interact with a vast amount of highly sensitive data. “We deal with HIPAA information, credit cards, and a lot of other personal information,” explains Gosnell.

title: Groupama Biztosító simplifies telephony, bringing 150 branch offices closer to customers with Teams Phone
executive_summary: As one of Hungary's biggest insurers, Groupama Biztosító draws together thousands of customers and agents across the country. To do that fast, seamlessly, and cost-effectively, it relies on Microsoft Teams Phone. The solution is part of the familiar Microsoft 365 suite and enables instant, high-quality audio and video communication anywhere. With these converged communication services, Groupama simplified communication and collaboration, achieving enterprise-level security and 70% cost savings on telephony. Now, 1,500 company agents can meaningfully work together wherever they are while customers get their requests resolved immediately via phone.

title: Putting the user experience first: Digitisation prioritised by Ulster University
executive_summary:
With over 27,000 students, Ulster University is one of the largest universities on the island of Ireland, with overall student satisfaction consistently outperforming national benchmarks.
In late 2019, the University recognised the opportunity to respond and adapt to the changing requirements of staff and students by embracing a digital transformation journey, supported by Microsoft.

title: Global pathology experts share data to combat disease with help from Azure
executive_summary: PathPresenter has big goals. The scaleup company offers a global image sharing platform for pathology through which it plans to democratize access to the world’s pathology knowledge. The aim is to connect pathologists to the vast expertise of their colleagues globally while providing a practical platform to access and use best-in-class AI models. PathPresenter is well on its way to reaching its vision with an enterprise workflow platform that runs on Microsoft Azure Cloud and allows pathologists across the globe to easily share digitized microscope slides for remote consultation, research, and teaching. Despite having less than 20 employees, PathPresenter has built a global community of 45,000+ users in 172 countries with 30+ tier-one institutional customers.

title: Zurich: Developing innovative production systems with Dynamics 365.
executive_summary: Since 2018, Zurich has been using Microsoft Dynamics 365, starting off a series of new systems within the platform and positively impacting the company. The first of these was Z-Chamado, which allows different people to create tickets. The second was the development of the commercial CRM, and the third was the development of Workflow Underwriter, followed by other operations.

title: L’Oréal delights customers by empowering beauty advisors with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: As Multi-Brand Beauty Advisor for L’Oréal Luxe, Jenifer Hart must often juggle many time-sensitive responsibilities. With a busy customer-facing role at the busy Boots store in Plymouth, England, where she works, plus responsibility for creating educational content for other beauty advisors, Jennifer is used to multi-tasking. Despite these ongoing demands on her time, Jenifer keeps her customer’s satisfaction a top priority. “The job of a beauty advisor is about leading with empathy,” she says.

title: Isuzu Motors Limited drives workstyle innovation at new headquarters with Microsoft Teams Phone and 130 Microsoft Teams Rooms
executive_summary: For over 100 years, Isuzu Motors Limited has been creating prosperous and satisfying global lifestyles with commercial vehicles for transporting goods and the diesel engines that power them. In May 2022, the company relocated its head office to Yokohama Gate Tower to drive dynamic and diverse workstyles, using Microsoft Teams Phone and Microsoft Teams Rooms as a platform for the initiative. The new headquarters forgoes a PBX, instead using company-supplied notebook PCs and headsets for internal and external connection and 130 Teams Rooms for effortless remote meetings. This setup delivers greater convenience than conventional business phones and slashes deployment and expansion costs. Employees who visit factories or work from home can now communicate efficiently. While the new environment is currently limited to the new head office and some affiliates, Isuzu Motors Limited has expansion plans for other offices.

title: Power Apps as a bridge to SAP: Automated digital customer orders for WENKO field service
executive_summary: Founded in 1959, WENKO-WENSELAAR GmbH & Co. KG is one of the leading suppliers of innovative product solutions for bathroom, kitchen, laundry, and living with a range of over 5,000 articles. Around 500 new ones are added every year—from soap dispensers to dehumidifiers to stylish home accessories. Approximately half of these products are sold to DIY and furniture stores by the company’s field service reps. In the past, the reps would generate orders on paper or using a laptop. But now, the family-owned company uses automated processes via Power Platform and a scan app based on Power Apps. This avoids errors and shortens lead times.

title: Breville’s brewing in new markets at record pace with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Breville, the quintessential kitchen appliance brand known the world over, enhances people’s lives through exceptional coffee and culinary experiences at home. Founded in Australia in 1932, the iconic maker of internationally award-winning coffee machines and premium kitchen products is on a quest to inspire people to “Master Every Moment” through thoughtful design and brilliant innovation. Breville delivers their ever-expanding inventory to more than 70 countries, empowering people to prepare food and beverages more easily and impressively than they’d thought possible in their own homes.

title: PwC Switzerland: Increasing business value while staying compliant using the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: For a long time, PwC Switzerland’s ambitions to move to the cloud were limited by strict Swiss regulations around data storage and sharing. But when Microsoft established two data centers on Swiss soil, it opened the door to the opportunities the cloud could offer. The company has since embarked on a cloud transformation journey that drives greater efficiency, enhances collaboration and is yielding new innovations every day. Using Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365 and Power Platform, the multi-year cloud transformation program has paved the way to a cloud-native future.

title: Aberdeen City Council helps more vulnerable people by taking a platform approach with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Aberdeen City Council, a governmental organization with nearly 8,000 employees in northeastern Scotland, is dedicated to the mission of providing citizens with the social care and resources they need to live safe and fulfilling lives. But the Council faced roadblocks to providing Aberdeen residents with this care. Social workers had to gather information on vulnerable citizens through a variety of methods, and workers struggled to assemble a clear picture of the overall needs of citizens as well as plan future care. The Council rolled out Dynamics 365 Customer Service to unify how it collected data and to provide data transparency to all workers, leading to faster service, a better understanding of citizen needs, and more than two million pounds saved annually on manual data collection.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service

title: Infosys powers digital transformation of sales with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Infosys embarked on a digital sales transformation journey to be a live enterprise with agility built into the core to stay ahead of the game. With the primary objective of transforming sales experience across the entire sales cycle, it identified specific interventions across every touch point where sales operate, from lead generation to order booking, by creating a data and insight-driven ecosystem.

title: Windows 11 Pro powers Universe Power Systems
executive_summary: Founded by Jeyalakshmi Venkatanarayanan in 1997, Universe Power Systems sells all kinds of power-related products, from UPS systems to batteries, stabilizers to server racks, transformers to inverters. Based in Bengaluru, India, the company provides green power solutions to customers across various segments like IT, healthcare, and government. Their innovations include end-to-end power and automation solutions for data centers.

title: Bossard fastens its future to innovations in the cloud with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Bossard Group (SWX: BOSN) is a leading global provider of industrial fastening and assembly technology solutions and services. Founded in Zug, Switzerland in 1831, today the Bossard Group has 2,925 employees at 82 locations in 32 countries offering more than 1 million items. Companies from local businesses to multinationals count on Bossard’s expertise to increase their productivity. The Bossard Group generated CHF 1,153.8 million in sales in FY2022.

title: Veranova’s shift to Dynamics 365 is good medicine
executive_summary: Veranova is a worldwide leader in the development and manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API), with expertise in highly regulated and complex chemistries. Formerly part of Johnson Matthey, the company has more than 50 years of experience navigating the challenges of the global healthcare industry. With more than 1,000 employees in the United States, the United Kingdom, and Asia, its mission is to harness the power of drug development and manufacturing to transform molecules into life-changing medicines.

title: ECS unlocks strategic advantage with generative AI in Power Platform
executive_summary: ECS, a leader in advanced technology, science, and engineering solutions, receives hundreds of performance ratings reports for its government contracts. To make it easier to manage and analyze these reports, the company developed an AI-driven document processing model using AI Builder in Power Automate.

title: Presidio builds a unified solution on Microsoft Project for the web to streamline its project management
executive_summary: Presidio is a Global Digital Services and Solutions Provider that has more than 150 project managers on staff guiding thousands of projects for multiple clients. The management team worked with a patchwork of processes and tools, which made collaboration difficult and reduced visibility into the status of the company’s projects. Looking to create a central platform to enable the delivery of client outcomes efficiently, the Presidio team built the Presidio Project Portal on top of Microsoft Project for the web with Power Apps, Power BI, and Microsoft Teams integration. This tool gives project managers an easy way to drive projects and provides a central location for all relevant data, improving visibility and collaboration.

title: Azure Virtual Desktop is the last piece of full cloud migration, Future of educational field by “Digitalization of School Affairs”
executive_summary: Located in the eastern part of Ehime Prefecture, Saijo City is surrounded by Ishizuchi Mountains to the south and Seto Inland Sea to the north. While the city is a sightseeing district rich in nature called “City of Waterways”, it has one of the largest areas in Shikoku as an agricultural city/industrial city. Utilizing ICT and promoting the creation of “Smart City Saijo” where everyone can connect and live a safe/secure and prosperous life, the city is actively utilizing ICT especially in the field of education. It has been working on the cloud migration of education/school affairs/learning systems from a very early stage for a local government, adopted Microsoft Azure (hereinafter, “Azure”), and realized an environment with three separated tiers which do not impair convenience. As the next step based on these efforts, Saijo City Board of Education will start migrating the VDI environment operated on premise to the cloud. What was selected under these circumstances was “Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD)”, a virtual desktop service provided on Azure.

title: Aberdeen City Council helps more vulnerable people by taking a platform approach with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Aberdeen City Council, a governmental organization with nearly 8,000 employees in northeastern Scotland, is dedicated to the mission of providing citizens with the social care and resources they need to live safe and fulfilling lives. But the Council faced roadblocks to providing Aberdeen residents with this care. Social workers had to gather information on vulnerable citizens through a variety of methods, and workers struggled to assemble a clear picture of the overall needs of citizens as well as plan future care. The Council rolled out Dynamics 365 Customer Service to unify how it collected data and to provide data transparency to all workers, leading to faster service, a better understanding of citizen needs, and more than two million pounds saved annually on manual data collection.

title: Infosys powers digital transformation of sales with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Infosys embarked on a digital sales transformation journey to be a live enterprise with agility built into the core to stay ahead of the game. With the primary objective of transforming sales experience across the entire sales cycle, it identified specific interventions across every touch point where sales operate, from lead generation to order booking, by creating a data and insight-driven ecosystem.

title: Windows 11 Pro powers Universe Power Systems
executive_summary: Founded by Jeyalakshmi Venkatanarayanan in 1997, Universe Power Systems sells all kinds of power-related products, from UPS systems to batteries, stabilizers to server racks, transformers to inverters. Based in Bengaluru, India, the company provides green power solutions to customers across various segments like IT, healthcare, and government. Their innovations include end-to-end power and automation solutions for data centers.

title: Legal & General’s mainframe modernisation uses Microsoft Azure to bring speed, agility and innovation
executive_summary: Legal & General was carrying a burden of technical debt, as much as 60 years old. To enable growth and innovation it needed to modernise. A range of solutions were deployed, all on Microsoft Azure. Key mainframe and business applications were rebuilt. Other projects have augmented existing mainframe applications by building development and test environments. By taking a tailored approach to the needs of each project, they have transformed and modernised its business.

title: Backbase seeks to usher in a new era of engagement banking with its Grand Central platform and Azure API Management
executive_summary: Backbase, a leading force in the banking industry, is spearheading the future of banking through its revolutionary Grand Central platform powered by Azure API Management and the leading banking domain model BIAN. With commitment to innovation and customer-centric solutions, Backbase is empowering financial institutions to navigate the evolving landscape of banking with agility and efficiency.

title: The State of Alaska innovates to make digital government services more resilient and accessible by migrating to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The State of Alaska completed the initial phase of a large-scale migration, expanding access to digital services for constituents. Alaska overcame legacy on-premises infrastructure by contracting with Microsoft to enhance modernization, security, and workforce development. This catalyzed the state’s rapid digital transformation and migration to Microsoft Azure. Alaska actioned a “migrate and modernize” pattern that has empowered its teams to focus on high-value efforts, not costly hardware replacement and service remediation. After migrating 700 applications and one-third of its infrastructure in just three months, Alaska is facilitating innovation and expanding access to secure government services—all while optimizing costs.

title: Marketing company, Avocados From Mexico, uses Power Platform to streamline its purchase order process
executive_summary: Avocados From Mexico is a non-profit marketing organization which supports importers and distributors of Mexican avocados across the US. The company used Power Platform to create a customized app to help streamline purchase order processing with integration to their SAP ByDesign system.

title: Northrop & Johnson sails to exponential growth with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The superyacht business—where Northrop & Johnson is the world’s leading brokerage—is about making dreams come true and catering to a small group of high-value clients worldwide. The company embraced digital transformation, keeping it at the top of its field. Deploying Microsoft Dynamics 365 customer experience suite of marketing, lead, and opportunity management tools has led to a 250% increase in charter bookings. The average close rate in year-over-year brokerage sales grew 20% and 23% in 2021 and 2022, respectively.

title: All Pro improves efficiencies with Microsoft Power Pages and saves CAD $30,000 in ERP fees
executive_summary: All Pro Electrical was looking for a cost-effective right sized solution for various business needs, including submitting expenses, completing crucial safety forms, and managing leave requests. All Pro Electrical chose the Microsoft Power Platform and created an employee portal using Microsoft Power Pages and Microsoft Power Automate that has automated key functions, improved safety compliance, and significantly reduced manual administrative tasks. By developing a solution primarily in-house, the business saved CAD $30,000 in consulting fees and implemented a customized portal that was based on their business needs.
products: Azure Blob Storage, Power Apps, Dataverse, Power Automate, Power Pages

title: CNH boosts customer loyalty with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: CNH Industrial (NYSE: CNHI) is a global leader in agriculture and construction equipment. It designs, produces, and sells machinery and services that help farmers and builders work sustainably. Founded in 1842 as the Racine Threshing Machine Works, today CNH Industrial (CNH) is a multinational company with 10 brands, including New Holland and CASE Construction Equipment, and more than 40,000 employees at 43 production facilities, 40 R&D centers, and 170 locations on five continents.

title: Icatu modernizes its data architecture with Microsoft Cloud solutions
executive_summary: The insurer carried out a comprehensive program for modernizing its data architecture, evolving its business intelligence environment, adopting a hybrid architecture with Microsoft Cloud tools with support from partner company Informatica, and realizing several benefits from the solution. The next step is to further deepen this new reality by looking for more technologies involving AI and machine learning.

title: The transformation of FS amidst the pandemic supported by Microsoft 365
executive_summary: FS, Brazil's first and largest ethanol producer that uses 100% corn to manufacture of its products, has always sought to use technology as an additional resource to transform agribusiness. Almost all of its systems operate in the cloud, for example, making processes more agile and efficient and adding value to its products. When they found themselves in the midst of a pandemic, the FS team did not think twice: it would be through sophisticated technology that they would face that situation. That's how they started using Microsoft 365 solutions, ensuring flexibility and better performance for their employees.

title: Coop Norge: Turbocharging collaboration through change management and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Coop Norge is a major player in the Norwegian grocery market, offering a wide range of products and services. It is a collective of individual cooperatives and comprised of more than 1,300 stores across the country. Previously, there was no consistent single tool available to keep employees in contact and disseminate information. To address that, the organization decided to roll out Microsoft Teams, launching a digital adoption strategy that successfully rolled out across more than 23,000 employees and 52 Cooperatives. As a result, the company has now adopted a unified comms system that allows for closer collaboration—empowering Coop's workforce to communicate more efficiently and securely, and which is continuing to evolve.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva Engage

title: LGT drives digital workplace transformation with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: The pandemic opened LGT’s eyes to the need for a modern, flexible work environment to facilitate seamless collaboration. The company committed to a comprehensive digitalization strategy that would deliver on these requirements.

title: MetLife Asia transforms development security operations with Azure DevOps
executive_summary: N/A

title: Malabar Gold and Diamonds unifies data, systems, and teams with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Different business units at Malabar Gold had different legacy systems to manage their processes. These disparate systems were becoming increasingly inefficient and costly to manage and could not keep up with business demands.

title: First West Credit Union adopts critical Dynamics 365 process in seven weeks, lowers resolution time
executive_summary: First West Credit Union is one of Canada’s largest credit unions, built on authentic connections with its members. It aims to bring the power and promise of cooperative banking to more Canadians and keep local decision making and community connectedness.

title: MSC unifies global operations and tracks millions of shipment data points with Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Transforming drug discovery: Novo Nordisk uses the power of AI and Azure with Microsoft Research
executive_summary: Developing high-quality medicine is a resource-intensive endeavor that requires collaboration across Novo Nordisk.  Novo Nordisk aimed to scale a pipeline of drug discovery, development, and data science capabilities with AI and machine learning.

title: ManpowerGroup Talent Solutions builds strategic workforce planning solution with Power Platform
executive_summary: ManpowerGroup’s Talent Solutions practice was in search of a solution for gathering and analyzing HR data to power its consulting practice, which was previously a time-consuming process that impeded workforce planning.

title: Farm Credit Canada empowers employees to streamline operations and advance the organization’s mission with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Farm Credit Canada (FCC), an agricultural and food lending corporation in Canada, sought to boost employee productivity, enhance customer service, and stay at the forefront of technology adoption in the sector.

title: Lightning protection is personal safety: DEHN optimizes sales with Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: DEHN faces challenges in construction projects: long durations, frequent plan changes, and many contacts. The sales team must identify these evolving needs and provide the appropriate lightning protection solutions.

title: Michigan Air National Guard reduced training time from weeks to days with mixed reality and Microsoft Azure innovations
executive_summary: The Michigan Air National Guard (MI ANG) is preparing for US Air Force (USAF) Agile Combat Employment and Multi-Capable Airmen operations using mixed-reality solutions to support global agility. Its Kelly Johnson Joint All-Domain Innovation Center (KJJADIC) operationalizes innovation for USAF efforts at the National All-Domain Warfighting Center in Michigan, helping solve national security challenges. The KJJADIC also provides academic certification programs and practical experiences in creative problem-solving. In collaboration with Microsoft, MI ANG is incorporating mixed-reality technologies into its exercise and training teams, showing how innovative ideas and technology can securely enhance training, readiness, and efficiency.

title: Dynamics 365 Customer Service modernizes Latin America's oldest Chamber of Commerce
executive_summary: With its digital opening, the Santo Domingo Chamber of Commerce and Production achieves greater stability from a single platform by using Dynamic 365 Customer Service as a CRM, reaching 14,000 monthly registration transactions and allowing users to access the institution's services and requests from any location.

title: TotalNet modernizes its financial platform with Azure Active Directory B2C deployment
executive_summary: Becoming a multibrand company, TotalNet implemented a Microsoft Azure–based customer identity access management security solution. This solution was adopted as a central hub for the growth of the rest of its applications and processing operations through its platform.

title: Somerset councils merge and modernize with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As a UK local government unitary authority, Somerset Council works to fulfill its mission of offering services in health, education, housing, economy, and environment to its community. Once operating as five distinct councils, each with its own financial management systems, the amalgamation of the groups into one council required building a centralized financial system to enhance data insights, automate manual processes, and optimize efficiencies and transparency. Dynamics 365 was the right solution to keep Somerset Council efficiently delivering the public services so many in its region rely on.

title: Alpha Inversiones brokerage firm in the Dominican Republic strengthens its business model with support from Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Building on Dynamics 365, the company has gained a 360° view of its business, improving its sales operations and customer relationships. It has also been able to automate different processes and comply with local securities superintendence regulations.

title: Adobe uses global cloud to create, deliver, and manage better digital experiences
executive_summary: Adobe wanted to help its customers understand how people engage with the content created through the Adobe Creative Cloud, so it built the Adobe Experience Cloud to integrate data analytics with content, audience, and campaign management. By partnering with Microsoft to connect Experience Cloud with Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365, Adobe can offer businesses a 360-degree customer view and the tools to create, deliver, and manage digital experiences—backed by a globally scalable cloud platform.

title: Leading Dutch energy company improves access to collaborative workspaces, increases productivity with user-friendly app
executive_summary: More than a corporate headquarters building, Eneco World reflects a philosophy about bringing people together to collaborate and innovate. To improve productivity and efficiency, Dutch energy supplier Eneco turned to Macaw—a trusted Microsoft Gold Partner—for help in developing an app that would provide an easy way for nearly 3,000 employees to find the space they needed to meet and work together. Eneco met that challenge with Microsoft Office 365 cloud-based services, using Power Apps, Flow, and Power BI to develop the RoomFinder app that now connects people and ideas.

title: Microsoft Surface for the NHS: Real-world examples of how Surface devices are already in use across the NHS
executive_summary: The NHS Long Term Plan paints a bold vision for the future of the NHS. One where healthcare is connected from end to end, and today’s disparate healthcare bodies collaborate to provide modern services that will stand the test of time. Within our manifesto for change, The Case for Digitalising Healthcare, we outlined how Microsoft Surface devices represent a giant step towards realising that lofty ambition.

title: Top oil & gas firm Royal Dutch Shell, accelerates software development to fuel global energy production
executive_summary: The global population today is approximately 7.4 billion and is projected to reach 10 billion by 2050. Industrialization and population growth are closely intertwined, fueled by energy consumption that the US Energy Information Administration says will increase by 48 percent between 2012 and 2040. Although renewable energy sources are on the rise, fossil fuels will still account for more than 75 percent of the energy consumed worldwide.

title: Rzeszów School in Microsoft cloud: transforming education with Office 365
executive_summary: Rzeszów is a city of innovation, implementing the Smart City idea—including Rzeszów’s Intelligent Transportation System, improved communication between the citizens and city hall, and strong support for education. Since 2005, all schools have been connected to the city’s IT network, providing safe internet to the students. In addition, the schools use a unified modern electronic gradebook, an element of a complex education management system. Another step toward improving teaching conditions and methods―for students and teachers alike―was the introduction of the Innovative Education package. The perfect solution that enabled the execution of its assumptions turned out to be Office 365 Education.

title: Larsen & Toubro Construction unlocks business value with a connected equipment platform powered by Microsoft Azure IoT and AI
executive_summary: L&T Construction has developed and deployed cutting-edge digital solutions and platforms across the construction value chain. One such key platform that is deployed at scale is Asset Insight, a connected equipment platform that takes advantage of Microsoft Azure IoT and AI. Armed with these insights, managers at L&T Construction can take various tangible actions, such as undertaking specific maintenance activities to improve equipment availability, and right-sizing equipment based on project requirements and past usage data.
products: Azure App Service, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure HDInsight, Azure IoT Hub, Azure SQL Database, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Internet of Things, Power BI

title: Rabobank provides a strong cooperative workplace experience to improve employee engagement and customer satisfaction
executive_summary: Rabobank, a cooperative bank headquartered in the Netherlands, has long prided itself on helping customers be more self-reliant and efficient, whether through providing financial advice to the community or delivering user-friendly apps for customers’ banking needs. The bank wanted to empower employees in the same way by enabling them to be productive whether they are at a bank branch or a corporate office, at home, or at a customer site. At the same time as it allowed for independence, Rabobank wanted to create a more unified workplace culture across the bank branches.

title: Volkswagen Financial Services transforms development practice, delivers more value with Azure Stack Hub
executive_summary: With 80 web applications powering several brands across about 10 countries, Volkswagen Financial Services manages a complex IT estate. To achieve its digital transformation goals, it needed to modernize its apps—and its development approach. By supporting its DevOps practices with Microsoft Azure Stack Hub, VW Financial Services AG combined cloud speed and scale with on-premises data privacy and compliance. Now it can deliver applications and services faster at lower cost and drive innovation with a modern DevOps platform. VW Financial Services migrated its first application to Azure in May 2020, with more applications to follow.

title: Quest dramatically reduces go-to-market times with Azure
executive_summary: For more than 30 years, Quest Software has aided businesses in their journey to simplify IT management, spend less time on IT administration, and devote more time to innovation. As part of an internal move to Microsoft Azure, Quest also developed a series of software as a service offerings for its customers, resulting in stronger relationships with existing customers, multiple new avenues for growth, and the agility to bring new services to market 66 percent faster than it could in the past.

title: Commvault pleases customers by adding a new SaaS version to a strong repertoire with Azure services
executive_summary: Leading data management provider Commvault stays on top of industry trends to ensure that customers have the solution they need for any environment. When the company began architecting the cloud-based software as a service (SaaS) version of its ubiquitous Commvault solution, it naturally turned to Microsoft Azure—the cloud platform it uses for all its own internal systems. With Azure now underlying its new Metallic offering, 40,000 joint Microsoft and Commvault customers can better secure their most precious business asset: mission-critical data, either on-premises or in the cloud.

title: Campbell Soup Company transforms IT and boosts supply chain visibility with a single global SAP HANA environment on Azure
executive_summary: The Campbell Soup Company is an iconic food company that produces meals, beverages, and snacks and generates more than USD8 billion in annual revenue. To improve reliability and availability and build greater flexibility and scalability into its core SAP environments, especially after its large acquisition of Snyder’s-Lance—Campbell migrated to SAP HANA on Microsoft Azure. The company runs a single global instance of SAP, which has helped it greatly reduce downtime, make manufacturing more resilient, and gain deeper insights into its supply chain.

title: Clariter eliminates the risk of email malware with FileWall by odix and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Clariter is a global clean-tech company that uses its upcycling technology to transform plastic waste into oils, waxes, and solvents, which are then used to make over 1,000 clean end-user and consumer products. The company was seeking an additional security layer to enhance its email security systems and found FileWall by odix was the ideal solution. FileWall is a content disarm and reconstruction (CDR) solution that provides complementary protection for Microsoft Advanced Threat Protection and Exchange Online Protection deployments. With FileWall's comprehensive malware protection and email security, Clariter ensures its users and data are protected around the clock.

title: Oman Data Park helps customers meet data regulations, cuts its operating costs by 52 percent, and attracts 10 percent more customers by implementing Azure Stack Hub
executive_summary: As a premier datacenter provider in Oman and one of the largest, Oman Data Park needed a way to provide cloud services to companies while helping them adhere to the country’s data sovereignty regulation. By implementing Microsoft Azure Stack Hub, the managed services provider not only achieved its primary goals, but also opened entirely new markets for its business. In six months, the company expanded its customer base by 10 percent and cut operating costs in half. Oman Data Park also reduced deployment time by 75 percent.

title: The power of data
executive_summary: Life science company Eppendorf must respond to rapid changes not only in one market, but in many markets simultaneously. Eppendorf increased the flexibility and agility required for this by using Microsoft Dynamics 365. The CRM solution forms a reliable basis for quick decisions based on current data.

title: Upstream Applied Science accelerates innovation with HPCBOX on Azure to reduce turnaround time for modeling methodology assessment
executive_summary: Upstream Applied Science Ltd. offers applied science and math consultancy services, specializing in computational fluid dynamics (CFD). Upstream wanted to assess the performance of several CFD models and contacted Drizti Inc. to investigate the use of high-performance computing (HPC) for this modeling. Drizti’s HPCBOX solution on Microsoft Azure delivers a cloud HPC platform that makes supercomputing as easy to use as a personal computer. With HPCBOX’s user-friendly and performance-enhancing toolset to access HPC on Azure, Upstream completed its turbulence model simulation in less than five days.

title: Housing Works uses technology to serve clients struggling with homelessness, AIDS, and COVID-19
executive_summary: The nonprofit Housing Works serves homeless people living with and impacted by HIV/AIDS, so it had to find creative ways to continue supporting this vulnerable population during the COVID-19 crisis. With the help of Office 365 and Azure, the organization transitioned to a mostly remote model in only five days. Operating in the cloud allows staff to better meet clients anywhere, whether that’s over the phone or in community settings, now and in the future.

title: CadDo and Microsoft products bring transparency to asset management company’s portfolio
executive_summary: A fund and asset management company in the Netherlands with over €50 billion in assets under management wanted absolute transparency across every investment. This meant the company needed to augment financial performance figures with the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) performance for each investment fund, as well as all underlying holdings. The CadDo solution was implemented to deliver this rapidly and effectively, embedding the client’s extensive ESG knowledge, priorities, and preferences into a codified rules-based system. Using an end-to-end Microsoft stack, including Azure, SQL Server 2019, and Power BI, meant everything just connected and data flowed effectively from the client’s raw source data into beautiful end-user reports. The project has been a clear success in terms of its original scope, as the CadDo solution is now a single and verifiable source of truth for ESG data and insights.

title: Campari Group raises the bar for customer experiences with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Campari Group knows how to create great brand experiences, and the beverage manufacturer always seeks to deepen its relationships with customers. To gain a 360-degree customer view and enhance the personalization of its marketing, sales, and customer service efforts, Campari Group deployed Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights and Dynamics 365 Marketing. The company has unified a fractured data landscape into a common customer data platform and accelerated time to market for new campaigns that support end-to-end customer journeys across the organization. With AI-driven recommendations and real-time, customer-led journey orchestration, Campari Group can personalize marketing messages for maximum impact across all customer touch points.

title: Walgreens Boots Alliance trims in-store audit times by 75 percent with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) strives to have a positive impact on the lives of its millions of daily customers. To ensure that products are on the shelves where they should be, the company has a robust asset protection program to guard against theft and loss. WBA made life easier for its program’s managers by giving them Microsoft Teams and the Asset Protection mobile app developed with Microsoft Power Apps.

title: Zafin empowers banking innovation through product modernization with Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services
executive_summary: One of the most complex dilemmas in the banking industry to date is how to modernize 40-year-old systems while still maintaining product innovation. And banks encounter innovation barriers that prevent them from adapting to market shifts toward personalized bundles and offerings. Zafin is utilizing Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services to transform banking by innovating the way a financial institution provides products and pricing to its customers without compromising its modernization journey.

title: The Right Tools for the Job: How OUSD Rapidly Deployed Windows Laptops to Promote Equity of Learning in a Time of COVID
executive_summary: Orange Unified School District transitioned from a piecemeal, multi-OS, multi-device educational technology program to a fully Windows 10-based device program over the course of a few months as the COVID pandemic forced schools to close for in-person learning. They found Dynabook’s Windows 10 Pro PCs to be more proficient to handle online learning for all grades, from Kindergarten to high school, than legacy Chromebooks and iPads. These devices, managed by Microsoft Intune, proved to be a powerful way to address issues of inequity in the district, where the socioeconomic status of students differs dramatically.

title: Upepo Technology is inline with Kenya’s vision 2030 providing solutions to the growing challenges encountered in the country’s water sector.
executive_summary: In April 2019, Upepo secured a Microsoft AI for Earth Grant which begun its journey to building its products and solutions through immediate access to IoT, Cloud Storage and Machine Learning (ML) tools. Upepo seeks to provide IoT solutions to 105 regulated water service providers (WSPs) and the estimated 5,200 community water projects across Kenya that serve an estimated 12.3 million households. The results of the pilot were successful and are set for commercial launch within 2021 with a scale up planned to 18 District Meter Areas, 90 Zones and 10,000 households.

title: Satori Analytics and BIC invite users into the product design process using Azure
executive_summary: FMCG giant BIC was intent on creating the “Next BIC Thing” in shaving—personalizing the shaving experience for every customer, no matter their skin or hair type. The company partnered with Satori Analytics, who involved customers in the product innovation process from the very beginning. Using Azure technology, Satori Analytics began collecting data from thousands of shaving sessions—effectively crowd-sourcing design and usage insights thanks to thousands of volunteer users—boosting productivity, fueling R&D with ideas and pioneering a new, data-driven strategy for customer-centric care.

title: Vitaldent is smiling with better customer insights, quality patient interactions on Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Fast-growing dental clinic network Vitaldent relies on the highest quality of dental care to keep patients smiling and to expand its clinics throughout Spain and beyond. It followed its Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management rollouts with Dynamics 365 Customer Voice, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, and Dynamics 365 Marketing to support critically important patient-clinic communication. Patients have the freedom to communicate about any concerns whenever it’s convenient for them, and Vitaldent has a 360-degree view of its patients. That’s healthier for everyone.

title: Local Authority of the Year is keeping the most vulnerable safe
executive_summary: Aberdeen City Council is an ambitious local council which serves more than 227,000 residents in a vibrant and growing city. In October 2020, Aberdeen City Council was named Local Authority of the Year at the prestigious Municipal Journal Achievement Awards.

title: SwiftAnt transforms Insurtech at Zero CAPEX with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: SwiftAnt provides insurance technology solutions aimed at fostering digital transformation of insurers using advanced automation and artificial intelligence tools. The company has a presence in India, US, UAE, and Kenya.

title: ADvTECH Digital Journey – The goal is uninterrupted learning
executive_summary: As we reflect over the last 2 years and the Covid-19 pandemic, it is surreal to see how far we have come and how resilient we have become. It is perhaps even stranger to suggest that the Covid-19 pandemic has become the catalyst to even better teacher and student engagement and innovation.

title: Martin & Zerfoss and Kite Technology Group optimize business advantages of Microsoft Defender for Business
executive_summary: Martin & Zerfoss is an independent insurance agency built on customer service and the community relationships of its founders.
