The agency needed to modernize its existing on-premises IT infrastructure, which was a traditional local server environment. It turned to Kite Technology Group to provide a solution that could meet its requirements, including security, availability, and simplicity. Kite Technology Group migrated Martin & Zerfoss to Microsoft Defender for Business to provide end-to-end, enterprise-level security with small-business affordability.

title: Career planning for the modern workforce - How University College Cork used Career Coach to transform the student experience
executive_summary: The world of work has changed dramatically in the last couple of years driven by the on-going global pandemic. The way that college students pursue opportunities in today's workforce is undergoing disruption in unprecedented ways.  Students hold greater expectations that college will prepare them for a career and help them find employment opportunities that align with their interests and skills.

title: Ferring Pharmaceuticals analyzes data using Microsoft Azure services to unify its global CRM strategy
executive_summary: Ferring Pharmaceuticals connects subsidiaries in 65 countries to help people worldwide build families and improve their lives. Its stakeholders sought to transform customer-related processes and align strategic key performance indicators (KPIs) by pursuing digitization. To achieve this, the pharma company unified storage standards across all divisions and moved the customer relationship management (CRM) data to the Azure cloud. Now, Azure Synapse Analytics empowers teams across the global organization with efficient business workflows and instant data insights available via Power BI.

title: ALTO and Quantum Security secure millions of financial transactions using Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: PT. ALTO Network is a financial services technology company that provides banking and payment solutions for all the major banks in Indonesia. The company’s goal is to provide seamless transactions through highly secure and innovative payment platforms. “We want to deliver 100 percent of our services without any security incidents or interruptions, and we want to protect our data,” says Alvin Christian, Information Security Engineer at PT. ALTO Network.

title: IT solutions company keeps its business growing with up-skilling programs and Azure-based offerings
executive_summary: Established in 1993 in Zagreb, Croatia, Span is an IT solutions company that helps power up the global presence of businesses of all sizes around the world. Span supports its customers in their digital transformations, paving the way for a successful digital future. The company has built a strategic partnership with Microsoft over 30 years, enabling Span to help customers get the most out of digital technology and tools. Aside from offering Azure-based cloud and security services, Span also provides customers with 24/7 support and service management as well as employee up-skilling programs.

title: Milton Keynes University Hospital simplifies endpoint management, elevates mobile clinical care efficiency with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Milton Keynes University Hospital is committed to providing the highest quality of care and adopting technology to boost operational efficiency and enhance patient care capabilities for its community. The hospital deployed Microsoft Intune to simplify endpoint management, improve configuration and control over its Zero Trust environment, and enhance the mobile device experience for hospital staff. Combining Intune with Azure Active Directory and Defender for Endpoint provides a comprehensive platform of software as a service solutions to manage and safeguard its environment across multiple devices, platforms, and operating systems. The hospital’s Digital Services staff can now deploy and update apps using dynamic grouping, set security policies and audit compliance, and remotely wipe devices. The result is streamlined core security and IT operations that help ensure clinicians and nurses can access the most up-to-date versions of the vital applications they use daily for patient care.

title: Providence Swedish makes medical advancements with Mixed Reality
executive_summary: For 112 years Providence Swedish’s focus has been improving the health and well-being of each person they serve. Since 1910 they have been recognized as one of the Seattle area’s best hospitals with the best doctors, nurses, and overall care in a variety of specialty areas.

title: Senco Gold and Diamonds delivers a sparkling customer experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Senco Gold and Diamonds is one of India's oldest and most trusted jewelry brands with a legacy of more than 50 years. It is among the most prominent jewelry retail players in India's eastern and north region and has over 130 stores across the nation. The 50+ year old brand is blending handcrafted art and craftsmanship with technology and believes in leveraging the latest digital tech to stay ahead of the curve in jewelry and retail sector. It has an ever-growing consumer base and caters to their diverse demands through its omni-channel approach.

title: Mr. Turing accelerates cognitive search, extends Elasticsearch with Azure
executive_summary: Alan, Mr. Turing’s software-as-a-service product, uses cognitive intelligence to understand documents that were written by humans for humans—and then use that knowledge to help humans immediately find the information they need. Alan’s digital “memory” contains about 1 million pages of information, which Alan uses to answer some 2,000 questions per day.

title: Evolving with speed with Microsoft Trusted Cloud
executive_summary: Investec partners with private, institutional, and corporate clients, offering international banking, investment, and wealth management services. The Investec journey sets it apart — from a small finance company founded in South Africa in 1974 to an international organisation with listings on the London and Johannesburg Stock Exchanges. One of the world’s most inspiring leaders Nelson Mandela described Investec as “a company which stands head and shoulders above its peers — not merely because of its phenomenal growth or its sound management of assets, but because it is a trendsetter.”

title: Sportisimo accelerates international growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Sportisimo, the leader among Czech sporting goods retailers, is expanding the number of customers within and beyond its national borders. In the past, opening a new branch abroad involved complex integration and alignment of disjointed software systems. Adopting Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance has cleared the way for a smooth expansion into other markets. With simplified technology stack, Sportisimo now needs only three to four months to expand to a new country from an ERP perspective, down from 14 months before.

title: Confused.com uses Microsoft Azure to halve analytics lead times
executive_summary: Confused.com is the UK’s longest running comparison service. With a team of 300, it serves a customer base of 15 million UK consumers. To stay ahead in a competitive marketplace, Confused.com chose to update its infrastructure by moving to Microsoft Azure and using Azure AI. Confused.com has improved marketing ROI by 10 percent, reduced the analytics lead time by 50 percent and is opening up new B2B channels to deliver its services as a service.

title: Signly builds with Microsoft Azure for a more inclusive future in tech innovation
executive_summary: Signly is a technology-driven startup that aims to address communication barriers faced by the Deaf community. Despite ongoing efforts to enhance accessibility, the Deaf community continues to grapple with significant challenges. Signly recognises the unique nature of sign language, asserting that it deserves recognition and promotion Signly recognizes the distinctive nature of sign language, asserting it deserves both acknowledgment and to be part of the mainstream. To address this critical need, Signly is creating revolutionary technology that assists hearing individuals in communicating with sign language users.

title: AmRest drives clarity and efficiency on a global scale with Microsoft Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: AmRest is a leading European restaurant operator with more than 2,100 restaurants in 22 countries. As the company grew, consistently collecting, analyzing, and comparing data across geographies and number of brands, became a challenge. To overcome this, AmRest relied on Microsoft Azure and Power BI to gain one source of truth across business domains, empowering its employees to assess the health of the business from a 360-degree angle.

title: Hamburg Commercial Bank finds cost savings, efficiencies, and improved sustainability with Windows 365
executive_summary: Hamburg Commercial Bank’s move right before the COVID-19 pandemic to untether its workforce from their desks was just in time to support the growing need for hybrid work. Now, the bank is building on this foundation and extending its device capabilities with Windows 365. With these Cloud PCs, traders and developers get right-size processing, and their devices let them pick up the next day right where they left off for greater efficiency. This has proven so effective that the bank is now making plans to roll out the solution more widely, citing reduced IT implementation and support needs plus overall cost savings, sustainability improvements, and a better overall user experience.

title: Fife Council modernizes infrastructure, reduces virtualization datacenter footprint by more than 80 percent with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: As one of Scotland’s largest municipal governments, Fife Council knows how to deliver what its citizens need. The council dependably and efficiently provides essential services like garbage collection, street lighting, public housing, and education to more than 370,000 residents. With that kind of mandate, Fife Council makes smart use of technology to keep its service levels high and costs low.

title: Washington Metro Area Transit Authority’s six-month migration to Microsoft Azure drives culture change and better service
executive_summary: The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) is the nation’s third-largest transit authority, serving Washington, DC, and adjacent areas of Maryland and Virginia. In mid-2022, it embarked on a transformative journey to modernize its digital infrastructure by migrating to the cloud. Maintaining a network of rail and bus services  with aging IT systems was contributing to high maintenance costs and service disruptions. Within six months, WMATA moved critical infrastructure operations, such as fare collection, to a more secure network on Microsoft Azure with help from Microsoft partner Presidio. WMATA’s digital transformation aims to deliver an excellent transit experience, and its business culture is embracing ongoing innovation.

title: Quintet Private Bank drives trust and security across its customer base using Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft 365 Defender (XDR)
executive_summary: As one of Europe’s leading wealth management institutions, Quintet Private Bank knows just how important data protection and cybersecurity are to establish trust amongst its customers. While devising a cloud strategy, the company saw an opportunity to build a future-proof SOC (Security Operations Center) powered by Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft 365 Defender (XDR). Created in collaboration with partner NVISO and Microsoft, the platform has radically transformed the way Quintet approaches security – helping it to stay even more on top of its customers’ data and assets.

title: Domino’s Pizza: Ensuring customer satisfaction with data-driven demand planning in Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Domino’s Pizza UK & Ireland Ltd. is squarely focused on its mission to deliver a better future through food people love while creating positive opportunities for its colleagues and the communities it serves. To create exceptional customer experiences and deliver the right product to the right store at the right time, expert inventory planners had been predicting demand using hundreds of spreadsheets. Domino’s optimized its forecasting by tapping into Microsoft Dynamics 365 with demand planning capabilities and the game-changing capabilities of AI, automation, and analytics.

title: Vestas uses .NET to manage sophisticated simulations and streamline development
executive_summary: Sustainability is always front and center for Vestas, and the global company relies on a robust cloud-native architecture to run high-performance computing resources like Vestas Turbine Simulator and Vestas Climate Library that help it reach its sustainability goals. With the open-source, cross-platform Microsoft .NET, Vestas can easily run sophisticated simulations at scale. The company has a multiplatform, multitool development environment, and .NET fits in seamlessly, providing much of the infrastructure that keeps Vestas Turbine Simulator and Vestas Climate Library running smoothly. Vestas has found that .NET offers excellent performance, cloud-native development, cross-platform compatibility, and easy interoperation with Azure services.

title: Optical solutions pioneer ZEISS Group uses Microsoft Fabric to advance innovation with data analytics
executive_summary: ZEISS Group knew it could put its “mountains” of disparate data to better use. But the company needed a way to break free of its ever-increasing number of data silos so it could work from a single source of truth across all its data analytics workflows. With targeted technical goals including evolving its enterprise (Big) DATA Analytics platform (eVA, based on the Data Mesh principles) establishing end-to-end data lifecycle acceleration, and supporting business growth through AI innovation, ZEISS Group chose Microsoft Fabric on the Azure platform as its solution. With Fabric, ZEISS Group can connect and combine all its data sources without creating redundant data silos and without the need to invest in additional infrastructure. ZEISS Group feels eVA, supported by Microsoft Fabric on Azure, will provide the architecture and governance it needs for a secure and trusted data supply chain that can be shared effortlessly across a range of business units—allowing the company to focus on creating industry-leading optical solutions.

title: Eduvos simplifies student enrolment experience from 90 days to instant with Microsoft and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: “We were constantly developing actionable insights,” says Dr. Riaan Steenberg, Executive Director at Eduvos, a South African higher education institution that once grappled with a fragmented reporting landscape. The manual processes were transformed through Eduvos’ collaboration with Braintree by leveraging Dynamics 365 solutions. As a result, Eduvos has gained real-time insights, allowing it to run more smoothly and deliver more learning opportunities to students in South Africa. With Microsoft 365 and Azure, the institution also streamlined student interactions, from enrolment to course completion, thus bringing a more satisfying educational experience.

title: Clifford Chance trailblazes Microsoft responsible AI to improve services for its legal clients
executive_summary: “Magic circle” law firm Clifford Chance is a digitalisation leader, focused on leveraging new technologies for the benefit of its clients. The company has built a solid data platform on Microsoft Azure on which to innovate with new technologies including the new generation of large language models (LLMs), Azure OpenAI, Microsoft Azure and Copilot for Microsoft 365. Early innovations are already delivering value. Cognitive translation has proved to be one of the fastest growing products IT has ever released. The potential for Copilot for Microsoft 365 is vast.

title: One NZ democratizes data access, enabling instant customer support with Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Analytics
executive_summary: New Zealand’s largest mobile carrier, One NZ, adheres to its central value—customers. To give nearly 1,000 users a real-time, tailored view of customer data, it upgraded to Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Analytics (RTA) within less than two weeks. The new platform elevated One NZ’s customer service and added depth to its analytics, transforming raw data into actionable insights. Empowered teams can now make accurate, data-driven decisions and respond to customer inquiries nearly twice as fast as before.

title: Hargreaves Lansdown achieves transformational benefits with Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Hargreaves Lansdown is the UK’s number one platform for private investors, employing over 2,000 people. They are trusted by more than 1.7 million clients who together invest over £120 billion. The business was keen to explore the potential of artificial intelligence and, especially, Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365. The response from users has been fantastic, with improved accessibility and significant productivity savings.

title: Oregon State University protects vital research and sensitive data with Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft Defender
executive_summary: Oregon State University (OSU), an R1 research-focused university, places a high priority on safeguarding its research to maintain its esteemed reputation. In the spring of 2021, OSU experienced an extensive cybersecurity incident unlike what they had seen before. After initiating their first full incident response, OSU found criminal efforts underpinned the incident. This took a large amount of manual work and luck to avert potential problems, highlighting a need for improved security measures. The cyberattack revealed gaps in OSU’s security operations, specifically that their tools were not sufficient against the threats they were confronting. In response to this incident, OSU created their Security Operations Center (SOC), which has become the centerpiece of the university’s security effort.

title: OPAP invests in AI to simplify digital workstreams and boost employee efficiency with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: OPAP, Greece's leading gaming company, was one of the first companies globally to integrate Microsoft Copilot to transform its daily workflows. With Copilot's introduction, OPAP aims to save time and automate routine tasks, as well as make meetings more actionable, efficient, and quick.

title: Avocados From Mexico and Lantern automate processes using Microsoft Fabric to reduce weekly reporting time by up to 95%
executive_summary: Nonprofit marketing organization Avocados From Mexico (AFM), which works to drive demand for Mexican avocados in the United States, used Microsoft Fabric to centralize disparate data sources and create a single, trustworthy place where employees can access data for reporting and analytics. The group found it difficult to produce accurate, efficient reports due to fragmented data and manual processes. AFM worked with Lantern, a Microsoft partner and Microsoft-only consulting firm, to implement Fabric and create a secure, accessible source of truth. Now, employees can create reliable reports quickly, so leaders can make better data-driven decisions. AFM has significantly increased productivity and reduced costs by automating processes.

title: Lumen Technologies accelerates dev productivity, sees financial gains with GitHub Copilot, Azure DevOps, and Visual Studio
executive_summary: For Lumen Technologies, customer demands catalyzed a need to streamline developer workflows, accelerate problem solving and defect management, and increase developer productivity to build customized solutions quickly and seamlessly. Working with Microsoft, Lumen sponsored a full developer population trial program for GitHub Copilot at its location in Bangalore, India, with nearly 600 engineers. Lumen saw that the developers gained efficiency, flexibility, and security while delivering great code faster. The success of the India pilot prompted Lumen to globally scale the solution to all of its 2,400 engineers. In addition to significant productivity gains, Copilot is supporting greater democratization of technology across Lumen and supporting potential financial benefits between $95 million and $300 million.

title: INSPIRE Entertainment Resort: Establishes a Global Resort Integrated Service Environment with Microsoft Surface
executive_summary: INSPIRE Entertainment Resort, located on Yeongjong Island in Incheon, features 1,275 rooms and aspires to be the largest casino resort in Northeast Asia, driven by Hallyu culture. INSPIRE uses Microsoft Surface Pro 9 and Go 3 for digital check-ins, orders, and payments, creating a paperless, efficient, and secure environment. These devices support multiple languages, enhancing convenience for global guests, and seamlessly integrate with the resort’s management system, boosting operational efficiency and service quality.

title: Azure Kubernetes Service boosts the pace of feature development at Victoria’s Secret & Co.
executive_summary: As one of the biggest brands in the world, Victoria’s Secret & Co. (VS&Co) welcomes nearly 75 million unique visitors to its website during peak times and major shopping events like holidays and its semi-annual sales. With these large spikes in traffic, the retailer sought out solutions to support the site experience and migrated its containers to Azure Kubernetes Service to gain scalability, elasticity, availability, and resiliency. Today, Victoria’s Secret & Co. has 99.99% availability and has increased its deployments and releases from 9 per year to roughly 3,300 annually.

title: QNET increases security response efficiency 60 percent with Microsoft Security Solutions
executive_summary: Wellness and lifestyle focused direct-selling company QNET was growing internationally. The company found that its cloud solutions were at risk of cyberattack, so it sought out improved data security, better identity management, and refined control of role-based permissions. Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel, and Microsoft Copilot for Security gave the company visibility into and control over employees’ permissions and roles, making the apps and data QNET relies on for everyday functionality more secure than ever.

title: Softchoice harnesses Microsoft Copilot and reduces content creation time by up to 70%, accelerating customer AI journeys with its experience
executive_summary: A leading software- and cloud-focused IT solutions provider, Microsoft partner Softchoice is harnessing generative AI–powered tools to unlock business efficiencies and offer customers a hands-on experience for their own AI journeys. In 2023, Softchoice tested Copilot for Microsoft 365 with a cross-organizational group to explore how generative AI can streamline operations and empower employees. By prioritizing employee education, the company is realizing productivity gains, including a 97% reduction in time spent summarizing technical meetings and up to 70% less time spent on content creation. Softchoice employees are experiencing firsthand how Copilot can transform daily workflows and sharing their expertise to inspire their own customers.

title: Aztec Group uses Copilot for Microsoft 365 to enhance the client experience whilst powering efficiencies
executive_summary: N/A

title: Schaeffler uses Microsoft Sustainability Manager for systematic planning of decarbonization measures
executive_summary: To reduce emissions, companies like Schaeffler need to identify optimal reduction measures. The Motion Technology Company relies on decarbonization scenarios and requires a central platform that can process big data.

title: Aberdeen City Council adopts Microsoft 365 Copilot, freeing staff capacity to better serve residents
executive_summary: Facing spiked demand for resident services and limited staff capacity, Aberdeen City Council sought AI solution to automate staff’s most repetitive administrative workload.

title: Egyptian Tax Authority improves tax compliance using Microsoft SQL Server
executive_summary: A longstanding shadow economy in Egypt was costing the country significant tax revenue. The Ministry of Finance, via the Egyptian Tax Authority, decided the best solution was to digitize the tax return system to create a single, unified platform.
products: Power BI, SQL Server, Windows Server

title: Belgotex unifies sales and manufacturing operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Belgotex, a South African carpet manufacturer with global operations, faced inefficiencies due to outdated and disparate systems. Critical data was scattered and departments were disconnected, hindering informed decision-making.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Power BI, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft 365, Power Apps, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Power Pages, Dynamics 365 Finance, Microsoft Fabric

title: Closure to comeback in one week: Oshwal Education & Relief Board empowers 3,000 students with Microsoft 365 A3
executive_summary: Oshwal Education & Relief Board, serving more than 3,000 students in Kenya, faced a critical challenge when COVID-19 forced schools to close, requiring rapid solutions to continue providing quality education.

title: Vixxo finds the modern fix with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Vixxo needed a modern, flexible, and scalable solution to optimize customer service experiences with more efficient dispatching and easily accessible customer history information.

title: Success with Intune Suite streamlines Krones AG global operations
executive_summary: Krones AG faced significant challenges managing over 25,000 Windows and 11,000 iOS devices globally. Reliance on third-party vendors led to increased complexity, security risks, and operational inefficiencies, hindering its operations.

title: Softchoice harnesses Microsoft Copilot and reduces content creation time by up to 70%, accelerating customer AI journeys with its experience
executive_summary: A leading software- and cloud-focused IT solutions provider, Microsoft partner Softchoice is harnessing generative AI–powered tools to unlock business efficiencies and offer customers a hands-on experience for their own AI journeys. In 2023, Softchoice tested Copilot for Microsoft 365 with a cross-organizational group to explore how generative AI can streamline operations and empower employees. By prioritizing employee education, the company is realizing productivity gains, including a 97% reduction in time spent summarizing technical meetings and up to 70% less time spent on content creation. Softchoice employees are experiencing firsthand how Copilot can transform daily workflows and sharing their expertise to inspire their own customers.

title: St. Luke’s transforms patient care with digital collaboration among providers using Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Employees at St. Luke’s University Health Network (SLUHN) embrace the concept of digital health transformation with vigor, vision, and a commitment to caring that’s palpable in each of its 10 hospitals and 300 sites across Pennsylvania and New Jersey. Since the network deployed the Microsoft 365 productivity cloud and began empowering care teams to collaborate better and make faster decisions, there’s a sense of excitement over the potential to improve patient experience.

title: Miami HEAT boosts season ticket sales by 30% and saves approximately $1 million on operations
executive_summary: The Miami HEAT has one of the highest customer satisfaction scores in the National Basketball Association and that comes from a sharp focus on delivering superior fan experiences. To make every game and team interaction memorable, the HEAT relies on insights gained through Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Power BI, and Microsoft Azure to gain a 360-degree view of customers and operations and to increase fan engagement. With these tools, the HEAT can make sense of data, streamline operations, and deliver benefits like approximately $1 million in operational cost reduction and a 30 percent increase in season ticket sales.

title: Future-focused Dutch water utility counters climate change with smart use of data on Azure
executive_summary: Dutch water utility PWN streams 106 billion liters of pure, high-quality water to a million and a half citizens in North Holland. The utility monitors and maintains the health of the dunes that act as a natural filtration mechanism for 25 percent of the water, but that complicates service delivery. And running both the business side of the utility and the systems to monitor water quality requires enormous data stores. PWN found one answer for both issues: moving its SAP estate from an expiring cloud hosting provider to Microsoft Azure to meet PWN’s complex business needs. With all the data on one platform, the utility can better manage its assets, communicate with customers, predict climate change effects, and help protect against them.

title: Team Rubicon uses Dynamics 365 to serve communities during crisis
executive_summary: By combining infection rate data with other information sources like potential weather events and social vulnerability, we can see which areas are bending the curve and which aren’t there yet. We can find gaps in aid and fill them. Using Dynamics 365, it’s easy for us to continually build up the story of each individual and determine where their unique qualities would be most useful. They can complete courses based on their desire to learn new skills or bolster the skills they already have, and we log all that information in Dynamics 365. This creates incredible opportunities for that individual, and ultimately it helps us harness their capabilities and capacities to better respond to disasters and help people around the world.

title: Virgin Atlantic easily creates custom-built mobile applications with Microsoft Power Apps and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: At a time when air travel can sometimes feel like a chore, United Kingdom–based Virgin Atlantic is doing things differently in its ambition to become the world’s most-loved airline. To do this, Virgin Atlantic needs to ensure that employees have the tools and information they need to make each travel step as smooth as possible. Using Microsoft Power Apps and Dynamics 365, Virgin Atlantic now has a better view of its customers, and can quickly and easily develop apps that help its business and field workers excel at their jobs and bring even more love to the travel experience.

title: Siemens Healthineers moves more computing to the cloud to support value-based care development
executive_summary: Helping millions of patients benefit from better care? All in a day’s work for worldwide healthcare technology company Siemens Healthineers. Siemens Healthineers is leading the digitalization of healthcare with its Digital Ecosystem, which helps health providers and solution developers bring more value to the delivery of care, ultimately improving the quality of insights derived from healthcare data. Siemens Healthineers uses Microsoft Azure to make solutions more accessible, and it uses Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and other tools for a fast, efficient, and competitive development pipeline.

title: BP implements solid cloud governance and effective cost management with Azure
executive_summary: BP has moved a significant portion of its IT resources to the Microsoft Azure cloud platform over the past five years as part of a company-wide digital transformation. To manage and deliver all its Azure resources in the most efficient possible way, BP uses Azure Policy for governance to control access to Azure services. At the same time, the company uses Azure Cost Management to track usage of Azure services. BP has been able to reduce its cloud spend by 40 percent with the insights it has gained.

title: Greek school drives learning forward with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Since its founding in 1949, Greek private school Avgoulea-Linardatou has been teaching generations of students. According to its leadership, the move to digital teaching and learning with Microsoft Teams has delighted students―while reducing IT costs and administration. In 2020, when the COVID-19 health crisis struck, the platform helped the institution mitigate its impact on learning. Newly empowered with digital tools and skills, the school seamlessly transitioned to a remote model, ushering in a new era of differentiated learning in a hybrid setup.

title: Mining firm uses IoT and data science to cut downtime, reduce costs
executive_summary: Insight collaborated with Microsoft and Newcrest Mining Limited―an international mining company based in Australia―to develop an intelligent Internet of Things (IoT) solution, enabling the company to manage operations with greater insight, efficiency, and precision. By using an Azure IoT solution to collect data and push AI workloads to the edge, Newcrest optimizes operational performance and predictive maintenance—thereby reducing unplanned downtime and delivering quantifiable financial value.

title: Insights from Microsoft Workplace Analytics help Lumen drive ‘anything is possible’ mentality
executive_summary: As a world-class leading technology company, Lumen (formerly CenturyLink) recognizes that sales is the foundation of the company’s success. In this video, Meghan Wilkinson, Vice President, Application Engineering for Global Enterprise Commercial Excellence at Lumen, explains how Microsoft Workplace Analytics put real-time information into the hands of sales leadership for the first time. See how they used insights to uncover and replicate the best practices of their top performers, provide effective manager coaching, and drive sales excellence by improving productivity and well-being.

title: It’s all about security and scale for this fintech
executive_summary: OpenWrks is a fintech start-up and technology innovator in the open banking space. It works with some of the UK’s biggest banks and building societies to help people to gain control over their financial information.

title: Transformation delivers new customer insight
executive_summary: EQ is a British-based outsourcing business that is a leading specialist in technology, finance and administrative services in complex or regulated markets. It is the UK’s largest provider of employee share plans and share registrations.

title: Nonprofit Cahoots responds to community challenges in Western Australia by pivoting its business and growing its team with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: When Jess Karlsson, Chief Executive Officer of Cahoots, wrote her first memo to staff regarding COVID-19, she remembers how working life immediately shifted and all job titles “went out the window.” Cahoots is an Australian community organization that hosts programs and camps for children and young people who are living with disabilities or facing exceptional challenges. “Just because we had the pandemic didn’t mean that our services were any less needed by the community,” says Sam Evans, Communications and Events Coordinator at Cahoots. “Actually, we saw a greater need because so many other organizations had been forced to shut their doors, and suddenly, people were stuck at home and needing our support more than ever.”

title: Brookfield sets a new standard for innovation in real estate with WillowTwin and Azure Digital Twins
executive_summary: Dedicated to creating “live, work, and play” ecosystems, Brookfield Properties is one of the world’s largest and most innovative commercial office landlords. Before building its state-of-the-art One Manhattan West (OMW) property, it recognized an opportunity to use a digital twin to lower costs, save energy, and offer differentiated experiences to its tenants. Microsoft and Willow were key partners in the Brookfield digital transformation journey. Together, they built a digital replica of OMW and all the systems within it, unlocking cost savings, energy optimizations, and value-added services today while laying the groundwork for a digital-first future.

title: Bristol Dental Specialists launches virtual visits and provides faster, more personalized care with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: When Dr. Adrian Watts set up his first virtual consultation with a prospective patient using Microsoft Teams, he was skeptical that a video meeting could rival the experience of an in-person consultation. As a specialist in restorative dentistry and implant surgeon, Dr. Watts requires a detailed understanding of his patient’s needs before creating a treatment plan. However, given that COVID-19 restrictions were in place and the United Kingdom was in lockdown, minimizing unnecessary travel was a top priority. By participating in a Teams meeting, the patient saved himself a 70-mile journey to Bristol Dental Specialists, the private referral-based practice in Bristol, England where Dr. Watts is a founding partner.

title: F5 finds winning formula with the commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Application delivery and security provider F5 began selling in the commercial marketplace five years ago—nearly at the commercial marketplace’s inception. Since then, the company has continued to invest in building the cloud route to market and embrace selling through the marketplace as a key part of its sales strategy. Cloud marketplaces started as a simple directory of third-party apps, but now they have evolved to sophisticated distribution platforms with functionality for users to discover, procure, and deploy relevant applications. F5’s evolution in the commercial marketplace has helped customers simplify the deployment of their technology as well as unlock a sales channel that allows F5 to rapidly scale. This winning formula led the company to being named Microsoft 2021 Partner of the Year Award winner for the Commercial Marketplace.

title: BRF transforms data, democratizes AI to improve business outcomes with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Based in Brazil, BRF helps create a better future by producing high-quality food. As the company became more data driven, it wanted to use AI to better predict manufacturing efficiencies and make sophisticated sales recommendations to its customers. BRF launched a Center of Excellence in advanced analytics, which spearheaded the adoption of Microsoft Azure Machine Learning with its machine learning operations and automated machine learning capabilities. Business users from across the company access the models and the results to make decisions that improve profitability, agility, efficiency, and customer satisfaction.

title: WWF Italia makes preserving the planet easier with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: WWF Italia supports conservation work not just in Italy, but in other nations where its parent organization, World Wildlife Fund, works to save endangered species and conserve wild lands. After years of struggling with disjointed on-premises systems to track and report on funding, the nonprofit opted for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central online. Now the nonprofit is making valuable staff time go farther, while also providing critically important reporting to donors, government agencies, and internal groups with Power BI. For WWF Italia, getting the greatest value out of its funds is about something much more than profit—it’s about preserving the most precious places and creatures on earth.

title: Fairfax County creates transparency, efficiency, accountability with Dynamics 365 ’VFOIA‘ Tracker
executive_summary: Public requests come in many forms. However, those requests falling under the various Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) laws of local, state, and federal government arrive with the mandate of being regulated and requiring an answer “as quickly and in the most transparent way possible,” according to Amanda Kastl, Countywide FOIA Officer at Fairfax County, Virginia.

title: QuoteWizard boosts engineers’ efficiency, employee satisfaction, competitive edge with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: QuoteWizard connects online customers with highly competitive insurance quotes. But the company’s IT leaders realized that its human-powered development ticketing system wasn’t scalable or flexible enough to keep up with company growth—and that engineering teams couldn’t prioritize the innovative work they really wanted to do. QuoteWizard used Microsoft Power Platform to build an automated, AI-powered ticket routing system to match tickets with the right talent at the right time to help the company improve efficiency, hone its competitive edge, and deliver a better employee experience.
products: Azure, Power Apps, Power Automate, Azure Machine Learning

title: Datasite automates M&A and speeds redaction by 80%, saving customers valuable time with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: Mergers and acquisitions (M&A) take a lot of work and attention to detail. Datasite helps guide its customers through the complex processes, including steps to redact highly sensitive data before a deal is final. The company wanted to automate and streamline the redaction process using AI while still safeguarding its customers’ information, so it turned to Microsoft Azure Cognitive Service for Language and Translator to enhance its Datasite Diligence application. Using Language Service named entity recognition, Datasite added a new feature, Redaction AI. Now, the lawyers and investment bankers who coordinate sales can reduce redaction times by up to 80 percent, helping to move deals forward faster and support successful outcomes.
products: Azure, Azure AI Language, Azure AI Services, Azure AI Translator

title: Moneysworth & Best works smarter, drives agility with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: For almost 40 years, Moneysworth & Best Quality Shoe Care has developed and distributed shoe care and foot care products to retailers across North America, offering the largest and most comprehensive shoe care assortment in the industry, worldwide. Owners at the family-run business wanted to streamline business processes, optimize operations, and provide better work-life balance for company leadership and employees, so Moneysworth & Best replaced an on-premises enterprise resource planning solution with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. As a result, the company now uses cloud-based tools to react quickly to changing markets, work smarter, and perform better with real-time business insights.

title: FintechOS powers low code digital financial services platform with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: FintechOS is on a mission to help banks, financial institutions, and insurers digitalize their operations and provide hyper-personalized customer experiences. To achieve this ambition, it uses the power of Microsoft Azure to give clients the ability to deliver cutting edge end-to-end digital products in weeks, rather than months. The FintechOS low-code digital creation platform leverages the latest technologies, including artificial intelligence (AI) and advanced data analytics. FintechOS clients can harness the power of its low code solutions to build the applications, experiences or journeys demanded by modern customers and bridging the gap between legacy and digital processes.

title: Ursuline Academy of Dallas uses Microsoft 365 with Surface Hub devices to support individualized remote learning
executive_summary: When COVID-19 forced schools worldwide to suddenly switch to remote learning, Ursuline Academy of Dallas was prepared. The Microsoft Showcase School had already adopted Microsoft Teams and OneNote for all schoolwork and collaboration to support personalized learning, making the switch to remote learning seamless. But when the 2020 to 2021 school year shaped up to be a hybrid learning environment, the school adopted Surface Hub 2S devices in every classroom for a truly immersive, collaborative experience. With the Surface Hub and other Surface devices, students can screen share, use a digital whiteboard, and stay closely connected with friends and teachers from wherever they’re learning.

title: Powering vital research at the University of Leeds
executive_summary: University of Leeds is one of the prestigious Russell Group of universities and a leading UK research university. In 2014, it established the Leeds Institute for Data Analytics (LIDA) to facilitate multi-disciplinary research collaboration both across the university and with external research and commercial partners.

title: Zurich Germany: Disrupting the insurance industry with Microsoft AI
executive_summary: Zurich Germany is part of the worldwide operating Zurich Insurance Group. It is among the leading insurers in Germany with a wide range of property and life insurance products. To stay competitive and mitigate risk, analyzing customer data has always been at the center of Zurich Germany's operation. But in 2020, Chief Data Officer of Zurich Germany, Dr Michael Zimmer, took things to a new level by introducing Al technology with Microsoft — giving the business not just a more accurate way to calculate premiums, but to optimize business processes across the entire customer journey.

title: VEGAS Creative Software gives video makers natural-sounding voiceover using Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: People make videos for a lot of reasons, and VEGAS Creative Software offers something for them all. From home video amateurs to TikTok influencers to Oscar-winning pros, customers use VEGAS software to bring their content to life. VEGAS Creative Software adopted Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services, including Translator and text to speech functionality, to augment its popular VEGAS Pro application with advanced voice capabilities. It completed development in days, and now its customers quickly and easily add natural-sounding voiceover to their videos. Cognitive Services provides more than 270 prebuilt neural voices across 110 languages and variants, plus a range of different speaking styles. Video makers now save money and create higher-impact content faster, and VEGAS Pro is generating more value and attracting new customers.

title: Amnis: Giving SMEs the financial tools to compete with Europe’s largest companies
executive_summary: For large businesses, traditional banks offer a range of competitive international payment and currency exchange options. But in 2015, Swiss payment service provider, Amnis, decided to give SMEs the same advantages – by creating a cloud-based WebApp that gave SME finance managers access to simple, low-fee monetary transfer tools. Six years later, Amnis is a big hit with SMEs in Switzerland, prompting the startup to set its eyes on expanding into Europe and beyond. An ambitious target that required a complete restructuring of Amnis’s IT infrastructure to meet its growing business demands.

title: Des Moines Public Schools improves education experience for staff and students with Microsoft Surface
executive_summary: When designing education programs and curricula for its students, Des Moines Public Schools keeps its vision of becoming the nation’s model for urban education top of mind. Wanting to update its approach to digital learning inside and outside of the classroom, the district turned to Microsoft Surface, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, and other Microsoft solutions to connect both students and staff with an excellent education experience available at their fingertips. By moving to the cloud and deploying portable, durable devices, Des Moines Public Schools decreased the burden on IT staff, improved device reliability, and reduced long-term costs.

title: Nazarbayev Intellectual Schools ensures education continuity for 15,000 students using Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Weather-related school closures are common in Kazakhstan, where winter temperatures often drop below -30°C (-22°F). Well before pandemic restrictions came into place, the Nazarbayev Intellectual Schools, a prestigious K-12 school network for gifted children, had to find a way to teach students remotely. Now students and teachers from 20 facilities across the country are using Microsoft 365 for Education. All lessons, conversations, content, and apps are accessible through Microsoft Teams, delivering a continued educational experience to 15,000 students, even in sub-zero conditions.

title: How Cobase is using cloud technology to build and grow its fintech solution
executive_summary: Dutch fintech Cobase is a multibank platform that allows companies to manage accounts from many different banks via a single platform that includes a central Payment Hub, Cash Management and Treasury modules. Born in Azure, the company has made cloud technology the very foundation of its solution and the key to its current and future operations. Azure is helping them to build out their solution at high pace and stay compliant with strict regulations imposed on the financial services industry.

title: RHI Magnesita: How a Synapse Analytics data platform is transforming the refractory industry
executive_summary: For more than 100 years, refractory products have played an essential role in the manufacturing of everyday materials such as glass and steel. As the world leader in refractories, RHI Magnesita wanted to expand their digital services to customers. An aspect of this involved offering not just a managed installation of their refractory products, but also continuously monitoring and identifying when these products need replacing – helping raise efficiency and avoid production having to shut down unnecessarily. Developing this kind of predictive analytics required RHI Magnesita to undertake a significant digital transformation and rebuild their entire IT infrastructure on Azure.

title: Derbyshire Constabulary's new, digital way of working with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Derbyshire Constabulary is one of the UK’s 43 regional police forces. With a staff of 3,500, the force covers an area of over 1,000 square miles with a population of just under one million. Like many UK police forces, Derbyshire Constabulary has engaged with the National Enabling Programmes to introduce a secure digital platform with national standards that enable new ways of working and collaborating with the ultimate goal of serving its communities in better ways and protecting the public. Analytics and digital collaboration based on Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams are key elements of this programme. While Derbyshire Constabulary was forward-thinking in its adoption of these technologies, its teams were taken aback by the full extent of the potential use cases that evolved as their use of the digital tools progressed. Their learnings offer useful insights for other forces around the UK.

title: Fujitsu delivers up to 99.9 percent scanning accuracy with Azure AI form and character recognition
executive_summary: Fujitsu is the world leader in document scanning technology, with more than 50 percent of global market share, but that doesn’t stop the company from constantly innovating. To improve the performance and accuracy of its cloud scanning solution, Fujitsu incorporated Microsoft Azure Form Recognizer. It took only a few months to deploy the new technologies, and they have boosted character recognition rates as high as 99.9 percent. This helps Fujitsu deliver market-leading innovation and give its customers powerful and flexible tools for end-to-end document management.

title: Singapore precision plastics manufacturer uses Microsoft Cloud to improve business productivity and collaboration
executive_summary: Sunningdale Tech Ltd, a Singapore-based precision plastics engineering company, needed to transition its end-of-life on-premise infrastructure. It decided to migrate to the cloud and reimagine its working culture. The company deployed Microsoft Azure as its cloud infrastructure and used Microsoft 365 to effectively manage licensing requirements and information security. As a result, managers now have better visibility and control over licenses, employees can collaborate and connect securely on the cloud, and the company has the flexibility to scale as it shapes its culture of collaboration.
products: Azure, Azure ExpressRoute, SAP on Azure, Microsoft 365

title: relayr optimizes elevator maintenance with Azure Machine Learning and IoT
executive_summary: Elevators today are able to transport passengers and loads at speeds of 60 or even over 70 km/h—and they cover longer daily distances than many cars. This makes thorough maintenance essential, but that involves a lot of time, effort, and expense. This is where remote monitoring and predictive maintenance, i.e., the use of artificial intelligence (AI) to help determine the future need for maintenance, come into play. Hardly any other market segment benefits as much from these technologies as the operation and servicing of elevators. relayr, a subsidiary of Munich Re, draws on Microsoft Azure services for its remote monitoring solution for elevators. The cloud architecture provides relayr with a blueprint for solutions in all kinds of projects.

title: Gameloft removes language barriers, maximizes player collaboration with Translator, part of Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: People from every country and all languages play online games, but they need to communicate with each other to collaborate in strategy games. When Gameloft’s studio in Bulgaria launched March of Empires, providing players with accurate in-game message translation was essential. Gameloft turned to Translator, part of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services, to translate more than 100 languages in real time so players can seamlessly chat, strategize, and banter with other players. The wildly popular game has built global friendships and seen 100 million installations since its debut.

title: Kristiansund Kommune: Transforming the Norwegian public sector through the cloud
executive_summary: Kristiansund Kommune is a municipality located on the western coast of Norway. A small town of just 24,000 inhabitants, Kristiansund has big aspirations for its citizens and believes in using technology to empower future change. Over the past few years, this has meant migrating to the cloud and using it to develop ground-breaking solutions specifically designed for its community.

title: Texas City Independent School District drives 21st century education with Microsoft 365 and robust collaboration
executive_summary: If you travel 50 miles southeast of Houston you arrive in Texas City, Texas. Known for its deepwater port, the city is home to robust petroleum-refining and petrochemical-manufacturing industries. Serving the community is Texas City Independent School District (ISD) with nearly 8,000 students across 13 schools. The district carries a strong commitment to collaborating on issues of technology and instruction, with a keen eye to what will matter for students as they grow and graduate. This collaborative spirit has helped shape decisions about everything from which devices to choose to best practices for security, and how to best incorporate learning technology into the classroom experience. These efforts are facilitated and supported by their choice to embrace Microsoft 365 and Windows devices as a gold standard across the district.

title: Heidelberg Materials unifies its global CRM strategy with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Heidelberg Materials is one of the world’s largest manufacturers of building materials. Due to several acquisitions, mergers, and joint ventures, the company had inherited several different methods of customer relationship management that were not compatible or working in tandem. This made it difficult to track customer relationships and share best practices within the company. With the implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Heidelberg Materials was able to create a unified CRM solution that facilitates the open and productive exchange of best practices across the company’s different markets and sales teams. Now, sales agents have better insight into how other teams are working, enabling the company to be more unified and consistent as it builds stronger relationships with customers.

title: Chevron’s Supply Chain Cloud Transformation
executive_summary: The immediate priority of the SCDF project was to replace the existing legacy on-premise data platform with an equivalent data platform deployed in Microsoft Azure. The Publicis Sapient Product & Data Engineering team partnered with Chevron CSCM to build a new Platform as a Service (PaaS) solution in Azure to deliver on this vision. The new platform was deployed in production using Microsoft Project to coordinate the ‘cutover’, a carefully sequenced set of steps to ensure that the project is deployed simultaneously with all data publishers and consumers reconnecting to the new platform.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Microsoft partner Veritone provides a synthetic voice solution featuring Azure AI to save time and reach new audiences
executive_summary: Launched in May 2021, Veritone Voice is a lifelike text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-speech (STS) voice synthesis solution powered by its Enterprise AI platform, aiWARE™. Voice work is time-consuming and costly, and when creating audio for different audiences, content may lose its signature voice persona. Using proprietary and third-party AI engines, including Custom Neural Voice (CNV) from Azure Cognitive Services, Veritone is working with The Bert Show and iHeartMedia podcasts to use talent-approved synthetic voices to save time and scale their audio content to new audiences.

title: Yapı Kredi preferred M365 E5 Information Protection for data security
executive_summary: Leading the banking sector in Türkiye with a digital banking active customer penetration of 89 percent, Yapı Kredi increases data security by using the Microsoft 365 E5 Information Protection solution. Leading the banking sector in Türkiye with a digital banking active customer penetration of 89 percent, Yapı Kredi increases data security by using the Microsoft 365 E5 Information Protection solution.

title: NTNU helps K-12 students master English faster with innovative learning platform powered by Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: We spoke with Dr. Hao-Jan Howard Chen, Professor, Department of English at National Taiwan Normal University (NTNU) about his vision for Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service and the university’s collaboration with the Taiwan Ministry of Education on an English-language learning platform. This is an overview of that conversation, summarized in part by Azure OpenAI Service.

title: San Raffaele University and Research Hospital transforms clinical research and delivers precision medicine using the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: San Raffaele University and Research Hospital is one of the largest of its kind in Italy, as well as a pioneer of cutting-edge translational research and technology adoption at both a national and international level. During the pandemic, the organization saw an opportunity to start using artificial intelligence to better triage incoming symptomatic patients and identify their future reaction to the virus. Fast forward three years, the pilot project has been turned into an intelligent data solution powered by AI – which San Raffaele is going to use to transform clinical research, improve the end-to-end patient journey inside the hospital and accelerate its own move towards precision medicine.

title: Providence uses Azure OpenAI Service to decrease clinician burnout and expedite patient care
executive_summary: With the ever-growing popularity of electronic messaging between patients and caregivers, US healthcare organization Providence faced a deluge of incoming messages. This flood required triage and interfered with the time providers needed to spend with their patients. Providence clinicians, informaticists, and AI specialists developed a new product, ProvARIA, based on Azure OpenAI Service. ProvARIA classifies messages, directs them to the appropriate caregiver, and frees providers to focus on patient care.

title: Westnet boosts B2B sales with powerful product descriptions with Shopranos and Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Westnet, a provider of technology solutions and e-commerce platform across Greece, Cyprus, and Poland, struggled to generate thousands of product descriptions, missing out on search engine traffic and sales opportunities. With SoftOne's Shopranos, built on Azure OpenAI Service, Westnet's e-shop was easily setup, laborious content creation process was automated and streamlined. Results? An 80 percent reduction in content generation time. The move boosted Westnet’s sales and SEO performance. Now, the company is eyeing new markets, taking advantage of Shopranos’ multilingual capabilities.

title: PwC delivers the human-led tech-powered future of auditing with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) is a leader in the professional services sector and it’s a long-time technology innovator. With Next Generation Audit, PwC aims to usher in a new era of audit that is human-led, tech-powered, and data-driven. PwC is exploring how the generative AI capabilities from Azure OpenAI Service running on Azure global infrastructure can support a vision that includes: increased audit efficiency and transparency; reduction of unnecessary audit burden on clients; and enhanced data acquisition and utilization. PwC has a focus on relevant data regulations and compliance protocols, as well as robust data security supported by Microsoft.

title: Revolutionizing customer service: ERGO Insurance uses AI and Microsoft Azure to provide 24/7 personalized support
executive_summary: Providing top-tier customer service is a cornerstone of ERGO, one of the country’s leading insurance companies. To serve thousands of customers sustainably, ERGO Insurance used a Microsoft Azure-powered AI Virtual Agent (VA) developed by EBO. The solution revolutionized the company’s customer service by providing personalized, 24/7 assistance. It also streamlined policy renewals and enabled direct payment through the VA. Customer service efficiency has increased and ERGO Insurance expects this to raise customer satisfaction.

title: Iveco Group amplifies employee productivity with Chat IVG, powered by Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Iveco Group determined that artificial intelligence (AI) could tackle a wide-ranging opportunity and challenge for the enterprise. Iveco Group is the first manufacturer/automotive company headquartered in Italy to adopt Azure OpenAI services in a production environment by creating an internal smart chatbot called "Chat IVG," leveraging generative AI. As Chat IVG gains wide acceptance, Iveco Group is identifying, experimenting, and expanding AI use for scenarios where everyday work requires access to a large amount of data, communications, and documentation.

title: Onepoint: being a consulting firm in the age of generative AI and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: From Paris to Sydney, via Bordeaux and Kuala Lumpur, Onepoint has been supporting public and private sector players in their technological transformation for over twenty years. As both a consulting and technology firm, the company refines its expertise to keep pace with major innovations in cybersecurity, cloud computing, data science and artificial intelligence (AI).

title: GigXR transforms healthcare training with Microsoft Azure OpenAI standardized patients
executive_summary: Patient communication skills and empathy are crucial for healthcare professionals. Conventional training requires working with inconsistent and expensive human actors. GigXR, a global provider of holographic and AI-powered healthcare training, developed a solution to create the intelligence for specific AI patients using Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service and other Azure services. GigXR has to date created 65 different and diverse patients available on demand, providing a more economical and more consistent alternative.

title: Bumrungrad International Hospital optimizes SAP systems by moving to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Compassion, comfort, convenience, and coordination are guiding doctrines for Bumrungrad International Hospital’s daily practice. The hospital’s SAP S/4HANA system, an enterprise resourcing planning system that manages accounting and finances, was a vital part of daily operations over which it had little control. Making a timely move to Microsoft Azure gave the organization more consistent system availability, more visibility into its SAP S/4HANA system, and a more reliable disaster recovery solution.

title: Suzuki embraces Azure OpenAI Service, supercharges AI use with five apps, and sparks ideas for AI in business
executive_summary: Suzuki Motor Corporation (“Suzuki”) is evolving from a mobility company supporting people's lives to an infrastructure company closely connected with people’s lives. The motor giant is actively promoting generative AI as a tool to efficiently drive new initiatives. Having adopted Azure OpenAI Service, Suzuki is lauding the Microsoft solution for offering the same functions as OpenAI's ChatGPT with greater data security. Following the release of the Azure OpenAI Service preview version in March 2023, Suzuki was among the first to launch a company-wide deployment. Suzuki has created five unique, multipurpose web applications based on Azure OpenAI Service to expand its scope of use. Meanwhile, the company is continually pumping out ideas for business-specific use and expects the solution to be a pivotal tool for overcoming a once-in-a-century upheaval with a limited number of personnel.

title: Windstream uses Azure OpenAI Service to empower employees and transform business outcomes
executive_summary: In the fast-paced and ever-evolving landscape of telecommunications, staying ahead of the technological curve is essential for companies seeking to maintain a competitive edge. One such company that has embraced cutting-edge technologies to transform its business is Windstream, a leading telecommunications service provider of advanced network communications and technology solutions for consumers, small businesses, enterprise organizations, and carrier partners across the US. Windstream offers bundled services, including broadband, security solutions, voice, and digital TV to consumers.

title: DynamicWeb helps retailers simplify e-commerce and boost bottom lines with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: DynamicWeb is transforming the retail industry with its innovative Microsoft-powered solutions. By seamlessly integrating various systems like inventory management, customer relationship management, and financial operations, it's changing how retailers do e-commerce. From boosting BHG Department Stores' sales to enabling Pet Lover Centre to process thousands of orders daily, DynamicWeb is directly impacting retailers’ bottom lines. With plans to launch more AI-driven services and make its solutions available on the Azure Marketplace, DynamicWeb is set to redefine e-commerce.

title: How Albert Heijn is using Azure OpenAI to reduce food waste and help its customers eat healthy
executive_summary: As the Netherlands’ leading supermarket chain, Albert Heijn wants to help its customers to live a healthier lifestyle while minimizing its environmental footprint. To do that, the company is investing in artificial intelligence. With support from Microsoft, it has embarked on a series of initiatives aimed at leveraging AI – and Generative AI in particular – to do everything from customer personalization to demand forecast and food waste projects. These efforts have radically transformed operations at Albert Heijn – further strengthening its role in the Dutch retail sector and making it easier for its customers to change their lifestyle.
products: Dynamics 365, Power Automate

title: ASC delivers better FSI compliance solutions by integrating Microsoft Teams and AI
executive_summary: Being a technology leader in a highly regulated sector like the financial services industry has never been more challenging and ASC Technologies has been taking on that challenge for the last 60 years. Partnering with Microsoft to build its cloud solutions on Azure and integrating products like Microsoft Teams and OpenAI enables ASC’s customers to maintain strict industry standards more securely, efficiently, and comprehensively.

title: Macquarie Cloud Services protects Cafs’ sensitive data with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Cyber-attacks impact any industry at any given time. Potential data leaks lead to password changes, identity theft, and card cancellations. However, for some organizations, the stakes are even higher. There are a few reasons for this, including the perception that many lack the funding or skills to maintain and secure data. Organizations are struggling to keep up with the ever-evolving cybersecurity landscape.

title: Barnsley Hospital improves patient and clinician experience with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Barnsley Hospital NHS Foundation Trust schedules more than 300,000 outpatient appointments per year, an increasing number of which are offered as video consultations. The video solution deployed at speed during the pandemic met an immediate need, but the Trust knew there was potential for improvement. It chose a new, integrated platform using Power Platform and Microsoft Teams for video consultations.

title: San Diego Association of Governments improves regional planning outlook with advanced data processing and analytics using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The San Diego Association of Governments (SANDAG), a regional transportation planning agency in San Diego County, California, migrated its data management system to the cloud to keep pace with the growing complexity of modern transportation information. SANDAG turned to Microsoft and partner Quisitive to build an end-to-end data storage and management solution on Microsoft Azure that helped the agency process data, reduce manual work, and foster innovation. The organization’s digital transformation, achieved in about one year, helps it serve the region through improved forecasting accuracy and offers a blueprint for small government agencies seeking data management solutions.

title: Time savings and an enhanced employee experience at Vodafone through its use of Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Digital transformation is at the heart of Vodafone’s strategy to unlock efficiencies and use generative AI to enhance customer experience.

title: Kenya Red Cross expands access to mental health support with Azure AI-powered chatbot
executive_summary: Kenya Red Cross works to alleviate suffering and promote wellbeing, but a shortage of mental health professionals and services puts this care out of reach for many. The organization wanted to bridge that gap.

title: Legrand and Azure OpenAI Service: Powering smarter solutions with AI-driven tools
executive_summary: Legrand needed tools to help its teams manage complex product data, translating it into multiple languages and keeping it relevant for customers worldwide.

title: Canadian Tire Corporation uses Azure AI services to boost employee productivity
executive_summary: To remain competitive in a fast-changing retail industry, Canadian Tire Corporation chose to pioneer the responsible use of generative AI to drive efficiencies, create unique customer experiences, and differentiate itself from competitors.

title: Powerserv Technologies boosts morale, productivity with AnnounceBot on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Dedicated to developing dynamic software solutions with a people-first approach, Powerserv Technologies prioritizes innovation and emphasizes employee wellbeing. With 200 employees worldwide, the company needed to bridge the gap between office and remote workers and foster team bonding.

title: RSA maximizes cloud efficiency and cost savings with Microsoft commercial marketplace
executive_summary: As the speed of business accelerates across the insurance industry, RSA recognized the need to speed up time to market to better serve customers and brokers. Traditional procurement processes were slowing down this fast-paced strategy.

title: Boost leads by 10x: Virbe’s Azure OpenAI Service avatars revolutionize customer engagement
executive_summary: Virbe, a Polish startup that automates communication and sales activities, wanted to enable businesses to interact with customers through AI-powered avatars.
products: Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365

title: Flagstone innovates with Microsoft Azure OpenAI to enhance client experience
executive_summary: Flagstone is the UK’s leading savings platform. They migrated their infrastructure to Microsoft Azure in 2019. Since then, they have been partnering closely with Microsoft to advance their innovation culture. Today, Flagstone is exploring the potential of artificial intelligence (AI) tools, including Microsoft Azure OpenAI and Microsoft Copilot.

title: Daiwa House Industry builds a new future for Japan's construction industry using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Since its founding in 1955, Daiwa House Industry has been on a mission to industrialize construction in a range of fields, with home building at the core. It has embraced digital transformation (DX), implementing digital construction and many other measures leveraging advanced technology. Microsoft Azure plays a critical role as the enterprise’s public cloud platform. After adopting Microsoft 365 in 2018, the company set Azure as its standard public cloud as part of its investment to create new value. This shift accelerated DX initiatives immensely. Azure is also the foundation for the data integration platform driving Daiwa House Industry’s DX initiatives, modernizing its core portal, and running mission-critical SAP S/4HANA systems. The company has also started using Azure OpenAI Service while continuing to implement DX initiatives and modernizing existing systems with Azure as its cloud standard.

title: Chanel combines exceptional creation with cutting-edge technologies powered by Microsoft AI & Fabric to continually elevate client experience
executive_summary: Founded over a century ago, Chanel is a world leader in luxury, from ready-to-wear, leather goods, and fashion accessories to makeup, skincare, watches, and fine jewelry. Dedicated to high levels of craftsmanship, the core values of the brand remain historically grounded in exceptional creation and client experience. Associated with long-standing heritage, expert craftsmanship, and “savoir-faire,” Chanel is also embracing digital technology as it recognizes the value of data insights to stay ahead of the curve.

title: Syndigo accelerates digital commerce for its customers by more than 40% with Azure
executive_summary: Syndigo needed a scalable digital platform to help it manage and syndicate data, simplify infrastructure, and become the foundation for its cloud-native technology stack. The company had experience with Microsoft 365 and knew customers trusted Azure.

title: World2Meet: The travel company providing a better customer experience and operations with a new virtual assistant powered by Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: World2Meet (W2M) is a travel company based in Spain. Part of a larger tourism group, it was looking for ways to utilize generative AI (GenAI) to become more productive and further improve its customer service. Together with Microsoft and one of their technological partners Bravent, W2M’s tech team developed a speaking virtual assistant and avatar, able to handle and answer any question from its customers, in multiple languages. Named Mía, the GenAI-powered solution made its debut at the world’s largest tourism trade show and is set to be rolled out to benefit the company’s frontline staff, its customers, and the organization’s technological evolution.

title: Wrtn rewrites the next generation of its consumer-enabling superapp with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: South Korean startup Wrtn Technologies is transforming everyday life with its AI "superapp," designed to enhance productivity, entertainment, and emotional connections.

title: JÄGER Group engineers better business operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: JÄGER Group, a global provider of rubber, plastic, and metal solutions, needed to update an aging on-premises solution that lacked features needed to mitigate modern cybersecurity risks. The company also had to assess and overhaul operational processes to meet rapid growth.

title: Personalized Imaging Consultants uses PowerShare Image Sharing to help coordinate complex care journeys with ease
executive_summary: Personalized Imaging Consultants (PIC) was unable to establish quick connections for seamless image sharing and patient care coordination.
products: Azure

title: University of Oslo builds GPT-based chat for higher education in 9 weeks with Azure
executive_summary: With increasing student and staff demand for access to AI tools like ChatGPT, the University of Oslo (UiO) decided to create its own highly secure GPT chat.

title: Enerjisa Üretim powers asset management with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Rapid growth spurred the need for a modern, user-friendly asset management solution that offers end-to-end asset life cycle management.

title: Safeguarding research and innovation: Singapore Management University’s cybersecurity transformation with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: N/A

title: IMD is shaping the future of learning with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: IMD wanted to revolutionize business education by going beyond traditional methods of teaching and instead delivering scalable, personalized learning journeys to prepare managers for the future.

title: Bear Analytics partners with Microsoft Power BI to accelerate decision-making for event organizers
executive_summary: Bear Analytics pivoted from a traditional consulting firm for the event industry to a technology-powered company that offers event planners unprecedented insights through data collection and analysis.

title: Textron Aviation enhances maintenance efficiency with Azure AI
executive_summary: Textron Aviation recognized the potential of generative AI to enhance the efficiency of its frontline technicians, enabling them to provide faster aircraft maintenance services.
products: Azure OpenAI Service

title: YAMASHITA adopts Microsoft Fabric as a platform to drive data democratization
executive_summary: To achieve its goal of becoming a home care platform provider, YAMASHITA needed seamless data infrastructure to support data democratization with more DX personnel, real-time market knowledge, and deeper customer insights.

title: Bridgestone helps frontline workers achieve more with Microsoft 365 F5, Microsoft Entra ID
executive_summary: Bridgestone faced multiple challenges: inefficient paper-based systems on the factory floor and frontline workers who were isolated from its digital environment. It needed a secure but easily accessed, productivity-enhancing digital solution.

title: Bucher Municipal develops an AI chatbot based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Old documentation that wasn’t available in digital form often seriously delayed processes. Bucher Municipal needed a solution to quickly make maintenance data available for various vehicle models.

title: TalkTalk Group dials in digital transformation with Dynamics 365 Finance
