executive_summary: TalkTalk Group replaced its aging Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 system with Dynamics 365 Finance to address fragmented systems, outdated processes, and drive efficiencies and cost savings while improving controls to meet UK government requirements.
products: Power BI, Power BI Embedded, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: SOCAR Türkiye strengthens security with Microsoft Intune and Microsoft 365 E5
executive_summary: SOCAR Türkiye managed a complex security operation involving multiple sites and thousands of devices. The existing setup incurred high operational costs due to the maintenance of on-premises hardware.

title: LlamaIndex partners with Microsoft Azure to power the future of AI-forward data solutions
executive_summary: LlamaIndex needed a secure way to connect enterprise data to LLMs and chose Azure OpenAI for privacy, seamless integration, and scalability.

title: Electroimpact’s operational efficiencies take off with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Electroimpact faced inefficiencies and risks with its highly customized on-premises ERP system, leading to prolonged update processes and reliance on a single knowledgeable individual.

title: Weights & Biases and Microsoft Azure partner to power AI Innovation
executive_summary: Weights & Biases needed scalable, integrated cloud infrastructure to support growing AI workloads across industries—which required seamless deployment, fine-tuning, and experimentation capabilities delivered through Microsoft Azure.

title: Utz Brands dips into finance and manufacturing transformation with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Nordic insurer guarantees DevOps quality with cloud-based monitoring and governance
executive_summary: If Insurance is a leading Northern European property and casualty policy provider with nearly three dozen DevOps teams. The company found that its centralized monitoring group was struggling to keep up with the needs of all its development groups, so If started delivering Monitoring as a Service with Microsoft Azure Monitor. Combined with other tools like Azure Security Center, If now has a robust, developer-friendly solution for monitoring and governing its cloud and on-premises systems.

title: AnalogFolk uses facial recognition to test for the 'Marmite Gene'
executive_summary: “You either love it or hate it” is a phrase that’s been synonymous with Marmite since its creation. In 2017, the brand set out to discover the real reason why the sticky stuff has long divided the nation. The answer lay in science: it turns out its genetics that determine whether you’re born a lover, or a hater.

title: Total optimizes team collaboration with Office 365
executive_summary: As a major energy player, Total is a producer and distributor of low-carbon fuels, natural gas and electricity. The brand is mainly known worldwide through its network of more than 14,300 gaz stations. Founded in 1924 as “Compagnie française des pétroles” (CFP), the company is now the 4th “major” players in terms of market capitalization.

title: Romanian farmers better supported thanks to artificial intelligence
executive_summary: The Rural Investments Financing Agency (AFIR) is the main government agency supporting Romanian farmers and companies to access grants and an average of 2 billion euros yearly of European Union (EU) funding for rural development projects. It is the government agency with the highest absorption rate of EU funds. A vital internal forecasting task to help manage grant projects used to require a lot of manual intervention by AFIR’s employees, which was slow and inaccurate. However, the situation completely changed once AFIR started using artificial intelligence (AI) powered by Microsoft Azure.

title: Brisa strengthens its communication with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Brisa, the leader of the Turkish tire industry, has transferred its business processes to Microsoft Teams to strengthen its communication, eliminate security risks, and gain speed.

title: Manufacturer unifies data and gains agility in finance and supply chain with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Bel Fuse designs, manufactures, and markets electronic circuits products at 24 manufacturing locations across North America, Europe, and Asia. The company’s existing enterprise resource planning solution was highly customized and expensive to maintain, so it decided to deploy Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Bel Fuse unified data and can now more easily manage its supply chain operations and finance processes, gaining more agility to respond quickly to changes in the market or its suppliers.

title: Spirit of Math delivers engaging online learning with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Spirit of Math provides after-school classes for students seeking to excel in mathematics. When COVID-19 disrupted its in-person teaching model, Spirit of Math quickly adopted online teaching with Microsoft Teams. While maintaining the collaborative learning and live, teacher-led classes that it attributes its success to, Spirit of Math not only saved 400 jobs and retained 11,000 students, the company has set itself up for continued growth for years to come.

title: Leading innovation in the UK’s NHS
executive_summary: The NHS Business Services Authority (NHS BSA) is a Special Health Authority and an arm's length body of the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC).

title: ilke Homes transforms its business data access with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and CPIT’s KickStart service
executive_summary: ilke Homes is pioneering the future of homes, creating high-quality, energy-efficient modular homes using advanced manufacturing and precision engineering at its 250,000-square-foot factory in Yorkshire, England. As a rapidly growing business, ilke Homes needed to move from spreadsheets and paper to a fully managed enterprise resource planning (ERP) system as quickly and as cost-effectively as possible. Microsoft partner Cooper Parry IT (CPIT) rolled out a rapid implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central with its KickStart service, allowing ilke Homes to get up and running rapidly. The scalability of Dynamics 365 Business Central via Kickstart allowed ilke Homes to get started with a minimum viable product, access all of its information from multiple sites on any device at any time, and easily expand to accommodate future growth.

title: WATAN innovates and improves agility at critical times by automating HR operations with Dynamics 365 Human Resources
executive_summary: WATAN, an independent non-governmental organization operating in Türkiye, automated its HR processes and saved time with data-driven solution, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Human Resources. The first NGO customer of the platform in the MEA Region, the organization started to benefit from the platform's smart capabilities, including performance measurement, updating employee data, and monitoring its teams anytime, anywhere.

title: Arizona MVD engages citizens and delivers value with the cloud
executive_summary: Arizona may have been the last of the contiguous states to be admitted to the Union, but its Motor Vehicle Division (MVD) continues to build on a history of technology initiative firsts. As part of the Arizona Department of Transportation (ADOT), MVD led the nation more than 20 years ago with ServiceArizona.com, the first United States online service for residents to renew vehicle registrations, driver licenses, and perform other tasks remotely.

title: Manufacturer tracks food storage temperatures with Azure, helps reduce global food waste
executive_summary: Headquartered in Denmark, Danfoss manufactures products for heating and cooling appliances such as radiators and freezers. The company wanted to expand its offerings to software as a service (SaaS) solutions and use its decades of domain expertise to help its food retail customers become more efficient. Danfoss developed Alsense Food Retail, a cloud-based solution built on Microsoft Azure Event Hubs that grocery stores use to monitor temperatures with sensors. Customers can tightly control energy efficiency across grocery chains, leading to an estimated 30 percent decrease in their energy costs and a 40 percent reduction in food waste.
products: Azure, Azure Databricks, Azure Event Hubs, Azure SQL Database, Power BI

title: Standard Bank of South Africa was well-positioned to transition to work from home using Microsoft identity and access management
executive_summary: The cybersecurity team at Standard Bank of South Africa thrives on pioneering security work. Based in Johannesburg, South Africa, the bank has a strong presence across 20 countries in Africa. It adopted Azure Active Directory and Microsoft Intune, now part of Microsoft Endpoint Manager, to manage and monitor user access. This helped Standard Bank transition smoothly to a 75 percent work-from-home workforce. It also earned a Microsoft Secure Score of 82 percent, which is 43 percent higher than similar organizations’ average.

title: Emirates Group creates digital, accessible workplace for employees
executive_summary: Using technology to improve its processes is not new to Emirates Group. The group includes the largest airline and flag carrier of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and one of the world’s largest air services providers, dnata. Having Microsoft as a trusted partner for years, Emirates decided to take the next step in their digitalization journey and focus on productivity, collaboration and communication capabilities for its employees. It used Microsoft 365, the Power Platform, and Azure and established a powerful and productive digital workplace.

title: Zurich Insurance gets future-ready with Microsoft 365 tools that modernize customer service
executive_summary: For nearly 150 years, Zurich Insurance has helped protect customers and their futures. “We’re a value-driven, diverse organization providing service in 215 countries,” says Raid El Badarin-Deriy, Head of Modern Workplace at Zurich Insurance Germany. “We want to offer solutions for customers that fit their lives.” To strengthen its commitment to great service, Zurich Insurance uses Microsoft Bookings to make it easy for customers to schedule appointments with Zurich Insurance agents. “In the past, it took a lot of time on the phone to coordinate an appointment,” remembers El Badarin-Deriy. “We searched for a way to improve that situation and discovered Bookings. It was a game-changer. Today, we’ve rolled out Bookings to more than 1,000 Zurich agencies, and the response from customers and colleagues has been fantastic.”

title: Knowledge shared is knowledge doubled: Tandemploy’s solutions ensure knowledge transfer among employees thanks to Azure Kubernetes Service
executive_summary: “Generation Streaming” wants to consume content when and how it wants: on demand, fast, and simple. It also wants the experience to be enjoyable. The same goes for learning processes. These days, the only way to achieve efficient knowledge transfer within a company is through tailored, engaging content, that puts the employee front and center. Tandemploy, a company based in Berlin, offers the ideal solution: software that allows each company to design its own “talent marketplace.” The technological basis for mentoring, finding experts, arranging lunch dates, and a whole lot more is provided by Microsoft Azure and Azure Kubernetes Service.

title: Shree Digvijay Cement leverages Microsoft Dynamics 365 to modernize its sales operations
executive_summary: Shree Digvijay Cement is a pioneer in cement manufacturing with a legacy of eight decades. It markets cement under the trade name ‘Kamal Cement’ in various districts across Gujarat and also exports its specialty cement to many countries in the world.

title: Microsoft Surface devices raise standards and ensure opportunity at Newcastle University
executive_summary: One of the most prestigious Russell Group universities, Newcastle University is currently ranked within the top 150 universities globally, by The Times Higher Education. It also ranks highly for student experience. The digital transformation of learning is an important part of delivering both academic excellence and an enhanced student experience. This is why several schools within the university took the decision to provide their undergraduates with Microsoft Surface Go devices. These mobile, two-in-one devices operate as a secondary device when working in high-performance computer labs, an essential mobile device during field and lab work, and are helping to ensure equity of opportunity and access to learning for all.

title: Cdiscount launches a 360-degree marketplace solution based on Azure API Management
executive_summary: With its marketplace expertise and catalog of more than 13,000 international sellers, Cdiscount decided to offer its services to physical distributors, e-merchants, and sellers to enable them to grow their online business through a marketplace. To do this, Cdiscount identified the need to enhance its API platform in order to facilitate the onboarding of these new customers. So, Cdiscount selected Microsoft to support its API management and thus accelerate the company's transition into a new direction, helping it to become a marketplace solution provider through its new dedicated entity, Octopia.

title: Elsewedy paves the way for remote work with Microsoft 365 and Microsoft 365 Defender
executive_summary: Since its founding more than 80 years ago, Elsewedy Electric has grown into a global provider of energy, digital, and infrastructure solutions. Needing to ensure business continuity in the face of the COVID-19 pandemic, the company made the switch to Microsoft 365 and Microsoft 365 Defender, creating a single, secure hub for hybrid work. Today, Elsewedy is reaping the rewards of its investment—saving costs, boosting productivity, and empowering employees with an easier way to manage daily operations.

title: Microsoft Azure Blob Storage provides flexible, economical storage for GE Healthcare’s medical imaging team
executive_summary: GE Healthcare’s imaging services provide state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to healthcare providers across the United States and around the world. These tools range from handheld ultrasound systems to cardiovascular imaging to AI-guided algorithms that help radiologists detect lung problems.

title: King County delivers critical services using Microsoft Power Pages
executive_summary: To better serve its constituents, the King County Department of Information Technology has developed 200-plus solutions on Power Platform, including a wide range of low-code portals using Power Pages.

title: Johnson Controls exceeds enterprise training expectations with scalable solution built on Power Platform
executive_summary: Johnson Controls’ 136-year history of innovation propels its ability to do what the company does best—make buildings smarter. It enhances the environments where people live, learn, work, and play. Serving four million customers in 150 countries, more than 100,000 Johnson Controls employees create and deploy systems and digital solutions that optimize building performance, safety, sustainability, and comfort.

title: All marketing materials in one central location: Beiersdorf relies on a digital asset management system based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Photos, videos, animations, and graphics: marketing departments have to manage a large number of promotional materials. And that number grows with every new product, with every new campaign, and with every new market. Storing this volume of data locally is unthinkable—especially for companies with global operations. That’s why Beiersdorf uses a digital asset management (DAM) system called Sharedien. Hosted in Azure, it ensures that marketing teams and all participating agencies worldwide have fast access. It eliminates the laborious search for materials—saving valuable time for everyone involved.

title: Malaysia’s research and technology firm saves millions with in-house app development capability
executive_summary: Owned by the Malaysian Government, SIRIM is Malaysia’s industrial research and technology organization. SIRIM’s vision is to be the best partner for innovation, which meant enhancing its internal processes and discovering innovative ways to serve industries better. SIRIM is one of the first cloud-based government-owned companies in Malaysia. “We automated many business processes and workflows, and we continue to transform our internal processes with Microsoft products,” said Tengku Intan, Chief Digital & Information Officer at SIRIM.

title: Dairy cooperative brings better nutrition to the world with a workplace built on Microsoft 365
executive_summary: For the 16,995 dairy farmers in Belgium, Germany, and the Netherlands who are the co-owners of the cooperative FrieslandCampina, most days start before the sun is up. The work of milking cows, maintaining a farm, and supplying customers with nutritious dairy products goes around the clock. Their dedication is shared by the 23,877 employees who work at FrieslandCampina. Founded in 1871, the cooperative has grown over the past 150 years to become one of the world’s largest dairy companies, with branches in 38 countries and exports to more than 100 countries worldwide.

title: ArcelorMittal: inside the steel manufacturer’s data-driven approach towards industry 4.0
executive_summary: Headquartered in Luxembourg, ArcelorMittal is a leading steel and mining company. For the past year, the company has been migrating its SAP applications to the cloud with Microsoft partner NTT DATA Business Solutions AG. This has led to cost savings and increased flexibility, but most importantly, it has created greater opportunities for ArcelorMittal to innovate and focus on what matters to them: inventing smarter steels for a better world.

title: Avacon Natur is helping customers become more energy efficient through streamlined, platform-based customer management based on Dynamics 365
executive_summary: For many companies, reducing their carbon footprint while also meeting energy requirements in a cost-effective way is now more important than ever. And this is exactly what Avacon Natur is helping its B2B and B2C customers do by providing them with eco-friendly energy solutions. Each system is precisely tailored to the respective company’s unique production process. In the past, Avacon Natur used expensive, standalone solutions to model each customer life cycle. Now, it uses an integrated IT platform based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and does so throughout the company.

title: India’s leading food ordering and delivery platform, Swiggy, uses Power BI for a low-cost powerful data solution
executive_summary: Founded in 2014, Swiggy is India's leading hyperlocal food ordering and delivery platform. The company processes millions of customer orders each month while operating in 500+ cities with 120,000+ restaurants on its platform. One of the key goals for the organization is to build a data-driven culture by enabling democratization of insights throughout the organization. A robust BI platform was one of the first goals for Swiggy.

title: Agility and growth through Azure Kubernetes Service: Userlane creates IT architecture to match its startup mentality
executive_summary: “Learning by doing” was yesterday. Today is about “learning and doing at the same time.” Userlane helps users navigate their way around software by offering them click paths. So instead of learning though how-to videos or training events, users are able to work with a given piece of software from the very first click, understand how it works more quickly, and use it more effectively. In this way, the startup is also paving the way for greater equality and participation in the digitalized world. And this can be in any sector—anytime one of its customers needs help with software, Userlane is by their side. The technology behind this commitment is Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

title: LBV modernizes supporter relationship management via Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The LBV (Landesbund für Vogelschutz in Bayern e. V.) is a nature conservation association that relies on fundraising and volunteers in its focus on the preservation of biodiversity. As their supporter network grew, managing it became increasingly challenging, a problem that was aggravated by its aging and increasingly inefficient IT solution. To solve this challenge, proMX developed a customized, scalable platform solution for fundraising. proMX experts improved the LBV's engagement with supporters, facilitated donation management, and enabled the visualization of business data for easier interpretation, further saving the LBV valuable time.

title: Sustainability-focused Swedavia soars to the cloud with the Azure Migration and Modernization Program
executive_summary: In accordance with the government-mandated Swedish Public Procurement Act, Swedavia needed to find a different service provider and move its servers to a more dynamic and agile platform. In addition, after losing 90 percent of airport passengers during COVID-19 shutdowns, Swedavia had to take drastic measures to save its bottom line. With sustainability underscoring Swedavia’s vision, it wanted to find a technology company that aligned with its overall mission to create airports with fossil-free operations. Through the Microsoft Azure Migration and Modernization Program, Swedavia revised its landing zone, aligned its architecture and road map for business intelligence services, and found a savings of about 40 percent per server. And, with the Microsoft Emissions Impact Dashboard, Swedavia is finding measurable business impact with metrics that support its environmental and sustainability initiatives.

title: Coca-Cola subsidiary, fairlife, implements Power BI and Azure solution to democratize data across the brand
executive_summary: Founded in 2012, fairlife is a dairy company focused on creating better-for-you products through the power of dairy nutrition. Originally owned by a co-op of dairy farmers, fairlife has grown and launched numerous products and is now owned by the Coca-Cola Company. fairlife strives to make products that are better for people, animals, and the planet—and is harnessing the power of data to achieve that mission.

title: Hendrick Motorsports hones car aerodynamics, improves NASCAR pit performance with Power BI
executive_summary: Hendrick Motorsports is an American professional auto racing organization founded in 1984 by Rick Hendrick. The organization competes in the NASCAR Cup series and has earned more NASCAR Cup Series race victories than any other team and holds the record for car owner championships. Hendrick Motorsports is located in Concord, North Carolina.

title: Romania’s Patria Bank enables business resilience with Microsoft 365 tools
executive_summary: Patria Bank provides banking services to micro and small business clients as well as to the retail and agribusiness sectors in Romania. Committed to high-touch banking, it always strives to drive meaningful connections with its clients, employees, and partners. To enhance internal connections, the bank rolled out Microsoft 365 tools—namely Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, and OneDrive. Now, with streamlined communication channels, more than 700 employees across 30 cities are empowered to run leaner operations, accelerating delivery of fast, reliable, and more resilient services.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business

title: Angelini globally standardizes thousands of email signatures across devices in minutes using CodeTwo and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Angelini Holding is the parent company of an international group operating in the pharmaceutical and consumer goods sectors. Founded in Italy in 1919, today the Angelini group operates in 17 countries with a staff of 5,700. The company’s management wanted to centrally manage email signatures in Microsoft 365, maintaining visual consistency across divisions and ensuring emails always included up-to-date contact details, as well as complying with relevant legal regulations. Angelini chose CodeTwo’s Email Signatures for Office 365, an Azure-based software service that integrates seamlessly with Microsoft Azure Active Directory. With CodeTwo’s service, a single Angelini employee created a unified signature layout across different email clients and devices and provisioned country-specific signatures for individual offices. The entire process took a few minutes.

title: Global computer-based testing company ensures that credentialing exams are highly protected with Azure
executive_summary: Pearson VUE is the company that professional credentialing and licensing programs rely on to deliver the exams that certify nurses, doctors, IT practitioners seeking technology-specific credentials, and many other professionals around the world. Until early 2020, examinees flocked to Pearson VUE test centers around the world to sit for the exams that determine their future. But when the COVID-19 crisis surfaced, many test centers closed, and candidates had to take exams from home. That imposed enormous processing demands on the company. But it had begun a cloud migration and used Microsoft Azure technology to overcome its previous on-premises limitations.

title: Dynamically moving Wales forward
executive_summary: “The integration between all the Microsoft applications helps, such as integrating Microsoft Dynamics CRM with Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Outlook. When we see those product announcements about the new things coming up, it’s all functionality we can use because we use the Microsoft suite of products,” enthuses Malcolm Payne, Head of Business Systems at Transport for Wales.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Finance, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Power Apps, Power Automate, Windows 10, Outlook, SharePoint

title: Passport 360 offers integrated end-to-end compliance automation on Azure to help Kumba Iron Ore streamline operations
executive_summary: Sustainable mining company Kumba Iron Ore produces high-grade iron ore for use in steelmaking around the world. Kumba needed to automate and consolidate its manual approach to onboarding and risk management across all its work sites. Passport 360 worked with Kumba to implement a Microsoft Azure-based solution, empowering Kumba to streamline operations and improve risk outcomes.

title: PUMA changes the game and speeds up data transfers with Azure Virtual WAN
executive_summary: Always challenging itself to move farther and faster, iconic sportswear brand PUMA lives up to the agility and speed embodied by the big cat in its logo. The company pushes its technical teams to focus on solutions and implement with speed. When it needed to improve the connectivity between its international offices and simplify management, PUMA pounced on Microsoft Azure Virtual WAN, propelling its digital transformation forward and setting the stage for the agility it reveres.

title: Jumbo turns customers into fans using automation and AI
executive_summary: With a market share of 21.5%, Dutch supermarket chain, Jumbo, is the second largest in the Netherlands. This is, in part, down to its intelligence-driven approach to optimizing its services and operations. After realizing the potential insights that its data could bring, Jumbo embarked on a digital transformation that saw traditional processes revitalized using automation and AI. Using Microsoft Synapse for analytical power, Databricks for predictive power and a BI dashboard to visualize and understand that data, Jumbo not only improved customer experience, but also started turning its millions of customers into loyal fans.

title: Indus Towers fuels data-led, scalable decision-making with Microsoft Power BI
executive_summary: Indus Towers Limited is India's largest passive telecom infrastructure company. It deploys, owns, and manages telecom towers and communication structures for various mobile operators.

title: Bolstering Equity and Maximizing Opportunity—How St. Lucie Public Schools Has Embraced the Challenge of Providing a Twenty-First Century Education
executive_summary: What does it mean to commit to educating 41,000 students in a twenty-first century model of education? That is precisely the question that faculty, staff, and administrators of Lucie Public Schools, located in Port St. Lucie, Florida, have navigated for the past five years. Although it would be easy to focus on the ways that COVID-19 disrupted the educational practices that many schools had relied on for decades, St. Lucie Public Schools had already made a commitment to reevaluating their pedagogical practices before the abrupt switch to remote learning. As educators across the world continue to reflect on the role of technology during the switch to remote learning, it is important to identify how school districts like St. Lucie Public Schools have utilized educational technologies to go beyond just delivering content remotely.

title: NextBillion AI enables seamless location data services with Azure
executive_summary: NextBillion AI (NextBillion) is an industry-leading spatial data and AI platform that helps enterprises build, scale, and manage their own mapping ecosystem. The company enables enterprises to tackle highly complex location problems with the help of tailored location and navigation technology solutions. It offers location tools and APIs such as last-mile delivery, telematics, logistics, transport, food delivery, automotive, and ride-hailing/ride-sharing.

title: TomTom takes the optimal route to the cloud with Microsoft Azure Storage solutions
executive_summary: Like the world it portrays, the mapmaker’s art has completely transformed. A chasm of difference lies between the hand-painted parchment maps once created with paper surveyor’s notes and today’s vibrant digital maps. Technology makes the magic for the maps we access on mobile devices and in-vehicle navigation systems—real-time, dynamic depictions that we’ve come to trust and rely on while on the move.

title: Aecon modernizes collaboration by migrating to Microsoft Teams with VNEXT iQ’s help
executive_summary: Aecon, a Canadian leader in construction and infrastructure development, had an on-premises Skype for Business environment and wanted to migrate to Microsoft Teams. Microsoft partner VNEXT iQ, a professional services and managed services provider, assisted Aecon with the project and set up audio conferencing, auto attendants, and call queues. VNEXT iQ and Aecon then collaborated on change management and adoption activities that were critical to the transformation and modernization path. Now Aecon uses Microsoft Teams as a remote-work tool and has been utilizing Teams app templates for company communications and documentation.

title: BNY Mellon helps clients harness the power of data and analytics via Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: BNY Mellon is a financial services business with an ultra-modern outlook. Understanding the importance of data and the value of the cloud, BNY Mellon chose Microsoft to deliver a platform that moved its clients beyond business as usual. To deliver a more nimble data management system, more accessible ways to generate insights and analysis, and take advantage of the flexibility and scalability of the cloud, BNY Mellon turned to Microsoft Azure as the foundation for its public cloud-native data management platform.
products: Azure

title: Standardizing MSC’s IT infrastructure in the cloud with Azure Disk Storage
executive_summary: To reduce management complexity and increase agility, MSC began migrating its on-premises infrastructure from a storage area network to the cloud in 2017. In 2019, the company began updating to SQL Server 2019 and the SQL Server Always On high availability and disaster recovery solution. By July 2020, MSC started beta testing Azure Disk Storage. With shared disks in Azure, MSC can avoid a large overhaul of its current code and architecture.
products: Azure, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Disk Storage, Azure SQL Database, Azure Ultra Disk Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, SQL Server

title: Amref broadens donor support and volunteer mobilization with Microsoft Cloud for Nonprofit for health development in Africa
executive_summary: Amref Health Africa is one of the largest health development nonprofits founded and headquartered in Africa. The organization works to improve health services and outreach across 35 of the continent’s 54 countries. This massive effort requires management and oversight of numerous processes, people, and huge amounts of data. To ensure efficacy and efficiency, Amref, with the help of Impax, a Microsoft Gold Certified partner, transitioned to a centralized CRM system and new, more robust IT solutions, including Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Power BI, and Microsoft Cloud for Nonprofit. The change is helping Amref automate processes that support program development, partner engagement, advocacy efforts, fundraising, volunteer engagement, and more, while ensuring compliance. This is leading to stronger donor relationships and increased capacity to advance its critical health work. Amref can also more easily make sense of the vast amounts of data it collects—imperative in managing complex health crises such as COVID-19.

title: Urban mobility of the future: Leipzig’s transport company expands its digital network with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Leipzig is currently Germany’s fastest growing city. In addition to affecting the housing and labor markets, this has an impact on the city’s public transport infrastructure. In 2019, the city’s transport company, Leipziger Verkehrsbetriebe (LVB), carried more than 150 million passengers—and that number is growing. Part of the company’s strategy for serving such vast numbers is to roll out new mobility offers that combine different modes of transport. The apps that underpin this kind of intermodal routing run on Microsoft Azure. LVB also relies on Microsoft solutions when tackling other challenges: to keep pace with demographic change, Microsoft HoloLens 2 is used in-house to aid the transfer of knowledge.

title: Open space despite pandemic: On-site booking system at Carglass® makes chains of infection traceable from end to end
executive_summary: When it comes to replacing or repairing car glass, people in Germany trust one company: Carglass®. Customers have enjoyed the option of booking their appointments online for years now. But the company’s employees also benefit from the digital solutions Carglass® offers: to maintain the open-space concept for its Digital & IT unit at the company’s headquarters in Cologne, and to be able to trace chains of infection, the company uses an on-site booking system based on a variety of tools from the Microsoft Power Platform.

title: CIFC adopts agile Azure platform for mission-critical credit services
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: OPAP empowers its partners’ agencies with Power BI Embedded
executive_summary:
Founded in 1958, OPAP is the leading gaming company in Greece and one of the most renowned worldwide. As part of its vision, OPAP aspires to offer best-in-class entertainment, with customer-centricity and digitalization being key areas of focus.

In this framework, OPAP made sure its partners’ agencies have the necessary support to make data-driven business decisions, by implementing Power BI Embedded. Microsoft’s solution allows OPAP agents to see key information about their activities, such as targets, status reports, etc. It also helps them focus on improving their operations and pursuing growth.

title: Microsoft Project helps Dutch indoor climate system provider streamline its processes, increase overall business
executive_summary: Dutch company Climate for Life is in the business of residential heating, cooling, and ventilation systems it sells as a subscription model off the typical energy grid. With demand increasing, the business wanted to streamline processes, minimize manual tasks, and find a project management tool flexible enough to manage changes and tackle resource planning and scheduling. Today, Climate for Life is using Microsoft Project to help automate work and meet demand. The business is handling 25 percent more projects and onsite standstill days have decreased 20 percent, leading to 15 percent overall growth.

title: Innovative Cloud9 player-training solution builds, runs, and stores on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Not to be overshadowed by Batch, Azure Blob Storage supports very rapid rates of access to those huge amounts of unstructured video and related data, making it the perfect choice to service VRT processing tasks and the corresponding variety of video and image types. Cloud9 has found itself at the leading-edge when it comes to using technology to help keep its teams ahead of the competition. And it’s working; the team has won four straight VCT Game Changers events.

title: Celebal Tech unlocks enterprise information innovation for DKSH
executive_summary: DKSH helps companies grow in the Asia-Pacific and European markets and expand into new ones. DKSH had envisioned a modernization roadmap for its organization that included establishing a modern analytics pipeline and self-service business intelligence (BI) tools. The company engaged Celebal Technologies to take advantage of its expertise in Microsoft Azure modernization. Celebal Tech architected, designed, and built a consolidated enterprise Azure Data Lake for both DKSH's SAP and non-SAP application workloads. The solution simplified DKSH’s on-premises data landscape and facilitated a comprehensive analytics layer via machine learning and AI.

title: Van Havermaet scales up innovation to deliver superior accounting advice with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: Trust is everything for Van Havermaet. The Belgium-based multidisciplinary accounting firm has been a trusted, dependable partner to its clients for the past 80 years, reliably advising and guiding them through accounting, tax, legal, and HR issues. Maintaining that ironclad dependability, however, increasingly requires the digital innovation and scale necessary to meet clients where they are and the foresight to lead them where they need to be. So, when Van Havermaet decided to take a cloud-first approach to improve innovation for itself and its clients, it found its own trusted partner in Microsoft Azure Stack HCI.

title: Dynamics 365 underpins a transformational data strategy for Cornwall Council delivering high-quality data
executive_summary: Cornwall Council is a unitary authority with a revenue budget of over £1bn and 87 local councillors serving the 550,000 residents of Cornwall. In 2009, the council launched the Digital Cornwall initiative to bring together core data assets to enable vertical reporting. The council adopted Microsoft Azure Data Warehouse to build a strong foundation and support the scaling of their Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights solutions to create a golden record of employees and Cornwall residents, driving improved service delivery across the county and creating more connected citizen experiences.

title: airBaltic's ground team gets off to a flying start with Microsoft Teams and Power Apps
executive_summary: Latvian airline airBaltic pairs a passion for aviation with customer service excellence and a drive for innovation. Establishing a new ground handling unit at Riga airport provided the carrier an opportunity to digitalize and streamline operations. Combining Power Apps with Teams, airBaltic’s business team developed vital tools that helped streamline work shift management, approvals, and reporting. Now, the ground crew can execute tasks via Microsoft Teams using mobile devices. The optimization has helped airBaltic save 1,000 printed report pages a month and reduced the time needed for data input from two days to 15 minutes.
products: Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Power Apps

title: Edenred UAE is the UAE's largest salary processing provider serving more than 6,000 companies, 2 million employees, over 10 banks and 35 financial institutions
executive_summary: Edenred UAE is the UAE's largest salary processing provider serving more than 6,000 companies, 2 million employees, over 10 banks and 35 financial institutions. Operating out of Dubai since 2008, Edenred simplifies WPS and non-WPS payroll, improves the quality of life for employees and helps companies take care of their hardworking people - pay them on time, securely and without effort. Edenred believes everyone should have equal access to essential financial services, regardless of how much they earn. That’s why we created C3Pay for their unbanked or underbanked employees, a mobile app where employees can manage their money instantly and conveniently.

title: Perrigo takes on the future with enhanced agility, flexibility, and scalability with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: A worldwide producer and supplier of consumer self-care products, Perrigo needs to track tens of thousands of SKUs and manage shipments all over the world. After significant growth through a series of acquisitions, Perrigo wanted to streamline its enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems. It identified finance as the most strategic place to begin. Perrigo’s long-standing relationship with Microsoft, dating back to its Microsoft 365 implementation, helped inform its decision to move its finance workloads to SAP on Azure and the Microsoft Cloud. Perrigo is setting itself up to take advantage of comprehensive security and compliance, intelligent insights from its numerous data sources, automation and innovation to accelerate transformation, and familiar productivity and collaboration tools to empower its employees.

title: The Bot Platform solution in Microsoft Teams makes for smooth sailing at Ports of Jersey
executive_summary: Ports of Jersey Limited, an incorporated business that operates the island of Jersey’s airport, harbors, marinas, and Coastguard, had to reexamine its internal communications when much of its workforce transitioned to remote work. The organization needed a solution that would allow employees to stay more closely associated and interact with each other. Ports of Jersey IT staff had been researching bot solutions that could field common IT questions. The Bot Platform solution in Microsoft Teams offers templates, tutorials, live support, and other features that make it easy to build apps and help Ports of Jersey drive more engagement through Teams.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Chevron powers its business future with SAP on Azure and the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Building on human ingenuity

title: Rodobens delivers seamless digital experiences, safeguards financial data with Azure Active Directory
executive_summary: Financial services company Rodobens wanted a scalable identity and access management solution that it could use to deliver streamlined digital experiences for its customers and employees without sacrificing network and data security. The company selected Microsoft Azure Active Directory External Identities as the authentication tool for its digital offerings. Now, Rodobens can easily control network access for all employees, partners, and customers and help them get to the different tools, applications, and platforms they need—after signing in only once.
products: Microsoft Entra External ID

title: TM International Logistics leverages Azure to streamline business processes and gain real-time insights
executive_summary: Incorporated in 2002, TM International Logistics Limited (TMILL), a subsidiary of Tata Steel Limited, is an international logistics provider formed as a joint venture company of Tata Steel Limited, NYK Holding (Europe) BV, and IQ Martrade. Headquartered in Kolkata, TMILL offers a diverse portfolio of logistics services including railways, supply chain management (SCM), warehousing, port operations, ship agency, freight forwarding, custom house agency, inland logistics and shipping.

title: CumulusPro streamlines data processing with Peritos and Azure Data Factory
executive_summary: CumulusPro helps businesses transform into digital enterprises by connecting people, processes, and applications. The company relies on the cloud-based business process management (BPM) platform Straatos, designed to revolutionize how organizations communicate and collaborate with customers, citizens, and partners. The platform setup was multitenant and multi-environment, though, and CumulusPro was looking to streamline Straatos’ billing and application usage reporting features for both internal users and clients. Peritos Solutions showed CumulusPro how to address its data challenges by leveraging Microsoft Azure data-management and storage services.

title: Louisiana State Employees’ Retirement System lives its customer-centric values by enhancing hybrid productivity and security with Microsoft
executive_summary: The Louisiana State Employees’ Retirement System (LASERS) sought to accelerate delivery of digital services to customers. To focus more on innovation and less on administration, they migrated on-site identity and email to Microsoft 365, increasing uptime and eliminating the cost and complexity of infrastructure management. When a pilot deployment of Microsoft Teams had to go agencywide due to the COVID-19 pandemic, LASERS initiated a major cultural shift toward digital collaboration. Information Technology (IT) leaders adopted Microsoft 365 Enterprise to unify security, collaboration, and productivity, which freed up resources, enabled better customer service, and improved data protection.

title: Businesses fight friendly fraud with Ethoca Consumer Clarity on Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: Friendly fraud occurs when a customer files a chargeback for a legitimate transaction and receives a refund from their bank. This kind of fraud presents a tremendous challenge for both payment card issuers and merchants. According to Rahul Deshpande, Chief Technology Officer for Ethoca, “Friendly fraud can account for as much as 70% of all credit card fraud, which is immense, and it costs the industry about $132 billion per year.” Ethoca, a MasterCard company, is helping businesses around the world fight friendly fraud with Ethoca Consumer Clarity™, a solution that provides rich merchant and purchase information to both cardholders and financial institutions, helping reduce purchase confusion. To accomplish this, Ethoca built its solution on Microsoft Azure, using Azure Cosmos DB to process 15 TB of data in real time. Since its launch, Consumer Clarity has processed thousands of digital receipts within seconds. Watch the video below to learn more about how Ethoca built Consumer Clarity on Azure.

title: Canadian vertical farm boosts production, supports sustainability goals with cloud data analytics
executive_summary: GoodLeaf Farms is helping make Canada self-sufficient in leafy greens, operating a large vertical farm operation outside of Toronto. It looked for technology to maximize the advantage offered by data harvested from its production environment and partnered with Adastra to introduce Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics and Microsoft Power Platform to improve yield and quality and gain increased visibility into its sustainable farming business.

title: Making a Play for Equity: How DeKalb County School District Has Embraced the Girls Who Game Program
executive_summary: DeKalb County School District is the third largest school district in the state of Georgia, with an enrollment of more than 93,000 students across 138 schools and centers. The district is supported by 20,000 teachers and staff who commit to providing a phenomenal educational experience to the diverse student population who represent more than 148 nations with 170 languages spoken. District administrators know first-hand that successful initiatives require collaboration among partners—motivation to action and dedication to equity. One such initiative is the Girls Who Game program that has taken off “like a wildfire” through the DeKalb County School District.

title: Traditional Romanian bank builds a more flexible, agile, and responsive business environment with the cloud
executive_summary: Headquartered in Bucharest, Romania, CEC Bank is the oldest financial institution in the country. The bank has successfully reinvented itself more than once to keep up with the times, and is now one of the most recognized in the market. Most recently, the company overcame age-old legal bureaucratic processes and, with its partner’s help, New Business Dimensions, adopted Azure Cloud to streamline and optimize its internal communication, collaboration, connectivity, and reporting. Now, CEC Bank is ready to expand its business with shorter time-to-market and easy-to-access new services for customers.

title: PwC builds multitenant enterprise decision support site with Power Pages
executive_summary: Big Four accounting firm PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) seized an opportunity to enhance service and build even more trust with its clients by migrating from its legacy client decision support system to an enterprise-grade, tech-enabled solution. The company chose to create a multitenant Microsoft Power Pages solution and was able to reimagine its data model by using Microsoft Dataverse with C# plugins to handle the business logic. In just six weeks, PwC successfully built the Cyber Technology Rationalizer site while gaining the benefits of low-code web development, including reducing costs and saving time. The team was able to reuse work done for the previous tool as code components in a Microsoft Power Apps component framework, which led to further time savings.

title: Digital strategy for growth: Hagedorn revamps IT infrastructure with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Hagedorn Group is an industry leader in the demolition and remediation of industrial facilities and buildings. In recent years, it has transformed itself into an all-around service provider by acquiring companies from related business fields such as waste disposal. The integration of these subsidiaries into the Group has driven rapid workforce growth and provided a wealth of new data. To meet these challenges, Hagedorn decided to move to Microsoft Azure. Microsoft’s software-as-a-service solutions are now making IT support easier than ever, and a modern data warehouse has helped the company derive new insights from existing data. With the assistance of Bechtle, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network, Hagedorn has radically transformed its IT infrastructure, setting an inspiring example for other medium-sized enterprises.

title: Carbon Asset Solutions plants the seed for net zero emissions—securing carbon credits with Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Carbon Asset Solutions is out to help rid the planet of damaging atmospheric carbon dioxide. Its breakthrough measurement, recording, and verification technology platform creates a new, much more accurate way of measuring carbon sequestered in soil, verifying it efficiently and securely selling carbon credits to the rapidly growing net zero carbon markets. The company needed to capture and encrypt the precision carbon measurement data, protect against data tampering at both ends of the carbon credit process, and consider long-term global scalability. By enabling Microsoft Azure confidential computing in its IoT devices and data management, Carbon Asset Solutions is working to solve one of the earth’s pivotal environmental problems.

title: CSU College of Business modernizes and simplifies IT, builds digital future with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: As the current system reached end of life, they decided to migrate many of the school’s on-premises environments to a simplified, end-to-end HCI platform that could support workloads from storage to virtualization. As CSU had already built most of its infrastructure on Microsoft solutions, moving to Azure Stack HCI—an Azure Arc-enabled operating system delivered as an Azure service—represented an opportunity to consolidate the entire infrastructure into a single ecosystem. By switching to Azure Stack HCI, CSU’s College of Business has improved the performance of its SQL and file servers, printing systems, and remote desktop services and significantly reduced the volume of support tickets generated by users.

title: Microsoft Teams as part of the global energy transition: Wind energy specialist ENERCON reimagines collaboration
executive_summary: Wherever the wind blows, ENERCON is in its element. Based in the town of Aurich, Germany, the company supplies one in three of the country’s wind energy converters. Founded in 1984, ENERCON was the first manufacturer to pursue a low-maintenance, gearless drive concept for its wind turbines—a concept it has continued developing to this day. In recent years, the wind energy pioneer has positioned itself as an increasingly international company. Microsoft Teams is the collaborative platform of choice here, combining all the digital tools required for communication and collaboration in one place.

title: OneStream Empowers Customers to Make Faster and More Informed Decisions with Azure
executive_summary: Offering a full end-to-end platform for data quality, financial reporting, budgeting planning and forecasting and deep analytics including built in AutoAI capabilities, OneStream has been instrumental in helping organizations retire legacy point solutions from Oracle, SAP, IBM and more recently Anaplan across manufacturing, retail, financial services and other verticals. OneStream strongly believes that the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) by finance and operations offices is a matter of when – not if.

title: Lotte E&C in Korea is Implementing a Smart Workplace With Microsoft Surface and Teams
executive_summary: Established in 1959, Lotte E&C is Korea's 8th largest construction company in terms of contract amount as of 2022. The company has built a reputation domestically and internationally for the completion and successful operation of Lotte World Tower, the tallest building in Korea and the fifth tallest in the world. With its construction capabilities, Lotte E&C has competitive advantages in all stages of construction projects, from planning, design, and procurement in the early stage of business to actual construction, project management, and operation after completion.

title: Sakata Seed America sows Innovation with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Sakata Seed America, Inc. (Sakata) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Sakata Seed Corporation of Yokohama, Japan. Sakata breeds, produces, and sells wholesale vegetables and ornamental genetics through seeds and plant cuttings. For more than forty years, Sakata has worked to meet the industry’s needs for high quality seed, strong performance, and excellent yields, as well as retail and consumer demand for delicious fruit and vegetables. They are actively involved in the development of new and improved plant varieties that are ideally suited to a wide range of environments around the world. Sakata continues to be an industry leader for innovation, quality, reliability, and service. It’s not surprising that Sakata’s overseas operations have earned them a reputation for quality in over 130 countries.

title: HRPlus gained scalability, stability, and security with the deployment of Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: With the support of TD Synnex, a Microsoft Partner, HRPlus went through a digital transformation with the deployment of Microsoft Azure and gained a new and modern ecosystem, which allows them to grow with a more robust system.

title: ePayLater powers 30x growth securely with Microsoft Azure, achieves more with less
executive_summary: ePayLater empowers small and medium enterprises (SMEs) by making credit inclusive, digital and accessible. The company offers a no-cost credit solution that enables small businesses to overcome short-term liquidity shortage and continue business as usual. Available across physical and digital channels, the product is a win-win for both buyers and sellers. Buyers are obliged to pay only after goods are received physically and get an additional 14-day interest-free credit. Sellers are able to eliminate risks and overheads of collection, unblock capital and boost sales

title: Snow Peak fully utilizes Azure and Microsoft 365! A close look at the aims of their digital strategies for enhancing user experience values
executive_summary: Snow Peak, a developer, manufacturer, and marketer of high-end outdoor products centered on auto-camping products, is working to strengthen connections with users through the use of digital technologies in order to realize its social mission of restoring humanity by connecting people to nature and people to people. They are leveraging Microsoft Azure to build up a data platform for collecting and utilizing digital data and linking core systems and community apps to improve the value of user experience. In some cases, increasing the customer loyalty resulted in a 10-fold increase in purchase price per unit. We asked them about the aims of their digital strategies, the roles played by Azure, and their vision for the future.

title: BKW uses Windows 365 to build a reliable, secure and flexible virtual PC to enable hybrid working
executive_summary: The main priority for global service provider BKW is to find sustainable solutions for the production, distribution and consumption of energy. After a period of rapid growth, the Swiss-based energy and infrastructure company’s on-prem IT infrastructure began to buckle under the pressure of scaling, leading the organization to scope out a new solution. After searching the market, BKW decided to deploy Windows 365, quickly migrating its users to a new virtual desktop environment that proved reliable, secure and flexible. The solution has helped to drive growth, enabled hybrid working and, above all, has given BKW the digital backbone to focus on solutions for the sustainability challenges of tomorrow.

title: Dreaming big: how the Philippines is using Microsoft Reading Progress to build confidence and enhance future ready skills in a global economy
executive_summary: It is no secret among educators across the Philippines that students need confidence to feel comfortable speaking and participating in a classroom setting. Speaking in a second language can be all that much more difficult for students who are worried about judgement from their peers or teachers. To help, the educators and students across the Philippines highlight the power of Reading Progress to bolster the confidence of learners who were previously hesitant to participate in class conversations and to help them with their future careers.

title: Omnichannel engagement technologists build a better retail customer experience on Azure
executive_summary: Peapod Digital Labs (PDL) is the digital and commercial engine for the companies of retail grocery group Ahold Delhaize USA. PDL builds and operates technology for Ahold Delhaize USA that drives omnichannel solutions for local brands. A modernization effort is transforming PDL into a cloud-first operation, with development, operations, and a collection of on-premises databases migrated to Microsoft Azure Database for PostgreSQL. PDL chose its proprietary store-picking app as the first to be built and delivered on the transformed infrastructure. In-store associates use the app on tablets and mobile devices to select products and fulfill online shoppers’ orders. Development and delivery are faster in Azure, and the store-picking app is demonstrating productivity improvement, a 33 percent reduction in errors, high application availability, and a 50 percent reduction in training time for in-store pickers at more than 800 stores.

title: SPAR NL readies for the future of retail with Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Customer Analytics develops high-performance system for seamless Data Routing and Aggregation (CADRA) from multiple systems using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Customer Analytics is a software and services company that offers data analytics, business consulting, and software and IT infrastructure services to B2B businesses. It seeks to strike a balance between investments in digital technology and people as it builds robust, data-driven business solutions to empower its customers. For instance, the company uses a synergy of data, analytics, and technology to resolve business problems that often cannot be solved with out-of-the-box applications. Over the last two decades, Customer Analytics has grown from strength to strength, building expertise across domains, with proficiency in data science, analytics, IT services management, and emerging technology platforms. The company has offices in India and the US with a strength of over 500 team members.

title: Renewtrak builds subscription renewal platform around Azure SQL Database, serverless compute and data services
executive_summary: Renewtrak has revolutionized the subscription renewal process with a solution that provides small, medium, and enterprise organizations with subscription-based products and services. The company’s renewal management platform removes friction from the renewal process, helping ensure that customers’ subscriptions are maintained and optimized while creating a new level of ongoing customer satisfaction and engagement. Built with highly secure and compliant Microsoft Azure managed compute and data infrastructure, the Renewtrak solution serves a global community of subscription vendors and channel partners who have experienced significant improvements in accounts receivable and net revenue retention.

title: Azure-based PaySpace streamlines payroll for multinational companies across continents
executive_summary: Over 11,000 companies in more than 40 countries globally trust PaySpace to manage their payroll and HR software and services. Hosted on Microsoft Azure, the cloud-native software-as-a-service (SaaS) solution brings payroll information together in a highly secure, centralized, and accessible platform. By taking advantage of the Microsoft ecosystem, PaySpace helps its customers enhance collaboration, security, and scalability. One of them is multinational bottling giant Coca-Cola Beverages Africa, which saved time and costs while ensuring compliance measures in local legislatures.

title: Dish TV boosts platform performance by 2x with Microsoft technology and Unified Support
executive_summary: Dish TV India Limited(DishTV) is India’s leading direct-to-home (DTH) Company and owns multiple individual brands like Dish TV, Zing, and d2h under its umbrella. The company benefits from numerous satellite platforms, including SES8, GSAT-15 and ST-2. DishTV has more than 750 channels and services, including 31 audio channels and 81 HD channels and services on its platform. The company has a vast distribution network of over 2,700 distributors and around 2,40,000 dealers across 9,300 towns in India. DishTV is connected with its pan India customer base through call centers that are spread across 22 cities and are equipped to handle customer queries all-round-the-clock in 12 different languages.

title: US LBM remodels its cybersecurity approach by centralizing IT with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Suppose your company routinely acquires businesses that vary in size and IT sophistication. Further suppose that preserving their brand identities, operating models, and community involvement is vital to your business ethic. How would you manage all that disparity while affording those companies operational independence, especially when they vary widely in size and IT budget? Building material supplier US LBM answered that question by centralizing its technology management and adding automation from Microsoft 365 Defender and Microsoft Sentinel. It provides new acquisitions with connected Microsoft Security solutions for proactive visibility and a degree of security that the company had never before achieved.

title: Lexmark streamlines and transforms sales operations with Experlogix CPQ for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: For Lexmark, a global provider of printing and imaging technology, an integrated approach to sales and operations was a meticulous and methodical strategy the leadership team envisioned and implemented to ease the transition to remote work, increase efficiency, and ensure a sustainable path to digital transformation. Using Experlogix CPQ and Microsoft Dynamics 365, the company integrated its CRM and CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) systems so the customer journey is visible and unequivocally supported, sales cycles compressed, and revenue accelerated. Lexmark also recorded an improvement in order accuracy, resulting in a 43 percent reduction in quote revisions along with seamless sales experience and streamlined reporting.

title: Solving Three Problems with SAP on Azure! Kao Achieves First Large-Scale Operation of ANF in Japan and Looks Ahead to Global Expansion
executive_summary: Kao, a leading Japanese manufacturer of consumer goods and chemicals, is working with its partner Accenture to fully integrate its global SAP systems. Kao has completed the migration of ECC 6.0 in Thailand and Singapore to S/4HANA by May 2022. The company plans to modernize all SAP systems in Asia, Europe, the US, and Japan, and to centralize codes and data globally that have been managed and operated independently in each country. As the cloud platform for the SAP system, “SAP on Azure” was chosen and the project is the first large-scale case in Japan to fully adopt Azure NetApp Files.

title: Engage Squared fosters sustainable growth and purpose-driven digital engagement with Viva Goals
executive_summary: The modern digital workplace is here, and there’s plenty of uncharted territory and challenges for intrepid trailblazers to navigate. Engage Squared, a consulting firm specializing in modern workplace solutions, built its reputation by venturing boldly into this increasingly vast domain. The company embraced the new era, creating a sought-after blueprint for fostering sustainable growth, cultivating an award-winning workplace culture, and increasing employee engagement and satisfaction. By specializing in the digital workplace and leading-edge employee experience solutions like Microsoft 365, Engage Squared helps its customers navigate the complexities and opportunities this new era presents through lived experiences and set a course for better business outcomes in this rapidly evolving landscape.

title: Versar unifies its global data tracking and reporting thanks to Xoriant’s expertise and Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Versar is a program management company delivering world-class technical and management support to governments and companies around the world. The firm focuses operations in the engineering and construction management, environmental services, and professional services segments and needed to automate its data capturing, processing, and reporting processes. Xoriant used its deep data and engineering expertise to build a solution using Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics pipelines and Power BI to fulfill Versar's reporting needs.

title: Co-op Group consolidates architecture with Azure Stack HCI to save £400,000 a year on power
executive_summary: Co-op Group is one of a kind. The British retail group has been serving customers and communities for more than 150 years by staying true to values like equality, solidarity, and concern for communities. Beholden to members rather than shareholders, Co-op strives to do business better and fairer by giving back to members and using its profits to support the communities it serves.

title: U.S. Bank invests in employee experience with Viva Connections in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Before Viva Connections, U.S. Bank employees who were looking for information on technologies had to peruse individual product help sites or websites with news related to employee collaboration tools. In addition to training resources and product information, U.S. Bank’s employee technology experience home site features weekly articles, and Viva Connections is helping them reach more people. After successfully implementing Viva Connections in Teams, U.S. Bank recently launched a mobile version of the employee experience site.

title: Microsoft Power BI Supports the Construction of Business Digitalization in SVW
executive_summary: The construction of a digital ecosystem is the key to accelerating the digital transformation of enterprises; through data visualization, data analysis and data application, empowering business digitization, accelerating the product innovation, improving operational efficiency, and making value adding for customers. During the process of business innovation, cultivate employees' digital capabilities and realize digital transformation of employees, providing continuously self-driven development of enterprises.

title: Awqaf Investment adopts a complete solution with the least effort
executive_summary: Awqaf Investment aims to grow the vast investment portfolio of the General Authority Awqaf (GAA) in Saudi Arabia. The company wanted to improve its business performance by enhancing its technological capabilities. Over the last eight months, all Awqaf Investment employees started using Microsoft’s Surface Pro 8 and Microsoft 365 in their daily operations. It has transformed how employees work, provided exceptional mobility and flexibility, and ensured high security, all while reducing IT costs.

title: Putting IoT to work for a sustainable future
executive_summary: Priorities for facilities management have evolved, with increasing focus on environmental sustainability, energy efficiency, and occupant well-being. To meet sustainability demands and cost pressures, building operations need to be smarter, more energy efficient, carbon negative, and water positive. A way to achieve these goals is to use IoT-powered building management solutions. Such solutions provide perceptive insight into the health of buildings and their assets by collecting and analyzing captured sensor data and giving owners and operators visibility and control of their building systems. Two companies that strive to bring about sustainability through Microsoft Azure services and IoT technology are ICONICS and Microsoft.

title: Kier Group builds the future by pivoting to the cloud with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Over the past decade, Kier found itself growing significantly, both organically and through acquisitions. The result of this growth was a highly distributed IT environment with several datacenters, numerous systems and applications, and multiple networks. To continue using the most innovative building approaches and cutting-edge technologies, however, Kier needed to modernize its digital infrastructure by migrating to the cloud. The company got there and is now realizing the power of the cloud with Microsoft Azure VMware Solution. With Azure VMware Solution, Kier was also able to migrate out of its datacenter environments and into the cloud easily, rapidly, and in a highly safe fashion without having to change applications or IP addresses.

title: BSi modernizes delivery proof with KPoD digital signatures and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance, reducing errors by 80 percent
executive_summary: In the convoluted and competitive landscape of the steel distribution industry, BSi Steel, one of South Africa's leading steel distributors, faced a formidable obstacle in maintaining a precise and up-to-date record of truck deliveries to its valued customers. BSi's truck drivers relied on manual paperwork to obtain customer signatures, which served as proof of delivery. However, this outdated and inefficient process led to several challenges, including errors in data entry, time-consuming administrative tasks, and increased operational costs. To overcome these obstacles and enhance its delivery process, BSi Steel implemented KAISPE’s digital signature capture solution, KPoD, that works in tandem with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance. The result has been a streamlined delivery process, an 80 percent reduction in errors, and an overall improvement in the efficiency of BSi’s supply chain management system.

title: Disability Rights Florida rapidly translates 10% of web content to ASL by using Signly and Microsoft Azure, increasing accessibility
executive_summary: Founded in 1977 and later established as a nonprofit organization, Disability Rights Florida (DRF) provides legal advocacy and rights protection for adults and children with a wide range of disabilities. Signly provides rapid deployment of American Sign Language (ASL) translations of websites using its sign language as a service (SLaaS) solution built on Microsoft Azure. The agility and high performance of Azure, combined with numerous Azure services, enabled rapid deployment of translated content to DRF’s website, enabling users to view or request ASL versions of the written text on any page. By integrating Signly's assistive technology, DRF expanded inclusive communication, accessibility, and independence for their ASL users and increased accessibility for 800,000 Floridians who are deaf or hard of hearing and who use sign language.

title: Orange Unified School District enables 28,000 students to learn securely anywhere with Microsoft 365 A5
executive_summary: When Orange Unified School District (OUSD) needed to remotely deploy and manage thousands of new devices for students and staff, the school district chose Microsoft 365 Education A5 and Windows PCs. The solution enabled the small IT team and OUSD to rapidly deploy approximately 30,000 devices, simplify management, and streamline and strengthen security. Most importantly the transformation helps OUSD enrich its learning environment and prepare students for future success.

title: XContent lowers its customers’ cloud spend up to 32 percent with CloudMonitor
executive_summary: XContent Business Solutions is a trusted Microsoft Azure Cloud Service Provider, offering comprehensive solutions and technological innovations to address business challenges and foster growth. An evaluation of XContent’s cloud estate and those of its customers uncovered the need to understand and optimize resources to deliver unparalleled value to clients. By white labeling CloudMonitor as part of CloudSource, XContent achieved an all-encompassing perspective of the Azure framework, which in turn helped its customers to optimize their cloud spend, in some cases saving up to 32 percent.

title: Complex can be easy: NORMA Group manages international supply chains with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: NORMA Group serves 10,000 customers in 100 countries as a leading engineered joining technology solutions supplier from 27 production sites and numerous sales offices worldwide. NORMA clamps, connectors, and fluid systems can be found in nearly all well-known automotive and industrial companies. NORMA Group has grown organically, entering new markets and regions, and through acquisition. This resulted in a disparate process landscape with eleven different ERP systems within the Group.

title: The Alabama Appellate Court System accelerates the wheels of justice with Windows 11 Enterprise
executive_summary: The Alabama Appellate Court System is transforming its legal landscape with a solution based on Windows 11 Enterprise and Microsoft 365 Government. The judicial institution is expediting results with flexible remote work and easy, secure access to case files anywhere in the United States. The team also has simplified IT management, and judges and court staff are better equipped to support the community, through a more secure, agile, and future-ready digital environment.

title: Public sector efficiency: Ashghal reaches more people with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Serving as the bedrock of Qatar's infrastructure growth, the Public Works Authority, Ashghal, is at the heart of the nation's infrastructural development. To facilitate smoother collaborations and conduct meetings online at convenience, Ashghal transitioned to Microsoft Teams Phone. This maintained critical operations during the COVID-19 pandemic. By centralizing and organizing key documents, projects, and conversations, the solution has also enabled Ashghal to streamline workflows and accommodate 3x more meeting attendees.

title: Teams and AI chatbots work together to create a streamlined digital helpdesk by leveraging query data
executive_summary: The adoption of "chatbots" that can automatically respond to user queries is accelerating across all businesses. While operational efficiencies and cost reductions are expected, the true value of this tool goes beyond that. The Business Support Department of the Business Innovation Division at Nippon Telegraph and Telephone East Corporation (NTT East) began business processes to improve the quality of human responses and share knowledge by integrating Microsoft Teams and AI chatbots. The company is taking the first step toward an effective digital experience by digitizing the familiar help desk response.

title: Arthur D. Little maximizes human capital, scans complex documents in seconds with Azure AI services
executive_summary: Consultants at Arthur D. Little often work with complex, unsorted document formats, creating a large, unwieldy amount of unstructured data. The firm wanted to tap into technology to improve its search capabilities and unlock its collective intelligence. Using Microsoft Azure AI resources, the firm built a solution that combines natural language processing with content and contextual search, getting consultants fast access to the information they need. It does so while maintaining data confidentiality and maximizing human capital. The game-changing solution has already helped the firm’s consultants prepare for client meetings faster and curate content for presentations in 50 percent less time. Soon, the firm will further advance its value to clients by offering them its Azure AI–based knowledge management solution.

title: Lexmark’s Azure-based IoT Solution for Connected Products helps manufacturers move from selling products to delivering advanced services
executive_summary: Lexmark, a global imaging and IoT solutions leader, grew its Microsoft-based IoT solution into an offering for other manufacturers. An effective IoT solution can transform how manufacturers go to market, but moving beyond “pilot mode” to gain the full benefits of IoT can be challenging. Lexmark, which had accomplished its own digital transformation with an IoT solution based on Microsoft Azure, quickly realized that other connected-device manufacturers would benefit from the same technology. It developed the Lexmark IoT Solution for Connected Products, providing a fast path to business outcomes. Now, as both the developer and the first user, Lexmark is delivering capabilities to meet real-world business needs.

title: Bayer innovates and advances industry using Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Agriculture
executive_summary: Since 2015, Bayer has deployed its Climate FieldView technology to give farmers an essential tool, accessible through any device, to inform and support on-farm decisions. Users can adapt farming operations and increase efficiency in the field using insights from satellite imagery, IoT hardware, and other technologies, through a centralized software application.
