Climate FieldView’s growth in popularity brought with it increased data management needs, creating a strain on Bayer's internal resources. Bayer partnered with Microsoft to implement a new cloud-based foundation for Climate FieldView using Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Agriculture. Now, Bayer can save time, cut costs, and free up its internal resources to build the next generation of innovative, digital solutions for farmers. As a strategic partner, Bayer’s decades of agriculture expertise informed the design of the Azure Data Manager and is thus helping empower organizations to address the challenges in agriculture today.

title: Kraft Heinz develops two groundbreaking apps with Microsoft technology, paving the way to transform the CPG industry
executive_summary: Global food enterprise The Kraft Heinz Company (Kraft Heinz) worked with Microsoft across several cross-functional initiatives to deliver groundbreaking innovation. Kraft Heinz previously had dozens of internal apps, which made it hard for sales professionals to understand or connect data to generate insights. Kraft Heinz and Microsoft set a vision and built two apps, Insights 2 Action (I2A) and LaunchPad, to aggregate key applications and insights into a single destination. Meanwhile, Ernst & Young, LLC, (EY) used Microsoft Power BI on Microsoft Azure to enhance data visualization for Kraft Heinz. More than 500 members of Kraft Heinz’s sales teams now act on near-real-time insights that drive sales.

title: Memphis-Shelby County Schools drive educational excellence with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Managing the twenty-third-largest school district in the United States is a massive undertaking that presents diverse challenges. For the team responsible for the 110,000 students across 214 campuses that make up Memphis-Shelby County Schools (MSCS), technology plays a vital role in the effort to keep everything running smoothly. However, with the rapidly changing pace of work inside the world of schools and academics, the need for new tools can rapidly outpace available solutions. To address the need for novel, custom tools without the requirement of costly and lengthy new adoptions, MSCS recently began looking for a high return on investment solution tailored to its diverse data gathering and reporting needs and leveraged Microsoft Power Apps data acquisition and reporting for leaders and staff across the organization, using Microsoft Power Automate.

title: Quotient Ventures turns to Microsoft 365 Business Premium for productivity, collaboration, device management, and data security in a single solution
executive_summary: Mumbai-based Tilt Brand Solutions, part of Quotient Ventures, offers brand and communications services to a wide range of clients. In 2022, the young company reached an inflection point in its growth trajectory and needed to standardize ways of working, collaborating, and communicating securely. With an IT team of two, the company also needed to ensure that the solution could be managed primarily by a few users. Quotient Ventures chose Microsoft 365 Business Premium as its IT solution and hasn’t looked back. In addition to reducing costs by 40% while increasing productivity, Tilt Brand Solutions reports other, unexpected benefits, particularly in the area of security.

title: One NZ doubles ICT business by enhancing Microsoft Teams Phone for customers
executive_summary: One NZ, a leading telecommunications business in New Zealand, partnered with Microsoft to offer new products and services to customers, including Operator Connect, a service that adds Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) connectivity to the Microsoft Teams experience. The business onboarded new customers to Microsoft Teams Phone leveraging Operator Connect in just a few days, accelerated its speed to market, and doubled ICT growth as a result of its collaboration with Microsoft.

title: Rebuilding a nation: UADamage accelerates Ukraine’s damage assessments through Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Half a million damaged buildings across 162 settlements in Ukraine assessed and mapped out in mere days instead of months—that's the remarkable pace at which UADamage has been able to accelerate Ukraine's reconstruction and demining efforts. Thanks to its community of engineers and a partnership with Microsoft, a city the size of Kharkiv can now be processed in just a few hours, with enhanced security for sensitive data using Microsoft Azure. UADamage not only fast-tracked damage assessments but is also working towards a future of transparent and corruption-free reconstruction.

title: Klöckner Pentaplast enables innovation and productivity for a global workforce with Windows 11 Pro
executive_summary: Klöckner Pentaplast (kp) is deploying Windows 11 Pro for all employees and the entire device fleet in a fast-paced process. The operating system aligns with the company’s sustainability practices and offers team members many new and enhanced capabilities that help them get excited about using technology and achieve more in their jobs. Because it now takes just a few seconds instead of up to 90 minutes to update a laptop or desktop, IT managers can focus their talents on accelerating innovation and making technology users’ lives easier. Critically for kp, Windows 11 Pro comes with advanced, highly manageable security capabilities to help safeguard intellectual property and digital assets. AI enablement and frequent, painless updates make Windows 11 Pro an outstanding technology foundation on which kp can build its future.

title: Growing Dynamics 365 functionality is key for SiteOne’s green business
executive_summary: SiteOne Landscape Supply (NYSE: SITE) prides itself on being the green industry’s number one partner. With an annual revenue of more than $4 billion, over 7,000 vendors, and more than 150,000 unique items in inventory, it’s the largest distributor of wholesale landscaping, hardscaping, irrigation, lighting, nursery, and pest control products in the United States. In addition to more than 600 retail locations in the US and Canada, SiteOne has an e-commerce presence and ships or delivers directly to customer job sites. From urban gardens and residential landscaping to large-scale commercial development projects, SiteOne’s local experts understand regional and site-specific requirements and design aesthetics.

title: Customers travel smart with Apollo and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Part of the European travel leader DERTOUR Group, Apollo is among the Nordic region's leading tour operators planning, booking, and arranging vacation and business trips for more than one million travelers annually. Whether it’s a relaxing beach holiday or an exciting city stay, Apollo’s network of tour operators, hotel brands, destination agencies, and business travel experts pair unparalleled service with expert knowledge to land its customers the trips of their dreams.

title: BECIS confidently manages green energy solutions with EvergreenWorx CMMS
executive_summary: BECIS is an Energy-as-a-Service (EaaS) company that provides customers with energy and related services across eight countries in Asia. Under the EaaS model, BECIS builds, owns, and operates various renewable energy generation assets such as solar, waste heat, and biogas solutions. This allows its customers to focus on their core businesses while implementing green energy solutions. With 200+ assets with useful lives of up to 20 years each, BECIS turned to EvergreenWorx and Microsoft Power Platform to deploy a scalable and adaptable asset management and operations platform. With this platform, BECIS can assure customers of the safe, high-quality, and efficient operation of the assets providing energy services.

title: GraceKennedy uses Azure App Service to increase access to financial services through its GK ONE app in the Caribbean
executive_summary: The GraceKennedy Group (GraceKennedy), a conglomerate headquartered in Jamaica that offers food trading and financial services across several countries, used Microsoft Azure and Azure App Service to provide more efficient financial services to customers. Recently, GraceKennedy has focused on unifying its financial services and improving customer experiences with secure digital solutions. Working with Azure offerings, GraceKennedy created the GK ONE app to connect financial services—such as remittances, bill payments, banking, and insurance—in one easy-to-use space. Since its 2022 launch, the app has seen monthly double-digit percentage growth in transaction completion and has become the number one digital wallet for remittances in Jamaica.

title: Manchester Met reduces up to 50% of its network footprint with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Manchester Metropolitan University faced the imminent end of support for its on-premises VMware infrastructure. Because of the university’s existing licensing, Microsoft Azure VMware Solution stood out due to cost benefits and value-added services. The university moved 80% of its servers to Azure VMware Solution within eight months while also consolidating a datacenter from 25 to seven comms racks. It achieved a 43% reduction in essential servers and cut its on-premises footprint by up to half. Manchester Met’s IT staff embraced cloud concepts and report improved performance across migrated applications, databases, and servers. The university now prioritizes Azure-native solutions, marking a major shift in its approach to technology.

title: Revolutionizing water supply in Ghana with Microsoft Azure: Ghana Water Limited's digital transformation
executive_summary: Ghana Water Limited (GWL) is transforming urban water supply with Microsoft cloud technology—enhancing productivity, streamlining payment processes, and improving customer service. Its shift to Azure and Microsoft 365 E5 has revolutionized operations and bolstered data security, benefiting nearly 940,000 customers that rely on the company for reliable water access. From virtual team meetings to smart metering to real-time reporting, the company has seen how technology is essential to its future.

title: Agappe transforms operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Agappe Diagnostics Ltd (Agappe) was founded in 1995 with the vision of becoming the premier partner in diagnostics and contributing to the welfare of mankind. The company has since established itself as a rapidly expanding In-Vitro Diagnostic (IVD) company. It focuses on the research, design, and production of clinical chemistry, immunochemistry, immunology, and haematology reagents and equipment. Additionally, the company provides point of care testing solutions to deliver high-quality and affordable diagnostics to customers.

title: Infrastructure at the touch of a button: Stadtwerke München runs SAP on the Microsoft Cloud to keep Munich supplied with utilities
executive_summary: N/A

title: Finastra delivers faster updates and performance using Azure Kubernetes Service with Windows containers
executive_summary: LaserPro document management software is key to the Finastra vision of delivering the future of banking. Migrating from an on-premises management system to a cloud-based infrastructure using Windows containers on Azure Kubernetes Service has significantly increased agility through biweekly updates and reduced support costs for both customers and developers.

title: Microsoft Teams lays the foundation for Globo content management and production
executive_summary: Using Microsoft Teams and Together Mode (Custom Scenes), Globo was able to leverage its internal communication with more users and video conferencing, in addition to its valuable tool that has been increasingly used by journalism, sports, and entertainment. Pursuing security and robustness, the platform continues to be improved but is already bringing interesting results to the company.

title: Deutsche Bahn’s community of citizen developers drives innovation at scale with Power Platform
executive_summary: Deutsche Bahn (DB) Group operates the largest rail infrastructure in Europe and provides both rail freight and passenger transport services. The company has found a way to accelerate innovation across the company—by empowering every employee with a premium Power Platform license to build low-code business applications. Their apps are saving time and reducing costs, with the potential to scale that impact across the world’s largest railway company.

title: Manchester Met reduces up to 50% of its network footprint with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Manchester Metropolitan University faced the imminent end of support for its on-premises VMware infrastructure. Because of the university’s existing licensing, Microsoft Azure VMware Solution stood out due to cost benefits and value-added services. The university moved 80% of its servers to Azure VMware Solution within eight months while also consolidating a datacenter from 25 to seven comms racks. It achieved a 43% reduction in essential servers and cut its on-premises footprint by up to half. Manchester Met’s IT staff embraced cloud concepts and report improved performance across migrated applications, databases, and servers. The university now prioritizes Azure-native solutions, marking a major shift in its approach to technology.

title: Elderly healthcare nonprofit Joris Zorg guards against cyberattacks with Microsoft Defender
executive_summary: Dutch elder healthcare nonprofit Joris Zorg experienced a hack of an on-premise server in 2022. The attack accelerated its ongoing move to the cloud and led the organization to work with Microsoft partner Wortell to strengthen its security stance. Now, Wortell’s managed detection and response services with Microsoft Defender repel cyberattacks and protect personally identifiable information.

title: Renting Colombia optimizes service with Microsoft AI Services
executive_summary: Renting Colombia deployed a virtual assistant that uses Microsoft Azure technology to automate processes and identify service and maintenance needs for its fleet of more than 35,000 vehicles it rents in the country.

title: City FM scales up its presence and transforms service with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The world’s top retail, grocery, and convenience store chains partner with City Facilities Management (City) for comprehensive, integrated facilities management, building and engineering, and sustainability solutions. City’s unique end-to-end self-performing model is rooted in tailored solutions to fit its partners’ plans for growth. City’s own growth necessitated a move away from its legacy on-premises enterprise resource planning (ERP) system and disconnected service solutions to Dynamics 365 Finance, Supply Chain Management, and Field Service to streamline workflows and optimize operations and service delivery in its US market.

title: Accelleron turbocharges IT support solution and resolution times with Power Platform
executive_summary: Accelleron needed to quickly establish IT service management after being carved out from ABB Ltd. It faced lengthy implementation timelines and required a user-friendly ticketing tool for transparency across multiple countries and process areas.

title: NTPF digitally accelerates management of patient waiting lists with Power Platform
executive_summary: The National Treatment Purchase Fund (NTPF) was managing a vast amount of patient waiting list data through a time-consuming, Excel-based process.

title: Accelleron turbocharges IT support solution and resolution times with Power Platform
executive_summary: Accelleron needed to quickly establish IT service management after being carved out from ABB Ltd. It faced lengthy implementation timelines and required a user-friendly ticketing tool for transparency across multiple countries and process areas.

title: NTPF digitally accelerates management of patient waiting lists with Power Platform
executive_summary: The National Treatment Purchase Fund (NTPF) was managing a vast amount of patient waiting list data through a time-consuming, Excel-based process.

title: Old Mutual elevates finance team to strategic partner with Dynamics 365 Finance
executive_summary: With more than 100 companies across 12 countries, Old Mutual required a unified platform to provide real-time visibility and insights across the organization.

title: LTIMindtree empowers security teams with the speed and scale of AI using Microsoft Copilot for Security
executive_summary: LTIMindtree faced challenges with swift incident responses in the evolving cybersecurity landscape. The ongoing battle against cyber threats diverted time and effort from developing innovative solutions, leading to additional work efforts.

title: IT consultancy extends global employee productivity with data residency compliance
executive_summary: As an IT consultancy, Dimension Data helps companies use technology to be more productive and competitive. But it was stymied in its own global rollout of Microsoft Office 365—Australian government contractual requirements blocked the company’s ability to move its Australian business to the cloud. Dimension Data is removing that blocker with Multi-Geo Capabilities in Office 365. With all employees using Office 365, Dimension Data expands collaboration and teamwork and reduces costs by eliminating on-premises infrastructure.

title: Robert Walters sets the highest standards in recruitment with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Robert Walters is a growing recruitment business with a mobile workforce. It wanted to empower staff by taking advantage of the latest technologies. They provided every member of staff with a Microsoft Surface device. They used these to access key business applications, including Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power BI and Microsoft Teams, while on the move. Now staff are better supported to work in the mobile, modern way they desire. Customers love the reporting available to them via Power BI.

title: Gelsenwasser, a utility company, uses Microsoft Power Apps to accelerate operational and administrative processes
executive_summary: Water, energy, sewage, and infrastructure services—the utility company GELSENWASSER AG, headquartered in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, is active across many sectors. The company supplies IT services to its subsidiaries as well as numerous other companies. However, its IT department was slowly running up against capacity limits. In order to manage work processes more efficiently under one roof, the utility has increased focus on digitalizing processes that were previously paper-based. Leadership realized that Microsoft Power Apps are also offline-capable, which means the company can digitalize a steadily growing number of internal work processes. The first areas it tackled were facility management, groundwater measurement, and effectiveness control.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Power Apps, Power Automate

title: Co-op moves its multi-century mission forward with a data warehouse built on Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Since 1844, the Co-op’s mission has been to help its communities thrive. The group does this today by providing food, insurance, legal services, funeral care, and more to members and customers across the United Kingdom. When the Co-op’s siloed, on-premises data solution could no longer keep up with its needs, the team evaluated leading cloud solutions and chose Microsoft Azure and Azure Synapse Analytics for its modern data warehouse solution. Now, the Co-op is unlocking insights and new use cases to empower communities today—and far into the future.

title: American Nurses Association chooses Catapult Systems to streamline and support rapid expansion of Azure usage, reducing costs by 30%
executive_summary: With a mission to transform the nation’s health through the power of nursing, the American Nurses Association advocates for four million registered nurses and their patients across the United States. ANA engaged Catapult Systems in a strategic partnership to help manage and optimize its Azure environment, focusing on security, operations, and spending. As COVID-19 spread across the United States and the world, Catapult’s Azure Management Service helped ANA pivot quickly. Catapult implemented monitoring, analytics, and governance, and other components that enabled ANA to transition over 250 employees to a remote workforce, cut Azure costs by 30 percent, increase its security score by 38 percent, and reduce service issues by 60 percent.

title: The Contingent serves more families in Oregon’s foster care system with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Contingent works to mobilize Oregonians to walk alongside children, youth, and families in support of the state of Oregon’s foster care system. After struggling to collect and use data to further that mission, the organization developed a customer relationship management solution using Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power BI, and Azure to understand the supporter journey and connect volunteers and foster families with the Department of Human Services. It is also using the Common Data Model for Nonprofits to connect applications and processes across the organization and glean insights that direct decisions. Now, the organization is leveraging this solution to recruit supporters, improve the process of being certified as a foster family, and ultimately get foster children the care they need.

title: Boys & Girls Clubs of America serves youth most in need via a user-friendly, cloud-based platform
executive_summary: Boys & Girls Clubs of America rebuilt its MyFuture platform on Microsoft Azure in 2019. The responsive and highly secure platform has allowed more than 3,200 Clubs to reach members even when Clubs had to close during the COVID-19 crisis. The cloud platform will continue to connect members with staff, enable employees to customize the online experience of individual Clubs, and provide relevant programming to youth—now and after Clubs reopen.

title: True to its reputation for embracing the latest technology, Husky now uses the Microsoft HoloLens experience to explain and draw attention to its products.
executive_summary: True to its reputation for embracing the latest technology, Husky now uses the Microsoft HoloLens experience to explain and draw attention to its products.

title: Ships use data from IoT and cloud solution to operate more safely and efficiently
executive_summary: ABB, a pioneering technology leader in digital industries, is using the Internet of Things and cloud computing to help the maritime industry chart a course for digital transformation. The ABB Ability Marine Advisory System – OCTOPUS is a digital solution that enables vessel owners to gather and analyze data from both onboard sensors and external sources in real time, helping them to optimize operations, improve crew and cargo safety, and maximize fuel efficiency.

title: SetPoint Medical tackles autoimmune diseases with .NET Core 3 and Windows Presentation Foundation
executive_summary: Chronic autoimmune diseases affect millions of people and impose a significant burden on the health care system. To alleviate this burden, SetPoint Medical is pioneering the use of bioelectronic medicine to fundamentally alter the treatment paradigm for autoimmune diseases. Its revolutionary implantable neurostimulator was built using .NET Core 3, Windows Presentation Foundation, and Windows 10, and the company is on the verge of providing a treatment with potentially less risk and cost than drug therapy.
products: .NET, Windows 10

title: Innovation in the classroom: ‘serious achievements in just one year’
executive_summary: One year was enough for the teachers at Veres Pálné High School to get over their initial skepticism, accept, and effectively use digital education tools. We sat down with Bálint Korompay, Principal at Veres Pálné, to learn more about how the Hungary-based school is navigating the digital space with Microsoft Office 365 and Microsoft Teams.

title: Camp management software provider accelerates performance at lower cost with Azure SQL Database serverless
executive_summary: CampBrain provides a gateway to fun for millions of campers. Based in Toronto, Canada, the software company offers a system to run camp registration, fee collection, and other administrative tasks. The small company serves a diverse clientele subject to dramatic and unpredictable usage spikes. All kinds of camps run on CampBrain—from traditional day and overnight summer camps to special needs, plus conference centers. It found a spike-proof, budget-friendly solution in Microsoft Azure SQL Database, using the serverless compute tier to optimize price performance and simplify management. While camp managers and parents enjoy uninterrupted service, CampBrain appreciates the savings—the company projects compute cost savings of 60 percent.

title: Geojit Financial Services shortens sales cycles, increases cross-sell opportunities with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Geojit Financial Services has more than 30 years of experience in capital markets in India. It manages assets worth approximately INR37,000 crore (USD4.9 billion) for its more than 1 million clients, who trust Geojit’s deep expertise, transparency, and cutting-edge technology solutions. The company wanted to update the legacy solution and processes it used for sales and customer service so that it could differentiate its business with more robust sales capabilities and value-added client services. To achieve these goals, Geojit deployed Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Customer Service, along with Microsoft Power Platform.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Power Pages

title: Leading Romanian healthcare network REGINA MARIA supports doctors and patients with virtual clinic
executive_summary: REGINA MARIA is one of the largest healthcare networks in Romania, recognized worldwide through 12 international accreditations for medical excellence and patient care safety. To make its leading medical services even more accessible, the company opened a virtual clinic in Microsoft Teams. Rolled out in a mere 10 days amid the COVID-19 pandemic and designed to aid access to quality healthcare, the telemedicine service has powered more than 130,000 virtual consultations within the first seven months. This has opened up a new critical healthcare lifeline, making it possible for Romanian citizens located in remote areas or even abroad to receive care from doctors and experts, no matter where they are.

title: Marks & Spencer embraces the future of retail with Microsoft Teams for frontline workers
executive_summary: When Nick Williams, Store Manager at Marks & Spencer Windsor, walks down the high street to work, he’s already checked in with his team and reviewed the day ahead. “I start the day by checking in with a series of different Microsoft Teams channels,” he says. “It helps me know what I’m walking into every morning.” Once Williams arrives, he again uses Teams to access Microsoft Power BI for immediate insights into how the store is functioning, something that used to be time-consuming, paper-laden work. “Before we started using Teams and Power BI on our devices and mobile phones, analyzing sales reports could take half an hour of clicking and printing every morning,” he says. “Today, I just pick up my Surface and go straight to the sales floor. I can drill down into any information I need in a matter of minutes.”

title: How an IoT platform is helping Eneco lead the energy transition
executive_summary: Netherlands-based energy supplier Eneco is on a mission to make sustainable energy resources available to everyone. To achieve this, the company has built an IoT platform that can communicate with the thousands of heating systems in its network, and which is currently being expanded to solar and wind energy systems. From cost savings to resource management, the platform is a key enabler of Eneco’s environmental ambitions.

title: Law firm Bradley readies for a win: higher performance, efficiency with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: Prominent American law firm Bradley adopted a hybrid infrastructure in 2016 to reduce licensing costs, increase performance, and heighten security for its workloads. Now, the firm anticipates further simplifying management and boosting performance with the newest development in hyperconverged infrastructure (HCI): Microsoft Azure Stack HCI. Delivered as an Azure service, it offers Bradley a simplified way to manage its hybrid estate while also increasing performance and security.

title: Government of Nunavut comes back stronger after ransomware attack with Microsoft security solutions
executive_summary: When a ransomware attack shut down computer systems at the Government of Nunavut, Canada’s largest and northernmost territory, the IT team responded with a well-coordinated strategy. But its isolation and the challenges of a harsh climate complicated technology environments, and the team wanted a coordinated toolset. It worked with Microsoft’s elite cybersecurity DART team to rebuild its network and 5,500 devices while also rolling out security solutions—including Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps—all in just weeks during an Arctic winter.

title: VINCI Energies: The scalable benefits of running native applications in the cloud
executive_summary: For VINCI Energies in the Netherlands, data integration is essential to allow its national network to share knowledge and insights freely. But as the organization is growing, its current enterprise service bus (ESB) system began feeling the strain—pushing VINCI Energies in the Netherlands to find a more scalable solution that could grow with its datasets. That solution was Microsoft Azure Red Hat OpenShift, which combines the flexibility of a container platform with the scalability of cloud infrastructure. And after successfully adopting the solution at full scale, the network organization is now sharing its model throughout its global network to help other sectors in VINCI Energies with their own data challenges.

title: Wildlife Protection Solutions helps protect the wildest places with Microsoft AI for Earth
executive_summary: Wildlife Protection Solutions (WPS) sits in the nexus between the most remote places in the world and burgeoning animal conservation science. It provides the monitoring technology that conservation groups need to keep watch over wild places and protect wildlife. Conservationists use remote cameras to gather image data about the status of the species they protect, but the number of images that must be analyzed before action can be taken is overwhelming. WPS overcomes this barrier in collaboration with Microsoft AI for Earth, supported by Azure technologies for a species-preserving solution.

title: Ichilov hospital adopts Microsoft solutions to improve communications, customize solutions, and enhance patient treatment
executive_summary: Tel Aviv Sourasky Medical Center (Ichilov) is Israel's leading multidisciplinary healthcare institution, globally recognized as a front-runner and provider of highly professional medical care. A leading academic and scientific research medical center, Ichilov’s medical specialists provide top medical care, participate in numerous research projects, cooperate with leading international and national institutions and pharmaceutical companies, and develop and use innovative technologies.

title: Lumen’s strategic leap: How Copilot is redefining productivity and employee engagement
executive_summary: Lumen Technologies is redefining customer success and sales processes through the strategic use of AI-powered Microsoft Copilot, enhancing productivity, sales, and customer service in the global communications sector. This transition is part of Lumen’s shift from traditional telecom services to a technology-driven, innovative, and efficient enterprise. Copilot supports Lumen’s operations by automating routine tasks and significantly reducing the workload on employees so they can focus on higher-value activities. Key leaders advocate for the role Copilot can play in increasing productivity without expanding the workforce while fostering a culture that values work-life balance. This initiative has not only strengthened Lumen’s competitive edge but has also redefined the inclusion of technology in corporate strategies.

title: UK health and social care services provider streamlines its clinical model with Power Platform
executive_summary: Surrey and Borders Partnership (SABP) NHS Foundation Trust provides health and social care services for people in Surrey, England, and surrounding counties in the United Kingdom. To deliver applications customized to specific health and care needs, SABP has deployed more than 30 solutions using Microsoft Power Platform.

title: Dynamics 365 improves collaboration and user experience at global bank, HSBC
executive_summary: “The pace is fast in terms of trying to keep up with the latest technologies, but also to keep up with our competitors,” emphasises Harsha Goodlad, CIO Frontline Effectiveness, Marketing & Sustainability, Wholesale Banking, at HSBC.

title: Technology drives BWT Alpine F1® Team beyond the track
executive_summary: Every time BWT Alpine F1 Team drivers Fernando Alonso and Esteban Ocon get behind the wheel, more than 200 sensors collect over 50 billion data points that help the technical staff improve aerodynamics, performance, and handling.

title: Inclusion Scotland shows that disabled people can do so much more with Microsoft
executive_summary: “Microsoft technology makes sure that disabled people do not feel they’re a burden,” says Raj Jeyaraj, Head of Operations at Inclusion Scotland.

title: Enabling Remote Learning During the Pandemic
executive_summary: Established in 2009, IGA is a Tunisia-based software company that specializes in insurance solutions. Its existing IT infrastructure was not giving the results and performance it was looking for, impacting its customers’ business. The company upgraded and modernized its solutions by moving its applications to the Azure cloud. With the switch to Microsoft, IGA ensured the scalability of applications, making it affordable for all. It also minimized downtime for its customers.

title: ManpowerGroup gains holistic view into sales data with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
executive_summary: ManpowerGroup is a world leader in innovative workforce solutions. The company has been in business for over 70 years in over 80 countries, bringing a complete talent solution to their clients. To gain a holistic view into sales and pipeline data, ManpowerGroup developed the Account Planning Power App integrated with Dynamics 365 Sales. Employees can now manage daily sales activity, identify client trends and opportunities, and quickly uncover presentation data in one location. Data is accessible from mobile devices which enables staff to be agile and make decisions in real-time. This improves the customer experience and provides ManpowerGroup a competitive advantage.

title: Czech bank, Česká spořitelna, reshapes customer experience with Azure-based solution
executive_summary: Česká spořitelna is more than a bank—it educates people on how to better manage their finances in order to achieve personal prosperity. By enabling its customers to achieve more, the company empowers individuals to contribute to the growth of the Czech Republic as a whole. To bring its services to new levels, the company implemented Quadient Inspire Flex—a customer communications management solution from Microsoft partner Quadient—to improve customer communications. Based on Microsoft Azure cloud, Inspire is highly scalable, enables cost optimization, and enhances security, so that the bank can offer the best experience to its customers.
products: Azure, Microsoft Entra ID

title: ‘So much at stake’: National Forest Foundation heads to the cloud to grow its forest restoration mission
executive_summary: The National Forest Foundation is a nonprofit that works to preserve and protect wildlife habitat and forestry across the 193 million acres of the National Forest System. As the needs of the forests grow, so do the needs of the Foundation – requiring new technology solutions that are scalable, collaborative, and more efficient. Watch to learn more about how Microsoft Cloud for Nonprofit enables the National Forest Foundation to track donor dollars, quantify the impact of their work, and further its mission of environmental restoration and conservation.

title: INTRALOT ignites industry-leading innovation with Azure employee upskilling initiative
executive_summary: With a global workforce of more than 2,000 employees, a global lottery solutions leader INTRALOT is transforming players’ gaming experiences with flexible, intelligent and innovative high-tech solutions. To support an organization-wide migration to Microsoft cloud, INTRALOT partnered with Microsoft to receive Azure training and certification to upskill its people. The learning program received an overwhelmingly positive response from employees, enabling INTRALOT to extract maximum value from its cloud technology. Technical employees were enthusiastically engaged and remained on the cutting edge of their fields.

title: Nimble and Sherweb partner up for growth on the commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Nimble, a simple, smart CRM built for Microsoft 365, unifies information across contacts, email, and calendars into a powerful team relationship manager. Sherweb is an award-winning Gold Microsoft partner with more than 6500 partners, whose value-added cloud solutions help customers streamline operations. Working in partnership and scaling in tandem, Nimble and Sherweb joined together to sell through the commercial marketplace leveraging margin sharing—a new feature where independent software vendors (ISV) like Nimble can create a private offer for partners in the Cloud Solution Provider program and offer the CSP a margin as motivation to resell the ISV solution. It’s a winning integration all around.

title: Inclusion Scotland shows that disabled people can do so much more with Microsoft
executive_summary: “Microsoft technology makes sure that disabled people do not feel they’re a burden,” says Raj Jeyaraj, Head of Operations at Inclusion Scotland.

executive_summary: Established in 2009, IGA is a Tunisia-based software company that specializes in insurance solutions. Watch to learn more about how Microsoft Cloud for Nonprofit enables the National Forest Foundation to track donor dollars, quantify the impact of their work, and further its mission of environmental restoration and conservation.
