executive_summary: Parloa saw a need for businesses to use AI for personalized, dynamic customer support experiences. Taking a “voice-first” approach, it wanted to create human-like interactions regardless of language.

title: ICG cuts proposal response time by 80% with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: As a startup consulting firm, ICG needed to hit the ground running with administrative infrastructure that allowed it to generate revenue quickly.

title: UBS innovates on Azure by transforming its critical workloads from mainframe into cloud native solutions
executive_summary: At the heart of this enterprise-wide modernization effort lies the Electronic Archive (ELAR) system, the largest records management system of ex Credit Suisse. ELAR manages an immense dataset of nearly 2 petabytes in a Mainframe Db2 database.

title: Carle Health boosts patient response to 87% with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Carle Health wanted to modernize patient engagement, reduce communication delays and improve care access while optimizing system-wide efficiency.

title: Now Optics and Avantiico’s ERP integration fuels expansion and modernizes eye care in 18 months with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Now Optics decided to transform and unify its point-of-sale, inventory, and finance systems to support its rapid business growth. The company needed a comprehensive ERP solution that would scale to support new locations and services.

title: Sheló NABEL jumps into the future with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and increases its sales by 17%
executive_summary: Sheló NABEL's expansion highlighted challenges within its operating model. The company required real-time visibility and control to facilitate improved decision-making and effective management of independent entrepreneurs.

title: Kern County unifies its approach to secure and govern data with Microsoft Purview
executive_summary: Kern County faced fragmented IT systems and lack of data classification, making security and compliance difficult. Unifying their approach improved data protection, reduced risk, supported compliance, and strengthened governance.

title: Fujitsu speeds TTM, expands security with Microsoft Dev Box, GitHub Copilot
executive_summary: Known for its human-centric innovation, Fujitsu builds technologies and capabilities for a complex, fast-changing world. But creating those solutions meant deploying customized computers for each project, and configuration chores cost developer time.

title: Cincinnati Children’s makes tough times easier with family-friendly mobile app
executive_summary: Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center is well known for the excellence of its care and its commitment to the well-being of the families it serves. To reduce strain for parents and make their lives easier, the hospital created the Caren mobile app using Microsoft Azure and Azure services. Parents turn to Caren for help navigating the hospital, to get answers to their questions, and to help them entertain their children. Using the app lets parents focus more on their families and less on stressful details.

title: Data science consultancy transforms the future of UK energy—and its own business—with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Elastacloud, a London-based data science consultancy, wanted to combine AI, advanced analytics, and machine learning to promote more profitable low-carbon energy production in the United Kingdom. So, it used Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to build and run the Elastacloud Energy BSUoS Forecast service, an AI-powered web service that helps energy providers avoid incurring energy-balancing fees imposed by national energy authorities. Now providers can better predict energy prices and help create a smarter energy system, while Elastacloud transforms its business.

title: European power company energizes its security and governance with cloud monitoring tools
executive_summary: Based in Solna, Sweden, Vattenfall provides energy services to 6.5 million business and residential customers across several European countries. The power company is committed to fossil-free living, and as part of this goal it has modernized its IT ecosystem by moving resources to Microsoft Azure. To manage security and governance in the cloud, Vattenfall worked with Orange Networks to deploy Azure Security Center and other Azure services to better identify and remediate potential security risks and to optimize its cloud deployments and spending.

title: Traceability and food safety innovator completes a seamless migration in two hours with Azure Database for PostgreSQL
executive_summary: HarvestMark creates technology solutions that food producers, government agencies, and retailers use to track quality and boost food safety. When its former cloud provider entered the food retail market, HarvestMark had to find an alternative that would eliminate its retail customers’ concerns about any possible conflict of interest. The food traceability pioneer found exactly what it needed with Microsoft Azure and Azure Database for PostgreSQL, and it conducted a seamless migration in a lightning-fast two hours, for a zero-impact transition for its customers. HarvestMark is seeing a 20 percent decrease in cloud hosting service costs.

title: PepsiCo uses Azure Machine Learning to identify consumer shopping trends and produce store-level actionable insights
executive_summary: As one of the world’s leading food and beverage companies, PepsiCo needs to balance consumer demand for its products with inventory on hand—in thousands of US stores. To move to a more machine learning, predictive analytics approach, the company deployed Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to gain actionable insights from its vast repositories of data, and PepsiCo has started using it for select markets in the United States. As the company learns from this pilot test and the models, its goal is to expand more broadly to other sectors and markets. In the pilot, PepsiCo field associates received daily lists of priorities for each store they visit, so they can better predict the snacks that individual stores need to stock to better meet the shopping needs of consumers. The data scientists generating the lists use the machine learning operations capabilities in Azure Machine Learning to streamline the process of developing and working with the models that inform those priorities. As a result, early signs estimate a shift of 4,300 days of work a year from routine tasks to value-added activities.

title: Achieving digital transformation and success with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: To maintain its constant growth as a small-sized business and provide the same level of customer excellence and service, Polytropic had to evaluate whether its current business processes and software could handle the growing demand. To stay ahead of its demand and growth, Polytropic chose to transition from Microsoft Dynamics NAV to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central in the cloud to take advantage of the virtualization and scale the cloud affords.

title: ENGIE brings AI to renewable energy platform, helps decarbonize energy production with Azure
executive_summary: Renewable energy assets connected by the Internet of Things (IoT)—such as wind turbines and solar arrays—create huge amounts of useful data on everything from performance and output to maintenance issues. But processing and making sense of all this data requires serious performance and scalability. When power provider ENGIE modernized its Darwin operational performance software with Microsoft Azure Time Series Insights and Azure IoT Edge, it delivered AI-driven analytics and scalable data management capabilities to optimize power generation and asset management, helping to decarbonize its global energy production.

title: How technology is revolutionizing care for patients with chronic conditions
executive_summary:
“Patients with chronic conditions getting the treatment they need—without making multiple trips to the hospital. That’s the reality of our monitoring system.”
José Paulo Carvalho, Founding Partner of Portuguese telehealth company Hope Care, explains how technology he has been developing for more than six years—HCAlert—is now helping hospitals remotely monitor and care for vulnerable patients with chronic heart conditions.

title: Instead of building infrastructure, focus engineering effort on delighting customers
executive_summary: With 130 years of specialist commodity expertise, Fastmarkets serves up market pricing, data and insights to customers in Metals & Mining, Agriculture and Forest Products. To enhance its customers’ experience, this global data provider built a new integrated data platform. Fastmarkets has gained greater agility, scalability and visibility over customer behaviour. Customers now enjoy a new, seamless experience across multiple digital delivery channels.

title: Cdiscount : quand Azure OpenAI Service et GitHub Copilot se mettent au service du e-commerce
executive_summary: Household appliances, cell phones, second-hand goods, ticketing services... With no less than 70 million products, 9 million customers, and some 14,000 sellers, the Cdiscount marketplace has been a key player in French e-commerce for over 20 years.

title: Q&A: NTT DATA trusts Microsoft AI to enhance automation and transform operations
executive_summary: NTT DATA needed an agentic AI solution that is rapidly deployable, integrates with enterprise systems, and ensures enterprise-grade security. This allows the company to deliver high-performance AI use cases, enhancing efficiency and scalability for clients.

title: Centrica leverages Power Apps to ensure its solutions are futureproof
executive_summary: The international energy  services and solutions company serves millions of UK consumers and businesses with the supply of electricity and gas, services and solutions through leading energy brands, including British Gas and Bord Gáis. Headquartered in Windsor, Berkshire, Centrica has pledged to support the transition to a net zero economy and has ambitions to become a truly digital business. As part of this, it implemented the Microsoft Power Platform to give staff the digital tools they need to drive transformation and value for customers. Following early success, Centrica invested further in Microsoft Dataverse to accelerate its ambitions using Microsoft Power Platform tools.

title: Calgary Counselling Centre’s rapid Microsoft Teams deployment delivers highly effective mental health care
executive_summary: Calgary Counselling Centre (CCC) serves some 12,000 clients per year, averaging 35,600 hours of counselling sessions as it helps individuals, families, and groups develop the skills they need to thrive. In business for about 60 years, CCC also provides 80 students each year with the leading-edge research, education, and training opportunities they need to become the next generation of counsellors.

title: Smart Qatar meets the needs of citizens, businesses, and visitors with digital services built on Azure
executive_summary: The State of Qatar has a thriving economy based primarily on oil and natural gas, but the country is increasingly diversifying into information and communication technologies and building a knowledge-based society. Qatar has developed an open, integrated, and extendable platform of national services built on Microsoft Azure to support citizens, residents, businesses, and visitors. The TASMU Platform is helping make the country a better place to live, from health management to national food security, while also boosting its non-oil gross domestic product by 2 percent.

title: Aramex makes effective global communication real with Microsoft Teams Phone System
executive_summary: Founded in 1982, Aramex is a leading global provider of comprehensive logistics and transportation solutions. Operating in over 65 countries worldwide, the company’s vision is delivering flexible, innovative, reliable transport and logistics solutions that connect the globe. Over the years, a key to Aramex’s success has been its ability to swiftly adapt to challenging market conditions. With its transition to Microsoft Teams Phone System in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, the company is continuing to deliver standout service to millions of customers around the world.

title: Andreas Messerli unites staff and customers like never before with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Pulling an event together that everyone will talk about for years takes a lot of diverse talent and exquisite coordination. Swiss brand experience company Andreas Messerli has organized its wide-ranging teams into 10 separate companies under one umbrella, creating an organization that flexes perfectly to the vision of every customer. That structure served the company well, but Messerli Group aspired to a better collaboration model that would make it easier to coordinate with different teams, often in far-flung locations. What better way to bring together everyone involved, from carpenters building a pavilion to project managers analyzing schedules, than with the flexibility of a voice-enabled collaboration app? Since Messerli Group deployed Microsoft 365, making use of the Teams Phone capability in Microsoft Teams, its staff and customers can easily make plans that unfold into magical branding moments.

title: University of Miami gains flexibility, disaster recovery resiliency with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Founded in 1925 in South Florida, the University of Miami is a private research university with more than 17,000 students. To fortify its disaster recovery strategies, the university’s IT team turned to Microsoft Azure for a cloud-based approach for its key systems. Also faced with a looming hardware renewal for its remaining colocation centers, the school decided to deploy Microsoft Azure VMware Solution. As a result, the university realized six-figure cost savings, averted months of purchase order processing and supply chain delays, and it gained agility during the COVID-19 crisis.

title: Cambia Health Solutions enhances calling performance and security with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: In the midst of COVID-19, Nationwide experienced a radical shift in how and where associates got work done. Today, the company continues to embrace change by finding new ways to bring their people-focused mission to a hybrid work scenario. It’s a big change, and Microsoft 365 tools are at the heart of how Nationwide delivers the future of work. A hybrid strategyCambia Health Solutions, Inc. is a total health solutions company based in the United States with more than 4,500 employees. To provide its employees with a more unified communications experience, Cambia moved to Microsoft Teams, including Teams Phone, and completed the migration three months ahead of schedule. continues the organization’s culture of care in a digital world for the 25,000 Nationwide associates experiencing the future of work firsthand.

title: Barracuda scales in-text search with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Offering a leading range of enterprise-grade cybersecurity solutions, Barracuda is dedicated to simplifying digital defense for its global customer base. Needing a way to enable seamless in-text search across its Cloud-to-Cloud Backup service, it chose Azure Data Explorer. Today, Barracuda is benefitting from its investment, onboarding thousands of customers in the first few months of its new platform deployment. It’s also tapping into a cost-efficient way to run text search on its protected data and is positioned to scale and support continued growth.

title: One-person clinic digitally transforms to not just survive but thrive with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: ADH Clinic is a solo-venture massage, physical, and remedial therapy business based in Taunton in the United Kingdom (UK). Founded in 2000 by accomplished practitioner Andrea Douthwaite-Hodges, the clinic had successfully been supporting patients in the Somerset area until March 2020. That’s when COVID-19 lockdown restrictions prevented Douthwaite-Hodges from seeing her patients.

title: Dynatrace uses Microsoft Azure to build a world-class observability platform for its customers
executive_summary: Dynatrace is a worldwide leader in observability, AIOps, automation, and application security. With its core business focused on monitoring application performance, development, and security, the company wanted to create a modern software as a service (SaaS) application that would expand their product offerings on Azure and scale in line with their growth. In partnership with Microsoft, the company is building a modern, multicloud architecture on Azure to support this initiative, and creating new avenues for business growth through deeper integration with Azure.
products: Azure, Azure Application Insights, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Monitor, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID

title: LVMH accelerates the modernization of its digital workplace with Microsoft Office 365, Teams, and telephony
executive_summary: LVMH is an international corporation that specializes in luxury goods. The group is headquartered in Paris, France and has 75 companies known as houses, with 150,000 employees. As a result of its diverse business activities in a hundred countries, the LVMH Group has been accelerating the modernization of its workspaces and collaboration tools for the past two years, thanks, in particular, to Microsoft Teams and cloud telephony.

title: Air Astana slashes reporting time and increases productivity with Microsoft Teams and Power Apps
executive_summary: Air Astana is the flag carrier of Kazakhstan and operates both domestic and international services across 64 routes in Eurasia. The company strives for the highest safety and customer service standards for both external and internal processes. To obtain timely financial reports, the company leveraged the power of Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics together with Microsoft Power BI. Now, reports are generated within seconds instead of hours, boosting the team’s productivity and efficiency.

title: How Microsoft developed Microsoft Viva to transform its employee experience
executive_summary: This article is the first in a series that describes how Microsoft Viva was developed and deployed at Microsoft. In this first installment, we look at how Microsoft approached employee experience in the past, how the pandemic influenced that approach, and how Microsoft HR and the Digital Employee Experience team worked together with the Viva product team to help Viva become a reality.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Viva Connections, Microsoft Viva Insights, Microsoft Viva Learning, Microsoft Viva Topics

title: City of Frisco modernizes its technology landscape to drive collaboration with Microsoft cloud solutions
executive_summary: It’s not easy managing the evolving technology needs of one of the fastest growing cities in the United States. But over the past decade, the City of Frisco, Texas, has transformed its digital approach from a disjointed set of products to a flexible, standardized infrastructure built around Azure, Microsoft 365, and Windows 10 that streamlines communication, encourages collaboration, and simplifies training and maintenance. Today, the city relies on an integrated suite of solutions like SharePoint, OneDrive, Surface, Windows Defender, and more to help different departments — from police to public works — deliver vital community services to residents.

title: SAP IT lifts its business-critical landscapes to the Azure cloud platform for scalable flexibility
executive_summary: Trusted by other Fortune 500 companies around the world, leading enterprise resource planning software provider SAP offers its software for on-premises or cloud environments, including its own converged cloud using a hyperscaler infrastructure. When the company’s IT department wanted to move its critical internal business systems to the cloud, it assessed the major hyperscalers. Microsoft Azure offered the level of security, flexibility, and scalability that SAP needed to optimize its global business. Since beginning its migration, SAP IT is realizing the agility and security boosts that it sought, in addition to saving about 10 percent of its former on-premises operating costs.
products: Azure, Microsoft Entra ID

title: BNY Mellon transforms with Dynamics 365 and innovates data solutions on Azure
executive_summary: Asset managers and asset owners are no strangers to using data to drive business and reach the best decisions. But in a new world of cloud technology, transparent data, and integrated platforms—where the sheer volume and scope of data continues to swell—these professionals must have the best and most agile tools and intelligence at hand to guide their decision making.

title: iMocha uses Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service to auto-scale its skills assessments platform
executive_summary: iMocha is a software company based in Pune, Maharashtra, with customers worldwide. Founded in 2015, iMocha’s Skills Assessment Platform became a go-to service for many IT companies to conduct virtual assessments and interviews. With customers in the US, Europe, and India, the business continues to grow at a steady pace and experienced increased demand for its flagship offering during COVID-19, when the recruitment processes migrated to the digital medium.

title: Azure helps Munich Re deploy climate change risk assessments that predict the future
executive_summary: As devastating and extreme weather events continue to increase globally, financial institutions, insurance companies and real estate investment organizations are on the front lines of climate-related risks. Thanks to Munich Re’s Location Risk Intelligence Platform based on Microsoft Azure, organizations can now predict how single locations from real estate to the supply chain will fare in coming years if nothing is done to mitigate those risks.
products: Azure

title: DEHN: Lightning strikes the cloud in Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Ever since company founder Hans Dehn received his first patent for a lightning protection system in 1918, DEHN has been an innovation leader in lightning and surge protection. The company safeguards buildings, public institutions, and critical infrastructure against damage caused by electricity. To develop innovative, ultrasafe products, DEHN now even simulates lightning strikes. By using supercomputers on Azure, DEHN has never had to build its own simulation center. The cloud accelerates the calculations, can be scaled flexibly, and is cheaper than a locally run solution.

title: Prosegur integrates and connects the systems of the 26 countries in which it operates in the cloud
executive_summary: The global benchmark in the private security sector has adopted Dynamics 365 for Sales, achieving greater commercial standardization and identifying successful practices that can be replicated in other territories.

title: Mahindra Lifespaces embraces cloud backup with Parablu and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Mahindra Lifespace Developers Limited—the real estate and infrastructure development business of the Mahindra Group—needed to digitally transform from a legacy tape backup system to a cloud-first approach. The company selected Microsoft Azure as the underlying cloud technology for its cloud-based data backups. The combination of the mammoth infrastructure that Microsoft provides, along with its acclaimed R&D, global presence, and industry-leading security and privacy standards, made Azure the cloud of choice for Mahindra, and the company turned to Parablu to deploy BluVault, its Azure-powered data backup and recovery solution.

title: The Red Sea Development Company boosts performance reporting utilizing Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The Red Sea Development Company (TRSDC) is developing the 28,000 km2 Red Sea Project as a key part of Saudi Arabia’s transformation into a global tourism hub. TRSDC has planned and is building every aspect of the destination to ensure it fulfills its ambitions to be the world’s most ambitious regenerative tourism project. To manage hundreds of key performance indicators (KPIs) across multiple departments, the company deployed Microsoft SharePoint and Power Platform. With it, TRSDC accelerated KPI reporting and team collaboration, keeping the company firmly on track towards achieving its ambitious goals.

title: PayPal unlocks workplace data, improves employee wellbeing with Microsoft Viva Insights
executive_summary: The welfare of its worldwide workforce is top of mind for PayPal executive leaders, and they are turning that deep concern for employee wellbeing into action with the help of Microsoft Viva Insights. As the company has continued to innovate its services and expand its business, it has modernized and consolidated its IT environments with advanced technologies such as Microsoft 365 to make it easier for all employees to get work done. It also reduced after-hours meetings and adopted focus days without meetings to help employees safeguard their productive hours, preserve their free time, and strike a rewarding work-life balance. With Viva Insights, PayPal has the capacity to identify urgent workplace problems, quickly generate business insights, and determine when, where, and how to take effective action to protect the welfare of its most important asset—its employees.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva Insights, Power BI

title: Technical support anytime, anywhere: Marabu relies on remote maintenance with HoloLens 2 and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Whether for motifs on bottles and glasses, automotive interiors, or wash cycle symbols on washing machines—Marabu has the perfect ink for all kinds of materials. The company offers its customers the full works: from advice on the right inks to on-site assistance should an industrial printing machine malfunction. In order to ensure these services remain as resource-efficient as possible in the future, Marabu harnesses mixed reality technology. Combining HoloLens 2 with Dynamics 365 allows the company to cut CO2 as well as travel time and expenses.

title: CAE, Staffordshire University extend virtual patient simulations, drive better healthcare education with Azure
executive_summary: Simulation technology manufacturer CAE Healthcare is well known for its intelligent patient manikins, which mimic a real-life medical patient’s conditions, ailments, and responses to procedures. Despite the benefits of physical manikins, a new era of remote learning calls for an updated approach to healthcare education where groups can gather around a manikin without being in the same room. To meet this challenge and evolve its manikins and training services for a world after COVID-19, CAE Healthcare now offers virtual patient simulation with CAE Maestro Evolve. Through Microsoft Azure IoT Hub and Azure Functions, the new platform offers rich data insights and feedback on users’ performance to help identify priority growth areas and promote self-learning. Using CAE Maestro Evolve has helped CAE Healthcare customers like Staffordshire University push healthcare curriculum forward, allowing students, aspiring healthcare professionals, and instructors to learn and teach from anywhere, driving better patient outcomes.

title: Digitally connecting children with special needs to healthcare
executive_summary: During the COVID-19 lockdown in Sri Lanka, the MJF Charitable Foundation (MJFCF) needed an innovative solution to digitally connect their Multidisciplinary Team with children with special needs. MillenniumIT ESP's Microsoft Azure-based remote patient-management platform HealthVision powers the disABILITY app, designed in collaboration with MJFCF. The app enables the foundation to provide expert teletherapy and educational services to differently abled children and their caretakers. The app has the potential to reach the 17 million people worldwide with cerebral palsy (CP), as well as others with Down syndrome and other developmental disorders.

title: RJRGLEANER upgrades its operations with the adoption of Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Jamaican company implemented Microsoft 365 modern workspace solutions and reduced the time spent on operational tasks, resulting in a more efficient and enthusiastic workforce.

title: How Field & Concept switched to Azure Cloud with About IT’s expertise
executive_summary: The Field & Concept agency has offered its clients innovative marketing solutions since 1989. The company needed to adapt its IT system to the current era. To meet data protection and remote working requirements, it needed a system that was simple, flexible and ultra-secure. To implement this transition, Field & Concept was able to call on its longstanding partner, About IT, to propose a suitable solution. The IT company opted for an Azure cloud system, implemented gradually to avoid disrupting the agency’s business operations.

title: Green Wallet makes it easier to shop more sustainably
executive_summary: “Trying to shop ethically is really much more difficult than it needs to be,” Bashir Khairy, Founder & Chief Executive Officer at Green Wallet. “I realised this when I was trying to make my own life more sustainable – and that’s how Green Wallet was born. Green Wallet knows that by choosing to build its platform on Microsoft Azure, it will easily support the scaling up of the online marketplace across different geographies without the need for unnecessarily large maintenance or skills overheads. This is vital for an ambitious start-up like Green Wallet, that wants to change the way the world shops.

title: Munich Re uses Microsoft Teams to transform worldwide offices for a new era of hybrid work
executive_summary: Based in Germany, Munich Re is one of the top providers of reinsurance, primary insurance, and insurance-related risk solutions in the world. With a vast client base and global operations, it needs modern conference rooms that could support true hybrid meetings. By creating highly-standardized blueprints for meeting spaces featuring Microsoft Teams Rooms—and supported by Microsoft Teams Rooms Managed Services—the company rolled out more than 400 brand new conference rooms around the world in less than a year.

title: EY teams turn to Microsoft for automation solution that speeds up processes, saves money
executive_summary: EY teams sought to transition their legacy Excel and SQL-based VAT tax application to a web-based big data solution to add more automation to their standardized process. Provisioning involved time and effort, knowledge, and development. EY teams found the right solution with a Cloud Native Application Bundle (CNAB) solution, combining their tax knowledge with that of Microsoft’s low-code products to decrease turnaround time from days to hours for thousands of deployments with the click of a button—resulting in significant cost savings.

title: EY automates VAT process with Power Platform, reduces tax errors and increases value to customers
executive_summary: EY teams’ purpose of “building a better working world” underscores their foundational way of operating. When the organization observed a trend in which the market sought deeper insights from its tax data, EY teams responded. They transitioned a legacy tool into their value-added tax web application, putting the power of big data and business analytics in the hands of clients. With reusability at the forefront, they also streamlined their own VAT environments to work smarter. The solution combines the strengths of EY tax experience with Microsoft Power Platform, Azure Databricks, and Azure DevOps automation to save EY time and is trending toward significant cost savings while allowing the company more time for direct client interaction.

title: Aurukun Shire Council realizes return on investment in under three months with SurePact project and portfolio risk management and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: A small council in Far North Queensland, Australia, Aurukun Shire Council manually tracked millions of dollars in grants, projects, and contracts for the construction and maintenance of community infrastructure and the AUD$2.9 million Aurukun Airport Upgrade. The Council turned to SurePact, a Microsoft partner providing a comprehensive, cloud-based solution for government and corporate management of projects, portfolios, and risk. SurePact moved the Council from an unwieldy set of spreadsheets, emails, physical documents, and shared files to a Microsoft Azure-based solution that streamlined document management, secured access, increased transparency for audits, and mitigated risks while also reducing bottom-line project cost blowouts. Aurukun Shire Council uses SurePact to deliver infrastructure projects more efficiently and realized a return on its investment in under three months.

title: Jardine Engineering Corporation replaces legacy phone system with Teams Phone, reduces implementation cost by 60 percent
executive_summary: Yiu and her colleagues identified Microsoft Teams Phone as the ideal solution for a highly dispersed organization with an outdated legacy phone system. Today, JEC employees make and receive calls right from Teams, bringing many of their most-used collaboration tools together in one place. Eliminating a standalone phone system helped JEC achieve significant cost savings.

title: Università degli Studi dell’Insubria: pioneering a new frontier of learning with Surface Hub 2S
executive_summary: Italy’s Università degli Studi dell’Insubria believes in using technology to deliver qualitative, engaging classes both on-site and remotely. To this end, the organization recently installed a suite of Microsoft Surface Hub 2S devices across its campuses. The solution champions the use of digital whiteboards in a new, highly interactive way that allows both in-person and online students to get more involved and bring active contribution to classes. All while helping lecturers to elevate their teaching.

title: Ashok Leyland leverages Microsoft Teams for remote collaboration and business continuity
executive_summary: Founded in 1948, Ashok Leyland is an Indian multinational automotive manufacturer. The organization was looking for an effective remote collaboration platform and leveraged Microsoft Teams to ensure business continuity amid the pandemic.

title: Ageas Group: Creating a centralized security solution for a decentralized IT landscape
executive_summary: Headquartered in Belgium, the multinational insurance group Ageas has always promoted autonomy; empowering each entity within the company to shape and operate its business and IT landscapes to best suit a local market. But with the financial services industry facing a growing number of cybersecurity threats, and no unified Security Information Event Management (SIEM) platform in place, Ageas needed to make a decision to best protect the group’s collective assets. Working with Microsoft, Ageas implemented a bespoke security solution to serve all of the organization’s entities across the world. A centralized security monitoring approach that is providing everyone with world-class detection and prevention – without any individual entity giving up their own operating model.

title: Centro Hospitalar Universitário Lisboa Central: Delivering virtual care with Microsoft collaboration tools
executive_summary: Portugal’s oldest hospital, Centro Hospitalar Universitário Lisboa Central (CHULC), has a history of embracing both traditional medical practices and innovative healthcare solutions. This culture is shared by its board of directors who, in 2019, decided on a digital-first strategy to help the hospital develop an omnichannel approach to patient care. By partnering with Microsoft, the organization has since implemented a number of telehealth tools to deliver virtual care to both clinical and non-clinical specialties. A transformation that helped the hospital provide remote care during COVID-19 restrictions and has now become an integral part of daily hospital life.

title: Cooperative Bank of Epirus transforms the user experience with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Cooperative Bank of Epirus is leading the social and economic development of the Epirus region, thanks to the greater efficiency and increased security of its financial services. With the help of Microsoft 365 solutions, it empowers its employees to commit to the development of local businesses and the prosperity of financial services customers.

title: Lenovo reinforces customer trust with ledger in Azure SQL Database
executive_summary: Lenovo builds millions of computers every year, and the company wants its customers to trust that each one arrives configured to the customer’s request. To provide this attestation, the company now tracks each new device with its Trusted Supply Chain solution built with ledger in Microsoft Azure SQL Database. Lenovo chose ledger in Azure SQL Database because of the performance, scalability, and security of the Azure platform. The company has been so pleased with the results that it is planning to use ledger in Azure SQL Database for additional high-security applications.

title: No kilometer too far: Digital transport management at Raiffeisen Waren GmbH with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With 210 locations across Germany, Raiffeisen Waren GmbH is never far away from the action. Whether roof tiles, wall paint, or floor screed, the commercial enterprise delivers building materials directly to construction sites. And quindata GmbH—a subsidiary of Raiffeisen Waren GmbH—performs state-of-the-art transport management based on SAP S/4HANA to guarantee efficiency when planning the necessary delivery routes and logistics. The company uses a slightly adapted version of the standard SAP S/4 HANA transport management solution to link the transport data for all the various locations, simplifying the delivery process and preventing any disruption to construction projects. That way, no unnecessary kilometers are traveled and no time goes to waste.

title: The Global Fund guides nations to get more out of medical aid with Visio
executive_summary: It could take weeks to produce a representation of the national health system and associated organizations that receive grant funds, but the image would be either too messy or incomplete, so no one would use it—time-pressed grant managers and other users found it difficult to grasp the non-standardized, complex diagrams. For Global Fund managers, the Visio-based tool took grant management to a more strategic level. Like the organization itself, the tool is flexible, agile, and invaluable to all constituencies, not just Global Fund grant managers.

title: Wigo4it: how a public-sector organization is modernizing critical services with cloud technology
executive_summary: As the organization responsible for providing IT services to the four largest municipalities in the Netherlands, Wigo4it is committed to putting citizens’ needs at the heart of all it does. As part of this mission, the organization is currently undergoing a digital transformation journey aimed at adding more value for money, optimizing operations and helping its civil servants to support vulnerable citizens. Powered by the Microsoft Azure cloud, the initiative has triggered a shift in Wigo4it’s working culture, empowering its employees to achieve more.

title: One system for everyone: Biologische Heilmittel Heel uses Dynamics 365 for customer management
executive_summary: Biologische Heilmittel Heel, a medium-sized enterprise based in the German state of Baden‑Württemberg, produces medications for a wide range of symptoms. Its product portfolio is diverse, as are its customers. From doctors’ offices to pharmacies to wholesalers—every customer has a different perspective on the products and wants the messaging to reflect this. Omnichannel marketing is gaining in importance, and the old IT landscape was no longer up to this task. Today, Dynamics 365 consolidates all data at Heel, enabling the company to provide its customers with more individualized support.

title: Terragon Group, thanks to Azure cloud, unleashed its full potential and scalability, helping its clients to increase their ROI by 900%.
executive_summary: Terragon Group is an African data and marketing technology firm focused on driving intelligent connections to consumers in Africa. Terragon uses its on-demand marketing cloud platform, attribution software, and deep analytics capability to enable intelligent, targeted omni-channel (SMS, USSD, email, WhatsApp, email, social) engagement between Brands (SMBs and Enterprises) to 350m+ “mobile-first” African consumers. In an on-premises environment, Terragon’s solution could only reach 10-20% of its potential. Using their platform on the Azure cloud unleashed its full potential and scalability, helping their clients to increase their ROI by 900%.

title: bp bolsters its threat resilience with Microsoft Defender for Office 365
executive_summary: bp’s ethical phishing program required manual effort. Its third-party solutions were not fully integrated with the company’s security and operations systems, making it challenging to manage attack simulation data efficiently. The energy company partnered with Microsoft to implement attack simulation training in Microsoft Defender for Office 365, using the solution to streamline bp’s ethical phishing capabilities and reduce its testing and reporting. Now, bp can send two automated attack simulations per month to around 75,000 employees, with most of the effort managed by one security engineering specialist.

title: Bain & Company builds new intellectual property management platform using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Bain & Company (Bain) built an intellectual property management platform on Microsoft, streamlining information access and increasing employee satisfaction. The global consulting company’s legacy knowledge system could not keep up with modern demands, so Bain decided to migrate to the cloud. The Bain team also wanted to build a modular, API-based platform that could grow at business speed. Using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365, Bain developed Iris, a custom web user interface that combines search functions and content management and provides security controls that facilitate wider employee access. Now the company’s knowledge specialists and consultants can find information quickly and with high accuracy.

title: Michigan Office of Children’s Ombudsman streamlines case management and improves compliance using i-Sight on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The State of Michigan Office of Children’s Ombudsman helps protect and improve the lives of children by investigating complaints regarding Michigan’s child welfare system and by recommending changes to law, policy, and practice. It needed a better case management system to fulfil its mission to bring greater accountability to Michigan’s child welfare system. Adopting i-Sight case management on Microsoft Azure for US Government has improved efficiency, productivity, and security, empowering the agency to better manage cases from beginning to end.

title: Rabobank balances the books: Optimal privacy and safety with Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention
executive_summary: Agility and dedication to its customers have served Rabobank well throughout its more than 125-year history. The bank’s global workforce supports food and agricultural producers around the world. Its small but successful security team relies on the most effective tooling available to help secure the bank’s assets across 42,000 endpoints. Rabobank turned to Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention to curtail inappropriate data sharing, regardless of the location of its employees or data. Best of all, Rabobank curbs data loss without deploying agents, providing a better experience for employees and more time for IT teams to focus on high-value activities.

title: Atea drives B2B innovation with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Atea wanted to provide a level of innovation rarely seen in B2B ecommerce. The top priority has been to transform the digital buying experience from broad-based engagement to fine-tuned communications with the right message and with the right cadence, in order to build loyalty and maximize retention. Atea is now able to bring together data from multiple sources like contacts, accounts, account registration, and orders to create a unified profile of each business user.

title: ABN AMRO: leaping into the future of the FSI sector with the Azure cloud
executive_summary: Dutch bank ABN AMRO is determined to embrace digitalization to improve its operations and provide better services for its customers. To do this, it has embarked on a digital transformation program – called Apollo – which includes adopting new technologies, moving applications to the cloud and embracing a new DevOps working culture. Crucial to achieving this has also been migrating its trading and treasury front-to-back-to-risk platform Murex MX.3 from on-premises to Microsoft Azure. All while shifting from Oracle Exadata to Oracle database on Azure NetApp Files. This is part of a key initiative that’s giving ABN AMRO greater flexibility, scalability and an improved time to market. The migration is helping ABN AMRO provide more stable, securer services – all while driving efficiencies and improving its working culture.

title: With a “360-degree view of the customer” Lufthansa Cargo seamlessly manages record-breaking growth
executive_summary: As one of the world’s leading companies in airfreight transportation, Lufthansa Cargo transports shipments to nearly 300 destinations in more than 100 countries. Experiencing record-breaking growth and with ambitious innovation goals on the horizon, the organization needed a more advanced and centralized way to manage its customer service and sales information. oneCRM, the new tailored Customer Relation Management (CRM) platform for Lufthansa Cargo, is powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, and Dynamics Customer Voice. The system pulls information and communication channels into a single location, creating a centralized touchpoint for all customer information and their related shipments. This integrated, end-to-end approach helps the organization respond to customers faster and with greater accuracy—delivering on the Lufthansa Cargo mission to provide exceptional personalized service experiences.

title: From tools supplier to digital service provider with Microsoft Azure: The Hoffmann Group is fine-tuning the future of the machining industry
executive_summary: Whenever anyone in the metalworking industry is drilling, milling, or cutting, they’re sure to be using a Hoffmann tool. Europe’s leading provider of machining, clamping, grinding, cutting, and measurement technology as well as hand tools has set its sights on one more goal for the future: becoming a partner for the digital transformation of small and medium-sized manufacturing companies. With this in mind, the Hoffmann Group has created a digital business model that relies on the infrastructure provided by Microsoft Azure. At the front end is the company’s Go Digital Store, where customers can access the digital solutions.

title: Combining advanced technology and high-quality foods to address food deserts in underserved communities
executive_summary: In the planned community of Trilith, Georgia, Microsoft is providing foundational technology that’s helping Nourish + Bloom Market expand the availability of high-quality foods in a previously underserved community. Through a unique combination of advanced technology and a focus on human connections, the company is creating a seamless shopping experience customers love.

title: Wortell helps Rogiers build a future-proof, modern, and hybrid workplace
executive_summary: The Rogiers family business, which was founded in 1956, supplies machines from top brands and focuses on quality and durability. Despite the fact that the employees at the company have a digital mindset, Rogiers was still using an old-fashioned Citrix solution. Even before the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, the team had a strong desire to have flexible and hybrid work options. Wortell has provided a standardized, secure and compliant work environment within the Microsoft cloud. Wortell also provides full and comprehensive management of the environment. The team ensures that everything is always up-to-date and complies with the most recent laws and regulations. Because of standardization and nearly fully automated management, Rogiers employees can rely on their work environment. This allows the team to offer customers an enhanced professional experience.

title: Grupo Fleury implements Microsoft Teams and standardizes its corporate communications
executive_summary: With more than 90 years of history, Grupo Fleury is one of the most respected medical organizations in Brazil. Its operation consists of approximately 10,000 employees and 3,000 physicians in more than 216 medical units throughout the states of São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Rio Grande do Sul, Paraná, Bahia, Pernambuco, Rio Grande do Norte, Distrito Federal, and Maranhão.

title: Bashundhara Group automates and secures its business through Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: A leading business engaged in diverse areas, Bashundhara Group sees serving its country and people as central to its mission. Given the complexity of its operations, the group needed to move from on-premise IT infrastructure to SAP on Azure for security, unified data, automation, and a modernized workplace. Since rolling out Azure and Microsoft 365, the conglomerate has not only saved time and money but has also strengthened accountability, collaboration, and mobility. Time saved means renewed focus on new business.

title: Creating a better digital experience for members: Nationwide Building Society chooses Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As the world’s largest building society, Nationwide Building Society often leans on technology to help support and deliver financial services to its more than 16 million members across the United Kingdom. Twenty-five years ago, it established one of the first internet banks in the United Kingdom, mailing out compact discs to members and delivering services on dial-up connections. Today, Nationwide Building Society offers mortgages, loans, personal and business accounts, investments, home insurance and protection, credit cards, and other banking services through a variety of branch, digital, and multichannel mediums, including the web and mobile apps, for the benefit of its members and their communities.

title: LBC increases near-miss reporting by 370 percent with Pro-Sapien
executive_summary: LBC Tank Terminals (LBC) is a global independent operator of bulk liquid storage facilities for petrochemicals, serving more than 100 customers across Europe and the United States. To complement a new, holistic approach to corporate social responsibility (CSR), LBC implemented Pro-Sapien's Health, Safety, Environment and Quality (HSEQ) software on Microsoft 365—and employee engagement has increased ever since. In the first year of the new approach, LBC saw a 370-percent increase in near-miss reporting, thanks to easier access and increased awareness of HSEQ risks enabled by integration with Microsoft 365.

title: Co-op cuts 2 years off its modernization plan with Datometry Hyper-Q and Microsoft Azure Synapse
executive_summary: United Kingdom-based food retailer Co-op, a large consumer co-operative, transitioned in 2020 from its longtime on-premises datacenter to a virtualized data warehouse using Datometry Hyper-Q and Microsoft Azure Synapse. Datometry Hyper-Q emulated Co-op's legacy data warehouse processes in the cloud, enabling Co-op's applications to interoperate with Azure Synapse. Co-op's modernization plan was expected to take more than three years, but Datometry and Azure Synapse shaved two years off the timeline. Co-op has already seen impressive benefits in processing speed and multimillion-pound cost savings.

title: DavidShield kept teams conected and productive throughout the pandemic thanks to Office 365
executive_summary: DavidShield Group is a leader in the Travel Insurance industry and was able to keep teams connected and productive throughout the pandemic, securing information thanks to Office 365, including Teams and OneDrive, for better collaboration and cost control.

title: Keeping an eye on global production processes: Accuride unites on-premises and cloud services with Power Platform
executive_summary: Wherever wheels are turning, Accuride isn’t far away. From loaders to trucks, buses to sedans—the company supplies wheels and brake components to manufacturers of commercial and passenger vehicles all over the world. Accuride operates a global production network that has grown considerably over the years. After a series of mergers and acquisitions, Accuride standardized its approach to international teamwork by implementing the Microsoft Teams collaboration platform. And the company’s complex production processes are now coordinated using Microsoft Power Platform.

title: Wortell helps Rogiers build a future-proof, modern, and hybrid workplace
executive_summary: The Rogiers family business, which was founded in 1956, supplies machines from top brands and focuses on quality and durability. Despite the fact that the employees at the company have a digital mindset, Rogiers was still using an old-fashioned Citrix solution. Even before the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, the team had a strong desire to have flexible and hybrid work options. Wortell has provided a standardized, secure and compliant work environment within the Microsoft cloud. Wortell also provides full and comprehensive management of the environment. The team ensures that everything is always up-to-date and complies with the most recent laws and regulations. Because of standardization and nearly fully automated management, Rogiers employees can rely on their work environment. This allows the team to offer customers an enhanced professional experience.

title: Grupo Fleury implements Microsoft Teams and standardizes its corporate communications
executive_summary: With more than 90 years of history, Grupo Fleury is one of the most respected medical organizations in Brazil. Its operation consists of approximately 10,000 employees and 3,000 physicians in more than 216 medical units throughout the states of São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Rio Grande do Sul, Paraná, Bahia, Pernambuco, Rio Grande do Norte, Distrito Federal, and Maranhão.

title: Bashundhara Group automates and secures its business through Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: A leading business engaged in diverse areas, Bashundhara Group sees serving its country and people as central to its mission. Given the complexity of its operations, the group needed to move from on-premise IT infrastructure to SAP on Azure for security, unified data, automation, and a modernized workplace. Since rolling out Azure and Microsoft 365, the conglomerate has not only saved time and money but has also strengthened accountability, collaboration, and mobility. Time saved means renewed focus on new business.

title: Creating a better digital experience for members: Nationwide Building Society chooses Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As the world’s largest building society, Nationwide Building Society often leans on technology to help support and deliver financial services to its more than 16 million members across the United Kingdom. Twenty-five years ago, it established one of the first internet banks in the United Kingdom, mailing out compact discs to members and delivering services on dial-up connections. Today, Nationwide Building Society offers mortgages, loans, personal and business accounts, investments, home insurance and protection, credit cards, and other banking services through a variety of branch, digital, and multichannel mediums, including the web and mobile apps, for the benefit of its members and their communities.

title: LBC increases near-miss reporting by 370 percent with Pro-Sapien
executive_summary: LBC Tank Terminals (LBC) is a global independent operator of bulk liquid storage facilities for petrochemicals, serving more than 100 customers across Europe and the United States. To complement a new, holistic approach to corporate social responsibility (CSR), LBC implemented Pro-Sapien's Health, Safety, Environment and Quality (HSEQ) software on Microsoft 365—and employee engagement has increased ever since. In the first year of the new approach, LBC saw a 370-percent increase in near-miss reporting, thanks to easier access and increased awareness of HSEQ risks enabled by integration with Microsoft 365.

title: Co-op cuts 2 years off its modernization plan with Datometry Hyper-Q and Microsoft Azure Synapse
executive_summary: United Kingdom-based food retailer Co-op, a large consumer co-operative, transitioned in 2020 from its longtime on-premises datacenter to a virtualized data warehouse using Datometry Hyper-Q and Microsoft Azure Synapse. Datometry Hyper-Q emulated Co-op's legacy data warehouse processes in the cloud, enabling Co-op's applications to interoperate with Azure Synapse. Co-op's modernization plan was expected to take more than three years, but Datometry and Azure Synapse shaved two years off the timeline. Co-op has already seen impressive benefits in processing speed and multimillion-pound cost savings.

title: DavidShield kept teams conected and productive throughout the pandemic thanks to Office 365
executive_summary: DavidShield Group is a leader in the Travel Insurance industry and was able to keep teams connected and productive throughout the pandemic, securing information thanks to Office 365, including Teams and OneDrive, for better collaboration and cost control.

title: The Children’s Mercy Kansas City Research Institute enhances pediatric research collaboration and sample sharing using Microsoft technology
executive_summary: As a pediatric healthcare organization focused on a translational approach to research, the Children’s Mercy Kansas City Research Institute (CMRI) aimed to accelerate its research capabilities through cloud-based collaboration. Investigators studying high-risk pregnancies wanted to provide greater visibility to their perinatal sample collection. In response, CMRI developed the Perinatal Research Biorepository (PRB) Query Tool, offering researchers access to de-identified sample data. The PRB Query Tool uses Microsoft Power BI for data visualization and Microsoft Azure for cloud-based storage. The resulting solution improves research speed and accuracy by integrating data from more than 4,550 samples and more than 500 participants.

title: Hilti future-proofs its IT environment using RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: As a premier supplier for the construction industry, Hilti has dedicated itself to making construction better. As the construction industry increasingly moves towards digitalization, the company recognized a great benefit in transforming its IT environment and moving its on-premises SAP landscape to the cloud, including its business-critical enterprise resource planning application. In less than a year, Hilti accelerated its continuous innovation roadmap for the future by migrating to RISE with SAP on Azure, reinforcing its product quality, innovative spirit, and direct customer relationships. By moving its SAP landscape to Microsoft Azure, Hilti enabled its IT team to move any remaining server infrastructure, including Linux and Windows workloads, to the Microsoft cloud and close down its on-premises datacenter, increasing resilience, minimizing downtime, and preparing for more rapid growth.
products: Azure, Azure Firewall, Azure Storage, SAP on Azure

title: Dynamics 365 gives SanMar a modern design
executive_summary: SanMar is the nation’s premier supplier of wholesale imprintable apparel, bags, and caps. The Seattle stalwart sells a wide variety of branded and private label categories, as well as blank garments and accessories, through its distributor customers to large corporations like Starbucks and the Seattle Seahawks, small businesses, and community-based events.

title: GAC IT Team saves 1,000+ hours after global cloud migration
executive_summary: Shipping and logistics pioneer Gulf Agency Company (GAC) operates out of 300 offices around the globe. To keep up with the challenges of the 21st century it needed to build a more efficient work ecosystem. GAC’s Chief Information Officer Martin Wallgren and his team migrated the group’s on-premises data centers to the cloud and built an integrated data platform—Pegasus. By doing so, they created a platform that puts GAC in a position to offer better, quicker services to customers, which sets it apart from its competitors.

title: Nordic Pet Care Group takes care of pets while Microsoft Defender for Business handles security
executive_summary: Regardless of an organization’s size, cybersecurity should be a prerequisite for success in today’s connected world, and Nordic Pet Care Group is a perfect example. The company is big enough to enjoy a strong market share in Northern Europe and continuing expansion, but at 220 employees, it’s too small to sustain a large IT team. It solved this quandary by engaging with multitalented infrastructure solution provider Atea Danmark and implementing Microsoft Defender for Business. The result: a reimagined security posture that provides enterprise-level protection at a small or medium-sized business price tag. With its Microsoft 365 productivity solutions, Azure, and Power Apps, Nordic Pet Care Group is ready to keep flourishing.

title: DataPlatform with Microsoft Synapse and Databricks
executive_summary: Executive Summary

title: Santeon: Harmonizing healthcare data for better, more transparent patient outcomes with the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: Santeon is a learning system of seven hospitals with national coverage in The Netherlands and is the largest healthcare network in the country. The group’s ambitions to use data collectively to provide value-based healthcare (VBHC) was limited by different data governance systems in each hospital. The Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform was used to harmonize data and create the groundbreaking Health Intelligence Platform Santeon (HIPS). Data is now usable across the entire group, helping to empower patients and provide better health outcomes – providing a compelling example of how a large healthcare network can harmonize data on a national scale.

title: BÜCHI’s customer-centric vision accelerates innovation using Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: For the past 80 years, BÜCHI Labortechnik AG has put quality laboratory technology solutions into the hands of the world's top researchers, scientists, and manufacturers. Always innovating, BÜCHI is changing its business approach from the inside out in a digital transformation that connects customers in new ways, streamlines processes, and drives profits. A new strategy requires new tools, and the company is upgrading and replacing dozens of legacy business systems—a sweeping modernization effort that also means reevaluating hundreds of integration points across global information and communications technology (ICT) platforms.

title: Dentsu builds Azure-supported analytics platform to modernize data across the organization
executive_summary: Dentsu is a marketing and advertising network dedicated to brand partnership that delivers meaningful progress and growth through unique and innovative media campaigns and bespoke data-driven solutions. The global organization spans more than 145 markets with 65,000 employees, serving 11,000 clients.

title: Ridgelinez, internally practicing data-driven management, builds data utilization infrastructure by Azure and accelerates DX even further!
executive_summary: Established in 2020 as a comprehensive professional firm supporting corporate innovation, Ridgelinez built data utilization infrastructure and is accelerating internal DX practice. As the background for building the infrastructure, they have dealt with issues such as “generation of data silos” and “lack of interest accompanying obsolescence of data” when promoting an architecture fully implemented on cloud by utilizing SaaS and PaaS. How did Ridgelinez solve issues of data, which is essential for promoting DX? Here is the introduction of activities related to data-driven management at Ridgelinez and the role that Microsoft Azure has played there.
products: Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Vodafone Fiji gains scale, reliability, and ease of innovation by migrating its payment platform to Azure
executive_summary: Vodafone Fiji customers send and receive money and make purchases and payments through its M-PAiSA payment platform. Hoping to gain greater scale, resilience, innovation, and compliance, and to shed maintenance efforts and costs related to its aging hardware, the company migrated its on-premises platform to Microsoft Azure. With help from partner Onsys Technologies, Vodafone Fiji’s platform is now architected with a host of Azure infrastructure services. These have helped position the company to work more efficiently, easily scale for peak demand, and more easily develop and implement new features for continuous improvement.

title: Engineered Advisory deploys Springworks Trivia for Microsoft Teams to boost team building and employee engagement
executive_summary: Engineered Tax Services is a professional services organization dedicated to helping businesses succeed in the accounting space and supporting clients’ financial goals by offering tax mitigation and wealth-building strategies. The company needed a fun team engagement app that was integrated with Microsoft Teams and would engage its fully remote team. Enter Springworks: a human resources technology company whose Trivia app for Teams helped Engineered Tax Services’ Cost Segregation team achieve a community engagement rate of 57 percent.

title: Changing end-user behavior at scale: New BrainStorm platform relies on Azure Functions
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Telit protects IoT networks worldwide with unprecedented visibility by using Microsoft Defender for IoT
executive_summary: Now one of the top Internet of Things (IoT) vendors in the world, Telit pioneered the technology in the mid-80s, long before the proliferation of mobile phones and other tools we take for granted today. The company sought a security technology versatile enough to cover a plethora of corporate IoT devices—laptops, cell phones, and others—capable of delivering detailed insights about every device and its behavior. Its collaboration with Microsoft became even closer when Microsoft introduced Defender for IoT. Telit and other IoT providers can use this new solution to gain detailed information and safeguard IoT devices for themselves and their customers.

title: Nippon Express boosts security coverage, operational efficiency through Microsoft Entra Identity Governance
executive_summary: As part of its 2037 Vision plan for the 100th anniversary of its founding, the NX Group moved to a holding system in January 2022, aiming to be “a logistics company with a presence in the global market.” Nippon Express Co., Ltd. (Nippon Express) is its core company. The NX Group is now engaged in logistics-related businesses in land, sea, and air operations through its domestic network, with 196 group companies (as of January 4, 2021), and its overseas network, which covers 730 sites in 310 cities across 49 countries and regions (as of the end of December 2021). With its corporate message, “We Find the Way,” the NX Group engages with an ambitious “How can we make it happen?” attitude and actively promotes digital transformation (DX). The Group has also implemented numerous layers of cybersecurity measures to help ensure the safety of its DX journey. For example, it has taken advantage of Microsoft Entra Identity Governance for entitlement management and automated its IT access lifecycle management. With this thorough identity governance, the NX Group has streamlined the entire process, including requests, approvals, deployment, and use of systems and applications its employees need. And the Group is moving forward to optimize the relevant license costs.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 F3, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Entra ID Governance, Windows Autopilot

title: Nissin Foods Group building cutting-edge security with a small IT team, Zero Trust, and cybersecurity hygiene
executive_summary: Since launching the world’s first instant noodles, the Nissin Foods Group has been growing with a vision for the future of food. As part of its program to support sustainable growth, the Group is aggressively promoting digital transformation, aiming to improve labor productivity through efficiency. The Group has implemented various initiatives to improve in-office productivity by migrating to the cloud using Microsoft 365 as its communication infrastructure and early adoption of a remote work–enabled environment. With Microsoft 365 E5 Security, the Group also implemented a Zero Trust security framework and is now further advancing toward cybersecurity hygiene that continuously maintains the health of the IT environment.

title: Frasers Group fearlessly scales with a modernized Microsoft Security solution
executive_summary: Behind the celebrations of a company’s rapid growth, there are often scattered operational teams trying to bring new acquisitions into the fold as smoothly as possible. But the complexity of absorbing different IT environments creates inefficient decentralization. The lean IT team at Frasers Group simplified processes, making maximum use of the interoperability of Microsoft 365 Defender and Microsoft Defender for Endpoint coupled with Microsoft Sentinel. It also improved user identity with Azure AD Identity Protection and is adopting data governance capabilities in Microsoft Purview. Frasers prides itself on pushing boundaries, and it now has the IT infrastructure to accommodate its ambitions.

title: Australian Football League optimizes business operations with Dynamics 365 Finance
executive_summary: The Australian Football League (AFL) nationally employs about 700 regular full-time employees, with the industry engaging another 3,000 or more employees in various club, stadium, and community football related roles—who must all coordinate efforts to create each season of sport and spectacle for fans. The 18 clubs operating under its banner are each their own legal entity, some with additional business lines. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance, AFL moved its on-premises financial work to the cloud, and in the process, created a new industry platform to reinforce best practices, standardize operations, and take advantage of automation at scale.

title: Azure migration helps TomTom achieve high availability
executive_summary: Based in Amsterdam, TomTom boasts a global team of over 4,500 that make the location technologies relied upon by hundreds of millions of drivers, businesses, and governments. Their mission is to solve the world’s mobility challenges, with innovative solutions to help to address climate change, and reduce road-related accidents.

title: Husky Technologies’ remote-monitoring solution delivers real-time predictability and reduces operating costs
executive_summary: Since its start in Bolton, Ontario, Canada, in 1953, Husky Technologies™ has pioneered industry-leading injection molding technologies to meet the essential needs of the global consumer goods packaging and medical markets. The expertise and service commitment of Husky employees in more than 40 locations supports customers in more than 140 countries through a global network of manufacturing facilities and technical and monitoring centers. To provide a more proactive approach to customer service, Husky developed Advantage+Elite™, a proactive, predictive, transparent monitoring solution that comes standard on its beverage packaging and medical injection molding systems. Based on Azure IoT, this solution combines a deep historical database of service expertise with real-time data and advanced processing analytics to anticipate, recognize, and resolve potential production issues before they affect productivity or product quality. This approach reduces the need for emergency service calls and shortens their duration. Husky estimates that the solution saves customers an average of USD 4,000 to 6,000 per intervention.

title: Coca-Cola Hellenic quenches its thirst for cloud transformation with Microsoft Azure and Intel
executive_summary: Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company (HBC) strives to give customers across 29 exclusive markets the ultimate delight every day—access to their favorite beverages whenever and wherever they want them. As the company acquired more brands and customers, its rapid and sustained growth demanded a high level of agility and flexibility that it didn’t have with its on-premises environment.

title: Nevada Department of Transportation buckles up with Azure, joint BCDR solutions to enhance public safety
executive_summary: At the heart of the Nevada Department of Transportation is being a leader and provider of effective transportation solutions for a safe, connected, and innovative Nevada. The department is responsible for planning, constructing, and operating the more than 5,400 miles of highway and 1,000 bridges that make up Nevada’s highway system, which is used daily by residents and tourists alike. It’s also charged with supporting its internal employees, contractors, and civil engineers in maintaining the flow of movement throughout the state. To make things easier and more efficient for its workforce and greater community, the department recently adopted a cloud-first mindset and moved critical systems to Microsoft Azure, gaining agility, resiliency, and an improved position for the future.

title: Raise your organization's awareness of the importance of data
executive_summary: Executive Summary

title: Centrica reduces SharePoint site provisioning from five days to five minutes with self-service solution
executive_summary: Carl Smith, the Office 365 Service Owner for Centrica, is always looking for ways to “put himself out of a job”—at least those jobs that other employees could do for themselves. Finding ways to enable self-service lets his team focus on enhancing business operations. “We were getting a lot of last-minute requests for Microsoft SharePoint sites from different groups across the company,” Carl says. “With our strict security and corporate branding requirements across our many organizations, we were forced to follow a manual process and do it ourselves.” But when Centrica, a leading energy services and solutions company, deployed the Collaboration Area Request (CAR) solution from the Microsoft Customer Success team, Carl got his wish.

title: Teladoc Health streamlines compliance for global virtual healthcare scale, powered by HITRUST and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Healthcare systems around the world are unsustainable. The global pandemic has only exacerbated existing staffing and physician shortages, increased cost pressures, and increased service backlog and capacity issues. For global virtual care company, Teladoc Health, the partnership between HITRUST and Microsoft enables data security, ensures regulatory compliance, and helps their platform maintain and grow trust with partners and patients.

title: Meliá Hotels International creates a cohesive culture across properties with Microsoft Viva and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Today, employees expect workplace technology that reflects the simplicity of the technology they use at home, including intuitive user interfaces and simple sign-on procedures. With Teams, Fuster and her colleagues saw a way to bring employees a modern technology experience at work, while still maintaining the strong security that is vital for a global business. Through Viva Connections, Meliá has reimagined how its employees receive information about the business and made it easier for all of them to find manuals, HR information, and other company resources.

title: Modernizing the public sector: EKOME adopts the cloud for effective and secure work with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: From introducing investment incentives to improving media literacy, the National Centre of Audiovisual Media and Communication (EKOME) is a hub of Greece's audiovisual industry. Aspiring to champion the country’s digital transformation strategy, the institution turned to the General Secretariat of Information Systems for Public Administration (GSIS) to adopt Microsoft 365 E3. As a result, it has enabled staff mobility, and saved almost 10 hours weekly on administrative tasks. Its cloud strategy has also placed it in the world’s 10 percent most cyber-secure companies in the sector.

title: Confiz Catalyzes SJS International's Digital Transformation with D365 Finance and Operations
executive_summary: SJS International, an eminent player in the beauty industry since 1998, offers a diverse range of cosmetics, personal care, and lingerie products across the globe, including popular brands like Rivaj and RIOS. With a huge network of 20,000+ stores, 5+ e-commerce platforms, and 65+ distributions for famous brands, SJS International is determined to pursue growth. However, their legacy system posed challenges, affecting financial visibility and supply chain operations. To address these issues, SJS International partnered with Confiz and implemented D365 Finance and Operations, to unlock its full potential and drive growth.

title: Business scaling 101: EDUardo enhances business education experiences and serves thousands of users with Azure
executive_summary: With its learning platform built around its interactive business simulations, EDUardo is revolutionizing the business learning landscape. Based in Budapest, Hungary, the company offers interactive and practical business courses that empower course participants with new skills. Confronted with scalability issues, it transitioned from unreliable on-premises servers to Microsoft Azure, reducing downtime to only 48 minutes a year. EDUardo’s distinctive business courses were also made available on the Azure Marketplace, empowering thousands of professionals to upskill through immersive learning.

title: Yobi partners with Microsoft to democratize responsible enterprise access to customer behavioral data
executive_summary: In today’s data-driven world, understanding customer behavior and having the ability to predict customer intent through data and analytics is a paramount advantage that businesses should embrace to remain competitive. Yobi, founded in 2019 by Max Snow, Bill Wise, and Tom Griffiths, is on a mission to enable companies to compete with powerhouses like Amazon and Google and their ability to predict their customers’ buying behaviors. Harnessing the power of Microsoft Azure Databricks and Azure Data Factory, Yobi is helping to democratize ethical access to customer third-party data for all.

title: UMS embraces more collaborative teaching with Microsoft 365 Education
