executive_summary: Universiti Malaysia Sabah (UMS) is one of the leading higher education institutes in Malaysia. Staff and students were using apps and solutions ad hoc in conjunction with the university’s scattered legacy IT solutions. Seeking a more integrated technological approach, UMS deployed Microsoft 365 Education and transitioned to using Microsoft Outlook for email, Microsoft OneDrive data storage, and Microsoft Teams for communications. The move has helped the institute refocus its attention on student-centered learning.

title: Confiz Catalyzes SJS International's Digital Transformation with D365 Finance and Operations
executive_summary: SJS International, an eminent player in the beauty industry since 1998, offers a diverse range of cosmetics, personal care, and lingerie products across the globe, including popular brands like Rivaj and RIOS. With a huge network of 20,000+ stores, 5+ e-commerce platforms, and 65+ distributions for famous brands, SJS International is determined to pursue growth. However, their legacy system posed challenges, affecting financial visibility and supply chain operations. To address these issues, SJS International partnered with Confiz and implemented D365 Finance and Operations, to unlock its full potential and drive growth.

title: A look at Proterial's data governance—building a data analytics platform with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Proterial, Ltd. began reforming its business operations through a digital transformation (DX) initiative in FY2021. As part of this initiative, the company launched a project in August 2021 to establish a data lake platform to enable the visualization of management information by consolidating business data scattered across the company, while promoting the development of data governance. Microsoft's data analytics solutions, including Azure Synapse Analytics and Microsoft Power BI, were selected to help realize the data lake concept.

title: The Church of Pentecost-UK serves communities, prepares for growth with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Church of Pentecost-UK's inconsistent mix of IT tools and infrastructure provided a barrier to collaboration and organizational growth. They turned to Microsoft 365 to work together on one platform. Staff and volunteers now communicate in one place, collect a single source of truth for data, and operate securely.

title: NeighborWorks America tackles the housing crisis with Azure
executive_summary: NeighborWorks America tackles the housing crisis across the U.S. by supporting nearly 250 local nonprofits. Its outdated on-prem hardware caused regular system outages, limiting partner organizations' important work. The nonprofit needed to transition to the cloud in mere months to coincide with a headquarters move.

title: Carlsberg secures 25,000 devices globally with GYTPOL Validator hosted on Azure cloud
executive_summary: Founded in 1847, Carlsberg Group is one of the world's leading brewers. Yet, it faced challenges in managing its hybrid cybersecurity infrastructure. To create a more robust security posture, Carlsberg partnered with the Israeli company GYTPOL to deploy the GYTPOL Validator, which discovers and remedies device misconfigurations swiftly without disrupting business operations. As a result, Carlsberg has gained robust security and the peace of mind to continue pursuing innovation.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager

title: Windows 11 Pro lets HUG HUB bring insurance into the digital age
executive_summary: London-based HUG HUB wants to transform insurance into a self-service, customer-friendly platform. The company uses Windows 11 Pro devices along with cloud services to keep their employees productive and protected. Layers of built-in security enable their remote developers to build great software while keeping their sensitive customer data and source code secure.

title: Welcome to Czechia: Czech Tourism boosts web performance and accessibility with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Czech Tourism strives to entice visitors to explore Czechia's rich history, culture, and landscapes. Yet, with online portals seeing 300,000 daily visitors in peak seasons, digital outages marred its mission. Teaming up with IT partner YOUR SYSTEM, Czech Tourism transitioned from unreliable on-premise solutions to Microsoft Azure’s robust cloud capabilities. The result? Enhanced website performance and user experience, innovative and inclusive features like text-to-speech, and increased team performance and efficiency.

title: Muckleshoot Casino Resort wins big with improved visibility and collaboration from Microsoft Project for the web
executive_summary: The Muckleshoot Casino Resort, owned and operated by the Muckleshoot Indian Tribe, is the largest casino in Washington state. With over 3,500 gaming machines, table games, multiple onsite restaurants, and endless live entertainment, Muckleshoot Casino Resort is a one-stop shop for an exciting night out. Their upcoming hotel resort, set to open in early 2024, includes a collection of luxury rooms and suites, spa, fitness center, pool complex, and steakhouse restaurant. To better prioritize and manage all these exciting business initiatives, the casino adopted Microsoft Project for the web to simplify its user experience, gain insights into projects, and boost productivity within its project management teams.

executive_summary: Healthcare systems around the world are unsustainable. title: HUBER+SUHNER accelerates data analysis from weeks to minutes with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: HUBER+SUHNER, a leader in electrical and optical connectivity, implemented Microsoft Azure Data Explorer (ADX) with Option 4.0’s support. The result? A unified data architecture that has led to data analysis speed shrinking from weeks to minutes, enabling the company to resolve issues immediately and trace them back to their origin. With a single source of truth for the company’s globally distributed team, the company is setting the stage for advanced analytics and empowering its analysts to see the big picture.

title: Amadeus empowers its teams to focus their time and skills on value-added tasks with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: As a company providing solutions to the tourism and hospitality industry, Amadeus operates in 190 countries. Created in 1987 by four European airlines, Amadeus has expanded its reach beyond flight booking, into a diverse range of travel solutions. Today, it is a leader when it comes to the technological solutions behind our travels.

title: EKZ workplace becomes “overwhelmingly positive” with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: One of Switzerland’s largest energy suppliers, Elektrizitätswerke des Kantons Zürich (EKZ), wanted to provide its 1,400 employees with a more modern device experience, and to eliminate the high costs of their legacy device-management strategy. Microsoft Surface devices with Windows 11 Pro enable more flexible and productive work environments for EKZ employees, while Windows Autopilot simplifies the configuration, deployment, and ongoing management of the devices with a zero-touch experience for IT.

title: Microsoft Teams: the Principality of Monaco enters a new collaborative dimension that's as secure as it is efficient
executive_summary: Known primarily for its elegance and postcard-perfect scenery, the Principality of Monaco is nonetheless a state in its own right, counting some 39,000 citizens. The Princely Government of Monaco is committed to providing high-performance services and infrastructures, for the benefit of quality of life, education, culture and the economy.

title: Schréder runs digital with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Schréder is the leading independent smart outdoor lighting solution provider worldwide. The company, founded in 1907, is present in over 70 countries on 5 continents. The family-owned company takes pride in exploring the potential of light to transform environments by enhancing safety, beauty, well-being, connectivity, and sustainability in public spaces. From lighting the Channel Tunnel, the Champs-Elysées, and the Coliseum to an innovative project in Heiningen, Germany, that adapts lighting levels in response to traffic while reducing the impact of light on insect populations, Schréder is a global company that takes a local approach to creating safer, more sustainable spaces.

title: One World Strong helps survivors heal together through an app built with Microsoft Viva Engage
executive_summary: One World Strong needed a way to quickly spin up digital communities in the wake of mass casualty events such as bombings and terrorist attacks. The nonprofit has built an app that leverages Viva Engage to connect survivors and families in a secure, trustworthy environment and in dozens of supported languages. Through technology, these communities are healing and supporting one another.

title: Chemploy simplifies project invoicing time tracking in three months using Klynke Time Management time tracking integrated with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Dedicated to providing technical expertise for manufacturing, research, and development, Chemploy provides full-service chemical engineering for food, life sciences, and chemical industries in need of feasibility studies, process scale-up, and technical studies, as well as design and review of safety systems. Chemploy needed to upgrade its time-tracking and invoicing processes to enable better project management and address challenges with tracking hours, progress, and billing to deliver projects on time and within budget. The company found Klynke Time Management through Microsoft AppSource and determined the ease of transacting through the marketplace, combined with the solution’s efficient hourly booking on a project-specific basis and integration with Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams, perfectly aligned with Chemploy's commitment to deliver high-quality engineering solutions. Within three months of implementing Klynke Time Management, Chemploy increased the accuracy of its monthly accounts receivable reconciliation processes to almost 100 percent on the first attempt, drastically reducing invoice review time and increasing operational efficiency.

title: Fully remote clean energy nonprofit, Advanced Energy United, collaborates smarter with Microsoft Loop
executive_summary: With staff across the US, energy nonprofit Advanced Energy United needed a cohesive way to collaborate and communicate. It adopted Microsoft Loop to coordinate projects, get more done, and create a more connected culture among remote employees.

title: Tagme digitizes the on-premises journey of restaurants with support from Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: With Microsoft Teams Phone, 3,300+ stores of Migros Türkiye are more connected than ever
executive_summary: Migros Türkiye, a leading supermarket chain in Türkiye, revolutionized its frontline operations. The retail powerhouse introduced Microsoft Teams and Teams Phone to 6,300 users across all its locations. This move redefined store managers’ communication and training in over 3,300 stores. Migros Türkiye’s digital leap enhanced productivity, security, and visibility, realized 30% cost savings, and seamlessly connected different business units all geared towards providing an exceptional customer experience.

title: From hindsight to foresight: Wipro’s business insights journey with Microsoft Data Lake
executive_summary: Wipro is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. Leveraging our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, and operations, we help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. With nearly 240,000 employees and business partners across 65 countries, we deliver on the promise of helping our clients, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.

title: Accenture upgrades the experience for over 700,000 employees with Windows 11 Enterprise and Intune
executive_summary: Accenture, a leading global professional services company specializing in digital, cloud, and security services, is a force in the industry for good reason. With a history of scaling Microsoft technology across its 738,000 employee-strong organization, it continuously seeks to modernize its workplace and employee experience while offering the highest performing technology across all levels of its business.

title: From weeks to days, hours to seconds: PIC automates work processes to save time with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: In the petrochemical industry, staying ahead means leveraging cutting-edge technology. Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC) has done just that, transforming its operations with Copilot for Microsoft 365. From drafting emails to generating complex documents in minutes, Copilot has not only enhanced productivity and data security but also fostered a more professional communication style across the company.

title: Promoting an unprecedented Osaka-Kansai Expo! The role of West Japan Railway Company in “Community ID Infrastructure” based on Azure AD B2C
executive_summary: In April 2023, West Japan Railway Company devised its strategic roadmap, drawing insights from the impact of COVID-19. The plan, titled “Medium-Term Management Plan 2025 - Taking on post-pandemic challenges,” centers on “developing diverse services via digital strategy.” As part of this effort, the Kansai MaaS Council was formed by seven railway companies, including West Japan Railway Company, that operate major routes in the Kansai region to promote Mobility as a Service (MaaS) in preparation for the 2025 World Exposition in Japan (Expo 2025 Osaka, Kansai, Japan). The council spearheads an unprecedented large-scale MaaS initiative, collaborating with over 60 transportation operators, encompassing bus and cab operators, and engaging a multitude of stakeholders from the business community, government, and tourism organizations. In September 2023, an application called "KANSAI MaaS" was released to provide seamless transportation options in the Kansai region. Its new membership-based infrastructure service "Mobility Auth Bridge," which supports the mobility and lifestyles of people and connects various services provided in the region uses the “Azure Active Directory B2C” service provided by Microsoft, an identity management solution for business-to-customer (B2C) scenarios.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Vinci Partners creates a secure digital collaboration environment based on Microsoft 365 tools
executive_summary: Vinci Partners, a benchmark in alternative investments in Brazil, works with several Microsoft tools, such as SharePoint, OneDrive, OneNote, Microsoft Teams, among others, that streamline communication, collaboration, and contract management through new employee training. In addition, the company implemented a layer of security that supports the operation and brought peace of mind to work during the pandemic.

title: Microsoft Azure supports new Agger Sistemas insurance broker system
executive_summary: With Microsoft Azure, the company backs up more than 10,000 databases to SQL databases every 10 minutes.

title: The Instituto Politécnico Nacional (IPN) modernizes education, collaboration, and telecommunication services with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: IPN, one of the largest universities in Latin America, delivers safe, quality education with Microsoft 365 and SharePoint collaboration tools. It also ran its admissions process 100% digitally, thanks to the online admissions exam for more than 110,000 applicants (more than 40,000 simultaneously), with the help of the artificial intelligence, machine learning, load balancing, and big data services of Microsoft Azure.

title: The Adani Group’s Cement Business achieves reliability, scalability, and improved performance with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Ambuja Cements & ACC are India's leading cement companies and a member of the diversified Adani Portfolio – the largest and fastest growing portfolio of diversified sustainable businesses. Together, they boast an impressive footprint that includes 18 integrated units, 19 grinding units, over 82 ready-mix concrete plants, and a network of more than 100,000 channel partners across the country. With a robust cement production capacity of 78.9 million tons per annum, the Adani Group is committed to supporting India's growth objectives. Ambuja Cements and ACC provide convenient and high-quality home-building solutions and maintain a pan-India operational and marketing presence. With more than 85% blended cement and by harnessing green energy, it aims to follow sustainable production practices and reduce its carbon footprint. Ambuja & ACC have been recognised for their climate change mitigation commitments by being honoured with a ‘Leadership Score’ of ‘A-’ during the CDP Climate Assessment 2023 in the Climate Change category and are also among ‘India’s Most Trusted Cement Brands’ in the Brand Trust Report, 2024 by TRA Research.
products: Azure Synapse Analytics, SAP on Azure, Azure

title: Raízen deploys Microsoft Teams and trains more than a thousand employees in 30 days
executive_summary: Raízen, the energy company that produces and markets fuels, lubricants, and other specialties, in partnership with Prisma and Microsoft implemented its ERP remotely leveraged in Microsoft Teams, achieving a significant organizational change that delivers added value to the company.

title: STRUMIENIE school excels as a model for digital transformation in education
executive_summary: The STRUMIENIE primary and high school is one of the best examples of using modern technologies in education. The school was awarded the title of a Microsoft Showcase School, which means it is part of a worldwide program that distin­guishes the most innovative schools. The impact of technology is notable in all areas of students’ lives, and teachers and faculty incorporate Microsoft tools into the daily curriculum.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Digital tools encourage teachers, improve student learning
executive_summary: Digital tools are a great opportunity for teachers, and it’s especially important for children with reduced mobility to participate in classes with online solutions. Empowered by Office 365 and the Microsoft Innovative School Program, teachers at Budapest school Mozgásjavító helps students improve learning experience.

title: Digital tools encourage teachers, improve student learning
executive_summary: Digital tools are a great opportunity for teachers, and it’s especially important for children with reduced mobility to participate in classes with online solutions. Empowered by Office 365 and the Microsoft Innovative School Program, teachers at Budapest school Mozgásjavító helps students improve learning experience.

title: Nestlé serves up anywhere access for a global team
executive_summary: When global food and beverage giant Nestlé wanted to take advantage of the secure collaboration offered by the cloud, it faced a monumental task. Migrating data for more than 300,000 users would require overcoming significant technical challenges, but leadership also knew the importance of something much less tangible: influencing the habits and attitudes of a diverse, worldwide workforce. After careful review, the company chose Microsoft OneDrive, part of Microsoft Office 365, as its file sharing solution. The productivity-enhancing app almost sells itself to users.

title: Cloud9 conquers esports using Azure data analytics
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Arcadis uses Microsoft Power Platform to support more than 40,000 sustainable design and engineering solutions for the world
executive_summary: Arcadis wanted to drive greater efficiency with self-service automation tailored to each project and client. At the same time, the company wanted to avoid the high costs of development with custom code.

title: Enhanced call quality, simpler system: University of Cyprus improves telephony with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: University of Cyprus struggled with poor audio quality, maintenance issues, and lack of collaboration features in its old telephony system.

title: Pioneering insurance model automatically pays travelers for delayed flights
executive_summary: Based in Zurich, Switzerland, Swiss Re Group is a leading wholesale provider of reinsurance and insurance. The second-largest reinsurance company in the world, Swiss Re has offices in more than 25 countries and reported revenue of US$33 billion in 2016. To break away from traditional business models, the company created a digital platform based on Microsoft Azure and launched a pioneering micro-insurance service that automatically reimburses airline passengers for delayed flights. More innovative projects are underway as the company takes advantage of a DevOps workflow combined with Azure platform-as-a-service offerings.

title: Pet care leader turns monolithic app into a global distributed solution on Azure
executive_summary: Pets, like their owners, need specialized care from time to time, but the referral system used by one major network of pet care providers needed care itself. The medical records didn’t always follow the client, and often the records got duplicated in the process. VCA, one of the largest pet healthcare companies in the United States, wanted to streamline referrals across more than 800 of its veterinary hospitals. The company turned to Microsoft Gold Certified Partner CloudIQ Technologies, which created a cloud-native application on Microsoft Azure that solved the messy referrals problem.

title: Korn Ferry taps collective knowledge to exceed client expectations
executive_summary: As a leader in executive search and organizational advisory services, Korn Ferry helps companies find the perfect people. Its 8,000 geographically dispersed employees use Microsoft 365 to locate expertise and content faster so they can collaborate to bring the full breadth of Korn Ferry services to clients. They compress the information search phase and get to problem-solving sooner. Korn Ferry protects this mobile, global sharing by using the Multi-Geo Capabilities in Office 365, Microsoft Enterprise Mobility + Security, and Windows 10.

title: Getting 20 SAP systems into the cloud in record time
executive_summary: In 2019, hydraulics expert HANSA-FLEX AG took on two major projects in an effort to adapt its IT structure to meet its organizational and customer needs. With 160,000 customers around the world, and 4,500 employees working in over 450 locations in more than 40 countries, HANSA-FLEX realized that its single, self-operated, local datacenter at its headquarters in Bremen was lopsided. Working with Microsoft Partner Network member, Arvato Systems, the company updated its SAP systems and database to SAP HANA, achieving the fastest cloud migration to-date. Today, the family owned business is one of Germany’s largest midsize companies using SAP on Microsoft Azure. It was the first time the company used Azure NetApp Files to run performance-intensive and latency-sensitive workloads in the cloud.

title: Boggi Milano automates its supply chain replenishment with Evo Pricing’s AI solution, built on Microsoft technology
executive_summary: Innovation is core to Boggi Milano. It’s the founding value that enabled the company’s transformation from a small boutique in 1939 to a rapidly growing ambassador of premium Italian style for cosmopolitan men all over the world, with 190 stores in 38 countries. The latest example is the company’s adoption of fully automated supply chain replenishment, an innovation introduced in partnership with Evo Pricing. This artificial intelligence solution powered by Microsoft services enabled 4 percent like-for-like revenue growth, even while overall stock shrank by 12 percent, thanks to accelerated learning and greater local relevance.

title: AA Service Co. uses CiraSync on Azure to centrally manage smartphone contact lists
executive_summary: AA Service Co. is a large-scale HVAC service provider in Chicago. The company has been modernizing its IT structure since adopting smartphones as its main tool to communicate with colleagues, suppliers, and technical resources in 2013. As employees inevitably came and went, the IT staff at AA Service Co. had to manually update a constantly changing employee directory of employee smartphones.

title: Georgia school district improves graduation rate and student success with Power BI and Azure
executive_summary: Forsyth County is one of the fastest-growing counties in the United States, and the Forsyth County School District (Forsyth) is the seventh-largest district in the state of Georgia. With the surrounding area known as Georgia’s technology corridor, Forsyth County prides itself on its technological innovation and high performance. The North Metro Atlanta–based school district has 40 schools and centers, over 8,000 full-time and part-time employees, and more than 51,000 students.

title: Mobile collaboration with the Malteser aid organization
executive_summary: SoCura GmbH provides IT services for the Malteser Verbund aid organization. In recent years, this in-house service provider has played a major part in the Catholic aid organization’s development into a digitalization pioneer in the welfare sector. A private cloud solution has been available to Malteser International since the early 2000s, which updated SoCura 2012 in a comprehensive renewal project. In the private cloud nursing specialists, paramedics, and administrators are working with specialist applications and confidential health records, the security requirements were high. Malteser decided to augment its private cloud with a public cloud solution based on Microsoft 365.

title: MOHRE boosts productivity by 20% with Microsoft 365 E5
executive_summary: For the Ministry of Human Resources and Emiratisation (MOHRE), managing its on-premises infrastructure with a lean team was a challenge. The outdated system and limited capacity hindered their ability to efficiently support their operations.

title: PHDC manages projects more efficiently and serves clients faster with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: PHDC helps low-income residents make needed repairs to their homes. The agency used disparate, manual processes to plan projects, track documents, schedule inspections, and pay for repairs. To streamline its complex processes, PHDC adopted the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Field Service business applications and Power Pages. Now, the agency has increased productivity, made remote work possible, improved reporting, and pays its valuable contractors in half the time.

title: Willis Towers Watson centralizes sales data, improves governance and predictability with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Insurance brokerage and advisory company Willis Towers Watson wanted to get greater strategic value from the client sales data dispersed across its large organization. It adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales to centralize all engagement into one platform and Power BI to add powerful analytics capabilities. After a rapid, successful deployment, Willis Towers Watson achieved nearly 90 percent adoption in just six months. The company gained visibility into its data, increased actionable insights, and personalized its services, which has led to a significant boost in sales leads.

title: Streamlining automotive lending on a global scale with defi SOLUTIONS
executive_summary: In the automotive lending industry, defi SOLUTIONS represents a trusted brand for software that empowers rapid and accurate loan origination. In an industry where the difference between business gained or lost is measured in seconds, defi SOLUTIONS is consistently looking for ways to support speed, scalability, and a global reach that could eventually evolve into a “buy from the couch” model of shopping, credit approval, and purchase. To better serve their customers, defi turned to Microsoft Azure to help them in their transformation to a cloud-native operation.

title: Syngenta Group legal team creates companywide impact using Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The people who work at agricultural and technology innovator Syngenta Group prize the company’s “can-do” culture, which makes it easy to make great ideas happen. But the information and business process professionals at Syngenta Group met with a range of blockers when helping the legal team tackle productivity-dampening issues. They found that they could solve a host of routine business challenges by creating simple solutions with Microsoft Power Apps, Power Virtual Agents, and the rest of Microsoft Power Platform, putting fast improvements within reach of their colleagues without needing advanced coding skills.

title: Canadian Tire keeps the wheels of commerce turning safely, triples online sales with the help of Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Iconic retailer Canadian Tire shared the pain of countless brick-and-mortar retailers when COVID-19 erected a barrier to in-person shopping. But just as it’s led the way in the Canadian retail space for the past century, the company innovated to provide a safe space for customers. It used Microsoft Teams to quickly create a reimagined curbside delivery capability. Not only are online sales up by a factor of nine; Canadian Tire looks forward to the next phase in an omni-channel retail ecosphere that promises the best of all worlds for customers and for its frontline workers.

title: Studio gains 70 percent compute capacity with Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets, HBv2 virtual machines
executive_summary: Jellyfish Pictures needed to enable secure remote access to immense computing power to render visual effects and animation sequences. The studio gained burst rendering on up to 90,000 processor cores in the cloud with Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets, HBv2 virtual machines, and Avere vFXT for Azure. It takes 80 percent off those rendering costs with Azure Spot Virtual Machines and uses an Azure ExpressRoute connection to minimize latency while more securely managing storage in one place, without replication.

title: New York City Department of Environmental Protection pioneers chatbot innovation improving employee experiences and operational efficiency
executive_summary: As the largest city in the US, New York City is home to 8.3 million residents, the nation’s highest population density, and 325,000 government employees – more than any other US city and most states. The NYC Department of Environmental Protection is committed to the quality of life of the city’s residents, providing safe, clean drinking water and wastewater treatment. Their digital transformation, which began 14 years ago and continues with ongoing modernization efforts, is helping drive a sustainable future for all New Yorkers.

title: AMD IT satisfies an insatiable appetite for capacity, scalability, and innovation with Azure HPC
executive_summary: As a leader in semiconductor, computer processors, and related technologies, AMD has a responsibility to serve its customers, keep pace with the industry, and help set the standard for how servers, computers, and embedded systems run. To maintain its execution track record, the IT team at AMD used Microsoft Azure high-performance computing (HPC), HBv3 virtual machines, and other Azure resources to build scalable capacity and optimize the company’s cloud capabilities, accelerating time to market and eliminating weeks and even months of delay.

title: Infobip makes hospital check-ins faster and safer with Azure Bot Service (AI)
executive_summary: When the COVID-19 pandemic hit, international hospital group Mediclinic needed a fast and safe way to give patients, staff and visitors access to clinics. For this, it turned to technology partner company Infobip, a global omnichannel communications leader. By combining Azure Bot Service (AI) and its Azure-based WhatsApp Business platform, Infobip delivered an effective health screening service for mobile devices. Today, the bot-driven solution is helping health-care staff and visitors access Mediclinic’s facilities safely.

title: With Dynamics 365, Natura imbues its service with robustness and tightens its relationship with its customers
executive_summary: The company managed to develop a robust customer service system, with a higher availability and flexibility to develop other solutions in the future, in addition to strengthening Natura’s very precious relationship with its customers.

title: Business Finland: boosting innovation with intelligent data insights
executive_summary: Business Finland works to support Finnish companies to grow their businesses through innovation at home and abroad. This is a well-oiled machine and at its core is a CRM system built on Microsoft Dynamics 365. Greater data insights have helped it support thousands of Finnish companies through the COVID-19 pandemic, increasing their export sales by 20%, and allowing the Finnish government to fund topics and initiatives that align with its strategic goals. It is a platform that sets a global standard for business support mechanisms the world over.

title: Singapore-based renewable energy company Sembcorp digitalizes to create synergetic employee experiences
executive_summary: As one of the largest energy players in Singapore, Sembcorp Industries (Sembcorp) has a balanced energy portfolio with substantial renewable energy capacity across the world. Sembcorp seeks to meet the rising global demand for sustainable solutions while ensuring a safe and flexible workspace during the COVID-19 pandemic. The company has set up its modern workplace by accelerating deployment and adoption of Microsoft 365, particularly Microsoft Teams, for connectivity and collaboration.

title: Sage extends cloud-enabling solutions for partners using Azure Virtual Desktop alongside Azure Lighthouse
executive_summary: In 1981, accountant David Goldman started a development project to automate print estimating and basic accounting processes for his business. He soon realized that other companies could benefit too, and he formed the Sage Group to begin selling the software.

title: Cloud solution helps group focus on goals over administration
executive_summary: Ruter Dam is a Swedish membership organization that offers an Executive Development and Mentoring Program for female senior leaders. Its goal is to help female managers reach high-level positions in business, and many of the more than 1,300 women who have completed the program since it began in 1987 now hold key leadership positions in Sweden’s business sector. Seeking to automate manual processes and embrace digital meetings during the pandemic, the growing organization turned to Innofactor Plc, which provided a Microsoft cloud solution to handle administrative functions and provide self-service options for program members.

title: FLSmidth plans industry-wide sustainability transformation and looks to Microsoft solutions for help
executive_summary: FLSmidth wants to be the sustainability leader in the mining and cement industries, and the company is on track to do that with its MissionZero plan for zero emissions and zero waste by 2030. FLSmidth believes Microsoft technologies can help it measure, track, analyze, and report on its progress while delivering greater value and insights from its sustainability data. By adopting sophisticated digital sustainability tools, FLSmidth can accelerate its own sustainability journey, deliver innovative solutions to its customers, enable brand new business models, and position the company to dramatically reduce the 10 to 12 percent of global emissions that come from mining and cement.

title: New Zealand’s largest farming co-op drives cultural change via digital transformation
executive_summary: Farmlands Co-operative is a major player in New Zealand’s rural industry, with business units in retail, fuel, nutrition, and horticulture. In 2013, the co-operative’s two biggest regional operations merged into a single entity. However, two years later, the national company was still working in silos and used multiple systems. To break down this highly fragmented approach, Farmlands embarked on a three-year project, employing Microsoft Dynamics 365 to help the diverse business build a united digital culture.

title: Kuwait’s Central Agency for Information Technology partners with Microsoft to spur digital transformation
executive_summary: Kuwait’s Central Agency for Information Technology (CAIT) was founded in 2006 to supervise the implementation of e-government plans and projects in collaboration with ministries and government entities across the gulf nation. Today, it works with Microsoft on an IT assessment initiative named Tamkeen. Focusing on cybersecurity, infrastructure, and application modernization, the project is laying the groundwork for a more integrated and secure future—both for Kuwait’s government entities and its citizens. Its key goal is to identify gaps in technology and empower entities to lead the coming waves of change.

title: BNY Mellon brings industry-leading technology innovation to wire payments system with Azure
executive_summary: BNY Mellon holds an important position in the global financial infrastructure that sees the bank process trillions of dollars in wire payments daily. For global markets and economies to operate in a resilient, orderly manner, they rely on BNY Mellon’s infrastructure. To ensure resiliency in the face of dramatic usage spikes like those the bank saw early in the COVID-19 pandemic, and to safeguard the trust of its customers, BNY Mellon has added cloud capabilities to its wire payments infrastructure with Microsoft Azure. The bank has been able to add this extra capacity without compromising the user experience, and BNY Mellon anticipates that the success of the deployment will spur further innovation and maintain the bank’s technology leadership position in the industry.

title: Creating a wellness-centered community at MUSC
executive_summary: At the Medical University of South Carolina (MUSC), wellness is central to healthcare—not just for patients, but clinicians and students as well. “Our mission is to extend life and improve quality of life for all South Carolinians,” says Susan Johnson, Health Promotion Director at MUSC, “but we can’t take care of others if we can’t take care of ourselves.” Since 2016, MUSC has promoted wellness initiatives through Imagine U, a digital engagement platform that supports clinician, faculty, staff and student self-care. Yet as MUSC expanded their health system and the COVID-19 pandemic put even more pressure on providers and health systems, the Imagine U platform struggled to keep up. With wellness more important than ever, MUSC innovated on Microsoft Teams and the Power platform, transforming Imagine U into a true engagement platform at the heart of the MUSC community.

title: CQC partners with Microsoft to transform the way they regulate health & social care
executive_summary: The Care Quality Commission (CQC) is the independent regulator of health and social care in England. It was established in 2009 as an executive non-departmental public body of the Department of Health and Social Care of the United Kingdom. It has an ambitious strategy to transform the way it regulates.

title: Microsoft Project helps Danish skylight manufacturer unify data systems and remote employees while improving processes
executive_summary: Roof window and skylight innovator VELUX was seeking a project portfolio management solution that would unify company data, create efficiencies, provide a robust yet easy-to-use interface, and allow for scalability. After careful consideration, the company selected Microsoft Project. Today, user satisfaction has risen dramatically—survey respondents report being satisfied and highly satisfied with the usability of the new system—and time to market has improved. VELUX has therefore decided on Project as the standard enterprise solution for PPM company-wide.

title: Vattenfall Streamlines sales and service, scales for sustainability and growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Vattenfall AB is a European energy company that has electrified industries and supplied energy to people's homes for more than 100 years. With a commitment to modernizing the way people live through innovation and cooperation, the company is determined to enable fossil free living within one generation. To provide a fully connected customer experience across its different lines of business and increase customer engagement in the company’s sustainability efforts, Vattenfall needed a way to better streamline its sales and service operations. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing, Sales, and Service, the company created a cohesive customer relationship (CRM) system—helping employees become more efficient and improving customer engagement.

title: Krones enhances its digital-first workplace using Windows 11 Enterprise as its platform for secure, sustainable innovation
executive_summary: Krones is a global manufacturer of process and packaging technology for the food and beverage industry, with distributed operations across more than 100 sites worldwide and a product portfolio that includes digital systems solutions, factory planning, and intralogistics services. Krones’s culture of innovation and engineering expertise has produced more than 7,000 patents and utility models. With a future-forward focus on sustainable innovation, its mission is to deliver “solutions beyond tomorrow.”

title: The Société du Canal de Provence relies on data to optimize the management of water supply networks and the use of this resource in the face of climate change
executive_summary: As historic droughts recur in France, the urgent issues of water stress and of the sustainable use of this resource are becoming permanent fixtures in political debates and public concerns. How to optimize the management and distribution of raw water? How can we spare this resource while guaranteeing a service for all uses? Let’s have a look at the ambitious project implemented by the Société Canal de Provence, which places data at the heart of its activity.

title: Al-Futtaim Group gears up for hyper-personalized customer experiences with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Al-Futtaim Group is a leading family-owned business conglomerate operating across the regional automotive, financial services, real estate, retail, and health markets, representing over 200 brands and services to customers across Asia and Africa. The company has been updating its infrastructure and migrating to the cloud in the last four years. Himanshu Shrivastava, Al-Futtaim Group’s Chief Technology Officer, believes this will enable the company to leverage data analytics across all its business lines, further fulfilling its mission of enriching people’s lives through quality services.

title: Arrow Vale leverages Microsoft Education to advance learning amongst underprivileged students
executive_summary: Arrow Vale, a Microsoft Showcase School, serves over 850 students in one of the most economically deprived areas of England. In the past, the school struggled with closing the learning gap between students from various socioeconomic backgrounds.

title: CQC partners with Microsoft to transform the way they regulate health & social care
executive_summary: The Care Quality Commission (CQC) is the independent regulator of health and social care in England. It was established in 2009 as an executive non-departmental public body of the Department of Health and Social Care of the United Kingdom. It has an ambitious strategy to transform the way it regulates.

title: Microsoft Project helps Danish skylight manufacturer unify data systems and remote employees while improving processes
executive_summary: Roof window and skylight innovator VELUX was seeking a project portfolio management solution that would unify company data, create efficiencies, provide a robust yet easy-to-use interface, and allow for scalability. After careful consideration, the company selected Microsoft Project. Today, user satisfaction has risen dramatically—survey respondents report being satisfied and highly satisfied with the usability of the new system—and time to market has improved. VELUX has therefore decided on Project as the standard enterprise solution for PPM company-wide.

title: Viridor tears down silos and drives improvement with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: “The problems we face are so complex, we cannot afford to work in silos. We need to come together to think and deliver creatively,” states Edita Adamcikova, Head of ESG at Viridor. “We have a very ambitious strategy ‘to build a world where nothing goes to waste’ of which we are very proud. We now have the foundation, supported by technology, to deliver that and to be creative and innovative for the benefit of our company and our communities.”

title: Sidra Medicine and its digital transformation journey with the cloud
executive_summary: Sidra Medicine, a research and medical facility in Qatar, provides specialist healthcare services for women and children. Its research team built an Azure-powered centralized data warehouse to enable easier cross-border research collaboration and achieve its digital transformation goals. With world-class data privacy and security standards, the healthcare facility empowered medical and research professionals to freely and securely exchange data, analyze results, and compare findings.

title: How Aker Solutions is using cloud technology to empower its disparate workforce
executive_summary: Global integrated energy services company Aker Solutions is determined to bring about sustainable change in the energy sector. With a strategic focus on low-carbon and renewable solutions, and an ambitious target of having net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, the company is prioritizing digitalization as a method to achieve its goals. The company’s transition to Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) exemplifies this drive. Intended to address latency and workload issues, while empowering its remote offshore installation workers with the high-performance compute (HPC) capabilities they need to undertake their work, AVD is supporting Aker Solutions to keep its disparate workforce united as it leads from the front in the global energy transition.

title: Georgian Ministry of Education leverages remote admin control for school laptops with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Ministry of Education, Science, Culture, and Sport of Georgia continues to follow its mission to create a modern and innovative educational environment. However, the ministry needed administrative solutions to remotely manage students’ laptops better after creating virtual classes and game-based learning with Microsoft 365 tools. The institution optimized its IT by implementing Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, and Windows 11. With the new tools, laptops can be connected, cleaned, and repaired remotely. Robust cybersecurity policies also enable to protect children’s personal data when they’re browsing online from home.

title: EY teams synchronize collaboration for over 300,000 users with modernized identity and data governance
executive_summary: For global professional services organization EY, helping to deliver value for its many clients hinges on a simple concept: collaboration. With over 300,000 professionals around the world who work with clients and external “guest” consultants, the scale of that teamwork is truly immense. Sharing content among that matrix of internal and external colleagues without oversharing presented a challenge to EY IT professionals, but the team found the answer it needed with Microsoft Purview Information Protection and Azure Active Directory External Identities. When the COVID-19 crisis hastened the need for remote collaboration, the company accelerated its rollout and stayed connected. The ROI of sustaining a business and helping clients face an unprecedented challenge. Priceless!

title: The Société du Canal de Provence relies on data to optimize the management of water supply networks and the use of this resource in the face of climate change
executive_summary: As historic droughts recur in France, the urgent issues of water stress and of the sustainable use of this resource are becoming permanent fixtures in political debates and public concerns. How to optimize the management and distribution of raw water? How can we spare this resource while guaranteeing a service for all uses? Let’s have a look at the ambitious project implemented by the Société Canal de Provence, which places data at the heart of its activity.

title: Land O’Lakes uses Azure Data Manager for Agriculture to support more efficient, sustainable farming
executive_summary: Land O’Lakes is one of the largest farmer-owned cooperatives and touches half the harvested acres in the United States.  Farmers are integral to all its businesses including WinField United crop inputs and insights, Animal Nutrition, Dairy Foods and Truterra.  Land O’Lakes turned to Azure Data Manager for Agriculture to provide growers with data-driven insights that make them more efficient, profitable, and sustainable in their practices.

title: TKC uses Windows 11 and Dynabook to help protect PCs from cyber-attacks
executive_summary: TKC has developed specialized information systems and services dedicated to accounting firms and local governments. These systems are required to adapt quickly to changes and to have high social responsibility standards. Together, Windows 11 and Dynabook help protect PCs from cyber-attacks by detecting and recovering attacks to the BIOS and preventing the spread of infection. These security advancements enable TKC to provide support through information and communication technology (or “ICT”), making broad contributions to the development of the Japanese economy and local communities.

title: Transforming Nan Fung Property Management’s Waste Disposal Patterns into Sustainable Strategies
executive_summary: A pioneering force in Hong Kong's community development for over four decades, Nan Fung Property Management (NFPM) focuses on delivering exceptional property and facility management, and upkeeps services to uplift the quality of residential, recreational, and work environments across over 80 managed properties. Lately, it has placed a greater emphasis on improving its Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) performance in light of new government policies such as the waste charging scheme, which may take effect in 2024. With stakeholders demanding transparency and accountability more than ever, NFPM realized the criticality of having accurate ESG reporting capabilities to reinforce its ESG commitment. Amid new ESG expectations, innovation and technology are now keys to accelerate sustainability goals, and NFPM understood the needs to quickly rearchitect its value chain to keep up with the changing times.

title: Aker BP transforms its data and operations with Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Energy
executive_summary: One of the largest independent energy companies in Europe, Aker BP is engaged in the exploration, field development, and production of oil and gas on the Norwegian continental shelf. As an energy industry leader, the company places operational excellence at the core of all its endeavors, recognizing that a robust operational framework lays the foundation for growth and empowers employees to do their best work. To improve processes and develop digital tools, Aker BP chose to work with Microsoft to reach the full potential of its data to meet its operational excellence goals, facilitate informed decision-making, and experience transformative impact. In harnessing the power of Azure Data Manager for Energy to analyze vast amounts of energy-related datasets, applications, and cloud services, Aker BP will gain valuable business insights to increase operational efficiency and reduce data evaluation time.

title: Al-Futtaim Group gears up for hyper-personalized customer experiences with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Al-Futtaim Group is a leading family-owned business conglomerate operating across the regional automotive, financial services, real estate, retail, and health markets, representing over 200 brands and services to customers across Asia and Africa. The company has been updating its infrastructure and migrating to the cloud in the last four years. Himanshu Shrivastava, Al-Futtaim Group’s Chief Technology Officer, believes this will enable the company to leverage data analytics across all its business lines, further fulfilling its mission of enriching people’s lives through quality services.

title: Arrow Vale leverages Microsoft Education to advance learning amongst underprivileged students
executive_summary: Arrow Vale, a Microsoft Showcase School, serves over 850 students in one of the most economically deprived areas of England. In the past, the school struggled with closing the learning gap between students from various socioeconomic backgrounds.

title: Sanofi uses the industrial metaverse to revolutionize training and operational efficiency
executive_summary: Sanofi is a leader in the development and manufacturing of both prescription and over-the-counter medications. To meet an increased demand for Sanofi pharmaceuticals, the Paris-based organization needed to find a way to make its production lines more streamlined while training and onboarding more operators. Sanofi launched a pilot project in it packaging workshop in Lisieux, France to work in the metaverse using Microsoft HoloLens 2 with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Guides and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist. The aim was to streamline employee training procedures, enhance operator efficiency, and integrate a digital approach within the manufacturing environment. Using HoloLens 2, Sanofi has reduced training time for new operators from eight weeks to six weeks. The organization is also using HoloLens 2 for remote maintenance and troubleshooting, enabling quicker resolution of equipment issues. With the success of the pilot, Sanofi is looking to expand the solution across its value chain, with a specific emphasis on data analysis.

title: Milliman is enabling self-service actuarial modeling with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Milliman wants to empower its clients to understand the risks facing their business more quickly and how to best mitigate those risks. Milliman’s journey with Microsoft Fabric began during the private preview, allowing Milliman to take a considered, step-by-step approach to deployment. Microsoft Fabric is an all-in-one analytics solution that offers a comprehensive suite of services, including data lake, data engineering, and reporting. Early results have been encouraging. Microsoft Fabric directly solves challenges previously faced by both Milliman and its clients, including enabling more advanced analytics and reducing latency and cost.

title: Södra plants a seed for climate neutrality with Microsoft Sustainability Manager
executive_summary: International forest industry group Södra has set itself ambitious sustainability goals. A collection of more than 50,000 family foresters in southern Sweden with an encompassing range of products, the association estimates that its positive climate impact is roughly equal to one-fifth of Sweden’s emissions. Södra became the industry giant it is today through its forward-thinking, innovative approach. The association’s intent focus on sustainability—not just for its industry or even its nation, but the planet—led it to its current drive to collect and interpret climate impact data for every part of the value chain. That’s why Södra is setting the pace for sustainability in its industry with Microsoft Sustainability Manager, a solution within Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability.

title: Copilot for Microsoft 365: Saving time and money and enhancing wellbeing for Atos employees and customers
executive_summary: In its ongoing quest to shape what the digital future holds for its clients, Atos is fully committed to giving them the most innovative solutions and making their digital transformation smooth and seamless. Its biggest challenge in all of this is to optimize workplace processes in terms of both efficiency and cost optimization, all with the aim of driving employee engagement. A group of selected Atos employees was recently given the chance to try out Copilot for Microsoft 365 for themselves. And the verdict? The AI program demonstrated just how crucial it can be in everyday processes and quickly established itself as a key partner in employee wellbeing. With Copilot for Microsoft 365, trialing is believing.

title: International Tennis Federation delivers performance insights with Azure Databricks
executive_summary: Real-time statistics are vital information for athletes and coaches, but the International Tennis Federation (ITF) could only offer high-level post-match summary data. Using Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Surface, and Azure Data Lake—ITF and Valorem Reply developed the Billie Jean King Cup Match Insights app to support teams with performance insights during matches. The app empowers tennis professionals to elevate their game, make data-driven decisions, and achieve better results on the court.

title: Copilot for Microsoft 365: Saving time and money and enhancing wellbeing for Atos employees and customers
executive_summary: In its ongoing quest to shape what the digital future holds for its clients, Atos is fully committed to giving them the most innovative solutions and making their digital transformation smooth and seamless. Its biggest challenge in all of this is to optimize workplace processes in terms of both efficiency and cost optimization, all with the aim of driving employee engagement. A group of selected Atos employees was recently given the chance to try out Copilot for Microsoft 365 for themselves. And the verdict? The AI program demonstrated just how crucial it can be in everyday processes and quickly established itself as a key partner in employee wellbeing. With Copilot for Microsoft 365, trialing is believing.

title: International Tennis Federation delivers performance insights with Azure Databricks
executive_summary: Real-time statistics are vital information for athletes and coaches, but the International Tennis Federation (ITF) could only offer high-level post-match summary data. Using Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Surface, and Azure Data Lake—ITF and Valorem Reply developed the Billie Jean King Cup Match Insights app to support teams with performance insights during matches. The app empowers tennis professionals to elevate their game, make data-driven decisions, and achieve better results on the court.

title: Close Brothers gains agility and streamlines IT effort by switching to Windows 365
executive_summary: Close Brothers wanted to modernise its IT estate to reduce support overheads, simplify IT, improve the user experience and make it easier to offshore services. They switched to a number of Microsoft solutions, including Microsoft Surface devices, Windows 11, Microsoft Intune, Entra ID and, notably, switching from a poorly performing incumbent remote desktop app to Windows 365. Performance tickets raised dropped by 80 percent, software requests have been cut by 50 percent, and at the same time, users are happier with the end user experience.

title: Globo empowers employees and automates all areas of the business with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Globo has undergone a digital transformation, with the standardization of its communication and collaboration, as well as a broad use of low code solutions to automate various processes, going from human resources to other core areas of the company, such as entertainment and journalism. After empowerment journeys and a Hackathon that accelerated this process, the company created a Center of Excellence to handle the high volume of applications created by technology-empowered contributors.

title: Florida nonprofit Agape Source scales to support more newcomers through AI-powered web chat, Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Agape Source runs Orlando Welcome, which serves international students, temporary workers from other countries, and refugees in Florida. The nonprofit operates with a staff of just three people plus volunteers and needed ways to be more efficient. They began using Microsoft Copilot, the AI-powered web chat assistant, to get more done, faster. The nonprofit is ramping up the number of people it supports with the help of generative AI.

title: SPAR helps customers make grocery savings with an Azure-based customer app
executive_summary: Austrian supermarket chain SPAR is committed to helping its customers save on their grocery shopping with the help of technology. A traditional brick-and-mortar retailer, the company is embracing digitalization and innovation by moving to the cloud – and using it to develop a new customer app that’s helping SPAR to push out more promotions and discounts while also phasing out paper-based systems.

title: Audi is reimagining endpoint management and security with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Renowned for its automobiles and motorcycles in the premium and luxury segments, as well as technological leadership, the AUDI AG embarked on an IT transformation with Microsoft Intune to streamline device management and enhance security. With Intune, Audi aimed to simplify the user experience, reduce IT dependencies, and ensure secure, seamless access to resources. This strategic shift enabled the migration of 40,000 devices to a unified management platform, enhancing operational efficiency and user satisfaction without compromising personal settings. Audi’s initiative showcases its innovation and sets a standard for secure, efficient workplace transformation in the automotive industry.

title: Dener Motorsport gains real-time race insights with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Automobile professionals and fans share a passion for high-level racing, but also for insights and news about technical detail, racing strategies, and driver statistics. Expectations were high for the annual Porsche Carrera Cup Brasil, but for Dener Motorsport, race information and reporting did not live up to the brand image or match its promise. Race data must be on display as quickly as possible. Dener Motorsport tested Microsoft Fabric to support real-time analytics, storage, and reporting, finding that it better supported stakeholders with actionable insights and a full view of the data. The new architecture helps to keep drivers safer, to sustain optimal performance, and to maintain the cars in good repair.

title: Digital assistant in the Microsoft 365 cockpit: Würth IT tests Copilot for the Group’s 400 companies
executive_summary: Writing emails, summarizing meetings, and culling content for presentations: it’s routine tasks like these that eat up time and energy that people could otherwise spend tackling their real day-to-day challenges. On behalf of the global Würth Group, Würth IT was in the market for a solution that would relieve employees of precisely these tasks and free up time for them to spend on those activities that bring the Group forward. As part of an early access program (EAP), Würth IT put Copilot for Microsoft 365 through its paces—and recognized the vast potential offered by this digital assistant.

title: Saudia Academy boosts aviation training efficiency by 100% with Netways and Microsoft
executive_summary: Saudia Academy, also known as Prince Sultan Aviation Academy (PSAA), is an aviation training provider delivering flight simulators and aviation services in the MENA region. To accelerate its digital transformation journey, the academy implemented an advanced Training Management System with the help of Microsoft partner, Netways. The platform resolved scheduling conflicts, improved PSAA’s training efficiency by 100 percent, and increased training capacity by 400 percent, resulting in time and cost savings for both trainees and the academy.

title: Localiza saves up to 19 hours of work with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Localiza needed to increase employee productivity and optimize repetitive manual tasks.

title: Enova boosts cybersecurity with Microsoft 365 and Azure, lowering costs and enhancing operational efficiency
executive_summary: Enova, an energy and facilities management provider, struggled with a fragmented cybersecurity landscape, having to rely on up to a dozen solutions. It lacked a holistic view through single pane of glass.

title: Sensei consolidates solutions, automates workflows, and improves security with Microsoft 365 and Copilot
executive_summary: Sensei is a wellbeing retreat company that wanted to consolidate and integrate several third-party software tools while embracing secure use of generative AI.

title: VSE unifies customer service with Dynamics 365, cutting response times from days to hours
executive_summary: VSE struggled with fragmented systems, outdated platforms, and siloed teams, lacking a unified view of customer interactions and efficient processes. This led to operational inefficiencies and inconsistent customer experiences.

title: ENGIE’s journey to a modern workplace with Windows 11 and Intune
executive_summary: ENGIE used Windows 10 with Microsoft Configuration Manager and VPN for device management.

title: Mitsubishi Electric advances energy-saving buildings with Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability
executive_summary: N/A

title: Mania de Churrasco! centralizes its data with Microsoft Azure and saves R$3.5 million in 5 years
executive_summary: Mania de Churrasco! faced the challenge of expanding its units due to the low data visibility offered by its decentralized technology platforms

title: Cathay leverages Microsoft 365 Copilot to move its employees to greater heights
executive_summary: Cathay is a premier travel brand offering flights, holidays, shopping, dining, and wellness. As Hong Kong’s flagship carrier, Cathay Pacific operates a diverse fleet from Hong Kong International Airport, connecting Hong Kong to the world.

title: Grant Thornton looks to the AI-powered capabilities of Dynamics 365 Sales Insights to close new opportunities faster and win more deals
executive_summary: To best serve its clients, Grant Thornton must tie its extensive knowledge of macro-level economic and industry trends to the micro-level business needs, motivations, and challenges faced by individual executives within its client base. The assurance, tax, and advisory firm does this by using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Azure, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator to “connect the macro with the micro” and deliver that information quickly and accurately to geographically distributed team members. Now Grant Thornton is beginning to use AI-powered Dynamics 365 Sales Insights to help take things to the next level. With it, team members can continuously analyze the data they already have to understand the health of client relationships and where new opportunities may lie, take actions based on those insights, close new opportunities faster, and win more deals.

title: IKEA empowers and engages its frontline coworkers with Microsoft Teams to support more great days of serving customers
Czech government makes its citizens’ lives easier with new e-services portal
executive_summary: NAKIT, the Czech Republic’s national agency for communication and information technologies, is a strategic partner of the Czech state that designs innovative solutions in the areas of cybersecurity and specific aspects of network, application, and cloud infrastructure. To facilitate access to more than 80 government e-services, it unveiled a new national online citizen’s portal in June 2018—a major milestone in the digitization of public services in the country. Within a year, the agency architected and implemented the system in the cloud, using a range of Microsoft Azure services, including Azure DevOps and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

title: Invitalia streamlines procurement and distribution of vital medical supplies with Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
executive_summary: Invitalia supervises economic development in Italy, and the government agency took on additional responsibilities during the COVID-19 crisis when the nation’s prime minister asked Invitalia to coordinate the purchase of vital medical equipment on the international market. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Invitalia easily tracked and managed hundreds of suppliers. It quickly identified suppliers with available personal protective equipment (PPE) and coordinated transportation into the country and then out to the more than 1,000 hospitals that needed PPE.

title: Englewood Health migrates to Azure, sees significant boost in app performance
executive_summary: Englewood Health and its more than 3,700 employees—including 1,100 physicians and other medical staff—provides world-class health services at 100-plus locations across New Jersey and New York. Its applications, scattered across more than 600 virtual machines (VMs), deal with a variety of business and healthcare activities—from human resource management (HRM) systems to virtual patient monitoring and diagnostic support, as well as healthcare-only apps that connect the clinical and operational sides. CloudIQ helped Englewood consolidate its fragmented IT architecture in Microsoft Azure to enhance productivity and optimize resources.

title: Egis finds the right match between patients and effective treatments using Azure
executive_summary: Serving patients in 60 countries worldwide, Hungarian pharmaceutical company Egis Pharmaceuticals PLC offers effective, affordable treatments for a broad range of conditions. Seeking to develop more personalized treatment plans for people suffering from rheumatoid arthritis, a life-long disease whose multiple forms require varying treatments, it turned to Azure. Accelerating both the modelling and documentation processes, Egis now benefits from faster and more accurate insights, delivering better treatments to patients for a healthier tomorrow.

title: Kantar uses Azure Machine Learning to help streaming services drive market growth
executive_summary: Kantar Group works with some of the biggest media companies in the world to improve brand awareness, attract more customers, and sustain financial success. Entertainment on Demand, a business unit within Kantar’s Worldpanel Division, wanted to help its marquee entertainment clients better anticipate customer behavior and better understand the propensity of customers to abandon a streaming service. Kantar trained models with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning and its automated machine learning capabilities to analyze behavioral data and profile customers. With new AI-driven insights, Kantar’s clients can make better decisions for the future to boost customer loyalty and increase their revenue.

title: Igloo Software finds better search results more efficiently with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Igloo Software embraces Microsoft Azure Cognitive Search to provide the most relevant human resources information possible to a global network of employees.

title: Investors Bank seamlessly transforms its data center using Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: New Jersey-based Investors Bank (soon to be part of Citizens Financial Group in 2022) has served customers since 1926, and currently has 160 retail branches. When the bank decided to transition its IT infrastructure to the cloud, business continuity was paramount. Their customers’ experiences could not be compromised, and their competitive market position had to be maintained. Investors Bank worked with Microsoft Azure Gold partner Applied Information Sciences to create a strategy that "slowed down to go fast." By taking time to make assessments, line up change champions, and stress-test the migration of their workloads, Investors Bank used Azure VMware Solution to seamlessly migrate its data center to new virtual machines in private clouds.

title: Startup chooses Blazor and Xamarin for full-stack development using C#
executive_summary: The Postage is a startup that helps people plan for end-of-life, so that they can live fully now. Through the company’s use of .NET, including Blazor and Xamarin, its technical team was able to do full-stack development across the web, back-end services, and mobile applications—all using C#. In turn, this has resulted in rapid time to market, a rich user experience, and the ability to continue moving quickly as the company continues to grow.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure API Management, Azure App Service, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL Database, Azure Storage, Bing Maps, Visual Studio, Xamarin

title: Conde de Benalúa transforms harvests with Tipsa and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, cutting finance processes from days to minutes
executive_summary: Founded in 1954, Conde de Benalúa is a Spanish cooperative whose members produce extra virgin olive oil. Its 50 employees manage the 1500-member annual harvest of 34 million kilograms of olives that are pressed, packaged, and shipped around the world. In 2015, the board of directors decided to modernize operations and chose Tipsa, a Microsoft gold partner with extensive experience in automating food and beverage production. Tipsa guided Conde de Benalúa through a migration of accounting processes onto a solution that combined apps built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and Microsoft Power BI. Conde de Benalúa gained a synchronized, end-to-end solution that provides real-time visual data, enabling faster responses to partners and customers.

title: Fineksus was one of the first to adopt Windows 11 as part of its continued approach of innovative technology
executive_summary: An expert in financial messaging and anti money-laundering solutions, Fineksus, continues its growth since inception in 2002, through its Microsoft powered software and service offering. The company recently transitioned to Windows 11 as part of its technology pioneering culture.

title: T-Net fosters community and connection for Trinity College Dublin
executive_summary: Since its opening in 1592, Trinity College Dublin (TCD) has been at the forefront of academic excellence in Ireland. Dublin’s landmark campus is renowned for the collegiate community it has fostered over the years. Today, Trinity continues to place students and staff at the core of day-to-day operations, with the university’s Strategic Plan for 2020-2025 underpinned by the ethos “we will be one Trinity community.” Fostering community and connection are documented pillars of this new plan. To achieve this, Trinity partnered with Storm Technology to implement T-Net, a modern communications platform for the TCD staff powered by Microsoft SharePoint.

title: Smart use of data: Schwäbisch Hall builds on data-driven business models based on Microsoft Azure Services
executive_summary: Auf diese Steine können Sie bauen, or You can build on these bricks, is a slogan associated across Germany with reliability. With these words, credit union Schwäbisch Hall promises not to lose sight of its target groups despite an ever-changing market and to constantly adapt its financing concepts and the way it approaches customers to the needs of the day. The construction financing specialist is strengthening this promise through its company-wide Smart Data & Analytics initiative based on Microsoft Azure. This has already enabled Schwäbisch Hall to start analyzing specific market segments under the strictest security and data protection conditions and is boosting productivity within the lending process.

title: Yapı Kredi bolsters bank security with Edge deployment and Microsoft partnership
executive_summary: Yapı Kredi, one of Türkiye's largest publicly traded banks, needed a new standard browser to deliver superior security and compliance in the heavily regulated Turkish banking industry, while also gaining upgraded speed, manageability, and compatibility. After collaborating with Microsoft to modify certain features, the bank deployed the modern Microsoft Edge to meet its needs and received great user feedback, in addition to improved security and performance.

title: Crayon boosts speed, accuracy of healthcare auditing process using Azure Machine Learning and PyTorch
executive_summary: Healthcare providers need to be able to verify that they’re maintaining the highest operating safety and efficacy standards. Those standards are set by a national accreditation organization whose surveyors, often healthcare professionals themselves, regularly visit facilities and document situations that might need to be corrected or brought back in line with the latest rules and policies. That assessment and accreditation process generates a huge amount of data, and even the most experienced surveyors struggle to keep ahead of the ongoing development of thousands of policy rules that might be relevant in any particular scenario. Vaagan and his team took on the task of fixing the issue by building a machine learning solution that could ingest text from those reports and return a top ten list of the latest associated rules with unprecedented accuracy. They used Azure technology, development tools, and services to bring that solution to fruition. Crayon customers report clear time savings with the new healthcare solution. Just as important, the solution provides consistent responses that aren’t subject to the vagaries of individual interpretation or potentially out-of-date data.

title: Mektebim Koleji facilitated the remote learning via Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Mektebim College adopted Teams to enhance an integrated training platform for its students allowing remote learning during the Pandemic, continuing exams in accordance with the academic calendar and finding an opportunity to work more effectively from anywhere in terms of location with also financial benefits in terms of cost saving. Mektebim Eğitim Kurumları Mektebim is an educational institution that offers its students the opportunity to become a world citizen with the Integrated Education Model and Innovative Education Programs by including the requirements of Industry 4.0 in the education system.

title: Julius Baer empowers software engineers to develop market-leading products with an Azure-based modern developer cloud Platform.
executive_summary: For over a century, Julius Baer has relied upon traditional processes when it came to software development. But after the Swiss wealth management organization saw rapid growth, it was clear that it needed to transform its operations to stay competitive and provide products tailored to its customer base. Due to the flexibility and scalability, Julius Baer chose to implement Microsoft Azure which allowed developers to create and collaborate securely. The cloud technology has proven to provide the level of automation and freedom needed for Julius Baer’s software engineers to build customer-centric products at pace.
products: Azure, Azure API Management

title: Yapı Kredi bolsters bank security with Edge deployment and Microsoft partnership
