executive_summary: Yapı Kredi, one of Türkiye's largest publicly traded banks, needed a new standard browser to deliver superior security and compliance in the heavily regulated Turkish banking industry, while also gaining upgraded speed, manageability, and compatibility. After collaborating with Microsoft to modify certain features, the bank deployed the modern Microsoft Edge to meet its needs and received great user feedback, in addition to improved security and performance.

title: Elekta brings hope to more patients around the world with the promise of AI-powered radiation therapy
executive_summary: Radiotherapy innovator Elekta harnesses AI technologies to help further its mission to bring hope to more cancer patients in more places throughout the world. Elekta AI specialists use the agility and power of on-demand infrastructure and services from Microsoft Azure to develop solutions that help empower clinicians to provide the next generation of personalized cancer treatments with the potential to improve patient treatment. Resulting increases in efficiency and effectiveness will help drive down the disparity between the many who are in need and the relatively few who have access to first-rate radiotherapy treatment.

title: Ai Otsuka with the next-generation AI artist "HUMANOID DJ"! Avex/NAKED and Microsoft opening up new grounds in entertainment
executive_summary: Application of AI technology has been spreading to the entertainment industry. Avex, one of the leading entertainment companies in Japan, and the creative company NAKED, INC. (NAKED) have come together to develop the “HUMANOID DJ”, which incorporates AI technology. HUMANOID DJ is a project in which the AI DJ “LUCY” analyzes audience emotions and connects to equipment, data, and networks to transform itself and spatial aspects to create music that can be experienced only in that place and time. It is a project that gives birth to a new “musical experience” that transcends genres and generations. At the closing session of “Microsoft Japan Digital Days”, held in 2021 by Microsoft Japan, a special live performance was held by the artist Ai Otsuka and the HUMANOID DJ, highlighting the technology’s capabilities.

title: Sandvik uses data, analytics and AI to make mining more sustainable
executive_summary: As one of the largest suppliers of mining equipment in the world, Sandvik is committed to making the mining sector more sustainable with cutting-edge technology. To do this, the company has developed a remote monitoring solution that uses cloud technology, AI and data to keep track of its mining & rock excavation machines. Powered by Microsoft’s Azure cloud and its analytics and AI services, the solution uses data to produce actionable insights into equipment performance and status. All while helping Sandvik to improve the predictive maintenance of the machines it provides, and to drive sustainable transformation across its business.

title: How UH is transforming men’s healthcare and finding 90% time savings with tech-assisted personalization using Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: At University Hospitals (UH), a 30,000-employee health system based in Cleveland, Ohio, a dedicated group of medical professionals is transforming the way men engage in healthcare with a technology-assisted concierge service. UH Cutler Center for Men is piloting a personalized approach to men’s healthcare, centered on health concierges called “Joes.” UH Cutler Center for Men used Microsoft products to develop specialized tools for its health concierges, helping them proactively engage with program members. UH leadership hopes that this combination of technology and personalized care can save lives and close the healthcare gender gap through consistent preventative care, leading to earlier diagnoses and treatment of health conditions.

title: OTELZ has achieved a 40% cost advantage with Microsoft Azure products
executive_summary: Established in 2013, OTELZ has become a notable success story by combining tourism and technology. 41% of OTELZ's customers are foreigners, and the company serves a wide range of customers in numerous languages and currencies. As a result, the technologies used behind the scenes have gained even more importance. By utilizing Microsoft's Azure products, OTELZ has achieved a 40% cost advantage.

title: The Celanese transformation to Digital Plant of the Future
executive_summary: Celanese, a global specialty materials and chemical company, wants to remove the impediments that stand in the way of its people doing their best work—for the company and themselves. It’s well on the way to achieving that goal with its implementation of a “Digital Plant of the Future” vision powered by Cognite Data Fusion® on Microsoft Azure. Manufacturing employees can now spend less time identifying problems and more time solving them.

title: EDP: powering the global energy transition using Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform, AI and IoT technology
executive_summary: Portuguese energy provider EDP is on a mission to drive sustainability in the sector and become net zero by 2040. That begins with data. Over the past few years, the company has been migrating its IT system to the cloud and embracing a data-driven vision that’s allowing it to implement insights-based initiatives across its markets. Fast forward to present day, the organization has now moved on to deploy machine learning, artificial intelligence and IoT technology to make even more of the data and insights it generates. And ultimately get one step closer to making the world less polluted and decarbonized.

title: King Steel powers the global shoe industry’s green transformation with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Taiwanese shoe equipment manufacturer King Steel faced growing customer demands for sustainable and recyclable shoe products from global brands like Nike and Adidas. That’s when CEO Jim Chen started to take the company on a path towards a "transparent supply chain" model, enabling greener practices through leveraging Microsoft's Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability services. These tools enabled seamless digital transition and data collection, fostering innovation and efficiency within the organization. With Dynamics 365 Business Central and Power Platform, employees created applications that accelerated business processes, allowing for a green transformation that both enhanced King Steel's sustainability performance, and also improved operational efficiencies and customer relations.

title: AKOLogic and VGI bring efficiency and sustainability to agriculture with Microsoft
executive_summary: One of the main environmental concerns in agriculture is the fact that the sector is a leading contributor to the rise of CO2 levels in the atmosphere. Traditional crop production practices often rely on artificial chemicals that can harm the environment, cause land degradation, and damage ecosystems. But the State of Israel, a world leader in agriculture and water management, is committed to making the industry more sustainable. By collaborating with the Microsoft Israeli Development Center, Israeli organizations like AKOLogic and VGI are bringing technological innovation and sustainability to farming.

title: Solutions you can bank on: Recording Insights for the financial sector—ASC Technologies offers regulation-compliant documentation in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Investment consultations are recorded as a matter of course, as stipulated by finance laws and policy regulations such as MiFID II in Europe, the FCA rules in the UK, and the Dodd-Frank Act in the US. This means that around the world, millions of consultation recordings have to be stored, secured, and analyzed in compliance with legal provisions—otherwise, financial institutions could receive hefty fines or even lose their banking license. For online consultations that take place on Microsoft Teams, ASC Technologies AG developed its Recording Insights digital solution. Where once only spot checks were possible, an artificial intelligence (AI) named the Compliance Policy Engine makes it possible to evaluate 100 percent of recordings, simplifying compliance with legal requirements. As an expert in compliance recording for highly regulated sectors, ASC relies on Azure Cognitive Services and integration into the Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services.

title: SEGES Innovation drives sustainable transformation in agriculture using AI and a new data science vision
executive_summary: Leading agricultural knowledge and innovation center in Denmark SEGES Innovation has one mission: to put farmers and food companies at the forefront of sustainable and innovative agriculture. To do this, the company is applying machine learning to develop models and software tailored to the needs of the farmers and partners it serves. The project has proved so successful that SEGES decided to take it to the next level –adopting a new machine learning operations (MLOps) platform that’s abstracting away repeatable tasks and unlocking more dynamic analysis, training and deployment at scale. It is all taking SEGES one step closer to its global goal: enabling sustainable farming in Denmark and beyond.

title: TomTom brings AI-powered, talking cars to life with Azure
executive_summary: TomTom changed how drivers reached their destinations with its navigation solution and has recognized that today’s drivers want more than the best route. Therefore, TomTom created Digital Cockpit, an immersive in-car infotainment system. Automobile manufacturers can customize it to the look and feel of their brand, cutting costs by up to 80% with a more efficient, sustainable approach. TomTom is using Azure OpenAI Service, Azure Cosmos DB, and Azure Kubernetes Service for seamless control and conversations by the drivers.

title: Serving customers 78% faster: VOCALLS’ voicebots supercharge call handing with Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: VOCALLS, a Prague and London-based pioneer, is reshaping customer service with its AI-powered voicebots. Relying on Microsoft Azure AI technologies, VOCALLS automates over 50 million interactions per year. Its happy customer, Estafeta, has seen myriad benefits: a 78% reduction in average handling time aside from a 120% increase in answered calls. Today, Estafeta’s customers receive immediate support instead of a 10-minute wait, leading to stellar customer satisfaction scores.

title: A dash of speed and agility: Tiryaki Agro transforms operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Tiryaki Agro, a leading agricultural products supply chain company worldwide, has been dedicated to providing healthy, reliable, and sustainable agricultural products since 1965. Confronted with the limitations of its legacy ERP system, Tiryaki Agro shifted to Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain. This move enhanced system responsiveness and streamlined reporting, enabling Tiryaki Agro to speed up its operations. Today, generating 12-month financial reports takes 30 minutes instead of a full day. Tiryaki’s team can collaborate on the fly, rely on more transparent and holistic financial data, and cut infrastructure costs.

title: ICONICS delivers facilities optimization and new sustainability reporting with Microsoft Sustainability Manager
executive_summary: Sustainability is the responsibility of every organization and individual, and now it’s easier to help save valuable resources and achieve building management cost-efficiencies. With ICONICS Azure-based solutions, companies around the world are realizing 10-20% savings of their total energy costs.

title: King Steel powers the global shoe industry’s green transformation with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Taiwanese shoe equipment manufacturer King Steel faced growing customer demands for sustainable and recyclable shoe products from global brands like Nike and Adidas. That’s when CEO Jim Chen started to take the company on a path towards a "transparent supply chain" model, enabling greener practices through leveraging Microsoft's Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability services. These tools enabled seamless digital transition and data collection, fostering innovation and efficiency within the organization. With Dynamics 365 Business Central and Power Platform, employees created applications that accelerated business processes, allowing for a green transformation that both enhanced King Steel's sustainability performance, and also improved operational efficiencies and customer relations.

title: Hartmann’s uses Dynamics 365 Business Central to artfully improve operations
executive_summary: Hartmann’s is dedicated to using responsibly sourced materials in the production of fine jewelry. As the store focuses on bespoke creations, it needs to meticulously track every stone used in its jewelry. Previously, the company used manual processes to track everything from sourcing materials to production and sales. Wanting to move to a unified ERP system to improve efficiency and access accurate real-time data, the company chose to migrate to Dynamics 365 Business Central. The move has given Hartmann’s an integrated point-of-sale system, detailed production and inventory management, customer management, and access to real-time data, with a 75 percent reduction in time spent on manual processes. Employees have embraced the new system and benefit from customer visibility and simplified processes, showing the power of Business Central as a solution for artisans without extensive IT backgrounds.

title: Pangaea Data and Microsoft Azure optimize patient care with the help of AI
executive_summary: Millions of patients across 7,000 hard-to-diagnose conditions remain undiagnosed, for example, up to 90% of patients with Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) are currently undiagnosed. This results in poor outcomes, heightened costs and inefficiencies across healthcare and pharmaceuticals. Both industries have tried applying AI to resolve this, but due to privacy regulations, they are limited to collaborating on ad-hoc projects with de-identified datasets, which does not help find such missed patients and treat them at scale. With the help of Microsoft Azure, Pangaea Data built a scalable AI-powered product platform to discover such missed patients and connect to them. For instance, Pangaea Data worked with two global pharmaceuticals and the UK’s National Health Service (NHS) to find 6x more (200,000) undiagnosed and miscoded cachectic cancer patients for therapies and trials, which led to improved outcomes for patients, halving treatment costs for the NHS (saving £1 billion) and a six-fold increase in revenue for the pharmaceutical sponsors.

title: Volvo Group streamlines invoice and claims processing with Azure AI and AI Document Intelligence
executive_summary: Known for its innovation in support of both employees and customers, Volvo Group, a leading manufacturer of trucks, buses, construction equipment, and industrial engines, wanted to help its workers by streamlining invoice and claims document processing. It particularly needed the ability to extract data from images, like photographs and stamps, and to translate documents from and to multiple languages. With Microsoft Azure as its enterprise cloud solution, Volvo Group chose to create a solution using Microsoft Azure AI services and AI Document Intelligence. After a six-week pilot and four-month production timeline, Volvo Group launched a solution that simplifies document processing and meets the objectives of data extraction from images and translation. Now the solution has saved Volvo Group more than 10,000 manual hours.

title: Element uses Dynamics 365 Customer Insights and AI to discover selling opportunities and drive customer retention
executive_summary: Element Materials Technology (Element) is a leading global provider of Testing, Inspection, Certification, and Calibration (TIC) services with roots going back to 1827. They are working to make tomorrow safer than today across a diverse set of end markets where failure is simply not an option. With headquarters in London and a global network of more than 270 laboratories in 30 countries, Element’s 9,000 scientists, engineers, and technologists support customers from early R&D through complex regulatory approvals and into production—ensuring that their products, materials, processes, and services are safe, compliant, and fit for purpose.

title: King Price Insurance refines operations using Alula Technologies’ Life Policy Administration System powered by Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: In less than a decade, King Price Insurance has disrupted the South African short-term insurance landscape by offering decreasing premiums and is looking to do the same in the life insurance space. Committed to meeting customers’ expectations, it wanted to further enhance efficiency and customer experience. It recently acquired Stangen, a life insurance provider and long-term user of Alula Technologies’ Life Policy Administration System (Exergy). Realizing the benefits of cloud, King Price Insurance chose to continue the partnership with Alula Technologies and use the Alula Life Policy Administration System built on Microsoft Azure, to modernize policy administration, claims, billing, underwriting, and more. The results are a set of digital portals that let staff and customers handle transactions efficiently and securely, while enabling continuous opportunities for the insurer through digital solutions.

title: hubergroup achieves operational excellence in 150 locations with a unified Microsoft solution
executive_summary: hubergroup is one of the world’s leading specialists for solutions and technologies in chemical and printing inks. It provides high-quality products for packaging, newspaper and commercial printing, and chemical products such as PU resins and UV oligomers. With a legacy of over 255 years, hubergroup develops innovative products for the printing and packaging industry, the paint and coating industry, and the chemical sector.

title: OMERS builds a data delivery platform in 20 percent of the typical time, unlocking self-service analytics using Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: OMERS Administration Corporation (OMERS) is a Canadian pension plan with 560,000 members and more than C$124 billion in net assets as of December 31, 2022. As an organization that regularly uses multiple apps, OMERS needed a unified solution that would bring together near-real-time insights from information stored across apps. A Fusion Team created an integrated cloud data and analytics solution with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power BI to implement a finance data strategy and reduce manual analysis. This solution now serves as a blueprint for scaling across the enterprise, supporting a finance transformation toward data-based decision-making at all levels in the organization.

title: Appeal after just one prompt: DATEV counteracts shortage of trained tax accountants with AI tools based on Azure
executive_summary: “Please check this tax assessment and submit an appeal if necessary.” One simple prompt and the automated appeal generator gets the job done. AI solutions like this lighten the workload for tax accounting firms—and the DATEV AI Workshop is where they are created. Based on Azure OpenAI Service, this platform solution develops artificial intelligence for the tax accounting profession.

title: ServiceTitan gives customers a second chance to capture leads with Microsoft Azure AI
executive_summary: ServiceTitan builds solutions to help commercial and residential contractors optimize their businesses. It built a generative AI tool for its Titan Intelligence suite called, “Second Chance Leads,” which evaluates unreviewed and rejected sales leads to uncover missed opportunities. ServiceTitan used Microsoft Azure AI to build it, citing a need for a fast, powerful, and secure platform.

title: CCC Group bridges 800 global stores, saving 300,000 hours annually on operations with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Facing the challenging task of managing communications across 800 retail stores and 20 markets, CCC Group tackled it by adopting Microsoft Teams. By centralizing its communication and task management on Teams, the company enhanced internal dialogue, saving USD 500,000-worth of printing paper and 300,000 hours annually, freeing staff up for more responsive customer service. By expanding access to corporate insights, staff feedback, and Power BI reports, it enabled informed decision-making.

title: Rajah & Tann paves the way for AI in the legal industry with Crayon and Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: As one of Singapore’s largest law firms, Rajah & Tann is a leader in innovation, pioneering the adoption and implementation of emerging technologies that continue to shape and reshape legal workflows. With an esteemed reputation and operations stretching across 10 countries, the firm found itself under mounting pressure to oversee a growing number of cases, while delivering at the same speed and level of quality for which they are known.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365

title: MediaValet minimizes The Jane Goodall Institute’s carbon footprint with the help of Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: ​​Symend enriches customer communications, stands up new regions in two weeks on Azure​
executive_summary: Canadian company Symend entered the market wanting to reimagine digital interactions between companies and their customers, pioneering a more empathetic approach to customer turnover and delinquency. The company’s Microsoft Azure–backed engagement platform combines behavioral science with Azure AI and machine learning services to increase personalized and productive engagement to drive better outcomes with fewer outreach attempts that boosts customer loyalty. Symend benefits from the global reach of Azure, standing up new regional instances in less than two weeks without needing to rearchitect infrastructure. Telecommunications clients have seen fivefold click-through rate increases on customer outreach.

title: Goodwill of Orange County grows revenue, employs more people with e-commerce app using Azure AI services
executive_summary: To expand the pool of people ShopGoodwill.com can employ, and to grow revenue used for its mission, Goodwill of Orange County developed an AI-powered app. The solution uses Azure AI capabilities to identify an item of clothing and extract information from photos of labels; it then creates a listing description using generative AI. The app means more people—including those with developmental, intellectual, and physical disabilities—will be able to work in unfilled e-commerce positions, and more clothing will avoid the landfill.

title: Ministry of Economy implements Dynamics 365 to increase placement rate by the national employment system
executive_summary: In collaboration with Microsoft, the Ministry of Economy was able to work on the goal of worker placement through Sine, with the purpose of improving profiling and creating a more assertive algorithm for worker placement. With Azure support and a Dynamics 365-centric solution, the federal government agency also strengthened its process with the Worker School 4.0, an initiative made in collaboration with Microsoft to promote professional qualification and insertion.

title: Saphyre helps institutions be ready to trade 300–500% faster with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Saphyre, a fintech company, uses Microsoft Azure to provide an intelligent cloud-based solution that automates and streamlines financial trading workflows around client and counterparty life cycle management. Using Azure, Saphyre transformed outdated and time-consuming processes burdened by email and faxes, including account onboarding and maintenance and trade exception handling. Saphyre uses AI, automation, and networking to save time and effort in pre-trade, make T+1 compliance possible, support efficient information and document management, and secure counterparty collaboration. It also reduces post-trade settlement issues and customers’ manual efforts by 75%, helping clients to be ready to trade up to five times faster.

title: Esri helps cities gain key climate science insights using geospatial data, AI, Azure
executive_summary: Cities can use the ArcGIS geospatial platform to create environmental digital twins that simulate heavy rainfall and apply hot spot analysis to highlight flooding. These insights help local government and public safety staff better understand potential community impacts.

title: Gojob augments recruiters with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Specializing in temporary work recruitment, Gojob is banking on generative AI to transform the daily work of its recruiters and speed up the jobseeker hiring process.
products: Azure OpenAI Service

title: SC Ventures & INSEAD: Introducing personalized corporate training with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: SC Ventures, Standard Chartered’s innovation, fintech investment and ventures arm, sought to address the challenges of upskilling an evolving workforce that is being shaped by remote work and shifting demographics.

title: Lloyds Banking Group enhances the customer experience with Microsoft Power Apps
executive_summary: Lloyds Banking Group aimed to improve communication with non-English speaking customers.

title: V-ICT-OR delivers innovative Flemish government services with Azure Container Apps
executive_summary: V-ICT-OR, a consortium of municipalities in Belgium’s Flanders Region, provides digital technologies to its member agencies. The organization decided to containerize its monolithic app infrastructure to increase agility and enable growth.

title: Evri boosts customer experience while saving £1.65 million annually with Power Platform
executive_summary: Evri, the UK’s largest parcel delivery company, faced significant challenges in managing high demand during peak seasons due to predominantly manual customer service processes.

title: Mitie transforms data management and enables AI-driven insights with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Increased customer demand for efficiency meant Mitie required an innovative platform to streamline its data processes and support predictive services in facilities management.

title: Continental relies on Microsoft Azure AI: A game changer in R&D requirements management
executive_summary: At Continental’s Automotive division, a customer project in the User Experience Business Area has up to 30,000 user experience requirements that need to be manually evaluated, checked, implemented, and tested.

executive_summary: ABB’s IoT and AI suite, ABB Ability™ Genix, gave customers insight into manufacturing and operations status. But extracting those insights required advanced skills.

title: Emirates Global Aluminium unlocks public and private cloud, industrial AI with Azure Local
executive_summary: In its mission to innovate aluminium to make modern life possible, Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) needs sustainable, scalable computing infrastructure that its on-premises environment struggled to deliver.

title: PointClickCare uses Azure to empower healthcare innovation and improve patient care
executive_summary: Medical documentation is complex—incomplete patient data puts providers and patients at risk. Patient documentation quality is also at an all-time low, and providers need support. The healthcare industry is experiencing historically low staffing.

title: eClinicalWorks empowers thousands of practitioners to reduce hours spent on paperwork with Azure AI Document Intelligence
executive_summary: Healthcare technology provider eClinicalWorks sought to improve efficiency and cut time spent for healthcare workers who had to go through thousands of faxes each year to match the faxed data with current patient files.
products: Azure, Azure AI Document Intelligence, Azure AI Services

title: Bradesco achieves +80% resolution rate integrating Azure generative AI into BIA
executive_summary: Bradesco Bank, one of the largest financial organizations in Brazil, was looking to enhance its virtual assistant, BIA, with Microsoft Azure’s generative AI in order to improve its efficiency and resolution capacity.

title: A move to Azure speeds AI innovation for Recordsure
executive_summary: Recordsure develops AI-powered RegTech solutions for clients in the financial services, regulated industries and public sector.

title: OpenAI transforms AI model development with Azure Blob Storage
executive_summary: As the size and complexity of AI models grow, so do the requirements for storage, especially on throughput scale and reliability. For that reason, OpenAI, renowned for developing conversational AI products like ChatGPT, relies on Microsoft Azure Blob Storage and newly enhanced scaled accounts to underpin its vast data and training workflows.

executive_summary: In its mission to innovate aluminium to make modern life possible, Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) needs sustainable, scalable computing infrastructure that its on-premises environment struggled to deliver.

title: Transforming banking with data analytics: Members 1st Federal Credit Union reduces model run time by 89% with 3Cloud and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Members 1st Federal Credit Union (Members 1st) was eager to use its vast data footprint to offer its members a more personalized experience and inform business decision-making with a data analytics solution.

title: COODE for increased efficiency: Uniper turns employee ideas into solutions with Azure
executive_summary: Uniper's COO aims to transform their energy portfolio through digitalization. But the unique nature of each technology makes this difficult. Tailored digital solutions are needed to increase efficiency across the life cycle of physical assets.

title: OpenAI transforms AI model development with Azure Blob Storage
executive_summary: As the size and complexity of AI models grow, so do the requirements for storage, especially on throughput scale and reliability. For that reason, OpenAI, renowned for developing conversational AI products like ChatGPT, relies on Microsoft Azure Blob Storage and newly enhanced scaled accounts to underpin its vast data and training workflows.

title: Holland America Line sees signs of more informed purchasing with Copilot Studio agent
executive_summary: Holland America Line wanted to provide even faster, more personalized support for customers—without driving up contact center volumes or running a traditional chatbot.

title: If P&C Insurance protects business-critical data with Microsoft 365 Backup
executive_summary: If P&C Insurance looked to boost operational resilience with a Microsoft-native backup solution that could improve recovery and support long-term protection.

title: FPT Software pioneers AI adoption with Microsoft 365 Copilot to increase customer engagement and leads
executive_summary: FPT Software, a subsidiary of FPT Corporation and a global IT services provider, wants to achieve purposeful growth. It sought to improve efficiency while equipping its workforce with AI skills and expertise so they could guide clients on their own AI journeys.

title: Nestlé innovates its SAP landscape using RISE with SAP on Azure to be future-ready
executive_summary: Nestlé undertook an ambitious digital transformation, migrating from six aging, regionally distributed on-premise datacenters to a future-ready cloud platform, accelerating business agility and innovation.

title: baseVISION AG optimizes the use of AI with Microsoft Copilot and Microsoft Purview
executive_summary: baseVISION wanted to put the company’s growing use of AI on a secure footing. It wanted to maintain central control and ensure efficient design to combine data protection with productivity.

title: Connecting with 500 million passionate fans worldwide
executive_summary: With 500 million fans worldwide, the Real Madrid Football Club is among the world’s top sports franchises. But with just a small fraction of those fans in Spain, it needed a way to connect with them—wherever they are in the world—and support their club passion. To accomplish that goal, Real Madrid engaged a Microsoft Services team for help in envisioning, developing, and deploying a global digital sports platform that was built using a wide range of Microsoft cloud services. It takes advantage of the global footprint of Microsoft cloud services to consistently deliver the very best fan experience anywhere in the world. Real Madrid can now engage one-on-one with fans, implement targeted promotional campaigns, and use data to track and analyze fan behaviors, among many other capabilities. Today, club officials report digital revenue growth of 30 percent and could not be more positive about the club’s digital future.

title: Daimler entrusts SAP HANA–based global procurement system to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Daimler AG is digitally transforming its business, from vehicle design to core business systems, using the cloud. In a milestone project, Daimler replaced its companywide procurement system—used to manage 400,000 global suppliers—with a software as a service system running in Microsoft Azure. The new system, which involves the SAP S/4HANA database, SAP Supplier Relationship Management on HANA, and the Icertis Contract Management platform, was operational in just three months, can be updated daily, and costs 50 percent less than the previous system.

title: Community healthcare provider safeguards key system and cuts costs with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: With hospitals, labs, clinics, and hospices across greater Portland, Oregon, Legacy Health is on a mission to provide comprehensive community healthcare. Achieving this goal requires always-on access to the electronic medical record (EMR), but user error, system malfunction, and a tectonic fault running right through the heart of Portland all posed threats to availability. In response, the healthcare system moved disaster recovery for its EMR system to Microsoft Azure and the EMR system itself to a hybrid live environment—improving reliability and availability, reducing costs by 65 percent, and enhancing patient care.

title: Mitie provides facility management of the future with AI, ML and IoT technology in the Azure cloud
executive_summary: Mitie is the number one facilities management company in the UK, employing 50,000 people and supporting services through which about 5 million people a day pass through.
products: Azure IoT Hub, Azure Internet of Things, Azure Machine Learning

title: AkzoNobel: Bring on the color revolution
executive_summary: AkzoNobel is active in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 34,500 talented people with a passion for color. The Dutch paint and coatings company owns household brands like Dulux and Sikkens, so it’s important that AkzoNobel stay on the cutting edge of color trends—which means ensuring the company’s process of color prediction can meet modern demands. Machine learning technology and AI, powered by Microsoft Azure, has helped the company do just that. Now, scientists at AkzoNobel can predict color more quickly and accurately, revolutionizing the way they work.

title: Swisscom uses Azure to drive innovation, market leadership with multilingual voice assistant
executive_summary: Although voice assistants are increasingly common on our smart devices, Switzerland’s largest telco, Swisscom, wanted to create more engaging customer experiences by building a voice assistant that uniquely represents its brand. Using the Speech service, part of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services, Swisscom has given its customers access to an intelligent, multilingual voice assistant, helping improve the customer experience and accelerate its own digital transformation.

title: Story collection: Explore how WBA uses Azure to better serve customers
executive_summary: Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) operates several well-known retail pharmacy chains, including Walgreens, Boots, Duane Reade, and select Rite Aid stores, and it has affiliated stores in more than 25 countries. WBA touches the lives of millions of people every day, and the company strives to help every customer be healthier and happier.

title: Vodafone transforms its customer care strategy with digital assistant built on Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: Primarily known as a global telecommunications company, Vodafone is expanding its digital strategy into other technology sectors. As one step in its digital transformation, Vodafone used Microsoft Azure services to develop a personable digital assistant named TOBi. Working closely with Microsoft, Vodafone customized this bot for its needs and expanded it to multiple markets in 15 languages. Vodafone South Africa jumped at the potential to further optimize TOBi with conversational language understanding, investigating it in private preview. The team’s experience with the sophisticated multilingual capabilities in conversational language understanding has shown how using this new feature can help Vodafone get to market faster in more languages and support customers even better with more accurate conversations—and lower development costs. Through TOBi, Vodafone provides fast, relevant, and engaging customer support that increases customer satisfaction and helps reduce its operational costs.

title: MacDonald-Miller drives sustainable smart-hospital solutions using Microsoft Power BI
executive_summary: MacDonald-Miller Facility Solutions is a Seattle-based design-build contractor that makes buildings more sustainable and energy efficient. MacDonald-Miller partnered with Swedish Medical Center to implement Fault Detection and Diagnostics (FDD) at three of its hospital campuses. By using a customized ICONICS platform together with Microsoft Power BI, MacDonald-Miller saved the healthcare network $350,000 during the first 12 months.

title: Tunisian training agency improves data visibility with EDLIGO and Microsoft products
executive_summary: The Ministry of Vocational Training and Employment in Tunis, Tunisia, wanted greater visibility on its training efforts through the Microsoft Imagine Academy's certification programs. The agency worked with EDUCATION4SIGHT, which implemented its EDLIGO analytics and AI platform. EDLIGO uses Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Power BI, and Office 365 for user authentication, cloud storage, machine learning, dashboards, and more. With EDLIGO, the agency quickly improved the monitoring of the program and was able to deliver more detailed training data to government decision makers.

title: Global Travel Collection to reclaim 1.5M advisor hours with Azure AI Foundry and Copilot Studio
executive_summary: Global Travel Collection advisors typically use 10 or more resources to plan and book customized travel experiences for their clients. The friction from manual navigation of travel data meant advisors spent six to eight hours on each itinerary.

title: NBA transforms basketball fandom with Azure OpenAI Service giving game insights
executive_summary: Focused on its fans, the NBA began exploring new technologies to enhance the fan experience, wanting to harness data to provide insights behind all the great moments in every game.

title: Polish e-retailer, x-kom, uplevels service quality using Dynamics 365
executive_summary: x-kom is an established retail and e-commerce group in Poland known to clients for its three online stores—Combat, al.to, and x-kom. Since 2002, the group has continuously leveraged technology solutions that efficiently cover clients’ ordering and delivery needs. To keep up with a fast-paced market, x-kom decided to streamline operations by moving to the cloud. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations, it built an omnichannel platform for its marketplaces and delivery partners. As a result, it improved its delivery promise and boosted its level of service.

title: Intertek-PSI lifts and shifts complex IBM Power workloads to Azure using Skytap
executive_summary: Quality and reliability are key to Intertek-PSI’s business ethos. The nationally recognized consulting, engineering, and testing firm found itself in a quandary when its service provider of many years discontinued support for IBM Power Systems because of escalating costs. Intertek-PSI needed to rapidly lift and shift its Power-based ERP and other critical business applications into the cloud with minimal downtime and without impacting users or increasing costs. Applying the same lens of quality and reliability, Intertek-PSI picked Skytap on Microsoft Azure and successfully migrated four logical partitions (LPARs), more than forty x86 virtual machines (VMs) and 29 terabytes of data in just three months. It did all this without impacting users or rewriting applications. The transition has been a success as the new cloud environment offers increased performance, reliability, and disaster recovery capabilities at the same or lower cost.

title: ZF Group selects Microsoft Teams to streamline communications for 110,000 frontline and office workers
executive_summary: ZF Group is one of the world’s largest automotive technology suppliers with more than 150,000 employees. When the company acquired TRW, another global automotive supplier, a complex integration between different communications systems was required. To help streamline communications, ZF Group deployed Microsoft Teams and is also moving to Teams Phone for calling.

title: Polish residential real estate developer has centralized customer data and doubled operational efficiency with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Warsaw-based Unidevelopment has over 13 years of experience in the Polish residential real estate market. As it grew, the company needed to replace its on-premises operational system to better serve its clients and speed up business-related processes. With the help of partner OneDynamics, the company adopted Dynamics 365 Sales cloud solution. Unidevelopment now has easy access to its centralized data from anywhere and can manage operations anytime, without compromising its core values—quality, professionalism, and safety.

title: Unforgettable virtual events with the MAKONIS streaming platform – based on Azure Media Services
executive_summary: Tightly packed music fans losing themselves to the beat of their favorite band. Conference attendees in huge halls hanging on the speakers’ every word. Colleagues standing around a whiteboard tweaking the corporate strategy. The COVID - 19 health crisis put a sudden stop to all of this. Looking to provide a solution here, MAKONIS developed the Streamboxy event platform in record time – based on Azure. An event solution that will remain relevant for a long time to come.

title: State Fish and Wildlife department modernizes services for a more sustainable flow of work with Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife (WDFW) preserves, protects, and perpetuates the state’s fish, wildlife, and ecosystems while providing sustainable fish and wildlife recreational and commercial opportunities across the state of Washington. The agency provides core services with a distributed workforce of 2,200 frontline field biologists, enforcement agents, support staff, and agency officials operating in six regions across the state. COVID-19 challenged the agency to speed up its modernization roadmap by embracing remote government solutions. In response to COVID-19 safety guidelines, WDFW Information Technology Services (ITS) engaged with Microsoft and standardized around core Microsoft 365 solutions.

title: North Carolina Plant Sciences Initiative accelerates agricultural research with Azure and IoT
executive_summary: The data-driven North Carolina Plant Sciences Initiative (N.C. PSI), an agricultural research initiative based at North Carolina State University, is using faster and more efficient data management to tackle some of agriculture’s biggest challenges. Working with Microsoft Azure and SAS Analytics, the N.C. PSI has equipped its research teams to address global challenges such as climate change, rapid population growth, and emerging crop diseases and pests. The N.C. PSI draws on the expertise of professionals in fields outside of agriculture—from engineers and meteorologists to social scientists and economists—as it works to speed up agricultural innovations and breakthroughs that will have a positive social impact.

title: T-Mobile adopts Microsoft Power Platform for fast and powerful low-code development
executive_summary: One of the largest wireless carriers in the United States, T-Mobile always seeks to improve its business processes and gain greater insight into operations. With low-code development using Microsoft Power Platform, T-Mobile employees from all different backgrounds—computer science experts to coding novices—now develop solutions themselves that help the company with everything from device promotion approvals to store closure management in response to COVID-19. T-Mobile has a thriving internal Microsoft Power Platform community and is creating a T-Mobile Center of Excellence to promote further low-code development.

title: Sphera generates SaaS insights and allure with Java EE apps on Azure
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Microsoft helps Robert Walters create a modern workplace for a mobile workforce
executive_summary: The Robert Walters Group is a specialist professional recruitment business that operates on a global basis. It helps businesses find the very best professionals and supports professionals and executives develop their careers in a diverse range of markets worldwide. The business has grown rapidly since its establishment in 1985 – in part, by harnessing the best tools and technologies to support its people.

title: Clemson University and Microsoft partner to pilot Surface and Teams to enhance student success and promote community-based engagement
executive_summary: With a goal to enhance student learning outcomes and promote broader engagement amongst student communities, Clemson University teamed up with Microsoft to pilot the use of Surface devices equipped with LTE and Microsoft Teams.

title: FLSmidth transcends on-premises limitations with Azure high-performance computing
executive_summary: Innovation is the lifeblood of Danish engineering company FLSmidth, which relies on globally dispersed teams serving cement and mining clients around the world. With its digital transformation, FLSmidth found the perfect vehicle for optimizing the engineering simulation platforms that depend on high-performance computing. The company adopted the UberCloud Engineering Simulation Platform, based on Microsoft Azure, powered by Intel® Xeon® Scalable processors, and optimized for leading engineering applications. UberCloud and Microsoft collaborated with a blended FLSmidth team, bringing the company’s engineering teams the performance and collaboration gains they need for continuing success.
products: Azure, Azure CycleCloud, Azure Files, Azure HPC, Azure NetApp Files

title: Protecting Times China’s information security with Microsoft 365 enterprise–level cloud-native security services
executive_summary: Adhering to its core values of “love, commitment and creation", Times China Holdings Limited is dedicated to becoming a Fortune 500 company, providing better products and services to its customers, creating greater returns for shareholders, and enabling more people to achieve their aspirations in life. Times China is a pioneer in combining real estate and art in China, giving careful consideration to the relationship between architecture and living, along with the arts and humanities in a broader sense. With the unique positioning of a “lifestyle artist,” the company has been the first to bring national art museums and art salons into communities, integrating art and everyday life, and promoting the development of culture and art in society, while at the same time opening up a new vision for its own development.

title: St. Luke’s University Health Network transforms patient care with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Dutch Food producer, Aviko, creates a high-availability cloud setup to support 24-hour operations
executive_summary: As one of Europe’s leading producers of potato products, Aviko needs to maintain an efficient production line, from farm to factory to shipping around the world. To further optimize operations, Aviko implemented a new SAP Extended Warehouse Management (SAP EWM) system to remotely automate its cold storage warehouses. As a data-driven solution, the SAP EWM calculates the optimum way to store products and also communicates orders to over 30 automated robots, cutting the downtime between deliveries. This level of digital transformation required an entirely new IT infrastructure and a high-availability setup that could only be achieved by migrating to the cloud.

title: Leading Slovenian insurer, Zavarovalnica Triglav, shifts 2,200 staff to Microsoft 365 Enterprise Voice in Teams
executive_summary: Founded more than 120 years ago, Zavarovalnica Triglav is one of  Slovenia’s leading insurers. Needing a unified, more secure digital communications hub to support its workforce, as well as more advanced compliance capabilities, Triglav chose to move to Microsoft 365. To further enhance its customer experience, and simplify analytics, the company implemented Microsoft 365 Enterprise Voice in Teams. By integrating the solution with its public telephony system, the company enabled its staff to benefit from seamless calling, call forwarding, and a single authorization and access interface to facilitate user access anywhere.

title: Nokia Mobile Networks builds its Digital Care Management Platform on Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Nokia Mobile Networks is a division of Nokia, a global telecommunications and electronics company based in Finland. Technical Support Service (TSS) provides technical support for Mobile Networks customers around the world. Microsoft Power Platform has been used to digitize and automate Care Program Management (CAPM)–related processes and tasks.

title: Millennium bcp reimagines communications in the Portuguese financial sector
executive_summary: Millennium bcp, the largest private bank in Portugal, has a reputation for using technology to provide a better customer experience and streamline internal operations. So, when the COVID-19 pandemic forced employees to work remotely, the bank began to look for innovative ways to maintain business continuity. The bank created a studio inside its headquarters and deployed Microsoft Teams Live Events so it could host a range of events from conferences to webinars. Millennium bcp managed to bring its customers, employees and other relevant stakeholders closer to the bank and has opened the doors to a whole new world of digital communication for the Portuguese financial sector.

title: Sulawesi’s Sinjai region leads the way in connected education
executive_summary:
The Regent of Sinjai has grand plans for his province on the relatively remote Indonesian island of Sulawesi. The region is rich in natural resources, and he wants to ensure the more than 250 thousand people living there will benefit from these resources. To achieve this goal, he needs a competent workforce, which is why he launched an ambitious digital transformation program that started with the education sector.
Working closely together, the Sinjai Regional Office of Education (ROE) and Microsoft Indonesia deployed Microsoft Education collaboration and communication tools throughout schools and colleges to revolutionize the way students are taught.
The solution provided simple, highly secure access to online classrooms for students of all ages, while relying on Microsoft Teams for collaboration and to deliver a familiar, easy-to-use remote learning experience.

title: Banishing barriers: Heidekreis-Klinikum bypasses railroad crossing with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: One hospital, two sites: located in the district of Heidekreis, Germany, Heidekreis-Klinikum gGmbH is unique in that it’s split between two sites: Soltau and Walsrode. A new, consolidated hospital is currently being planned, which will put both sites under one roof in the next few years. Until then, however, the distance between the two buildings remains—a stretch that has long been the cause of frustrating travel times and aggravating costs. Heidekreis-Klinikum chose to integrate a digital bypass into the transformation process—with cloud services and the Microsoft Teams collaboration platform.

title: Mailmodo relies on Azure to bolster its email marketing platform
executive_summary: Mailmodo is an email marketing platform that helps businesses create and send interactive emails, embedding forms and widgets such as calendars, shopping carts, NPS surveys within them. It is bringing Web 2.0-like features to emails, so that users can interact within the email itself, without going through numerous redirections. This reduces attrition and increases conversion, benefitting marketers.

title: Best-Hall charts efficiency via quick implementation of a modern analytics solution with Islet’s Data Platform Kickstart and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Based in Finland, Best-Hall Oy specializes in designing and constructing hall buildings for logistics, warehousing, production-related industries, sporting activities, and other uses. Struggling with manual processes built on disconnected Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, Best-Hall needed to develop a modern solution for data utilization and take information management to a level that served the growing organization and its customers. Best-Hall engaged a data platform kickstart consultation with Islet Group Oy, which is an expert in combining organizations, technology, and people into successful analytics, and realized Islet was the right partner for the project. In six weeks, Islet implemented a technical solution including extensive visualization packages that met Best-Hall’s future needs and generated immediate business benefits for communication and customer responsiveness.

title: Zscaler Digital Experience helps millions of remote workers resolve productivity roadblocks in real time with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Zscaler’s mission is helping companies around the world transform their network and security infrastructure—making work simpler, faster and more productive. To bring its newest employee experience monitoring service—the Zscaler Digital Experience (ZDX)—to life, the Zscaler team uses Azure Data Explorer as the analytics engine. Thanks to instant scalability, seamless product integrations with Zscaler’s global infrastructure and real-time data insights, Zscaler is now making a productive work-from-anywhere experience a reality for millions of users every year.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer

title: Flexibility and freedom in a secure framework
executive_summary: With migration from on-premise to the cloud and device management via MS Intune, it was possible to rebuild the entire IT infrastructure at Rubble Master in a short period of time. Quite a lot has changed as a result. The data and infrastructure are more secure thanks to the cloud solution. Device management via MS Intune provides a secure framework for the use of mobile devices without restricting the freedom of employees too much. Various processes have been automated, significantly reducing the workload for IT. Collaboration with Axians is ongoing as there are further ideas and projects in the pipeline.

title: BSi Steel sees 20% growth thanks to digital transformation with KAISPE and Microsoft products
executive_summary: BSi Steel Pty Ltd is a leading steel merchant and supplier in South Africa with multiple entities across the African continent. It was looking to adopt modern business solutions to enhance and optimize various processes, formalize consistent master data, improve sales process productivity, and standardize item costing, all while keeping entities and reporting separate. BSi Steel engaged with KAISPE LLC, a Microsoft partner that provides solutions and services to enterprise customers, to implement Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Power BI solutions. KAISPE also added functionalities to address the steel distribution industry.

title: Dynea - MSC - Microsoft Dynamics improves the quality of information and streamlines production for Dynea
executive_summary:
Dynea are working hard and purposefully with inspirit365 to achieve an optimal standardized Dynamics solution, in other words, to take advantage of Microsoft's state-of-the-art solutions. Dynea has chosen to use standardized, proven processes instead of adapting the system to Dynea’s own procedures.
Together with increased automation of production and processes, the new ERP system will contribute to further quality improvement and better traceability associated with the individual assets in Dynea's products.

title: MYTILINEOS makes the incoming invoices management process easier with Azure and Power Apps
executive_summary: MYTILINEOS is a leading global industrial and energy company, in constant pursuit of business innovation. In a recent collaboration with the Microsoft Digital Advisory Services team, the company reimagined its process of receiving and managing incoming invoices with Azure and Power Apps. The move is part of a broader digital transformation agenda. Saving considerable time and effort, the solution is not only accelerating processes, but helping all its employees appreciate first hand the efficiency and productivity gains with digital transformation.

title: Sri Lankan University students skill-up and get ahead with Cloud Skills Challenge
executive_summary: Many students lack in-demand IT skills and mastery of the latest technologies when they finish their degrees. To address this issue, Microsoft Sri Lanka launched Cloud Skills Challenge (CSC), a joint initiative with ten universities on the island. The aim was to equip students with the competencies they need to fast-track their careers in the technology sector. To ensure strong interest and uptake, the Microsoft education team worked closely with student-led organizations and IT clubs, enabling students to influence their peers in a friendly, competitive environment.

title: Dynea - MSC - Microsoft Dynamics improves the quality of information and streamlines production for Dynea
executive_summary:
Dynea are working hard and purposefully with inspirit365 to achieve an optimal standardized Dynamics solution, in other words, to take advantage of Microsoft's state-of-the-art solutions. Dynea has chosen to use standardized, proven processes instead of adapting the system to Dynea’s own procedures.
Together with increased automation of production and processes, the new ERP system will contribute to further quality improvement and better traceability associated with the individual assets in Dynea's products.

title: Avanade strengthens its focus on employee experience with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: At Avanade, a Microsoft-focused consulting company with 56,000 employees in 26 countries, the goal is always to help customers grow their business through the innovative use of Microsoft tools. While the global business has an undeniable impact on improving how customers work, the IT landscape within the company was large and complex. “At Avanade, we have more than 100 applications that are used across the company for different roles and different needs,” says Marci Jenkins, IT Executive, Workplace IT Experience at Avanade. “Figuring out which of those tools to use, and navigating between them, was a pain point for our colleagues.” That is, until Avanade became an early adopter of Microsoft Viva. “The power of Viva is that it’s helped us give employees information at their fingertips when they need it,” says Jenkins. Today, Avanade is exploring the use of all four Viva modules (Learning, Connections, Insights, and Topics) as part of its strategy to help Avanade employees enjoy a new way of working, renew their focus on wellbeing, and improve how they deliver value to customers around the globe.

title: A code for all occasions: Automotive supplier Plock runs quality assurance for microparts measuring just two by two millimeters based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Automakers aren’t the only ones under considerable pressure to innovate. Companies all along the supply chain must also continuously optimize their processes and products if they want to remain competitive. Quality assurance can often present a challenge, especially when it comes to microparts produced by Tier 2 suppliers. When batch sizes stretch into the millions, generally only spot checks are made. This is why Plock, an SME that supplies the automotive industry, introduced a solution that allows each individual part to be digitally traced by attaching a miniature code that contains all the key quality information. This information is stored in Azure and can be called up and analyzed as needed.

title: Capita sets itself up for hybrid work with Azure Active Directory and Microsoft Endpoint Manager
executive_summary: Capita provides business consultancy in a range of specialties, including IT and digital transformation. Committed to a “New Ways of Working” strategy that prioritizes strong support for a mobile and remote workforce, it recently transformed its own IT infrastructure to provide workers with a modern hybrid workplace built on Microsoft Security solutions for identity, access, and device management. The new highly secure, available environment features Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), part of Microsoft Entra, for identity management, conditional access, multifactor authentication, and self-service password reset, along with Microsoft Endpoint Manager for device management. The result is both a productivity boost and an enhanced experience for Capita workers, simplified operation for administrators, and reduced overall IT costs for Capita.

title: Supporting sales internationalization through migration of the CRM system environment to the cloud
executive_summary:
Swiss company Hawa is expanding its sliding door solutions business worldwide. To optimally support this growth, the company needed new IT solutions. In Microsoft Dynamics, a tool was found that can optimally assist the sales support team in its work. By having all information accessible through a single tool, agents can engage more effectively with customers.
In ORBIS, Hawa found a partner who could optimally support its changeover project, in particular the migration to the cloud. Actively involving all those affected and working together to develop a solution helped to ensure that the project was a resounding success for both sides.
products: Dynamics CRM

title: Malaysian data and AI firm streamlines finance and procurement operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Innovative digital marketing solutions provider Axiata Digital Advertising started its digital journey in 2020 to support its growing business operations across South and Southeast Asia. The company decided to deploy Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management to streamline and automate critical processes. After the implementation, ADA’s finance team swiftly improved in efficiency, closing faster than the previous 12 to 15 days after month-end close.

title: Transportation, driven by data: Transport for Greater Manchester keeps its millions of residents on the go
executive_summary: The citizens of Greater Manchester, UK, have a multitude of transit options when looking to get to their destination. Whether they choose tram, bus, rail, car, cycling, or walking, residents have access to an extensive transportation network to help them get where they need to go.

title: The recipe: Visionet revitalizes Y. Hata through technological innovation
executive_summary: Y. Hata & Co., Limited, a large, family-owned food service distributor in Hawaii, has been an essential part of the state's economy for more than 109 years. Facing ever-growing customers’ demands, the company required an integrated commerce platform for its cash-and-carry division, ChefZone. The food distributor needed to upscale its managerial productivity and overall output, and it turned to Visionet Systems for deployment of Microsoft Dynamics 365 to deliver a faster, highly integrated commerce solution. The implementation resulted in both higher scalability and increased customer satisfaction for ChefZone.

title: MYTILINEOS makes the incoming invoices management process easier with Azure and Power Apps
executive_summary: MYTILINEOS is a leading global industrial and energy company, in constant pursuit of business innovation. In a recent collaboration with the Microsoft Digital Advisory Services team, the company reimagined its process of receiving and managing incoming invoices with Azure and Power Apps. The move is part of a broader digital transformation agenda. Saving considerable time and effort, the solution is not only accelerating processes, but helping all its employees appreciate first hand the efficiency and productivity gains with digital transformation.

title: Sri Lankan University students skill-up and get ahead with Cloud Skills Challenge
executive_summary: Many students lack in-demand IT skills and mastery of the latest technologies when they finish their degrees. To address this issue, Microsoft Sri Lanka launched Cloud Skills Challenge (CSC), a joint initiative with ten universities on the island. The aim was to equip students with the competencies they need to fast-track their careers in the technology sector. To ensure strong interest and uptake, the Microsoft education team worked closely with student-led organizations and IT clubs, enabling students to influence their peers in a friendly, competitive environment.

title: Sunweb Group develops a range of self-service solutions to save customer holidays
executive_summary: Sunweb Group is a leading digital holiday expert providing ski and summer holidays to a million customers a year across Europe. Six years ago, it began its digital transformation journey, migrating to Microsoft Azure and automating many of its operations. So, when the COVID-19 pandemic hit the whole travel industry hard, Sunweb Group moved fast to limit the impact it would have on its many customers. Using its cloud-based infrastructure to its advantage, within two months it created a self-service voucher system that enabled customers to redeem vouchers for cancelled holidays. This was just the start, with the company continuing to innovate as the pandemic unfolded. Before long Sunweb Group had introduced an automated rebooking system and offered a Cashback Guarantee to incentivise wary customers to continue to book holidays. It has not only boosted the company’s reputation; it has paved the way for a future of continuing cloud-based innovation – and enhanced customer experiences.

title: Planzer migrates 200 servers to Microsoft Azure, saving time, space, and money
executive_summary: Planzer, one of the largest transportation and logistics companies in Switzerland, was operating outdated on-premises hardware. When the company decided that this costly system needed an upgrade, it turned to its Microsoft partners and the Azure platform. From the beginning of data collection to the last migrated server, Planzer moved 200 servers to Azure in about seven months.

title: HighRadius enhances security and productivity of a hybrid workforce with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: HighRadius offers cloud-based autonomous software for the office of the CFO. It brings modern digital transformation capabilities in processes like order to cash, treasury, and record to report. More than 700 businesses trust HighRadius’ autonomous finance products to automate routine processes. These businesses leverage the data-driven platform that delivers intelligence and experience to make insightful decisions. The company is headquartered in Houston, Texas, USA and has offices in multiple locations.

title: Thanks to scalable IT, Elindus can continuously respond to changes in the energy market
executive_summary: EFFIX deals with everything ICT related, including the infrastructure, security and networking. Having migrated to the public cloud in Microsoft Azure, Elindus can now continuously respond to growth and developments in the energy market. Energy prices are calculated accurately to the hour to reflect changes in the energy market. This is also crucial to Elindus’s success.
products: Azure Migrate

title: Accenture captures information quickly and easily using Microsoft Loop
executive_summary: Global professional services company Accenture helps its clients embrace change to create 360-degree value and success. To help deliver on its mission, Accenture’s 721,000 people have been using Microsoft Teams for several years. With Teams, Accenture provided a new generation of technology for calling, meeting, chat, and collaboration—all supporting collaboration with Accenture’s clients, partners, and vendors.

title: Techint E&C Leverages Technology to Deploy Time to Market Solutions
executive_summary: The engineering and construction company decided to adopt Microsoft solutions to make tools available to internal staff and external vendors to streamline tasks and increase productivity.

title: Organic food company followfood makes internal collaboration easier with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: What we eat can change the world: followfood has remained true to this motto since the company was founded in 2007. Today, over two million households have now pledged their allegiance to the followfood cause—a number that is set to rise. Based in the German city of Friedrichshafen, the SME sells sustainable food lines and is viewed as a pioneer within the industry. The increasing demand for its products is reflected not only in sales volume and revenue, but also in the growth of the company and its IT setup. Remaining competitive called for scalable and flexible standards for communicating and collaborating in a modern work environment. Together with Bechtle, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network, followfood has set itself the goal of becoming cloud-only, choosing Azure Virtual Desktop and Microsoft 365 to make this happen.

title: Grant Thornton UK LLP saves hundreds of hours with Azure Virtual Desktop and Windows 365
executive_summary: One of the world’s largest networks of professional service firms, Grant Thornton has 62,000-plus employees who work with clients in 130 countries, offering accounting and consulting services. While the company is focused on helping clients transform their businesses through growth, Grant Thornton UK has been on a journey of its own—a cloud-focused transformation a decade in the making. “Over the last 10 years, we have become a cloud-first organization using Microsoft cloud applications and services,” says Greg Swift, Chief Information Officer at Grant Thornton UK. “The goal was always to improve the services we offer our people.” The latest phase of the organization’s cloud journey? Embracing Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop and Windows 365. Grant Thornton UK used both tools to create a desktop and application experience in the cloud that caters to remote employees and helps departments across the company collaborate more efficiently. “The move to include Azure Virtual Desktop and Windows 365 aligns closely with our strategy for providing exceptional service to our people, no matter where they are,” says Swift.

title: NYC Department of Environmental Protection taps Dynamics 365 for transformation initiative
executive_summary: Each day, the New York City Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) provides about one billion gallons of high-quality drinking water to nearly 10 million residents. Sourced from a watershed that extends more than 125 miles from the city, the water makes its way to homes and businesses from 19 reservoirs and 7,000 miles of water mains, tunnels, and aqueducts. DEP also manages wastewater with 14 in-city treatment plants.

title: QIAGEN’s digital solutions based on Microsoft Azure lead to faster results in medical diagnostics
executive_summary: An accurate diagnosis is essential to determining the right treatment for a disease. QIAGEN GmbH develops technologies that allow healthcare practitioners to make faster, more precise, and more comprehensive diagnoses. To do this, the company relies not only on physical tests, but also on innovative, digital solutions developed in Microsoft Azure. Flexible and affordable, this cloud platform helps QIAGEN achieve its vision of making improvements in life possible—all over the world.

title: UK Department for Education raises career potential for the next generation with Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: England’s Department for Education (DfE) faced major obstacles with regards to its further education providers application process. Cumbersome, document-intensive processes for students, lengthy data entry and verification challenges for universities, and struggles to pull simple, relevant data from numerous third-party systems for the DfE led the department to pursue a student credentials verification solution. Working with Microsoft partner Methods, the DfE used Microsoft Entra Verified ID to verify student credentials while respecting the DfE’s rigorous privacy practices. With the solution, students can apply to programmes in minutes instead of days, and it has cut down application verification times from weeks to hours. The department’s prototype credential system using Verified ID promises to optimise possibilities for young learners.

title: How Dr. Pfleger Arzneimittel is becoming a data-driven company: Sales analysis with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Dr. Pfleger is a German pharmaceuticals manufacturer with many well-known medical products and drugs in its portfolio, including its ipalat® throat lozenges and Neuralgin® pain tablets. Located in Bamberg, the medium-sized enterprise employs more than 370 people in production, development, and sales. In a rapidly changing market and given the rising importance of e-commerce, Dr. Pfleger relies on a data strategy that employs Microsoft solutions: Azure Synapse Analytics provides the basis for a modern data warehouse, where data from all areas of the company is consolidated and analyzed. Providing support on this path toward a data-driven future is Oraylis, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network.

title: Export Development Canada leads Canadian business toward a sustainable—and prosperous—cloud-based future
executive_summary: Export Development Canada (EDC) is a Crown corporation dedicated to helping Canadian companies of all sizes respond to international business opportunities. EDC helps Canadian businesses innovate and become more competitive on the global stage through strong sustainability practices. As part of its corporate strategy, the organization is working to embed environmental, social, and governance (ESG) principles into its core business, which is supported by its investments in modern digital infrastructure built on Microsoft Azure.

title: KPMG reduces its time to market with Azure Landing Zones
executive_summary: KPMG LLP is the U.S. firm of the KPMG global organization of independent professional services firms providing Advisory, Tax and Audit services. KPMG firms operate in 145 countries and territories serving some of the top Global 500 companies around the world. Within KPMG is the Digital Nexus Cloud Engineering team which supports moving on-prem workloads to the Azure cloud as quickly, seamlessly, and securely as possible. Faced with one of the most consistent requests involving the remediation of end-of-life issues for on-prem applications, the KPMG Digital Nexus Cloud Engineering team needed to act swiftly to deliver a secure pre-development landing zone that offered a smooth cloud migration path. By adopting the Cloud Adoption Framework Azure landing zones & Azure Security Benchmark (ASBv3) policy-as-code, KPMG was able to successfully develop a pre-development landing zone to empower app development teams to test/build their own cloud infrastructure all the while helping internal clients reduce their time to market, enable automated governance, maintain security posture, optimize costs, and fast track their workloads to production.

title: ECH improves clients’ lives and care with a tailored Microsoft ecosystem
executive_summary: When ECH – South Australia’s largest provider of integrated, independent retirement living and home care – committed to using technology to help people live at home with confidence, the positive impact on clients and staff was greater than anyone expected.

title: CCC Group takes a pioneering step as a truly data-driven enterprise
executive_summary: The leaders at CCC Group, have reinvented their approach to data. To become a fully data-driven organization, they are building on Azure and connecting customers, teams, and decision-makers to each other. The new multi-cloud analytical framework enabled CCC Group to stay two steps ahead of consumer behaviors and shift market trends. Well-informed business decisions also enhance operational efficiency and help achieve customer excellence, securing the company’s competitive advantage.

title: Lenskart transforms the way it eyes data using Power BI
executive_summary: A direct-to-consumer omnichannel retailer, Lenskart, is one of the fastest-growing e-commerce-led eyewear retail chains in the world. It has over 1,100 stores in India and a growing presence in East Asia, Southeast Asia, the Middle East, and the US.

title: Combining advanced technology and high-quality foods to address food deserts in underserved communities
executive_summary: In the planned community of Trilith, Georgia, Microsoft is providing foundational technology that’s helping Nourish + Bloom Market expand the availability of high-quality foods in a previously underserved community. Through a unique combination of advanced technology and a focus on human connections, the company is creating a seamless shopping experience customers love.

title: Rx.Health supports 6 million patient encounters with Microsoft security, analytics, and automation
executive_summary: Rx.Health is a pioneer in the use of digital solutions to improve patient care and enhance health. With big ideas and a lean team, the company sought productivity-forward solutions that take care of security and compliance so it can focus on healthcare innovation. That combination of inventiveness and collaboration has led to the company’s expanded partnership with Yale New Haven Health. Supporting approximately 6 million patients and 55 million messages per year, Rx.Health knows its customer data is safeguarded by a wide range of Microsoft Azure solutions and supported by Power BI data visualization tools.

title: JM Family enhances analytics and streamlines customer delivery with Azure Arc
executive_summary: To deliver on its goals of citizen IT and agile development, JM Family began a digital transformation two years ago with the launch of the Microsoft Azure cloud platform. As the next step of its digital transformation, JM Family needed to create a business case for modernizing its analytics capabilities onto Azure.
