The Group also wanted to streamline its internal operations and data processing to facilitate empowered employee experiences, including better access to data to help it make the best creative and strategic decisions. L’Oréal decided to work with Microsoft Azure to help enhance its multicloud strategy. With Azure, the company has extended cloud capabilities when it comes to infrastructure as a service, and also platform as a service and AI, setting the stage for continued innovation. In addition, the beauty giant is using SAP on Azure to help streamline its manufacturing, supply chain, sales and distribution, and finance capabilities, accelerating market responsiveness to emerging beauty trends. Azure is also supporting innovative customer experiences, like virtual try-ons and personalized skincare assessments.

title: Investec yields high productivity returns with Microsoft Copilot for Sales
executive_summary: From its founding in Johannesburg in 1974 as a small finance company to the international bank and wealth manager it is today, Investec has always believed that strong partnerships and understanding are essential to creating enduring worth for its clients. With 8,500 employees in 40 cities on 5 continents, Investec’s offerings include private banking and bespoke investment management services for high-net-worth individuals, business banking, foreign exchange and risk management, and import and logistics solutions for entrepreneurs and corporations, and cash, investment, and foreign exchange management for financial advisors, attorneys, accountants, and other intermediaries.

title: SLC Agrícola transforms its management and development system with the support of Azure, already targeting the future
executive_summary: A leading international agribusiness company began its digital transformation by implementing a new enterprise management system with Microsoft Azure. It leveraged infrastructure resources and a digital development pipeline – both processes already implemented. The next step was to invest in services and data engineering to accelerate analytical processes, collaboration, and security capabilities, which enabled a whole new reality: farm on cloud.

title: Coca-Cola Bottlers Japan Inc. migrates to Azure, transforms data analysis results
executive_summary: Coca Cola Bottlers Japan Inc. wanted to migrate its applications and SAP environment from on-premises datacenters to the cloud.

title: Argano unifies platforms with Dynamics 365 to keep pace with growth through streamlined, efficient operations
executive_summary: Argano needed to more efficiently integrate newly-acquired specialty consulting firms into its portfolio, with the goal of unifying business units on a common solution to streamline operations and enhance visibility.

title: MetLife securely speeds up customer product releases using Azure DevOps
executive_summary: The developers at MetLife Asia wanted to implement industry best practices for development security operations across the enterprise. Their goal was clear: to enhance the security, efficiency, and quality of their software development cycle.

title: PCL Construction uses IoT with Azure to revolutionize the construction industry
executive_summary: PCL Construction, headquartered in Edmonton, Canada, is turning the centuries-old construction industry on its head with a push toward digital technology and cloud services. Using Microsoft Azure and Azure IoT technologies, PCL created the mobile-ready Job Site InsightsTM application to provide a single-pane view into all aspects of construction. By gathering and analyzing IoT data, PCL is improving its processes to increase safety, efficiency, and productivity while positioning itself as a future-ready builder.

title: Shell invests in safety with Azure, AI, and machine vision to better protect customers and service champions
executive_summary: In the energy industry, Shell manages everything from wells to retail gas stations—44,000 of them. The company works hard to ensure the safety of service champions and customers at its retail sites. Shell is piloting a new cloud-based, deep learning solution built on Microsoft Azure. The solution uses closed-circuit camera footage and Internet of Things technology to automatically identify safety hazards and alert service champions so they can quickly respond and eliminate potential problems.

title: Hilton Grand Vacations puts the fun in teamwork to improve customer service and satisfaction with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: It’s a sunny morning at Las Palmeras, a Hilton Grand Vacations Club in Orlando, Florida, but it’s not exactly business as usual. With the advent of the COVID-19 virus, anxious travelers now follow safety precautions posted by team members at this family-friendly resort where everyone is doing their best to stay healthy. This morning, Erika Alli serves at the front desk.

title: Greek flour milling company Loulis Mills boosts performance and saves costs with cloud-based critical system
executive_summary: Founded in the 18th century, family-run Loulis Mills has become one of Greece’s largest food companies. Supplying flour products to more than 10 countries, it needed to digitize its processes to provide better value to its customers. With the help of Microsoft partner TEKA Systems, Loulis Mills’ adoption of SAP S/4HANA on Azure has given it the secure and cost-efficient infrastructure needed to standardize operations and speed up processes, enhancing its quality control and delivery time.

title: Simplifying complexity for the benefit of clients
executive_summary: Dentsu Aegis Network is a global agency group that supports global clients, such as General Motors, P&G and Kraft Heinz, with media, creative and CRM agency services.  It helps its clients to speak to their customers in a personal way, boost creative optimisation and understand marketing effectiveness.

title: Kohler Co. embraces culture of agility and productivity with Microsoft 365, builds core strengths to provide gracious living for customers
executive_summary: Founded in 1873 and headquartered in Kohler, Wisconsin, Kohler Co. is one of the oldest and largest privately held companies in the United States. Known for its bold look, Kohler is a global leader in kitchen and bath products, cabinetry, tile, and lighting. Kohler is also a global manufacturer of engines and power generation systems. To round out its diverse portfolio, Kohler operates award-winning hospitality and world-class golf at Destination Kohler and Destination St. Andrews.

title: Poland pharmaceutical company escapes email overload and gets back to business
executive_summary: DOZ S.A. has two main offices in Łódź and Warsaw and a retail chain of over 1,000 pharmaceutical retail outlets. Recognized as a “Great Place to Work” in 2017, 2018, and 2019, the company has won Poland’s “Superbrand” nine times. However, employees at this successful organization found it hard to concentrate on their work in the face of endless email and phone communications. But this has been organized and made much better recently. The reason collaboration and creativity were restored was a move to Microsoft Office 365—and especially, to Microsoft Teams.

title: AkzoNobel: Improving factory performance with Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) technology
executive_summary: Dutch paint and coatings leader, AkzoNobel, is active in more than 100 countries. At its factory in Como, Italy, the company is implementing Azure IoT technology for the first time. After an adaptation period, AkzoNobel is now seeing the performance and productivity gains that come from greater connectivity on the factory floor.

title: Leading recreational vehicle maker rolls up to Dynamics 365 for easier, faster scaling
executive_summary: A world-leading manufacturer of highly engineered components for recreational vehicles, Lippert wanted to transform its complex manufacturing environment using a new cloud-based enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution as the catalyst. It chose to move from Microsoft Dynamics AX on-premises to Dynamics 365—the largest IT project Lippert had ever tackled. Paying careful attention to change management and communication to support the nearly 2,500 employees who use the solution, Lippert made a smooth transition, resulting in seamless ERP support for its just-in-time production.
products: Dynamics 365

title: Coats stays agile and responsive under any conditions with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: As the world’s leading industrial thread manufacturer, Coats has global operations and a complex supply chain. To keep the business running smoothly and provide a platform for innovation, Coats moved IT resources to the cloud. Coats chose Microsoft Azure because with it, the manufacturer gained the flexibility and agility to not only optimize existing processes but also accommodate unexpected changes in operations like those triggered by COVID-19. While COVID-19 forced office and factory closures, Coats maintained business continuity and even expanded some of its operations to help produce much-needed personal protective equipment.

title: British manufacturers unite to build ventilators for the NHS
executive_summary: As the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic began to be felt around the world, leaders at the UK’s High Value Manufacturing Catapult (HVMC) realised it would need to play a role in addressing a major impediment in the UK’s response to the virus: the shortage of hospital-grade ventilators.

title: Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust uses mixed reality in the fight against COVID-19
executive_summary: Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust provides acute and specialist healthcare in north west London for around a million and a half people every year.  It is one of the largest NHS trusts in England and, together with Imperial College London, forms an academic health science centre.

title: The Wonderful Company, a health food company, implements Power BI for low total cost of ownership, AI capabilities, and flexibility to utilize company data in business units such as finance, farming, and manufacturing
executive_summary: Headquartered in Los Angeles, The Wonderful Company is a privately held $5 billion global company dedicated to harvesting health and happiness around the world through its iconic consumer brands. Its 10,000 employees worldwide are dedicated to bringing consumers everywhere the freshest pistachios, citrus, and pomegranates; bottling the finest water and wines; and creating colorful floral bouquets.

title: Mural empowers digital collaboration at scale with MongoDB Atlas through the Microsoft commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Mural and MongoDB, both Microsoft partners and customers, are working together with Microsoft to inspire innovation and change how their customers collaborate to work better, easier, and faster. Mural uses MongoDB Atlas and its integrated suite of cloud database and data services to accelerate and simplify how it builds collaborative solutions with data.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Microsoft Teams

title: The power of partnership: Profisee and Microsoft—collaborating to serve customers better, together
executive_summary: Profisee is a leading provider of master data management (MDM) solutions with a deeply integrated suite of offerings that provide a unified approach to data governance. Profisee is a long-standing Microsoft partner with deep integration spanning technology, partner ecosystem initiatives, and more recently specialized ISV Success benefits. The partnership is paying dividends for Profisee and its Azure customers are benefiting by using their enterprise data more efficiently to drive business.

title: Ernst & Young processes emergency loans for small business using Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: When the COVID-19 pandemic hit the United States, the government passed the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act, which included financial support for small businesses. This support was provided under the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP), and it included loans as well as forgiveness on qualified expenses. The scope was huge: More than 5,000 US banks have processed over $500 billion in PPP loans since the program began and over 5 million borrowers have benefited from it.

title: Siemens GBS: Artificial intelligence for the next generation of Shared Service Organization
executive_summary: At Siemens Global Business Services (GBS) it is all about the customers’ ambitions: Nearly 10,000 employees worldwide work every day on the implementation and optimization of Shared Services along the entire value chain of its customers’ businesses. For example, the digitalization of a company’s hiring or payment processes enables GBS to support each business need with red carpet service, tailored to foster the customer’s success. A strong ecosystem of partners further increases the customer value. Accordingly, GBS and Microsoft teamed up.

title: Alışan Grup leads the way with its comprehensive digital transformation vision
executive_summary: A top-500 Turkish business name with an uninterrupted 7-year place on the  Fortune list, Alışan Grup employs 1500 people and operates in a variety of sectors from construction to insurance. The flagship company of the group, Alışan Lojistik A.Ş., is a market maker for the Turkish logistics business. Continuing its digital journey through 5  transition routes, Alışan Grup enjoys the benefits of cloud thanks to Microsoft Azure.

title: AXA UK sets the pace on insurance quotes with Azure Machine Learning and managed endpoints
executive_summary: AXA UK provides competitive car insurance quotes for customers via online aggregator sites, and the company needs the agility to respond to market conditions and quickly change its pricing algorithms. So, it’s moving to a Microsoft Azure platform as a service (PaaS) cloud environment that uses managed endpoints in Azure Machine Learning to automate deployment of new pricing models. AXA looks forward to staying ahead of the market, innovating, and delivering more value to its customers.

title: ENCAMINA tools boost state agency productivity and worker engagement
executive_summary: Recently, the government of New South Wales (NSW), Australia, launched an internal campaign to boost its employees’ ability to maximize Microsoft 365 performance and to make their work more secure and productive. But there was one more requirement: The whole process should be fun. By adopting the TeamsChamp and PlayQuiz applications from ENCAMINA, the state government successfully used gamification and productivity tools to enhance the way employees work. Through increased use of Microsoft 365 solutions, NSW employees were able work more securely and collaboratively.

title: Doğuş Group outsmarts cyberthreats with Microsoft Enterprise Mobility + Security and Microsoft Defender
executive_summary: With a workforce of 19,000 and more than 300 diverse companies in its portfolio, Doğuş Group is one of Türkiye’s largest conglomerates. Drawing the technology vision of the group is Doğuş Teknoloji, which undertakes the task of meeting the needs of the group in this direction. Witnessing a rise in cyberthreats, Doğuş Teknoloji realized it needed to better secure its highly sensitive datasets and improve security for staff working remotely. To improve its threat detection and resolution, it turned to the Enterprise Mobility + Security platform of Microsoft 365, Defender for Endpoint and Defender for Office 365. The Turkish group now maintains enhanced work security for its data and staff, while cutting down the time needed to investigate security incidents.

title: Municipality Vingåker develops a solution to tackle loneliness and isolation
executive_summary: For the past few years, Municipality Vingåker has been developing the concept of smart villages. The idea centers around building services that enable people to live in rural areas by taking care of, and utilizing, the resources available. As the municipality has been exploring ways to create long-term value for each of its departments, it’s been focusing on using Microsoft Teams to digitally transform elderly care. Its innovative approach to customizing the tools it already uses has helped to bring to life its mission: to not only provide intelligent services to its citizens, but to also improve their quality of life.

title: How the municipality of Langnau am Albis changed the way its municipal council meets during the pandemic
executive_summary: The Swiss municipality of Langnau am Albis faced a major challenge when much of its staff was forced to work remotely due to COVID-19. Against a backdrop of strict data protection laws, the administration opted for Microsoft Teams as a communication solution to keep staff connected internally. The results were so successful that the local authority now wants to keep the hybrid solution in the long term.

title: North Central Texas Council of Governments thinks beyond the document with a Teams-first approach to collaboration
executive_summary: A dependable communications and file-sharing backbone helps ensure smooth collaboration between more than 700 employees and contractors serving 230-plus government agencies and over 7 million people across the North Texas region. The North Central Texas Council of Governments (NCTCOG) started modernizing their technology with Microsoft Teams for communications and Microsoft 365 for document management. Today, NCTCOG relies on an integrated suite of solutions that includes Microsoft 365 Office apps, Teams, SharePoint, and OneDrive. In addition to being an early adopter of Microsoft solutions, NCTCOG has emerged as a thought leader on the effectiveness of digital transformation in improving government efficiency and supporting agency goals.

title: A chatbot learns to speak thanks to Azure Cognitive Services: Claims reporting just got easier with bot Claimens at DOMCURA AG
executive_summary: When storm front “Bernd” swept over Germany in summer 2021, it didn’t just leave flooding and toppled trees in its wake; it also damaged countless buildings and temporarily forced thousands of people out of their homes. To make sure it could receive claims as quickly as possible and provide rapid assistance, insurance specialist DOMCURA decided to introduce a chatbot. Its name: Claimens. Its technology basis: Azure Cognitive Services.

title: “How may I help you?”: Parloa optimizes telephone customer service with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: “Please press 1 to find out more about our products. Press 2 if you have a question about your order.” Gone are the days of tedious customer support hotlines. Instead, the automated customer service solution used by Parloa customers opens a call with a simple question: “How may I help you?” It then responds intelligently to callers’ queries and concerns. This is all thanks to the technology: the speech-to-text feature provided by Microsoft Azure takes the quality of conversational AI used by Parloa’s phonebots to the next level.

title: IPSO Tarım A.Ş. turned the key to its complete application solution in less than 3 months thanks to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: IPSO Tarım A.Ş., agricultural machines distributor, was looking for a complete ERP and CRM solution that could be up and running in less than 3 months. Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central allowed them to migrate 20K item cards, vendors, customers, price lists (40k), and chart of accounts in just one working day, enabling remote working and connecting with clients across the region

title: Bentley Systems creates breakthrough framework, drastically speeds up AI development with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Software innovator Bentley Systems offers a broad portfolio of solutions to help the organizations that design, build, and operate the world’s infrastructure assets. The company uses machine learning in its flagship product to read disparate paper-based asset data and transform it into consolidated digital data. To speed up and formalize this process, Bentley created a machine learning operations framework using Microsoft Azure Machine Learning and PyTorch. Developers’ speed and job satisfaction have shot up since they began using this stable, reproducible framework, which easily gets their code into the cloud, accelerating delivery by three to five times and significantly increasing efficiency.

title: A unique effort between Akbank and Microsoft Support Services as they join forces
executive_summary: A leading company in Türkiye's banking, finance, and insurance services, Akbank keeps up its strong roots with a forward-looking vision. A digital banking pioneer in Türkiye, it is working to provide customers personalized solutions for their financial needs along with a streamlined customer experience. For the past five years, Akbank has synergized with Microsoft Support Services to introduce the Unified Support, Support for Mission Critical (SfMC) Support System and technology integrations as well as cooperation between working teams under development and uninterrupted use within the scope of the Cash Management System Projects.

title: The Real Green Food Co. accelerates global daily operations in two weeks with TIPSA Harvest Management and Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: With over 750 employees across seven factories, The Real Green Food Co. manufactures and wholesales high-quality canned foods through operations in Europe, the Middle East, Latin America, and the United States. The Real Green Food Co.’s board of directors chose Tipsa as an experienced technology advisor to realize the board’s transformative vision that places technology, innovation, transparency, and sustainability as top business priorities. Drawing on extensive experience with Microsoft business applications, Tipsa implemented its Harvest Management, an app built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, and related harvest management processes and dashboards built on Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Power BI. The Real Green Food Co. quickly gained the foundations of an interconnected, collaborative, and secure platform for business operations and analysis in two weeks.

title: FSA helps keep UK food supply safe with Microsoft Purview Records Management
executive_summary: The Food Standards Agency (FSA) fulfills the vital role of overseeing food safety in England, Northern Ireland, and Wales. Its onsite inspections and scientific tools needed backup—excellent records management to boost collaboration and security. Food safety is a timeless need, but the records management system used by the FSA was showing its age. The agency desired a more future-proof alternative to boost collaboration, productivity, and security. It found the solution it needed with Microsoft Purview Records Management.

title: Business insurance company NIP Group moves to Azure to simplify its infrastructure, improve security, and support remote work
executive_summary: After 30 years of managing its own infrastructure, NIP Group had to decide between making costly upgrades or migrating to the cloud. Moving its IT infrastructure to Microsoft Azure proved to be a better decision than the company anticipated. In addition to simplifying IT management and improving security and compliance—a major benefit in the heavily regulated insurance industry—NIP transformed its workplace from fully on-site to fully remote, giving employees the flexibility to work from anywhere and expanding its talent pool nationwide. NIP continues to adopt new Microsoft cloud services to create an edge in a highly competitive industry.

title: Etex builds on family culture by supporting digital and frontline employees through Viva Connections
executive_summary: Despite its global reach, Etex is very much a family company. The building-materials manufacturer delivers beautiful, affordable, and inspiring living spaces, while living its values of leadership, excellence, and connectivity. Etex stakes its success on its ability to foster a culture of togetherness, trust, empowerment, and collaboration that drives innovation, continuous improvement, and employee performance.
products: Azure AI Services, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Viva Connections

title: CarMax puts customers first with car research tools powered by Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Since 1993, CarMax has grown from an industry-disrupting startup to become the United States’ leading used car retailer. CarMax isn’t content to rest on that success, though—the company continually seeks ways to innovate and make the car-buying experience even better for its many customers. With help from Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, CarMax has streamlined the creation of text summaries for its car research pages, quickly providing customers with meaningful content that also boosts the pages’ search engine rankings. With this success as a foundation, CarMax expects to add even more AI-generated content to its website.

title: Polish energy supplier dashes toward a green future with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary:
On track to making emission-free railways in Poland, PKP Energetyka blends the analytical capabilities of Power BI with Azure Machine Learning’s predictive forecasting models.
A solution developed in tandem with Microsoft partner Elitmind enabled real-time management of renewable sources to secure appropriate energy levels for powering rails. With this new system, the company stays on course to meet the goals of the Green Railway program, foreseeing the achievement of 85% of climate neutrality by the Polish rail sector by 2030.

title: Distell chooses Azure Synapse Analytics to drive its data warehouse transformation
executive_summary: Nearly a century ago, in the mid-1920s, a group of grape farmers in South Africa began making wine together, eventually forming the first winery in South Africa, Stellenbosch Farmers’ Winery. In the autumn of 2000, Stellenbosch Farmers’ Winery merged with Distillers Corporation, becoming Distell. Distell is the largest producer of wine, spirits, cider, and ready-to-drinks in South Africa, and is headquartered in Stellenbosch, South Africa.

title: Ultimation migrates to Dynamics 365 Business Central, guided by Peritos
executive_summary: Ultimation Industries, a major US conveyor manufacturer, had been using Sage for its customer relationship management (CRM) system. Ultimation’s business was growing exponentially, though, and the company found its existing system increasingly difficult to use. The on-premises CRM didn’t allow any customization or automation, and Ultimation was taking hundreds of hours each month to process thousands of financial tasks. Peritos mapped the client's requirement to the capabilities of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and showed that it requires no upgrades, while remaining fully customizable and capable of transaction automation.

title: Mobilet developed a flexible SaaS omni-channel platform leveraging Azure Cloud.
executive_summary: Mobilet is a social discovery and ticketing platform which aims to redefine the ticket buying experience. With a rapid growth, Mobilet has reached a vast customer base in a short time, and is now able to manage thousands of simultaneous transactions without any problem thanks to Azure Cloud. Mobilet achieved significant cost savings, increasing the agility of the structure according to the need, and securing applications with hypervisor isolation.

title: Twitter makes public conversations more accessible with Microsoft AI
executive_summary: Twitter is a social media platform that connects diverse people, perspectives, ideas, and information. With Twitter Spaces, the platform seeks to go beyond the character limit of Tweets and host live audio conversations. As part of its commitment to inclusivity, Twitter wanted to ensure that Spaces is accessible to users who are deaf or hard of hearing. Speech-to-Text from Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services overcomes the accessibility barriers of an audio-only platform with real-time transcription of spoken audio into text. Deployed on Microsoft Azure and supporting over 100 languages and variants, Azure Speech-to-Text makes Spaces more accessible by providing quick and accurate auto-captions to Twitter users.

title: USA TODAY taps into Azure Text-to-Speech to naturally read premium articles aloud
executive_summary: As USA TODAY celebrates its 40-year anniversary this year, the product team is expanding its subscriber experiences with voice. USA TODAY app subscribers can listen to premium articles with “Hear This Story”, powered by Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services Text-to-Speech. The road to this feature launching on USA TODAY started with the Gannett product team exploring different competitive AI solutions including Azure. For the end user, the team required natural synthesis of news and sports articles, in addition to the ability to handle obscure names and towns, a common challenge found in broadcast media.

title: Farmasi migrates its data center to Azure with a vision of inspiring continuity
executive_summary: Established by Dr. Cevdet Tuna as a pharmaceutical and cosmetics company in 1950, Farmasi operates in more than 29 countries offering more than 2,000 products. With around 5,000 employees around the world, the company's production hub continues to be based in Istanbul. Farmasi operates on multiple models including B2B, B2C and C2C and enjoys a web-based direct sales channel and network marketing system. Migrating its entire infrastructure, which has over 100 million visitors globally, to Azure, Farmasi now benefits from the advantages offered by the cloud to some other leading international organizations.

title: SWICA moves to the cloud with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Managing highly sensitive data, centralized data and analytics can be difficult. SWICA, one of the largest health and accident insurance companies in Switzerland, needed a way to combine the compliance and security of a decentralized system with the efficiency and collaboration made possible through a cloud-based solution. With Microsoft Power BI already in use, the organization integrated Azure Synapse Analytics and built a more unified platform—allowing SWICA to more efficiently leverage sensitive, critical data, in an efficient, safe, and cost-effective way. With the new platform, SWICA aims to enhance the data and analytics pillar of its organization and bring even greater value to its customers.

title: The Kingdom of Bahrain achieves excellence in education with Microsoft
executive_summary: The Ministry of Education (MOE) of the Kingdom of Bahrain has always maintained a resolute commitment to excellence, innovation, and creativity in education. To help fulfill its Economic Vision 2030, the Ministry has focused its efforts towards increasing student inclusion and access to technology, setting its youth up for growth and success.

title: Cyient leverages Microsoft Azure to increase efficiency
executive_summary: Cyient is a leading consulting-led, industry-centric, Technology Solutions company that specializes in engineering, design, IT and data analytics with a core focus on areas of total electronics manufacturing solutions in diverse fields of telecommunications, defense and aerospace applications. Cyient has a diversified base of over 300 customers, including 29 fortune 500 companies across multiple industries and geographies.

title: Haptik leverages Microsoft Azure Machine translation models supporting more than 100 languages; increases local queries by 2.5X and reduces human interventions by 80%
executive_summary: Jio Haptik Technologies Limited (Haptik) is an AI company that empowers conversational commerce experiences. A subsidiary of Reliance Jio Platforms (Jio), Haptik helps brands acquire, convert, engage and delight users with AI-driven, personalized, conversational experiences across 20 channels and 130 languages. With the vision of creating the most compelling conversational commerce platform of the 21st century, Haptik’s Conversational Commerce platform enables brands to design delightful experiences that improve conversion rates across every stage of their customer’s journey. Haptik’s leading clients and partners include KFC, Whirlpool, Starhub, HP, Reliance Jio, CEAT, Disney Hotstar, OLA, and Zurich Insurance among others. The company has been featured as a Category Leader across many platforms including Gartner, G2, Opus Research & more.

title: Insurance titan AIA embraces a cloud-based future to boost cost savings, sustainability while improving customer experience for millions
executive_summary: Even in the realm of corporations reaching global scale, AIA is a colossus. The multinational insurance and financial services provider is the largest Hong Kong–headquartered company listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. AIA’s business units serve 18 markets and more than 17 million group insurance members, and they provide more than 40 million individual insurance policies. It’s no surprise that in an increasingly complex digital marketplace, the corresponding IT challenges and goals for AIA are numerous and urgent.

title: HandsFree Health launches voice-enabled virtual health assistant platform with Azure AI
executive_summary: HandsFree Health was founded to help consumers stay educated, engaged, and empowered in navigating the complexity of their personal health. The company packaged the benefits of the most advanced AI technology and databases, powered by Azure, into WellBe, into an easy-to-use voice assistant virtual healthcare platform.

title: The Contingent—Mobilizing communities to transform the child welfare system with Microsoft Cloud for Nonprofit
executive_summary: Opening doors to children in need is not new to The Contingent. An Oregon-based organization, The Contingent is a venture nonprofit that recognized the power of mobilized communities early. Their success in mobilizing Oregonians to support the state's foster care system led the state to entrust them with foster family recruitment for the entire state. To transform the child welfare system, The Contingent bet on the Microsoft cloud platform four years ago. This was not just a bet on technology but a new mindset for strategic community engagements leading to trusted relationships and better placement for children. These superpowers are now expanding nationwide.

title: Bedrosians Tile & Stone enhances scalability with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Bedrosians Tile & Stone (Bedrosians) is one of the largest independent porcelain tile and stone importers and distributors in the United States, with 40 retail locations across the country and customers worldwide. Bedrosians has been providing tile and setting materials to contractors and builders for 75 years. Through Bedrosians.com, distribution centers, and their own trucking operations, Bedrosians delivers the on-trend, high-quality products they are known for, at affordable prices.

title: Revolutionizing census: Serbia's Statistical Office collects and publishes results in record time using Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: 18 months. That’s how long it took the Statistical Office of Republic of Serbia to publish its official census results before. This time, it delivered preliminary census results in just one month, and official results in six months. This was made possible thanks to the team adopting Microsoft solutions such as Azure, SQL Server, and Power BI. Not only did it help the Office conduct a paperless and efficient census process; it also ensured top data security, enabled real-time monitoring, and improved data quality.

title: Commerce.AI delivers up to 50 percent increases in productivity with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Commerce.AI started looking into the power of AI data insights in 2018. In the last two years, the software company’s solutions have exploded in utility, in no small part due to its adoption of Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service and Azure Cognitive Services. Layering its own technology on top of these, Commerce.AI unearths new kinds of customer feedback from unstructured video, audio, and photographic data. The company’s technology has already begun driving 30 to 50 percent increases in productivity for its customers, with even greater benefits yet to come.

title: Washington State Department of Natural Resources uses Azure AI to automate aquatic resource monitoring, saving months of experts’ time
executive_summary: The Washington State Department of Natural Resources (DNR) uses Microsoft tools to achieve its mission of sustaining and protecting the state’s lands and waters for current and future generations. Making good decisions about how to manage millions of acres requires massive amounts of data, which requires lots of time to analyze. In its quest to monitor eelgrass each summer, the Nearshore Habitat Program gathers 350 hours of underwater video footage, all of which must be stored and classified. To process the video data more efficiently, ecologists in the Aquatic Resources Division used Microsoft Azure for cloud storage solutions and automating video classification with the help of AI. These technological innovations boost scientists’ productivity while advancing climate change research.

title: Arkas Holding achieves 99.58% carbon savings by migrating to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Arkas Holding, which carries out end-to-end logistics with 61 companies, 59 offices and 7300 employees in 23 countries, puts sustainability at the center of its operational and technological infrastructure investments. By migrating to the Microsoft Azure Cloud in 2018, Arkas Holding achieved 99.58% carbon savings, with 62% coming from operational, equipment, and datacenter infrastructure efficiencies, and 38% from renewable energy purchases.

title: Medtronic transforms business with a “one best way” strategy and unified data system on Microsoft Power BI, fostering a data-driven culture
executive_summary: Medtronic, a healthcare technology leader, adopted a “one best way” strategy to unify its Global Operations and Supply Chain (GO&SC) data and analytics under one team and used Microsoft Power BI to create an innovative centralized analytics and insights organization. This team transformed thousands of dashboards with disparate data into a cohesive ecosystem, named INSIGHTS, by using Power BI to help create a single source of truth. Serving more than 45,000 GO&SC employees and operating unit staff, Medtronic’s initiative streamlined operations, automated more than 240,000 hours of work, and set a new benchmark in operational efficiency, empowering users to deliver better business results.

title: Groupama envisions mutual AI with generative AI and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: For over 100 years, the Groupama Group has been focusing on timeless humanist values to enable as many people as possible to build their lives with confidence. It relies on communities based on mutual assistance, that are human and close to people, optimistic and responsible. The Groupama Group, one of the leading mutual insurance groups in France, developed its insurance and service activities in ten countries. It counts 12 million members and customers and 31,000 employees worldwide, and an annual revenue of 15.9 billion euros.

title: Royal Mail relies on Microsoft Azure to increase the pace of innovation to its business
executive_summary: Royal Mail needs to remain competitive in a changing business environment. It has shifted several of its workloads to Microsoft Azure, helping it access Azure services that enable it to deploy new software to the business more rapidly. They are benefiting from the automation and elasticity of cloud provisioning to drive efficiencies in development and deployment, and better support the business including with its goals for transformation.

title: Lucy® the Answer Engine® broadens her knowledge and scope with Azure
executive_summary: With its innovative approach to creating an “answer engine®” rather than a search engine, Lucy reinvented knowledge management. With the proliferation of unstructured data, Lucy needed a modern AI solution and cloud infrastructure it could tailor to its customers’ needs and that could evolve as customers—and corporate knowledge—grow. The company chose a suite of Azure services, including Azure AI Video Indexer, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Translation, Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Language Studio, and Azure AI Services.

title: Belfius uses Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to help detect fraud and money laundering
executive_summary: Belfius recognized the opportunity of its cloud transformation to further scale up technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). Lacking an overview of all features, Belfius data scientists were rewriting the same code repeatedly for different data models. Belfius was keen to improve development time, increase efficiency, and gain reliability. As an early adopter, Belfius built on the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform using services including Azure Machine Learning, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Databricks.

title: Habu data clean rooms enable highly secure collaboration using Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Habu helps companies collaborate securely with external partners through data clean rooms. To improve customer experiences and strengthen its security assurances, it constantly evaluates new technologies to add to its on-demand product offering. The company explored Microsoft Azure confidential computing at the request of several of its top customers. Now, it boosts the capabilities of its data clean rooms using Azure confidential computing in tandem with several other resources, including AMD-based confidential virtual machines on Azure. Habu’s flexible software solution supports a wide range of use cases, and it’s designed for both technical and nontechnical users. The company gained new opportunities to work with customers who require the highest degrees of data protection—opportunities that wouldn't be available without Azure confidential computing.

title: Sonova Audiological Care brings life-changing hearing care to more people with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: While Sonova Audiological Care already has 8,600 employees and 3,900 hearing care centers located in 20 countries, this business unit of Sonova is dedicated to enabling even more people to experience the delight of hearing, particularly underserved populations, and younger customers. To do that, they devised an omnichannel strategy, and with the help of Microsoft Dynamics 365, improved visibility and engagement with their customers—all while keeping the needs of hearing care providers and customers front and center.

title: Dynatrace and Trace3 increase business growth together with the Microsoft commercial marketplace through multiparty private offers
executive_summary: With customers’ cloud portfolios becoming more complex as they balance innovation with optimization, Microsoft continues to create new opportunities to support ever-changing cloud needs. With many customers relying on their partners to advise on their entire cloud estates, Microsoft has introduced multiparty private offers through the commercial marketplace to support the partner community in meeting customer demands. Multiparty private offers empower more than 400,000 Microsoft partners to work together and create custom solutions for customers through the commercial marketplace.

title: Setting Sail for Smooth Journeys: How Setur's Azure Open AI Chatbot Transforms Travel
executive_summary: Buckle up for a travel revolution! Setur, the renowned Turkish tourism giant, is rewriting the rules of travel planning. With Microsoft Azure OpenAI, Setur has landed a new conversational chatbot that's changing the way we explore the world. By harnessing Microsoft Azure OpenAI, Setur has introduced a conversational chatbot that revolutionizes travel planning, offering unparalleled personalization. This innovative solution caters to Setur's 60,000 daily users, providing instant, customized responses in multiple languages, all powered by AI intelligence.
products: Azure, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: When everyone speaks the same language: Boehringer Ingelheim speeds up knowledge sharing with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: How can expert knowledge be used efficiently? Typically, someone comes up with a question and searches until they’ve found their answer. In the pharmaceutical industry, coming up with the answer quickly can save many lives. Companies in this industry store their expert knowledge in numerous internal repositories and databases as well as drawing on external sources. Trawling through these stores of information to gain insights for researching, developing, and providing medications could be extremely time-consuming. Now, with the combination of its iQNow platform and Azure OpenAI Service, Boehringer Ingelheim has made it possible for researchers to access information many times faster than before, leaving them with more time and capacity to develop drugs.

title: Aster Insights transforms the world’s largest observational research study in oncology with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Aster Insights, a leading provider of scientific intelligence for oncology research, migrated its extensive information pipelines to Microsoft Azure. The migration harmonized dispersed data and helped the company harness advanced analytics to quickly deliver new insights from its multi-petabyte, multi-modal data set. The company used other Microsoft solutions in parallel to streamline financial management and enhance collaboration, security, and compliance. This digital transformation, achieved with no disruption to business operations, reduced manual work on some processes by 90 percent and helped Aster Insights modernize and upgrade its cybersecurity posture. It will also save on storage and computing costs compared to prior systems.

title: Mining leader South32 builds an SAP cloud future by boosting data efficiency and performance with Azure
executive_summary: When global mining and metals company South32 demerged from BHP in 2015, it inherited a complex enterprise software environment with consolidation and efficiency challenges facing its large, business-critical SAP estate. The legacy on-premises datacenter did not perform to standard, resulting in outages to the business at critical times of the year. Together with Microsoft, SAP, and infrastructure partner TCS, South32 set a goal of transitioning its more than 100 terabyte data landscape into a fit-for-purpose enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. This was achieved through an SAP on Microsoft Azure transformation, including storage on 20 E-series Azure virtual machines equipped with Azure Premium SSD. South32 seamlessly completed phase one of its SAP migration to Azure, achieving consolidation and simplification of its estate. It also reduced its database size by two-thirds while benefitting from streamlined resourcing and noticeable performance gains.

title: CallMiner partners with Microsoft to convert conversations into action with Azure AI Services
executive_summary: Customer service contact centers can carry out thousands of interactions per day. The process of answering calls, responding to chats and emails, understanding customers’ needs and requests, and delivering the desired outcome can be challenging. What’s more, those interactions contain a wealth of valuable insights that have the power to drive meaningful business-performance improvements. From why customers are contacting your organization and how your agents are performing to potential issues such as with your products and services or compliance risks, intelligence from the contact center can help leaders make better decisions to improve efficiency, customer experiences, product innovation, and more. CallMiner’s AI-driven platform empowers organizations to ingest and analyze every conversation that happens in the contact center and beyond to uncover insights, take action, and drive transformational change.

title: Modern Requirements revolutionizing product development with Azure DevOps and Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: For companies to meet the needs of their customers and stakeholders, business leaders create a set number of functional and non-functional requirements (Quality of Service). These requirements help product managers and quality assurance employees enhance existing products and develop new ones for their customers. Success hinges on the ability to get everyone on the same page and working toward the same goal. However, without proper tools, this process can seem outdated, slow, and prone to error. There also exists a gap in the common understanding of requirements among stakeholders, especially as requirements evolve over time and changes need to be managed.

title: Mercy lays the foundation for a future of innovation in patient care using Microsoft Azure to unlock insights from data in the cloud
executive_summary: Mercy, one of the largest healthcare systems in the United States, aided its digital transformation by using Microsoft Azure to decrease operational costs, improve the patient experience, and give its providers better access to data. The company wanted to modernize its infrastructure and extract more value from its sizeable data archives to keep up with evolving patient and doctor expectations. With support from Microsoft, Mercy identified business outcomes and undertook a digital transformation to achieve them. On Azure, the company improved efficiency, connected previously siloed data, reduced patient stay durations, and built a foundation for ongoing innovation.

title: Magic Bus provides professional development and life opportunities to young people in India with Microsoft Community Training
executive_summary: With Microsoft Community Training, Magic Bus can deliver interactive and scalable learning experiences to help young people out of poverty, access professional opportunities, and lead successful lives.

title: Recognizing the Essence of AI and Building the Future With Clients: MHI's DI to Create Proprietary Architecture Using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Since its establishment in 1884, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, Ltd. (MHI) has been providing a wide range of products and services in various fields - including energy, engineering, defense and space, and mechanical systems, as a “comprehensive infrastructure company that supports peoples’ lives through engineering and manufacturing”. Among these is the field known as the “Energy Domain,” where the company's gas turbines, boilers, and other power generation equipment, as well as operation and maintenance solutions, support the large-scale power generation facilities that are indispensable to our daily lives.

title: Parker Aerospace writes innovative safety algorithm on Azure Databricks
executive_summary: Parker Aerospace partnered with its customer Republic Airways to better understand how its parts were performing in flight, but it needed to overcome infrastructure challenges that limited its data processing capacity. The company adopted Azure Databricks, reducing processing time from 14 hours to two. This enhanced operational capacity has paved the way for Parker Aerospace to further improve its ability to support aviation operations.

title: Sweco Group empowers its architects and engineers with a timesaving AI assistant built in Azure AI Studio
executive_summary: As one of Europe’s leading architecture and engineering firms, Sweco makes it a priority to empower its more than 22,000 consultants with innovative technology. To free up time for more creative solutions in client projects, Sweco used Microsoft Azure AI Studio to rapidly develop a digital assistant to automate document creation and analysis and enhance search capabilities across the enterprise’s global network. With the assistant, called SwecoGPT, consultants can now find critical project information quickly, create and analyze documents easily, and use the time they save to deliver more personalized service to customers around the world. Consultants are reporting increased productivity and added client value. With the success of SwecoGPT for internal use, the company plans to expand its use of Azure AI Studio to support digital innovation and to create solutions to enhance the customer experience.

title: Kinectify fights financial crime in the gaming world with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The modern gaming industry must protect itself against illegitimate activity. Kinectify, an anti-money laundering (AML) risk management technology company, uses its modern AI-powered platform to collect and analyze millions of daily transactions to detect suspicious activity. Kinectify has been able to build its scalable, robust, Microsoft Azure–powered AML platform with a seamless combination of Azure Cosmos DB, Azure AI Services, Azure Kubernetes Service, and the broader capabilities of Azure cloud services.

title: Canary Speech analyzes conversational speech in near real time, innovating healthcare with Azure
executive_summary: N/A
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure AI Speech, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Front Door, Azure Web Application Firewall, Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Teams

title: Schneider Electric fast-tracks innovation with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Schneider Electric may not be a household name, but it’s the innovative force behind many of the technologies we use every day, in energy management and industrial automation. The company provides productivity-enhancing and energy efficiency solutions around the world, in homes, building, datacenters, electrical grids, and in nearly every aspect of industry. AI is nothing new to Schneider—it’s been carefully experimenting with and using the technology for more than three decades. Now that the necessary infrastructure and supporting technologies have matured to the point where AI is within reach of all of us, Schneider is ready with its own AI-enabled solutions. The company is basing its customer-facing AI solutions on a highly performant technology from a vendor it has trusted for years: Azure OpenAI Service, a solution within Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing.

title: Del Monte Foods improves system uptime by 99.99%, saves 57% on infrastructure, and reduces security risk by 50% with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Del Monte Foods Inc. (Del Monte), a large food producer and distributor, embarked on a digital transformation to optimize its infrastructure and improve its security posture. Constrained by its previous cloud infrastructure, which was costly and complex, Del Monte faced high maintenance costs, limited scalability, performance bottlenecks, and challenges deploying continuous security improvements. To realize the benefits of the cloud while enhancing security, the company migrated its primary business operations system to Microsoft Azure and implemented the Microsoft Defender security stack. Since adopting Microsoft solutions, Del Monte has reduced infrastructure costs, increased system uptime by 99.99%, and reduced security risks by 50%.

executive_summary: The City of Madrid recognized the potential of generative AI to connect with visitors in a new and innovative way to enhance the overall tourist experience and stay at the forefront of technological advancements.

executive_summary: To tackle generative AI challenges, the company has decided to develop their own generative AI platform. Consequently, they've initiated the development of an in-house generative AI system named "DS-GAI (Daiichi Sankyo - Generative AI)."

DEWA has always been an early adopter of technology, creating customer-focused solutions like the High-Water Usage Alert, which notifies customers of unusual consumption to help them detect leakages in water connections. Customer happiness remains consistently at 98%, while internal efficiency continues to soar, demonstrating Dubai’s leadership in modernizing the most fundamental services.

executive_summary: Maryvit School wanted to personalize learning, streamline teaching, and support Thailand’s “Anywhere Anytime” education policy. With limited time and resources, educators needed to balance lesson planning, administrative tasks, and student engagement.

executive_summary: To streamline the vehicle purchasing process for consumers and dealerships, Tekion built Automative Retail Cloud (ARC), a unified, cloud-native platform that uses generative AI.

title: Louisiana State Government boosts efficiency, visibility, and security with Azure Arc
executive_summary: When Louisiana State Government consolidated IT for all its divisions and entities, it wanted observability across its entire estate, on-premises and in the cloud. It adopted Microsoft Azure Arc for maximum visibility, control, and efficiencies.

title: Singing River helps clinicians streamline workflows with Dragon
executive_summary: Singing River needed to upgrade its legacy speech recognition system to access enhanced functionality, simplify application deployment and management, and help clinicians work more efficiently and effectively.

executive_summary: ABN AMRO, one of the Netherlands’ leading banks, sought a comprehensive library of visuals to help its Microsoft Power BI users leverage their data and access a wide range of visualizations for deeper insights.

executive_summary: Mondra Global Limited is passionate about helping food retailers evaluate the environmental impact of the products they stock. However, it often took several weeks or months to compile a lifecycle assessment of just one product.

executive_summary: The Fukuoka SoftBank HAWKS, a professional baseball team in Japan, tried many initiatives to digitally transform its home stadium but couldn’t find a solution that sparked delight. The answer was an AI avatar that leverages Microsoft AI services.

executive_summary: INPEX Corporation pursues a stable supply of low-carbon energy and a responsible energy transition, heeding sustainability and the environment. Digital technology supports our optimized global business expansion and robust security.

title: Spotfire accelerates visual data science with Azure AI Foundry
executive_summary: Enterprises struggle to rapidly access and interpret complex data, with even skilled users facing steep learning curves. Spotfire aims to help enterprises quickly access and analyze their data, resulting in faster and more informed decision making.

executive_summary: Centro de la Familia, a US-based non-profit organization, needed a more efficient reporting system to streamline compliance and reporting to federal and state agencies.

executive_summary: Paraná Banco faced challenges with campaign management and the lack of autonomy on the previous platform, resulting in high operating costs and low efficiency. The institution was looking for a flexible and scalable solution to optimize the customer experience.

executive_summary: Paraná Banco faced challenges with campaign management and the lack of autonomy on the previous platform, resulting in high operating costs and low efficiency. The institution was looking for a flexible and scalable solution to optimize the customer experience.

title: See how Microsoft Azure empowered Thomas Concrete Group to drive its industry into the modern era
executive_summary: Construction is big business, and Thomas Concrete Group is an independent, family-owned and forward-looking concrete producer in that industry. The company was established 1955 in Karlstad, Sweden and today operates in the United States, Germany, Poland, Sweden, and Norway. Thomas Concrete Group does not only provide customers with high quality concrete products but also services, that is key in Team Thomas’ position as the Concrete Specialists. These services also need to be available digitally to support customers throughout the different phases of a construction project. To stay competitive, company decided to adopt cloud-driven solutions that had yet to emerge in the more traditional construction industry.

title: Bühler Group enables intelligent manufacturing insights for a safer, greener tomorrow
executive_summary: For over 100 years, Switzerland-based multinational Bühler Group has been manufacturing industrial equipment and technology to automate the production of nutritional products. With market-leading positions in the pasta, chocolate, wheat, maize, rice, and milling segments, billions of people worldwide consume products the quality of which relies on the performance of Bühler solutions. Now, with the help of the Bühler Insights platform and Microsoft Azure Data Explorer, Bühler’s customers are finding new ways to optimize their operations, reducing waste and energy usage, while increasing output.

title: Nestlé prevents cybersecurity threats with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Nestlé is the largest food and beverage company in the world. Like many global enterprises, fending off phishing campaigns across its massive footprint was a daily battle. After initial solutions left the company swimming in false positives, it built PhishScreener, a custom solution that uses Microsoft Azure DevOps and Azure Machine Learning to quickly uncover phishing before an employee clicks a malicious link. As a result, Nestlé has reduced false positives, sped up detection times, and increased its overall phishing coverage.

title: Immigrant Services Society of British Columbia gains insights and automation with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Immigrant Services Society of British Columbia (ISSofBC) aids new Canadians in their pursuit of an integrated, productive life in British Columbia. In an effort to better understand each of the thousands of people who take advantage of its services, ISSofBC adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Power Platform. ISSofBC’s objective was to build a solution that provided greater data visibility, real-time analytics, and a more comprehensive, 360-degree view of each client.

title: Digital India engages with citizens at scale to provide critical COVID-19 information using AI-enabled chatbot
executive_summary: Digital India Corporation, an organization under Ministry of Electronics and IT, Government of India, delivers important government services electronically. During the COVID-19 crisis, MyGov, which is a key initiative under Digital India for citizen engagement, was tasked to communicate essential public health information to citizens. MyGov built a chatbot using Microsoft Power Virtual Agents to help citizens to quickly find answers to their questions. It reduced load on phone and email, made critical information readily available to educate the public and helped minimize the spread of COVID-19, and positioned itself to scale other government communications.

title: Airbus accelerates innovation with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: Aerospace pioneer Airbus innovates constantly, meeting the needs of its aerospace and defense customers with complex, cutting-edge solutions. Its latest advances include two groundbreaking innovations that use Azure AI solutions to reimagine pilot training and predict aircraft maintenance issues. And thanks to containers, Airbus engineering teams can provide the air gapped solutions its most stringently regulated customers need.

title: Over 5 million consumers and 50 banks get closer with IndiaLends platform, powered by Azure and Microsoft AI
executive_summary: As the customer base started growing, so did the stress on the code base and complexity of the platform infrastructure. The majority of the team’s time was being spent on the maintenance and upkeep of the infrastructure, instead of scaling to meet market demand. IndiaLends collaborated with Microsoft to accelerate its transformation, and took advantage of a host of services on Microsoft Azure. The processing time for transactions has gone down by 40 percent alongside a heightened efficiency among the developers by 75 percent. Accurate recommendations have led to faster checkouts and significantly reduced internal processing time by 50 percent.

title: Scandinavian Airlines reduces loyalty program fraud with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: To derive meaningful business value from the wealth of data it generates every day, Scandinavian Airlines (SAS) uses Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to make predictive models to improve everyday operations and identify patterns in the company’s data. From reducing fresh food waste to cutting down on fraud in its EuroBonus loyalty program, SAS is harnessing the power of its data using Azure Machine Learning and its responsible machine learning capabilities, including model interpretability and explainability. These capabilities help data scientists understand models better, create transparency about their processes, build trust in machine learning solutions, and create better customer experiences.

title: PwC helps make compliance easier, automates regulatory obligation identification with Microsoft Azure Cognitive Search
executive_summary: The thorniest business problems fall away when a leading tax, assurance, and consulting firm combines its business insights and technical savvy with Microsoft solutions. PwC AI turned to Microsoft Azure Functions to create a scalable API for its regulatory obligation knowledge mining solution. It also uses Azure Cognitive Search to quickly surface predictions found by the solution, embedding years of experience into an AI model that easily identifies regulatory obligations within text. The proof of concept (POC) that it created, soon to launch, could be a sea change in how companies understand their regulatory obligations, reducing the time to identify relevant regulations from months to seconds.

title: Danske Statsbaner’s increases productivity up to 30% with help from Microsoft AI solutions
executive_summary: Danske Statsbaner (DSB), the largest rail operator in Denmark and Scandinavia, wanted to find ways GenAI could help solve a variety of operational issues, including the proliferation of graffiti in tunnels and on trains.

title: healow evolves healthcare provider and patient engagement with Azure AI Foundry
executive_summary: healow manages more than 50 million patient communications for its customers. The reality today is that healthcare staff are overwhelmed and not able to provide patients the support they expect when they need it, while delivering quality care.

title: Assembly Software saves law firms up to 25 hours per case with Azure
executive_summary: Law firms face challenges in efficiency, limiting the amount of time attorneys and staff can spend with clients. A leading provider of legal software, Assembly Software set out to simplify caseload workflow and redefine how legal professionals work.

title: Accenture champions responsible AI, gains faster time to market with Azure AI Foundry
executive_summary: Accenture needed to move beyond generative AI demos to deploy real, enterprise-grade applications that were scalable, explainable, and compliant—capable of meeting strict governance, safety, and performance demands across diverse client use cases.

title: D-ID enables 100x growth and scales its digital avatars globally with Azure AI Services
executive_summary: D-ID enables companies to use lifelike digital avatars for communication, training, support, and more. It needed a partner that offered enterprise-grade security, global scalability, and a shared commitment to ethical, responsible AI.

title: Japanese trading house takes advantage of SAP S/4HANA conversion to move to Azure
executive_summary: Inabata & Co., Ltd. updated its SAP enterprise resource planning solution, engaging IT partner Mitsui Knowledge Industry (MKI) to standardize on SAP Business Suite 4 SAP HANA across the global organization. Inabata also switched from the SAP cloud to Microsoft Azure for its interoperability and reliability and deployed Azure Site Recovery to keep its apps running during planned and unplanned outages. MKI migrated Inabata’s systems with minimal downtime, sparking a new business performing similar migrations.

title: Collectius improves customer experience and productivity and supports growth through Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Power Pages
executive_summary: As a financial restructuring company, Collectius provides their customers with a fresh start on their finances. With growing demand and new portfolios acquired, Collectius found that their collection platform and system no longer met their needs and vision. They then turned to Microsoft Dynamics 365 to provide the functionalities they needed. This proved to be a crucial decision, as it supported the growth of their business and even paved the way for a new self-service offer.

title: Mitie: Leveraging Microsoft Azure for the Modern Workplace
executive_summary: Mitie is one of the UK's leading facilities management and professional services companies. It manages and maintains some of the nation's most recognised landmarks from its headquarters in London’s Shard. With the goal of helping its customers be exceptional every day, the award-winning business is currently supporting organisations across the UK to return to the workplace safely, productively and efficiently following the disruption of COVID-19.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Power BI

title: Ukraine’s Naftogaz powers up collaboration and security with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Founded in 1998, Naftogaz is Ukraine’s largest vertically integrated energy company. On a drive to streamline and unify communication channels, the oil and gas major implemented Microsoft 365 as a solution. The shift to cloud technology took several steps, with careful analysis of risks and outcomes before finally being implemented. Today, the company has greater workplace mobility and advanced cloud security supporting its operations.

title: University of Pardubice enhances security and collaboration with Azure and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Founded in 1950, the University of Pardubice is home to 7,000 students from all over the globe. The Czech university brings together the best of creative human potential and advanced technologies. Needing to enhance security and ensure continued teaching in the face of the disruptions, the university switched to Azure and Microsoft 365 in the early days of the global pandemic. During the lockdown and isolation, more than 70 percent of its classes were taught via Microsoft Teams. The university takes pride in its streamlined operations, setting up seamless communication and bolstering end-to-end security.

title: Pittella ramps up digital tech to meet heightened customer expectations
executive_summary: In an era when customer experience is everything, Pittella understood the importance of leveraging world-class customer relationship management (CRM) that enables the manufacturer to keep pace with growing customer expectations in the marketplace. Pittella's sales team needed to maintain awareness of their clients and having a dedicated CRM solution that provides great sales visibility and forecasting was critical to better decision-making. That's when Microsoft Gold partner MicroChannel stepped in to make it all happen with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales.

title: Bridgestone proves how Azure high-performance computing can enhance the sustainability, efficiency, and flexibility of virtual tire development
executive_summary: Bridgestone EMEA is the regional Strategic Business Unit of Bridgestone Corporation, a global leader in tires and rubber, building on its expertise to provide solutions for safe and sustainable mobility. Bridgestone offers a diverse product portfolio of premium tires and advanced solutions backed by innovative technologies. When its high-performance computing (HPC) infrastructure began to reach capacity during periods of peak usage, the company began looking into the potential of Microsoft Azure for HPC as a supplemental resource. After a successful proof of concept, Bridgestone now sees Azure for HPC as increasing the sustainability and agility of its product development process, and it’s already looking into ways to move more resources to the cloud over time.

title: ERA Arqueologia manages projects, clients, and sales via the Microsoft cloud
executive_summary: In 1996, extraordinary archeological discoveries were made that changed the history of Herdade do Esporão in Reguengos de Monsaraz, Portugal—and the Perdigões Archaeological Complex was born. After 24 years of managing the site, ERA Arqueologia observed a major shift in its client base, and the organization realized that it needed a solution to oversee client relationships. Archaeology and heritage are key components of the company's day-to-day activities, and for managing and monitoring its projects, clients, sales, business opportunities, and teams, ERA collaborated with myPartner to implement Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales.

title: Microsoft helps China Molybdenum to set sail and navigate overseas
executive_summary: As a state-owned enterprise with beginnings in Henan Province, China Molybdenum (CMOC) has actively pursued a strategy of "going global" for many years, with its modern mining model of "mineral resources plus trading" and industry-leading environmental, social, and governance standards. After having made five major asset acquisitions overseas, CMOC has become a diversified, world-class asset portfolio company, ranked among the top players in the international mining industry.
products: Azure, Azure Cloud Services, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Power Apps

title: Sanitas leaps to the cloud and leverages the potential of Microsoft digital selling
executive_summary: Spanish health and wellness specialist Sanitas Seguros is undertaking a digital transformation journey aimed at optimizing the way it offers products and services to its clients. Key to this has been migrating to the Azure cloud and implementing Dynamics 365, helping the organization to create an automated, data-centric digital sales platform.

title: An AI view of the construction site: GOLDBECK and HoloBuilder detect defects using automated documentation with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: It is almost impossible to manage a construction site without being physically present. All kinds of tasks and trades have to be coordinated, controlled, and documented. A demanding job, where carelessness and corrective measures can eat into resources and delay completion. This is why GOLDBECK employs the solution provided by German-American start-up HoloBuilder, which combines 360° images with artificial intelligence to document and analyze construction progress. In 2020, Roland Berger and Microsoft honored GOLDBECK and HoloBuilder with the Intelligent Manufacturing Award for the solution.

title: "Rewriting the rulebook on Student Record Systems at TEDI-London"
executive_summary: TEDI-London is a new higher education provider for future engineers, co-founded by Arizona State University, King's College London and UNSW Sydney. It will accept its first student cohort in September 2021, welcoming them to a newly built campus in London’s Canada Water. To enable this, the TEDI-London team worked with ANS Group and Microsoft to build a modern, end-to-end student record system from the ground up, using the power of Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the Microsoft Higher Education Accelerator. Choosing these tools enabled the TEDI-London team to create and deploy the solution they needed within nine months.

title: Pheasey Park Farm Primary School brings learning to life with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Pheasey Park Farm Primary School in Great Barr, Birmingham, seeks to inspire its pupils to “believe and achieve”. Part of the Elston Hall Learning Trust group of schools, the school was recently selected by the UK Department for Education to be an EdTech demonstrator school.

title: KFH accelerates their digital transformation with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: KFH realised that by migrating to Microsoft 365 it could achieve the seemingly contrary objectives of becoming more mobile and building a more robust security posture. Users have adopted the software to support their own business practices and ways of working.

title: illumiSonics is working to accelerate real-time, touchless laser research geared to revolutionizing medical imaging with Azure
executive_summary: illumiSonics is a newly founded but quickly growing medical technology company dedicated to developing the Photoacoustic Remote Sensing (PARS) imaging system for a variety of preclinical and clinical applications. While attempting to source a powerful, GPU-powered server for its research projects, the company realized that no amount of onsite hardware would fit its rapidly scaling needs. Instead, illumiSonics adopted Microsoft Azure. Leveraging the Research Center of Excellence on Cloud, the company expects to accelerate its research outcomes, potentially revolutionizing histopathology and ophthalmology, and bringing more precise diagnostics and surgeries to patients and healthcare professionals.

title: Microsoft Azure helps business harness the power of AI for social impact
executive_summary: The partnership of Social Tech Trust and Microsoft for Startups seeks to realise some of the opportunities presented by using AI to solve some of the world’s biggest challenges. Kathy Marcham, Portfolio Manager Social Tech Trust, explains: “We created a programme that enables these purposeful founders to not only create world-class technology but to also develop their commercial skills and their social business acumen.”

title: Cycle Agarbatti automates HR tasks, boosts employee efficiency by 40% with factoHR on Azure cloud
executive_summary: Cycle Agarbatti, the largest manufacturer of incense sticks in the world, needed a modern HR solution to keep up with its evolving business and technological needs. By adopting the cloud-based modern workplace solution by factoHR using Microsoft Azure, Cycle Agarbatti improved its employee efficiency and productivity by 40 percent. The mobile-driven, plug-and-play features of factoHR combined with Azure platform capabilities helped the fragrance creator streamline and automate its weekly payroll process and track attendance and business expenses along with other recurring office tasks. This paved the way for Cycle Agarbatti to continue to live up to its commitment to employees and customers and honor the legacy of three generations.

title: For Procter & Gamble, data is at the heart of digital transformation
executive_summary: For more than 180 years, Procter & Gamble (P&G) has built a thriving business by challenging norms and delighting consumers. Its range of household products, from toothpaste and soap to paper towels and laundry detergent, can be found in millions of homes—in nearly every country on Earth.

title: Metrie increases customer response times, overall agility with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Metrie, a leading manufacturer and distributor of interior finishings for North America, needed to expand the capabilities of its SAP infrastructure. The problem was, the company’s existing cloud provider couldn’t cope with the new demand. Working with Qnovate, Metrie moved its SAP estate—core to almost every element of the business—to Microsoft Azure.
