The move not only granted the scalability required for future functionalities, but it gave the company back the control and security over its operations that aging cloud infrastructure had begun to erode.

title: Saint Peter’s Healthcare System modernizes processes to better fulfill its mission with Microsoft Teams and Surface
executive_summary: Saint Peter’s Healthcare System struggled with the cost and complexity of using many different tools and platforms, as well as the inefficiency of manual, time-consuming processes. Fortunately, a strong, mission-based culture has helped IT leaders at Saint Peter’s focus on digital transformation that empowers employees and improves patient outcomes. As a result, they have improved collaboration with Teams and started a pilot program with Surface that brings a fresh approach to making clinical rounds. They will also be working closely with Microsoft as they look to the future and explore how Azure can help streamline their infrastructure in the search for new ways to achieve their mission.

title: AxFina finds speed and regulation with Azure migration
executive_summary: When central and eastern Europe focused asset and loan servicer AxFina Holding SA acquired Hungarian leasing company Lombard Lízing Zrt., it had just a few weeks to replace Lombard’s infrastructure, which had reached the end of its life cycle. With AxFina’s desire to innovate and scale and regulatory requirements looming, it turned to Hungarian IT company DIGITAL Kft. to help AxFina migrate the entirety of its IT applications to the cloud. Microsoft Azure became the ideal solution to help ensure that AxFina maintained security, regulatory compliance, and speed.

title: Rabobank grows a safer global IT landscape with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: With agricultural and food industry clients around the world, Rabobank has a widespread IT estate to protect. The bank’s mission of “Growing a better world together” hinges on a blend of innovation and strong ethical principles. For the Rabobank Cyber Defense Center, that means securing a vast and disparate hybrid, multicloud environment. Not content to merely keep up, Rabobank rolled out Microsoft Security solutions to implement proactive, effective security and compliance—all while optimizing cost and security team productivity.

title: Customer engagement enhanced with cloud-based analytics and AI
executive_summary: 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. helps customers express, connect and celebrate with the help of SAS® Viya® on Azure. Personalized marketing helps the e-commerce retailer provide an exceptional customer experience, building meaningful connections with 14 million customers (as of 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. Fiscal Year 2021).

title: The Association of Waterworks in Denmark creates a safe hybrid workplace with iGlobe's Office2SharePoint for Outlook and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Most waterworks in Denmark are organized as cooperatives. Danske Vandværker (DVV) is the Association of Waterworks in Denmark, and its members deliver 40 percent of the total amount of water abstraction across Denmark. DVV’s purpose is to promote the views and interests of water cooperatives to the public, the authorities, and the politicians.

title: Azure helps Avanade build retail solutions to change the world
executive_summary: Learn how the Avanade Intelligent Store framework, built on Microsoft Azure, brings added value to store employees and allows stores to better engage with their customers—all while delivering the retail experiences that customers want.

title: Elkjøp creates a superior customer experience with Azure Kubernetes Service
executive_summary: As the biggest electronics retailer in the Nordics, Elkjøp has never had trouble attracting customers into its stores. But with so much focus on the shop floor, Elkjøp’s IT systems had been left in the dark, using outdated e-commerce and point of sale (POS) platforms that hadn’t been upgraded for the future. The Next Generation Retail project aimed to change all that, with an overhaul of every Elkjøp system to modernize functionality and move all its core business into the cloud—a revolutionary shift for this retailer that also helped it navigate the social-distancing challenges of 2020.

title: Tetra Pak enhances its industry advantage and sustainability goals with Azure IoT
executive_summary: Since inventing a ground-breaking way to package milk nearly 70 years ago, Tetra Pak has become a global leader in food processing and packaging. In 2020, the company sold more than 183 billion packages—that means 183 billion cartons of fresh milk, juice, and other foods were enjoyed all over the world thanks to Tetra Pak’s iconic packaging.

title: Sage Automotive increases efficiency and production using Mariner’s Spyglass Visual Inspection and Microsoft Azure to monitor defects
executive_summary: Sage Automotive Interiors, a longtime global manufacturer of high-performance automotive interior fabrics, needed to solve a quality problem with its material. Sage worked with Microsoft partner Mariner to deploy Spyglass Visual Inspection, an AI, IoT, and deep-learning solution that utilizes Microsoft Azure IoT Hub and other Azure services. Sage started with a proof of concept, and the digital transformation leader at the company was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to build the first deep-learning model, then scale with Azure. Using Mariner’s Spyglass Visual Inspection product, Sage is now able to run its production lines faster, increasing efficiency and quality standards across the board.

title: SONEM sensors create efficiencies in the beer brewing process using Microsoft Azure IoT Edge
executive_summary: Germany has a unique brewery landscape. Besides its traditional breweries, for some years now a growing number of craft beer breweries have been supplying the market with an even greater variety of beers. The ultrasonic sensors from SONEM Solutions GmbH help breweries of any size improve the efficiency of their brewing processes. These autonomous sensors use the industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) to continuously collect data during the production process, ensuring beer quality by comparing this data with a reference measurement—in real time and with zero contact. A joint case study looked at how, using AIT GmbH & Co. KG’s Smart Edge—a set of building blocks based on Microsoft Azure IoT Edge—and the appropriate hardware from MOXA Europe GmbH, the collected data can be preprocessed on the edge side and then analyzed and visualized in detail in the cloud.

title: Full transparency: Systrion develops a Product Information Hub for the consumer goods and food industries based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Allergens, nutritional values, ingredients: consumers are casting an increasingly critical eye over what’s in their food, while also choosing more and more vegetarian and vegan products. A wide range of information, known as product master data, is needed to describe a food product. To ensure customers have access to this information, food manufacturers have generally had to enter the data separately for each individual product, as well as for each different retailer or e-commerce platform selling that product – a laborious task that was prone to error. Systrion AG takes a different approach with its Product Information Hub, which allows manufacturers to share product master data efficiently and accurately, all around the world. This state-of-the-art and scalable Software as a Service (SaaS) is based on Microsoft Azure.

title: Hospital Jihlava frees six months of medical staff’s time, enhancing patient-centric care with Azure
executive_summary: Hospital Jihlava in the Czech Republic keeps pace with technological advances, delivering patient-centric services to more than 350,000 patients each year. It has adopted Microsoft 365 and Azure services to ensure business continuity, unburden physicians from manual tasks, and expedite care to patients. The implementation prepared the hospital to tackle the challenges of COVID-19 and ensure seamless operation during lockdowns. The facility has since saved thousands of hours for medical personnel, reduced emergency room waiting time, and empowered healthcare workers to save more lives.

title: NOVA Chemicals builds resiliency and agility with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: NOVA Chemicals, a chemicals and plastic resins manufacturer headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, makes products used in food and electronics packaging, industrial materials, appliances, and consumer goods. With a focus on innovation and shaping a world where the plastic products vital to our health and happiness are better tomorrow than they are today, NOVA Chemicals prides itself on taking a responsible approach to the plastics manufacturing process and setting itself apart in the market with world-class products, best-in-class technical expertise, and exceptional customer service. To do all of that successfully, it needs resilient, highly secure technology that can keep up with its business needs and goals.

title: Focus and alignment: How Microsoft uses OKRs to achieve business goals
executive_summary: Several years ago, teams at Microsoft started tracking objectives and key results (OKRs), giving them a clarity of purpose and establishing a practice that quickly saw grassroots adoption across the organization in groups like Marketing, Sales, and Engineering. This widespread adoption of OKRs, along with a company focus on delivering employee experience solutions to customers, led Microsoft to purchase leading OKR software company Ally.io, which is now available to Microsoft customers as Viva Goals, part of the Viva employee experience platform. Today, Teams throughout Microsoft use Viva Goals to help them drive company objectives such as growth, diversity, and employee wellbeing.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Viva Goals

title: Celcom gets the message across with Attack simulation training in Defender for Office 365
executive_summary: Leading telecommunications company Celcom counted itself lucky not to have experienced a major cyberattack, but it had concerns about the evolving threat landscape and phishing emails. Knowing that corporate security is only as strong as the least-informed user, Celcom set out to change its culture through a strong awareness and training program. Since launching Attack simulation training in Microsoft Defender for Office 365, the company has saved 70 percent of the time it used to spend on creating simulations manually.

title: Bekaert migrates virtual desktops to Azure, builds highly secure, agile, connected workplace
executive_summary: From twenty-first-century office towers to car tires and champagne corks, steel wire holds the modern world together. To help the world work, travel, play, and meet the opportunities of the future, Bekaert, a global leader in steel wire transformation and coating technologies, wanted to modernize its technology infrastructure by moving to the cloud from on-premises datacenters.

title: Fujitsu delivers sustainable innovation and customer success with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Fujitsu is a leading information and technology full-service provider that helps its enterprise customers build the type of lasting, sustainable change that drives business success. Fujitsu connects people, ideas, expertise, and support capabilities with leading-edge technologies, like SAP, to provide its clients with game-changing solutions.

title: ACI Worldwide reimagines convenience for bank customers—reduces onboarding time from weeks to minutes
executive_summary: When ACI investigated how to create greater value for its customers, it identified two possibilities: faster creation of the infrastructure needed by merchants who need their software to transmit transactions to financial institutions—often a matter of weeks—and providing rich customer intelligence for valuable opportunity insight. The far-ranging benefits of the cloud over on-premise datacenters, along with the ability to use highly efficient open-source solutions like Linux on Azure, sealed the deal for ACI. By freeing organizations to focus their expertise and energies on developing added-value payment features and functions on top of standardizing related operational and security capabilities, Azure dramatically accelerates time to market.
products: Azure, Linux on Azure

title: 3M standardizes, automates, and accelerates sales forecasting with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: 3M brings science to life through innovative products for home, business, and industrial customers. As a large, global company, 3M needed to standardize on an easily automated mechanism for sales forecasting to replace the multiple and highly manual methods in use across the enterprise. By adopting Microsoft Azure Machine Learning and other Azure AI services, 3M has been able to develop, train, and implement 1,500 custom models for each of its regions and divisions. These models deliver timely insights for finance, sales, and marketing employees and executives, while freeing them from time-consuming manual data manipulation tasks.

title: Wellness Forever cuts time to data availability from days to minutes leveraging Azure services
executive_summary: Established in 2008, Wellness Forever Medicare Limited (Wellness Forever) is a retail pharmacy chain with more than 300 stores across Maharashtra, Goa and Karnataka, employing 4,500 people. The business is currently making strides in the omnichannel space.

title: Swapping carbon paper for tablets: Shredding expert WEIMA restructures its global processes with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: WEIMA’s industrial shredders are used by companies worldwide to break down and compress huge quantities of plastic, wood, paper, and metal—helping preserve the environment. Because a resource-efficient value chain doesn’t stop at waste management. The family-owned company, based in Baden-Württemberg, has set itself the goal of making machines that mark the start of a sustainable, global recycling process. Determined to remain competitive in the future, too, WEIMA has restructured its digital processes. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 as its global, cloud-based CRM system, the company is harmonizing and improving its processes in the areas of customer service, field work, and sales.

title: Manufacturing group Dextra revamps customer relationships with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Dextra is a global leader in the construction and industrial infrastructure and development supply sector working with multiple construction conglomerates. With 14 offices around the globe, the company needed a cohesive system for customer management. Dextra upgraded to Dynamics 365, merging all customer data into a single source. Since deployment, there has been a significant reduction in costs and an increase in salespeople efficiency.

title: Anglian Water creates the workplace of the future with Microsoft Surface
executive_summary: Anglian Water is a water company operating in the East of England. It serves more than six million customers with water and sewerage services. Like many businesses, it rapidly transitioned many office-based staff to working from home in response to COVID-19. After six months, when it became clear that working from home would be a long-term response, the management team at Anglian Water reached out to colleagues to see how the new arrangements were working and to ensure that they had everything they needed to work well.

title: Avromed unifies data sources with Microsoft 365 and Azure
executive_summary: Avromed is Azerbaijan’s largest importer of pharmaceutical products, with headquarters in Baku. The company’s mission is to provide healthcare institutions and the population of Azerbaijan with high-quality essential pharmaceuticals. To scale up its distribution, Avromed needed to manage and process large amounts of data effectively. It built a new data ecosystem based on Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 to centralize collaboration and communication while relying on secure cloud storage and analytics. The team now has greater visibility across the organization with live reporting and effective data management, helping it stock and deliver much-needed products to customers across the country.

title: Meratus optimizes operations with Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Meratus is Indonesia’s leading integrated maritime and logistics company. In 2018, the company set out on a digital transformation journey to increase internal efficiency and improve workplace agility. It has since implemented Microsoft cloud solutions across various business processes. As a result, Meratus has enabled workplace mobility, cut performance complaints, and reduced infrastructure costs significantly.

title: University of Bath turbocharges academic research with Azure HPC + AI
executive_summary: At University of Bath, academic researchers work hard on difficult issues, from pharmaceutical development to astrophysics. While one team builds digital simulations of chemical reactions that will help reduce the time and cost of drug trials, another conducts blue-sky research to determine strategies for processing the literally cosmic volume of data that will come from future telescopes. Meanwhile, other teams may be working on climate change or public health.

title: Facilitating Better Business Decisions with Azure
executive_summary: Facq is a Belgium-based provider of sanitary, heating, and renewable energies distribution for professionals in the construction sector with 46 points of sale across the country. The company wanted to better enable its point-of-sale leaders to make informed decisions with the right data at the right time. To do this, they partnered with element61, a Microsoft partner and data analytics provider servicing Belgium, and built a business insights platform powered by Microsoft Azure. Today, Facq has been able to use this tool to solidify its presence in the market and ensure that its inventory levels are proactively managed. This is all thanks to their new platform and the culture of data-driven decision making that’s at the heart of this business.

title: Powering the modern way of working in the industrial sector with Surface Hubs & Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Like many organisations, the unprecedented shift to remote working during the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic accelerated change at RS Group.

title: The assmann gruppe keeps work simple with officeatwork Template Chooser for Teams in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Ensuring that everyone has the latest templates creates a sense of consistency across the assmann gruppe. With up to 11 departments involved in any project, maintaining version consistency was always a challenge. With the officeatwork Template Chooser, the correct template is now available in the app where they’re working, and relevant information is automatically filled in. Today, the latest version of any template is readily available, which guarantees that customers always experience a consistent look and feel from communications.

title: L’Oréal rapidly deploys Windows 11 Enterprise, enhancing productivity and security
executive_summary: For more than 100 years, L’Oréal has focused on providing the best beauty products on the planet for quality, efficacy, and safety. Delivering on that mission has made L’Oréal the largest cosmetics brand in the world, with an annual revenue of €29.8 billion. Maintaining that success requires constant investment in beauty tech such as AI-powered skin diagnostic tools and 3D-printed packaging. “We’re always striving to change the future of beauty, which means going beyond products to improve experiences and services for our customers,” says Guillaume Pires, Global Modern Workplace Director at L’Oréal. “With Windows 11 Enterprise, we can deliver a more secure environment to protect our innovations and support our employees with innovative experiences so they can do their best work.”

title: Modernizing Microsoft 365 with a move to Windows containers on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Jack Daniel’s Tennessee Whiskey maker saves thousands of work hours using RPA functionality in Power Automate
executive_summary: For more than 150 years, Brown-Forman Corporation has built a robust beverage alcohol product line that includes familiar brands such as Jack Daniel’s Tennessee Whiskey, Herradura, and Korbel. When a global process owner in Master Data Management needed to find an alternative to a repetitive, manual process, the firm’s Continuous Improvement Digital Transformation team used the robotic process automation (RPA) functionality in Microsoft Power Automate to convert a lower-value task to an automated process. The team has saved thousands of hours in the first seven months.

title: Azure Data Explorer analyzes petabytes of data to power Microsoft 365 Defender’s integrated threat security
executive_summary: The Microsoft engineering team constantly develops new scenarios for its Microsoft 365 Defender enterprise defense suite. To improve the data exploration capabilities underlying their product, the engineers switched to Azure Data Explorer (ADX) analytics service. The move immediately improved query latencies and enabled unprecedented analytics speeds while reducing ownership costs by more than 50 percent. Today, thousands of companies worldwide benefit from the reinforced Microsoft 365 Defender cybersecurity solution.

title: Slovenian government institution empowers field workers to be more efficient with Power Platform
executive_summary: Based in Ljubljana, the Labor Inspectorate of the Republic of Slovenia (IRSD) is in charge of overseeing compliance with labor and social legislation. One of the entity’s goals is to provide exceptional employee care and modern digitized processes. When the COVID-19 pandemic hit the country, the institution needed to monitor the implementation of the Infectious Diseases Act (ZNB). Using an app based on Microsoft Power Apps and integrated with Microsoft Teams, IRSD inspectors can accomplish their daily tasks 30 percent faster, and from anywhere.

title: Music Tribe tunes in to a culture of learning with Microsoft Viva Learning
executive_summary: As a global audio business, Music Tribe knows the value of listening. With customers who range from amateur musicians who are pursuing a hobby at home to well-known artists on tour, the organization has made its name responding to customer needs. Music Tribe calls this its “customer obsession,” which also extends to its internal customers—Music Tribe employees. With that in mind, the company asked its employees directly what they needed to be their most empowered and creative. The answer was loud and clear: more opportunities to learn.

title: CodeTwo and Microsoft 365 make a strong brand identity possible for CTOS
executive_summary: Custom Truck One Source (CTOS) started in 1996 with 15 employees as the first single-source provider of specialized truck and heavy equipment. Encouraged by its growth across North America, CTOS felt the need to standardize employees' email signatures and to strengthen brand identity in email correspondence. An internet search led them to Microsoft Partner of the Year CodeTwo and its CodeTwo Email Signatures for Office 365 solution in AppSource. The Azure-based app integrated automatically with CTOS’s Microsoft 365 environment, unifying all signatures in just a few hours and driving significant time and cost savings.

title: University of Toronto unlocks visibility, operational efficiencies running SAP on Azure
executive_summary: As Canada’s largest university and a global leader in research, the University of Toronto brings out the best in its students, faculty, staff, alumni, and greater community through world-class and hands-on teaching, training, and technology.

title: Microsoft upgrades its employee learning experience with Viva
executive_summary: To help develop a learning culture, Microsoft HR has invested heavily in its learning platform and content. About two years ago, the company started a project to revamp its employee learning experience. The project sought to empower employees, using self-directed training options and intelligent recommendations to help them gain necessary skills for their career goals. By transitioning to Viva Learning, Microsoft employees are now able to find and complete training in the flow of their work across Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365. Most employees are taking advantage of this new streamlined learning experience with 169,000 monthly active users - about 80% of Microsoft's employee population. Since the rollout of Viva Learning earlier this year, the number of employees who have taken two or more elective learning courses in a month has increased by 58 percent.

title: NETCONFIG helps SMB customer Rodel succeed with Microsoft 365 Business Premium and Microsoft Defender for Business
executive_summary: NETCONFIG is proof that success doesn’t depend on size. Based in Durban, South Africa, the managed service provider (MSP) and IT outsource company built a highly profitable business based exclusively on small and medium-sized business (SMB) customers. The company found the key to its own success in Microsoft 365 Business Premium, which aligns with the new Defender for Business for amplified security, along with Microsoft 365 Lighthouse, the solutions it uses to unlock opportunities for its SMB customers—companies like Rodel Financial Services. It’s a new age of flexibility, productivity, and heightened security for Rodel. “We’re in a stronger position than ever before,” says Andrew Church, Managing Director, Rodel Financial Services. “Our Microsoft technology has been critical for our survival, and it’s the best investment we’ve ever made in our business.”

title: The sky is the limit: Nürnberger Baugruppe migrates its data center to the cloud and relies on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Companies from all areas of value creation in the construction industry make up the Nürnberger Baugruppe, including builders, civil engineers, and property developers. There are also IT service providers, such as BRZ. Specializing in organization and construction informatics, this company operates a data center, provides construction ERP developed in-house as well as outsourcing services, and runs a training academy. In September 2019, BRZ took a strategic decision to use true cloud solutions for its ERP software with a view to providing key players in the construction business with optimum support during their digital transformation. As a result, BRZ migrated its own data center to the Microsoft Azure cloud platform. This was accompanied by the launch of BRZ 365—the company’s own cloud-native ERP platform for the construction industry.

title: Singaporean cloud communications provider makes security a team sport with Microsoft Defender
executive_summary: As a leading communications provider in the Asia-Pacific region, Toku helps companies streamline their workflows and optimize customer experiences by moving their business communications to the cloud. The Singapore-based company needed a cost-efficient endpoint security solution that would help implement the zero trust strategy company-wide. It turned to Microsoft 365 Defender to eliminate cyber threats. Today, Toku enjoys enterprise-grade protection against cyberattacks and boasts high scores on IT security and compliance, cementing trust among its customers as a result.

title: IGEL Technology: Microsoft Dynamics 365 accelerates transformation into a software provider
executive_summary: IGEL, a company known in Germany for decades primarily as a manufacturer of thin-client hardware, has achieved international success in recent years mainly as a provider of a secure, powerful, and easy-to-manage operating system for cloud workspaces. Now, to support its transformation into a software provider, IGEL is turning to Microsoft Dynamics 365, the Subscription Billing Suite add-on from Binary Stream, and Power Platform to deliver automated end-to-end order processing (order-to-cash) with flexible subscriptions.

title: Social services nonprofit Barnardo’s enhances client support through Microsoft technology
executive_summary: United Kingdom–based nonprofit Barnardo’s connects hundreds of thousands of families and children in need with valuable social services each year. To best make those connections, Barnardo’s must ensure that employees have the technology they need to work efficiently and accurately, and the organization also needs to show potential donors that its work has a concrete impact. By deploying Microsoft Cloud technologies and Microsoft Surface devices, Barnardo’s has helped employees be more effective in the field, and it has gained valuable reporting capabilities that have been essential in securing funding to meet the increased demand for services during COVID-19.

title: AB InBev GCC Uses Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI for E2E Automation and Increasing Efficiency
executive_summary: While AB InBev’s Command Center team was already using Power BI for all their visualization needs, they were sourcing data from numerous large excel files and the system was unable to handle high volumes of data. Since AB In-Bev was already using Power BI, choosing Azure Synapse to support their data platform made the most sense, as Synapse seamlessly integrates with Power BI and the rest of the Microsoft ecosystem. With an automated back end supported by Azure Synapse and Data visualization supported by Power BI, AB InBev has the powerful, competitive edge that empowers users to focus on decision making and react to the market even quicker.

title: Vietnamese food and beverage company improves system safety and speed
executive_summary: With its headquarters in Thuan An City, URC Vietnam is part of Universal Robina Corporation (URC). It has 60 years of experience across the ASEAN and Oceania regions is a pioneer in the food and beverage industry. The company aims to create “the perfect products for the consumer’s absolute satisfaction”. So, when the time came to make some digital improvements, URC Vietnam decided that for the safety of its partner and customer data, moving its Virtual WAN and Distributor Management System (DMS) to the Microsoft Azure cloud was the natural next step. All their digital operations are now faster and more secure.

title: Synergy WorldWide powers daily standups and developer productivity with virtual scrum master Geekbot and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Operating in more than 40 countries, Synergy WorldWide formulates, manufactures, and distributes high-quality supplements and skin care products. Synergy is a subsidiary of Nature’s Sunshine Products, a pioneer in natural health and nutrition since 1972. Nature’s Sunshine was the first company to sell herbal supplements in capsule form, and its culture of innovation extends to its marketing and sales efforts. Synergy markets and sells its products exclusively through a network of digital channels that includes 20+ localized country websites, several mobile apps, and an e-commerce-based affiliate program.

title: National Australia Bank boosts staff productivity, device security with Microsoft Endpoint Manager
executive_summary: N/A

title: Virtusa improves productivity by 25% while reducing costs by 10% with Microsoft Azure Arc
executive_summary: Founded in 1996 and headquartered in Massachusetts, Virtusa helps businesses move faster toward their digital future by combining deep industry expertise with frictionless technology. It enables clients to implement end-to-end digital   transformation initiatives with the pace and passion of a startup and at scale. With a robust partner ecosystem, including various fintech and insurtech startup collaborations, it empowers clients to change, disrupt, and unlock new value. The company has a worldwide footprint, with offices and delivery centers in the Americas, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East.

title: Unisys adopts Microsoft Teams to streamline calling and collaboration, saving $1 million
executive_summary: Global technology solutions company Unisys prioritizes the ideas and opinions of its associates. “The first thing I noticed when I joined Unisys was how people-oriented the culture is,” says Dave Hamshaw, Senior Consultant for Digital Workplace Solutions at Unisys. “If you have a problem, there’s always someone you can call.” Until recently, however, those calls happened on a variety of disparate technology platforms, including point solutions such as Microsoft Teams and point solutions such as Zoom. When an annual employee survey revealed that associates found using multiple applications to be inefficient—switching between two platforms to share documents and participate in video meetings was eating up valuable time—Hamshaw and his team were tasked with finding a solution. “Getting people onto a unified platform for highly secure communication was key,” he says. “That’s why we chose to consolidate on Microsoft Teams.”

title: Budimex streamlines internal processes and data collection with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Polish construction group Budimex was struggling to collect data from various work sites across the country. To improve process efficiency and data visibility, Budimex built mobile applications using Power Apps. With a solution for employee task management, workload, and salary calculation, Budimex now takes 15 minutes instead of an hour to prepare monthly reports. Other apps for subcontractor machine workloads further reduced reporting times by more than 85 percent.

title: Mount Sinai remains at the cutting edge of medicine with Epic on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Mount Sinai Health System needed to migrate their on-premises Epic environment to the cloud to keep their hospitals and medical schools at the cutting-edge of care. After partnering with Accenture, they chose the Microsoft Azure Cloud to facilitate data collaboration across their workloads and adopt a reference architecture that was purpose-built for Epic. Now, Mount Sinai can support changes in capacity during events like the pandemic, even as they migrate. Once in full production, they can enable HIPAA compliance in outages and more easily adopt the latest electronic health records (EHR) technologies—ensuring a better patient experience and securing their status as a leader in innovative care.

title: MHI uses ARO to standardize systems and create common components and drives DX as a leader in engineering and manufacturing
executive_summary: As a leading engineering and manufacturing company, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) is accelerating the use of containers. The main goal of using containers is to standardize its system development and use common components to quickly and flexibly create a development platform.

title: Kindeva combines four ERP systems into one using Dynamics 365 and remote collaboration
executive_summary: Kindeva Drug Delivery (Kindeva), formerly 3M Drug Delivery Systems, is a growing contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) focused on autoinjector, inhalation, transdermal, and intradermal technologies. The company makes everything from nebulizers and inhalers to microneedle-based delivery devices and drug-in adhesive patches. In early 2020, Kindeva began the process of becoming a standalone company and needed a way to extricate its data from 3M and move it into a new enterprise resource planning (ERP) system with the capability to scale.

title: Microsoft Japan explored in “Microsoft Ignite” the possibilities of frontline operations utilizing the transceiver feature of Teams.
executive_summary: Microsoft Teams is widely used among office workers as a tool for web conferencing and chatting. Teams is currently offering a wide variety of features. Moreover, there have been movements in recent years to utilize those features not just for office work but also for frontline operations, such as factories, construction sites, stores, and product deliveries. In this context, the transceiver feature of Teams is drawing the industry's attention. At Microsoft's annual event, "Microsoft Ignite" in Tokyo, a new work style on-site was explored utilizing the transceiver feature of Teams. Here, the person in charge of this event shares how the event was managed behind the scenes.

title: Eurobank uses the Enterprise Skills Initiative to create personalized learning journeys
executive_summary: Eurobank, a robust financial organization based in Greece and operating in 6 countries, embraces excellence through targeted learning and personal development initiatives for its people. Through personalized learning and training paths, curated in collaboration with Microsoft, Eurobank lays the groundwork for a successful migration of its IT assets to Azure.

title: City of Houston Fire Department improves 911 responses and saves nonemergency patients about 90% in costs with Microsoft Teams and Power BI
executive_summary: The Houston Fire Department (HFD), a public safety rescue system, built an innovative solution called Emergency Telehealth and Navigation (ETHAN) using Microsoft Teams to optimize emergency response resources. Thousands of patients without serious injuries are often transported to overwhelmed emergency rooms, even when it isn’t the best solution for the patient or the hospital. To address this problem, HFD created ETHAN. Using Microsoft Teams, ETHAN facilitates vital preliminary examinations of 911 callers through video conferencing with emergency physicians, who then make medical recommendations. By rerouting people who don’t need immediate ambulance rides, HFD reduces overcrowding, saves public resources, and improves patient outcomes.

title: Kelly uses Power Pages to revamp the customer experience
executive_summary: Kelly (formerly Kelly Services) is a global staffing and workforce solutions provider serving a range of industries including technology, engineering, professional services, and education. The company's diverse global client list includes well-known corporations within those industries, each with a unique set of workforce needs and requirements. To better support its customers, Kelly wanted to provide each one with their own bespoke portal, where they could request talent, chat with customer service, check performance reporting, and access business insights. The platform the company had in place couldn’t support customized pages without the need for full-time development and management staff. Using Microsoft Power Platform, Kelly created a new portal called Helix UX to serve as an all-in-one talent management platform. As part of the portal, Kelly uses Power Pages to create customized pages for each customer. With its new portal system, Kelly is serving more than 38,500 customer inquiries every day on average and tracking the service volume.

title: EyeMail brings innovation to email marketing, grows 71 percent in two years with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Delivering an effective marketing message through email has always been challenging, but email remains a preferred channel to communicate with customers. EyeMail Inc. technology helps organizations overcome this challenge and build a connection with their customers through videos that automatically play in email messages. The videos increase engagement and deliver storytelling moments in the inbox. EyeMail’s patent-pending technology compresses high-quality 4K videos down to 15 kilobytes to deliver compelling video-in-email experiences, helping organizations bring their marketing messages to life.

title: Pfizer encourages employee well-being using Thrive Global for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: As a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, Pfizer is in relentless pursuit of scientific breakthroughs and revolutionary medicines and vaccines that extend and significantly improve people’s lives.

title: Johnson Controls uses Microsoft Teams to construct a network of digital champions who drive business goals
executive_summary: Johnson Controls (JCI) is a leader in the world of smart buildings with more than 100,000 employees working to shape the future of sustainable, intelligent spaces. Given how the company made its name with leading-edge building technology, it’s not surprising that increasing its workforce’s digital skills is one of JCI’s key goals.

title: Orkla brings its dispersed employees together with communities in Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: With 90 business units and 300 brands under the Orkla umbrella, sales in 100 countries, and operations in 22, complexity presents a major challenge to employee engagement. Orkla is focused on creating digital spaces where employees can share insights, answer questions, and promote company culture. Orkla rolled out Microsoft Viva Engage to address employee expectations, boost employee engagement, and help employees strengthen hybrid work relationships.

title: Asahi Group Japan shares its Zero Trust mindset and seeks a unified security solution to modernize its business
executive_summary: As COVID-19 rapidly accelerated remote work, more companies focused on a Zero Trust security mindset. Among these companies is Asahi Group Japan, Ltd., the parent company of Asahi Breweries, Ltd., which is aggressively incorporating a Zero Trust security framework into its business and IT strategies. It’s also focusing on Microsoft 365 E5 Security to quickly implement comprehensive security measures to control document accessibility and ensure highly secure conditions and open communication, which will improve operational performance.

title: Orkla uses Microsoft Teams Connect shared channels to drive business forward by tapping into outside experts and collaborating across their 300 brands and 90 business units
executive_summary: For David Konrad Abramowski Aurtande, Lead Employee Engagement & Hybrid Work at Orkla, his job at Orkla gives him the chance to support heritage brands that hold special importance for consumers in Scandinavia, the Baltics, and around Europe. “I work for the company that creates a lot of the foods I fondly remember eating as a child and that my children now eat,” he says. With 90 different business units and 300 distinct brands—for everything from licorice to ketchup to toothpaste—Orkla supplies branded consumer goods to 100 countries and operates in 22. It’s a big, dispersed enterprise and growing all the time.

title: Builder.ai pushes the boundaries of building software with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Builder.ai is the next generation app development platform for every business and idea on the planet. The platform combines AI with human intelligence to make software accessible for every business user, regardless of their background, technical knowledge or budget. The AI-powered platform builds software faster and cheaper than traditional methods, so all businesses can become cloud first and digital first.

title: O2 offers holistic customer service with Microsoft Surface Pro
executive_summary: As one of the leading mobile service providers in Slovakia, O2 serves its customers efficiently and in new ways. Its store business experts, store consultants, and technicians leverage the laptop and tablet functions of the Surface Pro to assist customers wherever they are. O2 employees also use the Surface Pen for paperless contract signing, so they can instantly process transactions and archive documents. As a result, the staff has become faster and less reliant on paper, making the company more efficient and sustainable.

title: PPC Greece energizes its business processes and sustainability with Azure
executive_summary: Headquartered in Athens, Public Power Corporation (PPC) is the country’s largest electric power company, servicing more than seven million customers. Since 2019, PPC has been focusing on innovation through digital solution, with the goal to transform itself into a modern, data-driven organization. By adopting Microsoft Azure-based solutions, the company has reduced its total cost of ownership by 30 percent and cut carbon emissions by 99.84 percent.

title: Digital Manufacturing Platform: ZF plants are now more efficient thanks to the smart factory solution based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Full transparency for all data to create maximum plant efficiency: ZF Group applies this basic concept to ensure that all the steps in the manufacturing process work seamlessly together. To this end, the mobility and technology company uses its own Digital Manufacturing Platform (DMP) and follows a cloud strategy built on Microsoft Azure. Today, this data platform and its applications provide ZF with a consistent, data-driven overview of its manufacturing activities. As a result, the company can optimize work steps such as maintenance and repair, make better use of resources, and increase production flexibility. This marks the first step toward establishing a globally connected, digital manufacturing network.

title: Bp powers greater innovations with a modular data mesh design on Azure
executive_summary: Global energy giant bp is transforming into an integrated multi-source energy provider. To speed innovations in support of this initiative, the company is working to democratize data ownership, enhance and streamline data sharing, and optimize the flexibility of its platform by leveraging the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform for a new multicloud modular data mesh architecture.

title: United Kingdom, Department for Environment, Food, and Rural Affairs renews financial operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: In the United Kingdom, the Department for Environment, Food, and Rural Affairs (Defra) is charged with improving and protecting the environment, with a mission to enhance it for the next generation. They are responsible for policy and regulations that span a wide range of areas, including sustainable development, biodiversity, pollution control, animal health and welfare, and farming. With this broad remit, their work impacts the life of UK citizens each day.

title: Moody’s Analytics simplifies and streamlines risk modeling with Azure HPC
executive_summary: Moody's Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools to help business leaders make better decisions more quickly. Its industry-leading and award-winning insurance solutions bring together software, models, data, and analytics to create targeted solutions to address industry challenges, including underwriting, actuarial, regulatory and financial reporting, investment, asset liability management (ALM), capital management, and Know Your Customer (KYC). The Moody’s Analytics AXIS™ actuarial system is a powerful modeling solution for all actuarial analysis applications related to life insurance and reinsurance. It’s used by life insurers, reinsurers, and consulting firms for pricing, reserving, ALM, financial modeling, capital calculations, and hedging.

title: ESPN Edge finds a winning digital game plan in an evolving media landscape with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Leading multinational, multimedia sports entertainment brand ESPN developed creative solutions on Microsoft Azure to remain at the forefront of changing broadcast trends. ESPN wanted to continue to position itself as an innovative company to separate itself from competitors. ESPN worked with Microsoft, Accenture, and Verizon to launch the ESPN Edge Innovation Center, which brings together technology, consulting, connectivity, and hardware to develop new ways of experiencing sports. ESPN has already seen more than a 50 percent reduction in closed-captioning costs, and it expects significant cost savings across many other areas in the years to come.

title: Aexa enters a new frontier of communication with the Microsoft HoloLens
executive_summary: Aexa Aerospace produces creative solutions for training and operational support using mixed reality, augmented reality, and virtual reality. The company worked with Microsoft to create a solution using holographic teleportation where 3D models of people are virtually reconstructed as a three-dimensional figure elsewhere in real time. Aexa is developing the Microsoft HoloLens and the Aexa Holowizard© solutions in the health, energy, defense, and aerospace sectors, so that remote subject matters experts like surgeons can be “in the room” and provide better communication and support. Using the solution, Aexa CEO Fernando De La Peña Llaca and his team became the first humans to use holographic teleportation from Earth into space.

title: Sagra Technology offers business solutions at scale with Azure Marketplace
executive_summary: Sagra Technology creates IT solutions to help companies better manage sales, marketing, and analytics. The company wanted to expand access to its products, notably Power Translate, a tool for automatically translating Power BI reports within seconds. After introducing the solution on Azure Marketplace, Sagra Technology enabled companies from more than 50 countries to seamlessly access its solutions with simple procurement, payments and without time-consuming process of agreement signing. Sagra Technology’s customers, such as Westfalia Fruit, a global avocado production leader, can now make data-driven decisions and easily share corporate insights without language barriers.

title: Verofax bridges gap between brands and consumers with Martech tool on Azure
executive_summary: Verofax, a Martech solution company from the United Arab Emirates, specializes in transforming how brands connect and nurture direct engagement with customers with product twinning, create immersive experiences and virtual assets rewards direct-to-consumer. Verofax is built on Azure-powered technology to tag items and direct consumers into immersive digital experiences and offer virtual assets as rewards to boost customer long term value (CLTV). Fortune 500 beverage brands had applied the solution offering to give consumers a chance to win tickets to the FIFA World Cup by scanning the unique QR code on every product and having their purchase verified to access rewards. The frictionless interaction, led to over a million customers acquired, while lowering acquisition costs 20-fold and increasing conversion rates 50-fold vs under the cap or behind the label consumer promotions.

title: Understanding how forces act: Azure IoT helps fischer carry out continuous structural monitoring and thus enhance safety
executive_summary: From scaffold struts and concrete formworks to the jib and boom of a crane, many engineering structures are held together by bolts. Buildings and structures are subject to extreme forces that need to be monitored and documented to ensure that their functionality and load-bearing capacity is maintained. To this end, German start-up Connected Products—which forms part of fischerwerke GmbH & Co. KG—chose to base its Construction Monitoring solution on Azure IoT. Based in Baden-Württemberg, fischerwerke is a family-run SME that specializes in fixing and fastening technologies. The company prides itself on its ingenuity, offering products such as SensorAnchor and SensorDisc that improve the safety and service life of civil engineering structures by making construction monitoring more transparent and facilitating predictive maintenance.

title: CBRE strengthens every employees’ engagement and productivity with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: Wendy Sherwood, Vice President of Corporate Communications at CBRE, has worked with the commercial real-estate services leader for 27 years. “I’ve had a front-row seat to the company’s growth and evolution over those years,” she says. She points to the shift in how CBRE’s global workforce of 115,000 employees stays connected, calling it a transformative change. “We have a mix of office-based, client-based, remote and mobile employees working across different business areas and locations,” says Sherwood. “And now we can reach many more of those employees and ensure they get the information they need from CBRE. It’s one of the most rewarding enhancements I’ve been involved with. Our adoption of Microsoft Viva played a huge part in what we achieved.”

title: Microsoft cloud powers digital transformation at Dabur
executive_summary: Dabur India Limited, with a rich history of 138 years in providing quality products and services, is the most reliable brand in India. It is the world's largest Ayurvedic and Natural Health Care corporation, earning revenue of more than INR 10,800 crore and having a market capitalization of roughly INR 100,000 crore. Dabur is the leading FMCG business in India, with nine distinct power brands that have their own unique identities. Dabur's growth plan is based on four crucial pillars: revamping Ayurveda, creating dominant power brands, expanding into rural areas, and promoting digital transformation.

title: Générale pour l’Enfant leverages Power Apps and new technologies for its business applications
executive_summary: Since 1987, the Générale Pour l’Enfant group’s objective has remained the same: to imagine and design children and toddlers’ clothing that is comfortable, playful, and high-quality. This ambitious approach shared by all employees makes this family-based business a major player in children's fashion through its three flagship brands: Sergent Major, Du Pareil Au Même, and Natalys.

title: Public sector efficiency: Ashghal reaches more people with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Serving as the bedrock of Qatar's infrastructure growth, the Public Works Authority, Ashghal, is at the heart of the nation's infrastructural development. To facilitate smoother collaborations and conduct meetings online at convenience, Ashghal transitioned to Microsoft Teams Phone. This maintained critical operations during the COVID-19 pandemic. By centralizing and organizing key documents, projects, and conversations, the solution has also enabled Ashghal to streamline workflows and accommodate 3x more meeting attendees.

title: Hilti empowers its diverse workforce with Workday for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Hilti is a world leader in the design and manufacture of cutting-edge technologies, hardware, software, and services for the professional construction industry. With 32,000 employees in more than 120 countries, Hilti serves roughly 280,000 customer contacts each day developing products and solutions that drive productivity, safety, and sustainability in construction. With a diverse workforce spanning office-based, field-based, and operation environments, Hilti needed a solution to provide employees with a more simplified, flexible way to complete key tasks—no matter their location. Through the successful adoption of Workday for Microsoft Teams, employees can now quickly and easily request time off, share feedback, and check in and out without ever having to leave Teams. Not only does this save employees time, increase engagement, and improve productivity, but it also enables them to focus on their purpose of making construction better while delivering a better customer experience.

title: AACSB future-proofs association management with Protech and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Synonymous with the highest standards of excellence since 1916, AACSB International provides quality assurance, business education intelligence, and learning and development services to over 1,900 member organizations and more than 1,000 accredited business schools worldwide, serving more than five million students.

title: Peel Region enhances productivity, collaboration, and security using Microsoft 365 and Security solutions
executive_summary: Peel Region went through a digital transformation that increased productivity while facilitating collaboration using Microsoft solutions. Peel Region depends on its employees to provide services to more than 1.5 million residents. Therefore, it wanted to improve experiences for both employees and residents by modernizing its technology. Employees were already using Microsoft 365 for various tasks, and the region realized that Microsoft 365, in addition to other Microsoft solutions, can make it easier for employees to collaborate remotely. Peel Region’s IT team also enhanced security, preventing 10,000 emails with viruses or malicious URLs over the course of 12 months.

title: Empowering Nomura Ways of Working with Microsoft
executive_summary: As the world is undergoing a paradigm shift in values and perspectives, Nomura Group is ensuring they maintain a solid foothold in this new era of globalization. This incorporates a cross-regional approach starting more than four years ago to maximize the performance of employees throughout the global organization. Culture, people, workplaces, and technology comprise the four axes to achieve a new style of business that is not limited by location or time constraints called Nomura Ways of Working.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: ABN AMRO modernizes its infrastructure in 9 months with Datometry and Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Dutch bank ABN AMRO was looking to move business-critical workloads from Teradata to Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics. The deadline was tight, and the job needed to be performed with little to no downtime for business analysts and other internal customers. ABN AMRO worked with Microsoft partner Datometry, whose qInsight and Hyper-Q solutions enabled a seamless migration and allowed ABN AMRO to leave applications intact, avoiding time-consuming rewrites. As a result of leaving its legacy vendor, ABN AMRO realized significant scaling advantages, gained flexibility, and laid the foundation for a comprehensive cloud strategy.

title: Montgomery County Community College redefines and redesigns student data, journeys, and engagement with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: N/A
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Journeys, Power BI

title: UK Driver & Vehicle Standards Agency accelerates innovation with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The UK Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) is a UK government agency responsible for setting, testing and enforcing the standards for drivers, vehicles and roads in Great Britain. In 2020, powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365, they began work to bring their Theory Test services inhouse after 19 years. This hugely ambitious project was driven by a desire to realise cost savings and enable a faster pace of innovation and transformation.

title: Laris Hotels unlocks legacy data with Power Automate
executive_summary: Laris Hotels Group is one of the largest hotel chains in Krakow, Poland, and wanted more timely access to booking data across its network. To replace a weekly manual process, the company used desktop robotic process automation (RPA) in Power Automate to pull data daily from a legacy system that did not offer an API. With faster access to fully customized data in Power BI, the company now has a clearer view of booking data, with average hotel occupancy increasing by approximately 15%.

title: Empowering prosthetic innovation: Össur's Azure Integration Services journey
executive_summary: Össur develops and manufactures prosthetics for customers all over the world. With Microsoft Biztalk Server approaching the end of support, and as the company begins to offer new and expanded services to its customers, a move from on-premises datacenters to a hybrid cloud model is required. Having now transitioned to Azure Integration Services, Össur has not only future-proofed its infrastructure, it has also better incorporated a diverse array of legacy apps and services into its new cloud infrastructure.

title: Inclusion is essential: Elbe-Werkstätten optimizes its processes based on low-code with Microsoft Power Apps
executive_summary: Elbe-Werkstätten GmbH employs more than 3,000 people with disabilities. At over 50 locations in the Hamburg area, the company offers attractive, short-commute jobs in everything from hospitality to landscaping to its own IT department—all with the best possible levels of support and integration. Managing such a large, decentralized organization calls for a unified approach to communication, collaboration, and administration across all locations. Now, in collaboration with partner CGI, Elbe-Werkstätten is moving away from paper-based processes and establishing a new IT infrastructure. Here, too, the goal is to maximize employee inclusion. Underpinning this endeavor are Microsoft’s cloud solutions Azure Logic Apps, Power Apps, and Power Platform.
products: Azure Logic Apps, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps

title: Nottinghamshire County Council strikes the right balance of governance and innovation with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Nottinghamshire County Council consolidated its telephony contracts and infrastructure into a single solution and chose to migrate to Microsoft Teams, working closely with the FastTrack team and leveraging its Unified Support contract. Governance and efficiency have improved. Teams Phone and Teams Rooms are facilitating true hybrid working. The council is now well-placed to pursue further innovation and digitalisation.

title: Brooke Action for Working Horses and Donkeys grows to help equines with the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Brooke decided to move to the cloud to empower its globally dispersed teams and avoid replacing its end-of-life on-premise IT infrastructure. A shift to Microsoft Azure saved the nonprofit six figures and provided insights on future cost savings, too. By rolling out Microsoft 365, dispersed employees can access the tools and resources to support even more working equines around the world.

title: San Francisco Police Department saves officers hundreds of hours per month with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The San Francisco Police Department (SFPD), which upholds the law and protects residents in one of California’s biggest cities, used Microsoft Power Platform to create an app that helped officers more efficiently report the return of stolen cars. Initially, officers manually reported when stolen cars had been found and returned to their owners. This process took up to two hours, and delays in the system repeatedly led to unnecessary suspicion of vehicle owners. SFPD saw an opportunity to create a solution with Microsoft offerings that made the process of reporting stolen car returns near-instantaneous, ultimately saving officers hundreds of hours of driving time and reducing department costs.

title: Sanlam improves user experience and productivity by empowering engineers with GitHub Copilot
executive_summary: “I feel five times more productive!” or “The quality of my work has improved even further”—these are all things that engineers at Sanlam have said about GitHub Copilot. Gone are the days of interrupting colleagues with quick questions, browsing online for code sample guidance, and sifting through documentation. Now, Sanlam’s engineers have a helpful virtual colleague in Copilot, which offers suggestions, code optimization, refactoring into modern languages and generation of unit test data sets on the go. Engineers have saved up to 30% of their time while also improving code quality. And for Sanlam, Africa’s largest non-banking financial services group, this isn’t just about faster coding; it’s about applying AI and modern engineering for continued value development, happier engineers, and turbo charging their transformation of the client and intermediary experience.

title: Korea Professional Sports Association Enhances Digital Transformation of Fan Culture through Flexible Data Management with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Korea Professional Sports Association aims to elevate professional sports and foster a vibrant sporting environment. Their digital transformation leverages Dynamics 365 for real-time analysis and personalized fan engagement. Placing fans at the center drives increased satisfaction and loyalty, evident in notable sales results. Integrating various sports into a unified data environment promises to enhance fan experiences, nurturing a dynamic sports culture, supported by Dynamics 365's innovative capabilities.

title: LALIGA makes real-time data the heart of every match with Surface Pro
executive_summary: LALIGA, a sports association based in Madrid and comprising 42 football clubs, chose Surface Pro to achieve maximum benefit from its sophisticated player analysis data. The clubs needed powerful hardware to bring the system directly to the sidelines of matches and practices and chose Surface Pro 9. Now, every LALIGA club has real-time access to data that informs decisions to protect the health of players. This has the potential to improve outcomes for teams and the association overall.

title: Stiftung Diakoniewerk Kropp streamlines behind-the-scenes healthcare work with the Microsoft cloud
executive_summary: Stiftung Diakoniewerk Kropp runs healthcare facilities across Northern Germany, helping people with everything from mental health to hospice services. Yet with an IT staff of just five supporting 2,000 employees, the nonprofit needed to modernize its technology infrastructure. When Stiftung Diakoniewerk Kropp migrated to Microsoft Azure, it saved money by adopting Microsoft apps, gained the flexibility to scale up cloud resources as needed, and boosted employee productivity—all while adhering to strict EU security and privacy guidelines.

title: Availability, safety, and expense reduction: FRAM Capital undergoes digital transformation with Microsoft tools
executive_summary: With support from partner company Microsoft CloudData, FRAM Capital, an investment manager, implemented an integrated ecosystem based on Microsoft 365, Microsoft Azure, and the use of Microsoft Sentinel for security. The solution was easily implemented by the financial market’s familiarity with the tools, and there was an increase from 25 to 100 users with no additional infrastructure costs.

title: Microsoft Azure supports new Agger Sistemas insurance broker system
executive_summary: With Microsoft Azure, the company backs up more than 10,000 databases to SQL databases every 10 minutes.

title: Evup delivers intelligent solutions backed by Microsoft tools
executive_summary: Backed by partner Brasoftware, Evup achieves sophisticated architecture for both its internal operation and the solutions it offers its customers. The company is a digital native and sees the Microsoft Cloud as an enabler of its operation, increasing availability, simplifying operation, and generating cost savings by waiving an entire physical structure and allowing the team to focus more on their work.

title: Taking the innovation leap: Tervisekassa boosts security and innovation with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Tervisekassa, the Estonian Health Insurance Fund, wanted to modernize its infrastructure to enhance health services while keeping sensitive healthcare data safe. As the first step in its journey to innovation and digital transformation, it partnered with Microsoft and Fujitsu Estonia to migrate its infrastructure, including SAP, to Azure. With a scalable infrastructure, Tervisekassa tripled its innovation rate, adding 21 new customer-oriented services without increasing resources. It safeguarded its data and systems, and lowered infrastructure and maintenance costs while continuing to provide reliable healthcare to Estonians.

title: Outcome-based healthcare: AiR Healthcare uses cloud-based health management solution to expand new care model
executive_summary: AiR Healthcare Solutions (AiR Healthcare) wanted to shift the treatment of people with acute behavioral disorders in times of crisis to a value-based model that promotes ongoing communication and accountability for results. To that end, the organization launched the AiRCare disease management service, based on Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Dynamics 365. AiR Healthcare now offers personalized care and clinical insights on a scale that can significantly impact behavioral health, as well as help patients and healthcare providers avoid crises and improve outcomes.

title: Azerbaijan Airlines expands data access to increase efficiency by 70% with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Kaya elevates customer experience and operational efficiency with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power BI
executive_summary: Established in 2003, Kaya Limited is a leading provider of dermatologically approved and scientifically advanced solutions for skincare, haircare and body.

title: Cummins uses Microsoft Purview to automate information governance more efficiently in the age of AI
executive_summary: Cummins needed proper record labeling to be compliant with retention requirements.  Cummins needed to prepare its data environment for the adoption of generative AI solutions.

title: Waterair on its way to unrivaled customer experience with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The company has been in business for over half a century. It has brought its expertise to more than 120,000 customers and has won several awards for its innovation

title: Accenture boosts SAP HANA agility and performance by migrating to Azure
executive_summary: Accenture is in the midst of an ambitious digital transformation journey that culminated in the migration of its 7-terabyte SAP Business Warehouse (BW) on HANA estate to Microsoft Azure. By running one of its most business-critical applications in Azure, Accenture can deliver HANA environments five weeks faster, improve SAP BW performance by up to 70 percent, and reduce costs. After its rapid migration, Accenture now has a cloud migration playbook to use to help clients do the same and gain similar benefits.

title: Learning gets real for industrial customers with Honeywell mixed reality simulation
executive_summary: For multinational conglomerate Honeywell International, customer service doesn’t end at delivering innovative industrial solutions. Anticipating a decrease in the market pool of skilled technical staff to maintain complex equipment, the company sought a scalable, affordable solution for its customers to train new workers faster and more efficiently. Honeywell engineers used Microsoft Azure and Microsoft HoloLens to create a groundbreaking training solution that will be easy to deploy, manage, and use.

title: MESCyT Takes Digital Transformation to the Next Level with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With the aim of accelerating its digital transformation, the Ministry of Higher Education, Science and Technology, within the framework of the guidelines of the 2030 digital agenda of the Government of the Dominican Republic, implemented a "digital adoption cycle" based on Microsoft 365 solutions that improve productivity and strengthen the digital skills of employees, optimizing processes and generating new opportunities through the use of technology.

title: Qatar’s Ministry of Communications and Information Technology boosts security and efficiency with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: On a mission to transform Qatar into the Gulf region’s digital hub, Qatar's Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT) embarked on a journey to digitize government operations with Microsoft Azure. The FIFA World Cup in 2022 accelerated this transition and paved the way for Qatar's modern, cloud-first public service infrastructure. With the shift, MCIT has not only enhanced the government’s data security and operational efficiency, but also achieved USD7.3 million in cost savings, putting Qatar on track to achieve its Vision 2030.

title: Special Olympics International gets more athletes on the field with Microsoft Power Pages
executive_summary: Special Olympics International breaks down stigma by providing people with intellectual and developmental disabilities opportunities to lead—on and off the sports field. The global nonprofit developed accessible athlete and volunteer portals so participants can participate more easily and independently. The portals, created with Power Pages, also connect to Microsoft Dynamics 365 to enable Special Olympics to interact with supporters on a deeper level.

title: Lerøy Seafood Group uses Power Platform to improve reporting and reduce costs by millions of dollars
executive_summary: The Lerøy Seafood Group is the third largest producer of salmon and trout in the world. As part of a digitization strategy to improve data sharing and streamline operations, the company purchased over 4,000 Premium Power Apps licenses. Together with an automated Center of Excellence to improve governance and development quality, makers at Lerøy have leveraged the premium capabilities of Power Platform to develop an exciting wave of new enterprise applications, with just one solution saving millions annually in operational costs.

title: Sheridan College modernizes with the Microsoft Cloud and Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Sheridan College in Ontario, Canada, needed to replace its aging on-premises virtual desktop infrastructure with a scalable cloud-based solution. Compatibility with existing thin client devices was required to protect the school’s hardware investment.

title: Cummins uses Microsoft Purview to automate information governance more efficiently in the age of AI
executive_summary: Cummins needed proper record labeling to be compliant with retention requirements.  Cummins needed to prepare its data environment for the adoption of generative AI solutions.

title: 7 days down to 24 hours: DGA enhances customs services with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: The DGA needed to replace their previous financial system with a solution integrated with SIGA (DGA Operating System), Microsoft 365, and Microsoft Azure, to improve service to its taxpayers and change public perception.

title: ABN AMRO accelerates its cloud-smart journey with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
executive_summary: ABN AMRO, the third-largest bank in the Netherlands, needed a way to implement a modern, cloud-native, and scalable platform that could support its diverse polyglot applications without limiting the innovation of its developers.
products: Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure

title: Driving change to ensure user acceptance of new technology
executive_summary: Husky Injection Molding Systems, which provides equipment and services to plastics manufacturers worldwide, has 4,000 employees and operates across more than 100 countries from its headquarters in Ontario, Canada. The company’s previous ERP system had grown highly customized, making modifications difficult and costly. After evaluating its options, the firm chose Microsoft Dynamics AX as a replacement. During initial project discussions, Microsoft Enterprise Services introduced the concept of Adoption and Change Management as a disciplined approach to accelerate employee acceptance of the new ERP system. Microsoft experts worked with key team members driving the Husky initiative—called “Unite”—to get the organization ready for the coming changes and then to help employees manage those changes after the new ERP system’s debut. With guidance from Microsoft Adoption Services consultants, Husky’s change management efforts increased user acceptance of the new system, ensuring an easier, faster transition. Husky also developed a change management platform—including processes and team members—for use in its other digital transformation initiatives to help ensure their success, too.

title: TD Bank Group: Focused on making every customer experience legendary
executive_summary: There’s great customer service, and then there’s legendary customer service. With the goal of creating legendary experiences for more than 26 million customers, TD Bank Group (TD), one of North America’s largest banks, knows that keeping up with changes in customer expectations and anticipating their needs is critical. As part of its focus on staying close to customer needs, TD’s digital experience team is leveraging the company’s investment in Microsoft Azure to deepen relationships with its customers.

title: Greater Manchester Mental Health upscales the quality of patient care with Windows 10
executive_summary: One of the largest mental health trusts in the UK plans to use Microsoft technology to help doctors work together and improve patient care.

title: Global tax management solution provider transcends barriers to compliance and planning with Power BI Embedded
executive_summary: Orbitax takes on the world—literally. Founded in 2004, the young company expertly wields cloud technology to track the overwhelming number of tax laws, regulations, and requirements around the globe for its multinational customers. Valued by its customers for the time and money that it saves them, Orbitax brought even more richness to the solution when it incorporated Microsoft Power BI Embedded. The resulting graphical reporting takes data insights far beyond traditional reporting for huge productivity savings—up to 75 percent.

title: Government of Nunavut comes back stronger after ransomware attack with Microsoft security solutions
executive_summary: When a ransomware attack shut down computer systems at the Government of Nunavut, Canada’s largest and northernmost territory, the IT team responded with a well-coordinated strategy. But its isolation and the challenges of a harsh climate complicated technology environments, and the team wanted a coordinated toolset. It worked with Microsoft’s elite cybersecurity DART team to rebuild its network and 5,500 devices while also rolling out security solutions—including Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps—all in just weeks during an Arctic winter.

title: How a decentralized identity and verifiable credentials can streamline both public and private processes
executive_summary: Digital identity forms the cornerstone of everything that individuals do in the digital world. There is a genuine need for a sustainable technology and processes that give users control over their data and allow trusted interactions. In a decentralized identity ecosystem, citizens can easily prove their identity and share authoritative data with third parties. Furthermore, they can keep track of what information is shared with whom and at any time can deny third parties’ access to personal information. Microsoft applied this concept to a high-impact public sector use case in the region of Flanders in Belgium. The pilot ‘starting a business in Flanders’ showed that the use of decentralized identity technology lowered the burden for citizens and raised their trust in the government.

title: ZF employees create low-code solutions to accelerate the business using Microsoft Power Platform and Dataverse for Teams
executive_summary: Something new is happening at ZF’s workplace. The global company has a 100-year history in the automotive business and is renowned for creating systems for passenger cars and commercial vehicles. As the auto parts supplier accelerates its transition from a manufacturer to a technology company creating mobility solutions, it has deployed Microsoft Teams, the digital collaboration tool in Microsoft 365, to boost productivity and collaboration. But that’s just part of the story. Employees began to take ownership of how they used the new Microsoft tools to solve problems and get their work done faster—creating a valuable synergy between new workplace behavior and the company’s drive to lead in the mobility industry.
